description:
We've been here a couple times now, merely because of it's convenient location. Ordinarily we wouldn't seek out restaurants in such a touristy area but we've ended up near union square for several of the pop up museums and no way we were parking twice just to find better food options. Despite it's touristy locale, and it's chain status burger bar is pretty good! 

They have a kids menu and the option to build a burger to your liking so you can get exactly what you want. Even on a weekend it wasn't too crowded so we were seated right away, and they do have the option to make reservations online as well. You have a great view of union square too!

The first time we went my husband got the spicy burger, I think it's the "inferno burger". It's crazy hot. The waitress asked him several times if he was SURE he wanted it. I asked if a lot of people ordered it and she said yes. Then I asked if they liked it and she said no. It's so hot you have to sign a waiver. Even my hubby who loves spicy things said it was too hot, though it didn't stop him from ordering it again!

On our second visit we opted to build our own burgers, and he was able to get jalapeños on his to make it spicy, a much more manageable level of heat. I built my own turkey burger and it was cooked to perfection. Often when I've gotten turkey burger they are too try. Not a burger bar, it was juicy and delicious!
author: Michele B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, and it has such an amazing view of Union Square, but the food fell way short of my expectations, especially for the amount of money we paid ($60+for 2 burgers, fries, & a milk shake). We really wanted to sit by the window, but we're told that it was by reservation only. Although, they didn't seem that busy, but whatever. 
My boyfriend got the Kobe style Waygu beef burger, and I got the Chef's natural line burger with mushrooms, grilled onions, and cheese. I didn't try the Kobe burger, so I can't speak to that, but according to the boyfriend, it was only alright. My burger was dry, and the mushrooms had a strange taste to it? The sweet potatoes fries that I got were pretty run-of-the-mill. I feel like I've had better burgers at Five Guys. 
I didn't particularly enjoy the service either. Not sure if our server was just having a bad day, but he seemed irritated when taking our order and during every interaction we had with him after that. 
The best part of the meal would have to be the salted caramel milkshake-so good! I can't say whether I'd ever return, but if I do, it would just be for the milkshake.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I have severe nut allergies and after confirming with the waitress three times, I ordered a milkshake. I started reacting, finished my meal, and my mom had to drag me to the hospital. Stayed there until midnight after being put on an IV and other meds. 

Most likely never going back.
author: Ashley J.

description:
The 8 Of us came here for dinner last night. We had 4 burgers and 4 salads. We ordered the angus burger with bacon and blue cheese on an onion roll. We ordered it medium rare with crispy skinny fries. Our burger came well done. How can a burger place with burger in the name of the restaurant get this so wrong?  If I had known better I should have ordered it rare. The bacon that came with the burger was good - the two pieces were thick and crispy. The skinny fries was good too -nice and crispy. 

The cob salad was good but next time I will have the blue cheese on the side as it is so pungent and strong in flavor.  A good size salad. 

I thought everything was a bit pricey but we were in Macy's department store. We also shared two pitchers of porter beer each pitcher costing $28. Each couple paid $70 - not good for a burger that was overcooked and dry. It looked good but looks aren't everything.
author: Donna L.

description: I've heard of this place & decided to finally try it out. The views from the restaurant are amazing! Our server was friendly & helpful - attentive during our meal. I was surprised to find out that a waiver was required to eat the worlds spiciest sauce. My boyfriend loved it! Our orders came quick & were full of flavor. If you like burgers & milkshakes, this is the place to be!
author: Bianca C.

description: This is the place with a view if you don't want to wait for over 30 minutes at the Cheesecake Factory and gamble to get a window view. It's really a 3.7 rating. The chicken wings was okay and the chili cheese fries was descent.
author: Juan V.

description:
I like how Burger Bar is located in Union Square, so a lot of places for action and entertainment are accessible from the restaurant. There's a good view of Union Square from the restaurant too. 

I have to say that the food here is just okay -- nothing really to rave about. Everything is pricey... but what more can you expect when you're in one of the most expensive cities in the nation? 

If there's anything I'd recommend, it's the alcoholic milkshakes. I enjoyed Bananas Foster! It's good if you're someone who has a sweet tooth!
author: Danielle M.

description: I love this location in Vegas! I've been to the Vegas location multiple times & I always receive awesome service and great food. I came here today since i'm visiting san fran & the food was good. The food is served differently than the Vegas location. Prices are also higher at this location. The wings are amazing. I like the Vegas location a lot better but the food is still really good at this location!
author: Andrea C.

description:
I've been to this Burger Bar and the one in Las Vegas many , many times over the years. And have always had a pretty meal. 
But tonight was different. My $30.00 Hamburger was way over cooked and very dry. The fries were cold. The bar tender tried to charge me for a crown royal instead of a jack Danials. At first I thought it was a mistake or that just how it rings up. but when he did it again. I called him on it in passing. He seemed very put off about it. And pulled the out of the glass very quickly and went to the back. It turns out there is a $2.00 difference. The bar tender as with rest of the waitstaff seemed like they didn't want to be there and seemed like they complained about to each other. Something has really changed at this Burger bar and I won't be back there anytime soon if ever!
author: R L.

description:
nice views of union square, and great concept, but over priced, and no ambiance.
The variety of burgers is good, even building your own is min $15+, signature burgers range from $18-50.  very unique compilation of ingredients make decent pairings.
The milk shakes do look amazing, I did not try them though. Also have a wide variety of beers.
Maria and Eugene were very pleasant and helpful.
author: David C.

description:
My favorite burger place in Union Square!
Bison Burger and Black Butte Porter Pin.
No waiting and beautiful window view floor to ceiling of Union Square area. It's a definite better choice over Cheesecake Factory. Headed Back there now for a birthday celebration after doing Anchor Steam brewery tour in SF.
author: Christos V.

description:
1-star. Will update when we get to get in. Hours said open at 11, so planned accordingly. 11:15, gate still down and no one bother to answer phone.

UPDATE: We're glad we've given them another chance. The staff are friendly and very accommodating. TBH, by the rating here, we would never have come here. We came only because of the $30 credit per person from our Sightseeing Pass.
Learning from the morning mistake, we made reservation through the app, so they seated us by the windows, very nice.
We ordered the wings and they were seasoned perfectly and still very moist. The Union Square Salad was fresh and the sauce just takes it to another level. I built my own Wagu Burger, and, boy, was it good. Their milkshake is smooth like silk and you can taste every ingredients.
Definite a place to visit, and unless you MUST have a dish offered at TCKF on the 8th Floor and wait for hours to be seated....come here. You will be well fed.
author: Christopher L.

description:
3.5 STARS 

My team and I had our Holiday dinner here and surprisingly it wasn't so bad. I figured this would be more of a tourist trap type of place when it came to the food quality, but while the place is still a tourist trap, the food quality was better than I imagined it would be. 

We came in around 3:30pm on a Wednesday and my team and I got seated right away, and even got a seat next to the window which is AWESOME. Each burger ranges from $15 - $60, pick your poison. It's a bit pricey, but that's the nature of it being located in a prime location Union Square SF! 

Think of Burger Bar as another Red Robins, but it's a little better for a higher price in the city. Still worth trying at least ONCE!
author: Danny L.

description:
Yikes - this place was not worth the money. The only reason we wanted to eat here was for the view of Union Square during December. We luckily got a window seat overlooking the Christmas decor at Union Square. This includes the whole view of the ice skating rink, Christmas tree, and surrounding Christmas lights/buildings. 

We ordered: 
1. Peppercorn Burger ($23) My bf ordered this and didn't want to finish it :/

2. Le Frog Burger ($23) I absolutely love Brie, but it was an overkill with this burger. I thought it would have been an interesting and different twist to a burger, but it was way too rich. In the future, I'm definitely sticking to the norm - jack or Swiss. Yes the black angus was good with the mushrooms, but I definitely couldn't finish the Brie with it. Halfway through the burger, I ended up scrapping the rest of the cheese off. 

Both burgers come with your choice of fat fries, skinny fries, or sweet potatoes fries. The fries were good, especially with the truffle mayo, but then again, you can't really make fries wrong. I thought the presentation looked a little ghetto with the bagged fries. It definitely didn't feel or look like a $23 dish. 

The service was excellent. She was super nice and friendly, which I always appreciate great customer service. Despite the food, her service enhanced our experience. 

Probably won't be back again for these overpriced burgers!
author: Miranda T.

description:
Nutella shake for the win!

As I read through the most recent reviews before I type this, I feel lucky we didn't go through it.  We went the night before the new year's eve and it was fine.  We got in at 8:30pm, we got seated after a couple of minutes wait.  

I got a burger and husband got the slides.  We also got the honey lemon wings and the nutella shake to end the meal.  My burger was a big portion, which better be for that price lol.  Then again, we have a nice view of the Union Square for the holidays, so I guess I'm paying for the view?  The burger itself was pretty good.  The skinny fries was also good.  The wings that we got had a hint of spiciness, but not too much.  It was yummy...but I couldn't tell how it's honey lemon lol. I wouldn't pay full price for it though.  (We got a $30 meal credit each, using our Sight Seeing Pass).  

It took a bit more time for our food to arrive, but it wasn't that bad.  We've waited longer.  It did take sometime to get our nutella shake though, but it was almost closing time already, so I get why they'd be busier.  

I say if anything, I recommend this place for their shake.  It was smooth and silky, literally like drinking nutella!
author: Jane R.

description: Horrible food, service and overpriced.  Do yourself a favor and find someplace else to spend your money.
author: Angela W.

description:
I came here with a friend a few weeks ago for dinner before an event. Had a mad craving for burgers and wasn't disappointed! I will say this place is a bit pricey - we both built our own beef burger. I had mines with provolone. It also came with tomatoes, leafy lettuce, onions and a pickle on the side. The tray (like ones you'd find at a cafeteria) also had a beautiful tray of french fries (!!). I got mines with a chipotle sauce that had me hooked (and later took with me to go)! Burger craving was definitely satisfied, as well as my tummy ;) 

Our server wasn't the most attentive guy, but I could tell he was trying. We just found ourselves repeating our orders and requests more than we would've liked.

We got seated right away (it was a weeknight) with a prime view of Union Square which was in the process of getting decorated for the holidays. One of the prime reasons I'm sure people come here is for the views and I don't blame them!
author: Jamey P.

description:
Meh... we've had 2 good experiences here but this time it was not great. There might've been 15 people in the restaurant. When we came in we weren't even greeted, just looked at. ... but we tried it and sadly we prob won't be back. The food and service does not match the price. It is clean and the views are nice but our food was gross. I'm sad because we used to really like this place.

For what we paid, we should've went to Hillstone and gotten a Hawaiian Ribeye
author: Layne S.

description: Had the $50 burger with the sauce...ahhh man ya gotta pour the sauce over each bite. The service was ehh I went to the bar and experienced some bias service. So after I ordered the mondo burger I was asked for my credit card to open a tab.
author: Mrjc 9.

description:
...nothing stand out on my visit today. 
Calamari appetizer: disappointing, those aw not breaded, coming with marinara sauce which was not flavorful. 
American burger: very ordinary, best thing on burger was the bacon which was decent. 
Service: lacking. 

I think this joint needs to overhaul itself, other than that I can see the end for this restaurant is near.
author: Rahi Y.

description:
It was late night after the museum of ice cream & we were starving & if you been to this area you know you're not gonna wait 2 hours at Cheesecake Factory! So we came to Burger bar & im so glad we did. We were able to sit down within 10 minutes. 

PER USUAL we over order. We get the fry starters with pickles, zucchini & onion rings & I get the "lé frôg" burger it's good! You don't even taste the asparagus. 

I love that our waitress went out of her way to make us strawberry lemonade, even though it's not offered on the menu! she was awesome !! unfortunately no room for dessert or else I would have got the dessert burger! That looked amazing
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Came with a friend & the only good thing was the view, We sat next to the window but the food was embarrassingly horrid. 

I had the 'rosemary' grilled chicken with ciabata - the bread was cold (looked defrosted) , the chicken was just warm. The pickle was not crispy. The 'fat' fries looked as if they'd been fried & double fried over again to make them hot. They were not fresh & were oddly burnt, no doubt the way they'd been re-prepared. It was really terrible.

Service was hurried.. Drinks are insanely overpriced. This is meant for unsuspecting tourists. All around horrible! 1 star for the view.
author: Julian I.

description: I asked for my burger to be cooked medium and it showed up well done.  The kids sliders were like little hard hockey pucks.  And the fat fries were underdone.  I didn't bother sending anything back because we needed to make an after-lunch appointment.  For the price, I expect a quality meal so this was a big let-down.
author: Jake S.

description:
My first experience here (12/16/17) was, unfortunately, one of the worst experiences I have ever had with a restaurant in SF and especially in this area.

It began with dirty water, which was quickly exchanged when I had requested another one, but set the stage for the rest of the meal. My boyfriend and I had sat down around 10 pm​ and were asked for our drink orders. We both ordered milkshakes that NEVER appeared during our stay in the restaurant. When we asked our server about them (the third time) a half hour later while our food was served, he replied, "Oh it's not my fault, I asked them to hurry." Our food was edible but not something memorable to make me want to return. 

Throughout the course of the meal, we asked our server about our status on food and drinks as we were seated in a section that left us hidden from most servers. His responses left us feeling uncertain about when we would be served, showing an obvious lack of training or discipline regarding customer service. As the face of the restaurant, servers/waiters NEED to be in clear communication with kitchen staff and customers. Rather than focus on serving us, ​he seemed more interested in getting to know us, even going so far as to ask​ my age, which clearly upset my boyfriend.

As a student studying Hospitality and Tourism Management, service is something I am highly critical of. I saw what looked like a manager and asked to speak with him. I explained to him the entirety of our experience and his response was "Your waiter is seasonal..." and he went on to explain how a few "milkshake guys" quit that day leaving them understaffed on the milkshake bar. This seems like something servers should be trained in to alleviate instances like this. While he may have felt he could share his dissatisfaction with our waiter with me after I told him I am studying the industry, as a manager you NEVER admit to employing staff that are incapable of the job. This reflects on you, the company, and your training standards. In this case, Burger Bar, you have done poorly with training on a standard and managerial level.

After listening to the manager Aaron explain away the reasons as to why we were not served properly for 10 minutes, he finally provided a solution. A 10% discount on our meal. I was not complaining to gain something, only to give constructive criticism, however, ​I agreed to​ the discount. He then came back apologizing, saying he could not edit the charge already made and would write his name for us to mention "next time". He stated he was there from Las Vegas, and I'm not sure their protocol there for charges but in San Francisco, you void credit charges and then charge the new transaction. Aaron failed to remedy the situation and I WILL NOT be returning to ANY Burger Bar nor will I advise my friends to experience this horrendous service.
author: Kiva M.

description: Treated like a criminal/low life because I was alone and opted to sit at the bar instead of a table. Because I was at the bar, they don't trust you and require a credit card before they'll serve you. I asked if the people at the tables next to me were required to leave a credit card and was told no. Great way to lose regular customers.
author: L L.

description: This restaurant has a great view of san francisco city, but fried potato was a bit chilled and too much oily...
author: Miyuki S.

description: Overall nice experience, kind of hard to get to (located inside Macy's on the 6th floor) but the window view from inside is really nice. Cool set up for a casual business lunch. I made a reservation for lunch at noon and was seated right away. Ordered the sliders with sweet photos & was very well pleased, you can tell they put attention into their burgers from their freshness. My only knock is that the staff our waiter could have been a little more attentive. Had to find him to pay & took a while for us to order. Spent an hour & a half there but would definitely go back
author: LeVar H.

description: Came to Burger Bar in search of a gluten free burger. The restaurant is located on the 6th floor. You can sit in the restaurant at tables, or in the bar area either at the bar or tables near the big window. I ordered the "American Classic" burger with a gluten free bun and no cheese. The burger came out nice and the "fat fries" were tasty. The gluten free bun held together nicely, the burger and bacon were cooked perfectly, and it was presented very nicely. The service was average, not bad, not super. The thing that got me is that my bill was 25 dollars and change. The most I ever paid for a burger and fries. I know this is San Francisco, but come-on. 5 bucks too much. But if you do have the extra 5 bucks on you, I suggest you try it out.
author: Intellectual Reviews I.

description: 3.5 Stars. Ive  been to Burger Bar twice now before writing this review.  The atmosphere is great and the service was good. . The bar has Tv's. The food was just okay for me. Not bad, but not great. I expected the burger's to be a little bigger. I would go back and try it again
author: Danny N.

description: We ubered all the way across town to go to this restaurant because we had purchased a dinner experience valued at $90 only to find that the manager decided to close the kitchen early. The description was "late night eats" but we left hungry in a neighborhood where nothing else was open late night and we were out $90. This completely ruined our last night.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
This place was a giant let-down. It's supposed to be a celebrity chef restaurant with gourmet burgers. Between those two things and the location/view I had pretty high expectations.

I started with the Bavarian pretzels and then did a Build Your Own burger with grass fed beef (which I was thrilled to see as an option), provolone, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on Ciabatta bread with Fat Fries.

The short version is I don't think they have salt in the kitchen. There was not a spot of salt on the pretzels (there are three in an order) or - by taste - *in* the pretzels. The cheese dipping sauce was good, but the texture of the pretzel was dry and not quite right and it was extremely bland.

Ditto for the burger and fries - no salt. The fries could have been awesome - they arrived hot and cooked right. But not a grain of salt to be found. I sprinkled table salt on them, but it's just not the same as having them tossed in salt straight from the fryer. The burger patty tasted salt-free and bland as well. Honestly, the best part of my meal was the Ciabatta bread (and even that could have been toasted a little longer).

I was there for a late lunch, around 2pm, and the service was just kind of meh too.
author: Andie T.

description:
Burger bar sits ontop of Macy's and they serve typical burger diner food; there's also a bar. The food is pretty mediocre (underwhelming burger, mushy fries, cold appetizers), it's quite pricey for what you get, and everything was slow. The best part was the shake, which wasn't something to brag about. Overall the experience was very meh, probably won't come back.

Service was a bit slow. There's plenty of space.

I ordered the:
Wagyu burger
Fries
Wings
Chocolate shake
author: Sean W.

description:
3.5/5: Since there isn't a 3.5 I will have to put 3 Stars. This is my second time here. The first time I had the sliders and the 2nd time I had the veggie burger. TBH the veggie burger is more memorable than the sliders.  The veggie burger was juicy and full of flavor. It was so good I'd have it again and again. My wife had the wing starter with fries, and my boys had the mini corn dogs and nuggets.  All of their food looked very good and since they all ate everything, I will assume it was tasty.

The downfall is this place is on the pricier side. For 2 adult meals 2 kids meals and an Arnold Palmer, total bill was just under $100.  Kinda crazy to me!
author: J B.

description: A disappointing burger experience. Not what one would expect from a place with Keller's name on it. very mediocre burgers offset by an iconic view. Not worth your time or money.
author: Gav J.

description: The restaurant was extremely expensive and neither the burger nor the milkshake was good
author: Maria O.

description: Came in a weekend ago because Cheesecake Factory was busy. Meat was juicy and fries were crispy. Would definitely come again
author: Carl B.

description: Burger Bar is barely one step above airport food, in terms of food quality. It's about on par with an airport restaurant in terms of ambiance. This restaurant reminds me why I never want to go to Union Square anymore. The onion rings were the one highlight. The price tag: $60 for two cheeseburgers and sodas.
author: Morris R.

description:
When I was JCP 1.0 Yelper (my original Elite account before this one) I gave Burger Bar a 5 star review that earned me a coveted "Review of the Day." The Twinkie shake with added whiskey was alone worth 5 stars. The burgers and sweet potato fries were a favorite for me and my girls. 

I went again recently. The menu was somewhat the same. The space itself has always been gorgeous. 

The food. 

Well, let's say everyone was happy I ordered a lot of appetizers. 

No one enjoyed their burger. 

My shrimp cocktail was good - but this is Burger Bar, where burgers should be amazing. 

They weren't. Not for my family. 

Also, I am forever frustrated with shakes that come when you are almost finished eating. That makes zero sense. 

Our server was fine. The food wasn't winning anyone's wish for a repeat.

Things have changed.

Shrugs.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Awful experience at Burger Bar. The food was mediocre at best and the service was ridiculously slow. For a $20 turkey burger, I would expect it to at least come hot and with warm fries. Everything was luke warm to cold, our water glasses sat empty throughout our whole meal and we were rushed to order despite it being a slow night in the restaurant. 

I ordered a cabernet off the menu and my boyfriend ordered a large beer, we would have liked to enjoy our drinks and have another round but felt so rushed by our server. The milkshakes did however look amazing and we wanted to stay for dessert but were never offered. The check was dropped off before we finished eating. I would not recommend coming here. - We did have high expectations due to the pricing, we were hoping for something more close to The Counter but we ended up with low scale diner type food.  Very disappointing.
author: Hallie M.

description:
This is a ZERO STAR REVIEW!! 

Myself and some family member decided to eat here around 4pm NYE 2017. 

Getting seated was actually the best part of my experience during this visit. Burger Bar has a fantastic view of union square. It can be difficult to get a table at times. Surprisingly we were sat quickly and I was eager to order my burger. 

Our waiter greeted us and took our drink order. We also ordered some appetizers. The waiter took a while to bring us our drinks. I think he may of forgot. He also to a very long time to bring our appetizers. When he finally brought us a simple order of chicken wings they were not even hot. They were not cold either. They were somewhere in the middle. We also added fries to one order of wings and when we asked for them he made t seem like it was our fault. I can't even review the burger  because I was forced to cancel it. The 7 other people I was with had finished their food and I didn't want them to wait. I also figured there would most likely be a problem with the food since that had been the common theme of our experience. 

When we finally asked our waiter for the check he took a while to get this for us. My family paid cash and I was going to put the rest on my card.......HE F--king lost my card. He was crawling under my table asking his co-workers. It was a f..king NIGHTMARE. HUBERT KELLER!! DO SOMETHING ABOUT YOUR RESTAURANT PLEASE!!! I don't think I'd go back if they offered to pay me to eat. 

Two of my family members got sick and I was embarrassed I chose such a terrible place to eat. 

DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND EAT SOMEWHERE ELSE!!
author: Emiliano O.

description:
In short, great view of Union Square if you're able to get the right tables. Food is extremely subpar.

Years ago, I had ordered the salmon burger. I used to just eat the salmon without the buns. It was alright. Came back here recently and got the Caesar salad with salmon, and it was terrible. The salmon was undercooked in parts. The "salad" part was leaves of lettuce with some cheese and croutons. It was not a tossed salad to eat with a fork. Interesting presentation, but an odd way to eat a Caesar salad, and it wasn't particularly tasty. 

I also got their hazelnut milkshake. While it was good, it was extremely sweet. I asked them to make me a kid's size for half the price (and half the calories). 

This place is not cheap and the food isn't good. Unless you're here for a good view or you can't be bothered to go elsewhere for a quick bite, I wouldn't bother.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I came to visit SF before Christmas and remembered this burger spot from 2 years ago ... clearly the food was really great if I remembered from 2 years ago! I brought my friend here our first night in sf and he LOVED it, he couldn't believe how tasty the burgers were. He also loved the view of union station as we were eating our burgers and drinking our wine! 

The service wasn't as great as my first time but the food made up for the service. It also wasn't so packed which was great ! 

I definitely recommend you stop here in between shopping at union square ! Top floor at Macy's !
author: Crystal D.

description:
The burger was tasty and they have gluten free buns (which I was thankful for), but I don't think I'll be coming back. This is why:

1. The skinny fries were super stale. They were the worst fries I've had in a really long time. 

2. They use plastic glasses. Who wants to pay $50 for a burger while sipping from an old disgusting plastic glass? 

3. They put a straw in every glass of water. Plastic straws are horrible for the environment! This is a restaurant in San Francisco, they should know that their clients care about more than just themselves. Please, STOP GIVING OUT PLASTIC STRAWS WITH EVERY DRINK!

There is a lot of amazing food to be had in San Francisco. There are also a lot of restaurants that care about the earth. I don't have to settle for anything less than great.
author: Diana G.

description:
Came here with my family the day after Christmas. It was my first time here. The Burger Bar is located in Union Square near the top of the Macy's building. The elevator is on the opposite side of the elevator that goes up to the Cheesecake Factory. When we arrived to the restaurant, it seemed pretty busy. My wife put our name down for a table and requested a table by a window if possible. The hostess told us it would be 30 minutes. We sat waiting for nearly an hour. When my wife checked on our status, they finally said our table was ready. As we were being escorted to our table, we noticed that there were many empty tables. We were a bit shocked as to why it took so long. My wife guessed that they may have been short staffed and were managing the number of customers in the restaurant. On a good note, they were able to get us a table by the window, which was good. 

Service and our server was good. Friendly, and checked on us throughout our meal. I ordered a smoked Gouda burger with bacon, and caramelized onions; with a side of fries. It was ok, but nothing to sing home about. Considering we spent the day walking around Union Square, the food really hit the spot. Not sure how often I would eat here but it was nice to experience a new burger place. I will say, during Christmas time, the view from a table by the window was great.
author: Joven S.

description:
Ugh. New Year's day and this place left the worst taste in my mouth.  We were really hungry and Cheesecake Factory had an enormous line so we walked in here to be sat at the bar area immediately.  Yay! The server didn't have any recommendations, said she didn't know the menu well and started there a few weeks ago.

My sister chose a Cobb salad to be safe, her bf a Classic burger and myself the Peppercorn burger.

The burgers were awful, a quarter pounder at McD would've been better.  Both overcooked, we ordered medium and they were over well, completely dry.  Mines had the weirdest dipping sauce that tasted like sweet and sour ammonia and A1.  The pink peppercorns on the Dijon sauce on the burger were just weird.  Such a huge disappointment.  Add two sodas and the bill was $75- $90 after tip.  

Hard to believe the worst burger I ever had came from the "Burger" bar.  I mean, an airport cafe makes a better burger.

NEVER EVER, EVER again.  The worst!!
author: Angela K.

description:
Wonderful restaurant with a panoramic view on the mean place of SF. The burger is good, I ordered a frog burger so with mushrooms Portobello and they are not tasty but fresh. The steak cooked rare as I like. For burger I m not really difficult with the cooking of the meat because there are much things around it and the pleasure of the tenderness meal is a mixed of all.
French fries are amazing. My favorite French fries are thin as they did, they called it skinny French fries. Finger fooding after eat asparagus and mushrooms in the burger...wonderful, the restaurant I found it on this Sunday, my paradise brunch!!! Waitress and waiters are kind, there presence is not too much on you, they know how to ask you if all is well, I appreciate that they are not as ghost when I need someone too explain me what they served me, and they're not the guest or just here for waiting only tips.
And as I said at my first purpose, it's a pleasure also for eyes. 
Eyes and bully are full ! Sunday great weather.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Great burger.
Great view.
So-so digs.

The Hubert Keller burger is all the talk, & if you're into spinach, caramelized onions, & blue cheese w your juicy patty, you'll be very happy.  I'm a big fan of ciabatta bread too, but I still prefer a sesame seed bun in times like these.

Times that I want a great burger, that is.

If you're like me, & are happier w the simpler things in burger life, than go w the American classic burger.  The American cheese, bacon, & sesame seed bun (yay) accompany & compliment the patty just like they should.  Perfectly. 

The Hubert Keller name is a heavy hitter in the industry (understatement).  Fleur De Lys was a beacon of fine dining in SF forever.  So it stands to reason that his burger joint should rightly reflect his stature.  And the food does.

It's the space that doesn't.

The burgers & their quality are upscale.  The view is upscale.  The prices (2 burgers w fries ran me 46 bucks) are upscale.  But the space is reminiscent of a wedding reception...in a hotel.  The overall concept rings best in the main room, w the bar.  The other 2 rooms?  They just scream hotel conference.

The laminated menus are tired & in need of a serious makeover.  This isn't Cheesecake Factory.  

But, it is next door.

The view of union square is stunning.  Milk shakes that you customize & can add alcohol to...genius.  And the classic burger is really fantastic.

Just forget that, despite the fact that the price of a burger here averages 25 bucks (without fries), you're given menus that look like they belong to a diner.

3 & 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Super disappointed. This has always been one of our favorite places to eat but the food was just so bad. Ordered my burger medium and it was well done. No pink at all, when in previous times it was the perfect pink, almost red in the middle.  It was dry and very little flavor. The fries, mozzarella sticks & onion rings appetizer came out cold, not even warm. Service was also poor. Had to flag people down for our drink refills.
author: Denise C.

description:
Delicious food. Absolutely. Had a business lunch here with a colleague and it's delicious. Because of how packed it is (go EARLY if you're trying to get a table, or make reservations early). 

We opted in for the potato fry's (pretty good) and the burger (delish). One of the better burgers I've had in SF (maybe top 3). It's really small inside, so if you expect a spot, think ahead.

Ambiance is casual. Chill spot to kick back, eat, and have a very good time. 

Very recommended if you a burger fan
author: Amber D.

description: The food is good and bad. You have a plate with a bomb hamburger but then the meat isn't medium like I asked. But then on the other plate you have a burnt onion ring and some sucked up no potato skinny fries. And have we talked about price? You mean to tell me you gave me an $8 burger for $20something? Way over priced. Now let's talk service.. I had to take another tables utensils and no one even noticed. Took 10 minutes to get a servers attention. I've been waiting for the check for 10 minutes and I don't doubt it will be another 10 minutes before I actually get the check. As a matter of fact.... now that I'm waiting so long I'm going to go from a 3 star to a 2 star. Sad service.
author: Bianca L.

description: The burgers and appetizers are pretty good but, having been coming here for a while now, we've noticed that the service is pretty much on the decline. Such a shame as it's a nice alternative to the Cheesecake Factory and it's lengthy wait times!
author: Foofa B.

description:
This place really disappointed me and my friends. Great location with a nice view, but the view was far from being worth it!!! 

Mediocre food honestly for the price. For being a burger place we were not blown away with our burgers. Very dry. Overpriced. And even the shakes we just bland. 

I honestly wouldn't go back here or ever recommend it to anyone. Just not worth it for how expensive it is!! We went in without checking reviews and that was a big mistake. 

Also service is so slow and it wasn't even that busy. 

Bottom line: go somewhere else. There's way better food out here in SF!
author: Celeste C.

description: Hands down the worst burger I have ever had; not counting the cold fries! The burger had no taste. Every single addition to my burger wasn't fresh, including the cheese. (I've never experienced a dry, dehydrated slice of cheese on my burger, ever.) The "skinny fries" were cold, soggy and tasted as if it had been sitting around all day. (We ate at 6pm.) The reviews are deceiving, perhaps because of the location and view. While walking around we saw a Burger King... and a Walgreens... we could've eaten ANYTHING from either of those places and it still would've been exponentially better than Burger Bar. Did i mention our bill for 2 Buffalo burgers with cheese, fries; which came with the burger, and two iced teas came out to $83? Yeah, avoid this place at all costs. You're welcome.
author: Holly P.

description:
Juiciest burger I've ever had!! And I got medium well! No wait on Sunday at 4pm. Great view of union square. 

Back to my burger. I forgot to ask for a whole wheat bun but the default was soft and toasted-- totally went with the whole build your own Angus patty! For extra charges, I added Swiss, portobello mushrooms, and smothered my side of truffle mayo on both halves of the bun, topped it off with included lettuce & tomato. Omahgah! I was deliriously hungry after Bay Bridge toll plaza traffic (I need fastrak!) and from the very first bite I had burger juice running down my chin. So freaken good! Medium well was cooked to perfection, no pink! The angus base was $10.75 and toppings range from 65 cents to $3. Special exceptions include $30 truffles (1/3 oz), $8.95 for world's hottest sauce, and $7.50 for 3 large shrimp. 

Nick took care of us. Seems like he was the only waiter taking orders and asking how we were doing. Besides him, there was a lady seating everyone and another waiter whose sole duty was to deliver food. Mom ordered the three sliders and sis got the American Classic? Both come with skinny fries. I ordered buttermilk zucchini fries as a side but they didn't arrive with our meals. Nick apologized and comped them. Thank you! The zucchini was crisp and lightly breaded, no excess batter! 

I'll be back for a burger in the future.
author: Kristine F.

description:
Don't know what happened to this place, it used to be good, but this time I went, the burgers were not juicy, I ordered medium and it came out more than well done and super dry.  The wings were super salty, it's terrible!!

I was in a hurry, so I didn't send it back.  The service was slow... and it wasn't even that busy!!
author: Will C.

description:
The roommate and I were looking for a place to eat dinner late on a Sunday night. Since we were going to be in the Union Square area, I just randomly picked Burger Bar as I haven't been here in years. (It was actually where the roomie and I had dinner on what you could have called our first date 6+ years ago.) We stopped by on June 5th around 9pm.

*Rossini ($65): Kobe Style Wagyu Beef from Australia, sautéed foie gras and shaved truffles on an onion bun. Named after a XIXth Century Italian composer whose love for fine food was legendary. The preparation always includes foie gras, truffles and a rich brown sauce - in this case, Black Truffle. Served with Skinny Fries.
*Caesar Salad ($6.95 Small): Crisp romaine hearts, shaved parmesan, crunchy croutons and caesar dressing.
*Fish and Chips ($8.95): Fresh battered rod cod, garlic fries, tartar sauce and coleslaw.
*Jalapeno Onion Petals ($3.95)
*World's Hottest Sauce ($8.95)

I've always wanted to try their rossini burger, but thought it was too pricey. The roommate said to just go ahead and get it, so I got it. So not worth the $65 in my opinion. The burger patty was a little tough and the foie and truffle didn't have much of the decadent flavor I love in both these ingredients. Maybe because everything was frozen for too long? I don't know, but for a rich burger, it just had dulled down flavors. I also got the hot sauce without looking at the price. $8.95 was too much to pay for this tiny tin of sauce. And world's hottest? I beg to differ. The roommate ordered the rest of the items. They were just average. Nothing special.

Probably would have given them 3 stars if I didn't order the rossini and hot sauce. Minus one for the pricing and flavor on those. I've had better burgers elsewhere. Overall, just super overpriced.
author: Elena N.

description:
Herbert Keller.  The name evokes a sad sigh from me as I was too late to eat at the fabulous Fleur de Lys.  My husband has fond memories of his place, and speaks of it as the best French food he has ever eaten.  

An errand into the city meant we needed a lunch place.  He wanted to try Burger Bar, so off we went.  

It was shoulder to shoulder in Macy's, and I was concerned about seating.  Surprisingly, there was no wait at 1:00 on a Sunday.  At least, there was no wait to be seated.  

We waited to order drinks.  

We waited to receive drinks.  

We waited to order food.  

And then we waited, and waited.  

All that waiting gave us time.  Time to find all the little things that needed refreshing in the restaurant; our table had sticky stuff all over it.  The chairs were badly dinged and the walls were in serious need of a paint job.  I felt like I was in a very busy Applebee's that was scheduled for a remodel.  I was seated directly across from a slightly obscene picture of two women sticking their tongues out, ready to suck on a straw protruding from a single milkshake.  My husband's view was of a 50 something woman displaying her "senior yoga" skilz on the TV in front of him.

Finally, the food came.  I had ordered a Wagu hamburger on a sesame bun, medium rare, zucchini fries, and a side salad. What I got was a small, hockey-puck sized, almost well-done burger on a ginormous, untoasted, sesame bun.  The fried zucchini appeared to be cooked from frozen rather than fresh.  There was no salad.  The hamburger was pretty good, even though most of its life was cooked out of it.  

Hubby ordered a regular hamburger and a side salad.  Though his meat was cooked medium rare (he had ordered it rare), he said the burger and the salad were pretty good.  (Since I had no salad, he shared his.  It was very good.)  

Not surprisingly, there was no check back after ordering the food, and our drinks were refilled long after they were empty.  The bill reflected the two salads we ordered, and the young man who waited on us seemed surprised that we didn't receive two.  

All in all, for the price and location, I would consider this an emergency restaurant.  I would not seek it out, as there are so many other, better choices, in the area.  The burgers are good, but not great.  The view is pretty great, if you can get a window seat.  The service was pretty terrible and the decor was in bad need of a facelift.  For the price, it is... okay.

Herbert Keller, you don't know me, so take this advice for what it is worth-- some stranger with very little professional cooking experience, on the internet, advising a world famous chef how to run his business.  Crazy, huh?  But, this time, hubris wins over sense, so here it goes.  Burger Bar is probably not what you want San Francisco to remember you by.  It needs some love and attention.  And toast the buns.
author: Polly P.

description:
Was thinking about getting the Rossini here but I'm not too much of a truffles fan so I decided to make my own burger instead.  

I chose the Kobe beef and the onion bun, added the foie gras, those three ingredients are the same as the Rossini, however I did not get the truffles or the truffle sauce I got the hangovers sauce instead.

the DIY burger comes with sweet potato fries however they gave me regular fries so I had to ask and they were happy to bring the extra sweet potatoes fries. However they tried to charge me for it at the end and i had to get the bill updated

The bottom of the bun was already soggy by the time they brought it out to me, not good. They did get my medium rare beef right though. The foie gras is definitely a lot smaller than it looks on the Rossini.

Would I come here again? Certainly not!
author: Trammi N.

description: Meh. Basic burgers not worth the price, but generous portions. I had the American burger and husband had the Catina. Fries were good and was quick, milkshakes looked really good but we were definitely too full to order one after eating.
author: Danika C.

description: The price is a little on the more expensive side but it was pretty good. Burger was cooked well and tasted good but the fries seemed like they have been sitting out for a while. A tad cold and soggy. I described the concept like a more expensive version of The Counter.
author: Shannon C.

description:
Worst service ever !! I always have this problem when my boyfriend and I dine out! Being a young, black couple, this isn't the first time I've received shitty service. Kept getting walked by, by servers and saw people get sat after us, receive immediate attention. Waited for about 15 minutes before someone spoke to us and they only offered a drink because they didn't know who our server was. I've been serving for almost 4 years and I know exactly what was going on. Little did they know, we tip 20%!!! We will never come back nor recommend this place to anyone. Treat everyone equal, not everybody is a rich, white businessman. It's all about respect. 
PS: We only ordered drinks because we didn't feel comfortable eating there and as we were walking out of the place, our "server" and his friends yelled "0 tip"!!!  If I could give this place negative stars, I would.
author: Rozina B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place since a friend of mine used to work here. I knew it would be overpriced and a tourist trap, but were the burgers decent? I had set the bar pretty low. 

So I took a group of friends on a Saturday around noon and was pleased to see that there was hardly anyone there, we were seated immediately. The menu was fun, in a TGIFriday's, gimmicky kind of way, and I was super hungry. I ordered a turkey burger and my boyfriend ordered a regular burger, medium rare. 

While my turkey burger was cooked through, my boyfriend's was dangerously rare. As in, bloody with translucent meat. I am not exaggerating--you can see my picture. So he sent it back, and they sent us another burger, this one seemed even more rare! I couldn't believe it! He eventually got a burger that was edible on the third time after telling them he would prefer medium to well done. He was a bit freaked out by his brush with food poisoning. 

The remainder of our meal was spent in heated debate: was the cook being vindictive? Was it his first day? If you work at an establishment that is known mainly for their burgers, and you have probably cooked hundreds of them per week, why did it seem so impossible to carry out a medium rare order? Surely, it has been ordered before? 

Thanks for the entertaining and heated debate, Burger Bar. But I will never eat there again.

Btw, the turkey burger was ok, not great for $18.
author: Amity B.

description:
Wow, I should have known better than coming here. Burger might have looked ok, but lacked flavor. For a 'gourmet burger' place? Come On!

I got the 'frog' burger with bacon, and looking forward to the truffle sauce. I did not notice any truffle sauce. The lower bum was soggy, like it sat on counter for a while. Usually good burger joints grill the bread to avoid this problem. Not here... overall a 1 out 5.

The only good thing there was the Poke, which my wife had. Big chunks of Poke, and a fair amount. 

Service was dismal with the waiter forgeting about the bacon order, a bus boy going back and forth with a cart of dirty dishes. I felt like I was at Denny's.  Oh wait, even their well done burger was better than this.
author: Ed K.

description:
Surprisingly not bad. I figured this would be more of a tourist trap type of place when it came to the food quality, but while the place is still a tourist trap, the food quality was better than I imagined it would be. 

We came in around 5:30 on a Saturday with no wait at all, and even got a window seat. Perfect. They have a large line up of drinks and even have a $60 dollar burger. No joke. The burgers we had were flavorful and tasty, but not nothing out of this world in terms of the best of the best. They are a bit pricey, but that's the nature of being located in a prime location I suppose. 

Overall, a decent burger spot, but there is much better, for much cheaper in the city. Still, it was worth trying at least once.
author: Benny H.

description: Stopped in today with some friends who were craving a good burger.  Was not disappointed.  I got the American burger.  It was quite tasty!  And I definitely did not leave here hungry. Only downside was that they serve Pepsi products.
author: amanda c.

description:
The food is average, and overpriced. The waits at this location is not too long, and varies between 15 minutes to 2 hours. It is a great place to walk into​ if other restaurants (like the Cheesecake factory) have a long wait. 

Service was great, but the food ruined it for me.

Overall, this felt like an overpriced Red-Robin. 

P.S. get the skinny fries over the fat fries!
author: Javelin R.

description:
Thank you Gabriel!!!!!! Our fantastic waiter explained the menu items to us, recommended his favorites and made sure our drinks were full. He was very attentive even with so many tables! 

Now.....The restaurant wasn't really clean though. Napkins and straws were on the floor. The booths nearby had food on the seats and the restrooms needed to be tended to. 

Not sure if we will be back, cuz the food was just "okay".
author: Mal M.

description:
Good service, good food! I would come again!

The view is great.

The food is expensive but tasty.

I went with my mother and aunt. We all created our own burgers. I had a plain bun, pepper jack cheese, avocado, and jalapeño bacon. Very good! Then an vanilla Oreo milkshake. I was so full. My mother and aunt had shakes too!
author: Nicole J.

description:
We came out of sheer desperation for a TV and a place to eat and watch Game 7 of the Warriors. Cheesecake Factory was full so we went down to Level 6 of Macy's and found Burger Bar. Originally, we were going to sit near the bar but then learned that the booths had TVs! Whaaat?!

Sure the TV was tiny and there was no sound and only subtitles but it served its purpose nonetheless. Burgers were around $10+, a little pricey but you're downtown and in SF. I had the Hangover Burger and it was a patty smothered in Hangover Sauce which was a sort of thousand island dressing with onions. Lettuce, red onions, and tomato came on the side along with a giant dill pickle. 

I also had a side of fries included but it was the fat fries and I preferred the skinny fries more since I like my fries crispy so I mostly stole it from my friend's plate since she had the Classic Burger. 

Eating the burger was messy since the hangover sauce would drip everywhere but it was pretty good and I was starving. I was actually distracted by my burger during the game since it's hard to read subtitles and stare at my massive burger. 

The bathrooms are towards the back and there's two single bathrooms for the Women's! Nice, lord knows how long the wait is for the Women's restroom no matter where you are. 

Definitely might make a return for perhaps a milkshake and another game. I enjoy having the relaxing atmosphere with my friends and being able to talk while still enjoying the game together.
author: Diana C.

description:
Located on the 6th floor of Macy's in Union Square, this burger place is a nice reprieve from the Seafood Places around SF. 

The Burgers are a good size and Burger Bar offers many different types of fries to compliment them. The Fried Sampler I had was great with the fried pickles, fried mozzarella and garlic fries. Kids shared the nachos which was enough to fill them up. The fries were a little cold but other than that they food was great for the price. 

The service was a little slow but again, it seemed the wait staff was serving all over the place. We sat in the bar area which had a great view of Union Square despite the construction  below. The Host seemed hesitant to sit anyone in the regular dining room and sat everyone in the bar unless they asked for the specific area. All in all, a good place to eat if you're in Union Square.
author: Kacie M.

description:
Tourist Trap.
Great location.
Overall food quality: quality doesn't come close to the price. 

Compared to a simple Red Robin it pales in comparison of quality and taste, but is overpriced by a large margin (Due to prime location)

-Stringy Fries: stale and luke warm
-Sweet potatoes fries: stale and luke warm. 
-Onion Rings: Luke warm below average
-Milk Shake Sampler (6): Nutella, strawberry, black and white. Looked good, taste was flavorful, but was not cold. Milk shakes should be cold. Tasted more like room temperature heavy cream.
-Burgers: below average in taste, and freshness for the price. 
-Service: below average. (Missed a few orders, drinks were not takin until we reminded them, hostess cringed that we came at 9:15pm with 9 and mentioned they may not be able to serve us.)
author: Rico T.

description: Burger Bar is great for the views, experience, and service.  The restaurant offers tables next to the window overlooking Union Square, or booths if you want a larger table.  I prefer this restaurant over the Cheesecake Factory because it's less crowded and loud, but the food/drinks are still great.  I would choose the Cheesecake Factory if I wanted a table outside, but overall I prefer Burger Bar for the service and selection.  The menu has a lot of customization options, great appetizers/salads, and drinks.  You can also choose to sit at the bar, and the bartender can refill your drinks faster or give you extra napkins/sauce, basically anything you need.  The portion sizes are also great, you can share depending on how much you eat.
author: Lola S.

description: I returned and had a much better experience. Their servers are wonderful, but their kitchen still needs help. I ordered the rossini burger and while the burger was cooked correct, the foie gras was under cooked, could have used some char, and the black truffles looked different from my experience, but tasted good (see photo). a better experience, but lags behind their opening here and their sister location in Las Vegas.
author: Dean N.

description:
I think this is one of the best (if not the best) burger restaurants in the country. 

Located exactly on the union square area of San Francisco, the location is also excellent. 

Their menu consists mainly of gourmet burgers. Starting at about $15 and ending at $65. But well worth it. 

Watch out from their spicy burger, I can tolerate spicy food, and this one was more of a pain than a sandwich. 

Their dignitaries Herbert Keller (chef name) sandwich is one I recommend amongst many.
author: Mike S.

description: The burgers are okay not the best in SF, but they have a good view of Union Square. Other than that they don't really got anything great going for them
author: Christian M.

description: I've wanted to try this place every time I came to San Fran. I must say I was highly disappointed. I won't be back. Husband got the burger and was disappointed as well
author: K S.

description:
Who would have thought that Cheesecake factory would have over an hour wait during the week?  I guess the holidays brings out the troves of tourists.

Well, burger bar seemed like a close 2nd option. 

How can you mess up a burger? Um....yea this place was basically a diner.

The "build your own" became much more complicated than I thought.  Each person at our table ordered different toppings, meats etc.  I knew that something was bound to get messed up.

The nachos were a joke.  I could have microwaved velveeta on a plate of Tostitos and it would have tasted better.  

The burger was dry and the bacon was over-cooked.  I ordered Avocado and the waitress forgot it.

Seriously, just save your $20 and eat somewhere else.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Typical bar and grill, but expensive. They have a $50-60 burger with truffles on it. Their wings were mediocre, and cost $15 holy cow. I liked the fried pickles ($4 side).
author: Natasha K.

description:
The first time I came here we had excellent service and the food was great! This could be because Chef Keller was in the building. My friends and I dined here this weekend. Three of us ordered meals and on two were brought out. We thought his was just taking longer but no the server never input his order. 
very disappointing. Sad that this place has a great view great owner and has slipped when it comes to service.
author: A C.

description:
Yummy alcoholic milkshakes at the Burger Bar!! Yes those milkshakes bring all the boys (and girls) to the yard. Hahaha...

But no seriously, those milkshakes are dang yummy. My bff and I came here for lunch on a Sunday night a couple of weeks ago after the wedding faire at the Westin. We had the following:

Wings & skinny fries - yummy
Onion rings - pretty good, but I'm biased cause I'm not really a fan of onion rings
Mozzarella sticks - yummy
Red Velvet Milkshake - mmm yummmy
Irish Coffee Milkshake - she said hers was yummy as well

Everything's good, but it's a bit pricier, but what do you expect of a burger place in a Macy's in Union Square. Plus, the view is nice to look at.
author: Amy C.

description: Came here on a Saturday at 8ish & it was about a 30 minute wait. The service here isn't the best, it's quite slow. After we were seated, after 30 minutes or so, a waiter didn't come by at all, so we had to call someone over to take our order. I really enjoyed the Salted Caramel Milkshake, but the Burger Bar Sliders were okay, they were kind of dry & the skinny fries were cold. My sister had gotten the Build Your Own Burger & they completely forgot the sauce on her burger. This place is also more on the expensive side & I don't think it's exactly worth it. Don't think I'd come back here.
author: Stacie I.

description: Food was amazing! Their burgers are amazing ! Def get a burger medium rare if you wanna try the best taste
author: Arash M.

description: We were very pleased with the Burger Bar inside of Macy's. The serving sizes were larger than we expected.  My Wedge Salad was half a head of lettuce, wow! The French Fry Sampler was large too. They even made my wife a special chocolate shake with espresso added!  The staff was great and so was the view of Union Square.
author: Scotty B.

description:
Came here on one of San Francisco's rare hot summer days for a late lunch. Took a short wait to seat us. My burger was entirely satisfactory; it was the peppercorn burger. Ultimately, though, it was quite pricey for what it was. For ~10% the price, you can get equally good burgers in the same neighborhood.

There was a $50 wagyu beef burger on the menu with foie gras and black truffles. It seems kind of gimmicky to me, but if it's something that appeals to you, it's something exclusive to Burger Bar, so maybe think about that.

My lunchmate got the sliders, and she was actively dissatisfied with them, mostly because they came without any sauce.

We didn't get any of the shakes, which I sort of regret, because they looked pretty darn good.

The kicker was that the service was pretty crummy. Our silverware didn't come until after we'd had our food for, like, five minutes. We had to grab condiments from an adjacent table. And they'd run out of beer glasses ... ? That one isn't a big deal, but it struck me as kind of weird, and is perhaps indicative of the lax service overall.
author: Greg P.

description: I had a very bad experience here. First of all the Union Square salad is pricey on its own- $13 but they charge $7 to add a chicken breast & it's $4 for a side of sweet potato fries that were nasty. A total of $27 just for this! Salad wasn't even good & my tummy got irritated from this so called meal. Not worth it! Don't waste your $$$ when you can buy a tastier salad for a way lower price somewhere else.
author: Cristina R.

description: Brought a coworker who is in town for business to this place for lunch looking for some good burgers and good laughs, left with more bad debt than Bernie Madoff. Pretty good deal on wine though, only paid $12 for a 1989 Romanée Conti, and by Romanée Conti I mean a Nutella milkshake. Seriously 12 dollars for a fucking shake. That said, a milk shake here is probably the most fun you can have with your pants on.  Burger was nothing I couldn't have made at home, if I was not an 88 year old veteran of two wars who can barely walk. Fries were just a poor effort like come on, COME ON. You expect better when you have to defraud the IRS to finance a meal here. Waiter was fat, take that as you will. While the prices were egregious, we did have good banter. Can't complain too much. Fow stahs.
author: Matt B.

description:
Ok so generally like this place. But we put our name into the"queue" today hoping for a nice table. Bottom line? After waiting for over an hour with multiple check ins at front desk with assurances that we were "5-10 min" from being seated, we left. On the way out i told the hostess that this was a fail and she did not even care. Nice.

Spoke to S. Casilla at BB who is supposedly a manager (after 5 calls that went to voicemail and said the mailbox was full), and she was nice but could only offer me a "reservation" for later today to spend more $$. She said that "Rocky" the receptionist said I yelled at her (really? After waiting so long with zero help?) and called my name and we did not respond. Wow. 

My two cents: "Rocky" should be fired for lack of attention to a customer, and you all should avoid this place in Union Square as over-priced and suck service.
author: David B.

description:
Very disappointed. Considering it was probably the most expensive burger I've ever had...I can get a WAY better one at Super Duper Burger just down the street for not even a 1/3 of the price. Real bummer. 

Fries were meh :/

The milkshake was amazing though!
author: Andrea V.

description: Burger bar was good. First server was very attentive as when they switch shifts the second server seemed a bit overwhelmed and didn't come back to check on us often. The women's restroom was disgusting. I refused to use the restroom due to its condition.
author: Carolyn R.

description:
Meh... Seriously I've experienced better. Cheesecake inside of Macy's was packed, so I though of giving this place a try. I was not very hungry went there for some quick drinks and appetizers. For drinks I got the Moscow Mule which was very very strong, bitter and It lacked the most important ingredient "Ginger". 
In appetizers I ordered chicken nachos or I should just say cheese nachos because there were like 2 tiny pieces of chicken in the entire plate of nachos. Not happy, definitely will not be recommending this place to my friends.
author: Simran K.

description:
Been here once for a company event, and twice to get take out. I'll start with the first experience. Great burger place when eating in. Love the meat, it melts in your mouth. The add on toppings are great as well ! They have a few selections and you can always create your own burger. 

I ordered the sliders to-go with fries twice. Both times, the fries were COLD! I was so not impressed. The ranch is amazing! The fries were disappointing when I got take out. Sliders were somewhat cold, and wasn't that great either. 

But for higher quality food, its better to get a regular sized burger and also eating in rather than doing to-go.

Great view from the location, over looking union square!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Salted caramel shake was too sweet. S'more shake was flavorless. My burger was dry. In addition, they ran out of avocado... what restaurant runs out of ingredients??! Especially since all Californians love avocado!!!

On the upside, my friend loved his burger! He had the Kobe beef with pan seared fois gras medium rare. He said it was the best burger in his life! Coming from a guy who eats $200 steaks for dinner! The entertainment on the televisions was great for showing sporting events! We were able to watch espn and sf giants play.

My friend described his sweet potato fries average. I loved my fat fries (steak fries).
Tip: elevator on the left!
Service was wonderful! Very capable bar presence. High stool and booth type seating.
If you're lucky with a window seat, you get a spectacular view on Union Square! 
2 stars for the best burger of his life. Missing 3 because of shakes and my burger
author: Jenny C.

description:
Maybe I went in with expectations set too high but overall the meal was really disappointing.

I got a Peppercorn burger with garlic fries. They put way too much sauce on the burger it ended up overwhelming the taste of anything else. As for the garlic fries, the waitress told us they were amazing but instead, they were underwhelming... You could barely taste the garlic on the fries and they were way overcooked. Some of the fries I got were crunchy and actually hard to bite through. I had some pickle fries from my friend and they tasted better.

The best part of the meal was the milkshakes. We got a milkshake sampler which came with 3 flavors: Nutella, Caramel and Strawberry. We thought it would be 3 smaller cups of the milkshakes but they're actually full sized milkshakes so it came with 6 cups, 2 of each flavor. I only tried the strawberry but it was definitely one of the better milkshakes I had and not overly sweet. 

Honestly burger bar is pretty disappointing for its price point. I wouldn't recommend coming here and definitely don't get the garlic fries.
author: Cassie Z.

description:
3 Onos our of 5
So, view was terrific, service was terrific, no wading through the tourist season. 

Just underwhelmed by the food.
author: John A.

description: This place was awesome. It is on the 6th floor of Macy's. It was easy to get a seat and the view of Union was amazing. The highlight of the meal was the unbelievable milkshakes - now this is decadence!!!
author: Hellen B.

description: Food was pretty good, orders were slow coming out and incorrect. Couple of 7 went back to be corrected. Then the food was pretty good after that. Nice server, new to the job. He was polite and attentive. Always share the specials first. Drinks were really good but small for the $13 cost.
author: Monica W.

description:
I came here with a group of friends from South Florida in town for a pharmacy conference back in October... I know I'm a little late on the review but had to share my experience! We came in on a Saturday night and found this place to be pretty packed, but got lucky finding enough seats at the bar where we could squeeze in.  As soon as we sat down we we're greeted by a waiter, and then a couple minutes after by the shift manager as well and taken care of really well.  It was nice to see service on point when the establishment looked like it was at about maximum capacity.  Again the service was so on point we even had someone who had too many drinks bothering our table and they had him escorted out and resolved the problem swiftly.  

As for the food all the burgers we ordered came out to perfection! I remember ordering the Kobe burger, JJ recommended it to me since I couldn't decide on what to order... everything looked so delicious! The result? That Kobe burger is one of the best Kobe burgers I've ever had! Also they have a pretty solid selection of beers, craft beers, and liquors as well too! Again big thanks to JJ helping us out and making us feel welcomed.

Some other cool features about this spot is the view by the window is really nice.  Also in the menu I noticed they have alcoholic shakes... Didn't get to try these out but they sound like a hit! 

If I end up in San Fran again anytime soon I'll definitely come back and visit.  Really had a great experience here at Burger Bar!
author: David L.

description: Food was amazing, price was right for the area, view was spectacular, and portions were huge! Only issue was the service. It wasn't to busy but our server didn't come to check on us and we had to flag him down for the check. Would still eat here again, but might benefit from better service
author: Brad S.

description: No wander why they have 3 stars, first time here ask for recommendations on salad and I want something light, but was told every thing. Plates was stack up on table without spread out for customers, food is alright.
author: Qing L.

description: Burger Boi and I were at our annual pilgrimage to the car show and post convention center we headed here. Two Moscow miles for me, a shake for him. The fries were undercooked, the onion rings perfect but only 7 or so made the $4 upgrade not quite worth it?The burgers were good and bar seating with a view of union square made it worth it.The service was efficient. A solid place in the city to appease the Burger
author: Sydney P.

description: Really good food and decent service. The view of union square is pretty awesome. If you plan to do some shopping and tourist stuff this is a great place for lunch. However "$$" isn't accurate. It's more like $$$.
author: Andrew V.

description: Really good drink options and they use quality meat. Plus it doesn't hurt that it's by one of my favorite master chefs ‍
author: Isaiah G.

description: We came in from shopping and had an amazing view of union square while eating!! The burger sliders were wonderful along with the Cobb salad! Great view and great food!
author: Echols J.

description: Great burger place with an amazing view of union square! Sylvia our waitress went above and beyond! The food was very tasty and delicious! The burger had a fresh grill taste!
author: David K.

description:
Late one afternoon, Mr. Joy suggested we go to Burger Bar. There was hardly anyone there, probably because it was a weekday.  I hear it can get busy, so good thing they take reservations.
We were seated at one of the tables by the window, so we got a view of Union Square.
The food was pretty average.

American Classic - Angus Beef, American cheese, crispy bacon, lettuce, tomato on sesame bun, with dill pickle:
Burger was pretty close to well done. We requested medium rare. The leafy lettuce and tomatoes tasted crisp and fresh though. 

Burger Bar Sliders - Buffalo with caramelized onions, Angus with plain bacon, NatureSource beef with American cheese, with skinny fries:
These burgers were well-done too, if not a little more dry, probably because small patties cook a lot faster. We couldn't really taste the difference between the 3 different types of beef. 

Nutella Milkshake - Chocolate ice cream, Nutella, chocolate sauce and chocolate whipped cream, topped with toasted hazelnuts:
The milkshake was not bad. It was a lot smaller than I expected, but kind of a relief, because it was so thick and cloyingly sweet. The toasted hazelnuts were the best part.

Most of the burgers are around $15-$25, with the exception of the "Kobe" style burger with sauteed foie gras & truffles for a whopping $65. I'd pay $65 for a faux "Kobe" steak, but not for a burger. Even with the foie gras and truffles, it seems overpriced. & why would foie be sauteed?

It's cool that the menu has different types of beef - Angus, Buffalo, Australian... but considering ours were all pretty overcooked, we couldn't tell the difference anyway. I didn't expect much from a burger in a department store, but once I realized it was Hubert Keller's restaurant, I wondered why it wasn't better. The chef is known for the FleurBurger after all. Then Mr. Joy reminded me of the episode on Top Chef when he didn't do so well with the burger challenge. It was good to try and a relief that we didn't need to wait in the tourist-heavy, central location.
author: Joy W.

description: Tried the salted caramel shake, I thought it was just ok. Didn't taste much of the salt till I reached the bottom of the glass. It was sprinkled on top and not mixed it, the caramel also sat on the bottom stuck to the glass.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday and it was not busy at all.  I ordered the Hulbert  Burger and to be honest it didn't really have a unique taste.  I also ordered garlic fries for an appetizer and it was so small.  I would come here for drinks only next time. 

Pros: Views of union square,  great service and lots of seating.
author: Richard M.

description: Great choices of burger, good location and casual dining with very friendly servers. I really enjoyed the wagyu beef burger there, and my wife had a chicken one, which was great too.
author: Suman D.

description: Was very disappointed in the management. I had a reservation for 9:15 on a Friday night. When I get there they're closed. When I asked what's up the manager tells me he that they're slow tonight and we closed early. Apparently he sent me a text that I didn't see because when you book on open table you get a confirmation text and a don't forget text. I would have appreciated a phone call to make sure I didn't drive from Oakland to sf for no reason. Smh ‍ then you give me a coupon for 10%off
author: Emile F.

description: Good place if you're in a holding pattern for whatever you need to do next.  Go for the drinks & view over Union Square.  Food is mediocre, service good.
author: Coni B.

description:
Granted this place is right by Union Square and all, the food is way too expensive for being so ordinary. I got the Kobe beef burger with cheese,nothing else special, and it was already $20. The burger size was smaller than most fancy burger places I had been to. I would say, give or take, it was the same size as a in-n-out burger. 
The Kobe beef came out to be pretty decent- quite thick and juicy. I liked the meat. However, the cheese (I got Gouda), for being $2 extra, the slide was so so so so thin.  It was practically non existent. I could barely taste any cheese at all. A bit bitter because I really like cheese .....
We came on a Saturday for dinner and the wait was only about 20 mins. Not too bad. 
Meh I won't be coming back by choice.
author: Veronica N.

description: The saddest salad I ever seen. Hamburger was not the best one neither. The place had a GREAT view but it was all very old and horrible to be honest, kind of dirty. Would never come back.
author: Fede C.

description: My time here was short, which explains my low review. While waiting for our table at The Cheesecake Factory, we decided to stop by a bar for a drink and came across Burger Bar. We probably sat at the bar waiting for the bartender for about 10-15 minutes. To add, there was only one other guy at the bar with us, so I have no idea why the bartender was wandering around making small talk for when there's people waiting at the bar for him. And by the time he finally asked for our orders, our table at Cheesecake was ready, so we just forgo the entire thing.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
The view is worth 5-stars alone! Unfortunately, that was the best part of our experience here.

We came kind of early and by time we left it was prime lunch time on a Saturday and it was still slow. It seems the people of San Fran know what's up-I'd give it 2-stars, but alas-those views!

We each got burgers medium rare. They were cooked to satisfaction, but mine didn't have the Brie on it that I ordered and my $3 avocado was not edible. I had to waive our waiter down after 10min to get a ripened avocado...ugh. He barely had a pulse, and whoever hired him should reevaluate their decisions. 

It seems the problem here is staff and management. My favorite burger joint in Las Vegas is Burger Bar, and it FAR exceeds this one.
author: Erin Y.

description:
My mum and I stopped in around 7:30 on a Friday evening and I was happy to find the place with many open seats. However, the man at the host desk was not friendly, almost as if "Dang it! Not another customer!" was running through his head. But we got a menu and were greeted by Winchell, our super friendly and attentive waiter. Mum and I just ordered drinks, which we were thrilled about. I had the Blackberry Margarita and mum had the drink with cucumber in it. Both were absolutely delicious. One of the best drinks I've had in a long time. 

This joint is right across from the Cheesecake Factory, which we tried to go to first, but quickly left after seeing the entire restaurant flooded by rude, pushy people. I imagine 200+ people in the lobby area. Needless to say, that was a no-go. We hopped over to Burger Bar and our experience was as described, not to mention having a beautiful view of the city.
author: Olivia D.

description: Enrique, was ehhh, he didn't help much. The lady who actually dropped my nuggets was the best and actually helped us the whole time. Our milkshakes were trash and only had whipped cream, no ice cream at all. Once we complained to the manager, he was an asshole to us and barely helped. Very disappointed. Won't be coming back. Also a $17 kids menu...the fuck???
author: Madison R.

description:
Trendy upscale burger bar with a great view of union square 

FOOD: bacon cheese burger with spinach & grilled onions and  the burger bar trio ; fries, cheese sticks & jalapeño poppers 
Burger was good had a nice char flavor fry trio just ok Luke warm nothing special 

Service : fast easy accommodating

Ambience: if u can get a window seat the view is very nice the burger bar sits up high so u can enjoy a nice view;  atmosphere casual quite  chill

Conclusion : burgers are good decent casual place to stop in when u want the above average burger experience they also are famous for their milkshakes which some contain alcohol next time I'll definitely be back for one so overall decent experience I'd come back
author: Sac M.

description: Great place nice views menu is extensive. Friendly staff. Great alcoholic floats. One of the dips requires a release form to be signed before they can serve to you.
author: Rey B.
