description: $$ is misleading as we found the menu options expensive.  The cheapest burger was $13 plus $1 for cheese.  I would of been happier with In and Out.
author: Janey E.

description:
Garbage experience. Service is nonexistent, burgers were barely warm, and extremely rare.
Watching staff stand around and talk to each other, right now, while waiting for someone to pick up our check. Had to run down a manager to even ask for it. This may be the first time, ever, I just don't tip.
When you can watch people be sat, order, eat, pay, and leave in the time it takes to get your check, nobody's *earned* a gratuity.
author: Erik Y.

description: Nice view, nice server. One of the burgers and the fries were ok. But cocktails and wine were terrible and a burger came out that was basically raw inside.  Prices were excessive for the quality.
author: Jonathan H.

description: 23 dollar burger (peppercorn) was mediocre at best and didn't even include the lettuce onion tomato pickle. Just cheese. 16 dollar boozey milkshakes tasted amazing but not as boozy as advertised. Inexperienced and awkward server. At $40 a head it was not at all up to par
author: Katie N.

description:
Super bad service. I agree we came at on a Friday evening which is usually pretty busy, but not providing napkins , silverware or water even after the food was on the table is unacceptable. We ordered milkshake and it came 30 minutes after we were dun with the food. Only reason we still hung around is because I needed water and no one bothered to even fill the water glasses.
food is pretty good but I am not coming back!!!
author: Sathya J.

description: I prefer this to Cheesecake Factory. Quality of their meat is much better. I give it 4 stars because it's slightly over prices.
author: Fatima S.

description:
Let's start with the zero personality male hostess that greeted me. Nothing really good or bad to say about this individual but not really the best introduction to the Burger Bar brand. No smile. Barely any effort to announce your name when called good thing I was standing within 5 feet of him. He just seemed very uninterested in being there. 

Burger was perfect. And that's why you come to burger bar. 
The staff is not as good as the Las Vegas location. I was brought skinny fries instead of the fat like I ordered. The guy that came and brought us our food could barely speak English so figuring out whose order was who's took a little bit of work. It was not a big deal since there were only 3 of us. Everyone's burger was cooked perfectly. My friend ordered the truffled mayo and all 3 of us tried it and tasted no truffle at all. My chipotle aioli was quite good as a spread not too overpowering. 

Two of us got shakes a mint and a salted caramel. Damn they were good!!! Save room and go for one. 

I'll be back and I don't really blame burger bar too much for staff issues. Finding anyone worth 2 shits In SF to work is nearly impossible. Finding any good people to work in CA is a struggle currently.
author: Adam B.

description: Seated right away on a Sunday afternoon. Service was "ok", as our server could have been a little more attentive as far as drinks are concerned, especially considering it wasn't busy. Food order was correct, and food was served at a good temperature, and my medium rare burger was *actually* cooked medium rare (!!). Prices are high for what you get, but it's downtown SF, so that's to be expected.
author: James E.

description: Really enjoy this place. Typically come once per year when in town for a race. Staff is always friendly and accommodating. The view can not be beat, overlooking union square. Concept is Burger is basic, you make it a masterpiece. Bar is great too, Moscow mule and cucumber solstice both recommended.
author: Tiffany D.

description: We loved this place. There was a wait but it was worth it! I ordered a salmon burger with some Brie on top (cheese lover here,) but it would have been just as good with out it! We sat by a window overlooking Union Square. Post card view! It may seem touristy but you're overlooking the heart of the city with delicious food!  Go early, as they ran out of sour dough buns when we were there!
author: Shelly S.

description:
Based on the amount of stars this restaurant has, I was pretty hesitant about coming here for a company dinner. However, this place was actually really good! And I mean reaaaaally good. 
This burger joint is on the 6th floor of Union Square Macy's which makes it convenient when shopping and wanting to grab a bite to eat. 

For starters at my table, we had onion rings, zucchini fries, and some spicy jalapeno fries- it was all delicious, and the accompanying sauces were just as tasty. As for my salad, I ordered the Union Square Salad and oh my god it was fantastic! One of the best and healthiest salads i've had; now, this salad has a lot of kale. Kale is a hit or miss for me because i either hate it or love it. This one? loved it. Get the Union Square Salad. For dinner, I ordered the oven roasted chicken breast that came with spinach I think? and mashed potatoes. One word? DELICIOUS. Now for dessert...

Dessert gets its own section in my review!!! 3 words: CARAMEL. LATTE. MILKSHAKE. To tell you the whole truth and nothing but the truth: best milkshake i've ever had. I'm a visitor from Hawaii and honestly, if I ever make my way back to Union Square, this milkshake is a MUST. I've also heard great things about the other milkshakes. You've gotta try it! You really won't regret it. 

Overall, the food I ordered was great. The views are awesome. The location is convenient. And the decor is fitting. Good place to eat and enjoy. This place was a pleasant sur
author: Michele U.

description: Had the burger with the chili and cheese topping. Chili was very bland and burger was dry plus flavorless. I paid $23 for this burger not worth it. A Wendy's burger with Wendy chili is 10 times better. Only plus are the milkshakes. Expensive but very good
author: D J.

description:
I'm drawn to places with "Burger" in the name, and I like bars, so naturally I decided to check it out. My mom and I visited SF for a few days and our hotel was walking distance from, and we wanted a view of the city from a decent height. We first tried to go to Cheesecake Factory on the top floor of Macy's but there was obviously a huge line. But! We were both in the mood for burgers and this was one floor down. This was a good alternative.

We got a great seat by the window that overlooked Union Square, perfect spot for some people watching while we waited for our burgers. I decided on the Hangover Burger with sweet potato fries- definitely would recommend them! My burger was pretty alright, nothing extremely special to me.

Overall, pretty good! Tasty burger and fries, neat view, and friendly/quick service. Although I didn't try them, they had a ton of alcoholic milkshakes options to try that all looked delicious.
author: Jori B.

description:
HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE 
do not ever go to this restaurant! First of all the hostess tried to seat me at a table with no chairs and it was a random table in the middle of the room... and then another hostess proceeded to walk in the middle of the dining room and screamed out MOTHER FUCKER. And my waiter charged the wrong check to my card and I was never refunded when I tried to call the restaurant again! I understand working in a restaurant I work in one myself but this was ridiculous! NEVER GO TO THIS RESTAURANT!
author: Cart R.

description: I am seeing three stars and not sure why? My girlfriend and I were shopping around Macy's for the holidays and took a seat at the bar for a quick bite. The prices definitely were higher than the regular burger joint however the food was superb and we were definitely impressed with the service. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area and we will likely be back!
author: Michael B.

description: Initially we were suppose to go to the Cheesecake Factory but there wait was a hour. I decided to come here this was my aunts first time. The wait  was 30 mins we were sat in exactly that time. The burgers were cooked perfect the fries were perfect the waiter kept coming to check on us
author: Kentara W.

description:
FOOD:
Really delicious shakes! They can get pretty pricey especially if you make your own. It's not super big in volume either so don't expect to be getting a good deal. What I love is the variety of options and how friendly the staff is!

SERVICE: 
There is a really young girl early 20s and she is so kind! I don't know her name but she was on the closing shift I wish I could have her as my waitress all the time! Super nice and friendly :)

TIPS: 
Go here for the pretty view of union square. Just ask nicely for a seat by the window. 

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? Yes-delicious shakes and friendly staff
author: Kelley Y.

description: The burgers we all had were great. The quality of the meat was excellent. Based off the previous reviews I was skeptical but my mom really wanted a burger. The view was awesome over looking Union Square I recommend going here over Cheesecake Factory. My mom and I just ordered cheese burgers. I had skinny fries which I didn't really care for. But we also had sweet potato fries which were great. My son had sliders they put cheese without asking but he was ok with me scrapping it off. He loved it with his apple slices. The service was great I would definitely come back.
author: Nicole M.

description:
For some reason, I remembered this place being more appealing. I guess things can change after a few years? 

Burger Bar and its neighboring restaurant Cheesecake Factory overlook Union Square from atop Macy's. Luckily, Burger Bar is not quite as popular as Cheesecake Factory, so I was still able to make a reservation with only a couple hours notice on a Saturday night. Unluckily, my girlfriend and I got seated in one of the few booths at the restaurant; this meant that we didn't get to enjoy that spectacular view of Union Square that is half the draw of this place. I would have easily traded the booth, with its embedded TV, for the view.

In terms of decor, think of a sports bar version of the Cheesecake Factory. They managed to cram plenty of seating into this place, but there isn't much in terms ambiance.

In any case, here's what I had to eat...

The Hubert Keller Burger, which features buffalo meat, caramelized onions, baby spinach, and blue cheese (yum!) on a ciabatta bun, was absolutely delicious, and the (alcoholic) Mint Chocolate Chips Milkshake was pure decadence. That said, I think the burger was somewhat overpriced at $25.

If you're in the area and you are craving a burger and drink with a view, then I might recommend this place as an option. Otherwise, you should fill your burger cravings elsewhere.
author: Rodney G.

description:
Great view of the union square, the drinks and food are delicious and the atmosphere is really calm and relaxing.

The staff is really nice, the host Jocelyn , the server Kyle and The managers suzAnne  and Travis , very nice and professional.
author: Simon B.

description: The hamburger was a hard rock even though I ordered it medium. The French fries were over cooked. All four of us ordered hamburgers we could hardly eat because of them being so over cooked. Hubert Keller, take your name off this restaurant.
author: Luanne P.

description:
Surprisingly, this place was really good! We were shopping around union square and started to get hangry. We ended up in Macys and poof! Our stomachs led us here!

I was kinda reluctant because after all, sometimes tourist spots are a hit/miss. But! My friend had spoken highly of this place so we gave it a shot. 

I'm not sure what everyone is talking about, but wen it comes to service, they did just fine. They were fast, and checked on us. They didn't fill our waters until we asked but I didn't mind that. 

I ordered the hangover burger. I felt it was the most bang for buck. It was the only burger that came with fries. It was a reasonable price at 13$. It was very delicious! I loved that sauce. However, the sauce can make everything soggy, and if you eat slow or just don't want a soggy burger, I suggest ordering the sauce on the side. The fries was superb! Moist inside and crisp on the outside. It was enough to share with my bf. I ordered mine medium rare. 

My bf ordered the Kobe with ciabatta bread, I think, and pepper jack cheese. He ordered his medium. His burger was pretty good too. You can definitely taste the difference between meats. 

This place can get pretty pricey. If you choose the custom burgers, you choose a bread that could be .75 to I believe a $1. Then you can get a basket of fries and things like that for $5. Or add avocado and other things. 

They have a decent dessert menu which we had no room to try. But what caught our eye was their alcoholic milkshakes for 10$ I believe. We asked how much alcohol was in it and it was less than 2 shots. We skipped it but may return!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Bad food, bad service, bad prices, and long wait! Everything about this place is No, No, No, and No. First and most important, the burgers were bland, disgusting, not juicy, not tasty, thin, and way below average. We ordered the Kobe burger ($17.75) and the American Classic burger ($15.75), both cooked medium. The menu claims the Kobe burger is a Wagyu patty that is "tender, melts in your mouth, and has unmatched flavor." The Kobe burger I got was nothing like that at all. It was dry, bland, burnt on the outside, and had no flavor. It also does not come with any sides. The American Classic burger has Angus beef, American cheese, and bacon. It also tasted plain, dry, and ordinary. It came with skinny fries, but the fries tasted old, chewy, and previously frozen for too long.
Service was almost non-existent. I needed ketchup to wash down my bland burgers, but we almost finished eating before the waitress would come check on us. Also, the hostess told us the wait would be about 45 minutes, but ended up being closer to an hour and a half. Even towards the end, I went up to the hostess to check and they said 10 more minutes, but after 20 minutes, they still had not text me. 
I seriously cannot believe people are waiting one and a half hours to eat the worst, overpriced burgers ever. The only decent thing is the view. Burger Bar is on the 6th floor of the downtown Macy's building and if you get a seat in the bar area, there is a nice view of Union Square. It's a high tourist area, but a VERY BAD representation of San Francisco eats. There are lots and lots of great restaurants in SF, but this is NOT one. I could think of many great burger restaurants in SF and Sac that could take over this valuable space and put Hubert Keller's restaurant and burgers to shame.
author: Jean S.

description:
Stopped in for dinner by myself after attending a conference at the nearby Hilton.  Some of my colleagues had eaten here for lunch some time ago so I thought it would be worth a try.  

I had no issue with getting seated or served.  My waitress was very friendly and helpful in recommending my burger.  I decided to go with the build-your-own burger with Kobe beef (medium well), cheddar cheese and the chipotle aioli.  I ordered the sweet potato fries on the side, and had a glass of Pinot Grigio.

The view would have been fantastic if it wasn't for the massive "Art in Bloom" sign hanging in front of the windows.  

I would absolutely visit again.
author: Ann J.

description:
Went to this place on 12/27 around 2:30-3:00pm. Placed my name down with the female hostess for a reservation for 2. There were 3 open tables for 2 in the bar area but was told you had to place your name down for a reservation. I was asked if I'd be staying around the area so she could call my name instead of texting me. Approximately 15-20 minutes go by and I watched two couples of 2 walk right in without placing their name down for a reservation and get the two of the open tables. When I asked the hostess what was the ETA for our table she looked confused and said she was just about to call our name. Which I knew was a complete lie. We watched her do this exact thing 2 other times to a group of 2 and 3. 

When it came time to order our food, the waiter was rushing through it. He repeated our orders twice to us. When my food came, it was missing a few things and the fries were luke warm. I was able to get an employee to stop and try to help me but he just looked at me and said he'd let someone know. He went to the hostess stand and began to talk to the hostess and laugh. As I was watching this I couldn't believe it. Our water cups stayed empty and never got a refill. 

This was horrible customer service and I definitely do not recommend this place. They weren't even that busy during this time, probably because of their horrible customer service. I would rather spend my $50 at Red Robin or In-N-Out before coming here. Do yourself a favor and skip this place. Not worth the crappy service.
author: Brittany T.

description:
Tourist trap! Skip this burger spot. I'm a native San Franciscan and I only tried this place last weekend. Apparently Burger Bar once made great burgers...not anymore. I visited on a Saturday evening around 5pm; it was a half hour wait for a table for 2. I decided whatever, we're here, let's wait it out. It took around 25 minutes to get seated. We were then escorted to our table towards the back of the restaurant. Whoopee! And it all just went downhill from there.

Food:
If I'm going to pay $18 for the most basic burger on the menu, I expect it to be a mind blowing burger. So when the mediocre burger arrived, my anticipation and excitement turned into plain disappointment. I ordered the most plain burger on the menu to keep things safe (patty/lettuce/tomato), I mean how can someone mess with that solid combination. It was by far the worst highly priced burger I've ever had. To be honest I only ate it because we had waited for half an hour for this darn burger and I was starving.

Also added some avocado to the side. Bad move. $3 for a couple slices of bruised avocado. They will charge you for everything here (even plain side sauces!! Ranch, etc.) Surprised I didn't get charged for the ketchup too.

Service:
The wait to get seated is longer than average. The wait to get the food on the table is longer than average. This place is so popular it was mind-blowing, they must all be tourists. Our waiter was really nice, to be fair. He went missing a couple times and forgot to give us utensils, but hey no biggie. 

Atmosphere:
It can be nice if you get seated in one of the window tables (there aren't many and usually saved for parties of 4). We were stuck in the way back of the restaurant, where all the servers hang out. It wasn't atmospheric at all. They've made this restaurant as big as possible, so this other back half feels super isolated from the rest of the restaurant. The decor seemed run down, no theme going on at all. The restaurant can definitely use some updates to make it more presentable/pleasing to the eye. I'm sure, with $18+ burgers, remodeling should be no biggie.
author: Stefany Z.

description: My brother took me here, he was talking it up like it was the best burger in town. I do not agree way to expensive for what it is I got the frog burger $25 you would think it was the best burger from the price but no not even close. It is a good burger just not a great burger Unami Burger is better and cheaper!
author: Steven K.

description:
Dine in / bar with a beautiful view of Union Square. If you decide to watch TV for a game or what not try getting a table where the bar is at because there are no TVs on the other area of the restaurant. 

THEY HAVE HAPPY HOUR TUES& THURS but the catch is that you have to register on your phone. It takes about 2 minutes.

-- $3 Shots (tequila, Jameson, whiskey, etc)
-- Half off selected appetizers. 

Note; Their sweet potato fries are bomb!
author: Rachel A.

description:
Three stars is pretty accurate. From the moment we got in, we realized the vibe was interesting. Customer service was OK, just OK, nothing to write home about. 

Our server was good, he came by often but the food was less than what we expected. I could see this place being a tourist trap since its in the heart of union square on Macy's 6th floor overlooking the square. 

We ordered the wings (pretty good) for appetizers during happy hour. I ordered the small prawn salad (delicious) and was surprised at how filling it was. Also I ordered the soup of the day (clam chowder) and it really exceeded my expectations. 

Overall, I would say it was an average experience though. Some helpful tips for management:

Check your bathrooms often (one of the restrooms had no more toilet paper and needed trash to be taken out)

Install diaper changing stations in all the restrooms

Tell your servers to be more friendly! Please!
author: Darina H.

description: We stopped there for a drink and afternoon snack mainly. We also had the seared ahi sliders on the appetizer menu. The sliders were excellent. Also, the drinks were like what I expected. Service was excellent. Also, the view of Union Square was fantastic. As far as their real burger menu, I did not have the opportunity to try those. Overall, I am happy to have found this place!
author: J J.

description:
THIS WAS THE WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER!
Well, the view of the ice rink was great but that was it!  My wife, our son and myself decided to eat there on Christmas Eve (Sunday 12/24/2017). Big mistake! We got there right before closing, not realizing it closed at 6:00pm. We were seated and it went downhill from there. The waiter obviously did not know what he was doing and he was conversing with us as if he was with us. Very awkward! He didn't know the menu at all. He forgot to bring our waters, disappeared for the longest time and eventually came back with one of the two drinks we ordered. We had to ask about the second drink, it ended up that it was so bad my wife did not even drink it. We ordered the fries sampler and they arrived cold. Our waiter never came by our table so we could address the issue, so I flagged another employee walking by and it just happened to be the manager, although we did not know it at that time. We told him about the cold fries and he said 
"Oh, ok I will just re-heat.... I mean, I'll get you some new ones"  
WTF... Sure enough! HE JUST WARMED THEM UP! And there were less fries when it came back!.... It gets worse. So, our meal arrives and one burger that is supposed to be medium well was just freshly slaughtered...so rare!! I mean  completely raw in the middle. I ordered the sliders and they were cold and hard. Our waiter was informed about our issues and he just stood there telling us that the normal cooks were not even there that night. I asked for the manager. What do you know, the guy that returned our rewarmed fries walked up. What?!? This is the manager? Ok. Well, we started telling him how dissatisfied we were and  he strait up tells us, "the guys in the kitchen are in a rush because it is Christmas Eve and they want to leave". What customer wants to hear that the food is crappy because the cooks don't want to be there? To top it off, he only removed the raw burger and half of the sliders. So, we still had to pay full price for some cold-reheated fries and a bad margarita. The worse customer service I have ever encountered at an eating establishment. And dessert? Hell no!!! We were done and eager to leave to enjoy our Christmas Eve in the big City. Or so we thought... It is located on the 6th floor of the Macy's building and there was only one out, the elevator as the store had since closed. Well there was about 25 customers all waiting at the elevator door trying to leave this nightmare or some kind of social experiment!? First of all, the elevator takes a long time to come. We wait until the second time it came back and the doors open, It was still full (The Cheesecake Factory is located just two flights up with customers leaving there as well.) So by time the door opened the third time, still full, I asked an employee where the stairs were located? They told me there are no stairs... WTF... That is SO illegal NOT to have an emergency exit. Then I saw an EXIT sign and asked if we can just go down there. THEY HAD THE NERVE TO TELL ME NO!! So I just walked over and checked to see if the stairs really did go down to the street. Once I saw they went down, we told all the rest of the 25 or so people waiting by the elevator that we found the stairs... Oh, and the employees actually tried to stop us all from going down the stairs! The best thing about our experience that night is that we still laugh at the series of events and the utter awkwardness of our waiter and so called manager of a restaurant that is supposedly owned by a renowned chef...ha what a joke! I've been there a couple times before, and it was great. I don't know what changed but i strongly advise passing on The Burger Bar!!!  BAH HUMBUG!!!
author: Bryon S.

description:
No wonder there are only 3 stars... Chris, who was doing a terrible job as our sever. Apparently, he was too lazy to separate our checks between 3 credit cards. Really?! He had us calculate our own bills, write down the amount (including the tax) next to the last 4 digits of our cards. Never heard of such nonsense. We spent minutes doing our own calculations until he realized he was able to separate the bill on the pos AFTER it was finalized. ARE YOU FREAKEN KIDDING ME? The fact that he didn't even make an effort to figure out how to separate our bills to begin with. Do your damn job.

The one star is strictly to the server, not Burger Bar. I just hope the rest of the servers are better trained.

***I ordered the Kobe burger. It would've tasted better if the server asked me how I liked my burger (he didn't ask me how I want it cooked) cause mine came out over cooked when I'd typically prefer it medium rare and what type of fries I'd prefer (he assumed I wanted skinny fries, when there were fat fries). Overall, it wasn't too bad but it could've been better and customer service totally sucked a$$!!!
author: Lyly N.

description:
Came here for our roomie's birthday :)
Food & service were great! The manager JJ is awesome.

My faves: 
- le frog burger is amazing if you like brie
- zucchini fries are perfectly crispy and juicy at the same time
- the milk shake flight was amazinggg
- the dessert burger is so much fun
author: Cheri K.

description:
Came here with two friends for dinner. Burger Bar is conveniently located at the Macy's building in Union Square.

I customized a burger - just went for the standard burger with cheese and mushrooms. The patty was not that great; the inside was too raw and the outside a bit too burnt for my preference. The toppings were average and the bun was pretty soggy.

Also quite expensive.
author: Alvin W.

description:
We wandered in here after seeing the atrociously long line at The Cheesecake Factory, and we were pleasantly surprised. The ciabatta bun is delicious, and I would definitely recommend getting the aioli - it was to die for! We ended up dipping everything into it. Their fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings were also delicious. For dessert, we got the whimsical cheesecake burger, which was yummy! The cheesecake taste was spot on. 
The only downside is that this place is pretty expensive.
author: Ally M.

description: Came back with my husband and son during the holidays and  it was ok. We arrived around 4:30 and was told 30 min for 3. I requested a window seat if they had any for 3 and was told they didn't. We patiently waited, watching the waiting get more crowded. I gave it until 45 min until I finally went up to ask about our table. They looked me up and then sat us right away. I honestly thought the restaurant was crowded and packed but there were empty tables EVERYWHERE! That told me they were short staffed. It was the day after Christmas! Anyhow while walking to our seat, I was not expecting a window seat since I was told there wasn't any available, but we were told to wait because our table was clear. Within 2 min, we had a window seat. Hmmm. I will say that the host that sat us and our server was very friendly and attentive. Drinks and food were ordered in a timely manner while the view was gorgeous. However, the burgers were very ok, better than some places but not anything to scream about. They are accompanied with skinny string fries that were crunchy. Overall, the place is casual and a cool spot if u don't want anything fancy. The wait time is usually shorter than the neighboring Cheesecake Factory too
author: Viclaire S.

description:
My experience at Burger Bar was quite great. Making a reservation under Yelp, we were directed to our table immediately after being greeted warmly. Our waiter was extremely kind, and took our orders promptly. We (3 people) ordered two orders of the American Classic (medium rare) and a Caesar Salad (small). Portions were just right, and filling for the three of us. 

The burger was absolutely delicious: crispy toasted sesame bun, juicy patty. The only thing I'd recommend is for the burger to be cooked a bit rarer, it was slightly leaning towards the "medium" spectrum. Fries were also a bit bland. Other than that, I was extremely satisfied with the burgers. 

The salad was good as well, nothing TOO special. Romaine lettuce was crisp, but I'd say slightly a little bit too much cheese. 

Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our meal here. Although food seems pricy, I'd say that it was worth it. We got here at about 7:00 and it was barely full, but in the matter of 30 minutes, the restaurant quickly filled up. I was looking for the classical American burger experience, and I was extremely happy with my order. Service was extremely friendly and warm, the atmosphere of the restaurant was nice with just the right amount of noise. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Friend of a friend recommended this place.

- great view of the city, ask for window seating.

Ordered some burger (18ish)

Burger was hot and delicious.

We were a party of 5 - Five burgers + four drinks = like $160 excluding tip...hella not worth it..just being honest tho.

You pay for the view on this one.
author: Matthew A.

description:
I figured with its prime location in the heart of Union Square, in Macy's, it would be the best burger joint in all the land. Boy was I wrong. 

Didn't read the reviews on Yelp but I did notice it had an average of 3 stars after 2000+ reviews, so I knew that going in. It was right across the street from where I was, and they had burgers, and they had beer, so it was still a no-brainer despite the 3 stars. 

Got seated pretty quickly considering it was prime dinner hour, in Union Square, on a Sunday, during the holiday season (red flag #1). I chose to build my own burger. I opted for the Kobe beef (their most expensive choice at $18) and stuck with normal Monterey Jack cheese, some bacon, and condiments (ketchup, mustard, mayo). 

Food came quickly (red flag #2). I mean it was TOO quick, ya know? Got my burger and there was no bacon. Asked my server for the bacon I ordered (I'm not paying an extra $2 for something I didn't get). She brought it right before my burger was finished! Oh well, I'll just eat it anyway because, hello, bacon! I ate it and I'm pretty sure it was the crap my mom eats- that already-cooked-just-microwave-and-eat crap. It looked like it, smelled like it, tasted like it. 

The meat of the burger, the Kobe beef, the pricey stuff... I ordered it medium rare, which it was, but the outside was so burnt I couldn't tell if the Kobe lived up to the hype. All I could taste was charred meat. I was so bummed. The burger should have been on point, tender, and wonderful- at least that's what the menu said. It wasn't. The bun was also dry and seemed reheated (?). 

After dinner I grabbed a Red Velvet adult milkshake. It was yummy but not $18 yummy, maybe $10. It was pretty light on the alcohol for the price. 

All in all, after spending $78 there for a burger dinner (and crappy fries), I was totally bummed. It was definitely not the best burger joint in all the land as I had hoped. It wasn't BAD it just wasn't good. Lackluster is a good word for it. Don't waste your time. Go to the Cheesecake Factory on the next floor, or just find a better burger place somewhere nearby.
author: Krista N.

description:
*THIS IS A GLUTEN-FREE REVIEW!*

So. Disappointing.

I went here thinking it would be the same as the Burger Bar in Las Vegas.  It's got the same name, same menu, same "Hubert Keller" establishment.  It's the same place, right?

NO.

#1) NO GLUTEN FREE FRIES ANYMORE!!!

This was the main reason I went there in the first place.  I was super juiced to get some gf french fries which- if you have celiac, you know- basically never happens.  But alas, I was denied the french fry experience.  They no longer serve gluten free french fries.

#2) I ordered the turkey burger - same thing I got when I went to Burger Bar in Las Vegas - and it was this weird, flat, chicken burger looking thing.  I'm *pretty* sure it was turkey (?), but it was not the giant, mouth-watering, thick and juicy, fresh ground turkey burger I had previously gotten at the Vegas location.  It looked (and tasted) like a flat, fresh-from-frozen, hockey puck of a poultry patty.

Bummertown: population me, bro.

The side salad that they gave me in lieu of the fries was surprisingly good, but obviously, I didn't come to a burger place for a salad.  My sister said her burger was good.  And it looked good, as did her fries.  But if you have celiac and want a burger and/or fries, don't bother coming here.  Us celiac folks can get a good enough real beef burger elsewhere for less money, and definitely a better turkey burger basically anywhere.  

Points for the good salad and still offering gluten-free buns, but otherwise, not so impressed with what comes in between 'em for the price. 

Sorry Burger Bar.  I may give the Vegas location another shot, but I'm definitely calling ahead of time to make sure it's still the same menu before I go!
author: Teenie J.

description:
This place is alright - the food is comparable to other burger joints and the service is good enough. We were a table of 9 and although they said the wait was 2 hours, we still our name down. We were told our table was ready after only 20 min wait (which was nice). This place has a nice view of Union Square as it is on the 6th floor of Macy's. The only annoying part was the big Christmas wreaths they had in front of the view that covered it! -_- 

Food is a bit pricey here - I ended up halfing a burger with my cousin. We ordered the Hottest Burger in America, but with the hot sauce on the side so that we could still get the spicy kick we were craving but not hurt ourselves with the heat!

Although I didn't order it, the milkshakes look delicious (but God, too pricey).

If you come here to eat, I would say this is a nice place for a special occasion - plus, the wait is way better than Cheesecake Factory.
author: Loveleen K.

description:
Way over priced for the quality of the food. I ordered the peppercorn burger and everyone else at my table ordered the Kobe beef burger. The bottom bun on all of the orders were soggy as soon as it was served to us... We all took off the bottom bun because it was too gross to eat. The beef was NOT juicy and it was burnt on most of our orders. Extremely disappointed because each of us paid 20+ dollars for mediocre patties and terrible buns. Sure it was a great location that overlooked union square, but we were so excited for the burgers (because the wait was ridiculously long- 1&1/2 hours) and was let down. 

Good things: location and they will text you when your table is ready so you can go shopping while you wait!
author: Victoria T.

description: 3 stars for the food-it was fine. Overpriced, but fine. Let's face it, you're paying for the view. But the service?  5 stars and it was all Celia (Cecilia?). We got there early, she took our drink order right away. The place filled up quickly but she handled it all with grace while the other 2 female servers showed up, not ready for work, and proceeded to use both bathrooms for 10-15 minutes to do their hair and makeup while customers waited  use the restrooms. Bad business. Management should take note and offer Celia a raise. They could lose both other (uninspired) workers and she could still handle the floor. Best part of the meal? The "Smores" milkshake-made by Celia!
author: Amy L.

description:
The burger itself was good. The ahi poke was delicious but oddly paired with regular tortilla chips. The fries were bland and the $4 upgrade to garlic fries was completely not worth it at all. 

For the price, the burger alone wasn't worth the price of admission since that was pretty much the only thing to come here for
author: Eddie M.

description: Horrible service from the get go! Avoid the place like the plague!. There are many more around the city  with better food, value for your money and way better customer service.  I've been craving a burger all day so why not go to Burger bar? Well Burger bar host on duty could very well be the worst I've ever come accross. "I don't play those games" he says to me. Excuse me?!? I'm not playing games, I came with the intention to enjoy a nice meal and you have just ruined it.
author: raquel z.

description:
I would actually give this place 3.5 stars.

We sat right against the window overlooking Union Square, which had a really nice view especially since it was such a nice day out.

Our waiter seemed kind of slow and didn't really offer his opinion and they have an extensive menu with all kinds of toppings, meats, spread and bread to choose from.

I ordered a medium rare angus beef burger on ciabatta bread with cheddar cheese, bacon, onions, mushrooms and chipotle aioli with a side of onion rings.

The meat was cooked perfectly and they used nice thick pieces of bacon. Although everything came out well, it wasn't that memorable. The onion rings were just ok, their garlic fries were much better.

Pricey burgers, good ingredients, nice setting.
author: Jerrica N.

description: The Rossini burger (wagyu beef, fois gras, truffles) partnered with a Nutella milk shake.  Probably was a 3000 calorie lunch.  Delicious!
author: Gonzalo R.

description: I enjoy stopping in for a bite to eat whenever I am in the city for some fun. If your in the area and craving great food, atmosphere and kid friendly. This is the place for you.
author: Dee R.

description: Service is beyond slow!! Food is average & very overpriced. Shake was too sweet... super disappointed right now
author: Chalaya B.

description:
Very packed on the weekends but the best milk shakes in the world!!! And the fastest service I've ever had!!!! 
Worth the drive from the east bay
author: Tifani F.

description: The food was just ok.  I don't have any complaints other than I expected a lot more from my dinner.  I enjoyed my nachos more than my entree - a burger.  My husband ordered the fish and chips which he also thought was just ok.  This place is appropriate for children which was good.  Service from our waiter was good.
author: E P.

description:
Yummy food! Got the Kobe burger with cheddar cheese on an onion bun.  My hubby got the turkey burger w cheddar on a jalapeño bun.  

Took off a star since they charged us for the jalapeño bun and that wasn't an extra charge!! Check your receipt.  The burgers are expensive as it is so don't need extra costs.
author: Deena R.

description: The burgers here are overpriced and not the best, but you get an amazing view of Union Square and they have great milkshakes. I ordered a buffalo burger with pepperjack cheese and bacon on Ciabatta cooked medium. It was nice and juicy with fresh toppings. However the milkshake that I ordered came 10-15 minutes after the food arrived. We had to flag down our server and he brought out the shake about 5 minutes later. He wasn't very attentive or friendly either. The burgers here are good but overpriced, however the service can be improved. I think receiving attentive and friendly service is vital to having a good time while eating out and we did not experience it this time. It would make me think twice about returning. $70 for 2 burgers is a lot of money to pay when I can get similar tasting food for half the price.
author: SF N.

description:
This review is a mix of good and bad. 

Bad:
1. Their prices are just too high for a burger. I'm assuming the increased price is not just for the burger but the view (see the "Good" section). We ordered:

The hangover burger
A Shirley Temple
The sliders mini burgers
Glass of water
Two milkshakes 

And our total was $60, before tip!

2. This place can be crowded leading up to and during the weekend...so seating can be hard. 

Good:
1. Delicious burgers and their milkshakes are to die for!
2. The view is beautiful (hopefully it will be stunning when the construction around Union Square is over). They have floor to roof glass windows so you sit and over look the square. 


Overall I doubt I would return here. My only reason to visit again would be just for the view.
author: Tré S.

description: I was surprised at how great the meat of the burgers tasted at the restaurant. Juicy and tender, just what I would expect from a burger. But the service is not the best. We had to wait about 10-15 mins before our waitress came, and waited even longer for food. But the food did not disappoint. Shakes, fries and burgers are all great items.
author: Elliot F.

description:
Hey hey yelp world! Not a normal yelp reviewer but from time to time I like to write a review for fun and even though the downtown SF area is filled with tourists I still had my fun here at BB (burger bar)   had a couple beers (lil symptom) a good cross between a west beer and ipa, fries, and their veggie burger. I always eat solo, it's funny people find it weird but I enjoy myself more and don't feel rushed. Everything came out in a timely manner, the wait staff was very friendly, warm, welcoming, funny, and chatty with me when they had the time. Everything on the menu looks wonderful and when I'm around and have the time I'll slowly pick away at the menu crossing off what I've had and figuring out my favorites. 

Would I recommend this place to others? Of course! It can be busy at times but it that's how it goes here in a tourist part of sf. Be patient and you'll have a really great experience.
author: Stanley C.

description: We have dine several times here and always had a great meal and good service.  Nothing fancy or pretentious, just a good burger with plenty of ways to customize it, from bun to cheese to fries or onion rings.  They have a nice selection of draft beers and a great view over Union Square.  We will be back!
author: Dean B.

description:
There are few places which serve decent food but have a great location. Burger bar falls into that category. Located in the heart of downtown San Fran, this spot is on the higher floor of the building which houses Macy's.

I opted to get the table right by the glass and the view was awesome. Now coming to the food I had the Atlantic salmon burger with chocolate shake. The burger and shake were just OK. I would come here for the view rather than food.
author: Vineet S.

description:
Ordered the  Le "frog" burger. Asked waitress if soda is included and whether you can substitute salad for fries. Yes to both and no mention of additional charge.
When the bill cam, got charged for both???
When we questioned the bill, was initially given only a credit for the soda but not the substitution.
Had to ask again and finally got credit for both. 
IMO, are they trying to gouge me?
Not sure, but surely not the way to do business
author: George C.

description:
A group of us came here for dinner last night.  The service was good, everyone was friendly, and we didn't have a problem with anything...well, at the time, we didn't have a problem... I would five a 4 star for the service and everything so far...

You may ask, why a one star?  Well, the one star is for the food.  To be exact, it's for a piece of metal that looks like part of a stapler that we found inside the pattie.

My husband ordered a Le Frog burger.  However, he wasn't hungry during dinner, so he only took a couple of bites and boxed up the rest to eat later at home.  

Later, as he was chewing the left-over burger, he felt something sharpie in his mouth.  He spitted it out and found a piece of metal!!!  He was thankful that he didn't swallow it!!  He put it back on the pattie to take a picture so that you can see it in perspective.  Since we left the restaurant already, we didn't have a chance to report this to anyone there...

If you dine here, you should be careful with your burger.  Make sure you chew well before swollen anything :(
author: Lolipop W.

description:
So much disappointment! I have been to the Vegas location and the burger was so much better.

Ordered the naturesource beef (Medium) on sourdough with the foie gras and baby spinach with skinny fries and chipotle aioli. The beef came out medium well..... Our server was nice though so I gave some stars due to that. But I walked away disappointed.
author: Karen N.

description: Great place to grab a drink! I didn't eat this time but it's usually great. The selection of beer is great. The view is always fun especially at Christmas overlooking the square with the tree.
author: Joanna C.

description: First time eating here...... A friend and I went there, while shopping at Macy's. We both had a salad, and wine. We did not have to wait, as it was mid-week. Watched the people wander in Union Sq, as we were lucky enough to get a window seat!.  Our waitress,  Sylvia was awesome!  The hamburgers looked delicious! and the menu has almost everything you could want!  I will absolutely go back !
author: A N.

description: Very extensive menu with a killer view. Very pricey for food that is only a little above average. Milkshakes look extravagant but are only 3/4 filled with the rest being whipped cream. But it is fun to customize your own. Somewhere to go once! But make sure your wallet is full.
author: Brianna R.

description:
Used the yelp reservations for the first time. It was very easy to get a table for four on a Friday night. I'd probably have to wait 1.5 hours for Cheesecake Factory upstairs.

I love love love the guy when you first come in. He greeted my group as if he was eagerly awaiting our arrival. I've never felt so welcome to a restaurant.

We were seated at a table against the window. I highly recommend it! You get a great view of Union Square. It's fun to watch during daylight, and breathtaking at night.

The guy who greeted and seated us offered to take a group photo. I don't know you're name, but you're awesome!

Would come back just to high five that guy.
author: Alison S.

description: This used to be one of my favorite places to eat lunch but apparently they've made a lot of changes & it's absolutely terrible. I always buy the burger bar chicken wings or salmon steak. Last night I ordered the chicken wings and they were dry and skimpy even with the mild sauce. Also the menu has changed. There's not much you can choose to eat from at all. My mother also had the most lifeless microwaved turkey burger of all time. Extremely disappointed. Never again :(
author: Nay H.

description: We came here a few years ago and it was nothing short of amazing. This last time was quite a disappointment. They sat us by the bar which smelled like bleach so we had to move to a different table. The waitress didn't know much about the menu. My Salmon steak burger was overdone. She dropped food the food and went MIA. She only returned to give us of check. Can't say I will be back. Such a shame. I am a huge fan of Hubert Keller.
author: michelle s.

description: Friendly helpful service and good quality food. My turkey burger was perfectly cooked and seasoned, and I could not stop eating the fries.... And the view of Union Square (unfortunately currently under construction) was great.
author: Howard F.

description:
162. My birthday was coming up.  I wanted to hold a nice dinner with a few friends-- maybe 4?  Sounds simple.

I didn't realize I would be RSVPing for 14 people till the night before.

I called up everywhere in SF.  Literally. I got so desperate I started calling $$$/$$$$ places.  But no one would book me.  I was sad.

Burger Bar was the last restaurant on my call list.  Surprise, surprise.  I was able to book a reservation.

Most of us got burgers, all of which were pretty good.  Your order might come out medium rare if you specified medium.  But for the most part, it was good.  It can get busy during peak hours, so service might be a little MIA.  Even for a large party.  But it's a good place to host a casual birthday dinner.

__________
My 2¢:
- First timers: try Le Frog or Hubert Keller.  These are pretty popular according to our server.
- If you can't find a place to RSVP the night before, try this place.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Burgers and fries were good. Service average. 
Good atmosphere. Glad we tried it.
Great views from restaurant as it sits above Macy's.
author: John P.

description: Visiting from Dallas. This place has pretty good food. Burgers were cooked well done when ordered medium well. Service was terrible. Didn't get all the drinks ordered for our group of 7. Husband did not get the burger he ordered and my son got his burger with wrong kind of cheese and fries. Expected much better food & service for the status/prices of this restaurant.
author: Marian K.

description: You're paying for the location. Burgers are the same as Red Robin or the counter. You have to pay for all the add-on. The service sucks. All they do is get your drinks and food and never come back until it's time to get the check. I was so thirsty for a good 20 mins. I had to ask a different server for a glass of water. Btw, you have to pay for sauce....YES SAUCE! Whack!
author: Christopher J.

description: By far, this is nothing like the Burger Bar in Las Vegas, which is where I live. Albeit, I'm in SF and wanted a AWESOME  burger...The grilled Shrimp Salad was good. The Slider Trio were just okay, the skinny fries were cold. The custom Buffalo Burger came out over cooked  & with dirt on the lettuce, so they replaced it..minus the bacon. After FINALLY getting the custom Buffalo Burger as ordered (med rare). It was tasteless & red rare, yes, red not med. rare in the middle. Couldn't even finish it. Service was great. Back of the house obviously, has issues with quality control.Very Dissatisfied.  Won't be back.
author: Alexia M.

description: Food was good, fresh and fast . Best part was the view. Oh and I ran into Mark Jackson! Staff was nice and friendly ! The place isn't fancy but nice for a late night late. Good selection, you can't go wrong with building your own burger !
author: Lauren N.

description: Service and beer was good. Burger and fries were OK. At least the view made up for it, except we got sat at a booth with no view and a TV advertising Medicare back braces. TIP: request a window seat
author: Patrick C.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco for the weekend from LA, and decided to stop by this place for a quick lunch before I left the area. This place is located inside the Macy's by Union Square on one of the top floors where you have a really nice view of the designer buildings, and Union Square itself. The menu is not huge, but they definitely have variety. 

Quickly seated by a window, had a nice view and server came by quickly to take our orders. I ordered a Nutella milkshake, which was delicious! But it was overflowing inside the glass cup so it was dripping everywhere on the table, and they didn't bring napkins with it, so that made it even worse to handle. The only "napkin" you have to use to clean your mouth is the washcloth  that has touched the utensils and the table. Not sanitary. I understand its a quick place to grab a bite to eat, but a napkin wouldn't hurt. 

After our orders were taken, we were waiting 45 minutes and our food was nowhere to be found. After an hour of waiting, the server comes back and says he FORGOT to put in our orders, and it never went to the kitchen. Um okay? We were in a hurry and could've left the restaurant right then and there but we gave him another chance and the food came out a little over 10 minutes later. Food was good! Somewhat made it up for the delay. Overall its an okay restaurant to grab a bite.
author: Adrienne B.

description:
I've been here several times now and have had an amazing experience . The staff is fantastic, the food is good, and the views of union square are surreal . I order the hangover burger and the server suggested to add cheddar, great combo. I also get the fat fries and they were on point. Kyle was an amazing server , my glass never went empty. Even when I could tell he was very busy and I was already finished he checked up on me. The check was brought quickly not like some other restaurants where you have to be making your way out the door before any one wants to give you your check. 

All in all get the hang over burger and ask for Kyle's section if you want great service.
author: Andres L.

description:
Burger Bar is overpriced but love the view of Union Square. I ate here several times and usually order burger sliders. Nothing memorable, just good location and somewhat of a good service. 

Favorite: shakes, love all of their shakes except the ones with alcohol... yuck

Highly recommend if you want burgers but if you want good burger then go to Super Duper!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I have been to a lot of burger joints and sampled some great beef, turkey and veggie burgers. I have even been to the Burger Bar in LV and had such an awesome experience with great tasting burgers and great service. So when my son was looking for a great tasting burger I thought we should hit up the Burger Bar in SF. I was hoping that our experience would be the same as in LV...not so much. 

There was an awesome view of Union Square from where we sat in the bar area. Me being scared of heights and our table being against the glass totally freaked me out but my son wanted to sit there...so I scooted the table away from the window just a tad! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=zig4LoH-zkjp8bSSZt9u4Q

The food was just ok. The menu was slightly different and we opted for the American Classic for him (angus burger and skinny fries) and I did the build your own Veggie Burger with sprouts, cucumbers, and zucchini. He seemed to be content with his burger and skinny fries. My son gotta kick out of the basket of fries and mentioned that they did taste kinda like McDonald's fries and they did! As for me my veggie burger was dry and lacking the flavor I remembered from LV. I was kinda bummed. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=mSSD_7GfI_8XRFOlkmLPKQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=lkU-evztii4fMJ7RPvNppw

Service was ok, she came by a couple times to see if everything was ok. Yes our drinks were refilled and brought things we needed. But just comparing my two experiences I was disappointed. Would I come back, probably not to this particular location.
author: Gloria R.

description: Made a reservation for burger bar for 8:45pm on a Friday night. Was called by them at 6:30pm on the night of the reservation saying they are closing the kitchen early at 8:30 and asked if I could come in earlier. My fiancé doesn't get home from work until 8pm so I told him no we could not go earlier. Asked if this was an every night thing or if they just happen to be closing early on this night and he just said it depends and they just close it whenever they want. I don't understand why a restaurant would accept reservations online PAST the time they keep their kitchen open and then notify you DAYS after your reservation that they can no longer accept it. Being that it is in the heart of San Francisco you would think they would keep their kitchen open longer. I guess the only reason I give them 2 stars is because they had the decency to call me and tell me, even if it was 2 hours before the reservation. Better than getting there and being without food. Still extremely disappointed and will not be visiting.
author: Hannah O.

description:
Great view,  great service,  great food.

The build your own burger options are great, no one wanted to try the worlds hottest burger in my group. 
The zucchini fries were the best ever.  I was very impressed all the way around.
author: Anthony S.

description: This has to be one of the worst dining experiences I have had all time. I have travelled extensively, all over the world in fact and was in shock at what occurred. It took us almost two hours to get our food and when it arrived it wasn't even cooked(burgers were very raw, we all requested medium). The only saving grace was that the manager took care of the bill(as he should have) but that being said. I would NOT recommend this restaurant.
author: Chris V.

description:
This was my second time eating at the Burger Bar and I have been pleased both times! The view of Union Square is great and the burgers are amazing!!
I had the lamb burger and it was superb!!
Great place for families too!
author: Jamie C.

description: My husband I were with the kids so we thought burger, bar and view, perfect. Except my salad, his burger, and two kids items plus adult milkshake...over $80. Definitely not worth that. I would not recommend when there are so many other options.
author: Courtney H.

description:
If you're ever dismayed by the 2+ hour wait upstairs at Cheesecake Factory (8th floor of Macy's) and are starving after hours of shopping in Union Square, do not fear! Just go downstairs to the 6th floor and enjoy wonderful food at the Burger Bar :-)

I've been to the Burger Bar in Vegas and this location was just as good. The burgers are on the pricey side ($15 and up) but good quality meat and very tasty. They also have a lot of good beers on draft.

My sister and I were famished after running the Nike Women's Half-Marathon so we headed from our hotel to Macy's (both the Cheesecake Factory and Burger Bar are located inside Macy's). The Cheesecake Factory (like always) was total chaos. 2.5 hour wait for lunch at 1:30 p.m. My sister suggested we try Burger Bar, which I actually had not known about! We went down two floors to Burger Bar, were seated immediately, and 15 minutes later were happily munching on our burgers and fries. 

Great to have this option in Union Square!
author: Wendy N.

description:
Someone recommended this place to us as a Vegas restaurant that has made it to SF.

Being a burger lover I had to try this place for lunch. 

I decided to build my own burger instead of choosing one of the pre constructed options.  I had buffalo meat patty, pepper jack, jalapeño bun, bacon, and extra fresh jalapeños.   

It sounded like a good idea but all that spicey stuff more than ruined my guts for the next few hours.   All my fault and I didn't even try the habanero hell fire option from the menu.

I think I am lactose intolerant because I always get sick from dairy but they had a chocolate chip mint shake on the menu so I decided to jump right on that.   It was good but smaller than I would of thought.

Overall the food was decent.  Nothing amazing.  

The service was kind of crappy and slow.   

The price was what you pay to eat in a prime location in a city like SF.

I would eat there again because I like burgers and shakes but this place is not winning any awards from me.
author: Ben K.

description: 6th floor of Macy's - good view of you can get it. Our server, Nick, was awesome. So accommodating and just a nice attitude. The burger was very good. We built our own and upgraded our meat; the buns were fantastic. The only two complaints we had were: both fries (skinny and sweet potato) were undercooked and a little mushy. Second complaint was they ask you how you want your burger cooked and then sent out two well done patties (we ordered medium and medium-well). That's just a pet-peeve of mine of burger places that ask how you want it cooked and then send out whatever they cook.
author: Lo W.

description:
Food is okay
Service is okay
Fries are good
I once ordered a brownie,it was as hard as a rock
This place needs a deep cleaning
The salt shakers are always sticky
There is tape on the walls
author: Kelly A.

description:
What a creative menu! Make your own burger! Choose from Angus (grain fed beef), Natursource (USDA prime), Buffalo (raised in Wyoming), or Kobe (Wagyu Beef). Then choose your bun (sesame, plain, ciabatta, whole wheat, gluten free, onion, sourdough, or jalapeño). Then choose from an extensive list of about 50 toppings to top it all off. (Just beware that every item and topping has a separate cost.) If you don't want to make your own, there is a Chef's selection of 11 different burgers. I won't mention the desserts because we're always too full to have one, but they look like they are to die for. 
We've gone a few times and have not been disappointed by the food. My only complaint  is that the service is what I call San Francisco SLOW. I'd give it 5 stars otherwise. I wish they'd open one up here in L.A. We'd be regulars.
author: Judy H.

description:
We very much enjoyed our lunch here yesterday. We were lucky enough to get a window table and our drinks came quickly. The portions are generous and everyone liked their food. 
The only downside was that the floor was really sticky but that's really not a big deal.
author: Alison V.

description: I visited Burger Bar on Sunday, Nov. 12. The server, Kaylee at terminal 709 decided to give herself a nice 50% tip. I found that out today when the charge showed up online.  I will file a dispute with Chase + I will call management to let them know (unless of course Management already knew but decided to look the other way).
author: Joe J.

description:
I think middle of the pack is where Burger Bar should fall. I'd give it 2.5 stars myself. 2 stars isn't really bad, but "Meh. I've experienced better." fits my sentiments exactly.

Service: 3 stars. People were friendly when they came around, which wasn't often. Water refills weren't asked and the guy serving us was nice.

Food: 1.5-3 stars. Definitely enjoyed some parts of the meal more than others. As the first customers of the day, being told you're out of a couple milkshakes isn't something you'd expect at the top of service.

My bro got his Classic American burger Medium Rare with skinny fries, while I got the Le Frog burger medium with jalapeno onion petals. The burgers by default come with skinny fries, but you can substitute any side by making up the price difference.

Both burgers were seasoned well. The skinny fries were basically McDonald's fries, for better or worse. I liked my petals, sliced jalapenos and onions generously battered and fried. Our sides were surprisingly cold/lukewarm though. Hard to believe they were fresh.

As for the burgers, don't push your luck. My medium turned into medium well with random splotches of pink/red on the top of my patty. Meanwhile my bro's medium rare somehow looked rare on one half of his burger and medium on his other. Odd.

The view is really nice, but tourist trap is the right word here. Then again, you're eating in a Macy's so what did you expect?
author: Dave N.

description:
I've been to the burger bar in Vegas and was very impressed. My being from the Bay Area I had to try out the one in union Square. It was the holidays and it was busy which was expected. Was able to do some shopping while we waited. 

Once in I wasn't very pleased with the table we were assigned because of the heavy traffic of around us, but again it was tolerable because of the busy season. 

Started out with ordering a couple of their famous milkshakes and two Kobe burgers with our own favorite toppings. We were starving and we're excited to demolish these burgers. We waited and waited and waited still no sign of burgers coming out, or even the milkshakes. Us being hungry probably made us a little impatient but it wasn't that much of a big deal. 

Once we were received out burgers we were so happy. However we weren't very pleased with how  much fries we received as though it appeared we received the scraps and little fries that barely filled the plate. The burger was definitely delicious. But there was another problem...still no milkshake. We were told that the milkshake bar was also backed up. 

By the time we received our shakes we were about done with out burgers and too full to finish. We felt like we wasted our money and wasn't too happy about the timing of it. Everyone may be different but I like to have my beverage in the beginning or with my meal. 

Overall we had an ok experience. Maybe I'll give it one more try.
author: Jentry P.

description: I love this spot. The view is incredible, the vibe is nice, the burgers are great, and they have a good beer selection. I've always had good, consistent service here as well. It's maybe a tad pricey, but the food quality and the view make it a worthwhile splurge.
author: Rich K.

description: Terrible customer service. Came in on a Wednesday evening, not busy at all. Sat for 15+ mins with no service at all, not even a hello from anyone. A server walked right past our table, multiple times. I left to go to the Cheesecake Factory where there is extraordinary customer service every time.
author: Raquel L.

description: Used to enjoy watching Hubert Keller on Food Network, so was very disappointed with the gimmicky, tourist feel and franchise-like quality of this place. The menu is primarily burgers and shakes. The quality is akin to chain restaurants such as TGIs or Red Robin. The prices are a bit high for burgers. It may be them passing on the price for a view of Union Square Park, which is not worth a single penny as it's basically just a view of cement pavement, a garage and random drunk people. But if it the view that is desired, might do better to go next door to Cheesecake Factory instead.
author: Kimberly H.

description: This place promised to be amazing with the views......it isn't amazing.  It is dirty and the staff wasn't friendly.   The food was nothing special--I ordered a classic burger and it just simply looked mediocre and tasted just okay.  Nothing special. Would never come back.   The food around Union Square is lacking.  Big time.
author: Molly H.

description:
Visited for the first time last night and so happy I did. I was craving a good quality burger and that's exactly what I got. I went in thinking that I was going to eat half a burger...well it was so delicious I may or may not have eaten the whole thing.

I got the American Classic medium rare and opted for the organic, antibiotic free patty. Also got the chipotle aioli on the side. My burger also came with a side so I tried their zucchini fries. Every bit of it was better than I anticipated. The only thing that was a bit of a challenge was taking a bite out of that massive burger (it also had thick slices of bacon) but I managed. I think it's awesome that they offer so many options to customize your burger or milkshake. Since it was my first time I decided to stick with the regular menu stuff but would probably be a little more adventurous the next time I visit.

All in all it was a great dinner. The host greeted us as soon as we got out of the elevator and he seated us right away at a table with a great view of union square. Super chill place. Apparently they do parties too..thumbs up! I also like how the host called the elevator for us as we were leaving our table so as soon as we walked up, the elevator was waiting for us. I personally enjoy these little details that show that the staff is really dedicated to providing more than just good food but a wonderful dining experience. Highly recommended and would definitely visit again. They have a ridiculous list of milkshakes that I must try!
author: Camilla G.

description:
It was a Bourgie Burger for sure.. what really made it worth while was the epic view of Union Square and my dining partner (aka the "kid").. 

Chef Keller (of Fleur De Lys) created a fantastic burger menu here and delicious shakes to boot.. I enjoyed the build it yourself part of the menu which included amongst the other common accoutrement, varying degrees of meat quality.. Wagyu (of the Aussie variety) being the highest and Black Angus the lowest.. great idea and all great meat choices!

The less than desirable qualities of the place were the ambiance- lacking, service was not very friendly, and theme- kinda Cheesecake meets Diner style, complete with laminated menus.. that's ok if you are paying diner prices.. 

The burger itself was quite good, not blow my sox off good, but definitely a decent $30 burger. Juicy perfectly Mid Well...  However, the fries were quite lacking in crunch...

I almost went for the $65 hamburger (if you can call it that).. but I thought it was a little overkill for a shopping day lunch.. ehhh hemm, *cough.. I am a lady after all! 

....so instead I went in for a make it yourself burger.. Natursource (USDA prime), jalapeno bacon, spinach, queso, whole wheat bun (gotta be healthy somewhere) and the sweet potato fries .. verrry ladylike! 

The kid opted for the classic American with cheese.. we split a Caramel Salted Mocha shake..  After all that fat cramming, we were ready for the rest of the hard shopping day ahead... le sigh*
author: Sara F.

description:
This little chain serves burgers invented by Hubert Keller - a SF legend for french gourmet cuisine.

You can select your ingredients from a huge list. Cooking is good, service is fine, drinks are above average.

Good
author: Oliver S.

description: This place is nothing special, except for the fact that it has a great view of Union Square. The service wasn't very welcoming, but the host and waitress wasn't rude, either. The food is so expensive, with an average burger being just $15, at least. The burger wasn't that good either, and when I ordered it to be medium, it was almost well-done. If I ever want a burger and a nice view, I would literally go to a fast-food restaurant, and then go to a high-rise with a public viewing area before this. If you're a tourist and in San Francisco for a limited time, make sure not to waste a meal experience on Burger Bar.
author: R T.

description:
Burgers and Milkshakes... They get an A+. 

When it comes to salads.... I will pass! Horrible and plain. My waitress also had her finger in my food. Our waitress was also rude and didn't care to speak to us. Customer service is SO important at restaurants and can make or break your experience. The location is a typical SF tourist spot, so it's great for first time visitors. They also have TVs at their booths, so great for games. I just wish they put time into all of their food and not just the burgers.
author: Taylor C.

description: Okay so this review is a little skewed bc my meal was paid for by work so I didn't have to shell out bc this place is pretty pricey. That said, it was kind of incredible. GET A MILK SHAKE!!!!!! It was so delicious!!! And the burgers were really good. I usually hate burgers from places like this bc they can be too big and come with too much bread or are really dry. I have absolutely ZERO of these complaints about my burger here. Hearty burger that will definitely leave you stuffed, but so tasty.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Originally, my friend and I wanted to dine at Cheesecake Factory, but since the wait was 1-2 hours long, we decided to just try out the Burger Bar. There was a 30-45 minute, which was kind of long too, but a shorter wait. The ambiance of this restaurant is pretty nice - not very lighted, sports playing on TVs, and everyone having a good time. We were seated next to the window so we were able to see the ice skating rink. (This was during Christmas time, so it was really nice!)

I ordered the Black Jack Burger, which consisted of beef, monterey jack cheese, tapenade, tomatoes and onion. I ordered fries with my burger, which was $14 bucks before tip and tax. There wasn't enough fries, in my opinion. :( My friend ordered the American Classic, and that looked pretty good cause the bacon strips were huge and juicy!

For about $16-$17 a person, I would probably go elsewhere for "high end" burgers and fries. But since it is located in a shopping mall, it is quite convenient!
author: Christine S.

description:
Horrible service!

Our server, Shawn, was extremely rude. He didn't offer any alternatives to unavailable items on the menu. He never checked on our table to see how we were doing. He was short with us when we asked questions. He forgot to put in our drink order until after we finished our meal. 

The food was disgusting. The milkshake paddle tasted like a concoction I could have made at home. The salmon burger was super dry. 

Overall, we were completely unhappy with The Burger Bar.
author: Jolie A.

description: Excellent burger! Fantastic view!  Definitely make a reservation via Yelp or try to get there on the early side so you can get a high top table overlooking union square.  Very nice burger. Great fries. Friendly and attentive staff. Will go back next trip to SF.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Totally acceptable for being in a touristy location overlooking Union Square. The food is fine and the waiters are friendly. Drinks area little pricey, a pint of Bud Light is $7 and most others are $8 or $9.

It does have a nice view and atmosphere as well as large portions. I had the SF Vegan burger which has mushrooms as buns which was creative but well apart completely so had to eat it with a fork #firstworldproblems overall not too bad.
author: Ryder M.

description: The host was so rude and unaccomodating. We were promised a table by the windows when I made the rez. When we arrived he gave us a booth. I asked about the window seat we reserved and he would not help. He instead gave our table to the group after us. The wait for any service to our table was way too long. The waitress would disappear for long periods of time. Food was good but was overshadowed by the overall negative experience with the host and wait staff. It was my daughter's birthday, so it was pretty disappointing.
author: Johanna D.

description:
First time here and defiantly the last.
Customer service was garbage except for 1 individual, a woman with blonde dreds. She was lovely! But every other server seemed like they had "fuck you" / "I hate my life" written across their forehead. 
Also ! It took three try's to get the burger done right and yet it was still crap. In N out is by far way better. $25 for a half ass burger ? No thank you. This burger bar is an absolute exaggeration. You're better off spending less than $10 at Joe shmo's burger joint than here.
author: Kaylana B.

description:
This place kind of really sucks, which is frustrating because they have some prime real estate.

First of all, the hostesses are a bunch of lazy, clueless, high schoolers that would prefer to gossip than help a customer out. I wanted to sit by the window and there were multiple tables open, yet they have no idea how to figure out how I can sit there.

Secondly, I can't tell if they're understaffed or they just hire a bunch of useless hostesses instead of actual waitresses. It takes forever for anyone to even come over and bring you water or take your order.

At least they're friendly though, I really had no issue once we got seated.

But lastly, their food sucks and it's overpriced. I'm sure this is more a restaurant for its view than its actual food, but I'll try not to come back again (although this was my 2nd or 3rd time already).
author: Angela L.

description: I don't understand this place.. so pricey on their menu that they use cheap plastic glasses for their drinks
author: I H.

description:
Awesome view of st. Francis square. Burgers were so delicious.  I recommend the fried pickles,  Fish and chips and their specialty dirt martini  ( strong and yummy ). I built my own but her and was so satisfied with the ingredients and quality. Shout out to Robbie who made us feel so taken care of and at home, had a smile on his face the whole time and checked on us frequently 
 Thank you robbie!
author: Izabell M.

description: Had the Kobe with Gouda, portobellos & caramelized onions delish! Around $25 would have liked to try spicy ketchup or aioli but didn't want to pay extra, Irish cream milkshake fantastic but took a while to come out of the kitchen. Few things wrong with our order but overall I would say give it a try overpriced but you pay for the view.
author: ROXY C.

description:
This place interior-wise, is very nice. Quite classy really. Definitely take the chance at a table near the window. The view is superb. 

Their menu consists of mainly burgers, but their are other options, such as salads and desserts. Pricing is really up there for some burgers, but overall most are reasonablly priced.

I enjoyed the chef's "veggie" Burger, which is a Patty comprised of a variety of vegetables. Its a delight that they served it with pesto and the different choices of bread makes it worth while. My biggest recommendation would be to get the sweet potato fries. Really good and crispy.
author: Jerianne G.

description: We decided to try this because the wait for the Cheesecake Factory (which is what we wanted) was 2hrs. So we got seated at the Burger Bar with no wait... now I see why. $40 for two burgers and fries with nothing special at all about them. Tasted like frozen griller patties. Didn't try any beer, but if you are looking for a good burger go somewhere else.
author: David H.

description:
Super yummy, but also super expensive. 

I come here for a burger fix on special occasions and have never been disappointed. Only a little shocked when the bill comes but that's OK because we know what we are getting into and its always good quality food and super delicious. 

They have fun options for your burger and the yummiest jalapeño bacon. 
 
And I can't forget to mention the reason behind my love, the truffle mayo! A must and so good I keep coming back for it. 

They also have a gluten free bun available which is a big plus. 

A fun place to try when shopping at Macy's or just in the area.
author: Brandy B.

description:
This place is a joke. Way overpriced for what you get. They wouldn't accommodation our baby stroller.  They made us unload the baby and EVERYTHING in the stoller. They said the aisle had to be clear, yet there were little kids in heelys racing up and down.

I ordered a medium burger and my husband ordered medium rare.  We both got a rare burger.  I sent mine back, but my husband ate his. The lady took my burger and brought back the same half cut patty with the cheese all melted and congealed.  It still wasn't a medium,  but I was not going to wait.

The only reason I gave 2 stars is because our server was nice. We will not be coming back.
author: Mitra W.

description: I loved it. Primarily an upscale burger place but they have salsa and salmon burgers for the health conscious as well.
author: Ric B.

description:
I don't know, the food wasn't great, the wait staff took such a long time to get around to helping us with anything, and overall the restaurant seemed more like a gimmick than a great burger joint.
