Maybe it's horrible for me to point out that a french celebrity chef is the face of this burger restaurant....and burgers are decidedly American. I guess I'm not much to talk. I'm a vegetarian. (And the veggie burger is blah)

Also, the shakes looked like something AMAZING! Too bad I couldn't afford one!
author: Kelsey W.

description: I had the American classic medium well, I asked for a side of their 5,000,000 scoville sauce and it was HOT!. I can't imagine enjoying that other burger on the menu. Anyhow ambience was calm and beautiful window view, our waitress was very friendly and enjoyable to talk to, the food was delicious and well cooked. Bathrooms are super clean a rarity in San Francisco so if you are spending the day in the city use it, it will be the last clean bathroom you see. Music was audible enough to listen and talk to your people with out being disruptive. The fries, I gotta say the fries are a major fail, they charge you $15-$50 for a burger with skinny fries( they taste like McDonald's fries) not that I don't like McDonald's fries but if I want McDonald's fries, I go to Mcdonalds. I feel that's the only thing that needs more attention, steak fries would be sweet!. Overall experience was very good, I definitely recommend this place.
author: Armando h.

description:
I love a great burger.  I do.  

Burger Bar has been on my list of places to try forever it seems.  The long waits definitely kept me away for quite some time.  Finally went in last week for lunch and was seated immediately by the window in the bar area.  The space is open and inviting.  The amazing view of Union Square is priceless.  I can see what all the fuss is about.

The menu is filled with so many burger options.  There's a build your own section where you can customize your choice right down to the type of bun.  Haven' seen that before.  There is also a list of Chefs Burgers filled with a wide variety of preselected combinations.  I made my own:  Sesame seed bun, buffalo burger, caramelized onions, and cheddar cheese.  Accompanied with skinny fries and a Sam Adams Octoberfest beer. 

The service efficient and friendly, especially the host who was checking on all the guests in the bar area.  My food came out fast, which I appreciated.  The tab for my meal was $34.00 before tip.  I knew what I was getting into when I went there, it's a restaurant in prime Union Square real estate owned by a great Chef.  Maybe I'm a cheapskate at heart because I cannot justify the price for the food and venue.  If I'm craving a burger when in the area, I'll stick to Pearls on Post Street.  When I'm craving a meal at Chef Kellers, I'll go to Fleur de Lys, one of my favorite spots in SF.
author: Kim A.

description: I had the veggie burger . For $18! It was mushy with no flavor. The fries were likely frozen and not fresh. The thing that really made me mad was that they charged a "help us pay for our employees' health insurance" add on of about $4. Ummm, that responsibility should NOT be placed on a customer's head. You should maybe think twice about your giant profit margin and the fact you're already charging a steep $18 for a vegetarian burger. Next time if I ever see this on my bill, if i ever come back, your waiters can thank you for me reducing their tip to account for that "health" add on you just hit me with. Shame on you.
author: karinneh a.

description:
Methinks it's pretty good, but way too expensive for a burger. Touristy, you betcha, but the view of the lovely Union Square garden and shops is tre fancy. Brought to SF from famed chef Hubert Keller (who now is a DJ, go figure), Burger Bar sits atop Macy's and is a huge pull for out-of-towners / countriers, and it will also pull the money right out of your wallet!

You better believe it's pricey, so my party all went with the American, which is probably the least expensive burger and subbed different cheeses for American cheese, which I love, but not on a $16 burger. The Kobe beef burger also caught my eye, but to be honest, beef is wasted on me. I more care about how spicy or flavorful something is, but it doesn't have to be red and bleeding to be good. 

I got my burger cooked medium and it was truly was. Not that I went out of my way to check, I just happened  to be full from IPAs and shots of Fireball from earlier in the evening at 83 Proof, so I cut my burger in half and was in awe of the gently pink center. 

We all got different sides of fries, I had the Onion Rings which were crispy, sweet, and gigantic, my friends had the curly fries and shoestring fries and we all shared Buffalo Chicken Wings. I had a Cider with my meal which cut the richness of the burger with bacon and cheddar, and I got jalepenos ots, of course. 

Will I be back? Purrrrrhaps, but with so many other places to try and an ever dwindling bank account, I may find somewhere more in my price range. Thankfully this meal was paid for by my friend since he owed me dinner, so it tasted a little sweeter just for that. AND I'M OUT.
author: Crystal C.

description:
After spending much of the day mingling in downtown San Francisco I struck up an appetite. While being in Macy's at Union Square I remembered Burger Bar was on top of the Macy's building (not literally as in rooftop but 6th floor). So, off we go.

From the lobby floor at Macy's to Burger Bar the transition was quite simple. Not too confusing. Although alot of hussle and bussle. The combination of tourists stopping snapping away and sightseeing, to the locals, to the employees the area can get pretty hectic. Being that Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf are the tourist mecca of San Francisco the prices can be somewhat inflated. Just an fyi.

Once at Burger Bar we were seated immediately by the hostess and that's when I realized I should have requested a window table overlooking Union Square....Next time. Looking at the menu the first thing that stood out to me was that $60.00 dollar burger. I said to myself how in the world can a burger be worth $60.00 bucks? I found out soon enough when I saw what was included in this burger.
 
It's called the "Remixed Rossini Burger" (Kobe beef stuffed with braised short ribs, topped with a lobster tail, shaved black truffles, truffle sauce on an onion bun. "SOLD". Not only was this a unique combination but the shaved truffles and lobster tail was my deciding factor. Burger was great, worth $60.00? I think so. Nice flavor, Kobe beef with the stuffed short ribs was delicious, lobster tail was fresh and the truffle sauce went hand in hand. I'd definitely order this giant burger again.  Towards the end the onion bun could not support all the ingredients and the experience started to get sloppy and I refused to use a knife and fork on a burger. I had to put my pride to the side and use that knife and fork or I would have had to resort to eating like a caveman. Extra napkins please!

In summary, I thought the Remixed Rossini Burger was great. Expensive but nonetheless worth it in my opinion. Service could have been better. Had to wait a while on the menu out of all things. Besides the $60.00 Rossini burger Burger Bar offers a wide variety of burgers. Vegan, Vegetarian to the "World's hottest hamburger". Also, you can build and customize your own burger with a plethora of ingredients. Alcoholic drinks were not the best but sufficient and the fries which were tasty come in steak, skinny, and sweet potato styles. I would come back.
author: Alastair G.

description: I was here on March 23rd, after flying in from the East Coast. My GF who lives in Calif. took me here. We got there right when it opened. The food was good, but its definitely very over priced!! The service was terrible! We had to ask the waiter about our drinks and food. It took a very long time for our drinks and food to arrive. The waiter was not friendly. My GF didn't even want to tip him. However I did tip him.  I would never recommend anyone to this restaurant. The waiter forget to give me back my credit card. Unfortunately I didn't noticed until I got back to my hotel and my GF had left to go to her home. I had to take an Uber back to the restaurant and pay $16 to get my credit card. I spoke to the mgr. Suzanne - who told me that it was my fault, and my responsibility to get my card back! She also told me that I was in a bad mood when I got to the restaurant! I was in shock how unprofessional a mgr could be. I had been flying since 3am! I am sure I looked tired! I take some responsibility,   however, it is the Waiter's job - to give good service, and to give you back your credit card. I would highly recommend DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE. Service is terrible, and the Mgr. is RUDE.
author: Sharyl R.

description:
This restaurant proved to be a terrible experience. Although the restaurant is labeled as a high end location because of the view, the staff and food are anything but. One of the chairs was damaged which pinched my daughter's finger causing it to bleed profusely. As I went to clean her up I asked for a new chair and when I got back it was not replaced. I had to ask numerous times for them to bring us a new chair. The restaurant never apologized or offered any type of compensation for the incident.
Aside from that, as one of my guests ordered she asked a question. The waitress rudely  implied that she was too incompetent to order and that someone else should order for her. After such rude treatment, the waitress had the audacity to remind us that the expected tip was 20% and that she had earned it. Overall the experience and service was horrible. The food was less than medicore with outragoues over prived meals in comparison. Would not recommend under any circumstances.
author: Tim T.

description: Burger was pricy but it was pretty darn good. I like how you can add and bulk up the burger. I was pleasantly surprised by truffles being on the menu. I recommend this place. The view, food and service is above average.
author: Jimmy P.

description:
Eh... 

We came here with the bf's fam on a whim saturday night, originally we were going to go to the good ol Cheesecake Factory but that wait for 8 was ridiculous so someone in the group suggested Burger Bar... There was a 30 minute wait for our party so we got a name on the list, went to the bar and had a few drinks before getting our table. I had a mojito, it was ok. Nothing spectacular but it was very refreshing on such a warm day. 

The restaurant is really narrow so if you have a decent sized group like we did, there's not a lot of room. But it was all good, just had to move out of the servers way a few times. 

We finally got our table and started to look over the menu. The burgers here are a little more steeply priced than burgers elsewhere, but that should mean it's really good, right? Ok.. So as everyone was ordering, I noticed they had a Kobe burger ($18) on the menu so I went with that...medium rare with Brie cheese, sautéed shrooms and grilled onion. Oh, and a plain bun. I couldn't wait to sink my teeth in a Kobe burger. We also had ordered some hot wings and a trio of fried goodies.. Cheese sticks, zucchini & onions. They were good, typical little bar snacks that you can't really mess up. The hot wings were not very spicy at all to me, but everyone else at the table found them to be spicy.. Flavor was good, they could have been a little crispier though, not a fan of soggy chicken skin. I wish I got a picture of the wings... Oh well. 

Finally our food came out. I was so excited to get my burger and once it came out....... It wasn't what I had ordered. I mean, it kinda was, but it wasn't. It was the Kobe (or so they said it was) with Brie, shrooms and grilled onions but it also had avocado and was on a wheat bun. Don't get me wrong, I love avocado and am a fan of wheat buns, it's just it wasn't what I had ordered. Low and behold, my bf's cousin noticed his burger was wrong too. His was on a plain bun and had no avocado. Minor mistake but still... I saw our waiter write down everyone's order exactly as we were ordering it. It took a hot minute for us to find our waiter so we could tell him that out orders weren't correct, he finally came around and took the food back. Oh yeah, another person in the party had ordered a separate order of fried zucchini sticks which never came out, luckily it didn't end up on their bill. Finally our "correct" burgers came out, but they both were still wrong. Mine had avocado and the bf cousin's had no avocado. LOL it's just a matter of switching it off, I know BUT STILL! The waiter ended up bringing an extra side of avocado out for the cuz and I got avocado I didn't order, but I didn't complain! Finally I got to bite into my Kobe burger.... One bite and it wasn't medium rare. It was medium. The bf cuz's burger was overcooked as well. What can you do... We were both over it by that point. Anyways, the manager ended up coming to our table and asking how our experience was, so we told him what had happened. He ended up taking 50% off two burgers, mine and the bf's cousin's because of their error. My burger went from $30 (yes $30) to $15... Which is what it really should have been at full price because that burger was sure as hell not worth $30 lol. 

Service here is not the best when it comes to waiter attentiveness. The wait staff seemed frazzled, unfocused and irritable. Final outcome: There are a ridiculous amount of better burger places in the city. I know I won't be making another visit here.
author: Tracie A.

description:
I ordered the American Burger with Skinny Fries. I asked for it to be cooked medium rare and as you can see in my photo I received a well done burger. We were seated in a corner table with a huge beam that blocked us from the rest of the restaurant. It took a while to wave someone down for more water and to ask them to fix my burger. I'm not paying $25 for my meal to not get what I wanted. I tasted my friend's pepper sauce that came with her burger. We used it to dip our fries in it. I asked the waiter for extra sauce, he never informed me it was $3 for a small serving of sauce!! 

My correct burger was good lots of bacon in it, bun was good too. It was a solid burger. Skinny fries were ok, nothing amazing. The chipotle dipping sauce was the best. curly fries, not amazing. 

The server was nice but super pushy, No drinks??, yes just water, you sure no drinks? yeah maybe I'll want dessert...we were so full after the burger, sorry no dessert.
author: Karen T.

description: Loved the ambience of the restaurant. The food and drink is very average for what you pay.  But definitely worth a try.
author: Carmel E.

description:
A friend was hosting her birthday dinner here about a week ago. There was a party of about 20 or more and were accommodated nicely. 

I've never been to Burger Bar before so I wasn't aware of this but there are several menus here. There's the standard restaurant menu which you receive when you walk in to dine. This time, we were given separate menus which are labeled according to price. We were initially given $31 menus which consist of an appetizer course, meal course of your choice, and a dessert of your choice. The host requested $27 menus which only consist of the first two listed in the $31 menu minus the salmon sandwich.

The dessert looked good though...so I got it. The desserts were milkshakes so I got the Caramel Latte flavor. Really pretty presentation and delicious in every way (very generous with caramel) but DAMN. REALLY overpriced. $10! I didn't know how much it cost until I got my check!

The appetizer course consisted of beer battered jalapeño pickles, onion rings, and zucchini fries. Another table had yam fries in place of zucchini fries. All of the appetizers were delicious. The table favorite was the onion rings because they're irresistibly crispy. This appetizer course came with a trio of sauces: chipotle aioli, BBQ sauce, and house ranch. All three were good but the favorite was chipotle aioli.

The meal course consisted of a few choices in burgers and sandwiches but I chose the American Burger which was a classic cheeseburger with bacon. I chose to get Medium rare but medium rare here is WAY more rare than you would think....so I requested having the medium well which was perfectly pink and juicy.

The quality of the burger was good. It was very juicy and delicious but not totally memorable. The fries were pretty good. I appreciate good fries.

Service was also really nice and attentive. The only issue we had with the service was the communication between the cooks and the servers who gave us our food. Several of us ordered the same burger but with different variations of done-ness. I had to cut into everyone's burgers just to figure out which ones were which and in the end a lot of us had to have them recooked because they were less well-done than we were expecting...if that makes sense. 

Total (for me) came out to be around $50. DAMN. Even if I didn't buy the milkshake? Still $40! Crazy expensive. I don't think I would plan on going back here for burgers unless it was a really special occasion on someone else's request.
author: Sofia R.

description: Was super excited to try this place as it has a beautiful view over Union Square especially during the holidays with the huge Christmas tree and all the lights! (Opt for a window seat, might be a little longer of a wait on busy nights but was met with terrible service and a sub par burger.. $15 for a burger with this special "hangover sauce" that basically tasted like thousand island dressing and mayo. I had to scrape it all off since I didn't like the taste of it at all. My burger patty was also very dry. Our waiter ignored our table and we spent an extra hour there all together just waiting to get the receipt back after paying. What I enjoyed was the calamari platter which was tasty but still a bit small for the price point. Overall, this is a nice once in a while once a year during the holidays kinda place but I'll definitely just try to order something new. They also have "adult" milkshakes, yes you can add booze to your milkshake, they have create your owns or their signature drinks. There is also a nice sized bar inside too!
author: Chelsea T.

description:
I've been in San Fran for a few days and I had a craving for a burger and beer. Finding a place that serves both in Union Square is apparently a semi-difficult task. I finally found this place and wandered in at 9:30 pm on a weekday evening. As I approached the host stand, he says "we're closed". I had literally just looked at their website which clearly states "open until 10". 

So I ask politely "I thought you were open until 10?" He proceeds to tell me that I can have a drink but the kitchen closes at 9. So what, they literally kick everyone out of the restaurant at 10? I've never heard of a restaurant closing the kitchen an hour before closing time, let alone a freaking burger place.
author: Megan K.

description: Can't speak to the food since we only ordered cocktails, but the view alone is worth the price of admission.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I'm not sure that this is the food that made me ill, if I was sure it'd merit a 2 or 1 star rating. The reason for the 3 stars is that they offer a standard burger at a premium price, and the service is sub-par. 

As far as redeeming qualities go, the view is nice if you sit next to the window.
author: Spencer R.

description:
Woo-hoo...I just received my tax return.

And what did I decide to spend my money on? I'm going to get a burger... from Burger Bar to be exact!

There are only a few Burger Bar restaurants in the world (Las Vegas, St Louis, MO and Beijing). I have been wanted to come to the Union Square location for a long time. But I did made an attempt to go to the Las Vegas location at the MGM. But the wait in the "Sin City" location was too long. 

My anticipated debut, I ordered the "Chef Hubert Keller's burger". For a whopping $22.00, I get a medium rare 1/3 of a beef patty with melted blue cheese, caramelized onions, chopped spinach in a toasted ciabatta roll. I'm used to eating my burgers at fast food joints and diners, but this gourmet burger is indeed very pricey and indeed one of a kind. A side of skinny (BK-like) fries is also included with my burger. Yeah the fries better be included with the gourmet burger. My burger: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=Fv_wsEkDwMwq1jmHB0JC8w#Fv_wsEkDwMwq1jmHB0JC8w

I also ordered one of the restaurant's gourmet milkshakes...yeah, damn right gourmet. My $8.75 Black & White milkshake has Vanilla ice cream liquid concoction with hot chocolate sauce and crumbled cookie topping.  Pricey, thick and creamy beverage, but divine and pleasant to look at. My milkshake: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=z7hoK6kAGbjfka48IDghfg#z7hoK6kAGbjfka48IDghfg

Dominic, bartender and the dude that took my order was very nice. As I was enjoying my pricey burger, Dominic was making ten Mint Mojitos when I was there. The drink must be very popular here. He also gave me a sample of the blended cocktail. That cocktail is $13.00. But with fresh Lime juice, mint and other ingredients to make the drink, I may come back and try that cocktail. 

I came here to dine after receiving my tax return. But after my pricey meal here, I may need to beg for money to get some of my money back.
author: Matt G.

description:
Up to the 6th floor we go! Damn, I didnt know this place was huge for being in a Macy's? It was a full on restaurant with bars and window seats! One of the best features here are the booth seats with a small TV screen playing different sports! 

Anyway, I ordered the classic with a fried egg on top and a side of sweet potato fries. Now the burger was medium rare just the way I like it! The fries could've at least been better and bigger...Instead I got small dinky burnt ones mixed in..I wish the egg yolk dripped all over my burger but it was deep fried too much that it held in place. Overall the burger was a 7/10 and the fries were just ehh.

What made my night was the Irish Bailey's shake crunchy chocolate dipped espresso beans. MMM this was awesome but it didn't go too well with the entree. The burger's shouldn't be this expensive and the shake was a bit too over priced but this is what I expect from a burger bistro. The shake was up to a 9/10! Loved it!

I would definitely come back here with some friends!
author: Allister D.

description:
Your paying for the view not the food. Got the salmon burger which was tasteless, side of Orion and jalapeño fires - too oily. 
Got the kiddos Mac and cheese and chicken tenders 
Mac and cheese looked like it came out of a box.
Chicken tenders were probably from Costco. 

The view was great. Especially with the Holiday tree lit up. 

Overall = 3/5 stars 
2 stars for the view
1 star for the waiter
author: Meeta C.

description:
If you sit by the window, the view is beautiful.

Food: 
-Hangover burger: I found this burger really messy to eat, as it was dripping everywhere and falling apart. I don't think it was anything special. 
-Crispy fries: Good when they're hot but once they cool down, they taste like rocks. 
-Black angus burger: I added caramelized onions and swiss. The onions were perfectly cooked! Simple but delicious. I ordered medium rare and it tasted a bit overcooked though.
-Sweet potato fries: really good but once I got to the bottom, they were soggy and crumbled up.

Service: 
TERRIBLE. We never got silverware until I was half-way through my burger and asked him for a napkin. He never checked up on us and disappeared for 15+ minutes at a time. We resorted to asking the host for things we needed. He disappeared with the credit card for a long time while we were on a time crunch. We could see him just wandering around and not at the register. 

Would not come here again.
author: Shelley K.

description:
$9.50 for shrimp cocktail (5 pieces of shrimp and small bowl of salad)
Jake was the only waiter that gave us great customer service. The person that gave us our food was extremely rude and just placed food in front of people without asking if that is what they ordered. He was in too much of a rush to even put them down smoothly.
author: Laura B.

description:
Suppose to be about building your own custom burger. Mine came with wrong bun and wrong side.
Supposedly manager came out after 2 request. No help.
Save your hard earned dollars, dine elsewhere.
author: Gary M.

description: Came here for my birthday dinner and got a really good table with a fantasticview of union square. We tried a bunch of apps, and i got the hubert keller burger which i thought was pretty good. Dessert was bomb. Also, JJ the manager is awesome!
author: Beatriz G.

description: Great service the drinks are the best, the hamburgers are delicious. I really recommended this place
author: Pris B.

description: The burgers were not even close to good and I came on an empty stomach! Its just a bunch of expensive ingredients carelessly thrown together in their attempt to create "The Ultimate Burger Experience". I ordered the Le "Frog" Burger with Black Angus, melted brie cheese, shaved asparagus, portobello mushrooms, truffle mayo on an onion bun. Sounds delectable right? It was totally flavorless and characterless. Everything was very sloppily put together. And it was a $18.95 burger. The only thing I truly enjoyed was the alcoholic milkshake, though didn't taste alcoholic, satisfied my sweet tooth craving. I had the mint chocolate chip with mint liquor. That was pretty darn good, it was so weak kids can drink it (no just kidding, don't be a terrible parent). Oh yes, the restaurant has great views of Union Square if you get to sit by the window.
author: Janny S.

description:
Utensils were filthy. I asked for two hot waters, both mugs were dirty. Asked for replacements, one of the replacements were even dirtier than the original. 

The food was okay. A much crumblier burger Patty than I'm used to. The redeeming factor was that it was a juicy burger. However, the chicken breast burger was very dry.
author: Annie W.

description: Delicious aalmon burger, good service very friendly and pleasant. Good atmosphere.  I would highly recommend the salmon burger
author: Anne K.

description: The service is terrible, the food is bland, they charge you for everything "extra" including sauce. Way overpriced.
author: Steph ..

description: The bar service for a quick round of apps and drinks is VERY attentive, friendly and expeditious. One can be In and Out (pun intended) in 20 minutes...which is helpful as a pit stop for marathon shopping at this Union Square favorite - Macy's. Cheers to The One and only Enrique - as Luke (great asst mngr) can confirm.
author: Michael G.

description:
I give two stars only because the staff are very nice and attentive and the sidewinder fries are good. Ok, on with the review. The burgers we got were revolting. We sent back the first ones because they tasted like kerosene. Ligit tasted like someone dipped them in kerosene. The staff was very kind and accommodating about it. This is the first time in my life I have ever sent food back because of quality or taste, usually I just let it go, but man, did those burgers suck. My girl got the make your own and basically ordered a cheeseburger. I ordered the Le Frog burger. They both tasted like kerosene, but I digress. So they brought us out new ones that still tasted like kerosene, but slightly less so than the first. 
I'm now writing this review from bed where both my fiancé and I are googling food poisoning to see whether or not we should go get our stomachs pumped. We've both been in and out of the bathroom SEVERAL times. 

Burger Bar is the restaurant equivalent of getting kicked in the crotch. 

The fries were good though. 
And the staff was nice. 
The burgers may be slowly killing us from the inside out. Send help.
author: M F.

description: After a long day biking across the Golden Gate Bridge and hanging around Pier 39 we took an Uber to Union square to do some shopping. It was close to 9 pm and we called up Burger Bar and they told us to come quick. We were greeted very well and given a table right next to the window. What a great view of the Union Square. Burgers were great as I have had them in Vegas before. Great service too. Love this place. A must visit if you are craving for a burger with a view while in Union Square.
author: Ashwin H.

description:
OMG WHAT A RIP OFF. My wife and split a burger and a shake with two sides. 54 bucks
It would be a little more acceptable if the burger was not over cooked. And the bun was definitely  not fresh.
I took one bite and immediately regretted eating here.  For a place calling themselves BURGER BAR you would think they would get the Burger right.    
Run away from burger bar if you value your hard earned money!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Leo r.

description: Tried it out Monday. Very nice place and great view. Came in at 7:45pm. The hostess was very nice to inform us that the kitchen was closing at 8. I'm guessing the bar stays open. Overall, great service, good food and good dessert.
author: Johnny W.

description: I had the salmon burger on a brioche bun with the skinny fries. The salmon was cooked perfectly. Even the skinny fries were good. I typically do not eat skinny fries because they do not stay hot and are usually hard. I would return!
author: Tonii T.

description:
OK, I'll add my +1600th of this place!

It was the last Friday before Christmas. I already took off from work for the holidays.  My daughters and her friends just finished their finals, and I picked them up and drove up to the City so they can go shopping and skating around Downtown and Union Square.  I needed a break from my own shopping, and needed a pick-me-up to get me going.

I always wanted to try this place, but the wait was always long.  At mid-afternoon, there may be chance the wait wouldn't be long.  I checked in with the host, and he said it was a 10 minute wait for one (not bad), or immediate seating at the bar.

Bar seat sounded good. A great view with the clear and unusually mild Winter day overlooking Union Square.

After I settled in, I ordered myself a Pyramid hefeweizen (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=Ebk3C0qcLaqOf9ARYlGLrw#Ebk3C0qcLaqOf9ARYlGLrw), and proceeded to look through the menu.  I was too lazy to "build-my-own" burger, so I chose one of the "Chef's Burgers."

My choice was:
-Le Frog Burger, with a side of Curly Fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=Ebk3C0qcLaqOf9ARYlGLrw#437Nt1pMijKTWNhSf2NYrA): Ground black angus, topped with brie and shaved asparagus, portabella mushroom, on an onion roll, with a side a truffle mayo.  The meat was prepared medium rare as ordered, and it was moist and juicy!  Toppings didn't overwhelm or overpower each other.  I thought the shaved asparagus was especially good, adding a slight crunchiness with each bite.

I didn't use all of the truffle mayo on the burger, but used it as a dip for the curly fries. The curly fries, but the way, were a little on the soft side, but still had a nice crispiness on the ends and edges.

 Service was efficient, but friendly, and my order came out quickly.  The burger was pricy, but very good.

Worth coming back?  Yes, but next time I need to order a shake!
author: Steve L.

description: This place is amazing. Wonderful staff, great atmosphere with a great view (when I made reservations I asked for table view). A bit on the pricey side but worth every penny. Wish I wasn't so stuffed after my burger and shake. I would of went for a Nutella burger. Can't wait to go back to try one.
author: Sirena L.

description:
First timer here.. tried the Black Jack Burger with zucchini fries - YUM YUM YUM. Juicy burgers and the olive tapenade was delicious on the burger. It's a little on the pricey side (I think it was $15 for the burger & zucchini fries sub) and a bit of a wait for a Saturday night. 

I think I would definitely try the Le Frog burger next - can't go wrong with brie and shaved asparagus!
author: Jennie P.

description:
Veggie burger was great, but pricey. 
Fries...good...
but holy hell.  $4.95 for a soda water!?   WTF!   Go away.  
The prices RUIN this place.
author: Matt V.

description:
Overpriced and touristy. 

Banking on their location and the view.  Quality of food not that great.  The views are wonderful- try to sit buy the window if you can.  

The burgers aren't terrible, they're fine (hard to really mess up a burger) however for the $$ not really worth it.
author: Alex J.

description:
The service just sucks at this place. Long line at the door, plenty of seats available but no host. Ud think at least someone can take over if they're busy but no. 
If u love burgers come eat here because u have many choices!!
author: Anudari K.

description: By far the BEST burger that I've eaten. I built my own burger. The KOBE patty is perfection! I love that I can pick and choose everything that I want on my burger. I still can't believe how amazing that burger was :)  the waiter was very nice and  attentive for how busy they were. Highly recommend coming here if you want a fantastic burger. Check out the happy hour. Make sure you sign up online!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Expensive as shit but I didn't pay for it, so that's what gets the extra star. 

Both my cousin (who was visiting from out of town, hence having dinner at one of the biggest, overpriced tourist traps in SF) and I ordered the Hubert Keller burger. I shared it with my 6-year-old. Yay bragging rights. 

Truthfully, I've had better burgers (y'all need to stop by Cecil's on Tennyson Blvd in South Hayward - gourmet it is not, but it is everything a burger should be) but you know, for what it's worth, it was a nice effort and flavor combination. 

For dessert we had the cheesecake burger and the Nutella burger. The cheesecake burger was a little too pudding-like for my taste but the Nutella burger was definitely on hit. 

As much as I love the idea of burgers with fancy ingredients, the old school part of me holds fast to the idea that burgers should be cheap, greasy, and readily available (i.e. don't cost the same as a mani/pedi)!

Honestly, the next time I ever want to drop some $$$ on a Hubert Keller meal, I'll save up and go to Fleur de Lys.
author: Aivy C.

description:
The Rossini chef's burger (Kobe style Wagyu beef from Australia with foie gras and truffle) is simply SUPREME. The best burger (and I've tried A LOT and all great ones) for sure!
Service is excellent and the view to Union Square is unbeatable
author: Jesus L.

description:
Prices are reasonable for SF, and also overlooking Union Square.  Good burgers, and 30+ draft beers; they specialize in the all-American food of choice for recreational eating, and they do a decent job.  Wait staff was def too casual (ie forgetful...), and that's somewhat irritating.

I might go back here as the food was pretty good and the 4th story perch was beautiful.  Staying at the Westin St. Francis, I could have hit the Burger Bar with a decent baseball strike to home plate from the outfield, so if I'm back there again I'll prob make that throw.  Lots and lots of high quality places to eat in SF though, and I can't say it was great, so 3 stars for the joint is the max....

Bottom line: A-ok for a pinch hitter but would not be in my regular lineup as a go-to eatery.
author: David C.

description:
I came here for lunch, and it was not busy at all. Too bad I didn't get a table with a view. 

Anyway, for lunch I decided to get the sliders with sweet potato fries, so I could try a little sample of their burgers. The sliders were country natural with cheese, angus beef with bacon, and buffalo with caramelized onions. They were all good, but the angus and buffalo meats were a little too dry for me. My favorite was definitely the country natural, which is a typical American burger. The meat was seasoned very nicely, and it was so juicy!

For dessert, I got the funnel cake "fries." The presentation was great, and it was delicious! It was also pretty light.

My only complaint would be the service. There was only one waitress in my section, and she never checked on us.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Can you give zero stars?
The most awful food that we ever had
Burgers are dried and over cooked
The burger buns were old and hard
French fries tasted like they were fried yesterday
Fish was all batter and no fish
$60 down the drain
author: Mag M.

description:
After so many years, I finally made it to this place. Always up for a good burger, it did not disappoint and makes for a nice stop in the middle of shopping at a magnificent flagship Macy's.

The place itself is located on the 6th floor of Macy's with a nice view of Union Square and its associated parking garage. The staff was quick to seat us but slow on the orders.

Got a buffalo (the healthy beef) and turkey (the healthy white meat) burgers with skinny fries which was more than enough. Ended it with a bomb Nutella milkshake.

Three stars - not bad at all. I'm still a bigger fan of Umami and Roam but when you're wiped out from shopping (or returning items) at Macy's hit this place up. It's a much better alternative than the other large restaurant in the store - Cheesecake Factory (who goes there anymore?)
author: Julia P.

description: I gave it a try because I do not need to wait for a window seat at Macy's 6th floor. But I regret coming to this restaurant because their food is not as good as Cheesecake Factory upstairs. Not even at the same level! Burger is totally a joke. Very normal, very disappointed! Meat quality is average, portion is even less than average, price is higher, why it is that special? Milk shake is fair, also average, but not that special. Price is a rip off, we came in with 2 people, we split a burger, they charge me for onion ring ranch dipping sauce, and sauce portion is so less! We even ordered 2 sauces for mozzarella sticks. We had one burger, 2 drinks, and a side, it cost us 60 bucks...
author: Nina H.

description: stopped for a bite to eat when near Union Square.  Food is pricey: burgers are $15 and up and a milk shake is $9.  Food was just OK.
author: david c.

description:
As my 300th review (holy begeesus how did I reach #300...), Burger Bar has a special place in my heart. And my stomach. But mainly in my heart because of my amazing boyfriend :)

The first sign of priciness is that you can get to this restaurant either by riding 6 floors on the elevator or 6 flights on the escalators in a Macy's shopping complex. The next sign is the mini televisions found in each of the private dining booths, just in case your dining companion isn't interesting enough. The third sign is the section on the menu talking about the chef Hubert Keller. And the most obvious sign is the dollar signage itself.

Burger Bar has a very eclectic range of burger choices, including the famous Kobe beef burger. But it confuses me as to why someone would eat high quality Kobe beef in the form of a minced meat patty. I'm saving the popping of my Kobe beef cherry for my next trip to Japan yeeee.

Opting for simplicity, I ordered the BLACK ANGUS BEEF BURGER on a whole wheat bun with all the fixings (tomato, red onion slices, lettuce, dill pickle sliver), $9.95 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=ma5-fEYSpDATSc3Mq3U5XA#BXAy9QGxuDAx4C8okc2Onw), adding a side of BUTTERMILK ZUCCHINI FRIES for $3.95 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=ma5-fEYSpDATSc3Mq3U5XA#J-Dnjkonuy9QGs-1HS6rRA). My boyfriend ordered the AMERICAN CLASSIC, Black Angus beef with American cheese and crispy bacon on a sesame bun, for $14.95 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=ma5-fEYSpDATSc3Mq3U5XA#gnVWAd-L_0H9M_cBRDvBhA), and the burger comes with your choice of fries. He chose the SWEET POTATO FRIES (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=ma5-fEYSpDATSc3Mq3U5XA#x50roHgFd1JlPFWXBCp7hA), which are normally $3.55, the same price as the regular fries. Unsure if he could've substituted the more expensive fries. Hm, thinking on it, I should've just gotten the Monterey Jack combo ($13.95) or the American classic combo because it comes with fries, which are already $4, AND the burger comes with cheese. Always on the lookout for cost-effectiveness ;)

We both asked for medium-rare, and I have to say that my medium-rare was done well (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=ma5-fEYSpDATSc3Mq3U5XA#ma5-fEYSpDATSc3Mq3U5XA). Raw has never looked so good, amirite? ;) Unfortunately, my boyfriend's leaned more toward a medium-medium-rare, but at least he had bacon!

The sweet potato fries were thin and crunchy, enjoyable but not memorable. The buttermilk zucchini fries were delicious, largely due to the lipid-licious batter. I'm not even certain that each fry had zucchini in it...

Aside from the food, the service was spectacular. Our waiter, John, was amiable, attentive, and all-around awesome, especially since he played along with my boyfriend's request haha :)

Despite having exotic menu choices, Burger Bar does their basic burgers well. Good food, great service, and the best moment!
author: Adele F.

description: Not impressed. Food wasn't great. Was a little pricey for just burgers. Won't return.
author: Carmen C.

description: I love the variety at this place, not just the burgers but the beers as well. The buffalo burger was tender with a lot of flavor, it has become one of my favorites! I love the location and on a Friday night the waiting period to be seated was pretty short. The service from the waitresses could be better.
author: Maria F.

description:
The bf and I were shopping at Westfield and thought we should grab a bite to eat. His co-worker recommended this place so we gave it a try. He hooked me in with "some famous chef from TV owns this place", knowing that I watch the food network religiously. 

We came at an off time so the place wasn't  crowded. They had TV's at the bar so we were able to catch the soccer game. The service was good, everyone was friendly and attentative. 

That being said, the food was just okay. I don't think the quality is worth the price. When I pay  more than $15 for a burger, I expect something more substantial. I got the slider trio bc I wanted to try a variety of burgers (I was curious about the buffalo burger, I've had bison and it's GOOD). I liked the slightly sweet buns that it came on, but the meat could've been better. I got them medium rare so I expected them to be juicier. They also lacked a lil flavor. On the plus side, they gave me a ridic amount of fries!

My bf got the one of the signature hamburger (sorry forgot which one), and we weren't impressed. Basically just a patty on bread with some cheese and bacon, with tomato,  lettuce and onion on the side. I think the quality of the meat wasn't what we expected and that's why the flavor was lacking. 

After our meal we both said we could've gone to In and Out and been more satisfied. For the price and what you get, it was a disappointment, I don't think we will be back.
author: Thuy N.

description: Came here with a few friends for milkshakes! I ordered the pink monkey and it was delicious and adorable! It was crowded and the wait was quite long for tables but it was a Friday night so it was pretty understandable.
author: Terri C.

description: Can't recommend this establishment on a Sat afternoon, we went for a family lunch with 3 grandkids and their parents for something fun before going to ACT 2p performance of A Christmas Carol.  Waited 50 minutes for our expensive & cold burgers, fries  to arrive....really???? Waiter could only offer that the kitchen "was behind" but it was also quite evident tbey were seriously understaffed. Don't waste your time& money for this disappointing dining experience
author: Aggie W.

description: Ordered delivery so didn't see this amazing view of Union Square. The burger patty was dry and not tasty. Ordered a BLT burger but it had not B, just LT. There are definitely better places to spend $15 for a burger.
author: Kyle C.

description:
It was during the biggest shopping days of the year so the waiter was overwhelmed. But he did do his best in a tough situation. My wife and I shared the hangover burger. I'm usually not one for lots of condiments on my burger but the hangover sauce was awesome!

I recommend this place as it is similar to The Counter in Corte Madera and just as good if not better!
author: Mark K.

description: Great view of Union square! Atmosphere lively! Food ugh! Ordered the sweet potato fries and bar sliders . Everything was almost cold and tasteless. What happened to cheese cake factory in Macy's? Scratch this one !
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Paddle Shakes is the title! 

Every time I go downtown with friends or family? I always come here. This place is neat! Great view, good food and friendly. 

I love the Nutella Burger with that cute little mouse in the side. A place where I can do a sugar overload! 

This place is highly recommended!
author: Nell B.

description: The food is a 4 but the service is a 2. We were in SF for my son's 9th birthday. We told the waiter this was his birthday dinner and asked if he could make it special.....his reply was "I have 7 other tables." Not the best response when we were hoping to make it a great night!
author: D'Lisa C.

description:
A remarkable place to enjoy a fantastic hamburger. Not only good food but a great view of Union Square and some top of the line service. This would be a must revisit place on a return trip to San Francisco. And they make a very good Bloody Mary. Did not have to add too much Tabasco to the drink as presented.

Besides the food and drinks, the view of Union Square is worth the visit just about from any seat in the place.
author: Harry T.

description:
Blah! I came here almost half a year ago and I remember exactly what happened and didn't happen.

Our server disappeared. For a LOOONG time. We didn't get our waters for a looong time. And we had to flag down a nearby server to get OUR server to come back and take our order! And while the short time he was here, he wasn't apologetic or even attentive. Worst service ever.

And I look at the menu, seeing the prices.. I expected an orgasm-in-my-mouth type burger. I ordered the Kobe beef burger with some toppings and fries. I took my first bite............ no orgasm there. Second bite? Nope.. not even close. I eventually finished it, completely Unsatisfied and disappointed!

No, don't get me wrong, the burger wasn't horrible. It was Okay. But for their prices? Okay won't cut it. I expect the full-on Oooh's, Aaaah's and Mmmmm's!!
author: Athena L.

description: I've been here several times and always had a great experience, until today. Service was mediocre and almost felt Denny's would have been a better choice. Maybe it was and off day but none the less prob will think twice about coming back. Ordered a Cobb salad and my partner ordered a burger.
author: Daisy A.

description: Thought they were open until midnight.... Closed at 10. Hours should be correct so no one is mislead like we were.
author: jessica n.

description:
Veggie burger, salad instead of fries, glass of wine $44. WTF??

Burger mostly onions. Salad was greens mix and a few cucumber pieces. 

Music awful. Just no fun, bad taste and super pricey.
author: Gregg G.

description:
Having just arrived in SF, we were hungry and desperate for lunch. Burgers sounded good, so a quick search set us towards this place. Burgers and a bar, what's not to love about that, right? Sadly, we were extremely underwhelmed with this place. 

First, it's inside a mall. Inside Macy's, to be exact. That was really strange to find. We still held out hope, we were hungry and excited to be on vacation. 

We were seated next to a wall with absolutely no view. There were multiple open tables next to windows so we requested to move and were denied. Not sure why, as some stayed open for a while and other people eventually got seated there. Maybe they had reservations? Either way, the way our request was handled was odd.

Our waitress seemed almost offended at having to serve us, very dismissive. Still, we were happy to be eating and chalked this up as a place that seemed like a typical suburban chain restaurant.

Then the strangest thing happened. I went to the restroom and when I returned, the waitress was practically sitting on the table talking to my BF about her weekend plans, laughing and giggling. As soon as I returned, she took off. BF said it was really strange. As soon as I was back at the table she returned to her gloomy demeanor. So, a waitress who hits on my BF while I'm away, but can't be bothered to help us otherwise?

Two stars is simply because the food was good enough for a quick lunch. Maybe a little overpriced. Beer selections were good. The strange service is what left such a bad taste in our mouths. If you're visiting from out of town, there are so many other enjoyable places to eat, you can get a good chain-restaurant burger back home for cheaper!
author: Amy R.

description: Great place , great burgers. It's not rocket science . It's a burger bar -make good burgers . This place does this perfectly . I had the Hubert Keller on day one and the Rossini on Day 2 . Apart from my heart (joking) it was perfect . It's well worth having the Rossini as the truffles are perfection .
author: Paul B.

description:
THE SLIDER!!!!
(4 stars)

That slider can slide right into my mouth. Get in my belly!!!!

- FOOD, yum
- PRICES, $3 per slider
- SERVICE, good
- AMBIANCE, burger brawl table

They were at the Ft. Mason Burger Brawl event and I was fortunately to meet the famous chef and try out one of the best sliders i've ever had. It was "THE ULTIMATE BURGER" experience that day. In my books, the best burger at the event. I think the sliders were either the Black Angus Beef or the Kobe Beef, either way it was CRACKING!!! I'm not a hardcore burger person but this slider really had some high standards. LOVED IT.

Will I be back? I'm going to have to deal with all the tourists and hit up Union Square to eat a full burger one day.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
Came here with Mr. W after our Sunday downtown date. I honestly can't remember much about the burger but love love
loved the raspberry velvet beer float! I'm not usually a big fan of beer but this doesn't taste anything like beer at all! Pretty sure I gained about 5 lbs from the float itself but it's well worth it!

I also wanna give some honorable mentions to the sweet potato fries and the sweet view of union square! I'll be back for the float for sure!
author: Tiffany U.

description: Great food and server was very nice and professional despite having my 2yr old being quite active. Definitely coming back.
author: Marky M.

description: Burgers are good, but they're definitely not worth the price.  The burgers here are not exceptional; they're just slightly better than other restaurants that serve burgers.  Their mint chocolate chip milkshake was amazing though; you can't taste the alcohol one bit.
author: Samantha C.

description: I don't understand the hype.  The burger was okay -- nothing special at all.  My wife and I split the burger and a side of onion rings.  While the view down onto Union Square is nice ... It is not worth the price or quality of the burgers and food.  Decent place but certainly not somewhere I would actually want to go.
author: Tim L.

description:
Craving a Burger and a Milkshake!? This is the spot to get it at! 

1. got seated quickly on a Sunday afternoon
2. waitress and hostess was quick and attentive! 
3. the view was nice and they had a couple of tv's so I could watch the niner game! 
4. Very Clean!
5. food was AMAZING! 

I will be back for more of EVERYTHING
author: Dina T.

description: This fucking douche takes our order and then brings our burgers out, before the shakes come out, the shakes don't come until we are all done eating, finally when she shakes come out the server forgot to put in my brother order of a Vanilla shake, then when my brother tells him he says ok I will get that and then he comes back and tell my brother they ran out of vanilla ice cream. Who the fuck runs out of vanilla ice cream lol this boy had me dyin whatever this place is a shit hole but the burgers are just ight.
author: Matthew M.

description: No wait here. Which should have been a warning sign here on a Friday night. The food was bland, in n out burger would satisfy me more. The service was terrible, but I do feel bad for our sever. She is running around and seems to be the only person here. I would say pass on by this place and head to Lefty O'douls.
author: Joshua C.

description: Sat at the bar. I don't remember such a horrible service for a while now. Would never come back. Burger it self was mediocre and way over cooked
author: Eyal R.

description:
Who doesn't love a juicy burger?!? I stumbled across this location as I'm new to the bay area and holy "cow" the burger was bomb! And the little baskets of fries are a nice complement as the onion rings on your friend's plate were just as good. 

Now don't get me wrong, you can order a burger anywhere, but the concept here is to add what you want (like a salad bar) except they bring it out all fancied-up. Guacamole, fried egg, peppered bacon galore, which can be a bit pricey as you add more and more. 

5th star lost due to the servers inability to handle our table on a Monday night. He was one of those servers that don't like to constantly bother the dining experience but took it to the next level and was basically gone. The view was better than the service fo' sho'!
author: Patrick C.

description:
3.5 Stars for Burger Bar.

Quality and service are quiet inconsistent here. Not to mention the lines are as bad as going to Cheesecake Factory upstairs, and being from the city I know I have better options. Definitely a bring your tourist friends to type destination. I have yet to try Burger Bar in Las Vegas, which has a larger location and is supposed to be better, so I can't compare.

Given the prices, the burgers aren't that spectacular. Once again, inconsistency. Sometimes really amazing, which is how it should be?? but often bland and leaving you wondering why you just wasted $15. If you get seated in the corners.. beware.. your waiter will forget about you and you're going to wonder what happened to the AC. Not for the claustrophobic. If you're up for the challenge, go for the DIY burgers. I usually stick with the given options but add my own toppings and sides.

Their only redemption is the dessert burgers. Not a real burger but it sure looks like one. The use of dessert items to create the facade of a burger was not only cool to look at but yummy. I enjoyed this part of my meal more than my burger.

Jenn
author: Jenn Y.

description:
Nothing was running smoothly here besides the view on a nice day.  Unlike Cheesecake Factory upstairs, there is no outdoors dining.  The wait is slow for everything i.e., staff, hostess, bartenders, etc.  I have to say that our waitress was friendly, but she forgot to come by many times and literally forgot our lemonades with our burger lunches.  The nutella shake was not spectacular, just ordinary - Mel's, Lori's Diner, Johnny Rocket's, or Denny's would have been better.  I felt the burgers were tiny and at the price of Bellagio's ($15-25).  No happy hour and no truffle fries...no bueno!!!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/burger-bar-san-francisco?select=81cHJ_zEToXEU9djXhw7jg
author: Christine R.

description: Great burger spot! The food is delicious and comes out quick. Exceptional service as well. Nandiya was very attentive, friendly and personable. The bar wings were yummy with the flight of sauces and the the bar sliders were great as well. Perfect portion and well cooked.
author: Christopher M.

description:
I had gone ice skating at union square and wanted to get some food with my friends. It was late around 9:25pm I walk up to the hosts and asked to see a menu, we were looking over the menu, when she proceeded to come over and tell us, they had stopped seating. Not sure why they didn't, just tell me that when I walked in. 

The hosts was very rude and unfriendly, it didn't make me want to return, since the customer service was horrible.
author: Veronica V.

description: Their burgers are really good. The customer service is very good.  I ordered the surf and turf burger. It is a burger topped with a lobster tail. The burger was cooked correctly. I also ordered the foie gras burger, before it was banned.  Both burgers were very good. I also ordered the Nutella milkshake.  It was a chocolate milkshake topped with hazelnuts and chocolate chip. It was delicious.  The French fries tasted good. It was crispy and not greasy.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: Eh.  Wait was too long, service blugh.  Maybe I should try it again, but I'm not racing in.  Food was ok.
author: Dick B.

description:
Burger Bar is located on the 6th floor of the Macy's shopping complex.  We had our team lunch here and were seated in a private banquet area that seats about 40 - 60 people. 2 50" HDTVs on the walls and a gorgeous view overlooking Union Square.  

They have a pre-set menu that had fried zucchini, fried pickles, and onion rings served with three sauces (BBQ, ranch, and thousand island/tartar?  I forget.) as the appetizer.  They have two choices of burgers (American Classic or Hubert Keller)... and a salmon burger (Atlantic Salmon Steak) and veggie burger (Chef's Veggie) for those that don't eat meat.  Dessert was the Milkshake Paddle which was an assortment of milkshakes... a sampler of all their most popular milkshakes (Nutella, Caramel Latte, or Strawbery).

The appetizer was good at first cause I was starving but after maybe 5 minutes, it was starting be overwhelmingly fatty because of all the fried batter and I only really liked the onion rings.  @___@  I ended up just taking off most of the batter and eating the insides..  I had the American Classic medium rare with mushrooms.  Burger was standard, classic.  Nothing amazing.  I don't know if it's because of our huge party or what and just tried to get everyone's food out as soon as possible... but it seemed like they weren't putting enough time and effort into grilling our burgers.  My burger actually came out more rare than medium rare.  It was almost undercooked. :c  The fries weren't amazing either, just your normal ol' fries.  The milkshakes were not for me and too sweet for my liking.    A very normal burger meal.  Actually, a very heavy meal ... felt like 3000+ calories in one sitting. x_x  Goodness.

What I will give a huge applause for, is the amazing service that we received.  Over the course of our time dining there, there was at least 1 waiter at any given time (from when I was actually on the lookout) of the 4 that tended to our party.  Any additional asks that we had, were all accommodated for and they were very quick and efficient at serving our food/drinks and taking our orders!  They actually forgot my mushrooms with my burger, but right when I mentioned it to our waiter, he immediately took care of it and brought me a side of mushrooms to add to my burger!  I know it's hard sometimes when you have to deal with huge parties, but huge + to Burger Bar for the great service!!!
author: Carena N.

description: Came here last night and wasn't super impressed but I also wasn't in a burger mood haha. The restaurant wasn't very busy. We were seated right away by the window which overlooked Union Square, very pretty! I ordered the chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich was pretty standard. The bread was a little harder than I would've liked. The fries were my favorite, very yummy! My boyfriend and his mom both ordered burgers and seemed to enjoy them! Maybe if I come back I'll try one.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Not sure what happened but the last two times I was here over the past couple months the burgers have all been way overcooked. Last time I go the Kobe burger and it was so well done it was a waste of money to upgrade to the better beef. They used to cook the burgers perfectly.

Sides and shakes are still good but I can't justify a better review until they get the burgers right again.
author: Rade S.

description: I went into the City to meet a friend who recently moved up here like me.  We wanted to eat near Union Square so we could experience it at Christmas.  I had the sliders, she had the turkey burger, and her boyfriend had the Kobe burger.  One of the sliders came with American Cheese, which I subbed Cheddar as I'm a believer that American Cheese is not in fact cheese.  It's disgusting.  I had to send back the slider that had the American cheese on it.  I hate having to do that but I don't eat rubber. The waiter brought out another slider and tried to tell me my slider did have cheddar and that cheddar sometimes melts funny, but that they "went ahead and changed out the cheese on this new burger." No.. Just no.  I know my cheese and can tell the difference between rubber and dairy.  Anyhow, everything else was ok. Overpriced but ok.
author: Sarah B.

description: The service was good, the food was good, the view was good! A bit overpriced but almost everything is in the city. The sliders were perfectly cooked and the milk shakes were also a big hit with the kids! My husband and stepfather built their own burgers and they enjoyed that option very much as well.
author: Dorris K.

description:
Food was great! Service was lacking only cause there were only 3 employees on the floor! Ordered food and it came out great. Ordered a Pina Colada shake - TWICE. Twice it was wrong. We settled on water. In fact, had to get my OWN water behind the bar. Used the soda gun and everything! TWICE!!

This is NOT a staffing issue, it's a management issue. With 80 people you need more than 3 people serving. If some people called in sick, I could understand, but if this is the norm, then management needs get their act together - or possibly the ownership. 5 Stars for food, 1 star for service.

Asked to talk to the manager, after 45 minutes, he did not show his face. If I were him, I wouldn't have shown up either...
author: Jim P.

description: Came in and got a seat right away. The place had an awesome view of downtown SF. I waited about 15 minuted for the server to come. Ordered a lettuce wrap all natural medium cooked burger and a caramel latte milkshake. The burger was really dry while the milkshake tasted good but was not well blended. Service was just mediocre. The total price with tip was a bit over $30, & for what I got a little over priced.
author: J T.

description:
Get your meat on meat here. And a shake with that. 
(Surf and turf burger: Half grilled lobster on your meat) F*ckin aye. what will they think of next?
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Was it the half hour wait for our order (at 6 p.m. with the place 20% full)?  Was it the grey burgers we got when we'd asked for pink?  Was it the soggy sweet potato fries (they do 'em better at the ballpark)?  
Was it the upset stomach that I got three hours later? 
Or was it the nearly $80 tab for two, including a glass of wine for each of us?
Don't know.  Don't care.  Won't do that again.
ps. Wilson, our waiter, was new to his job and was trying hard to please.  He was not the problem in any way.
author: Barry R.

description:
I recently went to BB for a lunch in with an old friend to catch up. Upon arrival there was no host at the front to greet and 2 people in front of us were waiting for the host to even be seen. It seems like the Host was also a waiter from the looks of it passing food around and trying to sit people and juggle many things at once. 

For one it gives the customer a bad feel of confusion, a where do i go? is there a waiting list i sign? and the list can go on and on. But like i keep telling everyone in business or getting a job, first impression is EVERYTHING so why shouldn't restaurant keep the same ethics? 

SO passing the hurdle of getting sited and ordering the food and getting the food in a timely manner. The food is a bit bland, sorta feels like its missing something to give it that kick. That wow factor, of saying thats a good burger or thats a good salad.

-1 Star for bad impression no host
-1 Star for having the bathroom floor wet, since can be dangerous and increase risk for falls.

Solution: Have someone stay only at the front at all times to greet, and pass the job to the waiter to take them to their seats.
author: Ken S.

description:
I came here because the cheesecake factory was packed and had a 2 hour wait for my group. We came here to only quickly be seated. Service is a hit or miss and right now I feel like we are all falling asleep while waiting for our food. When looking at other tables their food seemed to be coming out fast. Anyway our server was busy so we ended up having our order taken by another server. Friendly and helpful service

Edit:food came out hot and delicious
author: Bei T.

description:
HUBERT KELLER'S OTHER RESTAURANT

About 7 months ago I eat at Fleur De Lys. I really didn't enjoy that well considering how much I paid for the portions. Last Tuesday night I went to here to try it out. Looking at the menu it seemed pricey however it was still intriguing. I came here for specifically to try the Hubert Keller Burger (buffalo). I never had freshly, made, ground buffalo before (I bought frozen patties at Traders Joe's). I've heard that buffalo meat is really tasty and not gamy at all. I had the buffalo burger and I liked it a lot. The burger was moist and not heavy. As people have said to me that buffalo meat is lean meat that doesn't have a strong taste. After having this burger I believe them. The other items I liked were the alcoholic milkshakes. I can't think of a burger joint where you can have an alcoholic milkshake. I ordered the French Kiss and you can feel a slight buzz, but the alcohol was not overpowering.

Might not be fair but this rating is based upon my comparison with Fleur De Lys. I really enjoyed my dinner at Burger Bar more than Fleur De Lys. I can see myself coming back here again.
author: Gerald R.

description: Took a long time to get water and drinks but the food was very good. We created our own burgers and they were huge and delicious we got the fat fries. And ended with an adult Irish whiskey. The waiter made up for our wait by giving. Us an extra shot in the adult shake. Had to give low rating as we waited way to long but the food was good
author: jessi s.

description:
I'm not a big meat eater but I always find myself craving burgers.  Strange huh?  I made the mistake the first time when I ordered their vegetarian burger.  I didn't make the same mistake the second time around.  I love the fact that you can customize everything you want in the burger.  The burgers are big and are very filling!  Grilled mushrooms make a great addition to your burger as well!  Don't forget to add a side of sweet potato fries because they do go super great with your burger.  

Don't forget to call ahead to make a reservation to avoid the wait!
author: Steph F.

description:
I only came here for their alcoholic milkshakes that I've heard about.

Comparing it to Vegas, it is like the Fat Tuesdays of SF!!!!

Their alcoholic milkshakes itself are amazingg and rich! However, I highly recommend adding extra shots of alcohol in there because just the basic order alone barely has any alcohol at all! So if you are looking for a delicious milkshake to enjoy while still getting tipsy from it, add extra shots of 151 :) You won't even taste it!!!
author: Cuc N.

description:
My friend and I are big burgers fanatics!  So when we were in SF for the weekend, we made a point to stop by Burger Bar because we both had different sets of people recommending this place to us.  

But sadly, I couldn't help but leave Burger Bar feeling a bit disappointed and let down.  Really?  All of that hype and the long horrendous wait for a dry and not very flavorful burger?

I ordered the Classic Burger, just your typical run of the mill bacon cheeseburger.  I know, I'm boring that way, but that's the burger that I use to gage it to other burgers I've had.  The bun was dry, hard, and cold and left little to be desired for.  My friend ordered the Le "Frog" burger.  Once again, nothing memorable.

We both left feeling a bit disappointed and robbed of something that we thought was going to be so magical.  Maybe our expectations were to high?  Maybe the location in Vegas is better?  Maybe we came on a bad night?  All I know is that I really wanted to like this place.  *sigh*
author: Linda T.

description: My friends & I really enjoyed this restaurant. Great burgers, yummy milkshakes & prime location in Union Square!
author: Kellie N.

description:
Our hotel was near Burger Bar. 
This place is in Macy's - which should be the first indication to STAY away.

The food was lousy.

The only good thing about this place is the beer list. The beer list WASN'T Bad - which is saying a lot coming from me. In fact, I am going to add this to my beer list.
author: Justin A.

description:
I have high expectations for Burger Bar since it is owned by one of the top chef in the country. And plus the fact that they are selling the most expensive burger ($5000) in the world. 

We ordered:

Hubert Keller Burger
--- it comes with blue cheese, caramelized onions, spinach nd buffalo. I found the meat to be quite on the dry side. I wanted a juicy burger. The kind that juices flows in your mouth in every bite. I had my meat medium. I also ordered the sweet potato fries but it came cold. It looks like its been sitting there for a while before they serve it. 

Low Carb Burger
--- Angus Beef, mixed greens, roasted red and yellow peppers. I actually like it. The meat was very juicy. We also ordered onion rings. They gave you generous amount of onion rings. Its too much for 2 people. 

I probably would go back again and try other burgers. .  I see people ordering sliders. Or maybe i can try their build your own burger. I am also intrigued about their surf and turf burger. I will give it another try and bring more people so we can order and share different types of burger. 

I think it would be a nice idea to have a burger tasting on their menu? 
Prices are ok but not cheap. One good thing is their location. Located at the 6th floor of Macys hiding inside the household department. Who would have thought that there is a must see restaurant in there? With a nice overlooking view of the Union Square this is a perfect happy hour place for friends and colleagues after a stressful day at work.
author: Kristina A.

description: We always come into this place after shopping at Macy's just to have a drink and look at the view and grab a burger and look for our bartender Rob but yesterday was Rob's last day we were told but not to despair too much in his place was Nick Francis first day fresh from Lake Tahoe what a nice guy he is...so get over Rob already and come say hello to Nick.
author: tom l.

description:
Had the bison burger.  Was decent but greasy.  The awesome part was watching my husband cry as he ate the "World's Hottest Burger."  The dummy.  He didn't even get his name on the wall for eating the whole thing.  You have to sign a waiver to order it.  No joke.  

Good stuff.  Make a friend order one.

I gave it five stars for the entertainment.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Don't come here.  For goodness sake, you can get a far better burger at any of the other diners in the area for less money.

We ended up paying $60 for 2 classic burgers, 2 kids meals and salad.  The salad and the fries were the best parts of the meal.  My burger was salty and dry.  I much prefer In-n-Out over Burger Bar.
author: Susan C.

description: Yum!!! We gave it a try after leaving another place and we're NOT disappointed. We were greeted and seated immediately, waited on attentively, and served quickly. I had the veggie burger...OMG!....The best I have had. The whole atmosphere was just welcoming and relaxing. Definitely bookmarking this one!
author: Karen W.

description: Gorgeous view of union square. Hair in my Caesar salad. Ew. New salad was wilted lettuce. Found a hair in my husbands fries as well. Wouldn't be back. Service was okay but never any eye contact. Super weird vibe.
author: Shea M.

description:
If i wrote this review last year - i've would have praised it, but since i went there last night as a yelper. I feel i should give a honest review...

The first time i went there everything was perfect - from the bacon cheese burger to the fast service. 

Im not going to complain about this visit, but service needed LOTS of work that night. Everything from the long wait to take an order to forgetting to put bacon and a bacon cheese burger. With that aside i will only talk about the food now...

In burger subcategories - this place falls into the gourmet burger section. Offering standard cheese burgers all the way to kobe beef and foie gras burgers. I had the chef special - Hubert Kellar. Which is buffalo beef toped with spinach and blue cheesed top with a red wine reduction sauce. Sounds fancy, but fit and finish did not come thru well. The blue cheese was over powering. The meet just fell apart when i was eating, while the chiabata bread was soaked in its fat that it became soggy. I should have just stuck with the cheese burger. Overall taste was feasible. I think if they put a little bit more work in polishing the burger - it would have been really good. I guess Hubert wasn't in the kitchen when i made the order.

On the up note... i did order a ridiculously priced alcoholic milk shake ($11). I had the mint chocolate with mint liquor. I did not taste any alcohol.Although the consistency was perfect. One of the more enjoyable milk shakes i had in my day. 

Well. Overall the food tasted better than most burger joints. It is on the bottom of premium burgers on my list but way better than a McDonald's burger. I might add that no burger is cheaper than $14.
author: Ryan R.

description:
GO FOR THE REAL BURGERS. I've been here 3 times and 2 of the 3 times, I tried to be healthy and was disappointed. The real deal is getting a solid burger oozing of delicious goodness. Don't cheat yourself. For my friend's birthday, I ordered the Hurbert Keller burger from the event's set menu. AMAZING. The buffalo meat was juicy and flavorful. All the delicious toppings just complimented it perfectly. Bonus points for their delicious sweet potato fries and curly fries!

The view from the window is also pretty bomb and I just realized their booths have inset TVs for those wanting to watch the game!
author: Leana L.

description:
Had fun here.. A little rude on the service.. She was very slow, and when we started off with just ordering fries and no booze or sodas, she was like, "You're going to order more stuff, right??" as if we'd be wasting her time if we didn't.  And then we ordered 3 types of fries (sweet, thin, and onion rings) and she charged us $15 for a "Fry tower" instead of the $9 it would've been going off the menu.  I dunno about that, but I didn't want to argue.. After all we did eat all of them!  They were DELICIOUS!

Burgers were good too.. Everything came out as we ordered.  I had a burger done medium, on ciabatta, with bacon, fried egg, and sprouts.  It was even better than I expected!  Wife had one with sauteed mushrooms, carmelized onions, and swiss. Both burgers were fantastic!

Check out the dipping sauces as well.

Oh, and the strawberry milkshake was amazing.  They have a milkshake sampler... Wish I would've seen that beforehand instead of on my way walking out.. But man that looked good!  We had strawberry milkshake with our meal and the strawberries were nice and thick, almost like a gel or glaze as well as whole fresh strawberries that went through the blender.  Ice cream was delicious too.

Overall a very nice place.. Hoping to go again soon!

Check out the dessert menu as well!
author: Robert K.

description: The food was just ok. The sliders tasted dried and old. The wings were too burned. I ordered boiled asparagus and it was too oily I had to clean them with napkins. It looked nice by the window but other than that, I found nothing good
author: Dao E.

description:
This is a solid option if you normally eat at McDonald's but want to impress a lady or upgrade for whatever reason. Also, this is the first time I've ever eaten at a burger restaurant inside a Macy's. I don't really know what to say about that. 

Anyway, the burger itself was thick and juicy -- not McDonald's quality of taste, but still respectable for an upscale thick-burger joint. And the fries came out hot. I opted for the classic burger. Meat, bun, cheese and bacon. I think that bacon burgers really aren't "classic," but that's a whole different debate. 

If your wife drags you to Macy's, this is definitely your best lunch option. And the service is fast, too.
author: Sammy R.

description: Only good for the view of Union Square. Burgers were not all that for their ridiculous prices. Come on people... it's burgers. Not interested in going again. Service wasn't good either.
author: CJ R.

description: Very good hamburgers. Excellent service and gear view. First time here I would really recommend the classic burger and build your own.
author: Gustavo A.

description:
The only reason we went here was for the view, overlooking union square, otherwise i would recommend just coming here for dessert, a milkshake, or a drink at there bar. We ate here on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm. You have to go through Macy's main lobby and take the elevator to the 6th floor, you may be waiting awhile just to get up since the elevator capacity is only 10 people. We sat in the bar area in front of the window, again NICE view. There was only 1 person servicing the bar area,and he was very nice, but he had several tables, so we had to wait about 10 minutes to order drinks, and another 10 minutes to get them. I saw my shirley temple sitting at the bar waiting to be delivered to me, i would have been better off just grabbing it and bringing it to my table.

I ordered the american burger, it comes with skinny fries, both were over seasoned, especially the fries, very salty. My boyfriend got the Kobe burger, he enjoyed it with a side of onion rings. My burger was $14 and his was about $19, not including the sides.The food was mediocre, and nothing that i would come back for. I would definitely stick to Umami if you are looking for a good burger. 

The plus was that Hubert Keller, owner and winner of Top Chef Masters was in the building. He walked around and smiled at the guests, a very nice surprise.
author: Dessirea V.

description:
So I am a fan of the burgers, fries and onion rings here.... I have been here 3 times and haven't had a bad burger.... 

Now for the not so great... we bought our vegan cousins there because- after some research- we found they had a veggie burger and vegan "burger".... so we get there and all of the buns have dairy in them... what is the point of that? Not ONE option of bread for them, REALLY?The vegan "burger" is a pile a vegetables that you have to eat with a fork & knife, soooo not really a burger.  the drinks were good 
We did have a party of 7, but the service was slow this time. 

So, bottom line is a 3 for the food and sad veggie options and a 4 for the regular burgers....
author: Dawn R.

description:
