My son & I had dinner tonight at the Burger Bar.  Great juicy burgers; delicious fries but maybe most memorable was the wonderful service from waitress Aida.  She is personable, smart & efficient and even remembered we had been there before.  Made us feel at home.
We will definitely be back!
author: Cindy R.

description:
We were seated immediately on a Friday night in December when crowds of people make their way to Union Square and Macy's. So there's 1 star. 

After looking over the menu, I told my family I would much rather go somewhere else to eat. As most people mention in the reviews, it's way too expensive for what you get. Yes the view is great, but if you're not right by the window then it just feels like you're at any other burger joint. 

It took the waitress around 5-7 minutes to come over and take a drink order. Then another waitress came by, introduced herself and asked what we want to drink. After telling her we ordered with another waitress, she proceeded to take our food order with no explanation as to who the first waitress was. After looking over the menu it was clear that most of the burgers did NOT come with fries as the menu had a detailed fry/onion ring section with various prices. Some burgers said they came with them, but most did not. So we ordered a fry sampler and 3 burgers that didn't say it came with fries. Food came and 2 out of the 3 burgers ordered came with fries and additionally we got a fry sampler for $12. Why did the waitress not inform us when we asked about the fries and how many people could share them that 2 of the burgers come with fries? The burgers were pretty good. There's the second star. The waitress wasn't very good or attentive. She did ask if everything was ok but as she was staring at 3 empty drinks. I mentioned to her that it wasn't necessary to order the fry sampler because the burgers already come with them. She responded ,"Oh yeah it IS a lot of fries!"  Then concluded the meal with, "Do you guys want the check?" Well....not really! For 3 people it was $75 before tip for 3 burgers, fry sampler, a beer, and soda. Should of gone to IN-N-OUT. 

 Throughout meal I also recognized some un professional matter by wait staff. One waitress was eating snacks in a drink station that was visible to customers. Another waiter had a really bad attitude about a large party splitting the bill. He was clearly unhappy about the situation and was lingering around their table with a disgustful look on his face. Other wait staff just hanging around chatting like they were off the clock, when the restaurant was busy.
author: Lauren T.

description:
A solid three. You ain't bad, Burger Bar, but you ain't great, neither. I reckon you're mighty fine at some things and at other things you're mighty lacking. At making buffalo burgers, you're mighty adequate. In other words, just adequate.

We was in the Union Square area doing some mighty fine holiday shopping in them there stores and shops and whatnot. There was a three hour wait at that new-fangled Rotunda restaurant at that city-boy Neiman Marcus store. I wasn't gonna wait no three hours to get me some lunch. By that time, it would be dang near dinner! There was a measly five minute wait at the Burger Bar, so it was going to have to do the trick.

My lady friend bought me some nice crystal decanters at the Macy's while we waited. I reckon I'll put some fine whiskey in them when I get back home. Mighty fine whiskey.

Nice views at this here place, if you get a spot by the windows, which we did. Some lady at a table next to us wanted to take a picture of them skaters in that there Union Square. She kept leaning around us trying to snap up a shot. It wasn't that annoying, but it was mighty weird. She had a disposable Kodak camera, the yellow and red kind. I thought they stopped making those after the two towers fell down. Damned terrorists. God bless America.
author: Mike A.

description:
Not too thrilled about the price to quality/tastiness ratio.

There were 6 of us hungry for some burgers and fries.  Some got a beer, but not all of us did.  In the end, when we split the bill we paid $35 per person - for some burgers and fries?!!!!  I should have anticipated this, since Burger Bar is located in Union Square.  This is why I was borderline ready to give 4 stars, but I was just not happy enough to be so generous.  If you are going to charge high prices, at least have the food be incredibly delicious or have that something extra (because location) that justifies the cost.

For example, the ambiance feels just like a simple burger joint (with high tables and high chairs) rather than something a bit more classy (booth seating).

For what it's worth, our server was friendly, and the hostess was friendly and responsive.

Likely won't be back for a while...maybe just for the dessert or a beer.
author: Elisha Y.

description: Great place if your are looking for a burger! I had the lamb, my kids the classic...all great. We had several types of fries (skinny, fat, veggie) and all were very good. The only advice I have is think twice before upgrading to the wagyu --- with all the toppings it is hard to "taste" the upgrade. My wife was underwhelmed. Milkshakes are impressive -- kids managed to magically save room, wife and I didn't but we had some sips. They even gave us a free shake because one took longer to make (trainee apparently).
author: John D.

description: Burger bar you see me every time I am in San Francisco!  Share please!  I love the milkshakes here!  I get the Oreo milkshake and know I will be fat but I don't care!  For a main course I order Le Frog and try to get it without the stripped asparagus, sometimes it can be a bit much. The burger itself is amazing though if oh like Brioche buns and melted Brie!  The view of Union Square is beautiful as well!  So happy this place exists!
author: Jordan N.

description:
Burger Bar is a medium sized restaurant situated on the 6th level of the Macy's building. Over looking Union Square it has great views of the area at night.

The food is delicious and the shakes are killer. Be prepared for slow moving service and a wait that will make anyone bored.
author: Andy M.

description: Save your money if you are not from San Francisco, this place is over price burgers with frozen potatoes, frozen onion rings. I really don't get these boutique burger places with frozen sides. My onion rings came out cold.smh..The burger is plain tasting with no flavor. I wish I could give a zero..but the customer service was Awesome..
author: Taliseia C.

description:
OK, I kinda liked it. I know I'm not supposed to, but I thought my burger experience here was pretty solid in a strangely unexpected way. You should know I've been avoiding this place for months because of two arbitrary but palpable reasons. The first is Hubert Keller not because he's not a great chef but because serving burgers strikes me as slumming for the man who revitalized Fleur de Lys' reputation. The second is the undesirable Cheesecake Factory-in-Macy's vibe I get when I'm stuffed into an elevator only to find myself in a waiting queue as if I was holding an E-ticket for a Tomorrowland ride. 

Imagine my surprise when Jamie W. and I found ourselves immediately seated on a Sunday evening the moment we saw the hostess when I expected to see half the East Bay and a lot of the South Bay filling the tables. As we were perusing the menu, we could see why they weren't there. The exorbitant prices. After I put my eyeballs back into their sockets, I noticed there was a pretty wide fluctuation in price points that you have to study to know what you're getting. I was immediately drawn to the left side of the menu, the Chef's Burgers since they came with skinny fries. The a la carte side on the right just struck me as a nickel-and-dime operation meant to cater to anal-retentive burger lovers with bottomless wallets. 

Jamie ordered the $14.50 American Classic, which sounded pretty standard down to the addition of bacon, all on a sesame seed bun (see photo). Mine was a marginally more daring choice, the $13.75 Black Jack Burger which came with melted jack and a spread of tapenade, all in a ciabatta roll (see photo). I threw caution to the wind and also threw in a $1.25 order of oyster mushrooms on top. Both were seriously delicious with the Black Angus beef fresh and cooked to order. We definitely didn't feel like they were skimping on the ingredients. 

The $3.25 Diet Cokes came with free refills, a big plus, especially on Jamie's checklist (see photo). And the view is nice if you can get a table next to the window. I only noticed later that there were TV screens in the booths, which I felt was rather ridiculous if faster turnover is necessary when the throngs of tourists come in. There's no getting around the prices, even though I am more than willing to overcome my elevator phobia to have another one of Keller's burgers. The happy hour specials strike me as a good time to gorge. 

FOOD - 4 stars...an excellent burger but you need to empty your pockets a bit 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...has that unmistakable Cheesecake Factory vibe to it 
SERVICE - 3 stars...better than I anticipated but still a bit shaky 
TOTAL - 4 stars...I honestly would have no hesitation coming back some time for another burger...it was tasty for sure
author: Ed U.

description:
If you happen to be in the hell on earth that is Union Square and need to grub before you escape, Burger Bar is conveniently in the middle of all the madness. Go to the elevators on the left (avoid the Cheesecake Factory mess on the right) when you enter from Geary. 

Pros:
- THEY HAVE BUFFALO BURGERS!!!
- views of the square
- full bar
- did I mention they have buffalo?

Cons:
- I hate Union Square
- Service was not the best--the host wasn't very welcoming and our server was no where to be found most of the time, but I must admit, she was friendly
- bathroom looked like someone dropped a toilet paper bomb on it--I know it was close to closing time, but have some shame, people!
author: Kristine W.

description:
Went to San Francisco for my bachelorette party last weekend and had to try Burger Bar. I'm a huge fan of hamburgers, and I wanted to try it out. We had a reservation and were seated immediately, next to a window overlooking Union Square (very nice!). We all ordered different burgers and different sides. I ordered the Kobe beef burger, and it was great! I won't go as far to say it is my favorite burger, but it was definitely good. The atmosphere was great for the reason we were there, and who doesn't mind the views overlooking the city? 

The sides were great as well, and we all enjoyed our meals! Service was also good, especially for a Friday night at prime dinner time. 

I would suggest coming here for a burger!
author: Shauna S.

description:
My father and I were just at this restaurant and requested a table for two. There appeared to be plenty of tables so we didn't think it was a problem, however the host told us to wait 20 minutes because the "kitchen is backed up." So we sat down to wait. 

Over the span of about ten minutes, several parties of two-three people went in and were given tables. Mind you, none of them had reservations either. So we asked the host if we could get a table as well, and he said no. Not sure what the rationale was in giving other people tables and not us, but that was really unprofessional. The only reason I could think of was the host was white and everyone he gave tables to were white as well, while we were Asian. He should have given all customers the option to sit at the bar and order a drink while waiting or something.
author: Eva C.

description:
I like this place. 
This was located on the 6th floor of the Macy's building at Union Square. The menu is almost mind blowing for someone looking for a gut busting variety of eats. They have a good selection of beer and great selection of mixed drinks/cocktails. They have a very tempting selection of alcoholic milk shakes and build your own non-alcoholic shakes as well. There's fried food galore to munch on. And of course there are burgers which sound fantastic if you don't mind loosening your pants belt a couple notches. I'll probably come back and try something else other than the fried trio sampler. 
Great job Burger Bar!
author: Steven H.

description: Delish. Not bad for a gourmet burger. I usually do not eat burgers but decided to give Burger Bar a try. My bf and I were able to grab a seat, late Sunday afternoon, without any wait. We shared a burger, classic w/ avocado and blue cheese w/ curly fries. The fries were awesome. Super tasty. Thank goodness we shared the burger because it was big! Juicy and dripping with goodness. Had to gobble it up fast to avoid eating a soggy bun. I do love the idea of making your own burgers. You can even add  boiled lobster to your order. Whuuu?Recommend for a treat while shopping downtown.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: If you want the Hottest Burger in the World, this is the place.  Wow the burger I had was the spiciest thing I ever fed my body and I recommend getting the sauce on the side, order a milkshake and hold on because the heat will make you cry.  Love and hate experience but glad I tried this place.  Great Service.
author: John C.

description: The Burger Bar venue is convenient when doing a lot of shopping at Macy's. It is a upscale burger joint owned by Chef Keller. It is a total burger experience. My favorite is the American Kobe Beef burger, cooked to perfection. Their fries and onion rings are excellent and pair well with any burger. You cannot leave without having dessert! The Nutella Burger is out of the world; a warm donut with nutella, cream, and strawberries. The presentation is indescribable...just order it and you will find out!
author: Marc U.

description:
I've been going through the reviews and remember, I write my reviews based on my experience with a particular restaurant or business. With that said, I speak for myself and some times for the people I eat with.

I was in the Burger Bar for the first time with a friend of mines and this place was...WOW. I went after the first of the year, so please forgive me, I forgot which burger I had. But I do remember that it was good. I had a shake and fries. Good stuff. I haven't been back since, due to my work schedule. But when I get some free time, I'll be back.

Five Trans Fats out of Five...
author: Blck R.

description:
Burger Bar is tucked away on the houseware floor at Macy's. I wouldn't have expected something to be in a Macy's that is an actual restaurant.

The place wasn't too busy on a Saturday afternoon; my friends and I had no problem getting a table, especially during a prime-time basketball game. Place did have a bar feel to it, just that I couldn't get over the fact the place was inside a Macy's.

Menu had a broad selection, including dessert burgers. Instead of being risky, I just decided on a simple medium-done American Classic burger with the skinny fries. Pretty good, considering that I'm trying to get over my "well-done" phase. 

The burger had enough juice that it wasn't dripping all over my plate, veggies were on the side, in case you did or didn't want them (and I try to get my veggies as much as I can), and the fries weren't soggy at all.

The price wasn't too bad either. Would like to come back here again to try a more daring burger and with different sides.
author: Tom T.

description:
Disappointing second visit this past Friday evening.  We ordered two burgers, waitress said the chef recommended medium so we ordered them that way.  They both came very well done and were really small pathetic little things.  The flavor was fine but they were definitely not juicy and relied on the melted cheese and other toppings.

I asked for no tomato.  It came out without a tomato but clearly there was one on it at some point before it came out as the lettuce was covered in tomato juice and tomato seeds so I couldn't have it.  Not sure why they wouldn't just replace the lettuce, that would have cost a few cents.  Waitress was no where to be found so I chose to eat the hamburger warm without lettuce instead of waiting.

Ordered two cocktails - was surprised they would send out drinks looking so sad.  One drink called for a pineapple garnish - the piece of pineapple had mold growing on it and yet was pale - so it was both unripe and growing mold (not sure how they even pulled that off).  The other drink was a martini and it was just mediocre.  I thought going to a restaurant called "Burger Bar" that has a martini in the logo - that a burger and a martini would be a safe bet, but they really did not deliver on it.

The most disappointing part is that the first time we went there the burgers were really good.  
It seems like no one there really cares - the waitress didn't bother to walk all the way up to our table to check on us so no corrections could be made.  At one point she just kind of called out from a few tables away.  Decor is not kept up - space needs a refresh.

When the bill came they did that thing where they calculate tip options at the bottom of the bill to save the customer from doing math.  They calculated from 20 - 25%.  It was optional of course but I just had to laugh - if you are going to assume 20% tip on the low end perhaps your waitresses should actually come to the table to check on people.

Great location and views if you get a table by the window.  They did give us a great table and the host was very welcoming and sweet so it wasn't a one star experience.
author: David B.

description: The Bison burger was different but pretty good! I went on a Friday night and the wait was pretty lengthy so plan accordingly.
author: Kamarena S.

description: Not the best at all we sat for a few before getting helped . Once we where helped we had ordered drinks and some starts. Well then we got a new sever and told them that we had place a drink and appetizer order. He looked lost and walked away. Then came back with mine and my friends drink and not my moms. And when it came to order he asked  what would you like to order we order our burgers then he says no appetizers but we had told him just a few minutes ago we had put two in. food was really good. Chicken was super good. But when it came to paying we sat there with the plates empty for 10 mins .I had to ask for the check from the Horst. Then To pay I had to get up and hand it to the bar tender. Because he never came back.They were not even busy at all
author: Cah G.

description: My Kobe was burned, my Blue Moon came with a lemon because they were out of oranges. The fries were great! The view was fantastic, so it was worth it!
author: Mary M.

description: I have been to the Burger Bar a looooong time ago, and recently came back again with my husband. We were doing some shopping in the city during the holidays and decided to have a late lunch there. During the holidays and on the weekends, this place is packed. Be prepared to wait. We, however, found two seats at the bar, and decided to just sit there, so we didn't need to wait. I assure you this was just plain, good luck. The bartenders/waiters serving the bar were really lacking. There was two of them, and they both looked like chickens with their heads cut off. They were going every which way trying to make the drinks for the tables and trying to serve the bar. It just wasn't good. It seemed like the manager came to try to help them at a certain point, but he didn't really look to know that much more than they did. So, it did take a while to get their attention and get our drink and food orders taken. Anyways, my hubby and I both ordered the build your own burgers. They came out fairly quickly, and were pretty tasty. I had the bison burger patty and it was very appetizing. Sometimes bison can be really dry at restaurants and this was not, which was a pleasant surprise. Not surprisingly, it took quite some time to get our bill paid, which I absolutely hate. A part of me just wants to walk out of a restaurant when the waiter/bartender is nowhere to be seen or doesn't seem to care to check back about the bill. Don't make me hound you to give you my money, that's annoying. So, to sum up, fairly decent food, crappy service. 3 stars.
author: Carina R.

description: Don't EVER go here unless you want to be sick to your stomach ! My wife and I both ordered the Kobe Beef Burger and it was super dry and over cooked. The waiter had such a bad attitude and took so long with our food - we didn't want to send it back. We also had an appetizer (calamari) and a shake sampler. Our bill was $91.00 but that's not the end of it. At midnight my wife had really bad diarrhea and the next day I was rushed to Urgent Care because I could not stop vomiting. That burger was the last thing I ate because just hours later I started to feel cramping in my stomach so badly. My MD ordered an Ecoli test today and I am waiting for the results. This is the worse I have ever felt after eating any where. Please don't eat here. Unless you wanna get sick !!!
author: Cks C.

description: Very good food, but the price was high!But if you wanna spend some money it's a very good place to spend it! The service was ok, a little slow.
author: Cathrine L.

description:
We were left down by the disappointing service here. At end of a long day of tourist-ing, we didn't want much. A burger, some chips and a beer. Everything started well, and the beautiful view of Union Square made it even better.

Ordering our food and drinks, we were asked for ID. While I had mine, my wife did not and we were curtly refused by our server. Fair enough, restaurants have laws they have to comply with. But it seemed overly officious, given that I've never heard of anyone going to the trouble ordering two full meals in order to illegally drink a single beer. A bit of common sense and manners would have resolved this quite easily.

Unfortunately this put a dampener on the whole meal.
author: Dave H.

description: I checked in with the hostess for a party of 5 and was sat immediately. I initially went to Cheesecake Factory but the wait was too long so we decided to try this place and I'm glad we did. Was greeted by our friendly server immediately and happily took our pictures. I was catching up with a cousin who I haven't seen in over a decade so it was a lot of catching up to do and our server never rushed us. Everything we ordered was delicious especially the desserts. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Candice J.

description:
First off, I'd like to state that the food was delicious so that's the only reason I won't give this place a 1 star review. However the service we received here was really poor. 

I came in with my girlfriend and my brother's family and we each ordered our own burgers (I personally ordered an angus burger with onions and mushrooms) while my brother ordered a turkey burger, my girlfriend ordered the sliders, my nephew had a kid's fish and chips and my sister-in-law ordered a ground beef burger. 

As I said, the food was great but our server was anything but. The only times he even bothered talking with us were when he took our orders and when he attempted to sell us desserts while dropping our bill. We asked for an extra roll-up at the beginning since we were short by 1 but he never came back with another so we had to ask the busboy instead. He also got my sister-in-law's order wrong and we had to try to flag him down because he still hadn't checked up on us yet (it had been around 5 minutes or so at this point). Then when we mentioned it, he just seemed annoyed at us. He came back and dropped off her side of mushrooms and left without saying anything . My girlfriend wanted to order a mojito at this time but she never got the chance to do so because he left so quickly and never came back. Our drinks were never refilled and we had to ask the other staff for refills. 

As a server myself, I try to give other servers a benefit of a doubt. I understand they are busy and have a lot on their pallet. But  the fact is he never checked up on us, never got us refills, didn't get us any rollups even when asked, and we couldn't get our drink orders in because he never bothered stopping by until he decided to drop our bill. All these things combined led to a really poor experience here. Honestly wish it was better but oh well.
author: Matt N.

description:
Came here on a whim and was pleasantly surprised. The Burger Bar is a high-end burger joint that caters to those who like options. The food is pricey, but you're in the middle of Union Square and the service is friendly. They have daily specials as well as a full menu of recommended burgers, but I went for the custom. There are six choices of buns, four types of hamburger, and many cheeses and sauces. For those that don't like beef, they have a turkey patty as well as a veggie patty. 

I vouched for the natural beef patty with ciabatta bun. I also had a soft drink and some yam fries. They all turned out well. The medium cook on the beef left it juicy but not bloody. All in all, a good lunch meal. Like many reviewers say, this place is over-priced, but if you're in a pinch, come here for a nicely done burger.

Pro Tip: The Kobe beef was not that much better than natural.
author: William H.

description: Waited for an hour to get seated on a busy Saturday holiday. Food took really long to get served, for a party of 2. If you want a burger and fries fix, go to In n Out.
author: Jorge K.

description: Had the burger dessert - doughnut with cream cheese. Very artistic plating. OK. Quite expensive. Nice and honest waiter.
author: Kitty D.

description:
The view from the 6th floor is beautiful and the personal TV in each booth is a nice touch. 

The Nutella milkshake is a must-have! 

But as far as the burgers go, they are pretty pricey! They tasted good but weren't impressive. I had the surf & turf - the lobster was just a bit overcooked and the asparagus was a little too salty. My husband thought his Kobe Beef burger was OK. You would think for the price you're paying, the food would be cooked to perfection. 

Halfway thru the Nutella shake, I scooped out a triangular piece of plastic. We reported it to our server. She then spoke with her manager who removed the  shake from the bill and replaced it at no charge. I like that they offered to do that without me having to ask. Other than that little mishap, I'd have to say the Nutella shake was probably the best thing there.

This is probably one of those places you can try once just to say you've tried it. Or at least go for a shake and enjoy the ambience.
author: Rose A.

description: Do not attempt to eat here later in the evening. I was here for a conference two years in a row and even though their hours say they're open until midnight on Saturday, both years (yes, years) they closed early because they were slow. The most recent time was a Saturday (6/18) when they decided to close at 10p.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Note: This is inside Macy's. Staff was nice, service was quick, food was really good! Decent selection of beers on tap. Fun spot to overlook Union Square.
author: Kelly B.

description:
This place was such a let down. It was our date night, so my bf and I drove an hour to get into the city to get a good burger with foie gras since we've heard so much about this place.

Pros: many different meat options, bun options, and in general very customizable.
Cons: pricey, dry burgers, overcooked/dry foie gras, tiny portions, slow service.

I think I'll save my money for Umami instead.
author: Nancy N.

description: This place is right in Union Square (actually inside Macy's at Union Square) and they have a great view of the area from the 6th floor. I got the supposed "World's Hottest Burger" and I must say, I've had hotter. They do give you a side of ghost pepper sauce though so be careful with that stuff cause I'm pretty sure it also would get acid off your car battery.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
My review is a bit overdue.  I had hoped to visit a second time, but I haven't found an opportunity to do so.  Yelp friend Simone F organized the outing, a UYE of sorts, which brought together about twenty of her friends and Yelp friends old and new.  I had to leave my job early to attend, but for good friends and good food I'd do it again.  Thanks again Simone for organizing!

The restaurant set up a super long table for us just beside the bar which made it easier for the beer drinkers to get their brew on.  I was anticipating a call to return to work so I decided to stay beer-free that night and just sipped on the glass of ice water that was provided shortly after I was seated.  I don't drink beer too often anyway, but I often do so in a social setting.

The name, Hubert Keller, does nothing for me.  Sorry Mr. Keller!  I work nights, I watch very little television and I rarely follow the culinary arts.  Simply put I had zero expectations for this restaurant knowing only that I had read many mediocre reviews judging this Keller dude and his new restaurant simply on expectations.

The menu is kind of busy and confusing.  Thank goodness I was sitting next to Fong L who had already been here before.  It helps to have someone to help navigate a confusing menu.  Basically one page had burgers all thought out by the kitchen and the opposite page gave you the chance to build your own burger item by item with a specific cost for each item.  I decided to take the easier route, but I was happy to learn that it was okay to add items to the "pre-designed" burgers.

After a bit of waiting for folks to arrive and get settled in the round of ordering began.  Other people at the table had already ordered milkshakes with the drink orders, and those darn things looked good.  After checking my pocket to make sure I had a supply of my trusty Lactaid Fast Act tablets I went ahead and ordered the alcoholic version of the mint chocolate chip milkshake.  My burger of choice was the American Classic (Black Angus beef, American cheese, bacon, tomato, onion on a seeded bun).  I ordered the beef cooked medium and had a fried egg added onto it.

I was too busy listening in on conversations when my big milkshake arrived, beautifully assembled with liquid already oozing down the side of the glass (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=RMY1PNJ8Evaz_V1tqSURaQ).  My photo doesn't capture its awesome beauty well enough.  I hope Fong and Simone got better pics of it.  The shake consisted of mint chip ice cream, hot fudge, mint liqueur, chocolate whipped cream, big chocolate chips and an Oreo cookie.  Oh my!!  This was so good!  The chocolate whipped cream was nice and fluffy yet light as ever with very good chocolate flavor.  The shake itself was thick too.  I can honestly say that I could not taste the liqueur but no doubt this was one of the most incredible milkshakes I've ever enjoyed.

The food service coming out from the kitchen was a bit spotty.  I was among the first at our table to get my burger, but others at our table waited a long time after our food arrived to get theirs.  The burger came with a side of Skinny Fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=Xe7cyB5ko5EmFbsQYj8ATg).  The fries were very generic, but I liked the burger very much.  I forgot to take a photo of the inside of the burger, but my beef was more of a medium rare than it was medium.  The beef had good flavor and it was fresh tasting so I really didn't mind the rareness of the burger.  The quality definitely shows; although, I wished they used a sturdier bun.  The fried egg was one of perfection cooked just below over medium with the yolk just beginning to cook yet having a nice liquid center to ooze out onto the beef.  The bacon was thick and flavorful.

They brought us complimentary desserts too in the form of their chocolate burgers and cream cheese burgers which looked fun.  I only sampled a bit of the chocolate one which had a thick chocolate ganache burger, a glazed donut bun and some exciting passion fruit flavored gelle that acted as the cheese.

When it came down to settling the bill the restaurant had everything already separated based on individual seat locations so determining who owed what was an absolute breeze.  I wish more restaurants would do that for large groups.  That alone helps me to boost my rating up to a 4.  

I'd like to return to try the Kobe beef and more outrageous ice cream concoctions, but until then I'm very happy to have attended this Burger Bar outing.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
One day early for Father's Day, we treated my dad to a dinner here at Union Square. However, negative things started happening from the top with the service: three of us ordered various complex shakes, whereas my dad just ordered something on tap. All of the shakes (presumably as if they were all of our drinks...?) arrived at once, as my dad's never came. It took poking another waiter 5-10 minutes later to remind them.

Then came the meals. I ordered the Hubert Keller Burger. Just before it was served to our booth table, the server literally dropped the bun to the ground. The rest "stayed afloat" and a new bun was replaced (are they "pre-crispy"...?), but that illustrates how all of our service was.

There was a Kobe beef burger on the menu for $60. I would not pay $60 for this kind of service anywhere. Flavors were fine, so the problem is not in the kitchen. Might just be a summer break thing, who knows... Expected much better for my dad.
author: Garett T.

description:
(See pics) Updated review. More of 3.5 stars. Good thing when you can see from the electronic board downstairs with "No waiting." Certainly helped especially when it was 30 minutes before closing and they're still serving.

The country natural burger was decent for its price of $10.50 comparing with other styles and the extra such as chopped jalapeno, aioli were quite a bit for each order so you really only need 1 order for 2 people. The fried egg, on the other hand,  was kinda small and flat that I almost forgot there was one.

Irish coffee was pretty good to warm up a windy evening. They also serve Irish Coffee milkshake, something to check out on the next visit.

On the evening we visited, they had the whole Macy's sign draping outside so no clear view to the Union Square.
author: T L.

description:
This is a review about the first experience I had at Burger Bar. (6/6/14)
Overall the experience was 3 stars, but I gave it 4 because:

1. After we were sat the waitress came by and dropped off water for our table. But we waited at least 15 minutes until she finally returned. I wouldn't say that we were provided horrible service because it wasn't; they probably were just understaffed even though it wasn't too busy for a Friday night. The service was good because every time she finally had time to check up on us the interaction was good, even if it was slow and not so attentive.

2. There was a group of horrible, ratchet ladies there for a bachelorette dinner. (Of all places, BURGER BAR??!) Anywho I think every one would agree that they ruined every one else's dining experience today. Screaming, yelling profanities, being ratchets and drunk (or maybe even sober and I would believe it.) For paying about $20-$60 per burger I would say this restaurant qualified as quite classy, however today the vibe wasn't very much so. One couple had their young children with them and everyone can tell they were particularly upset at how rude the women were being. They even covered their children's ears in response of all the profanity of the party.

3. The only factor that made this review a four star instead of three was that the manager on the floor tried to do his job right. Upon realizing that most of his customers were disturbed, he approached the bachelorette party and asked them to settle down. He then proceeded to go around every table in the restaurant and asked how they were doing, while apologizing for the table responsible for all the ruckus. In these types of situations not many managers would come out do what he did. For that I highly respect that and I think he made things better by doing so. But I hope he at least comped part of that family's dinner because the dad left bright red.

4. Most importantly (I guess) onto food. The burgers were very tasty. Melted brie and truffle mayo are highly recommended for building your burger. I don't personally believe in paying more than $15 for a quality burger but I guess you're paying for the view too. Would come back again for the food&view. Hopefully ambience is better next time.

As for the ratchets of the evening, well congrats bride-to-be. I hope you have a wonderful wedding. And may I suggest Applebee's or in-n-out to hold your "fancy" wedding dinner? I'm sure you and your friends will fit right in.
author: Vicky H.

description: Will def come back here to eat.  Great selection of burgers. I had the Turkey burger, it was delish.  Hubby had the Kobe Beef and he loved it.  Great view, totally awesome restaurant.  I wish one was closer to me!!
author: Mel B.

description:
Basically over rated.

Jam packed with a lot of tourists, which typically I don't mind but service greatly lacks because of this.

True story:

I once had the habenero fire/flame/scary death burger (don't know the exact name ) and I couldn't eat it because of how spicy it was. That is just no fun! Long story short, I ate it anyway and I really paid for it the next day. 

Plus they don't have the foie gras burger anymore so what's the point?
author: Alexandra C.

description: We stopped here to grab lunch after the Taiwanese Cultural Festival before haading up to Ghiradelli on the trolley.  Thankfully, there was not a wait and we were seated immediately (it was around 2 pm).  The burgers are solid and there is an option for everyone and you can customize the fries as well (ie.sweet potato, curly, skinny, cajun, etc.).  The Kobe burger was a hit, for sure.  If you sit at a booth, there are TVs that play ESPN, which is a nice perk.  Service was passable but overall, it's a good option if you don't want food court fare and don't have 3 hours to wait in line at the Cheesecake Factory.   The salads are TINY though!
author: Danan R.

description: This place is great! Rob,the bartender, is amazing. Had 3 Martinis and loved all of them. The fat fries were piping hot! The view of union square from the 6th floor is breath taking. Will definitely come back.
author: Dee B.

description:
I'm a bit surprised at such a low rating Burger Bar is getting! I came here last Saturday around dinner time. I think it deserves a better location than being at the opposite elevator as Cheesecake factory. I made a reservation for 2 people at 7:30p. We were seated at a table with bar stools looking right at Union Square. Great view, but not that great for someone afraid of heights. Looking down 6 floors while eating your burger? Thrilling.

I wanted to try foie gras on my burger but I wasn't ready to pay $60 yet. You can build your own burger for less expensive and possibly less flavorful. So it's your call. I built mine with kobe beef cooked medium rare, add-on foie gras, sprouts, swiss cheese on a sesame bun. FORGOT to add in sauce. I knew it was missing something when I took my first bite. My burger was definitely juicy enough, the taste of foie gras and burger blend in quite well. I must say, foie gras had an acquired taste. My piece wasn't as wide as my burger, so sometimes I couldn't have a bite full of everything I ordered in the burger. Very fresh ingredients, I must say. I should have chosen a better cheese, like monterey jack or pepperjack. I was afraid of the flavors of the cheese being too overwhelming and covered the tastes of the kobe beef and/or foie gras. It wasn't the best burger I've had, but one of the few good ones I've had in SF. Definitely coming back again and perhaps build a better burger to serve Burger Bar some justice.

They have a decent beer selection, tried the Union Jack IPA, went pretty well with my burger. the restaurant had two rooms, one with the bar tables and large TVs and the other room more romantic and quiet. Service was great, I liked my server a lot, very friendly and didn't forget about us just because we were at a corner seat.
author: Connie C.

description:
Had a Kobe peppercorn burger, was delicious.  Highly recommend the shakes.  I had a caramel vanilla shake, and I already want to go back for another shake.

My server, Daniel, was great.  He spoke french, which turned out to be a great thing as the group I rode up in the elevator with only spoke french.  I helped them get to the right floor with my limited high school french, and he served them.  They seemed to really enjoy their time too.
author: Blayne W.

description: The wait at Cheesecake nextdoor was 4 hours on Christmas Eve so we came here. It has a very clean polished interior and we were seated right away at a table next to the window wall with a breathtaking overhead view of Union Square during Christmas time (lights, giant tree, ice skating rink and all). We ordered the Bison burger, which was juicy and tender, and also the sliders. They were nice enough to let me sub fries with mozerella sticks. If you come here, definitely come for their signature beer floats and spiked milkshakes. We got the French Kiss spiked milkshake which was amazing in taste (like a gourmet chocolate cake) but had a low to non-existent alcohol content, so dont expect to get drunk off them unless maybe you ask your server or are a lightweight. If you are looking to have burgers, a variety of fries, salads, or alcohol, this is a great place to go to. Otherwise the menu options are pretty much limited to just that.
author: Marianne D.

description:
Located in the heart of San Francisco, you can find the Burger Bar inside the HUGE Macy's building, on the 5th floor. I came here for a Christmas party with my dental office few weeks back and were totally looking forward to it.

This place is cracking, so make sure that you make reservations. The guy who is in front is sort of harsh, so make sure you have a reservation of check in with him before he hunts you down.

We had a wonderful view right next to the window where we could see the city. The tables and chairs were set high like a bar setting, and we were seated and assisted promptly.

The menu offered a variety of specialty burgers, (even a vegetarian option), along with the most expensive burger on the menu, a kobe beef burger for 60.00. I ordered the "le frog" burger, a delicious burger with brie cheese, grilled mushrooms, and asparagus shavings, and it also came with a serving of fries. The burger was very good. The meat was juicy and the melted brie added the perfect punch. The only downfall was the incredible thick and doughy bun. Towards the end of the meal, i had to just remove the bun and eat the meat. One of my coworkers ordered an order of onion rings to share, and those were quite tasty as well. They were huge and had the perfect crunch to them.

Service was prompt and everyone was sweet. I'm not sure this is a place I would frequent, but I would most likely return because I want to take my hubby there. :) I'd have to say that it's slightly overpriced, ranging from 16-30 dollars (not including the 60.00 kobe beef burger). I can't say my burger was worth the 20 bucks, but it was pretty good.
author: Christine T.

description:
Pro's: great burgers! Fresh and definitely worth the price! I had my first salmon burger and it was really good! Goes well with the aoili sauce, mushrooms, avocado and sprouts in sourdough bun with a side of fries! Yummmm!

Cons: well, it's in union square which includes that health tax, parking fees, and of course if you come when it's busy- expect a long wait. I also wish the layout of the restaurant was bigger - def not good for large parties...most I would say is 8, 10 would be stretching it.
author: Jaylyn S.

description: After a few visits it's time for a review.  Food is consistent and ok to good.  Tonight's sliders were a bit over cooked.   Keep in mind it's Saturday and weeks before Christmas but service today was horrible.  Wait was not long. Might not be back...
author: Mark S.

description:
I didn't review BB? Are you kidding? Even after I got "The World's Hottest Burger?"

Yeah well... I'll start with what I liked:
1. The bacon. Yum
2. The fries. 

That is about it. Don't be an idiot and order TWHB. I had 3 bites and then had to beg for milk. Screw it. Not worth it.
author: Emily D.

description: My mom and I went here after a long day in the city! Yes it was pricey for a burger but totally worth it! My mother had the Kobe beef and was in love! I had the turkey burger and it was well seasoned and delicious. Yes the milkshakes are ten dollars but it was also the best milkshake I've ever had by far! This place is an amazing restaurant with an amazing view. We waited no time getting seated on a Saturday night. That is amazing. Service was a bit slow but not complaint worthy at all.
author: Tenaya M.

description: ExpenSive. Good food. I like the staff and manager. At least the waiters were nice when I was there. The hostess was a bit more nose up. Awhile ago I ordered plenty of things cause I liked several of the items off the menu, which I think is quite extensive / optional, including salmon burger and dessert. Ended up being 50 to 60 dollars, no drink or shake. The shakes or whatever are kinda literally (and taste) just ice cream thrown into the 'fancy glass' that you could literally get cheaper / just make yourself elsewhere at the store. I don't remember how the dessert tasted. The rest was QUITE doable. It always seems crowded. People love the location and enjoy the views. I wouldn't go here often. Not my price and type of crowd. Doesn't seem as laid back as another place might be.
author: M R.

description: Saulu our waiter was just "out of this world" GREAT! I always love the food there but he made it extra special for us celebrating someone's leaving the company.
author: Naomi H.

description: Our server Sylvia was fantastic we love the burger bar for the atmosphere food and service Sylvia reinforces our belief!
author: Joanie B.

description: Way overpriced but a great view and no wait if you get there right when they open. A couple of good vegetarian options for burgers . A very nice very of the Christmas Tree at Union Square. The service good. The food - mostly a B- to a B. While I am way open to a nice 5 start Yelp place for a meal/ the kids were starving and this was close by.
author: stacie s.

description:
We arrived and the place wasn't all that busy. We got a table and then waited ... And waited .... And waited.  He ordered drinks and waited.... And waited ....... And then waited.  Lunch arrived which was very good.  Came time to pay.  Yep we waited.  Then the waiter brought us  some type of a chocolate Mac chip milkshake with the check.  

Indulging and going.  The derive was not so hot the milk shake gave him another star.
author: Chuck J.

description:
Being a fan of Fleur de Lys, I was majorly pumped up to try Burger Bar when I first heard it was coming to SF.  First time I went I struck out and was told they weren't opening for a month.  Finally had the chance to dine here for dinner.

Absolutely no wait.  Was provided a really great table overlooking Union Square.  Being a sucker for sweets, couldn't resist starting the night out with a Chocolate Nutella milkshake.  This was good...but not 9 bucks good.  Especially disappointing was the fact that there was way too much whipped cream and too little actual milkshake.  I felt I was left with nothing but a mountain of whipped cream after taking less than 10 sips.

Burgers however were redeeming.  Country Natural Burger (paired with guacamole, cheddar & sprouts) and Peppercorn Burger were perfectly cooked.  They were well-portioned and the beef was juicy & tasty.

Overall, I'd rate this place 3.5 STARS...we had a nice overall dining experience but not quite what I envisioned for a spot bearing the Hubert Keller signature.
author: Justin L.

description:
I really enjoyed this place!

My friends and I were seated almost right away, however I think that the wait time is usually longer. It was in a convenient location since we were at Union Square. Our view was amazing since it was during Christmas time. They have little TV's which was great since the guys wanted to watch the foot ball game.

The food was delicious. I had Fish and Chips which was so crispy and soft. I was obsessed over the garlic french fries! They're thinly cut, crunchy, and is packed with lots of delicious flavor. I also had the Pyramid  Hefeweizen beer which was light and tasted great with my Fish and Chips. The burger my friends got looked delicious as well. Piled high, thick meat, and my friends loved it.

I would definitely come back!
author: Angel N.

description:
Was looking forward to this place since we had made the decision to go there and ended up a tad disappointed. 

I understand it's in Union Square and is going to be pricey in the first place but if the food is high quality I don't mind paying. Unfortunately that wasn't the case. I decided to go out on a limb and try the buffalo burger. While it wasn't gamy at all it was definitely on the dry side. For $17 my burger shouldn't be dry. Not sure if that's how buffalo meat is naturally but could've been more juicy. My girlfriend ordered a Kobe beef burger and it seemed dry to me also. I had 2 beers. First one was a Pyramid Hefeweizen which wasn't cold at all (sorry but I like my beer ice cold) Second was a Lagunitas IPA which was extremely cold so they made up for with that one. The best thing I ordered were the Jalapeno Pickles. I coulda at 5 pounds of those things.

Service was uneven. At first I was definitely put off by our server. She seemed very condescending but later on in the meal she actually came by and made some recommendations and conversed a few times and here entire demeanor seemed to have changed so I'll give her the benefit of the doubt.

Overall the quality did not meet the price they are asking. My burger was OK but not great and for $17 I expect it to be very good at the least. The bar area seemed nice and I would probably stop by for a beer and a bite if I was in the area but definitely would not make it a point to come here specifically.
author: jeff c.

description:
amazing burgers. Just enough to satisfy. A little pricey, but worth every penny! We tried the "world's hottest burger" which they make you sign a waiver before ordering. It is definitely hot, but again,delicious in a very masochist way. 

the sliders are excellent-- a good choice if you are indecisive. go for the fat fries as your side. 

le frog burger- tastes as good as it sounds.

if you can't decide, try building your own burger. we made one with the angus beef patty and it was juicy and well-cooked. 

if you want to splurge get an alcoholic frozen drink. they're amazing! i forgot the one i ordered but it was some vanilla, chocolate and offee liquor. YUM
author: Lilee N.

description: This place was a major let down. Totally dry, bland burgers at outrageous prices. My sliders were so bad I told the server to take them back. What a disappointment :/. Never coming back here again; There are tons of other amazing burger places in SF I wish I went to instead.
author: Hasti J.

description: If I could leave negative stars, I would. The signature drinks are disgusting, the burgers were less than desirable and the service was nonexistent. I could continue, but what's the point!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I only went to Burger Bar once, and I was really disappointed. 

First of all, the burgers are extremely overpriced. And there's nothing too special about them. Tasted just like the burgers I make at home. Just greasier. The fries were pretty good, but nothing amazing. 

I think the service was seriously the worst part of my Burger Bar experience. I don't know if our server has having a bad day, or if it's just their policy to be rude to their customers, but she was horrible. For example: 

My family really likes to have their burgers cooked rare, including myself. When I ordered mine rare, the server advised against it, so I figured that since she worked there she probably knew what she was talking about. My sister also ordered hers rare, and the lady explained to her that it wouldn't be as good. However, my sister was set on getting a rare burger. No big deal, right? Wrong. The lady got really pissy, like she was offended that my sister didn't take her advice. 

When our food came, a lot of the orders were missing some of the items that required an additional charge. For example, they charge extra for certain sides or ingredients (truffle oil mustard, bacon, etc.) The server did give attitude for us asking for our items THAT WE PAID AN ADDITIONAL CHARGE FOR. Also, some of the burgers were cooked all wrong. My sister, who ordered rare, got medium rare. It was pretty obvious because it looked just like mine. My cousin, who ordered well done, ended up getting an extremely rare burger. He ordered one of the simplest items on the menu: a cheeseburger. Yet somehow, they managed to screw that up. 

We had a group of nine, so gratuity was automatically added. Even though the service was shitty, we're not monsters so we didn't complain about having the tip be automatically added to the bill. We asked a question about the bill--which literally had nothing to do with whether or not she would get her tip--and she snapped about how there's nothing she could do about it being automatically added. She also rolled her eyes, and told my uncle they couldn't take his card (which they eventually did and it went through with no problems.) 

Overall, I probably won't be returning to this place. I wouldn't really recommend it either. But hey, if you're willing to blow extra cash on mediocre food and terrible service, then this is definitely the place for you.
author: Tiffanyy M.

description:
Don't eat here.  I know it seems convenient. The name even sounds kind of cool. But the food is terrible,  greasy,  and gave us food poisoning.  We are currently throwing up. Others on here have reported the same thing. It had been speculated that they pre deep fry everything as the fries aren't served hot.  

The burgers are pretty bad. Very dry, tasteless, overcooked with odd looking lettuce. This chef should really be ashamed of the food they put out. 

We think the oil is likely not changed enough and the kitchen may be due for a health inspection. The martini tastes watered down, thankfully they didn't screw up the beer. 

Go to Super Duper. Or the hot dog stand outside. The walk is worth saving yourself from being sick. Oh, and it costs $7 for an Anchor Steam. 

This place inspired us to write our first Yelp review. That bad.
author: Brown Y.

description:
This review might not totally be accurate because I only eat one thing here. It is the Kobe beef burger with foie gras. This burger combination is expensive though at 30 bucks. They have a 60 dollar burger with truffles but I haven't tried it. I used to eat this every time I went to Vegas but can have it locally now. Best burger ever but you have to like the "fat"!

7/28/10 Update: I only eat burgers here and have never tried anything else. My update is purely on kobe beef burger with foie gras.
author: Minh H.

description:
Came here on a Friday afternoon to grab some lunch with a friend.  The place wasn't quite busy so we were seated right when we walked in. 

Service: Checked up on us and kept our drinks refilled.  No complaints there. 

Food: My friend's veggie burger (according to her) was very good.  I had the "Le Frog" burger that had shaved asparagus, mushrooms, and melted brie.  It was a juicy burger but didn't quite wow'd me.  I needed a little more flavor.  For an almost $20 burger, I wanted something that wow'd me.  

Overall: I mean, I feel like it's the "Cheesecake Factory" for burgers.  It's nothing extraordinary, but it does it's job and you can sure find something you can enjoy, even for a vegetarian like my friend.  Great view of Union Square and the bar had a few small flat screens with games on.  It's a little pricey, but we are in the heart of downtown.
author: Meshell C.

description:
The views are great here. I've come here a few times mainly for the views. The burgers are pretty good. The last time I came here was for drinks and the service was really poor. 
Our server didn't really know his liquors of alcohols so couldn't really help us choose drinks. Then, when we paid the bill, they printed the wrong receipt of which upon addressing the issue was handled poorly. 
The manager came and accidentally broke a glass on our table and didn't even apologize for this. 
She did however take off the cost of a drink from our bill because of the mishap. 
It's unfortunate because it's got such a good view over union square!
author: Van-Anh N.

description: Had the Kobe burger.  Great taste, but I had to eat the second half of my burger with a knife and fork, because the bottom half of the bun was too soggy for me to pick it up.  Can't be a reputable burger place serving "soggy" buns.  Good atmosphere, plus a had a nice view.  That bun though!
author: Wendell K.

description:
I was shopping in Union Square and was in the mood for a good burger, so I decided to give this a try as I've been to a Hubert Keller restaurant before (Fleur de Lys in Vegas) and really enjoyed it. I went at 2pm on a Sat so the restaurant was only about half full. 

I was seated immediately after approaching the podium, and service continued to be as
timely throughout the meal. My burger came out in 5 minutes! I ordered a Country Natural burger with Provolone, Proscuitto, and Red Wine and Shallot reduction on a Ciabatta. Not the absolute best burger I've ever eaten, but very good. 

Had an order of skinny fries which were also good. The portion size wasn't huge, but it was more than enough to fill me up, as I had to pass on getting a milkshake (they had several very tempting sounding shakes on their menu) to close my meal as I wasn't about to pay $9 on a shake I'd be too full to finish half of. 

Menu had an impressive offering of topping options and non-Burger options and a great beer list. Ambience was very relaxed and casual, and the space had great floor to ceiling windows showing off a view of Union Square. Service was polite and on top of things, though not as warm as it could have been.
author: Chris A.

description:
All in all the burgers are only okay, especially given that they're much pricier than normal, but I'm giving them 4 stars because the chef was nice enough to let my friends and I order food even though it was already past dinner hour and they technically were only serving drinks at that time. 

I'd definitely recommend trying the Nutella Burger for dessert though. Something new to experience!
author: Iris H.

description:
I love this place.  While it's location near Macy's and the Cheesecake Factory make it appear as if it's another 'mass production' establishment, I find it to be anything but.  

Don't just stuff your face with one of these burgers, take little bites and enjoy!  You can really taste the difference between this quality meat and cheap ground beef.  I'm notorious for eating quickly, and last time I was there I prolonged my burger consumption to a personal record of about 20 minutes.  My only wish is that they would offer a larger version of their burgers for gluttons like myself.  My personal favorite?  The Peppercorn Burger with sweet potato fries.

Plus, who couldn't love a place with alcoholic milkshakes and beautiful views of Union Square?  Nicely done, Hubert Keller.

Update:  I went back for the Peppercorn Burger and it was delicious as always. I noticed the World's Hottest Burger on the menu so I had to go back and try it the very next day.  It was great--not the world's hottest for sure, but really flavorful and lots of good heat.  Despite these yummy eats, I have to pull back a star from 5 to 4.  The burgers are still a bit small for my taste, and I was really annoyed by a 30 cent charge for a one ounce side of ranch.  How stupid is this when I ordered a $20 hamburger with sweet potato fries (which, by any standards, should rightfully be served with ranch to begin with)?  Hubert, make me a bigger burger or stop with the silly charges and you can have your star back.
author: Alex H.

description:
We just had a drink here and were seated at the bar. Sadly there was a huge commercial in front of our window so we couldn't enjoy the view. 

Bloody Mary was good and pita chips with hummus too. Menu is totally American cuisine. Everything you shouldn't eat! No gluten free options and sports on every TV. 

Next time when I'm shopping in Union square I'll go to Cheesecake. Better options.
author: Jana A.

description:
$12 burger - ordered medium rare - served medium well 
Stale bun
The fried sides (onion rings, fries, etc) were above average 
Bottom line - you can get better for less - I would rather go to In and Out
author: Adam S.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday October 16, 2009 @ 7pm Opening Day w/ Wait Time of 1.5 Hours & Open Until 2AM Weekends
Location:  6th Floor of Macy's- Elevator Opposite The Cheesecake Factory
Company:  Mommy & Michael
Crowd:  RockStar Chef/DJ Hubert Keller Hosting a Party in The Private Dining Room & Mix of Tourists, Nike Women's Marathon Participants, Oracle Guys & Locals in Hudson Jeans 
Vibe:  Energetic
Music:  Hubert Keller Mixes of The Bangles & Techno
Decor:  De Rigeur Burger Bar-  Tables w/ or w/out Views & Wooden Booths w/ Flat Screens
Service:  Attractive Hostesses & Very Friendly, Competent Servers
Imbibe:  Twinkie Float. Also Available w/ Alcohol; Milkshakes & Floats 
Devour:  Hubert Keller Burger, Surf & Turf w/ Lobster, Vegas Vegan Burger
Total:  $75.26
author: Genevieve Y.

description: The burger bar is bomb. Chef Hubert Keller has taken burgers to the next level. I had the buffalo burger it was amazing. Perfection on a bun. They also have a great bar area that makes waiting easy. The restaurant is on the 6 floor of Macy's ... I know Macy's but it works. Be prepared to wait a little bit but it's worth it.
author: Jessica V.

description:
The salmon burger was delicious and thick cut. 

The only downside to this place is the price for all the additions such as cheese, asparagus, and grilled onions. However the food is good and the drink and tap selection is pretty big.

Next time will try a creative dessert. Its a splurge but worth it.
author: Victoria B.

description:
This review is just for the Milkshakes....
Came here today to get some milkshakes to go. The hostess directed us to place our order from the bar and once the bartender had a brief moment he took our order. This place was pretty busy for a Saturday afternoon, we waited for about 15 minutes and our shakes finally came out. Mr Keller was also standing near us briefly while talking with management. 
I ordered a vanilla shake and added oreos and chocolate chips. The price for the shake was a bit steep ($7.95) and the size was a 16oz but the shake was actually pretty good. Had a hard time slurping up the toppings but good flavor overall. 
Wouldn't mind returning again to try the food here
author: Miss H K.

description:
The view from the bar is amazing! We walked in late on a Saturday night and were seating at the window in the bar area. The seating is tight and the noise level is high but the view and milkshakes compensate. 

For starters we each got a shake: Black & White and the Nutella. OMG go with Nutella! I loved it and would go back for this alone. 

For dinner I went with a build ur own Kobe Burger with Cheddar, Button Mushrooms, and Avocado with fat fries which was yummy until I tried my Man's Hubert Keller Burger with skinny fries which was amazing. Definitely what I will order next time. As far as the fat v. skinny fries well neither out performed the other so I have no complaints. 

Overall the place offers a pricey but good experience. 

Now about the place. Deco was super sub par. Nothing other than the view made the place look good. Now lets discuss bathrooms. Yup, bathrooms. I am a fan of staying healthy so I wash my hands before every meal. When I got to the bathroom I realized the ladies had one single use stall which was occupied for what seemed like forever. What is this Starbucks?!? When I saw a staff person I asked if there was another ladies room and they pointed me to a door that was covered by a large plant on the opposite wall. Annoyed. - 1 star for all that!
author: Caro S.

description: So it was my first time in burger bar a few weeks ago and we ordered chicken wings which were RAW and cold in the centre - we returned them after my sister had eaten some of the wing quite honestly this scares me and makes me question the safety of the food
author: Elaine L.

description:
Burger Bar is what it is - a place for tourists to eat while in Union Square so naturally the food reflects it. I built my own burger and it was good but not $22 good, I've had better for cheaper.BUT I must say the server I had was amazing, His name was Jake and he had was prompt, attentive, kind and very informative which made dining at this over crowded establishment really great.

 I'd probably give this place only 2 stars as I think it is over priced but due to my experience with Jake and their delicious black truffle sauce (its so deliciously addicting) the place gets and extra star.
author: Paige M.

description:
We had heard about this place and the famous Chef so we thought we'd give it a try. We were there the weekend after Christmas and found the seating time to be adequate. We requested a nice window so we could sit and enjoy the view of Union Square and told the lady we'd wait for the right seat, when we were seated, there was like a 5 foot tall christmas wreath in our window, at this point I could see where this was going.  

The waitress came to take our order, we started with water and a beer, no appetizers. We had seen the sizes of the burgers coming out to the other guests so we decided to share our meal, the burger arrived and it was dry like shoe leather, the bun was hard and the fries were cold and stale. I had initially asked for mayo and some bbq sauce on the side, this never arrived. I had to ask the waitress again for the squce and mayo, she tried to make it a point that the server should've brought it out....at this point, I really don't care who was supposed to bring it out, just bring it.  I had to constantly ask for a refill on my water and beer which again, finding my waitress was painful.

We were shocked when our bill arrived....she charged us $2 to split our burger!  Who does that?  Secondly, we weren't notified of that...I would've cut that damn burger with a chain saw on my own...what a rip off.

Needless to say, she received no tip...actually she did...tip was "next time, notify the customer of a $2 split burger fee, don't serve up cold fries, and make sure they're water glasses and beer glasses are full."  this is no lie, I wrote that on the bill!
author: Tony C.

description: My husband got a regular burger and said it was great. I got the veggie burger and can say I've had better... however i also had the red velvet alcoholic milkshake and it was delicious!
author: Katye W.

description: Service was very slow and understaffed!! Burger was burnt and fries were kind of cold. Beautiful view and atmosphere just not the best food. Quantities were pretty great!
author: Gabrielle E.

description:
I went here today to meet a friend for lunch. I had never heard of the place so I looked it up right away. I was excited by the idea of it. With a place like this I wouldn't expect it to be inside of a Macy's. When I first got there, mind you it took me a little while to locate, I went to the elevator and thought "is this even working?" The light on the elevator button barley lit up. When I walked into the restaurant I wasn't even greeted by anyone, which struck me as odd. I saw my friend right away and sat down. We were right at the window which would have been lovely if there wasn't a banner that was semi transparent blocking the view. During the entire lunch it was hard to hear my friend because it was loud in the place. I can't remember if this was due to all the people or due to the TV or music. 

Our waitress was nice and came over quickly. Almost a little to quickly because I hadn't had a chance to look at the menu. Having looked at the menu briefly online before I arrived here I knew I was going to get the cheaper of the burgers which was the Turkey Burger on a sesame bun with sprouts and pepper Jack cheese with the Fat Fires. That alone came to $16 (rounding up a little bit). It was good but didn't taste any different than a burger I would make at home. The fires were very good and there were more than I expected. Looking at other thing on their menu I would say it is over priced. 

Our waitress was nice but mediocre. She came over once after we got our food and then for the bill. My friend and I split the bill, apparently that was too much for our waitress to handle. I told her what needed to be on each card, however she had to come back to figure it out and then charged it all on my card in the end.

Over all it was nice but I wouldn't go back there. I can get a better burger at the diner down the street from my school.
author: Tahanee B.

description: Even though the wait was long which anywhere at this point would be about the same since it is located in Macy's and around all the shopping of course. While my boyfriend and I were waiting for a table we got a couple beers and we started talking with the host her name is Bobbi and she was so helpful and friendly! It made the wait not seem so long at all and don't get me started on those hot wings! Delicious and the food was just great! I also got another drink I forgot the name but it tastes just like a flinstones ice cream push pop! Anyway I really enjoyed myself we had an amazing view of the Christmas tree and skate rink definitely coming back when I'm in the area again
author: Jazzmin A.

description:
My boyfriend had been here on a prior trip to the city, but hadn't tried the burgers (it was in his vegetarian days), but he remembered the view was decent so he suggested Burger Bar for dinner. I love burgers so I agreed to go. I went in with high hopes, but the overall experience let me down....

We came in around 9pm on Saturday night and were seated right away. We had a good seat with a decent view of Union Square. The view was great and I loved the vibe of the restaurant -- very casual and fun. This is what saves the restaurant in my opinion. 

The food idea is a cool idea. You get to build your own burger in a way by picking your own bun type and fillings. I like this a lot. But, my liking of the burgers ended there. When my food came out, the burger was just mediocre. For the $16+ price tag and by being able to pick what I wanted on the burger, I was expecting excellence and it just wasn't met. Boo to the burgers! My boyfriend also said that his burger didn't meet expectations either and he didn't finish his. As for drinks, the boy got a build your own milkshake (which he loved) and I ordered a beer. The beer I originally wanted, they were out of (which was a bummer), but the waiter suggested another kind, which was really good. Beer = good times!

Service here was lacking. The server never checked up on us once during the 45 minutes we were there and he was just slow in general. No good in my book. 

Overall, this is a cool place to hit up for the view and vibe, but that's about it. If you want a great burger, I'd go elsewhere in the city. 

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: Disgusting. I cannot believe they tout his place as a "gourmet" burger place when they don't even have some decent buns. Partner fell for the Kobe, truffle, and foie gras burger it was terrible aka Rossini Burger. Why is Hubert Keller still trying to make his name work as a chef? Could it be because it confuses people to think its Thomas Keller? ... One of the best in the world. Burger Bar is disgusting and skip it unless you want stadium quality burgers at a gourmet price.
author: Le O.

description: Excellent burgers.. Try the Hangover burger which has hangover sauce similar to thousand and lettuce with a angus beef as it's patty.. And come with far fries can't go wrong for $13.95.. And this bar is up on the 6th floor of the Macy's for woman and home. The wait though Is a bit to long .. Been at the table for 15min until someone came by.. They need to work on that
author: John G.

description: Great burgers and great service.  Their buffalo burger patty is exceptional and the views are nice as well.  Had to dock a couple of stars solely due to pricing.  I got the buffalo burger with just a small handful of fixings, and one beer, and my total with tip and tax came to 42.
author: Kunal K.

description: Customer for years. Decent food at decent prices, hard to find in downtown SF. Then they raised their prices by about 50%. Veggie burger at $18? I think not. Horrible value.
author: Presto G.

description:
This location is a top the Macy's building in Union Square.  If you've been to the Burger Bar in Vegas this place is pretty much the same.   There are "premium" burgers that you can order either preset or you can build your own.  You can order items such as kobe patties, lobster tail, foie grais (or at least you can in the vegas location) specialty cheeses and bacons etc.   You can order up a 30 dollar + burger if you wanted.  

The burgers are good but realistically not much better then a Fuddruckers or Red Robin...especially if you look at the price difference.   I'd be more inclined to order a crazy lobster, foie gras fried egg burger (and i did) at the Vegas location.  But a tofu vegan burger seems more appropriate for the SF location :P

Bottom line,  for a good view of Union Square and a decent burger at a higher then average price (and a decent beer selection) this place fits the bill
author: Ben Y.

description: We went here knowing there would be a wait and put our name on the waiting list. We were informed the wait was 25-30 mins. During our wait we witnessed them seat multiple parties who had just walked up with the same party size and also provided a window seat. When we questioned the hostess they admitted the other parties had not waited. Totally useless staff. We left and went went elsewhere for better food and a more efficient restaurant. Don't waste your time here, it's not that good
author: Jennifer C.

description: Do not order the Burger Bar Sliders, unless you like  dry hamburgers (not juicy) and hard like hockey pucks.   The rest of our group were happy with their Angus Beef hamburgers.
author: Al L.

description:
We have been here twice now, and today we brought a couple with us visiting from Seattle.

We were not disappointed either time.  For starters, it is conveniently located in Macy's and is great alternative to the restaurant up stairs that is an easy 35 minute (usually longer) wait.  

The menu here offers some really cool creations with burgers.  I have tried the kobe beef and the turkey burger on my visits.  They offer healthy alternatives on the menu as well, including gluten free buns.

The menu also offers some cool looking milkshakes, some with alcohol (although i have yet to try them).

Service, from hostess to server, was excellent....friendly and good follow up.

My only complaint is that the fries could be better.  The curly fries for example were not much better than a fast food restaurants.  That aside....everyone at our table tonight was very happy with their meals.
author: John K.

description:
We were able to snag seats at the bar within 5 minutes of arriving which I was grateful for. Decent craft beer session at a reasonable price. Burgers seemed to be a better buy if you build them yourself. I had the grass fed patty with blue cheese, bacon, grilled onions, and extra truffle aioli. Delicious! We also enjoyed the fried pickles which were dill spears with jalapeno beer batter and is a HUGE amount. We even shared with the family beside us at the bar we had so many. 

All in all not bad, but nothing worth going out of my way for. 

#BeAwesome ~ chase
author: Chase S.

description: We went there on 12/28/2016. It was very crowded and we had to wait for an hour for a party of 5.  My daughter was the only one who ordered a Kobe Burger done medium rare. She subsequently got food poisoning from this. I called the restaurant the next day (12/29) to discuss what may have happened. They didn't even bother to suggest a refund. Considering that the burgers here are expensive, I found this reaction inappropriate and not deserving of my future business. My daughter and I have eaten here before. I can't recommend going here if this restaurant won't take care of their customers. I am disappointed in their lack of concern with what was a serious health situation.
author: Nina S.

description:
I took a good friend  there for his birthday, the maitr'd informed the waiter that l wanted a desert with a candle in it after finishing our entree's.  The waiter brought the check....no desert with candle.   Idiot!!!!

The burgers and liquor infused milkshakes were a hit though, just awful service
author: tony n.

description:
Drinks took way too long to get to our table, even folks at our table who ordered beers had to wait 10 mins plus.  You'd think they'd want the drinks flowing since those tend to have the most markup.

Veggie burger was messy, and tasted gross.

Buffalo burger was excellent, and the manhattan I ordered was also good.

Overall decent place, but with all this union square only a minimal effort is given, since foot traffic is guaranteed.
author: Jon H.

description: Really yummy! The fries were delish if you like skinny fries  I ordered the blue cheese buffalo burger and it was perfect. Our waiter was fast and very observant with our 2 kids. ( very appreciated ) of course we'll be back
author: Yvonne A.

description:
Foie gras ban countdown!  Where can I get a burger with foie?  Keller's Burger Bar!  I called in advance for reservations and specifically asked the person who took my reservation if they are still serving foie and I was told yes.  The whole week I dreamed of foie and I planned a foie party.  I arrived at Burger Bar and had a drink at the bar while I waited for my friends.  I ordered a grey goose cosmo, but I have had better for $12/glass.

I give them a star or two for service.  The booth we sat down at had a personal tv and we requested that they change the channel.  Someone came by and changed the channel to the Giants game, without us asking...  I wonder how they knew we were Giants fans???

I attempted to order a foie burger and they told me they were out.  I mentioned that I called in advance.  The waitress checked, but FOIE FAIL!  Ok...  time to reboot...  what do I order?  I started out with the Raspberry Velvet.  I love the Lambic Framboise and buy it all the time at BevMo.  Add that with ice cream, YUM.  Burgers are a la carte and you pay for additional toppings and sauces.  I had the angus burger, which was ok, but would've been better with foie.  I ordered sweet potato, but they are nothing compared to Gott's.
