The strangest thing about Burger Bar is that there is only one stall in the bathroom even though it's in a pretty big space.  I hate restaurants that do this.  How do you expect to sell drinks?  I would cut myself off just so I don't have to wait in line for the bathroom.  :P  

Next time I'm in the area, I'm going to skip Burger Bar and consider going to Cheesecake Factory.  They might not have foie, but at least I'm getting more for my money.
author: Chrissy M.

description:
It's a shame that this restaurant holds such a fantastic view of Union Square Park and yet the food leaves much to be desired. SF is an awesome foodie city, and there's so many better burger joints than this place. 

PROS:
- great view of Union Square
- convenient place to grab a bite if you want a break from shopping
- prices are reasonable for what you get

CONS:
- food isn't fresh. I ordered the angus "All American" burger and asked for it to be cooked medium. My burger showed up appearing way pinker than it should be (apologies, I didn't capture a photo); I ended up eating only half of it. Also, the fries taste like the frozen Ore-Ida ones you buy from the supermarket. 
- service: the people there look incredibly bored and it shows in their service. I brought my parents here to show them the great view from this restaurant and unfortunately, our waitress wasn't patient in dealing with my parents' questions. 

If you're in Union Square and want to try an amazing burger, I suggest walking down Market Street and checking out Super Duper Burger instead.
author: Helen W.

description:
A burger in San Francisco seemed like a must and the fact that this place was associated with Hubert Keller and across the street from my hotel helped my choice.   

If you come in with the expectation that this burger will change your lift, you will likely rank it a three.  If you come in with modest expectations it might be a four.  

I came in with the latter.  I enjoyed the burger, loved the fat fries and got to say I tried the famous Fleur de Lys peppercorn sauce.  

All in all, it was a decent but expensive burger.  You get what you pay for is in the eye of the beholder....
author: Shawn P.

description:
Unimpressed overall. The sliders I ordered were very thin and dry. Our waitress Ashley was unnecessarily huffy and grumpy about my asking for separate bills.
On the plus side, the other burgers we ordered we really delicious and juicy.
author: Cristian A.

description:
Expensive but tasty and reliable with a good selection of beers.

Tourist central though so be aware that it can get busyl
author: Christopher M.

description:
still think this is the best burger in San Francisco!!! Service was fast and courteous and food was delicious like always. I had a build your
own milkshake which was probably the best milkshake I've ever had. I also split the Kobe burger and fat fries with my hubs and it was delicious!
Don't miss out on Burger Bar you'll regret it!.
author: Ray W.

description:
I had the Kobe with pepper jack and a fried egg medium rare, which was really good and cooked perfectly, kinda pricey for what I got. My gf had the buffalo with blue-cheese and pesto on the side, and it was KILLER!  Pricey but worth every dollar!  Good curly fries, plenty for 2 to split, and we split a vanilla milkshake that was very nice.  Cant F up vanilla, but it was kinda vanilla...  Ha

There were little tv's at the tables which were cool, but you had to get someone to change the channel for you.

Ryan was our waiter and we asked the manager over to tell him how much we enjoyed his attention and suggestions.  He was 5 star!

Overall 4 star, but Ryan and the taste of the buff burger were definitely 5 star.
author: Brad G.

description:
Don't waste your time with such horrendous service!

Some of the worst service I'd had the displeasure to deal with. Our table we had reserved before hand, had NO napkins or utensils. I asked  3 separate employees all of whom brushed me off. And when they did arrive about half hour into the meal, rather than apologize they were tossed at the end of the table.Not only did they fail on properly tending to us, they send out a burger that looked like charcoal and tasted just as bad. The manager, didn't even have the decency to say "thank you" when he took our check! We're local San Franciscans and have visited the restaurant a number of occasions but after this experience neither me nor the rest of my family will EVER go back.
author: muftia k.

description: I spent over $100 on dinner for me, my wife and 5 and 6 year olds, only to immediately return to hotel room with sick poops...don't do it. Go to loris diner..
author: Rich S.

description:
Solid, but not sure the burgers are worth the price. Hearty portions and you will leave FULL with just a burger and the accompanying side. Zuchinni fries were definitely a hit and preferred over the onion rings or sweet potato fries (more unique while the others were more typical).

Going to be booking this for my rehearsal dinner (since it's conveniently located in Union Sq near my venue and has one of the cheaper minimums around town). Def an opportunity to bump to 4 stars!!
author: Erica L.

description:
Unfortunately based on my experience eating here I'm only giving it two stars. I understand the restaurant was busy, when we first arrived and put our name down to be seated, that total wait time was about 45 minutes. When we were finally seated, we waited and waited... I counted about 10-20 servers passing us completely ignoring us or oblivious to them. We waited longer than when were waiting to be seated. So after waiting patiently for an hour we had to signal a server ourselves to ask to be helped. When we finished eating no one helped us again to receive our change for the check. So my boyfriend and I got completely fed up with the service and waiting and just left without leaving a tip. No customer should feel like they're being neglected and have to wait so long and have to signal a server themselves. If I could have a separate rating for the service it would be negative 5. Most terrible service I've ever encountered.

Now for the food, it's a bit pricey but very well made and delicious. Kobe burgers are a must try. The milkshakes were very good as well. The food is the only reason this still has a rating besides 0. 

I would come back here for the food but I won't just because I don't ever want to experience that type of service again.
author: Jennifer E.

description: The view overlooking Union Square is amazing. The burgers were mediocre and overpriced. I got the hangover burger and it reminded me of the In-N-Out animal style burger but with more ingredients. Their milkshakes, however, were really good. I got the caramel salted mocha shake. Went with a friend and both of us paid a little over $30 for a shake, burger, and fries. If you want a good burger with a good price, I wouldn't recommend this place. If you are looking for a restaurant with an incredible view, definitely come here.
author: Sara W.

description: Came here for lunch yesterday after a wild night out lol. I was impressed with the menu and the view of union square. Normally we will just eat at cheesecake factory so I was stoked to change it up! I got a turkey burger on a wheat bun. Salad fries etc are extra. I was thoroughly impressed with my burger, although it was turkey it was juicy and the bun was crunchy. Delicious. My friends got a kobe beef burger and that was delicious as well. I will definitely be coming back here when i'm in SF. We had NO wait and our waitress was excellent!
author: Lauren Ashley G.

description:
Menu rocks! If you're looking for a good burger, come here. It's worth the $$. So many different varieties to choose from and you can customize it any way you'd like. Service can be slow and our waiter last night was forgetful and inattentive, but the other time I went, it was fine. 

You got the basic burgers that will cost you $10-$15 or you can go gourmet fancy and get one for as much as $60. Yesterday, I decided to eat healthy and get the Buffalo burger with pepper jack cheese ($18). It came with either fries or mixed green salad. I chose the salad. He got the low carb burger which had no bun, but instead, portabella mushrooms. We ordered a side of zucchini fries too! The beef patties are sooo tender and big. I could barely bite into my burger. I really appreciate the fact that they cook it the way you order it. I wanted my burger done medium and there it was!! Reddish pink on the inside. When I bit into it, droplets of blood and grease dripped down to my plate. Mmmm. I could definitely tell that the buffalo meat was leaner but it didn't take away from the taste. 

Dessert: We had the cheesecake burger, which wasn't that good. I HIGHLY recommend getting the chocolate burger! Trust me, I'm not too crazy about chocolate, but this one is an exception! Comes out looking exactly like a buger, but it's all sweets. The bun is a warm fluffy donut, lettuce is kiwi, ketchup is strawberries, the meat patty is a nutella patty. Has a cute little mouse mouse for decor. Soooooooooooooo ridiculously good. Milkshakes are a must too!! Can't wait t come back and try their other burgers. Oh! You get a great view of Union Square too...so if you want to people watch, it's perfect.
author: Lynn V.

description:
They were playing St. Germain's Tourist when I walked in. I was finally here in Helmut Keller's Burger Bar. Mmmm. Yes! The opportunity to top an artisan burger with a grilled lobster tail was right before my eyes! 

But...as hungry as I was, I wasn't in the mood for a giant burger. I got the Cream of Mushroom soup, a side of grilled shrimp, and the onion rings. OMG. Delicious. 

The soup was so hot, thick, and smooth! Topped with grilled onion and parsley, it was perfect to fill my lunch void. The grilled shrimp were tender, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned. The onion rings? Hm. Lesly S said they were coated in magic. They were THAT good. Hot, crunchy, beautiful, and with tender onion inside. She got the fish & chips basket. I was pleased with the taste I had. It was yummy. 

I loved my lunch at Burger Bar! Even if I didn't have a burger! I'm a fan!

#pursehooks
author: Kelly G.

description:
I am sitting here waiting for my order but felt compelled to review now.
Waited 20 minutes before a server finally asked if we were helped.
After we ordered our food, 15 minutes went by and then the server told us that they were out of cups and that is why we dont have our drinks.
5 mins after that we had our drinks in these small plastic cups.
Busy spot, folks seem overwhelmed. Food better be good or this goes down as a 1 star.

Although the food runner dropped my husbands burger bun as he was bringing out the food....the food was good and the service got better..... It WAS a busy shopping day.  Overall, our experience was ok but not great.
author: Leila B.

description:
Even though this place is in a great location, the food was decent and the burgers were okay.

My friends and I went to this place right before the dinner rush and even then the restaurant was filled. I was slightly disappointed that there wasn't a larger bar area, but the space itself is pretty small.

We were seated at a booth, which was pretty roomy. The tall walls of the booth also gave the feeling of a lot of privacy. There was also a small TV embedded in one of the walls of the booth, which I assumed played any big sporting events that would be happening (it was off when we were there).

I did appreciate the interesting assortment of burgers that were available on the menu. I was very curious about the remixed Rossini burger due to the ingredients (braised short ribs, lobster tail, shaved truffles, and truffle oil) and the price (at a cool $60!), but of course I was not about to drop that much money on a burger. I also like all the options that are on the "create your own burger" menu. They have a wide variety of various fixings to choose from. 

There's only a few other food items on the menu other than the burgers and this includes chicken wings, fish and chips, and a few salads. Their shakes on the menu were really yummy and came in a pretty and tall glass and their "build your own shake" option has lots of ingredients to choose from.

Food quality was decent, but does not set itself apart from all the other decent burger joints that are probably a bit cheaper. I did not think that there was anything particularly special or unique about the burgers or the menu. 

The one defining quality of this restaurant is the great view of Union Square down below and the view of the San Francisco city skyline at about eye (and maybe even slightly above) eye level. I definitely recommend requesting for a seat next to a window, if possible.

Overall, I think this is a trendy restaurant in a touristy area with great views and only decent food. Good atmosphere, but if you're looking for something unique to the city, this is not the place to look for it.
author: Nirel R.

description:
Yes, the burgers are pretty overpriced, and I'm not sure I would come back here again and pay out of my own pocket for super expensive burger, but price aside, they do burgers well!

I got the Country Natural burger on an onion bun and added a fried egg ($1.95) and a slice of provolone ($0.95).  It also comes with lettuce, tomato, onion, and a dill pickle.  Great burger!  Perfectly cooked, and not too salty either.  Quality meat!  It looks pretty small when it comes out, but worry not - it's HEARTY.  I was prepared to go out and eat some ice cream afterward, but I was so full after my burger that I decided to skip dessert.  I also tried the skinny fries, which were quite good.  My friend ordered the Kobe burger, and he seemed to enjoy it too.

After the additional toppings, my burger came out to be around $13, which is a bit more than I'd like to pay for a burger.  The price is probably gonna keep me from coming back, but I'll admit, they make a GOOD burger.  Oh, and the service is pretty good too.  As is the space at the top floor of Macy's.  Overall, I enjoyed my experience here, and that burger reminded me that I need to eat more cheeseburgers now. :)
author: Vivian C.

description:
This place is over priced and overrated. 

Sure my turkey burger was good and my sweet potato fries even better but this place is not any better than any other "build your own burger" place.

I had a turkey burger with jalapeno bacon, caramelized onions, blue cheese and chipotle aioli on a sourdough bun.  The bun was dry and fell apart after my first bite, not good.  The sweet potato fries were good and so were their skinny fries, but this is a burger joint and I would expect the burgers to be better than the fries. 

The table setup is a odd.  Each booth has its own TV.  Maybe this is good if you're dining alone but If I'm going out to eat with someone, I'm there to enjoy their company, not watch TV.

The best thing about this place is the view and unfortunately I didn't get to sit by the window!
author: Heather K.

description: I would give this place negative stars if I could. It's 9:30 pm and everything says they close at 10pm. Shirt service
author: Nicholas F.

description:
Oh man...this place is one of those experiences that I will never forget. I was crazy enough to accept my friend's offer. He offered to pay for my meal if I could finish the Insane Burger and a beer. I've done spicy food challenges before so I thought "Why not?!" Big mistake...

The Insane Burger is not even on the menu but a description of it is found in front. It's an Angus beef burger that has The Source hotsauce (6,000,000 Scoville units!!) slathered on top. It also has jalapeno and , habanero peppers, tomato (what?!), chipotle aioli and served on a jalapeno cheese bun. They make you sign a waiver before eating it. 

The burger also came with fries that had cayenne pepper spritzed on it and the plate was sprinkled with cayenne pepper and a nice garnish of habanero.

Ok. Now on to the challenge...

First bite was great! Had a kick and I could clearly taste the smoky, Angus beef flavor. 

Second bite - "Hmmm... it's starting to kick in..." 

Third bite - "Oh man!! What am I getting into?!" It's about this time that I took a bite and the sauce went straight down my throat! I have never thought I would be able to imagine what it would be like to have red, hot molten lava poured inside my body but this is what I imagine it would be like. My face started to turn all different shades of crimson and my friends laughter started to leak out at about this time. 

Fourth bite - "..." It was about this time that I lost all feeling in the lower part of my face. Dribbles of sweat was pouring down my face and starting to drip from the corners of my eyes. My friend's cameras came out and started snapping away at how I looked. I put down my burger and started downing cup after cup of water and beer. 

...

The pain, numbness and sweating didn't go down until about an hour after I took my fourth and last bite. Fast forward to the next morning and I was clearly reminded why I'm not scared of eating this type of stuff but I'm deathly afraid of that stuff coming out. I had FOUR bites and that thing felt like I was evacuating a poker that's been marinating in fire for hours!! AArrggghhhHHH!!

In other foods and drink, I also had the Maui Brewing Company Coconut Beer. It came in a can (what?) and had the dark, mocha taste of a good porter. I also had the sweet potato fries that was a great combination of sweet and salty.

Now that I know what 6M Scoville units feels like I can safely say I will never try that again. 1M Scoville's maybe...still gotta try a ghost pepper. =D A grain of 16M Scovilles...maybe. Yes, I'm a sucker for punishment but there's nothing like a new experience.  

I would definitely come back here but never again for the Insane Burger...
author: Don D.

description: I've been getting waxed for years. I've had good and bad experiences. Gwen is absolutely great.  She is professional, knows what she is doing and this is one of the most comfortable waxes I've had (very little pain).  I highly recommend her.
author: Joel S.

description:
I wasn't expecting much from this place, as it seemed a bit touristy and convenient being inside Macy's. Even the menus scream "tourist" and "novelty" restaurant with a giant picture of Hubert Keller and menu items like the world's hottest burger. 

The burgers are pricey, easily in the 13-15 dollar range and possibly up to 20-30 if you decide to splurge. I find it a bit silly that you have to pay for every single additional topping, even aioli. I ordered a regular black angus burger with american cheese, caramelized onions, and aioli. The first noticeable thing about the burger is that the patty is almost an inch thick. This, in combination with the puffy bun makes its rather difficult to even eat the burger. The patty itself was somewhat dry, unevenly seasoned, and slightly overcooked to my requested medium rare. When biting into it, almost no juices came out. it was the most clean and unmessy burger ever. My bun looked barely toasted and didn't really do much. They did load up my burger with a ton of caramelized onions, which imparted some nice flavor and the side of sweet potato fries were ok, not very crispy at all though.

Overall an overpriced burger for how mediocre it tastes.
author: Tim W.

description:
I wasn't a big fan of the burgers and its was over price. I tired the world's spiciest burger and the buffalo burger. The waiter never told us we could put the sauce on the side for the worlds spiciest burger... It was so unbearable. Buffalo burger was alright but not memorable.

The drinks there were really good. We wanted to have the nutella with Jameson BUT they were out of it. Really!??!? Unacceptable. Lol
author: Cynthia N.

description: This place has zero care for their customers. My dad and I were eating here and he had a HUGE hair in his burger so the waiter took it back and said the manager was very busy "doing paperwork" and could not come out but apologized on his behalf. Then the waiter comes back and gives the check with only $10 off the $100 bill. We then say can we speak to the manager now and the waiter says he is still busy and it will be a while. Very upset with the tone of his voice and is condesending words "well what discount do you want" and "is $10 not good enough". The burger should have been comp'd off the bill and the manager should have cared enough to apologize to us. Then another employee comes out (not our waiter) and hands us the final bill with the burger off and our waiter walked away without saying anything. I look at the reciet and in writting it says "Please ask to speak to a manger if your Burger Bar Experience did not meet or exceed expectations"... Hmm interesting! I highly sugguest Cheesecake Factory located two floors up :)
author: Shauna R.

description: What a terrible waiter I had, service did not meet my expectation what so ever. Had my phone on the table, waiter brought over waters, spilled one of the cups all over my phone and said "this same thing happened earlier" Let the manager know of his waiter wasting water on my phone and his remark was "I'm sorry put your phone in rice". So I left this star because of the service and the recovery that was not there not on the food itself which was very pleasing.
author: Sidney J.

description: Waited 30 mins to get seated on a Saturday night, for a party of 8 which I thought was pretty decent. However, as soon as we were seated the service was terrible. We had 4 kids and ordered their drinks as soon as we sat. 30 minutes later our kids still didn't have their drinks. My husband ordered a tanqueray and tonic and they brought a Tom Collins. Flagged down a manger and finally got the right drinks and the kids drinks. Took about 45 minutes to get our food. Which was just ok.
author: Ashley M.

description: Underwhelming at best, incredibly expensive for what you get.  I ordered a Kobe burger and have my doubt's about if I actually got Kobe beef because it was not comparable to other Kobe burgers I have had.  The waitress was incredibly friendly and did a great job considering the whole place seemed to be understaffed.  I just feel that this place is over hyped for what it is, and is more of a tourist trap/shrine to the chef then a Zagat rated restaurant.
author: Zach B.

description: Looking for a place to eat in Union Square during the Christmas season is kinda like goin' into the Hunger Games. There are too many people, and they're all mean. So, our experience at the Burger Bar was a parachute full of good food and much-needed drinks when we thought we couldn't deal much longer. Still craving those spicy jalapeno fries!
author: Angela H.

description: If they had a zero I'd use it. The host couldn't have been any ruder. By the time we were seated we left the restaurant just because the host was so rude. Definitely won't go back. Came to the Marriott-great service.
author: Lisa S.

description: I had the build a burger and it was delicious. My friend and I actually split a burger and the zucchini fries and it was more than enough. We also ordered the milkshake paddle which comes with 6 small shakes. Looks great but what a waste. Its more for looks than anything. You take a few sips and there's just whip cream left. I will never order that again. We also ordered the Red velvet alcoholic shake and that was actually pretty good. You dont taste the alcohol right away but let it sit for a few minutes and you will taste it. We had a party of 8 and it was a Saturday afternoon and we waited probably less than 30 minutes. The waitress was great. Actually all the people that worked there were really nice and helpful. I would definitely come back here, I just would not order the milkshake paddle ever again.
author: Dee P.

description: I should have known better, but I wanted to try it. What an abject rip-off. Small & overpriced cocktails, a tasteless burger, and adequate (pleasant) but unenthused service. The whole place is a set-up to rip off tourists and other clueless individuals. Even the bun stunk. The only reason I am not giving this place one star is the view and the onion rings. The onion rings were very good, but I will never return. The height of middle-class buffoonery...MACY*S, who delivers The Cheesecake Factory to the guileless. I should have known better.
author: Larry K.

description:
Of course great selection of burgers... great meat. The place is inside Maci's shop... not great.

Very crowded at all time.. I was there for lunch. The tables are a bit too small for the big dishes you get. Buffalo burger was delicious... done as I expected.

Great selection of beers.

I would say definitely a place to try and re try to taste most of the menu. I would not spend 60$ for the Coby beef burger.

Fries were GREAT.... and yes.. served with majo on my request  ( I went Dutch!!) :)
author: Gianguido G.

description: This place is overpriced and not the best burger I ever had. I would recommend to go to the Cheesecake Factory instead. Service is very slow as well. The location is good but  I honestly thing this place is overrated. If I am going to pay over 15 dollars for a burger I expect a really good burger, the burger was pretty average and overlooked. I got the built your own with the wheat bread( that fell all apart btw) cooked medium with the skinny fries. This place is just target to tourists that come to the Macy's and get hungry after a lot of shopping. I highly doubt that locals eat here except drinks.
author: Marilyn G.

description:
After shopping at Macy's, the boy and I decided to check out Burger Bar. It's located on the 6th floor of Macy's and has a great view of Union Square.

We were warmly welcomed by Dominic, the bartender, who gave us some great recommendations from the menu since this was our first time here. I decided to 'build-your-burger' and ordered black angus beef, on a plain bun, with American cheese. You pay extra for the condiments, except for the usual suspects such as lettuce, pickle, onion and tomato. I also ordered a side of skinny fries for $3.35. The boy ordered chicken wings which came with a side of ranch and/or bleu cheese dressing.

My burger was was good but nothing mind-blowing. I had it cooked well-done but I wish I had gone with medium or medium-well; it was a little too dry for me. The fries were tasty but again, nothing special. All of this for $9.75, I expected much more but was overall satisfied. The boy enjoyed his chicken wings and said they were comparable to his favorite wings in AZ. 

I'm definitely a 'burger-and-fries' kinda girl, so I will give Burger Bar another try in the future!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Today we decided to be the common "tourist" and eat at this joint. It was a huge mistake. I've eaten here before and it was fine... But today seemed off. I've also viewed recent reviews and it seems to just keep getting worst.

I ordered a salmon burger. It did not come with sides (that's extra and the burger alone is already at $10) and when I asked to SUBSTITUTE (in which it didn't say no substitutions) for SPINACH instead of LETTUCE... He still charged me the extra topping at 1.15$.

My paramour was calling out "the hottest burger" and called it BS that it can't possibly be this hot and so he ordered that (he's Mexican btw).

Our food came in 15 mins which was good cause we were starving...

Let's start with the salmon burger...

I got ciabatta bread with it because it's amazing but this bread was chewy. Tooooo chewy. And didn't taste toasty at all. It didn't compliment the salmon well which is crazy cause when I make it at home THEYRE DELICIOUS WITH SALMON. The salmon itself was plain with no flavor. The spinach (although sautéed in some oily stuff) was also plain to my palate. No sauce came with it so I drizzled it with tapatio to help. But it just couldn't suffice. I was disappointed.

OK... On to the HOTTEST BURGER.

I took a quick taste of the sauce only and I was on fiyahh! It was hot! I was scared for my paramour. He took one bite and was red in the face. DEFEATED. It really was that hot. So hot it lacked flavor and tastiness. It's one of those foods that it's too much of something that it doesn't even taste good at all. 

After our unsatisfying meal we ordered calamari to make up for the blah in our food. And MAAAAAAANNNN. The calamari was TERRIBLE as well! It was either uncooked or too cooked. The squid was tooooooo chewy. We ate 3 pieces and left it as is.

Let me tell you about my server though. This guy just added the cherry to a ruined meal...

He takes our orders. Comes back 30 secs after our food had just arrived... And I told him please bring some milk out because of the burger. He says of course... NEVER SAW HIM AGAIN. I was upset. I mean my paramour JUST ate the hottest burger he simply needed the milk, but no he never came. 5 mins later we were passed to another server. In which our waiter failed to tell us he was leaving. This second waiter was GOLD. He was the reason I gave this 2 damn stars. But it was short lived because the original waiter came back only to hand us our bill and scoot us away.

A total for two burgers and 3 beers... 85$

Definitely a tourist price with a tourist view. 
I mean a Hef is 5$ and they charge 8$ .. Crazy!

I hope they change their chefs soon maybe I'll consider on venturing here again.
author: Ladonna A.

description:
Perfect place to be after dinner. If you're not worried about extra calories in your diet, TRY the nutella burger (look up my photo)! This is what it is:

Buns: holeless sugared donut cut in half
Cheese: passion fruit gelee made into a square
Beef patty: about an inch thick of nutella made to look like a patty
Tomatoes: slices of strawberries
Lettuce: slices of kiwi
(all held together with a toothpick)

Random decor: raspberry syrup with M&M's and toffee chunks, a whipped cream mouse with raspberry syrup eyes, tail, and waffle ears. 

You can ask for a glass of milk; they do have milk at this bar for the sole reason for this dessert. 

BOO-YAH. Wouldn't you LOVE to eat THIS? 

Fries and normal burgers are also delicious and very filling. Service is quick and friendly. The woman didn't have to after I read the description of my dessert burger, but she did it anyway just in case I had ANY doubts. Good sell!
author: Lily L.

description:
I dont get what the hype is here. You have to wait at least a half an hour. The hostesses are very nice and honest with that up front. That being said the hostesses were probably the best part here. Ironically there was an unbelievable amount of tables open that people were not being seated in. ???

The burgers are overpriced and bizarrely puck shaped. They are clearly formed from some machine. Served bare bones.. you have to pay for every single item to accompany your burger with the exception of one sad piece of lettuce, tomato and onion. Fries are served in a toxic combination of both lukewarm, overcooked and somehow not very crispy all at the same time. How do they pull off this feat or destroying a fried potato? 

The beer selection is great, except once you realize it is at least 30% higher than anywhere you would go go. That means beers for $8 plus tip and probably tax. 

The decor felt like nothing special at all. If anything it felt like a chain restaurant and kind of sad. Everybody eating there was a tourist except our party. It is geographically convenient if you are near the Powell BART. 

In summary. I would never eat here again nor would i recommend this place to anybody I liked. There is nothing special here to substantiate the long wait, above average prices and mediocre food.
author: Jake T.

description: The view is great but the food could be a lot better. Save yourself some time and find somewhere else to eat.
author: Kenneth H.

description: Came here today after ice skating with my grandkids. Yes, it was very busy, which is to be expected this time of year. All things considered, we were all very pleased with our meals and the level of service we received. Our server was prompt and friendly and our burgers came out quick and delicious! The manager (or who I assumed was the manager) checked in on us several times to make sure we were being taken care of. All in all, a great place with a great view!
author: Bette B.

description:
Updating this review based on service that my coworkers and I went through today.

Seven of us came in for a work lunch together.  I'm finding that after several lunches here, I'm not overly impressed with their food anymore. There's still some awesome things there (I still love the deep fried pickle spears) but the burgers are kinda not hitting the mark for me anymore. They're not terrible by any means, but the veggie patty really isn't all that I find. It's difficult to eat and most of the time it doesn't fit on the bun properly, making a huge mess and not really being a "burger".

Today though, the service we received was poor, borderlining on outright rude.

My coworker had ordered a salad and requested an ingredient be left out. The salad came out unaltered.  She sent it back and they were pretty quick in getting a replacement out. Except her replacement had bits of the ingredient she'd requested removed (I don't know if they just picked it off or if they made a whole new one and random bits wandered in).  The problem came when she tried to flag down a waiter about the second salad also being unacceptable and it took nearly 10 minutes of waiting for someone to finally come over. She requested a soup replacement and even that took another 10 minutes to come out.

It wasn't that crazily busy for the service to be that poor on this visit. There were a good number of waitstaff out and around the floor. We felt like we were getting ignored as we were trying to get someone's attention. We had very little service overall once our food was out (dare I say it was nonexistent?) and it was somewhat frustrating by the end of the meal.

I'm on the fence with this place. There's definitely some things I like about it, the potential is there for a lot more.  The prices still make me cringe (I ordered a pop today because I just couldn't handle the $8 price on the milkshakes) and the veggie burger is still kinda on the "meh" side, but the pickles are amazing and more than make up for it in a way.

There's other places I'll likely go to when given the option in the area but this will be kind of on the list of "maybe, if the other places are too full or closed or I really feel like deep fried pickles".
author: Cassandra J.

description: Inside Macy's Union Square is this little gem of a restaurant.  Get a burger any way you want it with class.  Our party ordered a Wagyu burger, a bison burger, a turkey burger and a regular ole burger.  You pick your bun (gluten-free option too), pick your toppings (MANY to choose from) and you get fries with that. Everyone got exactly what they wanted.   We also ordered a couple of really good cocktails and a milkshake.  It was excellent.  I recommend.   Shop while you wait for your table!
author: Christine L.

description:
Everyone likes meat, right?  Well, except those vegetarian people, and I don't understand them.

Prior to a shopping date with my friend She Ra, I needed sustenance.  I wasn't in the mood for Cheesecake Factory, and had wanted to try this place for awhile.  

It's a solid OK three stars.  The hostess staff leaves something to be desired, and our waiter was pretty good (in my former waiter opinion). 

The food...meh.  

You can pick from any number of burger/bread/cheese/toppings to build your own burger...which I like.  For the taste...I am not impressed with the price.

I got a cheddar, their favorite meat, tomato, lettuce, avocado dealy-o.  The meat, while good, bled into my bun shortly after arrival which made it eating sandwich-style impossible.  The sweet potato fries were nothing spectacular.

It's worth a shot to go here once, but this is clearly not a place that caters to repeat business.
author: Pam S.

description:
I give this restaurant a 2 with the nicest of intentions. The service was meh and the host made us wait for 10 minutes though there were a ton of booths open when s/he took us to the back.

I ordered a turkey burger because I'm a sucker for turkey burgers and hope to find as epic a turkey burger in SF as the one I always get at Max Brenner in NYC. To be fair, the turkey burger here was better than some turkey burgers I've had before, but there's nothing more satisfying than the rubbery snap of your cheese as you try to take a bite into your burger. Turkey patty itself was on the dryer side but not bad.

The milkshakes are pretty good but expensive, and...expect an explosion of sugar. Also prepare for the sugar crash afterwards as well.

This is an okay place to go to when you're hungry, don't have a reservation and don't want to wait in line.
author: Tiffany L.

description: The burger was ok, a little over cocked , also the bread was a little hard. The view is amazing & the service is good.
author: Hadla A.

description:
After hearing about Hubert Keller on Top Chef I'd been wanting to go to one of his restaurants. Living in the Bay Area for a summer gave me the opportunity.

Burger Bar attempts to take the classic American diner experience and elevate it to something finer. Keller has succeeded in elevating the prices, but the rest of the experience was a short of the mark.

There are TVs built into the booths. I understood this choice as television is common in diners, but we were given no control over what was shown. In our case it was an eating competition. Nothing diminishes the appetite more than watching someone devour hotdog after hotdog and proceed to blow chunks. We couldn't turn it off, either. It was distracting and disgusting.

The restaurant uses higher quality ingredients than a typical diner. Kobe beef was offered for the burger patties. The burger was around $17 and I couldn't taste much difference-- perhaps the reason you don't see a lot of burgers in fine dining. We also ordered milkshakes, but beyond the price we paid, they were nothing special.

The waiter also made an error with our order on the burger toppings. He said he would bring the correct toppings right away, but didn't return until we were finished eating.

Don't go to Burger Bar unless you like to spend a lot of money on mediocre food.
author: Jake L.

description:
Slow service
Salty food
Fries taste like McDonalds' fries
Ciabatta bread dry
...Nothing special
author: Dalia K.

description:
So, as some of you who read my reviews already know, I recently went through a five month stretch of eating zero/almost zero beef (side note #1: even after all this time, I still find it weird that I might have "regular" readers.  Assuming I do though, you guys are great!).  Though it didn't end up to being as tortuous as I had feared (once I got past the initial withdrawals), there were still a few times that I had some serious burger cravings (side note #2: if you read the opening to my Serpentine review, you'll get how bad I wanted one at that point).  So, with my beef ban over, what better way to celebrate than to go out and get some BURGERS?

When our party of three showed up on a Friday around 7:30, we were pleasantly surprised to get seated immediately.  No wait on a Friday night for dinner?  Score!  Table with a mini-TV airing the Giants game?  Double score!  After skimming through their menu, I decided to try my hand at creating my own concoction instead of getting one of their specialty burgers.  After all, with their wealth of ingredients, how could you not be tempted?  So, after some careful consideration, I opted to go with a Black Angus burger on an onion bun with slices of provolone and pepper jack cheese, jalapeno bacon, and, of course, a fried egg.  Along with a Brown Cow milkshake (vanilla ice cream and hot fudge topped with chocolate whipped cream) and baskets of Skinny Fries and Buttermilk Onion Rings we all decided to share, this certainly wasn't a healthy sort of meal.  Dieters beware.

When our food was brought out, it looked quite appetizing.  Maybe my cravings had something to do with it, but not much time passed between when the plate met the table and when the burger met my mouth.  The verdict?  Solid, but not life altering.  I liked that the patty wasn't too thick, had some beefy flavor, and was cooked exactly to medium as ordered.  On the flip though, the bun didn't taste like onion to me, though that's probably because everything else in the burger blocked it out.  The combination of cheeses didn't work out too well as the tastes got muddled together, but that's more my fault for doubling up than theirs.  My favorite part was their jalapeno bacon - though it wasn't as spicy as I hoped, it was still flavorful.  And the egg?  Well, who doesn't love a fried egg?  Definitely added to the burger, but it also made it a lot messier to eat as well.

As for their fries and onion rings, I liked both - crispy, but not oily.  Neither are the best I've had (side note #3: the fries tasted great with the truffle sauce), but both are good companions for your burger.  As for the milkshake, I was a little conflicted.  Outside of it being a little too sweet, I thought it was good.  However, I was disappointed that it didn't come with the excess amount in the metal tin cup like at other places.  I understand that it might not be classy and that they probably measure out exact portions, but at $9.00, it'd be nice to have a little more than just that tall glass to sip on.

Despite hearing only modest praise from friends and fellow Yelpers, Burger Bar was always a "must try" given Hubert Keller's reputation.  I could see why people haven't been overwhelmed by their experiences, but I wouldn't say it was a disappointment either.  It's certainly not the best burger in the city, but it's still pretty decent (side note #4: where else would you find a burger that's built around Kobe beef and foie gras?).  I'd say 3.5 stars is about right, but rounding up to four stars since I was in a good mood that night.  Ending a beef drought will do that to you.
author: Mike L.

description:
Two items that have me convinced to love Burger Bar: Sweet Potato Fries and Milkshake Paddles.

We hosted a large group event here with Burger Bar and it was amazing. They reserved the private room for us and we had our own dedicated server the entire night. The burgers were fantastic, the appetizers were great (all except the fried pickles...but that's a personal preference)...

The veggie burger was HUGE and filling and definitely homemade. They didn't fire up a frozen boca burger, they handcrafted one.

And oh MY. Save room for the nutella milkshake paddle. TRUST ME.
author: Carolyn H.

description: Good services. Great food. Nice views. The wait was not too crazy. Text you when your table is open. Love that. All in all great experience.
author: sunny t.

description: Yum good Californian comfort burgers ..and super hot sassy servers to complete the experience.  Super nice and super fun drink options
author: Sandra S.

description:
Not sure where to even begin with this place...so let's just go down the list.
We got here and were told it was a 45 minute to an hour wait.  That's fine, it's a Saturday night in the city, you can't really expect less at other place.  We go and walk around for a little bit and come back.  They said they had a table ready for us.  The hostess girl was a little upity, but the girl who sat us was very pleasant and nice.  Our server was great.  He was attentive and gave us lots of great suggestions.  

The food.  I love burgers.  I would eat them for every meal if I could, but that's not going to happen.  For being just a burger place, the burgers were only, alright.  They didn't wow, they weren't the best thing ever, they just fell a little flat.  I got the American Kobe Beef Burger with cheddar cheese and that's it. It also came with some veggies on the side to put on top.  I think a really good burger should be good enough without a ton of condiments on it.  It just didn't have a lot of taste, and for almost $17, I want this burger to be amazing.  I want it to punch me in the face and tell me how good it is.  This burger did not do that.  

This place had a really nice view, a long drink list, and a good atmosphere, so it has all those things going for it, but I probably won't be wating for an hour for an expensive only okay burger again.
author: Kimmy G.

description: Here on a Friday night and I thought it was going to be packed so we were seated right away.  I wasn't really hungry to begin with so I ordered the dessert burger made with a donut split in half with creamy cheesecake filling and a very thinly sliced pineapple to mimic the "cheese".  It was pretty ok and satisfied my sweet tooth, but not a wow factor.  Service seemed minimal and we weren't given any utensils ... we had to ask for some napkins and utensils after our food arrived.  Not a place I'd come running back to though.
author: Emy B.

description:
Burgers - not bad. Nothing too special for the price you pay; however, their desserts and sides - excellent!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
sorry hubert!!  having frequented the BB vegas location over two dozen times i figured this place must just as good or close to it.  alas i was extremely disappointed....sigh!

{ food : 2 stars }
*   peppercorn burger w/provolone + bacon - burger was extremely dry.  the peppercorn sauce on the side was amazing though.  had i rated the food strictly based on that, it would've received 5 stars,  i bet it tastes great on a ribeye or ny steak
*   fries were ok - i can't compare to the vegas location because i used to always get the sweet potato fries.  i stuck with what the burger came with, skinny fries

{ staff : 2.5 stars } 
*   host : 4 stars, friendly, seated us immediately, provided option of bar or dining area
*   waitress : 1 star, not friendly or helpful.  when i asked her what type of cheese would be good on the peppercorn burger, she stated that it doesn't come with cheese.  duh! i know that's why i was asking for a recommendation.  anyway, i was still polite and said "thank you, do you recommend any that would compliment the burger and sauces that it comes with?" her response to me, "i don't know what you like" if willie d. or mystery diners were shooting an episode there, she'd fail!
*   food runner : 4 stars, friendly
*   manager was setting up another room and not really paying attention to staff.  the manager in vegas was always walking the floor, ensuring a great exp.  maybe if hubert brings her over here BB SF will come up to par as BB vegas?

{ ambiance : 4 stars }
*   nice view of union square
*   dining area reminds me of the vegas location, which i miss
*   restrooms are clean
*   window (where i sat next to) was a little dirty. had bits of food stuck to it
author: Tina F.

description: Stopped in famished after a few hours of working on our registry (aka overwhelmed and looking for some comfort in food). It being a burger focus, we had a few expectations: 1- that it would be over priced because of the view on Union Square, 2- that it would be a decent burger. We got the special for Tuesday which was the mushroom and Swiss burger, was supposed to come with sweet potato fries and a coke but we asked for skinny regular fries and the Burger Bar Amber ale. Turns out they were out of their own ale so had to go with anther choice. Beers were twice as expensive as anywhere else - roughly $8 a beer. Burgers were mediocre at best especially for a place that prides themselves on their burgers. Our order came with sweet potato fries instead so we had to sent it back. Waiter was nice and pleasant but preoccupied by something else. We asked for ranch and the order was missed twice- he finally brought it and comically he had the audacity to say that he was comp'ing the tiny sauce container for us. When the bill came, we used a 10% discount on entrees that Macy's had given us. The bill however did not reflect this discount and when I asked, the waiter went back for clarification, then came back and still could not explain the numbers. He sent over the manager to discuss, however the manager himself could not explain the numbers when I did basic math for him and his answer was "I don't do math, I just push the buttons" and hearing my math he said he wasn't going to argue the math. He was overall rude about it and ended up comp'ing a beer but gave us an attitude like he felt we were jerks for checking up on the bill. It wasn't a lot of money, but it was the principle and the way they behaved that made us stick it through. Overall just get In n' out and eat it in Union Square. They have better service and food- oh but forgot our waiter comp'ed the ranch dressing... :)
author: Gaby E.

description:
Your typical burgers, nothing special at all (tastes like one of the burgers you order at a chain restuarant, i.e. Elephant Bar, Cheesecake Factory, etc). I tried the Fleur De Lys truffle sauce, and barely tasted any truffle. I was pretty disappointed by that point..

One redeeming factor was the Nutella Burger. If you have a sweet tooth, this might just be the perfect dessert for you. Numbingly sweet, but delicious since it's nutella ganache. However, please share this with your table because your teeth might just rot from all that sugar.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Hubert Keller kind of scares me.  

Just hearing the name reminds me of his appearances as a guest judge on Top Chef, casting judgement onto hopeful chefs while they sweat on their chick peas.  His eyes bury into their hopes and dreams and with one stern stare he dashes their whole world.  

On that note, he has a burger joint in Macy's!

This sits on the 5th floor, and as the elevator doors open you are greeted with a waiting area.  The host(ess) waits behind a podium and leads you into the further seating area.  

The decor is somewhat confused.  There are notes of classic San Francisco design, with a touch of forced casual encounters.  Big wooden booths are matched with neon signs.  The decor is just an effort to infuse high dining, an homage to San Francisco, and a casual experience (to not intimidate tourists, I suppose).

My dad and I were met by a server in a cotton shirt (another push for a casual, inviting environment) with waters.  And then came the menus.  

Sweet zombie Jesus, the menu.

Ok, any menu that claims a $60 BURGER is worthy of being, nay, automatically pretentious.  The burgers range at around $14 or so to the epic $60 burger (still not over it).

I opted to build my own burger, pairing a regular burger with pesto and bacon on foccacia, paired of course with fat fries.

I must say, despite getting an overly-pretentious vibe from the decor and prices, I was impressed.  The ingredients are clearly fresh and high quality.  Easily better than my typical good-burger fall back, the mighty East Bay establishment, Barney's.  

While the sandwich was big enough to eat half and bring the other half home for dinner.  It sat heavy in my stomach but did not leave me bloated or feeling self-loathing of any kind.

I wouldn't feel the immediate urge to come back, but it is a good place to hit for bragging rights if you can't afford Fleur de Lyss.
author: Andrea C.

description:
WOW! Impressively bad service! Been there many times, and never had service this bad.
* very long wait for order to be taken. Almost walked out, and it was not packed. 
* wrong orders practically thrown at the table. Left to sit until we could flag down someone to remove. 
* no condiments on table despite repeated requests. 
* a second wrong order brought, after we were almost finished. 
* Initially very nice waitress requests I tip in advance (???!) then unhappily presents bill. 

Why three stars?
Excellent burger. The hangover burger came with coke slaw inside. Could've been horrible. Was really really good. 
Steak fries!
Except for the food, Keller should remove his name from here.
author: Kevin C.

description: Service was awful and food was even worse. The burgers tasted like lighter fluid. The fried pickles were ice cold. Here for the weekend and thought a burger was a safe bet, geezer I was wrong. There's no reason I'd ever come back here
author: Erica R.

description: My server was so kind and super nice Aida I think it was her name  I love it.. The food was so good my mom love the service one of the hostess was so rude she was so tiny and rude there was other host she was so sweet she sit us & give us good service I had to ask Aida for her name .Samantha it's a nice hostess you guys need to hire more people like her . Everything was great love it.
author: Steven S.

description: Our server Nathan was very well mannered and was very flexible with our orders. He kept his composure and was very understanding. The atmosphere of the restaurant was nice and modern because the signs and the menus. It's very modern because they have the most beautiful and amazing burger types and the toppings on the burgers. The staters looked very good and appetising for the impeccable time it came out! Unfortunately I have to minus 1 star because the amount of time it took to get a Pepsi was outrageous. The burger looked and smelled amazingly good. The burger was very good and the meat was juicy. This was a all round place to go if you are craving an elegant and juicy burger.
author: Hunter V.

description:
Long waits, warm beer, long service times were the highlights of the visit. The beer was warm even after changing it. We has to call the waiter over for silverware, water and pretty much everything.

The burger is good (that is the extra star in the review) but the service does not justify the burger. Much better places to go nearby.
author: Rohit D.

description: Little bit surprised by some of the reviews of the burger bar that of been posted recently.  Every single time I go there for lunch or dinner, it's pretty outstanding.  While the menu is focused primarily on burgers (not necessarily a fine dining cuisine,) they do an outstanding job.  On my most recent visit this week, I ordered a turkey burger, sourdough roll, bacon, cheddar cheese, with skinny fries and a side of Ranch...everything was perfect.  They have a great selection of beers, and if you're by yourself sitting at the bar you'll enjoy really good service.
author: Vince C.

description: This is my second time here and this one was a better experience. The hostess, waiter, and manager were all very attentive and nice. Service was great! Food came out in less than 10 minutes. We ordered wings, mozzarella sticks, milkshakes and burgers. Everything was great!
author: Gabby F.

description: Service tonight was on top of things. Appetizer, burger entree, and milkshakes were brought in perfect transition. Definitely worth our last meal in SF!
author: Robin F.

description:
Went here on a busy Saturday night in Union Square (aren't they all?) with a couple of friends from out of town. Picked the place after learning the Cheesecake Factory had a 2 hour wait. As someone who won't even stand in line at Disneyland (oh, Space Mountain is badass? I'll take your word for it), I'm definitely not going to wait that long for jambalaya. There's definitely still a wait at Burger Bar, but it's not as depressing.

Seated in a booth towards the kitchen, service was friendly and fast. I ordered a turkey burger on whole wheat ($8.75) with pepper jack (+$1) and guacamole (+$2), along with sweet potato fries (~$3.50). Burger looked small when it came in, but was DENSE. A little too dense, actually...it felt more like eating a meatball than a burger. Sweet potato fries were stellar; a huge improvement to the string fries (bland). 

Overall a bit pricey, but for the location it's livable. The milkshakes were alluring, and the vibe was comfortable. One downside were the TV's at each table - you can't change the channel, and we had a middle-aged man at another table staring at the baseball game on our screen. Creepy is an understatement. A waiter noticed, and came up to change our channel to Tyler Perry. Not sure if this was an improvement, but at least it gave us some privacy. To ditch the awkward family dinner, it may be best to sit at the bar.
author: Laura B.

description:
what i love in this place aside from their yummy burger and fries is the overlooking view of Union Square. If you're planning to visit Burger Bar at Macy's building, make sure to ask the wait staff to find you a place beside the window. (of course if you're a sightseeing person but if you're not interested, then just sit anywhere and enjoy whatever you want to eat.) 

The service was okay, friendly wait staff, clean and neat surroundings and nice (but a bit pricey) menu. I ordered American Classic burger which costs almost $14 and I'm really not sure if it's worth it or what because the Black Angus beef patty was so thick and juicy and probably one of the best burgers I've had.. and the crunchy bacon on top.. just perfect. but.. $14.. for just a burger.. nah! I still love Burger Bar!
author: Mary Ann H.

description:
Hubert Keller? More like Poopburger Seller!

Jk.. I just wanted to say that. This place isn't that bad. I decided to try this place out after watching a video of Hubert Keller make a burger by chopping up a steak and making "ground beef" out of it. I was kind of wary after reading the reviews, but I was around Union Square area so I decided to try it out anyway.

The ambiance is alright. The view is nice, but they have fluorescent lighting by the window tables... not sure what that's all about, but it didn't bother me too much.

Someone on here noted that the strawberry milkshake was delicious, but it was "tiny", so her friend had to order 3 of them. I like strawberries, so decided to try it. The milkshake was pretty good, not the best thing I've ever had, but I think they put real strawberries in there and it wasn't overly sweet. It was far from tiny though! It was a pretty decent sized milkshake. I shared it with my boyfriend and it was enough for the both of us. So.. yeah.

Went with the country natural on sourdough with swiss and beetroot pickle. The burgers are pretty decent (ordered mine medium), but lack flavor. I kept having to dip mine in extra ketchup for any kick. And they're so freaking thick! They look kind of small, but I think if you squashed the patty and bun so that they were the thickness of a regular burger, it would be about the size of a regular burger, so overall mass is about the same. Beetroot pickle was kind of a waste of a dollar. 

After a while though, I got really annoyed with how thick the burger was. I mean, when I'm eating a burger, I don't care how tall it is. I want to be able to hold it in my hand without it sliding all over the place and falling apart on me. And I want to be able to take a full bite out of it. I didn't enjoy that part.

Overall, taste is okay, and view is good. It was a little expensive though, and I'd rather go to Pearl's for a decent burger at a decent price. Plus Pearl's lets you get unlimited pickles.
author: Rhea K.

description: Only thing great about this place is the view, especially during the holiday season. As for the food, everything was sub par. I'd pass on the wings next time. The fries (including zucchini fries) were good and the burgers were decent. I may come back for drinks next time I'm shopping around Macy's.
author: Asmita J.

description:
I wanted to like this place. I still want to like this place. It's hip and everything on the menu sounded delicious. Maybe it's my own fault I didn't love it. After all, I did go to a place called the burger bar and not order a burger. But I was in SF for a marathon and a big, juicy, fatty burger didn't seem like good pre-race food. I was already having a beer...I got the butternut squash soup and sweet potato fries. The soup was good. Not too sweet, but nothing amazing. The sweet potato fries were disappointing. They weren't very crispy and came with absolutely no seasoning. I tried adding my own salt and pepper and even asked for ranch. If it weren't for the lack of crispiness, they probably could have easily been salvaged. 

I tried my moms chicken breast burger. It looked like it would be tasty. She managed to eat most of it. I was disappointed by how dry and overcooked it was. There was absolutely no flavor to it, like chewing cardboard. The skinny fries must have been as good as they looked though, they were gone before I had a chance to try them. 

The service was nothing special either. Not the worst I've ever had, but nothing great either. 

I'd be willing to try the place again. But I'll need to come on a night when I can splurge on one of the black angus burgers and the bread pudding with a spiked milkshake...
author: mel m.

description:
The host told us that there would be a 10 minute wait for a table- but, if we wanted to sit at the bar, we could be seated immediately.
We sat at the bar but noticed 7 empty tables in the next room--strange.
The barkeep was so interested in the hot girl sitting next to us that he completely forgot we were there and had to be reminded several times about what we had ordered.
He wasn't good as a barkeep or a server.
I noticed he charged me for a drink that I ordered even though he never served it--I had to have another server bring it to me.  The hot girl didn't have to even think about asking for anything--the barkeep was ga-ga and in another world because of her presence.
He ignored my request for mayo.  The lying host had to bring it after I got up to ask him.
The food was so-so. It was expensive for a rather typical burger especially considering that everything else was a la carte.
We spent $80.00 for 2 burgers, a small side of fries, a small shrimp cocktail that was rubbery and tasteless and a couple of drinks.
Very touristy--bad service--food so-so.
Proceed with caution.
Compare the review above me^  (hot girl = good times there)
author: Thomas D.

description:
It's obviously going to be expensive here given the chef association and the location/view so it makes sense that things are overpriced.

Anyway, I came on a Wednesday like at 4:00PM and it wasn't busy at all so I got a nice seat viewing Union Square. I was waiting to meet a friend at 5:30PM so I needed a place to study and I was hungry so I came here since I just got done shopping at The Art of Shaving (right next door).

I had a good beer (21st Amendment or something) and the Hubert Keller burger. I would highly recommend this combination of goodies. If you're looking for a good lunch and somewhere to kill some time in the heart of downtown SF, Burger Bar is ideal. I did, however, pay ~$35.

If I come back, it would be for the view and drinks. If I am feeling extra awesome that day I might even order that $60 burger.
author: Marlon T.

description:
this review is for the vegans.  if you eat meat-- or even if you are a vegetarian-- you will have more luck!

I've got a kid so I spend lots of time at the East Bay's fave burger places-- The Counter, Barney's, Flipper's, etc. they always have at least 2 or 3 vegan options (burger, entree salad, some kind of veggie sandwich...). I never leave hungry.

Burger Bar is a big fat FAIL for vegans. the veggie burger is not vegan- that is rookie maneuver #1. why not make the veggie burger vegan, so more people can eat it? but the BIGGEST fail is LACK OF VEGAN BUNS. Whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat? I eat bread on a daily basis-- and we are not talking "special" vegan bread. head to the grocery store or local bakery & I guarantee you will find many vegan options.  at Burger Bar even the sourdough has milk, which is BEE-ZAR.

so, Burger Bar offers a "burger" called the SF Vegan. it is basically a glorified pile of grilled veggies.  the "bun" is 2 portabello mushrooms. No way you can pick that thing up. whatever marinade they use has waaaaaay to much vinegar.  and there is ZERO protein, you will be hungry in about an hour.  I got a side of hummus & avo to top the veggies, just so I could try to make the meal a little heartier.

even the salads have tons of meat, dairy, etc. & they charge full price if you have them take out the shrimp/chicken/meat even though they do not put anything in its place!

I had sorbet for dessert (the rest of my party was enjoying sundaes & such), which was sad, icy & freezer burned.

2 adults & 1 kid were $90. and that was without booze.

service was slow. 2 hours for burgers? WTH?

but let's end on some positives: the fries (both sweet potato & skinny) were good. big drink menu.  my kid was happy with her veggie burger & sundae.
author: Virginia D.

description:
Have a restaurant inside a mega mall Macy's can be a little freakish at first but then you look out the window of the 6th floor, take in the breathtaking view, and are reminded why your heart will always be in San Francisco.

Burger Bar has a huge variety of burgers, non-burger dishes (FISH AND CHIPS) and salads the size of my face.  So if you just want to stick to small food stuffs and fill up on deserts, do not leave this place without trying the milkshake sampler featuring a Graham cracker caramel shake, a Nutella shake, and strawberry shake. They are very rich and creamy but so amazing; I equally loved them all.  

From what I saw it looked like the menu had more deserts and alcohol options than actual burgers.  Also went on a day when the 49ERS won a game in the playoffs so the staff was pretty much off the chain in NINERS gear and jerseys, not a bad bonus.
author: Hazel K.

description:
We were seated promptly, with a nice view of Union Square, and the service was friendly. Great ambiance and service. However, the burgers weren't as amazing as their prices made them to be. I'm not an expert on burgers, but I know that I've had way juicier and tastier burgers for half the price, within walking distance. It wasn't horrible, but I don't think I'll come back... maybe to try the Nutella milkshake. Maybe.

Great for tourists who don't know where else to spend their money.  I will never spend so much on a basic burger ever again.
author: Zell C.

description: First time there. Horrible service. Server told us all about the happy hour specials and that we had to go online to sign up for them. We did and then he said that they were only good on Tuesdays and Thursday, really? All of that trouble for nothing. Then they didn't have a couple of items. Finally got up and left. Waste of time and money. Not a wonder that there are only three locations
author: Suzanne O.

description: The kobe burger is about $18 but it's worth the price. Meat was nice and tender. The view was excellent. Visited in December and it overlooked the may Xmas tree and the ice skating.
author: Alejandra R.

description:
By far the best burger I have found in San Francisco and its an amazing spot for people watching in Union Square (you are literally able to see all of Union Square from the big windows in this place).

Start out with what I like to call an adult milkshake, the Lindeman's Framboise float (they call it a Raspberry Velvet). It's a very sweet drink, but perfect with a burger and it fulfills the need of a stiff drink if you need one after a day of shopping.

I get a make your own burger with the Kobe beef, swiss cheese, and nothing else.  Yes it's plain, but it really hits the spot.  And they have so many other options that everyone is sure to find something they like.
author: Giselle S.

description:
I spent $21 on a burger and fries!  Ok, it wasn't just any burger and fries.  I had a Kobe beef burger with prosciutto (yes, prosciutto!) on a toasted onion bun, with zucchini fries. Delicious!

My MPA friends and I gathered here after finals for dinner and drinks.  Great food and fun company.  We shared onion rings, sweet potato fries and regular fries.  One of my friends enjoyed the buffalo burger.  They are big so either come hungry or prepare to take home half.  Yes, it is trendy, probably overrated, but the drinks were excellent, service was great and food was delicious.  Sure, I could go to another burger joint for less money, but it was so much fun to go here and overlook Union Square during the holiday season.  

I could not believe the extensive beer list.  It was longer than the wine list!  Though I can't imagine paying $30 for a bottle of beer - it better be a damn good one and make breakfast for me in the morning.  The bartenders are excellent mixologists and are cute and friendly too.   (Mental note - maybe not so much fried food if I'm drinking to celebrate the end of finals.  Really paid for it the next morning.)  Next time, I definitely have to save room for one of their signature milkshakes.  Who am I kidding, I'm going for the alcoholic milkshakes.  

This is a great place to hang out with friends, if you have a small fortune you are willing to part with.
author: Maria S.

description:
"It's just another meatless Monday 
I wish it was Sunday 
'Cause that's my funday 
My I don't have to runday 
It's just another meatless Monday..."

Burger Bar is a good place to get your random 80's flashbacks and mellow Monday grub on.  Yes, Chef Hubert Keller can hook you up with loads of meateriffic options (Kobe beef, foie gras, truffles, and heart attack anyone?) but there are veggie ones too. 

The Veggie Burger is full of all kinds of good stuff:  caramelized onions, mushrooms, lentils, green peas, brown & white rice, pumpkin puree, potato, bread crumbs, and mozzarella cheese ($8.50).  Mixed into a patty and lightly grilled, it tasted great especially with pesto slathered on top and sandwiched between a whole wheat bun.  Although the grilled zucchini add-on ($0.95) was greasy and the burger's texture was a bit mushy, I had no problems eating it up.   
 
The Buttermilk Onion Rings were nice and crunchy though heavy on the breading ($3.55).  You get about a half dozen and also an addictive ranch dressing for dipping.  Unfortunately, no room for dessert so next time I'll try the Nutella Burger.  Donuts for buns and nutella in the middle?  
 
Definitely my kind of "veggie" burger.   ;)
author: Amy C.

description:
Food - 3-4 stars
View - 5 stars
Service - 2 stars

As expected from a Hubert Keller restaurant, the food was good with some over the top items such as the Remixed Rossini burger which is a kobe beef burger stuffed with braised short ribs, topped with lobster, black truffles and truffle sauce on an onion bun. 

I had the Hubert Keller burger which was quite good, but nothing to write home about. Prices are somewhat expensive, but that's expected given the location. 

Overall a good choice if in the area, but in a city full of great dining options, there are better.
author: Michael B.

description: Sat at 5 p.m. Got our food at 6 p.m. I ordered the lamb burger because I've had the regular burgers and they are very bland. The meat was juicy and flavorful. But the pita bread was hard, close to unedible.  I'm writing this review in large part to remind myself to not go back.
author: Greg W.

description: Intrigued by the name and view I was, may I say I won't be recommending this place they only get 1 star because their alcoholic shakes were.... lets just say yummy!!!  My friend drank two of those like a boss lol. Tip: on your way up to burger bar may your elevator doors open at the Cheesecake Factory level and you hop off; trust me would have much rather had have dinner there, "drool" you can't ever go wrong @ the Cheesecake Factory. I'm 100 % sure I won't eat a burger there again.
author: Eli A.

description: Had the Hangover Burger with American cheese and the skinny fries. Good burger but lacked some seasoning. Good service and great view of Union Square.
author: David M.

description: Burger Bar is hard to hate, with it's infamous Nutella Shake and yummy burgers. It is pricy and there is a bit of a wait if you're going on a weekend for dinner, but nothing too ludicrous and it's an added bonus that I can cruise around macys while waiting and they'll call me. I did the Build A Burger and got the country natural patty, onion bun, and assortment of toppings. We got onion rings and curly fries, both good. He got the black jack, and we shared a nutella shake and cheesecake donut concotion for dessert. All in all, if you like "up-er scale" burgers and shakes (and nutella!), you can't go wrong here. Beautiful view of the decked out time square during the holidays too.
author: Fatima R.

description:
Yes, it is December so we had to wait an hour; but my family was out specifically for a birthday. 
Everyone had burgers but me, I had a chicken breast "build your own"; it was dry and tasteless even with mayo and pepper jack cheese. I had a hard time even chewing it. Our sever had way too many tables and although I managed to beg for other people's waters, not once did she refill my water or anyone's soda. This place would be good In a bind, but it's a super over-priced burger for the convenience of being right there in Macy's.
author: Courtney G.

description: This place used to be good but now it's trash due to the prices changing out of no where. The food is good but not for the $8 price change on everything on the menu. I can't believe they would do this to my beautiful girlfriend and I. It used to be our spot to go eat during our anniversary.
author: Ivan S.

description:
Start off with onion rings and beer battered jalapeño pickles. I won't steer you wrong. 
Next course. Onion bun. Kobe ncooked medium. Cheddar and pepper jack. Peppercorn sauce on side.
author: Beth K.

description:
Gourmet burgers are a dime a dozen now so if Hubert Keller wants to charge $20-40 for one, it better be DAMN GOOD.

But it was just okay.

I got the Hubert Keller burger which is a buffalo patty, caramelized onions, blue cheese, on a ciabatta bun with red wine shallot reduction.  I asked for this medium rare and I wasn't sure what I got.  The beef was grayish and didn't seem Grade A.  

The blue cheese was way too strong and salty which it tends to be so you need to either add less or lessen the impact with other flavors.  The ciabatta bun was a good idea and the red wine shallot reduction was nice and thick!  I appreciated a substantial sauce.

I did find myself dousing the burger in ketchup as the patty wasn't too flavorful and I couldn't get over the saltiness of the cheese.  The side of skinny fries that it comes with resembles McDonald's so it's nostalgic and hopefully healthier.

I also got a side of Greek salad which was messily strewn about, like it was made at TGIF's.  A little disappointed at the execution.  Good to know that a small portion is more than enough for two people.

My coworker and I split these items and it still cost us $19 each.  How is that possible?!
author: Shannon L.

description:
Burgers may not look like much, but they're quite filling. Built my own and added an egg--and I was stuffed. Downside, it didn't come with fries. But tried their beer float, not a ROOTbeer float, which was surprisingly tasty. They even split it into two glasses because I was sharing! It may be hyped up because it's a Hubert Keller restaurant but hey, it's pretty good. A place with burgers, beer floats, spiked milkshakes, and nutella dessert burgers, will automatically be cool in my book. 

Negative for waiting for the elevator to go up to the 6th floor though. Took waaaaay too long.
author: Valerie E.

description: Overpriced... 60dls for two classics burguers.& two pint glasses of beer..guide tips 15 & 20% wtf....
author: Edmundo P.

description:
I am normally a meat eater, and yet- I can't get enough of this place's veggie burger. I'm serious, this stuff is AMAZING. Just amazing. The best I've ever had in my life. Incredible. I love this place so much, I keep coming back for more and more. I love just about everything they serve, really.

Super recommended.
author: Emma G.

description: Tried burger bar for the first time today. Went with my friend after work. I almost didn't go because any restaurant in a mall wouldn't be very good. However I was pleasantly surprised!  The server recommended the Hubert Keller burger which turned out to be a great choice.  My friend had the chicken wings which were very good considering this is a burger place. I would recommend this place for anyone. Prices were decent, service was excellent and most importantly the food was great!!
author: Sasha G.

description:
***************** REVIEW 374 ******************

           Conveniently located on the roof top of Macy's Union Square. If you get the table looking to the Union Square, a gorgeous Christmas tree, an ice skating, and lovers hands in hands, it's beautiful view. 

          Burgers were never my thing. I tell you why, steak is my favorite pet, and I prefer to eat my meat as a whole piece med rare that way, not smash it up, grounded & between the patty. Although I would take the mini sliders anytime over a burgers. And we did just that here at Burger Bar,

          The sliders were fluffy, tasty, and just 2 bites, it was gone! We got all  2 types of beef, & turkey! The fries was also crispy, and somehow the server convinced me to order a milkshake & I did! Much tastier than I expected, must be the alcohol in it!

           So if you are shopping around here, it's a good place to have a quick bite before you drop!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Finally got to try their veggie patty and it was just okay. To me, there was nothing really special about their veggie burger, which is made in-house. It lacked taste, plus it was too soft and mushy. I got it protein style and wish I got it with the wheat buns instead because it was so difficult to hold the patty since it was so soft. It easily fell apart.

I did enjoy the fries and pesto that came with the burger, which added more taste to the patty. I probably won't be coming back here anytime soon, but I would go back to try their nutella burger.
author: Aiza B.

description:
I'm not proud of the fact that I had drunken burgers at this place after stumbling around Macy's and doing some drunken shopping, but I'm certainly glad I did.

I opted for the American Kobe beef burger with tomatoes, onions, and lettuce on a sesame bun; essentially a high-end version of the BK Whopper. Seriously. But then again, my discriminating palate was too busy swaying along to the handful of beers I'd had earlier that night.

Fries aren't included with the $17 Kobe burger, so I decided against it (and my thighs thanked me for it). Instead, I got an amber ale to drink. Whoopsies!

For a weeknight, the place was pretty packed. Service was just fine, and the burger was tasty, but I don't think I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Adena B.

description: Cecilio is an amazing server! Love him! He made our lunch one to remember! The place was pretty empty so the service was pretty quick.
author: rosanna b.

description: I came here for lunch yesterday. I had the Hubert Keller burger along with a Firestone Union Jack IPA. The burger was okay although it was overcooked (well done instead of medium rare). the bread was a little soaked in juices but the shallot and red wine reduction was good. Decent place but nothing exceptional. The view is nice though.
author: Julien S.

description:
The highlight of our meal was seeing Chef Keller walk through the restaurant and give us a nod hello.  I ordered the basic burger with cheddar cheese on a sour dough bun.
