I must say the bun was very disappointing.  There was no taste to this rather dry bun..we are in the sour dough capital I thought the bun could have been much tastier.  My friend had the buffalo burger.  She seemed to enjoy it but didn't rave about it either.  We also order the Sweet Potato fries.  A+ for presentation but a C at best for the fact that they were cold and limp.

I have been looking forward to trying Chef Keller's restaurant for quite sometime.  At $40 for 2 burgers and fries I won't rush back.
author: Sue P.

description:
went here because cheeseacke factory was too crowded.The burger is worse than Mac Donald!
Definitely will never come back again
author: Carolyn C.

description:
On 12-30-13 my daughter and I drove to San Francisco to try Hubert Keller's burger bar. We had read mixed reviews about it however I have a good friend locally that told me I would really enjoy it. And I have to say... He was right. I have seen numerous reviews negatively posted about the service here. However our server seem to be very attentive. His name was Josh I believe, and he was quite busy the place was packed, but he did still keep on top of our service including water drinks etc. 
Onto the food...
Started with the wings and their house buffalo sauce with blue cheese dip--very good not outstanding though. I ordered the le frog burger for myself (Black Angus shaved asparagus brie cheese portobello mushrooms truffle Mayo incl. fries). Nyah ordered the American classic which was as you can imagine your standard burger with bacon, cheese lettuce pickle onion tomato. Kind of lame that they charged us for Mayo for her burger. We both ordered medium rare, and that's exactly how it came medium rare. We both felt that our burgers were fantastic. The fries were also good they were crispy not soggy, and they went really well with my extra truffle Mayo hee hee hee hee. Great flavors with the burger! We finished the meal splitting their famous dessert which is the Nutella-hamburger. This was truly a delight. I didn't go into burger bar with super high expectations, but I'm glad that I didn't. I tend to be a little tough as a food critic. Maybe due to the fact that I've been professionally cooking in kitchens for 20 years now ha ha. All in all I would definitely go back again, the unfortunate thing is I've got another list of 20 other burger joints to hit up in San Francisco!! Oh in that being said, we live in Ukiah California population of about 20,000 people.  So you could imagine it doesn't take a lot to get us happy with new/good food. 
I recommend giving this place a try it's a little pricey but it's also still worth a shot.
Oh and we did see Hubert Keller there, I didn't talk to him but he looked like he was very nice person.
author: Taj M.

description:
I am slightly biased on my opinion because I was having such a great time.  I can say...
The Kobe burger and fries were good.  
The service was friendly and prompt.
The view was great.
Was the overall experience superb?  No.
Was it good?  Yes.
Will I return to try it again?  Most likely.
It's a fun place with decent food and a good view.
It's worth a try.
author: Dana B.

description: Food and drinks normal; not too exciting. Expensive! 5 BEERS and 2 burgers were $90 and I didn't even get a buzz on!
author: Melissa D.

description:
After a day of shopping we decided to go to Burger Bar because we were already in Macys. The girl at the front informed us the wait would be 5-10 minutes, which was fine with us, so we took a seat in the waiting area with a few others. As everyone around us got seated we noticed that people walking in we're being seated right away as well. It had been almost 20 minutes at this point so we returned to the counter and asked the same girl, who now seemed confused. Ummm, we had just talked to you about 20 minutes ago, and you had informed us there was a wait! It tuned out she had forgotten to write us down. At this point she seated us promptly and gave us menus. 

They have a nice selection of burgers that meet pretty much all food restrictions, which is nice. I had a friend who was vegan, and she was able to find something. You can pick your bun, and some of your sides as we'll.

I ended up going with the salmon burger, my friend got some form of veggie/vegan burger, and my other friend did a regular burger. The only con is sides are separate. They rang from 2$ something for fries to 4$ or so for onion rings. We decided to do a side of fries and onion rings. 

The food came out fast and looked tasty. The onion rings and fries were great. My friend liked her veggie burger, and my other friend enjoyed hers as well. The salmon burger was good, except for I had ordered well done and the salmon was not cooked in the middle. Portions were large, and we all ended up having a ton to take home.

Our waiter was friendly and attentive.

Nice location. If you can grab a window seat they have a nice view of union square.

Overall not a bad place. I might return in the future.
author: Jenn P.

description:
Kinda sucked. :(   
We only went here because Cheesecake Factory was going to be an hour wait and we were starving.  A red flag should've went up when they were able to seat us quickly.  That is the only thing they did quickly....we were there for eternity, painfully waiting for each thing.  Our waitress was so...so...absent.  We saw her maybe twice even though the place was only half full, if that.  We couldn't even find her to get silverware and napkins, I had to rustle them up myself from the waiters' station.  The atmosphere of this place was like that of an abandon saloon in the middle of a ghost town.  Now talk about sad...it's located in Macy's, in Union Square SF, and it was a weekend.  It should've been alive and kicking....but it was not.  We ordered the following:  onion rings, fried pickles, milkshake paddle, burgers, and fries.  The onion rings were the best onion rings I've ever tasted and the milkshake paddle was just so awesome we were taking pictures of it.  It was just fabulous because they give you 6 medium size milkshakes for $19.  You get two each of strawberry, chocolate, and caramel or something like that.  Everything else was average....the menu mainly consists of build-it-yourself stuff which if your not careful can land up costing you $20 a burger like it did me.  This build-it-yourself thing is for the birds...the whole thing was overwhelming and gave me a headache.  One more thing, stay away from the fried pickles, they were yuck yuck.  I will never go here again and Macy's should think about replacing this place with Gordon Ramsey's restaurant Burgr which deserves a primo location like this.
author: T F.

description:
Had a long day around town and my sister and I wanted to get something to eat. I had mentioned to her before that I saw a sign for Burger Bar while walking down Polk Street and we agreed later in the day that we would go there towards the end of the night since it was near our hotel.

Got to the 6th floor and were nicely greeted by a hostess. Sat in a comfy booth with a TV built into the divider wall. Ordered waters and looked over the menu. Sister got a beer. I wanted to get a cocktail, but wasn`t interested in any of their signature cocktails. Decided that we were going to share the Hubert Keller Burger which is what they call "Chef`s Burger." The burger also came with Skinny Fries.

When our burger came out, it was nicely split in half for us on two plates and an equal serving of fries (didn`t even have to ask, they just did it for us). The burger itself was made of Buffalo meat. First time ever having it and it was very tasty. The burger also has bleu cheese, caramelized onions, and sauteed spinach. I, at first, wasn`t so sure about the bleu cheese because bleu cheese is known for having a strong flavor, and I`m not partial to it, however, the cheese was very subtle and complimented the burger very nicely.

Overall, it was an okay burger. Nothing more, nothing less. You would think, that spending as much as you would at this place, you would expect something spectacular. I didn`t get that. Nice try Burger Bar, maybe the Las Vegas location will change my opinion.
author: Chris T.

description: The highlight of Burger bar was always the fat fries.  Now they are gone.  Bring them back!!!  The burgers are great,  if only they still had the fat fries.
author: B C.

description: After going to Umami Burger a couple weeks ago, Burger Bar seemed very below par. I got the famous Keller burger, which has buffalo meat, baby sprouts, and caramelized onions. The burger was alright, nothing very special. I ordered it to be medium well, and it was very well done and dry. However, the nutella shake was delicious, I would come back for it. Also, the views are nice, and we didn't have a long wait even though it was Pride day. Overall, not the best burgers in town.
author: Nikita K.

description:
I've been here a few times now, mostly for the view rather than the food.  This place has such a perfect view of Union Square, and the Cheesecake Factory is always so packed at night!  So.. we just come to the Burger Bar.  

The burgers are decent, nothing crazy or worth mentioning.  I do like the skinny fries though.  Prices can be kind of steep for the quality of the burger too.  The service has been great every time.  They're quick and helpful when you're totally undecided on what you want (I tend to be that way when it comes to burgers for some reason).  

Of course, I love that they have a full service bar.  

Overall, not my first choice, but if you're shopping in the area.. ehh why not?
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Location, location, location...Burger bar is located on the sixth floor of Macy's with a perfect view of Union Square and at this time of year there is the added attraction of viewing the christmas tree and ice skating ring.

Burger bar is the only place I know of that has a $60 dollar burger. Sixty bucks.....loaded with Kobe beef, foie gras, truffles, lettuce, and tomato. I ordered the Kobe burger ($16.50) where the beef was smooth like butter on a sesame seed bun. I thought the medium burger was very flavorful but I think that is the most I will spend for a burger. French fries and large pickle were served on the side.

The menu has salads, different burgers beef, chicken, turkey & veggie plus an assortment of fries: potato & sweet potato. Classic burgers with Angus beef start at $8.50. Burger bar also features sundaes and shakes which looked delicious (huge too!)

Thank goodness for the well stock bar and large selection of beers on tap. The wait can be up to hour or so on a busy weekend so it is worth it to call for reservations.
author: Jim D.

description: It is ok. The food is good. Milkshakes are fun. But it's nothing special. If you are in MACYS and it's cold or raining, so you don't want to go outside. This will be fine. I am in this store frequently and probably won't eat here again except the milkshakes. It's just a bit too expensive for  the average quality of food and dining experience.
author: Scott C.

description:
Just keep going up - to the Cheesecake Factory.  Skip this place, entirely.  

Fries were cold.
Cobb Salad was seriously out of a bag.
Forgot the dressing.
Forgot the cheese.
Forgot the drink. 
Fouled up the drink.

Are you all HIGH?  
You might need to be to enjoy this place.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
Underwhelming.

I was excited to try this place because of all the hype. Of course, it's partially my fault for listening to such hype, but I thought that Hubert Keller would know what he's doing...

My friends and I split the Hubert Keller and Surf 'n Turf. The Hubert Keller was pretty good; the caramelized onions and blue cheese was what made the burger. However, I've had similar burgers at other places and at WAY lower prices. The lobster in the Surf 'n Turf was dry and practically shriveled! TOTALLY not worth it. I would have rather gone to In-N-Out, if I had a choice between that and the Surf 'n Turf!

Their shakes are delicious for the first few sips, but it goes downhill because they are just way too sweet. Zucchini fries were delicious, though -- I would recommend those if you ever go (however, at an extra charge).
author: Angela K.

description:
A working lunch. It's raining out. Tired of Boudin's.  CF has an hour wait. Burger Bar has a 10 minute wait. 

I don't care how much it is because if its good then its worth it but honestly it wasn't all that good.  I ordered the Black Angus Beef with cheese.  Either the bread was stale and soaked up all the moisture from my burger or the burger was really dry to begin with. I chose the Fat Fries (which are sold separate) and they were cold.  Seriously?  Cold?  and Mushy? WTH?  FAIL. 

My friend ordered the same thing.  She liked her burger and had the same problem with her fries though.  Granted she puts on more mayo & ketchup than humanly possible but this is my review and based on my food/expierence I still give it a 2. 

Service was decent.  It was busy, its the holidays and it was around 1pm.  We still had to ask for our drinks to be refilled. Couldn't find our waiter and friend asked for mayo - she ended up just asking whom ever walked by to get it and that was done promptly. 

I will try it again with DH because he could live off burgers 24/7 if it were up to him.  So for now 2 stars.
author: Erika G.

description:
Walked into Burger Bar after a quick shopping trip to Macy's and checking out the Christmas tree at Union Square. We wanted a quick bite to eat and put our name down to request a table by the window. It was about a 15-20 min wait on a Sunday evening. So we grabbed what looked like the last 2 seats at the bar and enjoyed our cocktails (bar seats turned fairly quick as people were waiting for their tables). A bit on the touristy side but it's expected, it's Union Square.

Drinks - good cocktails and lots of selection of beer/wine/spirits. Nice bartender.
Food - I tried the sliders and fries. The sliders were a nice sampling of their popular burgers. I enjoyed them. The fries were good right when they came out but got a little hard if you didn't eat them fast enough. 
Service - Enjoyable and mostly prompt. It was nice they weren't in a hurry to shoo us away while we enjoyed the excellent view of Union Square. After our meal, we didn't see our waiter for a while as it got very busy and a large group just sat down behind us.

Overall Burger Bar was a nice spot if you're in the neighborhood. Not sure I would go out of my way to go there but possibly for drinks with friends if I'm shopping in the area and aren't in a super rush. Can't beat the view!
author: Cindy A.

description:
Took the kids here for a Friday afternoon milkshakes.  Hay...strawberry and nutella milkshakes...so good it was so bad, or should I say so bad it was so good...

We got a window table.  Perfect to play the eye spy game.  Gotta love Union Square.

I thought the burger was dry but I do want to come back for the hottest burger.  Let's see how hot is hot.  Kids meal was at $7.99, milkshakes $8.99.  I know, there's nothing cheap downtown.
author: Pam S.

description:
Talk about fancy schmancy!!!! 

When a place offers lobster, foie gras and black truffles as toppings for a hamburger, you know you're in for a pricey treat. 

Burger Bar is an upscale burger restaurant, located in the Macy's building in Union Square in San Francisco. BB has its own elevator that takes you directly to the restaurant, which is located on the 6th floor and boasts a beautiful view of downtown. BB is more like a Ruth Chris than a normal burger place like Red Robin or Islands. The staff wears fancy, all black outfits. The bar area and the dining room are both dimly lit and really fancy decorated. The one thing about BB that I really loved is that every booth has its own personal, small flat screen television that is hooked up with Direct TV. They actually let you watch what you want, which was cool for my group because we were able to watch some college football while we enjoyed our burgers. 

The menu at BB is pretty impressive. Besides the build you own burger option they also offer many signature burgers, one of which that costs $60 and contains a Kobe beef patty, sautéed foie gras, shaved truffles and maderia sauce (not sure what that sauce is but it sounds fancy). They also offer salads, chicken burgers, buffalo burgers and salmon burgers. After looking over the many options on the menu, this is what I created: 

Ciabatta Bread- Kobe Beef Patty- Blue Cheese- Pepper Jack Cheese- Avocado- Caramelized Onions- Jalapeño Bacon- Prosciutto- Button Mushrooms- Lettuce- Tomatoes- Pickles- Pesto Sauce- Garlic Aioli 

My burger was fantastic. This was defiantly one of the better burgers I have had from a build your own burger restaurant. The Kobe patty was big, juicy and flavorful. All the toppings were great, especially the jalapeno bacon, which was super crispy and had a nice spicy flavor. To go along with our burgers my friends and I shared an order of sweet potato fries and onion rings, both of which were wonderful. BB also has an incredible dessert menu. They have a build your our milkshake option that offers some of the coolest mix ins I have ever seen. You can mix in things like Nutella, Twinkies, Peanut Butter, and all different types of candies, etc. They also have dessert burgers that use donuts for buns and contain different fruits and other sweet condiments. 

Since BB is an upscale place I was expecting the service to be great, and it was. Our waitress was super friendly, even after we kept asking her to change our TV from one football game to another. The entire time we were there, she was very attentive and chit chatted with us whenever she stopped by our table and checked on us. 

The reason I think BB has such a bad rep on Yelp is because of the high prices. Again, this place is an upscale restaurant so I knew ahead of time that I was going to have to drop at least forty dollars for a burger. The burger patty itself and all the toppings were of higher quality so I did not mind the high prices. To be honest it was not the best burger I have ever had but it was still amazing. If I lived in SF I would not eat here on a daily basis because the prices are so high but it is definitely worth check out.
author: Craig R.

description:
I'm not sure if this is the best spot to come before a wedding day, but we did.  Then I was sure the bride-to-be would not eat a hamburger, but she did.  At least it was a veggie burger I guess.

This menu of American food that is probably soaked in corn oil before being served was overpriced. The only reason we ended up here was, because we all were so hungry, indecisive, and Cheesecake factory's waiting time was 45 minutes. 

I must say that I loved the sweet patato fries with my fish and chips order. This appetizer order of 2 pieces of fish sticks and a bowl of fries was $9.  Now you can envision the price of the rest of the menu. 

I don't think I will return to this place just because I don't believe in tourist prices.
author: Moua L.

description:
My first five minutes at this place was TERRIBLE. Their host was unbelievable rude and unkind.

Luckily our service improved. We had Brendan (I think that's his name... skinny, tall blonde guy). He was really nice, gave us great recommendations, and even let us vent about our terrible first five minutes.

The food is great, we had milkshakes and split sliders. 

I love the booths, they have little TV's with current sports programs. If they could replace their host in the front, this place would easily be a fantastic Woohoo, As Good As It Gets!
author: Alli J.

description:
This has been on my list of restaurants to try and since I was shopping in the area and needed a place to land to watch the Giants game, Burger Bar seemed like the perfect spot. 

We requested a seat in the bar so we can watch the game but our wait was still 50 minutes. The only area that was first-come, first-serve was the actual bar which could seat 15 peeps, 20 peeps at the most. Nothing opened up during our entire wait. To be honest, 50 minutes seemed reasonable considering everyone was in town for the Women's Nike Marathon and not to mention all the Giant fans roaming the streets of San Francisco to watch the game. 

When we were finally seated and had a chance to look at the menu, we were shocked at the prices of these burgers. $22?! These darn things better be worth it, Chef Hubert Keller!  I was tempted to try the $60 Rossini burger but figured if I enjoyed this meal so much, I might go back and get it next time around. 

For this visit, I decided on the Hubert Keller burger which was buffalo, caramelized onions, baby spinach and blue cheese. My dinner date ordered the American Classic which was black angus, american cheese, bacon, tomato and onions. I also ordered a size of onion rings extra crispy as per what a few yelpers mentioned in the review.

Although we both thought our meals were delicious - they weren't out of this world, never tasted anything like this before, got to have, kind of burger. They had great flavors and were cooked well but I gotta tell ya, I would have a hard time paying $60 for the Hubert Keller burger.  The onion rings on the other hand were fan-freakin-tastic! I think the extra crispiness is what made them great. They didn't fall apart when you ate and the flavors were tasty. We ate ever single one of those babies and there were plenty. 

The decor however was not very charming. It was like a Marie Calendars/Cheesecake factory blended into one. Not sure where Chef Hubert Keller was going with this but if he was going to be charging that kind of money for burgers, he could've thought about the decor a little more. Perhaps an afterthought?

I'd definitely go here again but I'd have to be feeling pretty darn good to order the $60 Rossini burger and might have to try the other $15-20 burgers before I get to that point. I reserve the right to order in the future though....
author: Sharon V.

description: A friend and I arrived at 12:30 on a Saturday afternoon. We were seated right away and were able to get a table right by the window. Our server came by within a few minutes to take our drink order. We had to order a Nutella shake, which, thankfully, we split. Wow! Best thing ever! Unfortunately, I didn't leave enough room to truly enjoy my awesome lunch. I ordered a turkey burger with Swiss cheese, carmelized onions, button mushrooms, and truffle mayo on a whole wheat bun. I also ordered a side of zucchini fries. I was only able to eat about half of the food and I was stuffed! I did not think it was extremely overpriced. I'm from L.A. and the price seemed average compared to what I've had down there. Overall, it was a great experience- good service, great food, excellent view!
author: Erin R.

description: Sorry but the burgers are average here. The location is great, the service is great, price is decent..... but you just come with high expectations when everything listed above is 4 stars. Medium burger was a little dry and over. Bun was just too big for the patty and a little dry. Their zucchini fries were good just wish the burger matched everything else
author: Stanley W.

description:
----------LUNCH ONLY------
When it's sunny out, the view is BEAUTIFUL from this restaurant. Came here around 12:30PM on a Wed and was seated right away (although the restaurant looked really full). Ordered the Le "Frog" burger which was super savory and filling. Overall, the reviews are pretty accurate. The burgers aren't bad but they're pricier than most places and depending on what you order and how good it is, it will make you wonder whether these burgers are really worth the premium tag. The burgers, while good, still seem consistent with most other places (aside from the awesome view) so ....maybe the premium is in the view.
author: Diana Y.

description:
If I close my eyes I'll have a flashback to saturday night with the girls on our way to Union Square: 
My friend driving like a NY Taxi driver on PCP... IN downtown San Francisco. Us girls in our calm and cool flats before we head off to the club in our sky high heels to commit shoeicide... Oh yeah were talking about burgers, yeah? Nice some what dim ambiance. Did I mention you also DON'T have to wait 2 hours for the elevator and 2 hours for a table at this place? This also seems to be one of the go-to's for tourists that are in the area.  It's perfect for a nice calm dinner in the middle of the city- with a nice view. 


Don't let the prices scare you! You're gonna get what you pay for! Us girl decided to share a platter of fish & chips for appetizers and they were oh so delicious! Nothing fishy there- it was fresh, fresh! I like to keep my burgers simple so I got the American Classic. I'm definitely not a bacon eater but I always make exceptions when they're on a burger. You wont get some pencil thin mystery meat junk- you'll get a nice thick patty cooked how you want it and its perfectly seasoned. The skinny fries are a great addition but OH! The skinny GARLIC fries that went with the fish & chips were the beeeezzzz'z kneeeez aka HELLA GOOD. 

Great service, the manager was kinda funky and was almost close to borderline hitting on us since we were dressed up- but he was nice and handled the  bill after a little confusion. 

This place is definitely a will come back again type of place- maybe not often as it's so expensive, but its worth it. One star off because it took a little long for someone to take our orders and my friend's drink was way too strong when the waitress said it was more fruity than strong. Overall this place is a definite go to.
author: Monina C.

description: Hands down the best burger I have ever eaten. Kobe-style beef patty...carmelized onions...Brie...  Simple ingredients, but they were assembled perfectly.  View was amazing, too.  Highly recommended.
author: Andrew J.

description:
This place kind of feels like a tourist trap (sorry, Hubert Keller). My sister and I split "le frog" burger. The burger was pretty good, and I loved the brie cheese. However, it was not worth the $$$$ price.

Also, DO NOT get the cocktails. They were disgusting.
author: Wendy S.

description:
Took effin 15 minutes before we were given ANY attention and it was only for our water glasses. Another 5 minutes passed before we got our utensils (and one set was dirty) and yet another 5 minutes before our server came! We sat there for nearly 30 minutes before someone FINALLY came to take our order! WTH? At LEAST ten employees walked past us and it took that long before we were even taken care of??

Classic burger
[+/-] meh. Just a normal cheese burger
[-] w/ two pieces of bacon that looked like it was just microwaved
[-] no sauce either so pretty bland
[-] NOT WORTH $14

Le 'frog' burger
[+] pretty good!
[+] angus beef w/ brie and asparagus!
[+] truffle sauce too! Mmm P:
[-] $18!? So expensive!!

[+] burger price comes with a side of fries in a cute mini fryer container
[+] and you have a choice of skinny, curly, or sweet potato
[-] but pretty damn pricey for decent food

I'll consider coming back just to sit by the bar or something. The alcohol is pretty standard pricing.
author: Sandy T.

description: I was so excited to try this restaurant because I am a huge fan of Hubert Keller but I have never been so disappointed with a dining experience. We ordered zucchini fries & mozzarella sticks...the mozz sticks weren't cooked enough & was still solid cheese & the zucchini sticks were a mushy mess. My build your own burger arrived & looked fantastic but when I picked it up the bottom was soggy from the grease.@ grease dripped down my arms...overall a very unpleasant experience.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I asked for my burger med rare and my American classic came rare. Fries tastes like it was fried a long time ago. Nutella Milkshake was just ok, and bit too sweet. 
Service was nothing to commend about. Won't be going back.
author: Ender X.

description:
Today was my third and final meal at Burger Bar. The first time, a few years ago, was pretty good. We had sliders and a few other things. Everything was tasty, as far as I can remember. An extra treat was that we spotted Hubert Keller, and I took a pic of him and the Hubster. Maybe that good experience flavored our visit more than I remember.

The second visit was less than 2 years ago, and it was just OK. I had the veggie burger - admittedly, not the best choice at a burger place. But the Hubster, a HUGE burger fan, wasn't that impressed either. Still, we hadn't given up. 

Today, on our third and now final visit, both of us were unimpressed. My Angus beef burger was fine. Not great, fine. The sweet potato fries were not seasoned well. They were bland. Same goes for the skinny fries. Hubster had one of the specialties and well, it wasn't very special. Our son's grilled cheese sandwich was pretty good and had lots of cheese. As we left Macy's, we wondered aloud if we couldn't have done better at the Cheesecake Factory. That makes me a little bit sad to say.

Good points? Our server was friendly, as was another whom we asked about crayons, which they don't seem to have. (Not so good, since they have kids placemats with word games and other activities.) The baby loved the giant windows and watching all the activity down below, so it kept him nice and busy.

However, at this rate, with the food quality decreasing on each visit, I wouldn't want to risk another visit here. Hubert, you let us down.
author: BlackDog S.

description:
Stopped for a break after exploring the city and a light dinner before a birthday party

Nice location and atmosphere - we just sat at the bar - service was lacking we were at the end and seemed like we were an after thought when they happen to come down to register 

Food was good - we will come back for a full meal.

Had....

cup of clam chowder - it was a little thin for my liking but it had really good flavor and lots of clams 

Jalapeño pickles - these are a really nice take on fried pickles 

Onion Rings - think crispy 

Chicken wings - hubby ate all of them so don't know - but must have been good
author: Misty L.

description:
So came back today for lunch and got the Tuesday special - the patty melt.  It's a ground beef burger with melted monterey jack cheese, grilled onions and mushrooms on a sesame bun. Comes with sweet potato fries and a beverage.  Still $11.75.  Ordered medium and came as ordered.

There's a daily special posted a black chalkboard.  This is where it's worth it.  Everything else on the menu seems expensive so stick with the special.
author: Shirley N.

description:
I've been to Burger Bar a handful of times (I'm a Hubert Keller AND a burger fan!) and each time has been great. I had my birthday dinner here earlier this month. When I called ahead they weren't taking reservations for that weekend (holiday season) so we had to wait for our table for 12 for about 45 minutes. That wasn't a  problem since it gave us time to browse around Macy's. My favorite thing to order is the Le Frog Burger which is a black angus patty with melted brie cheese, shaved asparagus, portobello mushroom, truffle mayo and served on an onion bun. It is heaven for your taste buds! This place is also famous for their alcoholic milkshakes and beer floats. My favorite is the Irish Coffee milkshake, it's such a guilty pleasure! 

All in all, this is a great place for groups, out-of-town guests (great view of union square), or any burger fans. If you have  6 or less people in your group, ask for the booths with the built-in TVs! I can't wait to go back!
author: Lorajean F.

description:
I'm downgrading Burger Bar - due to a recent dining experience in late Dec 2010.  My manager was taking a group of us out to lunch to celebrate the holidays.  We made reservations for a group of 26 of us for lunch.  The Burger Bar insisted that we order from a set menu as they could not accommodate such a large group.

It was a full house that day.  Having worked in the restaurant field before - I have a tolerance for good and poor service.  We were seated on the right side of the private room taking three long tables.  It took the Burger Bar staff a while to get us seated and drinks served.  The waitstaff was nice, clueless, and at times MIA (missing in action).  

The 1st & 2nd tables were served and 50% way done with their lunch.  Our table 7 out of 9 persons were served 25% done with they lunch, while myself and a colleague waited, and waited, and waited...

Ten more minutes goes by and a waitress stops by our table - take a look and walks away.  Ten more minutes goes by - I flag our waitress and ask her its been 20 mins and now our table is almost 75% done with their meals - where's out food?  "Oh - let me check" 

She returns 10mins later says the kitchen is working on it.  I had a chat with the manager and informed him of our wonderful experience thus far.  Ten minutes later he returns with the two missing meals.  Now everyone in out group is done,  I boxed my lunch...

The only thing done right was we were comp for those two entrees, I'm done with the Burger Bar - it's no long my favorite burger joint in San Francisco..... :(
author: Rich W.

description: Great food and environment at a reasonable price, and great views of Union Square. We regularly visit when in SF. Down to earth, but  varied menu.. Shakes are amazing!
author: Ryan O.

description:
We had lunch here today when they opened and we sat at a great table with an awesome view of Union Square

I've eaten at the Las Vegas restaurant many times and the food was the same.  Just okay.

I had the veggie burger which is pretty mushy but I like that it is so healthy so I tolerate it.  The daughter had the angus cheese burger with bacon and she said it was pretty salty.

The fries were good. 29 bucks for two burgers and one side of fries. No drinks.  Eh

Today union square was evacuated due to a suspicious package, fortunately we had just left before the lock down.....
author: Foodlover B.

description: Decent burgers, decent view, but lackluster service and unappealing environment and ambience. Feels more like a cafeteria than a fancy restaurant or special experience. I also had a hard time making a reservation: no-one ever picked up the phone and voicemail box was full. Email worked but took a few days. There are better burgers out there, give this one a miss.
author: rebecca p.

description:
$24.99 for a friggin burger!??!?!? I reeeeeally had hoped that burger would make me drool and salivate when thinking about it after the experience.. but I don't think so Tim. 

It was good, don't get me wrong... but for the portion and the price, it was not worth it. We had stopped by at around 1030pm, and STILL, the wait was unbearable on a Thursday night! Sadly, it was the only option around that was open.
author: Deanna G.

description:
I was a little hesitant coming to Burger Bar, as I figured it would be a tad touristy...Overall the place is "ok."  The location is nice as it overlooks Union Square.

I came here with the intention of getting a burger.  Ended up going for a "Valentine's Weekend Prix Fix" for two people.  $60 for either soup or salad, angus steak w/ gorgonzola mashed potatoes, and a dessert platter consisting of a mini chocolate and fruit "dessert burger," "funnel cake fries" and a mini strawberry milkshake.

The best parts of the meal I must admit were the squash soup with goat cheese mouse and the gorgonzola mashed potatoes!

I think I'll come back to try a burger in the future; however, I'm guessing this is the kind of place you come to once just  for the sake of trying.
author: Matt S.

description:
I was up in SF with a friend of mine and we thought it might be fun to do something really touristy despite the fact that we've been all over SF.  So we hopped on one of those red double decker tour buses and went to the golden gate bridge.  During the ride over the tour guide mentioned a lot of food places that were SF landmarks.  Craving a burger, we asked him for recommendations.  So we recommended some random restaurant on embarcadero and told her to take the muni.  We ended up taking the bart and muni that night, as we wondered into so random restaurant near the stadium to find out that burgers were not on their menu.  They did however have burgers on their lunch menu and let us order them anyways...ANYWAYS..tangent aside, burger bar is better than that place (which name escapes me)..

Story aside, I actually like burger bar.  I like that there are a lot of options and  the first time I was here I remember my burger really hitting the spot.  The second time, I don't know what was missing, but I wish my burger was juicer.  I ordered it medium and it just wasn't as juicy as I would have liked.  The fries were good, but not anything to write home about.  

I also had to subtract a star since one page of their menu consists a la carte menu items to add to your burger, but I wish it was better organized for easier ordering.  I really preferred the check off lists that they have at the counter vs scanning through two pages of menu to figure out where the mushrooms are  (..are they under grilled veggies or veggies?).  But I suppose adding a check list would make this place less trendy.  =(  All and all, a ok burger...still need to check out spruce though!

BTW, at least this place has a great view of union sq!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
My husband and I were out on a Friday night shopping in Union Square when hunger struck the both of us.  I have wanted to try Burger Bar for quite some time but haven't had the chance so I suggested it  and since the there was no wait, it was a perfect choice. 

It's a pretty casual setting - I actually expected it to be a bit bigger.  
Love their extensive menu of different types of burgers, condiments, sides, milkshakes etc.  

My husband and I shared a milkshake which was just perfect for the both of us.  I ordered a burger with onion rings (yum!) and my husband had a burger with sweet potato fries.  Our bill totaled $48 which wasn't too bad but it's a bit pricey for burgers and fries.  Everything tasted great and we'll definitely stop by again.
author: Christine P.

description:
The burgers are awesome and perfectly cooked. For that ultra customized eaters, come on and stop inside! Of course pay more for add ons. It's sort of worth it, but it gets pricey. 

Cons: workers dropping utensils often, small cramped restaurant, and pricey.

You should try because: the atmosphere is unique and tvs at every table, tasty burgers, and non-pestering staff.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Union Square has horrible food. 
Burger Bar is decent, but overly expensive for what it is. 
My burger was about $19 bucks, but tasted like a $10.
author: T J.

description:
Whether you choose a chef's creation burger or build-your-own, you can get pretty much any kind of burger you can imagine at Burger Bar.  Since you can pick your meat, cheese, toppings, and sides.... I had to build my own.

I ordered a Black Angus Beef burger with swiss cheese on a ciabatta bun, topped with caramelized onions and avocado!  The meat was cooked perfectly.. and how often do you get a ciabatta bun on a burger?! One word: DELICIOUS.  I also got a [huge] side salad.  The lettuce, cucumbers and baby tomatoes were crazy fresh.  And everything was washed down with a nice cold Stella!

So, food wise, it's kinda like a tastier version of The Counter Burger with a nice view of Union Square.  But pretty pricey for a burger.  I enjoyed a pretty awesome meal here and I will be back to make a whole different burger.
author: Tim L.

description:
Situated high on the 6th floor of Macy's in Union Square, the restaurant has an incredible view of Union Square.  We had window seating with the perfect bird-eye view of the big Christmas tree and outdoor skating rink.  Nothing gets you into the holiday spirit like the lights on the tree twinkling in the darkness of the night, unless you're a Scrooge!

We ordered the Rossini burger (kobe beef, sauteed foie gras, shaved truffles, and Madiera sauce on an onion bun, $60.00) and the Surf & Turf (black angus beef, grilled half lobster, and grilled asparagus, $24.50) and the pina colada alcoholic milkshake ($11.50).  People who are price-conscious should not bother stepping foot into the Burger Bar.  You go there for the experience, so don't expect McDonald prices.  There's a Burger King just around the corner.

The Rossini burger was magical.  The Kobe beef was definitely tender like it should be.  The Madiera sauce was so flavorful.  I wish it came in a bigger bowl, so I can dunk the entire burger in it.

The waiter made a big deal when we ordered the Rossini burger and insisted on giving us a free dessert.  However, we were still charged for the Pina Colada alcoholic milkshake, despite what the waiter said.  But whatevs...
author: Melinda Y.

description:
Burger Bar is a burger joint from a gourmet chef (Hubert Keller) at gourmet prices (~$20 a burger) that serves painfully-mediocre food. 

On the list of well-known, superstar chefs, Hubert Keller has always been the one that I always scratch my head about -- I thought Fleur de Lys was all presentation with mediocre taste. But a burger joint shouldn't be too difficult for a renowned, experienced chef, right? Maybe for Keller it is.

The Le "Frog" Burger, with brie cheese, shaved asparagus, sprouts, and garlic aioli, was just okay. The flavors weren't very strong, so it didn't have anything special going for it. The thick meat patty wasn't cooked enough for a "medium," so it was just an unseasoned, mushy burger. I've also had the Hubert Keller burger, which I had at a "medium," but was strangely too well-done, so it was just an unseasoned, dry burger. 

The one redeeming factor? Burger Bar has some pretty killer fries. Both the regular and sweet potato fries were delicious -- perfectly crispy. The view of Union Square is also a good reason to come up for a drink or two.

As for the main star of the show, Burger Bar's burgers just aren't good enough for the outlandish prices. In fact, if you just walk a few blocks down, you'll hit Pearl's Burgers, which has burgers that are phenomenally better at 1/3 of the price. 

There are so many delicious burgers in SF that Burger Bar should only be considered if: (1) you're shopping at Macy's and your lazy ass is too hungry and tired to leave the Macy's building, or (2) you are a tourist who doesn't know any better.
author: Roy C.

description: Veggie burger? Fabulous! Shakes? Spot on.  Fries? Terrific. Those who claim tasteless must be smokers who have killed their taste buds. Can't believe this isn't a 4.5 star place on Yelp. Get it together, people. Cheesecake factory is another big chain. .. burger bar is a special experience.
author: Rachel F.

description: I've continued to visit this location and the burgers are always amazing. I like building my own. Now I just need to make a stop at the Vegas location. Hope it's still there.
author: Karla B.

description: I would go back. :) Definitely a costlier place because it's right by union square and it has a view, but I enjoyed it. At first we were not greeted right away and not given menus, but once we finally got our waitress she was very helpful. The food and drinks were all very tasty! We got some alcoholic milkshakes and two burgers and it was more than we could eat. There was just us two so we scored a table right next to the window overlooking the square.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Burger - http://mw1.merriamwebster.com/dictionary/burger
Bar - http://mw1.merriamwebster.com/dictionary/bar

If you were to combine these two definitions, you would get this place, right?
Or if you defined the word "Bar" to mean the standard, then this place should exemplify what a basic burger should taste like.
Too tangent-y? Yeah, I know.

Anyway, there's a scene in Pulp Fiction when Vincent tries Mia astonishingly $5 milkshake.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eV31ucu2vWM&feature=related

That being said (or seen), my burger was good but it not f-ing good, and I expected f-ing good!
Maybe if I was more keen in choosing the correct combination of meat and cheese, my burger would have been tastier.  But I really am not willing or wanting to work that hard for a burger. 

Oh well, I've spent more on worse.
author: Dan B.

description:
If you're going to spend this much money on a burger, I suggest doing it elsewhere where you don't have to deal with pretentious wait staff.  My water was filled in a sloppy manner, no ice, not even filled beyond 2/3 of the glass.  The Pinot Grigio for happy hour was not even mediocre.  

I had a turkey burger, nothing too fancy.  I got it with blue cheese and carmelized onions but a sauce was lacking.  Unfortunately you pay for the cheese, sauteed onions or mushrooms, AND the sauce.  The zuchinni fries were good in that they were less greasy than other places zukes, but this meal wasn't worth the cost of $27.  

The attire us supposed to be casual, but it seemed the guys in collared shirts were getting better service.

Not coming back here ever.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I don't understand why this place got such low reviews...  yes, it is much more than you would pay for a burger, but you really have to look at the ingredients used in each dish!  

I got here way earlier and decided to sit first and wait at the table.  The host was really snooty and wasn't really friendly, so I was glad that I wouldn't have to deal with him a whole lot.  The wait staff, on the other hand, are friendly, attentive, and very pleasant.

While I was waiting, I ordered a beer and soon got so hungry that I ordered some zucchini fries to munch on while I wait.  The zucchini fries were really well done - crispy on the outside (even when having sat in the basket for a while) and so flavorful and steamy in the inside.  

I had the Hubert Keller Burger - buffalo meat patty served on a ciabatta bread then topped with sauteed spinach...  the meat is sooooooo yummy, and the flavors all come together very well.  I chose to get the skinny fries with the burger and it was crispy perfection - until the last bite!

I finished off the meal with the Irish Coffee Shake.  This is one of the alcoholic shakes on the menu, and it was so yummy!  It was sweet and chocolatey without being TOO sweet - a trait I detest in desserts.

Overall, it was a great meal.  I just took a star off my review because I REALLY didn't like the way the host made me feel like I was intruding on him for walking through the door.  His unfriendliness aside, the whole meal was a wonderful experience.
author: Vicky P.

description:
Every time I try and come here it's a tourist nightmare. I mean, I'm partially to blame because I shouldn't try to eat anywhere around Union Square on a weekend, but I'd heard a lot of good things about this place and I really wanted to try it!

Today it seemed like the stars were aligned for me. Despite being the start of the Game Developer's Conference, Union Square was surprisingly empty around lunch time today, so I took my visitor from out of town to Burger Bar to see if our luck would continue. When we got out of the elevator on the sixth floor at Macy's, it looked like Burger Bar was about half empty! YAY!

I wasn't super hungry, so I went with the turkey burger on wheat with just lettuce, tomato, and onion. The bun was super fresh and a little crunchy from being grilled and the turkey patty was perfectly seasoned. I only added a little bit of yellow mustard  and the crisp veggies and it was fantastic! My guest tried the Hurbert Keller burger which he said was one of the best burgers he's ever had!

The restaurant is very clean and stylish with a fantastic view of Union Square. Our waiter was very polite and attentive and kept our water glasses filled. Very classy operation and definitely my favorite burger place in the city now!
author: Jason W.

description:
No no no.

If your name includes 'burger' in the title, you better be ready to throw down some lust-worthy sandwiches.

Unfortunately, Burger Bar doesn't live up to the hype. For $12 or considerably more depending on cut and/or type of meat and toppings, you get a decidedly average to above average burger. American cheese? Boring buns? Sigh. At least the meat was juicy. I got excited at the prospect of sweet potato fries but they too underwhelmed. Maybe there are just too many burger-centric bars excelling in Chicago, but Burger Bar failed to impress.

Service is okay if a bit detached. However, the views of Union Square are killer. Burger Bar? A tourist spot worth skipping.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Visiting SF for the weekend and found this great hangout. We were trying to get a drink at Cheesecake Factory and couldn't get in the door. We stumbled upon the Burger Bar and were pleasantly surprised.  The ambiance of the bar is modern sports themed. They have speakers in the ceiling that drown out the chatter, so you hear music or the game from everywhere you sit. 

We requested a seat by the window that overlooks the square. It was perfect for people watching the skating rink. 

We had the fish and chips appetizer with a couple of drinks. The fish was moist and the garlic fries were to die for!!!  The only negative I had was that they couldn't/wouldn't accommodate a zombie, although they had the ingredients. 

I would recommend this bar for a place to rest your tired feet, quench your thirst and grab a snack.
author: Pamela N.

description:
Second time here and unfortunately, will never go back. Customer service is lacking. 
Drinks came in dirty glasses food on dirty plates. 
Food - my burger was over cook ( I ask for med it came well) my date ask for med and it came still mooing, returned the burger and still was charged. Server didn't even ask if we wanted to get something in exchange.  
 
We had a birthday and all the server said was "oh happy bday" when I said we had a birthday. 
There must have been a water shortage cause we couldn't get our glasses refilled.
. 
If I want an overpriced burger I'll go to Lark Creek down the street at least their burgers are edible and the service is fantastic.
author: Hello M.

description: Silvia was so helpful and welcoming, she helped us place our orders of five. We all enjoyed the food very much and customer service was outstanding! Great job Silvia!
author: N. A.

description: This place is a cool place in the city to grab an elegant burger ane have a drink or two.. Reallly chill and kick back I love it
author: Frank N.

description:
Truthfully, I don't want to like this place. A restaurant on the sixth floor of Macy's? Get serious! I was skeptical even trying it. Unfortunately, it's great.

I got a big fat juicy mushroom swiss burger, cooked perfectly, with all the trimmings stacked neatly on the side. Hard to find at any price, but this one was only 13 bucks (with sweet potato fries). 

Great view of Union Square.
author: Rick S.

description: Nice place to have a couple of pints and a burger and watch a game, but the burger here doesn't really do much for me.  Nice atmosphere, good beer selection, good fries though.
author: Mike C.

description: This is one of our go-to places any time we visit SF. We saved it for our last evening, to make our last dinner here special. We arrived at 8:45 (they closed at 10:00), and were told that the kitchen is closed. We asked why it was closed over an hour before the restaurant closed and the hostess just kept on repeating, "Sorry, the kitchen is closed."  Terrible customer service. Such a shame.
author: Mark S.

description:
I really only love this place because of the view! I usually only come during the holidays so we can sit by the window and have a perfect view of Union Square with the Christmas Tree and ice skating rink. Plus it's conveniently located inside Macy's and we can do our shopping all day long. 

The food is mediocre. It's good, don't get me wrong, but it's a tad overpriced. I feel like they don't give you enough fries ever and the additional add-ons are kinda pricey as well. A side salad is about 8 bucks and it's very small. However, the food is tasty and the service has always been good. 

The wait time can be a bit of a hassle if you come on a weekend. During the week there usually isn't a wait but on a Saturday during SantaCon we waited for about 45 minutes. The bathrooms are clean and the location is convenient. I highly recommend going here at least once just to see the view during the holidays. It is worth the price to go here for a fun once in a while treat.
author: Dusty N.

description: Got food poisoning there not once and twice. Avoid at all costs. Food is also overpriced for what you are getting. There's nothing special about why you're getting.
author: Tony L.

description:
If you get a table without a view, you've lost 50% of what you are getting. The food is good, fat fries are FABULOUS, but the last time I went I was shoved in a corner booth by the kitchen and had not one, not two, not three, but FOUR different servers. They kept moving them from our 'section' to another.  It was almost comical!

I think that it is pricier than it needs to be, however it didn't bother me when I was there and had a nice view. 

Husband and son both said they had had better burgers elsewhere.

I have wanted to try an 'adult milkshake' both times, but knew there was no way I could also eat my meal. Wish they did a 'tasting' shake!

This is a great tourist stop, but not a place I could see myself eating at regularly.
author: LA O.

description: This place is so amazing! I was craving a burger but wanted to eat healthy and they had the perfect option! Low cal burger which came with a salad, and skinny fries! It was so satisfying for someone who hates salads and dieting. And since I got low cal burger I sprang for the nutella milkshake, it was the BEST THING EVER! I also had the nicest waiter,  Cecilio. He was so kinda and fun. He was always checking up on us and making us laugh. I will definitely be back for more amazing food and service.
author: Fifi Z.

description:
The HK Burger (named for it and the Burger Bar's creator Hubert Keller), is the best darn restaurant burger I have encountered on my transcontinental quest.

The restaurant is on a high floor of the Macy's on Union Square and so its location comes with an impressive view but the the canned volume of the department store. Also, it's frequently packed to the gills, and waiting could only be not horrible here if you're in need of new ladies undergarments.

Location aside, noise aside, this place serves - I repeat - the BEST (restaurant) BURGER EVER.

The HK Burger is not the only superstar burger on the menu (I haven't even tried the chocolate dessert burgers), but it's the best. It's American bison with caramelized onions, sauteed spinach, bleu cheese and red wine-shallot sauce on a ciabatta bun. There's a reason it sounds weird and not-weird at the same time: it's French. Like Keller himself, the burger is French cooking expertise at its finest applied to American cuisine. But ciabatta's Italian! Perhaps. But a baguette in bun form would just be ciabatta, wouldn't it? In any case, it's designed to perform the French bread function of absorbing the meat's juices, and it performs perfectly.

Keller admits he knew little about burgers at all before tasked with creating a burger-themed restaurant. So that's his secret: bypassing the standardization that's happened to the American "burger". It's only a grilled red-meat sandwich! Chefs should take that concept and run, but so many top it with the exact same five ingredients. At least the Big Mac uses "secret" pickley thousand-island dressing. It's time for more red wine-shallot experimentation. Red meat goes with more than American cheese, lettuce and tomato.

Do make a stop here. If you're a master chef yourself, buy one of Keller's books (his latest has the HK Burger in it, and the Burger Bar has its own recipe book for sale), but be warned: the recipes are as complex as anything in Bon Appetite.

P.S. Beer floats. They've got a good but tiny bar - this is an excellent place to get drunk at dinner, which is probably Macy's' idea.
author: Jack H.

description:
Awesome view and a great burger. I've
been here a few times for lunch when I'm in town and I'm always pleased. It's a great place to meet people or show some folks who haven't been to San Francisco before.
author: Michael R.

description: I enjoyed my time here. I dunno maybe I have low expectations? The waiters name was Ari not sure if im spelling it right but he was awesome ha! I got a kobe burger and then ordered the desert burger which we split in 4 mini pieces divided by 4! Yes you can split that delicious little piece of heaven into 4 pieces! It was so good ha. We talked about baseball he is a Dodger fan in SF hahahaha, but im still going to enjoy a good conversation about some NL West Baseball!
author: Kyle R.

description:
Finally got to try this place out after passing it up multiple times, even in Vegas, because I heard mixed things. My experience here was mixed as well, but when it comes down to the food, it was fantastic.

I tried the American Style Kobe Beef in my burger and, wow, it was awesome. I am going to have a tough time eating other burgers from now on. I got the Peppercorn Burger (subbing the Kobe Beef for the meat that typically comes with that menu item) and was surprised that the "peppercorn cream sauce" was actually more like a gravy and it was delicious.

The food was amazing, but the rest of the experience was so-so. Couldn't figure out why we weren't able to change the channel on the table's TV, literally none of the servers could crack a smile, some of the orders at our table came out a little wonky (missing sauces here and there), and the price was way up there. 

But ultimately the food convinced me I'll be back, despite any issues I had. It was one of the best burgers I've ever tasted and cooked to a perfect medium rare too. So good!
author: Jimmy H.

description:
Well the food is average to good, except it is completely overpriced, and not creative, which you would expect when you pay up to $ 60.00 for a burger. You are paying way too much to look at Union Square.
The service is poor, takes al long time to seat, then when you place an order, it is incorrect.
Probably the worst part is the management attitude. When we queried on why service was poor, and they may need additional help there response was "where else can you get this view?"
Well, several other restaurants and bars without the unwarranted arrogance.
author: Ron S.

description:
Despite what everyone says, you just have to check it out for yourself sometimes. And I'm glad I finally get to review Burger Bar and remove it from my Bookmark list (its been there since  this place opened)!

First of all - the elevator to Burger Bar is AWFUL. That was the longest ride on the elevator. 2nd to 3rd back down to 1st to the 2nd floor etc. Getting to Burger Bar was not as straight forward as pressing the button. 

The view is fantastic. Not as great as Cheesecake Factory's on the top floor of the Macy's building but you still get to overlook some part of Union Square. 

Our waiter was very friendly and was happy to recommend and explain the menu. I ordered a regular beef burger and made it my own. I kept my burger simple and had a Blue Moon.  I hate to say it but my burger at In N Out is more enjoyable. Maybe because it's greasier and messy. The burger at Burger Bar was good but nothing special. I still love Hubert Keller though!
author: Samantha L.

description: Awesome burger! Portobello mushrooms . . . undeniably excellent! There is a little lack of service after you order but over all this place is great. Must have every time I am in San Francisco!
author: Eric W.

description:
We just got off the plane from NY and had a Burger craving, so off to Burger Bar we went.  I having been wanting to check out this place, but never had the time to do so.

We got in at 4 and got a great table by the window where we could view Union Square as we ate.

For a starter, we ordered the Twinkie Milk Shake....and as expected, it was totally awesome.

For our meal, we ordered the Kobe Beef Burgers with chedder cheese, grilled onions, bacom and a fried egg and we tried the skinny fries, sweet potato fries and the zuchinni fries.

The Burger was a majot disappointment as the Kobe Beef tasted like an average choice cut beef.......with minimal flavoring......Where is the fat that I paid for?

The $41.00 Kobe Beef Burger at the Old Homestead in NY is the real deal.....this is total fake!

The fries were ok.....but not great.

Overall, $100.00 for an average Burger is a rip off.....but the Twinkie Milk Shake and the gorgeous view saved this from being a 1  star review!

Thomas Keller.......You are NOT the MAN or the Chef! 

Go to NY and learn to cook a real great Burger!
author: Raider J.

description:
Came here as Cheesecake Factory was crazy crowded and friends & I were starving.

The setting was very sport bar-y, with every television in the booths switched to the Lakers' (booo) game.  But it wasn't that noisy, which was nice.

The food itself was alright, I tried the Black Jack Burger.  Nothing too special, except the price (not in a good way), but hey, what can you expect when you're in San Francisco's Union Square.  The fries were good!  Dining companions both ordered the sliders, with different meat patties per slider, which looked like fun, but they couldn't differentiate between the three, but we were dying so it did not matter.

But I've got to say, our server was quite the character!  So attentive, engaging and nice, just had to say that.

I wouldn't trade in the cheesecake factory for this place, but I was hungry and grumpy, so yeah....
author: Cindy L.

description:
In a nutshell, if you like overpriced, dry, over cooked (i ordered medium but got a very well done, grey burger), salty, boring burgers, then this is the place for you. I've had a better burger at Burger King for less than half the price. I've eaten fast food burgers, $60+ Kobe beef burgers, and everything in between and I'm fairly certain I know what makes a great burger. Sadly, this place definitely doesn't deliver. It's a nice atmosphere and you cannot beat the views (this place overlooks Union Square), but the burger was so disappointing. And salty. I've never had a salty burger. 
Save $15 and go to In N Out.
author: Anjanette M.

description: Pretty good food, but despite saying they close at 10:00, we were refused service at 8:00
author: Andi S.

description:
I shoulda went to Cheesecake Factory :| 

There was no wait so I jumped at the chance to finally try this place out. Cute little bar area for the milkshakes and desserts. Service was slow. Waitress was not at all helpful with recommendations, in fact, she always seemed hesitant. 

Basically, you can build your own burger by first starting with a variety of meats, such as: Kobe, buffalo, Black Angus, chicken, turkey, veggie, and salmon. Then a bun, like onion, ciabatta, sourdough, etc... Yummy sauces like pesto, a peppercorn cream sauce... you get the picture. 

Too many options for you? You can pick from the Chef's Burgers menus. The Rossini made my mouth water- Kobe beef, truffles, madeira sauce on an onion bun?! Yuuum for $60 bucks. 

We started with the Grilled Shrimp Salad and chose to build our own burger and share. The end results consisted of the Kobe beef on an onion bun, mushrooms and peppercorn cream sauce. 

Everything was just ok. The grilled shrimp was tasty, but the veggies not the freshest. The Kobe beef was really good, but the mushrooms and sauce didn't compliment it, nor did the onion bun. Skinny and sweet potato fries came in really small portions- about a handful of each and lightly salted. 

I'd rather have a Red Robin Whiskey River BBQ Burger... hamburger patty, BBQ sauce, onion strings and cheddar cheese with bottomless fries... YUUUUM!
author: S Y.

description: After raving about Happy Hour in my last review, was told by hostess today that happy hour had been eliminated except for "Happy Hour Club" members. I'm a member but never use it because the "selected appetizers" they offer for the club are VERY limited. Alcoholic milkshakes are terrific but regular menu food overall is overpriced for the quality. Check out Lark Street or 415 down the street at Westfield Center.
author: Jeff Z.

description:
I never thought of going to Burger Bar until a friend from out of town wanted to try it. We came here on a Tuesday night, during the NBA playoffs. I love the TVs within the booths and tables - you get to watch the game and enjoy the food at the same time without having to be next to the bar.

My friends and I shared the house burger, founder's burger and the kobe/lobster burger. The best was the founder's burger - the sauce was delicious and I loved the ciabatta roll. I suggest getting it! 

I did enjoy the kobe burger - but for $60? I think it could have been better or cheaper! I definitely won't be getting it again if I come here again. I made the mistake of getting the house burger well done - ALWAYS GET MEDIUM WELL!  

With the kobe/lobster burger, you get your choice of a cheesecake or nutella burger for dessert. We got the nutella. It was pretty good - with nutella (meat), cake (bun), jelly (cheese),  random nuts, chocolates and the best part - a fake mouse! Super cute! 

Overall, I think this place was a cool experience and recommend trying it at least once.
author: Mimi V.

description: Came here for the first time tonight and it was great! Great food, great service. The restaurant is on the 6th floor of Macy's and has an amazing view of union square. We waited for about 10 minutes and then got a table by the window. Chris was our server and he was awesome. Very friendly and had excellent recommendations. My boyfriend got the Le frog burger, he loved their brie and the fresh asparagus! I got the Cobb salad with a side of sweet potato fries. Both good choices. Chris also mentioned that they have happy hour which we will definitely be back for soon!
author: Courtney G.

description: They closed 30-60 minutes early because "it was a slow night". Be careful if you make plans to go hear late at night, even if it's just to the bar for the milkshakes. I've been here before and always had a great time, but I may never come back for a late night milkshake again. Or ever.
author: Dean Y.

description:
Fun place. We were there for the Sunday night football game. There are enough TV's that it makes for a decent sports bar. Don't expect sports bar prices though. Burgers are all $12-$20ish. They even have a $60 burger that comes with truffles and lobster tail on it.

I ordered the peppercorn burger with sweet potato fries. Everything was cooked well, but I think the various sauces we got were the highlight of the meal.
author: Matt T.

description: Great experience being in the city! Pretty good burgers, excellent wings, buy 1 star service! Very slow & not as responsive as I would have liked. High priced for the total experience but decent. If you gave 3 hrs to wait do it!
author: Steph S.

description:
After being told Cheesecake factory had an hour and half wait just for tables on christmas eve, we stumbled across this place.

The wait was surprisingly just 15 minutes and got sat down pretty quickly. I wasn't really shocked at the price considering this restaurant was in the mall, in San Francisco. But it better be a bomb-ass burger for my burger sliders if it's 12.95! My boyfriend got his "custom" burger which quickly added up to $20.00 for a burger.

The presentation was nice but the burgers and fries were just decent. Sure the patty was juicy and nicely grilled, but was it worth all that money? Not really! Quite frankly, I have a pretty decent time at any local burger place.

Skip it and just go to in and out. =]
author: Karen L.

description:
I love this place! 

The first time I came here I saw Hubert Keller so I was even more excited because I'm a definite fan of his after dining at Fleur de Lys. But if this place didn't have good food, I wouldn't be a regular. Since it does, I'm a regular customer for sure. 

I normally get the black angus beef with a whole wheat bun, jalapeno bacon, sprouts, chipolte aioli, jalapenos, pepperjack cheese. And sometimes I get some fois gras or a fried egg. 

It's always very delicious. Recently, I've switched it up to the salmon burger with the same fixings. The salmon tastes fresh and its a thick salmon steak. They always cook it well and it's never dry. It's just really tasty and a good option to pick instead of beef. 

My favorite topping are the jalapenos, fresh, not from a jar. They add the kick I love to my food. 

I just really love the food here. Granted it is pricey, but I have no issue with pulling out my wallet for a satisfying burger. Where else do have all these options for building your own burger in downtown SF?
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Had lunch here during our visit to San Francisco a few weeks ago. As a fan of Chef Hubert Keller, we weren't going to miss this place. Killer view of Union Square, lively diner-like atmosphere, fun and creative menu which was divided into two sections - the chef's burgers and the "Ultimate Burger Experience" or build-your-own.  The build-your-own features four kinds of meat: black angus, country natural (sustainably raised beef), american kobe and buffalo and about 45 add ons.

I opted for the Hubert Keller Burger from the chef's burgers section of the menu. I really wanted the Rossini (kobe beef, sauteed foie gras, shaved truffles, onion bun) but didn't want to shell out $60 for a burger. The Hubert Keller Burger has buffalo patty, caramelized onions, baby spinach, blue cheese, red wine shallot reduction on a ciabatta bun. The burger was flavorful, tender, meat was cooked medium rare and the blue cheese did not overwhelm. It was perfect but I don't think it's worth $22. 

Fantastic atmosphere, great view, great food, but the value, not so great. I'd have no problem recommending this place but not for someone on a budget, which most of us are these days.
author: Maita M.

description:
Oh Oh OH! 
Burger was tasty. You know that first bite? You know. 

Fries on the side. Dipping sauce= mayo. O fattening.

I admit I was in a bad mood here for a friend's birthday but forget those people, aside from that, this place was satisfying me. I need to try a milkshake! REGRET not having ordered one. 

I would assume this is where people would end up if they cannot get into Cheesecake Fac due to their 3hour wait list = that's what happened here! 
Well then boo hoo, Cheese Fac. Option#2 just as good.
author: Veranna N.

description:
I was here on my lunch break. Sat at the bar and me and my coworker ordered chicken wings and burger with fries. Pretty basic. So why was I waiting for my meal for 45 mins? The only reason I gave this review an extra star was because the bartender was so attentive and friendly. Since he's not a waiter he doesn't have easy access to the kitchen. So when he saw the girls next to me get there food right away (they only waited like 15 mins) He literally walked his ass to the kitchen and brought us our food. He didn't have to do that and he shouldn't have to that. I gave him pretty good tip because he was putting matters into his own hands. 
But seriously, it was my first time here and the burger wasn't all that and wasn't worth the wait. The bartender was awesome though!
author: April S.

description: Place reminded me of those airport restaurants. Food was better than I expected. Came on Saturday night, no wait chill atmosphere compared to the Cheesecake Factory we were trying to go to. Had the American Classic and Le Frog, both were good.  Bottom patty was soggy as others mentioned, but the meat was cook to spec, medium and med rare. Fries were warm. It was ok.
author: Olivia A.

description:
Do you like fish sticks?

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6GzOoyOOfqM

Then Burger Bar probably is not for you.

We met up with my super Yelp Megastar friend Alexandra and her boyfriend at Burger Bar for a night of feasting on red meat. No fish sticks allowed on this night. 

This was our first time dining here and we all very curious to finally sample and see what all the buzz was about. I had heard all about the $60 dollar burger and was expecting to see some steep pricing, but when opening the menu I found what I would consider some pretty reasonably priced offerings. Sure, there are a couple of burgers that are priced to the point one may consider taking out a home equity line to eat here, but that is the exception.

We walked in just after six and were immediately seated in the main bar area. Drink orders were taken and within a few minutes and I had a tequila gimlet sitting right in front of me. Alexandra had glass of pinot  which she never really took a liking to, my wife went with a Junipero martini which looked pretty refreshing and Alexandra's boyfriend had some fancy micro brew beer. 

After a few minutes of browsing the menu we were finally ready to order. Three of us went with the Country Natural which is farm raised beef, my wife however decided to try something a little different and boldly ordered the buffalo burger. We also requested a side of aioli for fry dipping. Speaking of fries, we obviously did not forget out about our little French friends and ordered both skinny and fat fries.

When our burgers arrived I was very impressed by the size. A nice thick perfectly cooked (rare for me) meat patty carefully placed on a toasted bun. My burger came topped with caramelized onions and cheddar cheese. The toppings were sparse, but I had no problem with this as is how Hubert Keller intended. He wants the burger to speak for itself which it did. Pure tasting goodness within each bite is your reward. It was quite obvious that Burger Bar uses only top quality beef and they know how to cook it up. 

The atmosphere is much more casual than I expected and all kinds of dress is perfectly acceptable here. The service is very good and attentive. The front bar area seems a little more lively than the seating in the rear of the restaurant and would prefer sitting there. There are also plenty of TV sets for those wanting to watch and keep track of your favorite team (gooooooo anyone but the Lakers!). The only sad part of the evening is we were one Popchip Angel down and she was missed. But on the bright side we get to see her next week! 

In my opinion both Absinthe and Bix still makes the best damn burger in San Francisco but, overral I would say that Burger Bar is the Cats Pajamas and would definitely make a return visit.
author: Rene C.

description: Ate here last weekend and it was delicious! Big fan of the sweet potato fries & you get to customize your own burger! My friends and I (group of 15) came here on a Saturday night and we waited about 40 mins (not bad) for a table! Our server was SUPER nice and patient with us. Wish I remembered his name. But everyone there was very nice and attentive!
author: Erin S.

description:
This is my second time ordering the same (sort of) meal from them in two months and love the results. I stick with the salmon burger, each time the salmon has plenty of flavor and the buns are still warm and wonderfully crispy on the outside, chewy in the center. I added avocado and cheddar on my burger which complemented the salmon. On the side, I also ordered sweet potato fries, cut thin and sprinkled lightly with salt. Both of my guests had pretty good burgers including the Three Amigos burger which they will make you sign a waiver for. Honestly the hubby thought the burger was not as spicy as it could have been, but loved it anyway. He had it with a side of regular fries and Mandalay Bay and loved both. 

If anything I think people are not overly satisfied considering the chef also owns Fleur De Lys, but come on, this burger joint is in the middle of Union Square. The hubby does say that it's painful process once the spicy burger is fully consumed, so don't plan on eating it on a heavy touring day, or right before hitting the ballpark. Other than that, I say give it a try and judge for yourself. The staff is friendly and helpful (I attended on a saturday for lunch and the hubby left his debit card behind at the restaurant). Considering your other food options nearby, I would go here before venturing out to anything on Powell.
author: Carolina S.

description: Came here the other night with some friends for burgers and drinks. Our server, Nandiya, was great, knowledgable, and friendly. The cocktails were ok, but I think it was the best turkey burger that I have ever tried. I already want to go back. It might not be the cheapest place but it's definitely worth the price. Can't wait to come back here again!
author: Leonardo Z.

description: SO, I have to explain before I dish on the meal - we would not have come here except for a gift certificate we had. Turns out that the restaurant, located on the 6th floor of a department store,  had really nice decor and a great view of Union Square. The certificate allowed us to get two meals....or one truffle/lobster meat/ wine reduction/ kobe beef and short rib mixture burger. With a side of skinny fries, to allay our guilt. And a small bucket of jalapeño fried, beer battered pickles. With two diet Pepsi, since you know we're counting calories. I would never spend this much for a burger. It's just not American. But it was OMG AWESOME. Sorry, had to say that.
author: Art H.

description:
Seriously Burger Bar averages 3 stars on Yelp?! Are the other Yelpers tasting the same burgers and fries I've eaten on my two visits?

Yes, I see a few areas where Burger Bar could improve, and I've only been during lunch on weekdays, but still, I'm not sure if I've ever had a better burger anywhere. And that's what it's about for me. Okay, let's get down to burgers and fries.

Here's what I've tried so far:

* Black Jack Burger - Black Angus beef, Monterey jack, tapenade, tomato, lettuce on a ciabatta bun. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=fDny65qdxn3EJH0PZbCxIw&select=9lco7HVv7ZwPDLD7vIlrAQ

* Chef's Veggie Burger - Caramelized onions, button mushrooms, lentils, green peas, brown & white rice, pumpkin puree, potato, bread curmbs, and mozzarella cheese on a whole wheat bun.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=cDB_VJfIIn8mM-qTk7MxTw

* Sweet Potato Fries

* Chocolate Burger - Donut, chocolate ganache, passion fruit, and strawberries http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=fDny65qdxn3EJH0PZbCxIw&select=wQFrfROysPEt0L9_gL-U5Q

The Black Jack Burger was juicy and satisfying. I didn't add ketchup (very unusual for me) because there was so much flavor already. It was so big that I felt I'd have to unhinge my jaw to bite into it. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=fDny65qdxn3EJH0PZbCxIw&select=H0BoiL3qyRN6fIQxnO3lpQ

The Veggie Burger was excellent, perhaps the best veggie burger I've ever had. The veggie patty had a lot going on and in a good way. I was extremely full and satisfied. One thing that also stood out to me was the bun. The bun can make or break a burger and this was super fresh from the Italian French Baking Company and enhanced the burger. Vegetarians are not left out here. 

The sweet potato fries were simple and perfect. Probably the most delicious I've had anywhere. "Nuf said.

The chocolate burger was cute and gimmicky.
