The bun was a donut from another bakery, and though it made a nice looking hamburger bun, it wasn't a great donut (I know my donuts - I even have a donut list). The chocolate patty was just so-so for me (yes, I've got a chocolate list too and I'm picky about chocolate). So the dessert was a 5 for cuteness and creativity, but only a 3 for taste. I liked the tangy passion fruit coulis (faux ketchup) and the gelatin cheese slice - those were well done. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=fDny65qdxn3EJH0PZbCxIw&select=RavFgtF7jd3Zy3KnBBH_HQ The strawberries ("tomato") and kiwi ("lettuce") were good too. The rest of the dessert taste-wise wasn't as high quality as the main course fare for me.

What's right about Burger Bar:

+ Excellent burgers and fries (haven't tried shakes yet!)
+ They grind their own fresh meat 2x/day
+ Many natural and specialty meats available
+ Plenty of non-beef options for vegans, vegetarians, & pescetarians
+ Very clean
+ Attentive service
+ Great views overlooking Union Square
+ Some booths with TVs http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=wEh92OkZn6L4XyD921pGhQ
+ Hubert Keller sightings (I met him yesterday and he was very nice)

What I see as justifiable complaints:

- Music is loud and annoying (even on their website - ack!)
- Could be kid-friendlier (they could provide crayons and paper, etc.)
- It is expensive

5 stars for fantastic burgers and killer sweet potato fries.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Hubert Keller's restaurant for the masses is pretty good. The price is a little considering you are actually just getting burgers and fries. There is a huge selection of customization for your burgers, which is neat. I still haven't splurged and got their $60 burger filled with foie gras and truffles, in due time. You gotta try some of their sweet stuff though. The alcoholic milkshakes are yummy but not very strong but you can nicely ask your waiter or bartender to give it a stronger kick. The dessert burger is absolutely phenomenal though. It looks just like a burger but instead comes with a slice of chocolate ganache, fresh strawberries, passion fruit all between a sugared donut. A little whipped cream mouse on the side finishes this really cute presentation.

Keep in mind that the place can get pretty packed, but you can chill at the bar while you wait. If you like burgers, I say give this place a chance.

~A
author: Alex C.

description:
There's a really great view of Union Square from this 6th floor Burger Bar inside of the Macy's building on the south side of the square.  However, you'll pay more than a bit extra for the view and location.  Sometimes I think pricing at places like this Macy's are really just a representation of the touristy nature of the Union Square vicinity . . . as $17.50 is pretty darned expensive for a cheeseburger and fries.  

In the case of my order, the French Fries were freakin' HOT and literally burned the roof of my mouth to the point of a blister from the very 1st fry.  This kinda ruined the meal for me . . . and with the high cost of the meal . . . even with the view, the best I can justify here is a 3. 

I will say that the service provided by my waiter was prompt, personable, and attentive.  The service was worthy of a nice tip, but the meal itself was overpriced.  I probably will not be hurrying back anytime soon.  There are better and more reasonably priced places for a burger and fries in this area of the City.
author: Joel E.

description: I would have rated this a 5 star but the menu is pricey for burgers and more!  Having said that I had ordered the Le Frog Burger and I must say it was one of the tastiest burgers I have ever eaten.  Our group had a waitress by the name of Ida and she was on point from start to finish, not to mention her cheery and positive attitude towards everyone on our table.  With employees like Ida it kind of takes the sting out of the price!  All in all I will be back again someday to try out another burger and hopefully get the same results in taste and hope to get another fun and happy waitress like Ida.
author: Victor C.

description: Had a good time here. Lots of ways to have your burger(s).  We were seated quickly and asked for a window seat, but unfortunately the tables were all full, so we sat at table that still provided a nice view. Our server was pleasant, checked on us to see if everything was ok. Our burgers were made right (medium). The onion rings are perfect. All the food was served hot too. We didn't have room for desert. They have a good milkshakes!!
author: Trey W.

description:
I've been to the Burger Bar in Las Vegas, but had to try the one in San Francisco.  My wife & I took my sister to lunch for her birthday.  When we arrived, the hostess seated us at a window table, overlooking Union Square.  In Vegas, I saw the Surf & Turf burger, with angus beef, grilled asparagus and lobster tail.  I didn't get it then, but had to try it.  The burger was very delicious, though it was so thick with the lobster that I had a hard time getting the entire burger in my mouth.  The asparagus added something a little different to the burger, but it also made the burger a little too much to eat.  Next time I order this, I'll put the asparagus on the side and eat the burger just with the lobster and beef in the bun.

But the best thing about this place isn't the burgers, but the milkshakes.  I love Nutella, and when I saw the Nutella milkshakes on the menu in Vegas, I had to have it.  And so, I had to get one in SF, too.  The milkshake was creamy, with chocolate syrup drizzled over the ice cream, and hazelnuts on top.  This is definitely the best milkshake I've ever had.  Maybe someday I'll try another milkshake here, but I doubt it.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: First time here tonight. It was pretty packed for a Saturday night but there didn't seem to be a wait. We made reservation and was seated right away. We had requested for a window seating. Beautiful view overlooking union square. The booth seatings have their own little tv screen. Service was okay. I ordered the black angus burger. It was okay.       I think it was a little over priced for a regular burger. You can build your own burger. There's a charge for the extra toppings such as cheese or grilled onions etc. I would skip the pickle fries and the funnel stick fries. Funnel was pretty tough and doughy. Overall this is okay place. I would probably rather go to Cheesecake Factory upstairs if these were my two options.
author: Susan M.

description:
I was in SF this past weekend and my friend recommended we go here and I was so happy we did. It was a Saturday afternoon and the wait was about 20 minutes. We sat at the bar and had a drink while we waited. 

They brought us to our table and it was AMAZING, right near the window looking into Union Square. It was so much fun....a protest also came by so that was pretty entertaining!

The food was delish..I had the Angus Burger on Ciabatta with the works..BBQ sauce, aoli, etc. The Skinny fries are pretty good too..Oh and we also shared a Ceasar which was not bad!! 

The service was a lil slow, but i think he was pretty busy. It didnt bother us because we had so much to talk about and watched the rallt outside!

YUM YUM, cant wait to go back to eat another burger!
author: Brittany G.

description:
Not worth the $78.

Ground Kobe Beef was ordered medium; was served medium well, and cooked up to well in less than 6 minutes.  Burger toppings were mediocre, even when dressed quite exotically. 

Fries were amazing, dipped it in chipotle mayonnaise. 

Milkshakes were innovative, delicious, and came with a larger straw- a nice touch. 

I've had better burgers in the city for a third of the price, i don't think i'll be returning.
author: Peter T.

description: The food was great. The server was argumentative and slack. Never came to refill my water, requested my burger not have ant sauce on it within 3 minutes of placing order. Was told the burger was already finished. Told server that was not possible. She ask me what I wanted to do. Very sullen.
author: Sheree P.

description:
Hubert Keller Burger = 4.5 stars. Juicy, packed with flavor, so savory. yum!

Surf and Turf Burger = 1 star.  Everything for some reason was bad. dry, lobster not good.

Fries = 1 star.  wtf? burgers need fries with it. I can't stop myself with fries.  but with these, I was wishing I had mcdonalds fries.  It was cold, dry, flavorless.  yuck!!

soooo.. that puts me in an akward spot.  this spot is great if you go get the hubert keller for a fast food when you're around the union square area.  but for some reason a couple things were such big fail. 

sitting next to the window is not advised if you're afraid of heights (uh.. like me.)
author: Hannah W.

description:
I know it says three stars, but add .5 to that because the Twinkie shake I had was AWESOME!!

I really, really wanted to eat at one of Hubert Keller's restaurants. However, I couldn't see ponying up the kind of dough you need to eat at Fleur de Lys. This was my compromise so we could spend more money all over the town.

The view was great. You are at the top of Macy's and the view over Unions Square is impressive. We got lucky and were seated at a table by the windows. Tables are small and it's bar height. Not my favorite type. If you don't like heights, don't sit by the window. At one point my husband looked down, gulped and then commented he wouldn't be doing that again. 

The burgers were truly the best cooked burgers I have ever had. My plate was covered in juice when I was done, so be careful and don't try to eat this over your lap. :) But, again it's just burgers, so hard to give 4-5 stars to a burger place. 

I got the skinny fries and they were exactly what I like in my fry. If you prefer steak fries, they have those too. I loved how the bring the fries out in a mini-fryer basket. Was too cute.

And the shake. I had seen pictures of the Twinkie shake and thought, "That sounds really good!" Well, it is. We ended up splitting one, which they charge you to do. Normally I would complain, but they served us the shake in two small glasses, each with a portion of Twinkie on top. It made it so we both got the good stuff and no fights over the Twinkie. This shake was so awesome. It tasted like a Twinkie, you could even tell there was Twinkie blended into it. Made me wish I had tried some of the even more odd shakes or even the alcoholic ones.
author: April S.

description: Burger Bar sounded like fun, so we went. On the 6th floor of Macy's. Great view. Good menu selection and the shakes/malts were really outstanding. Service was OK. I would go back.
author: R. S.

description:
Was doing some early Xmas shopping and needed to grab a bite to eat.  Cheese cake factory has the usually 45 minute wait  so we decided to grab a burger here instead. Was nice to see that there was no wait at 7pm in the midst of holiday shopping season.

Was surprised to see that this place is kids friendly. We were greeted with crayon and coloring placing. There was a kids menu. Got the rugrat Mac and cheese.  Wifey and I got burgers.  We most impressed that they were able to seat us with other families with kids.  It got really real in that section.  Food all over the floor.  Meltdowns left and right.  Thanks Burger Bar for not being snooty about it!
author: Sam T.

description:
Had a Kobe beef burger which was good, nothing too special.  The fries were decent and the service was slightly lacking.   

Cool location above union square.  There are way better burger choices in the city - but not sure about that specific area.  

Don't expect to be blown away, but you can definitely leave with a full tummy, which is a good  thing.
author: Juliana K.

description:
When they were out of mint tea, our waiter, Brandon, offered creative alternatives... I picked Green Tea with fresh mint leaves. So delicious.

The burger bar is a local favorite for me -- great burgers and fabulous sweet potato fries. With today's great service I had to finally write a review!
author: Sarah A.

description:
Burger Bar does some things really well, like getting the texture of the onion rings just right, and other things just so so. I have to say, my kobe beef Burger was cooked to pefection. It was a moist and flavorful patty on a nicely toasted onion bun. I was hoping to amp things up with some truffle sauce. The problem is, in my mind the sauce was going to be thick enough to pour on. In reality, it was more of an au jus. That would have been fine if it had come in a small, shallow dish for dipping. It didn't. Instead, it came in a tiny pitcher. Cute, but not ideal for anything except, well, being cute. I ended up pouring it onto my bun and letting it soak in a bit. It was delicious, but there has to be a less messy way to enjoy it. Maybe a splosh of cream to thickened it? I could be wrong, but I doubt they get a lot of vegans.

The beer float I had with my burger was good (the one with stout and coffee ice cream), but I wanted a slightly higher beer to ice cream ratio. The beer was gone far too quickly. Another quibble, my friend's veggie burger tasted kind of bland and the texture was dry and crumbly. Add some cheese for a better eating experience.

The beer selection is almost overwhelming, but it's really cool that there is the option to create almost endless samplers. The ambience is decent (shiny, pretty big screens oh my!) and is probably amazing when the shades are opened to reveal the gorgeous skyline. The service was typical (great to start and nonexistent when it was time to pay and go). 

I have to admit, I hold celebrity chef's restaurants to a higher standard than a chain or independent joint. I adore Hubert Keller, so I was hoping for amazing. Instead, I got ok. Regardless,  I will go to Burger Bar again.
author: Nicole M.

description:
First off - I am by no means a carnivore... generally, I only eat beef and/or burgers a few times a year, BUT I do love to try new places as well as new spins on old favorites.  

Entrée vous Burger Bar, Hubert Keller's newest fete in SF. 

Being a fan of Hubert Keller (pre-Bravo I might add), I was uber eager to scope out the new location, even if it was in the same building as Cheesecake Factory.  After my yearly trip to Moscone Center for the Annual Auto Show, my beau and I decided it was time for burgers, beer and most of all - frites!  

Not much a wait - enough time for beer and scotch at the bar before we were seated.  I inhaled the Hubert Keller Burger with sweet potato fries and it was heaven in my mouth.  The buffalo was cooked to perfection - nice and juicy.  The scrumptious bleu cheese melted so that it slowly dripped over the burger and into the nooks and crannies of the ciabatta role that it was served on and the spinach was such a nice, new touch on a burger... it was a nice change from boring old iceberg.

So, yes - the food was awesome... def one of the best non-traditional burgers I have scarfed down, but that wasn't the highlight.  If you remember, I mentioned my chef crush on Mr. Hubert... well, whilst sitting with my beau, savagely devouring my massive mountain of buffalo, Chef Keller causally walks by.  Not wanting to be "that girl", I just swallow my tongue and start heating up from the inside out.  My beau, being very well aware of my admiration notices that woman A) from around the corner asks for a picture.  Seeing how amazingly gracious he is to woman A), my beau speaks up and asks Chef Keller if he would take a photo with me, as well since I am such a huge fan.  Beet red and full of anticipation, I spend one minute stuttering my words like a fool, and one second smiling for the camera.  

Thank you Chef Hubert Keller for the picture, the sincere kindness and the buffalo.  ;)
author: Kris I.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday.  Nice looking bar; great view of Union Square!

Let's talk about the burger tho:
NOT IMPRESSIVE. I mean...it's edible but I wasn't blown away by it.  Ordered the daily special - cheeseburger, sweet potato fries, and drink for $12.  Pretty pricey for a small, not so tasty burger. Imagine what it would cost if I ordered off the menu.

One good perk:
Located on 6th floor of Macy's (womens side).  Right after my meal, I perused the shoe floor. Great way to burn off some calories!
author: Diana M.

description: It was just, eh.  We had a private event there and felt like the staff didn't know how to manage private party.  Appetizers just appeared with no explanation of what had been ordered for us.  Our starter salads were the size of a meal, so by the time I got to the burger, I was so stuffed, I picked it apart and never touched my fries.  Felt more like a tourist place for a burger rather than a chef owned experience.
author: Julie C.

description: The fries, dipping sauces, and appetizers (jalapeño and onion petals) were excellent. But the burgers were less impressive. We ordered "le'frog" - which  featured Brie and mushrooms. The Brie was much too overpowering and did not balance well with the other flavors. Come here for a great view but not necessarily a great burger.
author: Mich H.

description:
B/c most people just want to know the general idea/impressions of a restaurant review, I'm going to try something new and begin with my short, generalized conclusion statements, and finish with the details of a long review for those who appreciate the small stuff.

General Impressions:

1. Was it the best burger i've ever had? No.
2. Was it a good burger? Sure.
3. Is the price/potential wait worth this good, but not perfect burger? No.

For those who are satisfied with my quick statements, ciao and thanks for visiting my review! For those who crave the whys and whats, here are the details entailed in the style of my usual reviews:

I came in to Burger Bar at SF with mild expectations. I say mild because I have heard through word-of-mouth that this burger joint has long lines, overpriced food, and food that is "eh." Nonetheless, on a beautiful day in SF where I couldn't think of where to eat in Union Square for an early dinner (5pm), my gf and I decided to try Burger Bar, considering we don't have to fight a crowd at the this early bird time. 

Food:

Entree(s): note about their entrees - most of the regular burgers (black angus, kobe, etc) do not come with fries. They must be ordered on the side. However, certain "signature chef burgers," such as the Hubert Keller Burger, Rossini Burger, etc. come with fries. All burgers, however, come with the basics: lettuce, tomatoes, pickle. You also have a choice of buns, including plain, sesame, onion, ciabatta, sourdough, and wholewheat. 

American Kobe Beef Burger: I decided to forego the fancy ingredient burgers and get the simple Kobe Beef burger so I can get a true, uninterrupted sampling of Chef  Keller's creations. I opted for the ciabatta bun and added avocado and an order of zucchini fries on the side. 

Burgers at upscale establishments such as this tend to shape their meat patties in a similar fashion: a smaller in circumference, but thicker patty. My American Kobe was just like that. Cooked exactly as I wanted it (medium well). I decided to skip the condiments to first get a real taste of the burger. I must say i was not that impressed with the flavor. The patty, though cooked perfectly, could not differentiate itself from  the flavor of any other meat patty i've had in the past, from backyard bbqs to other restaurants. I suppose the only difference I could taste was that the meat was moist and not dry. Given that, flavor was lacking and preferred the patty to be more seasoned. Could I tell it was Kobe? No.

My gf opted to treat herself to one of Hubert's more extravagant creations: Surf & Turf Burger. Black angus beef, grilled half lobster, asparagus, on a plain bun. Sounds to die for right? I almost wanted to get it myself but thought the combination of flavors would make it hard for me to appreciate just the meat patty. Fortunately for myself, I still got a hearty sampling of my gf's burger.

To my utter surprise, there was the same lack of flavor in the Surf/Turf burger. The lobster, though cooked perfectly (moist, but not undercooked) was also unseasoned. The black angus beef and lobster combination did not really blend for me. There was two separate ingredients put into a burger, but the combination just didn't add up. Same story: cooked well, but not flavorful enough. 

Service:

Hard to review as it was a casual dining experience, but I can say our waitress did what was expected of her, gave us our food promptly, refilled our drinks, and was polite and friendly. No complaints. I also wanted to note that this establishment is notorious for the wait on a normal night and that I cannot attest to that since, as mentioned earlier, I came here at a very early time (5pm). 

Overall, unimpressed. Good food, but not great. Not worth the bill (our check was around 75 total for two people). I guess it was an experience to try, but I wish the flavor was there. I came away physically full, but my taste buds were still hungry and begging for something more satisfying.
author: Nathan T.

description: Bison Burger Gluten free!  Amazing!  My favorite (only) burger place. Just wish I lived closer.
author: Kellie S.

description:
Sacrilege. A salad at Burger Bar.  I have had the Kobe burger at Burger Bar at my first visit, and it was pretty darn good.  Also had the zucchini fries which were awesome.

Second visit, I had the cobb salad (I know, I know....) which was really good.  It isn't over the top fancy, very simple, but there isn't really much you can do to mess up a salad.  The chicken was great, small pieces so I didn't have to waste energy cutting it (lazy, I know).  Lots of egg, cheese, tomatoes and bacon.  Just the right amount of dressing.  The skinny fries are great.  Cooked just right, and come with a ranch dip if you are so inclined.  My dining companion had the Kobe burger with bacon and said it was "off the hook" good, along with the fat fries (more like steak fries - big and thick if you are into big and thick things).  Also had the watermelon beer that was brought in from First Amendment.   I definitely like that they are supporting local beer as an offering on the menu.  We also had a great server.  She was spunky in attitude and attentive.
author: Jason I.

description:
Im a little shocked that this place has such low reviews. I've been to burger bar on 2 separate occasions and both experiences have been excellent. The burgers were moist and delicious albeit expensive and the fries were crispy and delectable. If I were to ask for anything more it would be that the damn Macy's elevator denote what f'ing floor the thing was on. 

What else...the alcoholic milk shakes need more alcohol(still delicious).

I think that sums it up.

P.S.  I almost passed on this place because of the yelp score and am glad I didn't.
author: Jason C.

description: Located on the 6th floor of the Macy's building in Union Square. We had a window seat which gave us a wonderful view of everything. Ours burgers were delicious, but very pricey. We had great service, but it became harder for our server to get to us or even for us to get around as the place filled up. Over all a good experience.
author: Janell W.

description:
You know how you want to write a review but you decide to wait a day and see if you cool down at all.  This is THAT review.
The food is fine.  Great, even, for a high-end burger place.  I've been here several times and to the one in Vegas even more often.  The milkshakes are especially good (if on the small side) and it's nice to have a variety of meats, buns and toppings to choose from.
The meal service on our most recent trip was just okay.  Nothing to write home about.
The challenge for me and my party was the fact that we left after Macy's had closed, so the gate leaving the restaurant was down.  There was a line at the (only) elevator where we waited about 15 minutes.  The elevator never came to the floor (and yes, the button had been pushed).  We then said, "Hey, it's only six floors, we'll take the stairs and walk off this larger burger we just had."  No go; the stairwell door was alarmed.  We asked the host and hostess who said the elevator was the only exit.  I inquired as to the stairway and the hostess said there wasn't one.  (!)  I asked about the exit sign by the stairway and she said, "That doesn't go anywhere."  
At this point, I was becoming slightly claustrophobic and more than slightly annoyed.  I then asked about what would happen if there was a fire or other emergency and the hostess, and employee of this establishment said, and I quote, "You could always go out the window."  Seriously?  From the sixth floor?  (By the way, still no elevator had arrived)
I asked for the manager and explained the situation and the "solution" of the hostess to a fire emergency, and the manager laughed off the story like it didn't happen.  (For those keeping score, the elevator arrived at this point going UP and didn't have any room for any of the now 27 people waiting to leave).
My group was now searching for other ways out of the restaurant (the kitchen, the other side of the dining room) and seriously considering going through the alarmed stairwell (which the hostess still denied existed).
Long story short (too late!) Macy's DID finally assign a security agent to serve as an elevator attendant and got everyone down (while still taking people up to Cheesecake Factory on the 8th floor (which for the record has two elevators, one of which is express).
Eat here if you must, but plan on leaving before Macy's closes.
[I also harbor no illusions that management will respond to this review or even read it.  Upper management needs to take a more active role in hiring for service and personality especially for a restaurant with Hubert Kellar's name above the door.
author: Chad W.

description:
We got the best seats in the house!  Right by the windows, with the most wonderful panoramic view. (It was Thanksgiving time and they had just lit the tree!)

I got a burger that had melted brie cheese, sprouts, avocado and a garlic mayo sauce. Yum. Seriously amazing. I've been wanting to recreate it or find a place in SD that makes the same. 

That's all. I want that burger again.
author: Amy S.

description:
Burger Bar by Hubert Keller

One word after my anticipation: Disappointment

The name of the chef was what drew me to this place on a beautiful sunny day.  Of course, it was obvious that this restaurant was going to be more casual, hence the name Burger Bar.  It is located on the 6th floor of the Macy's building, which we thought was a bit funny.  The elevators on the left side lead to Burger Bar and the right side elevators lead to Cheesecake Factory.  We got seats along the windows which I totally loved.  The view of Union Square was beautiful, especially how I can people watch also.  We were welcomed with glasses of water and our menus with many recommendations since it was our first time there.  Our waitress was very nice and tried to explain the types of meat and what she had tried already in the past.    

What we got:
1. Burger Sliders- comes with a side of fries ( which was barely ).  Standard, nothing for me to make my significant other try them out.  It comes 3 different types of meat, which includes the buffalo meat.  $13

2. Black Angus Beef Burger- with wheat bun.  A bit dry for a medium flavored cooking and not as flavorful as can be.  Does not come with side of fries. $10

Overall, I don't think I will come back here if I were to crave for a Gourmet Burger.  For those of you that don't know about The Counter, Definitely go try their gourmet burgers there.  TEN TIMES better and a tad cheaper. AND their SWEET POTATO FRIES are TEN TIMES to die for there compared to Burger Bar.  Everytime I have gone to the Counter, I come out of there completely and beyond satisfied unlike Burger Bar.  This place is just average to me, nothing that would draw me to come back.  I mean it makes me curious to see how a Burger can cost $60 here.  If you let me taste it for free, I would come.  I think Hubbert Keller, from what I know and heard, should just stick to his specialty of Fine dining.    

Side Note:  After a couple of hours later, I am still suffering from an upset stomach.  Burger Bar was the only thing I ate all day long.  I  don't know if it was from the burger.. but ughhhh I definitely do not feel well........
author: Kathy D.

description: I went back for more peppercorn burgers and it was a good time.  Only the waiter was a little crass and inappropriate, but it wasn't so bad for me to never return. So far they've been really quick with bringing out the food.  I think I've gotten in and out in about 40 minutes.
author: Shaun W.

description:
03.20.10

I finally have the pleasure of checking this place out, months after opening.  I happily got lost on the 6th floor of Macy's and slowly wandered in.

7:30, we have a birthday party of 15.  We were seated within 15 minutes.  Orders were taking pretty promptly, and VERY orderly, I might add.

Had to ask for water, though.  Odd.

I'm on a fake health kick.  Meaning I won't have a burger one day and wolf down fried chicken the next.  So I ordered a turkey burger [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=NuBH2f-7RWNwnyzLrdGdpw].  With cheese.  And a fried egg.  And spicy aioli sauce.

Best turkey burger I've ever had.

The bartenders have a sense of humor to boot.
author: Jenny L.

description: I wasn't sucker in the Kobe Burger like everyone else but the mushroom burger was on point plus the shakes are awesome!
author: Akiliano T.

description: If you are going to focus your entire menu on burgers, I think you should at least do them well. There are plenty of toppings and the fries are great. Main problem is the buns. I noticed as I was walking in, there were a lot of buns left on plates. That's exactly what happened to my plate. We tried two different buns and both were equally disappointing. They were flavorless and dry. I think they get a lot of Cheesecake Factory overflow customers. Bottom line.....no thank you.
author: Kim K.

description: The location and service were excellent. Food was exactly what we expected. The one disappointment was that my burger was overlooked and dry.
author: Rich G.

description: Yes they serve best burgers ever! You should definitely try going there. Nice staff, fast service and BEST burgers and fries! It's a really good burger spot in the heart of city of San Francisco. But it usually gets busy specially packed at dinner time.  Go there between 3-5 pm. You will get out very happy :)
author: Helen M.

description: SUPER slooooowww service! Ugh! My kids are hangry and the waitress hasn't checked in with our table to let us know what's going on with our food orders.
author: Marie O.

description:
I probably would have never come here if it weren't for my sister, but I'm glad she suggested it.

The place looked packed when we got there and waited about half an hour for our table, but on the way to our table, we noticed that there were a lot of empty tables towards the back.  Hmm, could they have been low on waitstaff?  Possibly.  Anyhow, we were seated by the window and enjoyed the nice view from the 6th floor of Macy's.  

I ordered the Hubert Keller Burger: buffalo meat, sautéed spinach, caramelized onions, & bleu cheese on a ciabatta bun with red wine shallot reduction and sweet potato fries on the side for $22.  Yum!  This must have been the most expensive burger I have ever gotten in my life, but I can say it was totally worth the try.  I love flavor and this burger had so much of it.  I would definitely get it again.  To cap off my burger, I shared a caramel latte milkshake with my sister.  It was delicious, but not worth the eight dollars and ninety-five cents.

Our waitress, Lisa, was amazing!  Her service was on point and had a great sense of humor to go along with it.  

3.5 stars.  It's a journey getting to the restaurant, especially with those slow ass elevators and all those tourists.
author: Rosemarie P.

description:
Burger Bar is an okay spot for burgers, but Chef Hubert Keller who is the owner is an excellent chef. I think everyone should try there burger out. They have different kinds of meat for burgers such as Kobe, Angus, Buffalo, Chicken and even Veggie. They also have many different kinds of cheeses to choose as well as sauces to add to your burger. Black truffles on your burger are going to run you about 30.00.

For french fries, they have skinny, fat, sweet potato, and zucchini. Onion rings are also present along with beer battered jalapenos.

I recommend the burgers @ Tony's Cable Car off Geary St. in SF
author: Kathy V.

description:
Came here a while ago with some friends while in the area.  Never a big burger fan but it was cold outside and Cheesecake was overly pack (and don't really like it) as usual so decided to try this place out.

Got there right before dinner time so wasn't too crowded yet- but just missed the hh too so boo to that!

Overall burgers were ok- all the toppings and extras added up though sure made it one heck of an expensive burger!  Average per burger in our group was about $18 and one guy's was almost $50 but thats cuz he added foie gras and had beer.

Not sure if I'd be back anytime soon- unless I find money in my pocket then maybe!
author: Esther S.

description:
I really wanted to give it 3.5 stars, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.
What works for them: the burgers are great. The bartender was friendly, and though not a skilled mixologist (which always disappoints me about bartenders), he did mix me a nice drink once I told him what to put in it. The attitude counts, and his made the cut

What doesn't work: Speaking of attitude, the hostesses and wait staff are (justifiably, given the crowd at the place) sloppy, and if you're with family, you do tend to get somewhat less attention than attractive singles. The location kinda sucks too - the elevators in Macys are notoriously unavailable.

Overall, I'd recommend the place unless you've got little kids with you.
author: Anurag B.

description:
After a fairly horrid night at a new nightclub in San Francisco my BF and I went out in search of late night sustenance. We were staying at the Westin St. Regis and decided to hit up the Burger Bar because it was right across the street and it was open until 2 am. 

The Burger Bar is located inside Macy's and there was a poor man who had to open the door for us in one of the coldest nights of the year. Took the elevator up to the Burger Bar at sat right by the window which overlooked Union Square and the Macy's Great Tree. It was a few weeks before Christmas so everything was lit up and so romantic!

We ordered our food and I decided to get a Buffalo burger on a whole wheat bun for $16.50. I've always heard that Buffalo is very tasty and wanted to give it a go. It was $.75 extra for cheddar cheese and I had to go for the sweet potato fries which were $3.35. 

Decided to hit the loo while waiting for our food and found that there was no toilet paper in the bathroom. I found a waiter boy and asked him for some toilet paper. He came back to the bathroom with an odd look on his face and I realized that he was scared to go into the womens bathroom. Oh for God's sake!!! I had to use the bathroom so I grabbed the toilet paper and told him I'd just put it in myself! What's a girl got to do around here to pee! 

After my bathroom adventure I went back and ate my burger. It was tasty but definitely not worth $16.50. I don't mind paying for delicious food but this $20+ meal was one word: overpriced. I think I should have gotten a discount for playing bathroom attendant.
author: Emi H.

description:
Burger Bar is a burger DON'T.  

Conceptually, the restaurant works: gourmet burgers dressed up with premium ingredients and toppings.  But as far as execution their burgers leave you wanting more. 

After a careful scan of the menu I chose the black jack burger comprised of angus beef, montery jack cheese, and olive tepenade on ciabatta bread. I also added a side of their beer battered jalapeno pickles. 

It sounds impossible but the burger was tasteless.  The tepanade was bland and didn't add any flavor to the lackluster burger.  As for the pickles, they were a mushy mess. Overall, my tastebuds weren't excited.  

But I held my breath for dessert and ordered the chocolate burger.  When they brought it out it certainly looked promising.  The chocolate burger was cleverly presented to look just like a burger with all the fixings.  But as I dug into it I was quickly disappointed. The only part I enjoyed was the donut "bun".  But the rest of the dessert just didn't mesh well. 

DON'T come here for your burger fix, satisfy your craving elsewhere.
author: Dorothy F.

description: Good luck if you're here during an earthquake or fire.  Once Macy's is closed, the only way out is via the elevator.  They locked the door to the stairs. Isn't that illegal?
author: I M.

description:
Finally had the chance to try the famous Burger Bar. It was nothing like FLeur de Lys, if anything, I was pretty shocked at how casual it was. I get that it's a burger joint, but if you're serving up $60 foie gras burgers, I expect table cloths of some sort...

The buffalo burger was pretty juicy for being buffalo meat, so kudos! The angus beef burger was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Also got to try their shakes and I have to say, they're delicious, but at $9 a pop, I find that pretty ridiculous.

Overall, I liked Burger Bar but wouldn't recommend taking a date here. It's not spectacular or impressive. I would come here after a shopping day in Union Square to grab a bite or just meet up friends for a casual meal.
author: Veronica S.

description:
I was extremely disappointed by this place.  I came here with the family and the baby got the chicken tenders, the hubby order the clam chowder and I ordered the turkey burger.

The hubby like his dish and he ate the baby's left overs...to be honest I was amazed he approved of the food.  The clam chowder didn't taste like a traditional clam chowder (it tasted like it might have had bacon in it) and the chicken tenders were extra crispy...but they man liked them...go figure!

I, on the other hand, was not happy.  I paid $14 for a turkey burger that didn't really taste like turkey.  I've eaten a lot of turkey burgers in my day and this sure didn't compare to any other turkey meat I've eaten.  If I didn't know it was a turkey burger I would have thought it was beef.  I ate about half of it and I felt so guilty for ordering a $14 burger that I took the leftovers home and they have been sitting in the fridge untouched for the last two days.  

I wouldn't recommend this place to my friends...ever...the only reason it got three stars is because it wasn't a horrific experience (just my food sucked).
author: Ash P.

description:
Good service, less than average quality food and drink. Everything was way too salty, the chicken tasted as if it was derived purely from salt. Same with my Martini. For the money you pay you would at least expect something special but instead the food gets it's flavor entirely from salt. No good.

I'm sure they have decent stuff on the menu I just have to find it, but I don't think that this is a definite must place to go, especially for the price. If you're looking to spend a good $20 go somewhere else, this place isn't worth it.
author: Ricardo O.

description:
Any place that allows me to put lobster, foie gras and black truffle sauce on my burger, I'm there! I loved Hubert Keller's Burger Bar in Las Vegas so when I found out there was one in San Francisco, I had to try it. The burgers here are fantastic. You can add various toppings such as aioli, pesto, bacon, oyster mushrooms and red wine & shallot reduction to your burger or you can get all fancy and add pan seared foie gras or grilled half a lobster for an additional $12.

I selected caramelized onions, black perigord truffle sauce, avocado, American cheese and Portobello mushrooms to complement my burger and let me tell you, it was a whole experience in my mouth. The burger was divine! The richness of the truffle sauce was the perfect touch.  I also ordered a side order of sweet potato fries which were superb. 

The ambiance was pleasant and we had a lovely view of union square. This is the kind of place where you can expect to pay $20-50 for a burger depending on what you get so make sure your wallet is full before you arrive. In my opinion, it's so worth it!
author: Victoria N.

description:
This was the dinner spot for my bachelorette party on a Saturday night.  I am sure that the tables around us weren't too excited seeing the 11 of us waltz in but we had a good time and were relatively well behaved.  

My turkey burger was one of the best I have ever had.  It was so juicy and flavorful.  I think I could have eaten it plain and enjoyed it just as much as I did with it piled high with avocado and peppered jack.  The sweet potato fries were also delicious.  

Our waitress didn't seem very happy to be there or very interested in serving us.  We ended up ordering our drinks and entrees at the same time since we had been there quite a while before she even came over the first time.  I have to say that the other restaurant staff were much more attentive and made me feel a bit more welcome.  

I think the prices are decent for the food quality and serving size. I plan to return to try some of their other offerings.
author: Emily J.

description:
Burger bar is sandwiched between 2 other restaurants that actually combine into one big seating area in the back. Interesting. 

Bf and I just ordered some onion rings with a side of ranch.

I was kind of hoping to see a good amount of onion rings, and here comes our lady with a small little thang of like 8 onion rings. -___- 

BUT, they were sure good. Also, their ranch is hand made. You can see the girl making em as you order. It was good! 

Hook it up more though!
author: Ayumi S.

description:
I heard some good things about this burger joint. It's located on the 6th floor of the Macy's in Union Square. I ordered the buffalo burger for $16.50 + added toppings for additional costs. I had avocado, sprouts, carmelized onions, and asparagus. The burger ended up to be over $20. I think it is a rip off with the charging of additional toppings. My burger was extremely tall, so I had to use a fork and knife. The buffalo tasted like beef. I couldn't tell the difference between buffalo and beef. The sweet potato fries and deep fried zucchini were okay. They were mostly soggy. Also tried the hummus appetizer. The dish comes with a bowl of hummus with 4 pieces of pita bread. Yeah, I don't think four pieces of pita is enough. Someone needs to rethink the math on that dish.

Service was pretty bad. The chef forgot the sprouts and avocado on the burger. Other co-workers got stuff missing from their burgers. In addition, we wanted more pita bread, but we ended up getting another order of the pita appetizer. In addition, it seemed like a really long time to wait for the food.

The meat patties are better at "Burger Bar." However, I can easily go to "The Counter" where there isn't an additional charge for toppings and the burger is just as good.
author: Jackie S.

description: I have never heard of this place until last night and NEVER again, the bun was old and the burger was just a burger, nothing special. You are better off going anywhere else but here.
author: Magda G.

description:
Oh Hubert, you're a victim of your own success. Because we're used to such amazingly high standards from Fleur de Lys, we have equal expectations when dining at any of your other restaurants, including a place which at the basic premise is nothing more than a fancy McDonald's. I realize that's not a completely fair assessment, but let's be realistic, when you think of burgers fine dining is one of the last things that typically comes to mind. I could even accept the high-end burger concept, were it done to perfection, and felt like something grandiose rather than just a burger with some expensive topping(s) on it.

We initially came here hoping to see Hubert himself, after dining at FDL a few nights prior (http://www.yelp.com/biz/fleur-de-lys-san-francisco#hrid:2qTi2qd_ur5A6JDSrHACmA) and being told he's spending almost all his time here now. We've been huge fans of his long before the Top Chef Masters show took him into a new level of chef stardom, and we mainly wanted to thank him for inspiring some fantastic dishes at home, as well as for the fabulous dinner at FDL, but no luck, he wasn't in Burger Bar that night either. This fact became quite evident once we actually received our burgers.

We decided to go with one of the premade selection, the peppercorn burger, which is coated with peppercorn and dijon mustard and comes with a side of peppercorn. This was ok, I think the judge of a burger place is how well they perform with their basic burger concepts rather than how much fancy stuff you can add on at exorbitant amounts. No offense to the Rossini burger here, which I'm sure is amazing, but if any place decided to put shaved truffles, foie gras, and a wine reduction sauce on top of their burger I can't imagine those flavors not being superior to the rest of the menu, which is why I don't use that as my yardstick. 

The sliders were miniscule (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=_pypfetOujQo-zkiJl60EA), probably the smallest I've ever seen. I barely got much of a taste of any of the 3 different types, and as a result they all tasted pretty much the same. The fries here are also forgettable, another shock at a place with this pedigree.

Probably the biggest upside for me about Burger Bar was the custom milkshake options, because you can get essentially anything you've ever wanted in a milkshake added in, at least in the way of unhealthy chocolate-based products. I decided to go all dark with a mint chocolate chip ice cream milkshake with chunks of skor bar, hazelnut mousse and homemade chocolate whipped cream. The consistency was perfect, and all the ingredients harmonious, a truly great milkshake.

The beef float paddle (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=jUMkja8RKqLkuci_WD6BXw) was much less impressive, providing a subpar offering of beer (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=cWPFhwGF7wEas3Lgcmpk9A) with ice cream floats which could barely handle their opposing flavors. The only one I really like was the Lindemans and vanilla ice cream combo, mainly because if you add Framboise to just about anything it tastes great. Other than that the Beamish and the Eel River were both ok, but the others were entirely too sour.

A final little annoying thing about Burger Bar, the bathrooms were just rancid when I went in. I'm talking like gas station bad, soaked in urine smell. If you're going to try to pull of fine dining with a burger spin, then I expect to be all of your restaurant to be fine dining, not just your menu.
author: Justin C.

description:
I remember when this place used to be packed with long waits but now it's easy to grab a table with one of the sweetest views of Union Square! The burgers are big enough to share along with a salad.

My personal favorite--The American Kobe Beef Burger--the meat really does melt in your mouth. Couple that with a fresh Burger Bar Salad (with excellent light dressing) and you have the perfect meal!

Oh...and don't forget to top it off with one of their delicious desserts. Their Nutella Burger is a MUST TRY for donut and nutella fans alike--genius concept that looks just like a burger---SWEET I SAY SWEET!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Service was great! Chris was our server and was excellent! He made our dining experience a blast. He was knowledgable, friendly and overall wonderful!
Bobbi, the hostess, the best!! She knew the menu and assured our gluten free friend there was plenty of options. 
Food was great! If I'm back in San Fran, I'll be back!
author: Shannon C.

description: They have pretty cool happy hour and lunch specials here. Awesome selection of beers. Try the Watermelon beer -AMAZZZAAAZINGG! Place is cool cause they cook and build your burger to order, using only the finest quality beef. You can even build your own milkshake -with NUTELLA. Oh my. A Nutella milkshake, what a truly ingenious idea! Place is located on the 6th floor of Macy's in Union Square. Cute place to take a cute date ;)
author: Grace H.

description:
This was the second time I had been to Burger Bar and while the first experience was probably 3-star worthy, the second was a definite downgrade to 2-stars. 

After a few hours of shopping with a friend from out of town, we decided we both had earned a delicious dinner. I (regretfully) suggested Burger Bar which at the time I felt was one of the better options in the area. My biggest mistake was not ordering a real, beefy burger. I thought I'd go all health-y-fied and order the veggie option. I even asked the server if he recommended it and he said that he ate it all the time. BLECH. It tasted like mealy paste. I had a few bites and left the rest.

The service was lacking as well. My friend asked for mayo and never received it. I had clearly barely touched my burger and our server didn't ask if there was an issue when he cleared our plates.

To add insult to injury, my veggie burger came out to be close to $20. I'd much rather spend my hard earned cash on Umami Burger.
author: Julia N.

description:
Good but expensive but the quality was there and it's still expensive but we're helping them pay for their rent, so we got great seating to make it worth it.  Otherwise I would've felt like I was at a souped up Denny's or something.  Haha, anyways...

Good beer selection, got a Hoegaarden!   I got an American Kobe Beef Burger with Caramelized Onions, grilled Pineapple, Monterey Jack Cheese on a Ciabatta Bun.  Accompanied with tomatoes, red onions, lettuce and a dill pickle.  I got my burger with Beer Battered Jalapeño pickles with Ranch.  Amazing!  My mouth watered for this and finished it completely.  =)

My lady ordered the Burger Bar Sliders.  This included: Buffalo with caramelized onions, Angus with plain Bacon, Country Natural beef with American Cheese, all served on a plain bun with skinny Fries.  She finished all of it too so I know it was delicious!

For dessert we got a scrumptious Nutella Milk Shake!  AMAZING!  Look at the photos I've posted!
author: Limzer L.

description:
The Burger Bar is the inception of one of my culinary gods...Hubert Keller, and I am a fan and giving this establishment four stars for one reason...the onion rings. I am a sucker for onion rings and am on a quest to find the best onion ring in the world, and I am pretty convinced that the onion ring at the Burger Bar is on that short list of candidates.

Overlooking Union Square on the fifth (or maybe sixth) floor of the Macys, its location is convenient to the Union Square tourist trap and features some gorgeous views (assuming you sit by the window, like we did) of the square and surrounding area. The restaurant itself it tastefully appointed and if you happen to get a booth, you will be sure to keep up with Glee, 24, basketball, baseball, whatever show you happen to be watching on the small tvs mounted there.

The menu itself is your classic burger fare and allows you to customize one to your tastes or try on of the "pre-selected" choices if you are lazy or want an easy out. The fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings were all incredibly good.

You may be waiting there for quite some time as the lines can get long. Oh, and don't venture to far away from the lobby area, cause you can miss your name being called. The wait staff are knowledgeable, however is the area that is truly lacking and would be where I'd give it two stars. They are almost on the verge of being completely terrible. They were slow...really slow.

All in all, minus the service, a great place to go...did I mention they have amazing onion rings?
author: Chad Y.

description:
I was in charge of choosing a lunch spot one day this week and when your coworkers are all savvy people with discriminating tastes, it's a lot of pressure. After our sushi plan fell through due to one coworker's seafood aversion, we ended up at Burger Bar, which I was excited about because I happen to be in love with Hubert Keller ever since he charmed me during Top Chef Masters. 

I called ahead to try to get a reservation, but they said they didn't take them. However, they reassured me that it wouldn't be a problem to get a seat for lunch on a Tuesday, and they weren't lying. We stepped off the elevator and were seated right away. I was surprised that the decor wasn't a bit more special...it kind of felt like a hip restaurant from the early 1990s. 

The server was very nice, and helped me choose my fixings for my custom burger. I ended up going with mozzarella, which was the best decision I've made in a while. Who knew that this chewy gooey cheese would be so good on a burger? I also added chipotle aioli, in accordance with my aioli addiction, and got some sweet potato fries on the side. The burger was nice but probably not worth the price, and although it's hard for me not to love sweet potato fries, these were a bit dry and not that fresh. 

The burger was good...burgers are good in general. But for the price and the name brand factor, I was expecting a bit more. Sorry Hubert, don't hate me! I still love you....
author: Christina P.

description: Originally shooting for Cheesecake Factory, the 90 minute wait forced us to look elsewhere.  The Burger Bar was a great place to stumble upon.  Seating was immediate and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  The view of Union Square was excellent.  The burger I had was definitely juicy and delicious.  I totally recommend visiting the Burger Bar.
author: L Q.

description: This location is located in the Macy's at Union Square. It's on one of the top floors which provides a great view of the busy square below. The service was awesome and the ambience is casual. The burgers are rather pricey but very good. I can't recall all of the burgers we ordered but we were all pretty satisfied.  My husband had the burger named after someone and it was rather pricey but delicious. Sorry, can't recall the names but just know we were happy with our food. Parking can suck because it's in the heart of Union Square but it's a nice view and break from shopping. Would recommend :)
author: Penelope A.

description: My experience at Burger Bar today was just okay. Very expensive, not worth it!! Service was good, Sylvia was good attentive. The place was not too busy and it's really a place for tourists. Very over-priced for a burger. As a native San Franciscan, I can tell you, there are a lot of better choices for a burger, like super-duper, Marlowe, Bullshead. This place nickle and dimes you for everything-fries don't come with the burger and by the time you add fries, cheese, bacon, or avocado, you are paying well over $25 +. Our first appetizer, the mild chicken wings, $15.20 and we switched for fried zucchini instead of fries, and up-sell and were not told about it up front when she offered the option, andI can tell the wings were good! But when we ordered a second order, one of our guests said the inside of the chicken wing, the chicken to the bone was cold. We had already talked to manager Travis about not having the gluten free fries available because their fryer was broken, that they somehow fixed after complaining, and that when ordering we asked for the sourdough bun and that was also not available. He said he was sorry, had some excuse and offered dessert, which at the time I said "well thanks". He compt one, because we only ordered one, and didn't even compt the chicken that had to re-done because it was cold, like it had come from the fridge and only the outside of the chicken wing had been cooked. Travis, the manger, never came back. You barely saw him working the floor and never came back to check on us since we were having a bad experience,. Needs retraining on customer service. $300 check later for 10 people  and it was not a good experience I wish it could have been better.
author: Desiree A.

description: My sister and I visited this restaurant on her recommendation that they served gluten free food.  I ordered the classic hamburger on a gluten free bun from a very attentive and pleasant server.  The menu said this burger came with skinny fries. Our server asked if I wanted the gluten free fries instead. I was grateful she asked.  Many servers who don't understand the gluten problems people have don't realize there may be gluten on other items. The gluten free bun was FABULOUS! The only time in 5 years I was able to eat a burger with a bun up to the last bite! It didn't fall apart in my hands or disintegrate. It was so tasty and big, like the Kaiser rolls I used to eat. The burger was cooked to my liking and very tasty and juicy. The fries were steak fries and cooked perfectly. I couldn't finish them. I would highly recommend this place to everyone, gluten free or not.  Wish we had one in Florida.
author: Donna P.

description:
Wow! That explains it pretty much. Came with a foursome and we decided each to get different sides to taste them all. We each built our own burgers and were not disapppinted. I had the angus with portabellas and avocado, one girl had the veggie burger, another had the salmon burger and the other dude had the angus with a jalapeno bun nothing special.

Each burger was very good cooked perfectly to order. The thick fries were the winner for the sides. The zuchini fries were a little disappointing, they were breaded too thick like cheese sticks. 

We arrived right before the lunch rush and when we left there was a line of people waiting to get in. They have plenty of seating to the left and right of the entrance. We debated whether we should try any of the shakes, and decided to find somewhere else to avoid paying so much for what looked like a small sized shake for a large price. They looked good though!

All in all I am glad we stopped in and tried this place. I recommend it if you are a burger lover and don't mind paying for a good size, well cooked, stacked to order type of burger.
author: Joseph G.

description:
Happy St. Patty's Day!  We figured everyone would be out partying and drinking green beer somewhere, so this would be a good night to check out the San Francisco Burger Bar (we went to the one in Las Vegas and loved it too).  We got a really cool table next to the ceiling to floor windows overlooking Union Square - the evening light slowly grew darker throughout our meal, and it was the most amazing view!  

We both ordered burgers (angus, country natural) with grilled bell peppers plus a shared side of sweet potato fries and a couple of stouts ($3 each on special for St. Patty's Day).  Lettuce, onions and a pickle accompanied the burgers and the burgers were juicy and deeee-lish!!  And the service was real nice and attentive.  

Coincidentally, there was a Yelp company party going on in the private dining area (I wanted to crash it, haha).  There's also a nice bar area and plenty of tables and booths.  And *awesomely*, we got to meet and shake hands with Chef Hubert Keller - how cool is THAT???  Looooved it!  

2 burgers+2 grilled bell pepper adds+sweet potato fries+2 stouts+tip+tax= $41
author: Maile N.

description:
Solid place that doesn't feel too chain-y, good service, quick to deliver.

Ended up going there two times within a few days late at night.  Peppercorn burger both nights, curly fries.  Some interesting beers on tab, friendly service, no complaints.

Hard to find something quick and decent late at night in Union Square and they do have the amazing views on top of Macy's overlooking Uniion Square, must be great around Christmas.
author: Doug M.

description:
After checking into my hotel I wanted something to eat and didn't want to wander far away - lo and behold Keller's ode to beef was right around the corner!

Atmosphere is good, little weird that it's inside Macy's but whatever. Kind of a steakhouse-meets-bistro motif. Good bar scene with attentive waitstaff.

The house-made beers are very good and well-paired to the burgers. After studying the menu like I was cramming for mid-terms, I ended up choosing the buffalo burger with jalepeno bacon, caramelized onions and monterey jack cheese, along with sweet potato fries. What can I say - I like spicy food!

What arrived was a virtual monument to burgers - a giant, housemade bun on top of which was a medium rare buffalo burger and all of the toppings I asked for! Juicy, flavorful, the perfect combination of sweet/spicy/savory in every bite! The jalepeno bacon in particular was awesome.

Well worth the cost if you are in the mode for a great burger.
author: Andy B.

description: I came to this restaurant 2 years ago and fell in love with these burgers. they have the best food! I gave them 5 stars in my last review but I returned to burger bar recently and have to write a new review based on my experience. I went into burger bar hoping to have a great experience with a group of friends telling them how great this place was! Our server rushed up to the table and was very rude. I would write her name in this but she didn't bother telling us...ill just say the tall blonde girl that isn't very friendly. while each of us made up our minds on what we wanted, she made rude remarks and acted like she was getting impatient. the food was amazing like always therefore I had to give them 3 stars due to the bad service we had. I just hope they train their employees on being a little more friendly.
author: Ryan T.

description:
I went here with 3 other people for lunch on a Saturday.  The best part about the experience was the view.  I had called ahead and they sat us immediately next to the window overlooking Union Square.  Awesome view, I'll give them that but the rest of the meal was less than average.

Here were the negatives and why I'm only giving this place 2 stars:
1. I ordered my burger to be medium rare but 2 of the other people in our party ordered their burgers to be well done.  Unfortunately, my burger came well done NOT medium rare.  For a place whose name has "Burger" in it, I expect their burgers to be cooked 100% of what the customer orders.  The other person in our party ordered his burger medium and his also came out well done.  

2. Service is less than exceptional.  Our waitress was friendly at taking our order but after that, we never saw her.  No "Can I get you anything else" check in which I found annoying because we wanted to ask about our burgers being over done.  I also wanted to ask about a sauce I ordered which I'm 99% sure was not the correct sauce they put on my plate.  Not a big deal and I went on ahead to eat it with my burger but worth-it to mention because I would have liked to ask the waitress yet she was nowhere to be found.    

3. Overpriced.  I would have been more comfortable with the price if they cooked my food correctly and service was better, but because they failed at these two fundamental items, the value was completely not there.

I would NOT recommend this place to anyone unless you are only going up to check out the view and feel the need to order something so you can sit there longer. Other than that, skip it.
author: Jessie W.

description:
My friends and I came here after running a marathon, so we were all starving and looking for anything edible! That said, the food here was pretty average for the prices they were charging. The cheapest burger you can get here is $13, and that literally consists of a beef patty and a bun...maybe some tomatoes and lettuce too. If you want to add any toppings, you're looking at closer to $17-$25 for a burger.

I got the "Frog" burger, which had mushrooms and truffle sauce for around $17. The truffle sauce was delicious and the burger was nice and moist. Skinny fries were included as part of this order and those were nice and crispy. Delicious!

If the prices were more reasonable, I'd give it a higher rating. But for what it was, it was way overpriced. But what do you expect from a touristy restaurant in the heart of downtown San Francisco? Burgers generally don't vary too much from restaurant to restaurant, and this place was no exception.
author: Grace L.

description:
Burger Bar was conveniently located in the Macy's building at Union Square. It was 10pm and we thought the line at Cheesecake Factory (which was located on the 8th floor) would die down. The wait time was still 55 mins for a party of two so we decided to go to the Burger Bar which was able to seat us right away. 

Here are my opinions about the food:
1. Buffalo wings - just about standard. We got majority drumsticks and only 1 wing out of the ~6 pieces of chicken. 
2. Cobb salad - fresh avocado, diced tomatoes, crispy bacon bites, hard-boiled egg, cheese and lettuce with a bleu cheese dressing. We ordered a small and it was good for 2 people to share if you're not hungry. 
3. Burger slider - it's like a sampler of their burgers. There were three different ones - cheese burgee, mushroom burger & bacon burgers. They were juicy and perfectly cooked. I liked them. 
4. Mojito - couldn't taste the alcohol at all. Tasted like mint and lime juice in ice water.  Would never pay $11 for this drink again
5. French Kiss alcoholic milkshake - again couldn't taste the alcohol at all. It was a like chocolate milkshake topped with one Oreo and some chocolate chips. Not worth the $10.50.

We were seated by the windows - amazing view of the Union Square! At first we wanted to experience the patio view at Cheesecake Factory but we were able to bypass the wait time at Burger Bar! Our Cristina was so nice, energetic and sweet! She took her time to talk to us and answer our questions! She also recommend going to Cha Cha Cha in the Mission District for the best mojito in town.
author: Karen L.

description:
This place is a bit overated,. but I am giving this place a 4 star ONLY because Hubert Keller actually walks around to meet and greet.  I met Hubert and got to take a picture with him. 

Food = 2 stars (Meh. I've experienced better.)

Not a big fan of sitting at the bar, especially for dinner,. my back starts hurting after awhile.  The only good thing about being seated in the bar area is being able to overlook union square and the ice skating rink during Christmas time. Came here when It was kind of new,. and the wait was pretty long.  Nothing about my burger stood out, nor did any of the side dishes.  I only came here to check this place out and to see what the hype is all about.  If I was going to crave a meaty burger,. burger bar wouldn't be my choice of restaurant.  Will only dine here for special events,.
author: Chanel L.

description:
Came here for the bf's birthday last night. He's a picky eater and loves burgers, but after seeing some of the reviews on here, I was a little hesitant about coming to BB, but I'm glad we did!

I made a reservation on opentable noting the occasion and asking for a table by the window. We arrived about 10 minutes late, but our table next to the window overlooking Union Square, was waiting for us. And when my bf disappeared to the bathroom, the hostess came over and asked if I wanted a candle put in his dessert. I appreciated they actually took time to pay attention to my reservation request.

We started off with the beer float sampler. They were all delicious (except one that tasted way too minty). We each had a kobe burger. I ordered mine medium, and he had his medium well, and they were both cooked perfectly. I got cheddar and bacon on mine, but the bf opted for pepperjack and jalapeno bacon. The bacon was cooked nicely, but the jalapeno bacon was amazing! But why wouldn't be? Bacon = delcious & spicy = delicious. Genius combination.
We each had chipotle aioli, which was flavorful with the right amount of kick. I went with the onion rings and loved them. My bf even stole a few and he hates onions! His skinny fries were delicious too. For dessert, we shared the nutella dessert burger. I'm not a big dessert person, but I really liked it. It's not overly sweet, especially considering its decadence.

Overall, I really liked everything. Our waitress was great, and the view was perfect. We didn't have any beer, but they had some great ones on tap, and they offer a sampler size for $2, so you can try a few different ones. Our bill came out to about $75, which I didn't think was that unreasonable. I think people who are let down by this place think it's going to be the Fleur de Lys of burgers. If you don't gone in with those ridiculous expectations, I think you will really enjoy your BB experience!
author: Alissa M.

description: The first time i had Burger bar was a few years back in Vegas.  I was super glad that they have a location in SF.  I came here several times before and the food has always been average. Their drinks were always go. I finally got to try their Foie Gras burger.  They sometimes right out. However, i was a little disappointed.  The foie gras was ok, it was only lacking a good sauce to accompany it. Overall you are just eating a regular piece of foie gras with your hamburger. I wonder can i just order the foie gras without the meat?  I'll still come back there and get my dranks and dessert. i love the view from this place.  This place can get packed during weekends, so it's best to come on a weekday after lunch hours.
author: Belinda C.

description:
So I've been to Burger Bar twice & had 2 very different experiences (think Loving You & Hating You) so I'm giving 3 stars overall for now 

****LOVING YOU*****

Veggie Burger!!!! 

For those of you who are complaining about the soft smooshable texture of the burger? Get over yourselves! You want a hard crunchy burger? Go get a Boca or some other pre-made factory staple from the grocery store 

This is a homemade, 1-of-a-kind, flavor explosion w/ all kinds of yummy beans, seeds & grains

Paired w/ Sweet Potato Fries & it's the perfect combo - although a nice dipping sauce would be good....none was offered 

*****HATING YOU*****

Second venture, I called to place a to-go order & when I got there, I see an Eggplant Sandwich & for those who know me, you'll know Eggplant makes me gag & is def on my Naughty List. 

How was the situation handled? The bartender tells me it's MY fault I got the wrong sandwich b/c their burgers are "constructed" & I didn't tell him anything I wanted on it....then he whips over a menu to *show* me how you're supposed to select your cheese, bread, etc... 

So I read the menu *back* to him that the Veggie Burger already comes with Mozzarella cheese so basically I didn't choose a bun.....how tragic! You give me the wrong sandwich b/c I didn't tell you what kind of *bread* I wanted & get angry when I call you on it!? 

Speaking of call.....you had my phone number for the order! Ever think of USING IT?! 

No. You didn't. 

Instead you take my newwwww order & then proceed to ignore me as I'm standing directly in front of you w/ my credit card in hand for 10 min, to pay for my meal. Another bartender finally comes over & I pay 

Adding insult to injury, as I'm walking out w/ my food, the bartender starts yelling after me that I *forgot* to pay my tab which of course makes everyone stare. The other guy rushes up to him to tell him I *had* paid so then he proceeds to yell "Have a great day".....riiiiight 

Final insult? The burger tasted old & wasn't nearly as tasty as on trip #1
author: Adrienne G.

description:
yea cool place to stopby for a snack when you're shopping in union square.  been here several times and most recently twice in the past month.  both times the burger was way under seasoned and not hot.  

service has always been excellent.  wait time very manageable especially with reservations.   

not much difference between kobe, farm organic and regular angus, unless the cook messed up the meat.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Somewhere, Chef and owner of Burger Bar, Hubert Keller is probably chowing down on a In and Out burger. Animal style.

Food: Are burgers at Burger bar good? With out a doubt, yes. Are the prices they charge for their burgers blasphemous? Yes! They also have inconsistencies with cooking temperatures and under seasoning their patties. The shakes however were stupendous. Im pretty sure there's crack somewhere in the mix.They should just rename the restaurant to Shake Bar, instead.

Service: Short, abrupt, forgetful, and devoid of any kind of hospitality; all of which make our server. He brought out 3 waters for our party of 4 and never managed to correct the mistake. He forgot to bring out the side of ranch that I requested. Lastly he argued with us that he charged the right amount for a shake that we ordered, but right before I left the restaurant I checked out the menu only to realize that he was wrong. If I want better service than this, I'll hit up the McDonalds in my area next time.

Ambience: Upscale sports bar with a wicked view of union square. If that's your thing then it's the cats pajamas.

Verdict: Probably will be back when they convert the restaurant to solely a shake bar.
author: AJ V.

description:
It is not worth the over 1 hour wait for just okay burgers that cost more than most.

It has a wonderful location that overlooks Union Square which is so pretty during the Christmas season, but the service was just okay, food okay, and nothing much to rave about.

had better burgers elsewhere.  I think Hubert Keller's other establishment in Vegas is much better.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: My Friend and I arrived around 7:30 pm Thursday ,not too bad was a little busy .We were greeted immediately and seated promptly. The waitress was very friendly and recommend some choices . My friend ordered the fish & chips and I ordered the kobe burger ( medium ). I have to say the Kobe Burger - DELICIOUS - And the alcoholic shakes - very good - with a kick! We left not disappointed...
author: Liv C.

description: Good was decent- pretty good veggie burger (house-made), crunchy fries and good zucchini fries. Service was pretty lacking, though. We arrived in the early side for lunch when it was pretty slow, and it took  about 5 minutes for a server to come over. She wasn't familiar with the beer selection, and after placing out order for food and drink, we had to flag her down several minutes later to ask again for our drinks. This whole time, 5-7 staff members were milling about, chatting and generally ignoring customers. EVERYONE wanted to sit by the window (great view of union square from the 6th floor), but all the tables were reserved so if you want a window seat, make a reservation. If you want decent service though, go elsewhere.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
And the Yankees win the World Series!!!!!! [2009]

Yeah!!!!!!!!!! I wasn't in NY at the time nor do I particularly care for the Yankees but it was still pretty cool to watch. I didn't miss out since I was sitting in Burger Bar and we had our own personal tv in our booth. The exclusive tv's are a neat feature of Burger Bar. You kind of feel like you are in a sports bar yet you still have plenty of privacy to enjoy a laid back dinner amongst friends and family. Burger Bar is a great alternative to Cheesecake Factory in Macy's. It's the same amount of fun without the long wait time. Just don't forget your wallet. The burgers are not cheap.

I originally booked Burger Bar for a girls' night out but then one girl's hubby came along which was totally cool because Burger Bar is the perfect spot for both sexes. Burgers, beer, sports and shopping. Burger Bar is in a great location and the burger menu is endless.

Some of our group built their own burgers. I went for the Hubert Keller burger. It was my first time eating buffalo. The buffalo meat was lean, full of flavor and juicy. It was topped with caramelized onions, spinach and bleu cheese. The Hubert Keller burger was an interesting combination in my opinion and it surprisingly worked very well. If I ever go back to Burger Bar, I'll get it again. The ciabatta held up nicely and my favorite was the side of skinny fries. The fries were held in a wire basket which looked like a miniature shopping cart. 

Our mama-to-be got a Nutella milkshake. It wasn't anything special but it did taste like Nutella when you drank from certain parts of the glass. In other words, it wasn't shaken up very well. For dessert we shared a chocolate burger. The concept was too cool to pass up. Too bad it didn't live up to it's expectations. Sure it looked amazing. But if dessert doesn't taste good, then really there's no point is there? If you looked quickly you would not have even known that what you were staring at was not a cheeseburger. This burger was really made out of a cold donut bun, strawberry tomatoes, mint leaf lettuce, passion fruit jelly cheese and a chocolate ganache patty. It tasted interesting. Really sugary and rich textures. It was a good idea for four people to share it. I couldn't imagine eating or wanting to finish a whole one by myself. It's really too much and not so appetizing for one person. 

I had a good time at Burger Bar. I somehow thought it was going to be cooler since my only recollection of it was from Vegas but it just ended up to be a casual spot with expensive, if you can even call it fancy, burgers.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Ten weeks from its opening, Burger Bar is mostly still a bust.  There were significant conceptual and execution problems all around.  For one, they didn't cook our burgers to order.  It's understandably difficult to cook with grass fed beef because it dries out so quickly, but that's life, and they need to nail it if they're going to specialize in burgers.  We sent all three of our burgers back because they were either missing toppings or had been overcooked.

We also struggled with the buns.  As others have noted, the buns are far too big and bready for the burger.  It's carbo hell.  Worse, two of our three sets of buns were stale, and I can't really imagine the excuse there.  (For comparison's sake on all of these points, I had the Luke Burger at John Besh's restaurant in New Orleans, and it's simply stellar across the board -- none of the problems described here.)

My last nit goes to the veggie burger, which is a mushy mess of carbs.  Pair it with the buns mentioned above, and you've got yourself a dish that just shouldn't have made it to the menu in the first place.

It's still worth calling out what worked: the meat is tasty (when cooked properly), the sweet potato fries were nice, and the milkshake that the manager comped us was delicious.  I appreciate that the manager solicited our feedback, and while I'm sure he didn't enjoy hearing what we had to say, he was an absolute professional about it.  I hope he's able to improve the experience here. 

If the goal is to compete with the Cheesecake Factory for the tourist crowd, then Burger Bar is a huge success.  That may very well explain why the Burger Bar is doing such brisk business.  I'm curious, however, what this all says about Mr. Keller.  It certainly makes me think twice about going to Fleur de Lys again anytime soon.
author: Laurence W.

description:
I've come here on multiple occasions because it's right in my bldg. 

Portions are generous and quality is very good.
