They've got a list of Chef's Burgers and you also have limitless options with the Build A Burger (pick your patty--ranges from regular ol' angus to kobe beef to buffalo to salmon to turkey to veggie... and more) and everything else under the sun. They have the normal fixings that every reputable burger place should have (ie. avocado, bacon, etc) but also way special things like prosciutto, peppered bacon, truffles, foie gras and like... 7 different cheeses.

Milk shakes are YUM. I usually end up splitting my milkshake with a friend because they're sizable (and they make them in TWO separate glasses with the trimmings and garnishes also--not just slop-poured into a second cup). I've had their beer float milkshake for a birthday lunch (delicious!) and I never make it to dessert because my belly gets full.

Also try: Sweet Potato Fries!!!
author: Nicha K.

description: Food was alright , fast service . The waiter was bad, barley came to the table to ask if we needed anything . On top of that they gave us an expired bottle of beer, GROSS ! Would not recommend !
author: Ysabella R.

description: Came in Sunday late afternoon to get a adult milkshake and we were sat right behind hostess stand by window. We sat there with no help for about 15 min then the hostess turned around and ask if we wanted to order a drink, we did with her. The waiter that was helping table behind us never said a single word to us. Then about 5 min later we ask hostess for water. Sat there and watch her change shift as a new hostess came in. We waited and waited and finally ask her to check on drinks as been 15-20 min since ordered. She went to see and we decided your place was not worth our money. As leaving to walk out the table that was behind us said do not feel bad we got our food and almost done and still not a glass of water or our drinks we ordered. Very poor service!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Tammy J.

description:
My first experience with Burger Bar was on a trip up to the city a few yeArs back. This trip is the reason that my overall Burger bar experience has has many as two stars. During that dinner I had one of the best burgers of my life coupled with excellent service. It doesn't hurt that Hubert Keller was cruising around from table to table making sure everyone was happy. 

Fast forward to 2014 and you have the reason for only two stars. We had a reservation and arrived about 10 minutes early. We were told that our table would be ready right on time for our 7:30 reservation and we were all happy to wait. After being seated in a large booth, that is where it all went downhill. After waiting 20 minutes, we were first acknowledged by a server that apparently wasn't ours. He brought our waters and took our drink orders. After another 10 minutes the alcohol came to the table but no soda for my pregnant friend. We had to ask two more times for the soda to come. Once we finally placed our burger orders (a burger that I had been dreaming about since 2009), my medium burger came out with zero pink in it. This was the case for everyone at the table.... No pink in a medium rare burger??? C'monnnnn. We were all too fed up at that point to fathom sending the burger back in fear that we would never see it againAlso to make matters worse, when the food runner delivered our burgers, we had no silverware for condiments. I ended up spreading the cranberry sauce on my burger with my finger with zero shame before the silverware arrived 5 minutes later. 

All in all, if I could recreate my 2009 burger bar experience, I would happy return, but at this point, my next trip to San Francisco will certainly not include this restaurant.
author: Alison C.

description: Went to this place on a saturday night, luckuly we made a reservation because this place was packed!  It took awhile to seat us, but it was worth the wait.  The beer list is lengthy and impressive.  Everyone at the table was able to find a brew they enjoyed.  Everyone made their own burger and each varried.  I had the kobe beef burger with brie cheese, proscutto, and carmelized unions.  I also got the coleslaw and a side of the truffle mayo!  I really loved my burger, they were huge though- you could prolly split it.  The fries were tasty and so was the cole slaw.  We even got a alcoholic milkshake which was such a treat.  The service was attentitive and helpful.  I understand the complaint about the cost, however you really do get a gourmet burger!  To me the cost increase is worth it.
author: Kate F.

description:
I went here for lunch with a friend in the middle of the week. Got a table window side immediately.
The view was amazing....we watched some weird Giants fan choreography going on in the square.
Everything on the menu looked good! Including desserts!
Fried pickles were different and yummy with a kick, good for more than 2 people though as I wanted Rings too. Huge Rings and they were delicious, almost ate them all! 
Burger was very good. Got a custom Burger and it was totally to my liking! So many choices yet the best burger is simple. This is a good head to head with the new place in Corte Madera called, The Counter.
Wanted dessert! Too full though!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Hubert Keller promises the "ULTIMATE burger experience". Ehh...not sure if he succeeded. Don't think I like eating my burger while staring at the housewares section on the 6th floor of Macy's. Just kind of weird.  

3 stars is the average rating out of a 10 point scale. Sample size was 6 diners. Our average rating for burger bar (for just the food only) was 7.33 with a median and mode of 7. Not bad. Burgers seems to be hit or miss. I really enjoyed my customized burger: 
 
Natural Country Beef (medium-rare)  $10.50 +
Ciabatta Bun +
Carmelized Onions $1.25 +
Button Mushrooms $1.25 +
Provolone Cheese $0.75 + 
Zucchini Fries $3.95
Total = $17.70

Others got the "Surf and Turf" (7/10), "Peppercorn" (7.5/10), "Hubert Keller Burger" (7/10), Burger + homemade dijon + aioli (5/10), Burger + blue cheese (5/10). 

Lessons learned: 
* Pick a seat that doesn't stare into the heart to Macy's, turn around and grab a seat facing Union Square
* If you are lazy select one of the chef's burgers - they end up being a better deal because they already come with fries
* Buttermilk Zucchini Fries and Sweet Potato Fries are yummy
* Check out the great beer selection!
* The burgers at Burger Bar are about the sauces, veggies, and other add ons. If you are a traditionalist go elsewhere.
author: Debbie C.

description:
Great Buffalo Burger in the Macy's building on Union Square. 

As reported, the prices are high, but the quality is also very high. I'd recommend the Buffalo Burger with enthusiasm as well as the fries. The milkshakes are great, but I'd avoid the burger shaped tofu desert...... as it's bland, expensive and not worth the time or money. It's also cool that in the booths they provide TV's so that you can tune in to any sporting event that you fancy.

Overall..... Burger Bar is worth the trip.
author: Millard M.

description:
How I ended up at Burger Bar on a Friday during lent - I really have no idea.

I couldn't actually eat a BURGER so this review is mostly for the non-burger ordering folk. I ended up ordering the grilled shrimp salad and a side of steak cut fries. I'm a firm believer that everything on the menu should be tasty. Obviously burgers are the star here but if it's on the menu - it should still taste good! The shrimp were bland and the dressing was extremely bland. I ended up adding tons of salt and pepper so that it could taste like something.  I'm also not a big fan of having to cut my own lettuce, really? - why are you making me work for my salad??? Chef Hubert, please fix this.

On top of all that, I had to ask about the whereabouts of my fries twice.

Alcoholic milkshakes were tasty.

Overall, disappointed. Sad face.
author: Kim-van T.

description:
There's a lot to like for a locals once you get over the location in Macy's. But if you're going to eat at Union Square, why not get a view overlooking it? Fortunately, the view isn't the best part of the experience. 

The only difficult part of the meal was picking out the combinations of burgers and fries to share. Turns out that zucchini fries are more tasty for lovers of fried food than vegetables. (Yes, I've liked zucchini ever since my mom made 7yo me grow them behind our house in order to get me to eat them.) Our server was experienced, professional, and had a sense of humor - a must for a high-tourist spot like this one.

On my next visit, I'll try the surf and turf burger, since the kitchen is willing to put it on the menu. Get the Lipitor ready!
author: Mike H.

description:
Overpriced mediocre burgers with BAD service! Don't waste your time here....seriously. OVER HYPED & NOT WORTH THE WAIT!

Despite Mr. Keller being at the restaurant there that night, service was horrible. We should have known the moment we found out that they gave our table away. We were a party of 10 and had been waiting for 1.5 hours. Cheesecake Factory was the original plan but the estimated time was 3 hours there.

Flag #1: We were seated and they brought waters for 7/9 people. We ordered our food and asked for water, but it never came.

#2: Food came out and we were missing 2 burgers and a side of fries. We thought they were going to bring it out. No one noticed for about 5-10 mins and we had to flag down multiple people to inquire about it. They kept saying, "It's coming out." Then one guy goes, "It's coming right out.....By the way, what did you order???" You mean bullshit is coming right out?

#3: They brought out one burger that was missing and we were wondering why he was scraping off the mushrooms. He said I didn't order that (btw, he's 10 years old). He ordered the plain basic burger, but they brought out a kobe burger with mushrooms. Since he was hungry, he ate it anyways.

#4: About 25 mins after the manager got involved with our missing burgers, the chicken burger finally came out and the rest of the party was already done eating by then. They did not even comp this burger even though we had to ask 10 times about it before they took action. Also, the server said the chef would bring it out himself. We were kind of excited and got our cameras out, but that never happened even though we saw him walking around the restaurant. We noticed everyone started avoiding our table after that burger fiasco, especially the managers. They would avoid eye contact or turn around before they reached our section.

#5: When the bill came, they charged us for the kobe burger even though we had ordered the plain burger, but was given the kobe. It was a $7 difference so we asked the server about it. He implied that since he ate the kobe burger that we should pay for it. Seriously? We have to pay for your mistake?? Then after realizing that NO we weren't doing that, he reluctantly got it taken care of. Needless to say, we didn't leave a good tip.

#6: Bad Customer Service. My friends and I have been in the hospitality industry for years, so we understand issues/problems that come up, but the way they handled everything was appalling. They weren't sorry for making the mistake and even tried to make it sound like it was our fault. They could have simply comped the 2 burgers that came extremely late. ANY other restaurant would have done something for their mistake like comping the meal or providing a free dessert. How everyone handled the situation, including the managers, server, busboy, runners, was to "cover their ass."

FOOD:
- Grilled Shrimp Salad: over drenched with dressing, shrimps & grilled vegges were okay
- Kobe Beef Burger: nothing special, served with basic tomato, onion, lettuce side, bread good texture
- Onion Rings: taste like any other place
- Sweet Potato Fries: good, but a little surprised this gourmet restaurant didn't serve any type of aioli sauce to accompany the fries

Frankly, I think the server messed up and simply forgot to put in the order for the last 2 burgers. He was busy with 2 large parties and had a few other tables. That's a lot of people to handle for one server. Either have a seasoned server or don't be short staffed like that on a busy Saturday night.

Everyone knew about our table and how we were upset. We complained to the manager (Edward) again after paying for our meal. He was nice enough to listen but they didn't do much to make us want to come back. He simply said we could write to the GM on this card. It was a basic restaurant card with no email address and no name.

Yeah, Burger Bar is located in a prime location where the amount of tourists alone that visit will pay for the rent, but good luck surviving when it's off season. Also, it's logistically a nightmare to get in & out of the place, especially when Macy's closes. They only have ONE ELEVATOR. Be prepared to wait and panic if there's a fire or earthquake. The only good thing is they have a very extensive beer list and you can watch the game. The bartenders are efficient. 

I would rather wait 3 hours at Cheesecake Factory. At least their service is much more efficient and food tastes much better for half the price. Or just go to In-N-Out!
author: Linda C.

description:
Definitely a solid 2. Decent food but nothing popping. Expect to pay anywhere from $20~$60 for a burger. There's this super special burger they offer for $60. Ai... I guess if you want to indulge you can go ahead but really? Not me.

Anyway, went here only because my good friend told me to. I thought it'd be good or that I'd at least get to meet Hubert Keller, but alas, no. Even holding mediocre expectations going in Burger Bar failed to make a solid impression on me (and my party might I add). 

Supposedly kobe beef is okay.
My original classic burger was only okay.
The peppercorn burger is only okay. (Cheapest among the 3 at ~$15.) 
In general the burgers are far too round for my taste. It makes for a tall burger..hard to eat. The meat was not seasoned in some interesting way nor was it classic. I remember it tasting rather bland as if they wanted you to just taste the meat without embellishments. If that's what you like this is the place for you. Then again, you could also do it yourself by mixing salt/pepper/ground beef...you can pick. Overall, I'm a bit bitter that I gave Burger Bar business...sigh...there goes $20.

The one thing I really liked were their thinly cut, crisp, and salty sweet potato fries. But heck, go to Costco and get the frozen ones. They're just as good, just not as thinly sliced.

Service is slow as well. And you can only make reservations for parties of 13+. It's like...what the...13 people...what the? Oh well. It's a convenient place to go if you have plans downtown. After all it's in the Macy's building (look for the Cheesecake factory sign, same building as Burger Bar).
author: Sarah W.

description:
Extremely conveniently located at the Macy's building right at the square in the centre of San Fransicsco, this is an easy and nice place to meet and to have a real American burger (in the opinion of a visitor, so not so knowledgeable of all burger differences in San Francisco).

We ordered the most basic burger and that was just what we needed at that moment. 

This was great meat, good grilled, nice fries, large portions (again we are visitors.... all portions seem to be quite large to us).

Although this is not specifically a touristy place, I think this is a very convenient place for tourists  (like myself) to try to get a hand on a really nice burger because of the location, the view on the square, the very American look and feel of the whole premise, the menu, the food.
author: Merijn H.

description:
I'm really confused as to why there are so many 1 and 2 star reviews for Burger Bar? If it's because of the price- I don't think that's fair! Burger Bar is a gourmet burger joint with higher-then-average burger prices- And i think this place rocks!

Yes- the average burger here will run you between $16-$22, although they do have $9-$11 options. Since this was my first time trying Burger Bar(and i wanted to give Yelpers my best assessment), I decided to go all out and get "Hubert's Favorite Choice" as advertised in their menu; the Hubert Keller Burger. Hubert Keller is the head chef and creator of Burger Bar, so if this is his favorite burger it had to be good!

Folks, this burger was much better then good! It was outstanding! I understand for $22 I could have purchased a hell of alot more double cheeseburgers from McDonalds- But I could sincerely taste a difference and believe this burger is WELL WORTH IT! The juiciness of the burger was just awesome! The caramelized onions were just falling out of the ciabatta buns! The blue cheese was so pungent, yet so delicious. The Hubert Keller burger was so flavorful- it was down right amazing.

My Girlfriend purchased a Buffalo Burger- which tasted great as well! I had a few bites, each seemingly more tender than the last. You can really taste the difference between the Angus beef and the Buffalo beef.

On top of this- they serve really unique milkshakes such as Nutella and Twinkie flavors. Plus, they have a really huge selection of beer and wine. My jaw dropped when i saw their beer list! I ended up picking some random pilsener from Germany I'd never heard of- that's always fun lol.

I really do plan on coming back to Burger Bar soon. I might not drop $20 on a burger again since i'm sure the quality of their lower priced burger is just as great! Who knows, i might get crazy and throw some black truffles or some foie gras- or heck, even lobster on my burger. I'm definitely a fan of this place and recommend it!
author: Greg G.

description:
I was SO freakin' excited when I heard that Burger Bar in Macys of SF opened!! The first time I had Burger Bar was in Vegas at Mandalay and I was absolutely in LOVE. 

I love the idea that you can make your own burger...
I love the idea that you can get lobster on your burger...
I love the fact that burgers from Burger Bar are absolutely delicious...

BUT

What I didn't love about my experience here was...
1) Peppercorn bacon was fried TOO hard. I'm glad I don't have dentures
2) Sweet Potatoes were over-fried, leaving them crispy and as they got cold, they turned hard.
3) Service was SLOW. SLOW. SLOW.
4) No Reservations

So, if they fix those problems, I would give Burger Bar 4 or maybe 5 stars. I'm down to try it again, but they honestly shouldn't strike out! 

PS. The view of Union Square is awesome up here if you have a window seat. I recommend NOT sitting in the booths b/c servers can't see you and thus they conveniently forget about you.
author: Heidi C.

description: Disgusting Kobe burger not worth $17.95! Dry and bland and super THIN. Disappointing.
author: Taty A.

description:
4 stars for the milkshakes only.  Milkshakes are delicious!  Had the Black and White Milkshake.  So sweet, satisfying, yet doesn't taste heavy.. how do they do it?

Tried their nutella burger which is a dessert with donut, fruit, and nutella..... Clever idea and looks super cute when it comes to the table, but I would probably pass on this next time. I was expecting a really delicious donut (like Krispie Kreme) but that was not the case...
author: Maxine C.

description:
Someone told me to come here and order the Hubert Keller Burger for the "best burger in the world." Not sure if it was *the* best, but probably one of the top 3 burgers I've tasted in the worldwide. (The other two being Pearl's in SF, and a restaurant in Epernay, France that I really wish I remembered the name of....) 

Anyway, the burger was made of buffalo meat cooked medium-well done, caramelized onions, baby spinach, and blue cheese on a ciabatta bun - served with a side of skinny fries and gravy. Delish. Looked popular with the business lunch and own-of-town crowd. Reservations recommended. It's a little pricey, but the burger was great, and if you get a table near the windows - the view is as well.
author: Josiah M.

description:
60 Bucks for a burger, and it was worth it!  
My brother took me here for lunch, so we scored a table with the view of the square, and we people-watched while having lunch.
I got the Rossini burger.  The burger was amazing: a perfectly cooked medium rare Kobe beef from Snake River Farms Idaho, the duck, truffles, and Madeira sauce were a major contributor to the flavor-packed burger juicy-ness.  Oh, I forgot, the fries and shake were an awesome compliment to my burger-meal demand.
The place was pretty packed during lunch, the waitress was helpful and friendly, and the bathroom was clean.  The prices were a little high, but it's a Hubert Keller spot and next to Union Square.  I'll have to try the Vegas location next.
author: Michael K.

description:
Being an avid Top Chef Fan, I was so excited to go to Burger Bar after hearing they serve Kobe beef and foie gras. After seeing mixed reviews on YELP, I wanted to wait a bit hoping they would iron out their wrinkles. After several weeks later, I just couldn't wait...was it worth the wait? ABOSULTELY NOT! I have to say I AGREE with all the negative reviews regarding Burger Bar's food quality, pricing, and service. 

My friend and I came here on a Monday night around 6:10 p.m. We waited for about 5 minutes before we were seated. Upon walking to our booth, I was shockingly surprised about how mundane the décor was. More on décor later.

FOOD:
*Kobe Burger w/ Foie Gras and Swiss Cheese on an Onion Bun: The Kobe was very meh. I have had Kobe several times before and I have to say I agree with all the other YELPERS who say it tasted exactly like ground beef. The Kobe wasn't seasoned properly and therefore lacked flavor. I requested the Kobe be cooked MEDIUM, but it was WELL-DONE. 

Ok, while the Foie Gras and Kobe sounds like a good combo in theory; it didn't pair well together. Because the patty was substantially larger as compared to the foie gras; it got lost in the patty. The only thing it did to the burger was add a salty oily flavor to it. 

*Skinny Fries w/ Chili Aioli Sauce: The fries were ok; I would say something to comparable to McD's fries minus the salt. They would have probably tasted better if they were hot versus lukewarm. There was NO kick or heat in the chili aioli sauce. It looked and tasted like colored mayo.

*Vanilla Ice Cream w/ Nutella and homemade whip cream: They claim their ice cream to be homemade? I'm guessing that's why it took 33 minutes to get our ice cream! The ice cream was just average; there was nothing that really stood out about it. 

PRICING: Build your burger concept...pick your patty which ranges in prices. Then if you want to add cheese, grilled onions, veggies, condiments (i.e. Dijon mustard), etc, there's a separate charge. 

My Kobe w/ Foie Gras and Swiss Cheese came out to be about $30. Fries were an additional $3.35. 

SERVICE: Our waitress was nice; however, once we first seated, she was anxious to get our orders. And, after we received our food, she was no where to be found. It took about 25-30 minutes to get our burgers. After eating out burgers, we decided to order dessert. After 20 minutes of waiting for our ice cream, we flagged down the waitress to cancel our order. She said they were running behind schedule, and that they were preparing it right now. Another 10 minutes passes, and nothing. We asked again to cancel the order and to just get the bill. She apologized and said the Manager will comp the ice cream and they were making it now. After waiting a total of 33 minutes, we finally got it. Unless you're churning the ice cream as we speak, it should NOT take that long to scoop ice cream and pour some nutella sauce on it. 

DÉCOR/AMBIANCE: Ummm, if you're going to serve burgers ranging from $15-$60, you better have a decor that's more extravagant than the typical Sports Bar and Grill which pretty much sums it up. Cheesecake's décor puts Burger Bar's décor to shame. Sad...And, what is up with the TVs in the booths? It was very distracting especially when trying to hold a conversation. So yah, fellas, not a good date place. 

CROWD: Tourists, tourists, and more tourists. I guess they should be thankful that they're located in a prime location. 

We were able to see Chef Hubert Keller walking around the restaurant, hence the 2 stars. Would have been a nice touch if he made an effort to reach out to the patrons...

To sum it all up, I was disappointed with my experience at Burger Bar and highly doubt I would return, nor would I recommend it to anyone. There's far better places to get a burger that's more reasonable (e.g. Bullshead, Barney's, etc). I know Burger Bar is no Fleur De Lys, but if it's any indication of how it may be; I rather go broke and trek to French Laundry.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
First off, a serious shout out to Assistant Manager Forrester Loing.  He turned what could have been a bad situation into one of the best experiences we've had at a restaurant.  The food was amazing, the service was great, and the view was exceptional. 
My step-son ordered the World's Hottest Burger.  It was funny to see the staff shocked that he could eat it without sweating or drinking the complimentary milk. 
Based on our experience today Burger Bar has become our new "go-to" place when in or near Union Square.
author: David C.

description:
Obviously amazing view but a little overpriced for just burgers and fries were extra. 

The Veggie patty fell apart after a while. 

Great beer selection and just thinking about the milkshakes are making my mouth water.
author: Dominique D.

description: Never even got to try the food or drinks. We sat for 15 minutes and our waiter never took our order. I finally asked the host about our waiter, and he said our waiter was busy with a "bigger party." So he took our order and we waited some more. All we ordered were drinks and dessert. Our waiter finally came by and said he received our order but offered no apology, just excuses. After waiting 10 more minutes for my drink, we decided to leave. There are just too many bars in the area to waste time here and get no service. We won't return.
author: Iris M.

description:
I had the American Classic Burger and my wife had the Pulled Pork Burger special (not in the online menu). The thing I liked the most about the burgers and fries here are that they are not greasy. The staff was very friendly and service was good. The view off of this 6th floor restaurant is very nice if you get a window seat since you get a birds eye view of Union Square. 

My wife spotted Chef Hubert Keller himself walking by and waved and smiled at him. Was just expecting a nod of acknowledgement back, but he actually circled back to our table to talk to us and take a few pictures. Coincidentally enough, we made reservations to Chef Keller's other restaurant, Fleur de Lys, for the next evening. He seemed very happy that we were fans of his and took down our name. Not only did we get a complimentary side at Burger Bar, but we got an extra desert at Fleur de Lys!
author: Daniel W.

description:
The Burger Bar is awesome!  The view is terrific.  It is worth sitting at the high tables because you can get a great view of the activity going on at Union Square.  The bar makes awesome drinks and the wine list is good.

The burgers always come out just as you ask for them to be.  I have also tried the salads which are great.

The atmosphere is friendly.  It isn't a romantic place, but easy enough to have a good conversation.
author: Dallas N.

description:
Our group of four came here on 02/15/13 for lunch.  We had reservations at 12:30 pm.  The lines were super long when we got there but the restaurant was not full.  

The waiter seemed uninterested in serving us and kept rushing us to order.  We literally had just sat down for maybe two minutes. Although once we did order, the food did come out fairly quickly and correctly.  I had ordered a beer and was immediately asked by the waiter for the menu back asap.  I said what if I wanted another beer how do I know what my options are.  He said just ask.  I was not about to ask the guy to go through the large list of beers each time but had no problems asking him for the menu then passing it back to him every time I needed a new beer.  It was an inconvenience he would have to deal with.  Wasn't sure what the big deal was with letting me keep a menu to browse but whatever. 

I had ordered a customized burger that was delicious.  The burger consisted of Kobe Beef, an egg, chipotle sauce, and pickles.  Haha, I am a very simple guy. The burger didn't come with fries but I was able to have some from the others in the group. 

The place looked a little run down.  We sat in a booth that had holes in the seats with the holes and rips in the cushion covered up by duck tape. GHETTO. In addition, I came out of the restaurant feeling dirty like I reeked of burgers and fries. For a top chef master's restaurant, I was disappointed with the atmosphere. 

Overall:  I'd go there again but it wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Sokha S.

description:
They did not want me to sit on the table I wanted. 
Also i wanted the daily special they have on the weekdays and it ends at 16:00 and it was like 15:25 and they not wanted to give me the special. 
Also a bar tender wanted my name on my receipt when I payed cash. What's up with that?
Also it doesn't have much clientele compared to the cheesecake factory.
author: Nadav M.

description: Service was slow, had to sit at the bar. The AC was broken on an extremely warm day. There were no fans, everyone was sweating. It took 15 minutes to even be greater by a bartender. There was only a few waitstaff, they were obviously understaffed.
author: Denise P.

description:
All in all, I had a great experience here - there was one disappointment, but everything else was fantastic.

The restaurant is not enormous, but big enough for something in San Francisco.  The fact that you can look-out over Union Square is incredible.

The menu is great - so many options from special creation burgers to a build-your-own option, this place offers something for everyone as long as you're into burgers.  A ton of options including meat, toppings, sauces, cheese and bread are plentiful.  They also have specialty milkshakes as well as build-your-own milkshakes, which is nice because you can customize something to your liking with ice cream flavors, mix-ins and toppings.  The sides (fries and onion rings) are also great.

Many have complained that the biggest problem is the flavoring of the burger and I really do have to agree:  the burger lacks flavor.  I can tell that the quality of meat is incredible and very tasty, but the fact that the meat itself is under seasoned causes a lack in the burger experience.  Everything else is great - the buttered toasted bread, the fresh vegetable and special toppings, even the sauces are great, but the fact that the burger lacks seasonings (really just a bit of salt and a hint of pepper) leaves one a bit unsatisfied.  When a customer is being asked to pay $10 or more for a burger and the burger is from a world-renowned chef, it should be close to perfect and it wasn't quite there.  Honestly, the remedy is simple - add a bit more salt and a bit of pepper and the burgers will be fantastic.

Restaurant - 4 stars
Service - 4.5 stars
Burger - 3 stars
Fries/Onion Rings - 4.5 stars
Milkshakes - 5 stars

OVERALL: 4 stars
author: Ken G.

description:
Besides their location its not much excitement here. 

Food: The burgers are ok and nothing to go crazy over. Their prices are way to expensive for a burger that is not even all that.

Service: The service was satisfactory.
author: Brittney H.

description:
Got lost on our way to Japantown, kept circling around Union Sq... so decided to settle at Burger Bar above Macy's. Best choice ever!!

A casual joint on the 6th floor (i think) of the huge mall in Union Sq. My friend and I each got the Blackjack burger, medium rare, with sides of both regular and sweet potato fries. The meat patty was moist and perfect... as were the fries. Our waiter was nice and all, except you had to remind him 3 times for every request. but he meant well. 

I had to take half to-go bcuz i wasn't hungry in the first place.. but you know a place is good when the leftovers taste great the next day at work!
author: g k.

description:
Made our second visit to the Burger Bar after a day of last minute Christmas shopping in the Union Square area. We were a bit surprised that we were seated right away during the craziness of the season. The location is really cool, high a top the Macy's with a wonderful view of the Christmas tree and ice skating rink in Union Square. The staff was coldly efficent and the decor is very "burger modern."

The burgers are really good, and the draft beer selection pretty decent as well. But, in reality, you are not really coming here for a "GREAT!" burger, which you should get for the price. My wife and I had burgers, fries and a beer and the check was $65.00.

Really, you can get a good or better burger for a lot less at The Counter or even The Habit. But if your hanging in SF around Union Square and want to splurge, you could do worse.
author: Gary A.

description:
I can here for lunch with my boyfriend for my birthday and I don't think I'll be coming back.  Nothing in particular was horrible, but nothing memorable enough for me to come back.

Service was reallllly slow except when they came by to get our check (go figure haha).  We got there around 12 and didn't finish our meal until 2pm because of all the wait time.  It took about half our meal for them to bring my bf his mayo.

As with most places, there was a LONG line for the ladies room which is understandable except this is a decent sized place and they had single restrooms.  Design fail?

I wasn't feeling too hungry so I just got fisn'n'chips (an appetizer).  I couldn't even finish it.  Perhaps it's because I've been to England and had real fish'n'chips or maybe because I just didn't feel very hungry that day, but it was very unappealing.  The breading was too thin (almost non-existent) and the fish itself was similar to the fish I'd find at McDs.  

My boyfriend's burger look decent though (perhaps I should have gotten a burger since this place IS called the Burger Bar).  Also, both our orders were supposed to come with fries, but we only got one.  What the heck?  Service was so slow that we didn't even bother to ask.

The shakes are pretty good though (I def recommended sharing because they're pretty big) and the view is nice (if you get seated against the window).

Overall I'd say this is one of those places in SF you should go to once just to experience it, but definitely not a regular spot for me.
author: Vy L.

description:
We have been to the original Burger Bar in Las Vegas, NV so we had to stop by here because we had to have their Kobe style burger again. Let's start off by saying that it's busy. Very busy. The wait was quoted as 15 minutes, but when 15 minutes came... nothing. So the girlfriend went up and asked, Pow! We got a table. She was like that one girlfriend of Jerry Seinfeld that got everything he wanted. Probably just a coincidence, but it was awesome none the less.

The view was quite spectacular of a Christmas time Union Square.  Christmas tree and skating rink included. The tables are a bit crowded and if you got one next to a family that can't control their kids, that sucks. That could happen anywhere though. 

The service was kind of sloppy with the servers seemingly drifting in and out of attentiveness. Unfortunately, more out than in. It wasn't too bad though because we really didn't need much attending to anyways. For the price you are paying, that's one place that needs upgrading. Maybe it was just an off night. It was cool though, me and the girlfriend were there just having fun and shopping. 

Oh, yeah! We did enjoy our burgers though! Nice, thick, and burgery! Love'em! It was spendy. I mean we're ordering something meaty that has the word "Kobe" in it, so you know you're gonna spend some dough.

In the end, the service just needs to be streamlined and upgraded. We weren't waiting long for our food, it's just that the waiters seemed to wander at times.
author: Brian A.

description:
The correct spelling of Burger Bar is actually S-L-O-W.  It may just be because this place is brand spanking new that it is so inefficient, but it still probably shouldn't take almost an entire half of football to place an order for a hamburger and fries and to receive said order.

Aside from how slow this place can be the quality of the food is quite good, though pretty pricey just as you'd expect.  Couldn't afford the $60 Kobe beef and foie gras burger so I ordered the slightly more recession-friendly priced $11 Country Natural burger with provolone on a ciabatta bun and a side of sweet potato fries.  No complaints on the taste.  The burger was tasty, tender and pretty juicy and the sweet potato fries were very good as well.  We also ordered the Creamy Cheesecake Burger for dessert which was a thin layer of sweet cream cheese, pineapple and strawberries sandwiched in between a glazed donut sans donut hole.  The dessert burger looked a lot better than it actually tasted.

If you aren't immediately starving and you are in no particular rush, then you may want to check this new hot spot out.
author: Erich D.

description:
I admit it, Im a Keller fan. I watch his PBS show religiously and had resisted ever watching Top Chef until I heard about the "Masters" version he was going to be in.  When I first moved out here, Fleur De Lys was all the rage and after years now, Hubert Keller's brand is as strong as ever if not more so. Going on opening day knowing things are going to be crazy is a good way to set your expectations. Chef TV exposure? Grand Opening? The middle of touristville? Check, Check and Check. Even though it was really late on the first day, we still had a significant wait. 

Back when the Vegas one opened I had been very tempted to try the Rossini burger. Should I do it now? $60 is an awful lot and on opening day it's a risky proposition. So I decided for the peppercorn burger with some additions. Lo and behold the waiter said he couldn't do that. I guess some of the signature burgers have their own mise en place and you really mess with the line cooks if you add stuff. Ok, no big deal. So I went with a kobe buger, pepper bacon, pepper jack cheese, Fleur De Lys peppercorn sauce and then a half lobster for good measure. Damn that thing was yummy even though they went slightly over on my medium rare. Not enough blood (hmm that didn't sound right). Decent sweet potato fries and ok pickled jalapenos. The drinks were solid and the service was definitely on the tattered side as the tourist patron crush was non stop. 

Towards midnight Chef Keller popped in all dressed up (more like DJ Hubert Keller) and made his way directly to us and chatted  for a bit. We talked about the stress of opening something brand new and how things weren't going to calm down till about 1:30am for him. It's good to see that he values his customers experience and proceeded to say hi to a number of tables in the main room. 

I'd say if you really want to try this place and haven't already, wait. Let things get a but less hectic or eat late as they plan to hold 2am hours (thats awesome). Also keep in mind to the fact that the fame of the owner, the area it's and what they're striving for image wise, you're going to be paying a premium. Definitely plenty of good burgers around the city and I think this should be on that list. Guess three times a charm for that Rossini!
author: Kim N.

description:
The hostess was friendly and helpful. My positive experience ends there.

The special Keller burger had over an inch of spinach on top. When i tried it, the blue cheese absolutely overwhelmed every other flavor in the burger - too much. Even after I scraped it off with a french fry, the entire burger tasted like solid blue cheese. The meat was supposed to be buffalo I think (and I've tasted lots of buffalo in the Midwest), but it was bland and felt like ground chuck from Safeway. NOT a $22 burger.

The waitress was terrible and never came back until we were done with our entire meal, letting our hostess get us refills for our drinks. Amazingly, the check was served promptly and the credit card ran shockingly fast.

$80+ for a crappy meal. This was terrible and I'll never be back.
author: Jason D.

description: Fantastic burgers.  Very crowded, but everyone was working hard to serve the customers.  A bit of a wait.  All of the waiting and crowd were worth it.  We had some great burgers.  I had the low carb burger.  My wife had the peppercorn burger.  Bother were great
author: Alan H.

description:
First stop on my trip to San Francisco.  We came on the recommendation from a friend.  It's located on the 6th floor of the macy's in union square.  It's a bit fancy and pricey, but I think it's worth it to try it at least once. We were seated by the bar, overlooking union square. 

The menu is huge!  There has to be more than 30+ types of toppings you can add on top of your burger.  The most ridiculous topping you can choose is the grilled half lobster!!!  They also have a $60 dollar burger which has everything fancy that you can think of that can go into a burger.  They have a wide array of beer on tap.  

I ordered the black angus beef burger (medium) on ciabatta with american cheese, mushrooms, grilled onions, ranch dressing, and bacon.  The burger  comes with all the burger  fixings (tomato, lettuce, onions, and pickles).  I also ordered a side of curry fries and zucchini fries to share.

The burger was juicy and yummy.  I chose the wrong kind of buns though.  I tried picking it up and it immediately fell apart.  So I wind up having to dive into my burger with knife and fork.  It was super filling.

The curly fries were yummy, but not as yummy as the zucchini fries.  The zucchini fries reminded me of mozzarella sticks, creamy and crunchy.  I much preferred the zucchini fries over the curly fries.  I wish they gave us more of both of the fries.  I felt it wasn't enough to be shared between 3 people.  

This meal was pricy, but I think it was really good.  I would definitely go back again if I have a chance!
author: Maggie Y.

description:
Tourist trap! WATCH OUT!

I will admit, the fries were really really good and the meat (my buffalo) was cooked to perfection. Honestly, it really really is not worth the money. I could have gladly spent the $30 on something actually worth it. The amount of meat they give you is something that you could get at let's say Fuddruckers for half the price (and faster service). 

Overall was not a great experience and definitely just came here so I could have a frame of reference. The view is nice though and the wait staff are nice and helpful.
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
When I heard Burger Bar was coming to the city, I had to grab a friend and get here IMMEDIATELY!

The American Kobe burger is by far the best burger I have ever had! This rivals Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill burger. It was juicy, flavorful, and tender. So good, I am still thinking about it!

This is not an average burger and there is no way I could ever make something this delicious at home! I think it's completely worth it for a top chef to make something so dumbed-down as a burger into something so magnificent. Even when we were stuffed, we continued to take bites. It really was that delicious!

The nutella milkshake was a perfect pair to my burger, and next time I will definitely try to raspberry beer float! I'll also want to try the ice cream burgers, yum!

The best part of your visit is getting to see Hubert Keller who has to be the kindest and most patient man to deal with starstruck girls like me, ha! He is both gracious and modest, definitely cares about his customers and food. Honestly, it just seems like he wants to make you a really delicious burger and he definitely does!
author: Stella C.

description:
3.5 stars, but rounding up just because the food is so good. 

Ate here twice during the last week, which is a record for me. 

The first time I had a turkey burger on a whole wheat  bun with caramelized onions, pepper jack cheese, and chopped jalapeños with a side of sweet potato fries. 

The burger was really good - cooked nicely. The caramelized onions were not as dark as I was expecting, but also really good. The cheese was almost non-existant. I could see it, but couldn't taste it. I put very few jalapeños on my burger, as they were potent. They were NOT chopped, they were sliced which was disappointing. With something that hot, you don't need a bunch, but you also don't want to have to chop them yourself table side. The side of jalapeños was huge, something you could easily share with someone else. 

The sweet potato fries were tasty, but obviously frozen as they seemed a little emaciated. 

The sodas are a jaw dropping $3.50, but they're not stingy on free refills. I guess they have to make their rent somewhere (fountain drinks run about $.02 actual cost). I ordered a diet Coke and they brought me a diet Pepsi with no warning.   Yuk!

The veggie burger from my 2nd trip was OUTSTANDING. Very flavorful, great variation in texture, and not boring.  I got
it with a $2 side salad. The salad was good, but nothing special. Still, I would order it again without hesitation. I did not see the side salad on the menu as an option, so don't hesitate to ask!. 

One friend (with my both times) had the Salmon burger and could not stop talking about it!

The service both times was pretty good. Our first visit was 9 people, the second 6. Both times they dealt well with the chaos that comes with a big group. Our first waiter, Miguel did not deal well with the check situation.   He would not take more than 3 cards which proved a challenge for us.  Then he told us there was a problem with our math, but when we repeated our figures in front of him he just continually insisted we owed him more money. In the end we were expensing it, so we just paid more to get out of there.  If it had been my money and time I would have asked for the manager. On top of all that, he took foreeeeeeever to run our cards and come back. 

As a side note, they charge 18% gratuity on any group over 5, so be prepared for that, plus 8.5% city tax, plus 3.5% healthy SF tax. 

Let me tell you, they would sell a lot fewer $15 burgers if they put the actual instead of estimated costs on the menu.  I live in SF, so I'm used to it, but still, after paying $3.50 for a soda, it rankles.   

On our second visit we sat at a booth which had a TV.  It appeared to be playing some kind of soap opera.  We would have liked to turn it to another channel or off.  It was distracting!
author: Heather C.

description:
We held a team dinner here during our recent foray to SF for our annual sales conference.

Burgers, burgers, and more burgers - are the way of things at Burger Bar. There are other things on the menu, appetizers, other sandwiches, full bar - but Burgers reign supreme here! In addition to the lineup of burgers listed on the menu, there is a rather extensive toppings list - you can then customize your own burger - which is why I did.

We ordered a number of appetizers to share: Deep fried spicy dill pickles, fried Zucchini, and Onion rings. All were crisp and tasty - I'd never had a fried dill pickle before - wasn't bad - but I still prefer crisp, cold, dill pickles!

I ordered a custom Bison burger: Buffalo meat, with pepperjack cheese, jalapeno bacon, and Chipotle Aioli - with lettuce, tomato, and onion, on a wheat bun - cooked medium well. Ordered the burger with Sweet Potato fries. Plus I had a couple of beers - neither of which I had before - nor can I remember their names - both were good though!

When the burger arrived, I spread the Chipotle Aioli on the top wheat bun, slapped on the lettuce, tomato, onion, and took a big bite. Very tasty - BUT the Burger was cooked Medium Rare/Medium. Turns out pretty much everyone's burger came out at that temp - regardless of what temp was ordered.

We were sitting in a large private room of sorts - sharing it with one other group.

Service was decent - I would come back here again. Next time I send the burger back if it is not cooked to my specified temp!
author: Neal E.

description:
I've been to the Burger Bar twice now, once in Las Vegas and then in San Francisco.  I waited to review the Burger Bar for service and food.  I've tried the Angus Burger and the Buffalo burger.  I thought the buffalo burger was dry due to the meat being lean and not much fat to be juicy.  When I went to San Francisco I tried the Angus Burger and the result was even worst.  the meat was dry and overcook that it was flaky.  The bf had the surf and turf in Vegas and then the Angus burger in San Fran and according to him same result.  The meat was dry and hard to eat.  

We both love the french fries, it was crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  The onion rings had a thin batter and you can taste the onions.  The choices for the beers on tap and the bottles were extensive and so many choices.  

I wish the food was better.  I love Hubert Keller and Fleur de Lys.  The Burger Bar was a disappointment. I would rather have In-N-Out Burger, it's consistent and good.
author: Rox P.

description:
I'd been to the Burger Bar in Vegas, enjoyed it, so it was a no-brainer that I'd want to visit the one in SF.

Some of the reviews I read before writing my own mention a host who seemed to be completely out of it. Well, I met the woman, and I have a theory: She is in fact not a woman, but an apparition sent to observe the lives of mortals, not to intervene in our trivial affairs. Either that or she just didn't fuck!

A lot of waiters try their best if for no other reason than getting a good tip. I could only assume that our waiter was in fact an eccentric millionaire on sabbatical, moonlighting as a waiter in an effort to get closer to the common man, because he sure wasn't concerned about getting a good tip. We saw the guy like once every half-hour, and you pretty much had to jump in front of him to get him to stop. I think he was a little shocked we expected to get food.

The beer list, at least for me, was the shining light of my dining experience. It's about as extensive a list as I've seen, with beers for all seasons and all reasons. Some are on the pricier side; lets not lie, pretty much all more expensive than happy hour prices you can find around town. My friend and I counted at least three different beers at $38, so it is what it is. You can still find some brew at $5 a pint.

If the expensive beer wasn't enough, my friend bought a $12 burger and was charged $15 for it. We didn't feel like fighting it, we were in the moment. The place has ambiance, if nothing else. Celebrity chef, Hubert Keller, was even on deck mingling with customers, serving and things of that nature. He was a better host than the one we got.  

When it comes to drinking I've got the stamina of a rhino, and the work ethic of a turkey-buzzard; needless to I enjoyed the drinking at this place. It really is a great place to do some boozing, plus the burgers are pretty good, though I really don't think they're worth their asking price.

When my other friend arrived, wanting to join in on the experience me and my other buddy were enjoying, he ordered the veggie burger. He was kind of shocked that when it arrived, it didn't really come with fries or anything. The waiter had neglected to mention that, which was odd seeing as how that was kind of important. Also, our burgers came with fries, why not that one? Of course making matters worse, as I mentioned before, we only saw out waiter every fortnight.

Despite our incorporeal host, absentee waiter, and all around shitty service we still managed to scrape together a good time. I'll probably go back cause I like having to work for service, I guess. I just want the beer more than anything xD.
author: Shirrod R.

description:
I really want to like this place. I really do.

I've been four times now (including a few days ago), and there's just no denying it.

Burger Bar is, and given its location, will continue to be an overpriced restaurant that caters to tourists. It's just not a place for locals to go. Why pay tourist prices in one of the most tourist-saturated squares in the country, when there are a million other places you could go in SF?

I'm willing to pay a little extra for fresh, quality ingredients, and rest assured, the quality of meat and produce at Burger Bar is really great (and essential for any "gourmet burger" joint). But I don't want to pay tourist prices, sorry.

I usually get Country Natural on Ciabatta, with pepper jack cheese and pesto sauce (+ peppered bacon, if I'm in the mood). Burger sans fries is 13-15$. Not OK. Tax and tip with a fairly basic burger and reasonable sized order of fries (which were served very cold this time, and had to be brought a new order) is always 20$, bare minimum. Want to have the world's smallest (but admittedly very tasty) milkshake? That'll be $7.50, minimum. 

Not much else to say, as every time I try to talk about how good the food actually is, I am reminded that I'm kinda being taken advantage of.

Do try Burger Bar out - the food is really good, but I can't come here more than once a year...which is exactly what I've done since it opened...
author: Conrad B.

description: My burger (something with brie and mushrooms) was amazing. And the milkshakes-- WOAH! We mixed our ice creams for a neopolitan shake and got a huge dollop of their delicious whipped cream and fruit and chocolate chips as a bonus. To top it off, the service was really nice and we had an awesome view of Union Square.
author: M M.

description:
I had never heard of this place, or the chef for that matter, but I was open to see their spin on the American burger. They had everything from your classic American, which runs for about $10, to the Rossini, a high end burger with Kobe beef, foie gras and truffles for $60. Honestly if you want to spend $60 for some ground sirloin you can have it - I'd rather have filet mignon at that price - but to each his own. 

We had reservations (which I am glad they take unlike that other place across the way) for our large party, so it made things easier on us. I must say the waiter was very handsome too, which was a plus. But I digress...I ordered the sliders, which came with one kobe beef, one buffalo, and one angus beef slider. I couldn't tell which was which, which speaks of the quality of the angus, or the lack of quality of the others. They were smaller than most sliders I've had at other restaurants, and there was more bread than meat. The skinny fries that came with them were more to write home about - they were crispy, salted perfectly, and tasty. All this for $13 - not horrible but I can get meatier sliders elsewhere. I'm giving it 3 stars for the location, the fries and the service. We asked a staff person for a candle for cupcakes I made for my friend's birthday, and they obliged without hesitation. She was so surprised, and I'm glad they went along with it. I'm not giving it 4 stars because the burgers were just so-so, which is not a 4 in my book.
author: Laura G.

description: Not sure what all the hype was... it was super busy - waited forever for our food to arrive and when it did it was cold and not very good.  Floor manager was helpful but still the food... not impressed.
author: Shari V.

description:
Monday night & I'm feeling alright.....until I decide to come here with a friend for dinner.

Heard a lot of hype from ex-coworkers and pals that this place is great. It completely fell below my LOWEST expectations. 

She had: Veggie burger w/ steak fries. 
Moi: Sweet Potato Fries (per your reviews).

Needless to say, our fries were pretty good but hot diggity dog if there was a burger that I ever came across that I didn't like it'd be THIS one. I had a bite and it was COMPLETELY dry! There was nothing special about it all. Maybe it was just the wrong kind of burger to order from here? New chef? It was tiny and bland.

Sweet potato fries were great but not amazing and felt like an old batch that has been waiting under a heated lamp for the next sucker to get played. 

SERVICE: 
Horrendous. I haven't experienced this horrible of service in SO long. Our waiter was completely displeased with serving us. My friend wanted to order steak fries with her order after he left and ignored us while we politely called for him--I went a little ridiculous and waved my hands in the air and he, like, just didn't care (five points if you caught that one). He despised waiting us so much that he stuck to the bar and only refilled our water literally 10 minutes before we left. He seemed completely agitated and asked my friend if he could take away her full plate. After waiting for the longest time, we had to bring our check to him ourselves because he was completely avoiding waiting any of his seated customers. I'm sorry you had a bad day, sir. I hope everything that seems to be troubling with you works out. 


I am definitely not coming back here unless someone else pays for my meal because it was so unpleasant.
author: Kat L.

description:
I came here starving after walking the city for hours today. We asked for a window table that was open, both servers that helped us said it should be fine that we move to that window table overlooking Union Square. Then the hostess comes and tells us it's "reserved", so we quickly go back to our assigned table, embarrassed. 

Only to come and find out that the couple that was sitting next to us prior to us getting seated (waiting for a table), got that table that was so-called "reserved".

Service from the hostess was NOT the business. It ruined our whole experience of eating there. Yes, the manager came out to talk to us after we asked our server we wanted to speak with him, but he didn't seem to be sincere in his apology or to keep our business in the future..
author: Julia K.

description:
This is one of those places that I'm a little bit confused about how to rate. So I'll give it the pro/con treatment and maybe we'll get somewhere:

The Good:
- the burger - cooked just as we ordered it: "as rare as you can give it to us." It was quite pink all the way through (even cool, I think, in the center), and yet somehow managed to have charred spots on the outside.

- the service - friendly, attentive

- the cocktail - something with framboise beer and clementine liqueur

- the view


The Great:
- fries - salty!

- fried zucchini

- garlic aioli and truffle mayo - both AMAZING

- the selection of stuff you can get on your burger


The Not-Great:

- the burger - it kind of fell apart on me, but that might have been because it was so rare.

- the location - I mean, it's in a Macy's, so that's not exactly the most exciting way to get to a date, if that's your thing.

- the prices - this is the sticking point for me. The burger alone is $9, and that's without cheese or fries or anything on it but the standard "set up." Drinks were a bit pricey (though cocktail prices were standard) and desserts - yikes. $8+ is a lot.

I'd consider coming back, mostly if customization was what I was aiming for. If you want prosciutto, brie cheese, fried eggs, lobster, truffles, etc., etc. on your burger, definitely come here! I'd recommend anyone try it once.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Two stars earned: one for the view and mellow oasis (after the Yelp Unwrapped Holiday Party anything would have been considered mellow), second star for our server who was new and trying her best.

Alot of hype for a mediocre burger palace. The Cobb Salad was better than the blah $20 Kobe burger with dry tasteless sweet potato fries.

Doubt seriously that we will give it a second try.
author: Suzy S.

description:
Hubert Keller Burger, medium rare with sweet potato fries. Perfectly made, I really recommend to have it medium rare. that is all. The waitresses are cuties also. :)

Also might want to try the nutella milk shake, it looked so delicious when my friend ordered it. 
Stay away from the Watermelon brew... :) that is all...
author: BJ A.

description: The selection is great and the location and view are fantastic but the service really wasn't amazing and the food,  although yummy, was pretty pricey for what you are getting.  There are a lot of great burger places in the city with better burgers for better prices.  Overall a fun place to eat and great views but it isn't worth the price in my opinion.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Located on the 5th floor at Macy's.  Great views of the square.   The food is average.   They have a good selection of beers.
author: Maria E.

description:
Mediocre for the price (service in particular is atrocious).

Skinny fries are crispy and flavorful, but the rest of the meal was average. I had bison sliders, and while the meat was lean and fresh, the rest of the mini-burgers were flavorless and stale. Each burger came with the smallest pieces of lettuce and tomato, with a quarter of a dill pickle on the side. My mom and friend tried the Kobe beef and Country Natural burgers, and both complained that the patties were unevenly seasoned, with random clumps of salt throughout the burger. Waitress was impatient and rude throughout the evening.
author: Jing P.

description:
I like the burger at this place. Yeah, it's true, they brag about all these burger and the $70+ burger, but you are not forced to go with those crazy ones. The classic (I like the buffalo one) are really tasty. They have good beers, the place is a bar and it is good for that. The only little setback is the location (inside Macy's) but at least the view is nice :)
When I am in downtown and want a good burger, burger bar is one of the first places that comes to my mind.
author: Luca R.

description:
I've tried the Burger Bar in Las Vegas before, part of a large group in pre-wedding mode.  I remember good times and interesting food choices, so I was looking forward to this meal with friends at the SF location.

After a fairly long trip to the 6th floor escalator hopping, we finally reach the clean if not simple sports bar/restaurant.  The menu remains the same:  the big sell is building your own custom burger, with a handful of "chef's" specials.

I tried the most basic cheeseburger, to get a sense of how Hubert Keller treats it.  It comes out with smallish but rather tall burger, topped with a generous amount of bacon.  Each bite is a mouthful, but honestly unremarkable.  It's a good burger, but I can't say it's anywhere near the best burgers I've ever had.  The fries are tasty though.

One friend has the veggie patty, which I had as well in Las Vegas - I enjoyed that much more, and he did as well.

The beer selection is varied and plentiful.  Servers were attentive and helpful.  The desserts are indulgent and go down way too quickly.

I really wish I enjoyed the main reason for the meal - the burger - as the other parts are enjoyable.
author: Don B.

description:
maybe the hubs and i came on a good day? but  despite all the low reviews posted here, we loved burger bar!

i just ran 13.1 miles....so it's time for my reward meal afterwards=). FEED ME!!!! and FEED ME NOW!!!! haha.

okay, so I love Hubert Keller and Fleur de Lys, buuuut our original choice was to go to Cheesecake. I know I know, but the hubby really wanted a good view of San Francisco and we weren't sure how the view from Burger Bar was, plus I had the red velvet craving. Well, the wait for 2 into cheesecake was 50 minutes...guess a lot of other runners wanted their reward meal there too! and my tired, hungry self wasn't having that!

Off we go one floor down to Burger Bar - wait time? 10 minutes! We get seated at one of the tables next to the window with an AMAZING view of the city. yay, we're seated fast & great view...off to a good start!

the beverages of choice:
Anchor Steam Liberty Ale - hubby said it was okay. 
 Watermelon Wheat Beer- hmm i like my wheat beers and was curious how they'd do a watermelon wheat beer. subtle hints of watermelon..but not a favorite for me.

Our order:

Black Angus Beef (cooked medium) with cheddar, bacon & grilled onions on a wheat bun (came w/ the side of lettuce/tomato/sliced raw onions to put on top, and my favorite - the dill pickle)- the burger was cooked perfectly - nice and juicy! 

Sides of Skinny Fries & Sweet Potato Fries - I love me some fries and Burger Bars' fries did not disappoint! crispy and well battered! yum, i want more!

Buffalo Burger (cooked medium) with grilled onions on a wheat bun (also came w/ the same regular burger accompaniments) - hubby said his burger was really good! he's had buffalo burgers elsewhere where they've dried out the meat and it's not so good, well today we found a winner=).

i could see why ppl would say this place is super crowded and not enough servers/waitresses to take orders. we had one minor setback...my eyes were hungry and after placing our order i realized that i really wanted to try to the beer battered jalapeno pickles. i think i placed the order too late though bc our food came out in the next 15 minutes. our waitress did say that the pickles were coming out soon and when we already had our food she noticed it was never on the table. turns out, they had been made..but not brought out by the server. that was fine w/ me bc my big 'ol burger had me stuffed! if i had placed the order in the beginning, well then..that'd be a different story and maybe i wouldn't be so cheery about burger bar right now=).

but overall experience was great and i'll say it again..maybe we came on an off day? the place seemed crowded to us and if our waitress couldn't attend to us, there was another asking us if we were okay/taking our drink orders. 

i guess we lucked out because we had a short wait time, great food, and a beautiful view of lovely San Francisco=). just wish i saw hubert keller=P
author: Belle L.

description: I have to say Burger Bar is a really cooool place to eat a hamburger!!! Today was my very first time ever coming here for lunch although I have been to alot of hamburger joints in the past... Burger Bar was that one place I never thought about going to until today When I got here to the Burger Bar when, I took a look at the Burger Bar menu and what I saw was the Kobe Burger... I have been always wanting to try a Kobe Burger and so I finally did as I took my very very first bite at my well done Kobe Burger it tasted really gooooooood besides eating the Kobe Burger I also ordered a Pina Colada Milk Shake which had some little bit of Alchol in which did not cause me to get wasted... Now that I finally had a chance to go eat at the Burger Bar, I also have to say that this place has a clean bathroom... I definitely would want to go back to the Burger Bar!!!
author: William B.

description: It's like McDonald's only a slightly better and way more expensive.  Here's my beef with this place.  We bought one hamburger, one sweet potato fries, one salad with a couple of shrimp on it (which probably cost them all of $1.25) and two beers.  Our total was $65.  Sure the burger was angus beef but it wasn't anything better than a fast food restaurant.  I felt ripped off at this place.  I guess you pay for the view. Beer selection is decent and service was so-so. Meh...
author: Jeff G.

description:
Honestly, I've never heard of Burger Bar... and never knew that there was even a hype about it.

I'm pretty picky when it comes to burgers and this place was alright.  I had the sliders so I could try out their different patties.  I think it came with a buffalo, angus, and something else.  Overall, it was slightly juicy but nothing to be amazed about.  Maybe if you order their actual burgers... it might be better. Although the people I went with who did agreed that it was nothing special.  And a bit pricey for a burger, if you ask me.

You order the burger and pay additional for whichever add-ins you want.  They do give you a good selection.

The only great thing I enjoyed, aside from the view of Union Square, were their fries.  Especially their sweet potato fries. Yum! Definitely recommend those if you do go.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
This is honestly a "meh" type of experience and meal all around. On Sunday night, with Pearl's Burger closed, my 3 boys and I decided to give Burger Bar a try despite the bad reviews I yelped. We were all feeling burgers and since Burger Bar was known for their milkshakes, it seemed harmless to give it a shot. 

We were greeted at the host stand around 9:30 and luckily the place was empty. (For personal reasons, we all decided not to head upstairs to the Cheesecake Factory by the way.) We sat at the bar seating close to the window and were promptly greeted by a very lovely server who's name I forgot. She probably the only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars instead of 1 because everything else was definitely not up to par with any restaurant among the same level. She was patient, friendly but not pushy with recommendations and her timing was excellent.

Our meal however, once ordered was sub par at best. My iced tea unfortunately wasn't brewed properly and someone didn't let it brew properly and add hot water to it. It was the first time that's ever happened to me and I was sort of embarrassed sending it back. 3 of us ordered burgers and no one got the right internal temperatures. Strike 1. There were hardly any alternatives for people who didn't eat burgers even though the name on the menu did say "Burger Bar" and that was a disappointment. Strike 2. Did I mention it cost $3.50-$5.00 for sides that aren't included with the $10-$16 burgers? So you could be paying about $20+ for a burger and fries here. Outrageous. For the price alone I'm gonna have to say Strike 3. 

The burgers are petite and the buns are dry and accompanied by a spear pickle, a thin slice of red onion and a piece of romaine lettuce. Who wants a spear pickle with a hamburger? A spear pickle belongs on a hot dog if anything but at this point I was surprised they didn't charge you for that too. 

I was also surprised one of the youngest in the group also didn't get carded while we joked around about how he obviously looked 16. This kid looked underage and she didn't even think twice to pour his beer and push another alcoholic drink on him. I don't know if this is a Burger Bar policy or she really believed the hairless 5'2" kid really looked over 30 but now thanks to me and Yelp, everyone knows they're not hard about carding at Burger Bar.

Overall, we weren't wowed by the experience and while the food was "okay" it wasn't anything writing home about. I'd pass next time and plan on going to Pearl's next time.
author: Jessica K.

description: What's up with the snooty employee who felt the need to use a condescending voice when telling me they DON'T take reservations over the holidays? I've been here once before and the burgers were OK, definitely not worth the ridiculous amount they charge, but I wanted to take my brother here for a special occasion. How DARE I call to ask if they take reservations, the guy answering the phone seemed to imply when he barked they "haven't taken reservations for the past month and a half." That is perfectly acceptable (but annoying), however it was his tone that really bugged me. Thanks very little, I will definitely recommend other fantastic burger places in SF from now on. Umami Burger or Bill's Burgers are both amazing and have wonderful customer service!! Happy Holidays!
author: June L.

description:
Had my 2nd visit tonight. The burgers dropped from 5 to 4 stars. Pretty good but not "wow" like the last visit. We saw Hubert Keller in the private event room talking with someone, so cant' say it was because he wasn't there (maybe less chatting with the young ladies and more time at the grill? Just kidding Hubert).  The service was very slow (I mean, like over 45 minutes slow) on the burger delivery. After the waiter's second "your burgers will be out in just a little bit" we pleaded for some fries to tide us over, which did come in a matter of minutes. And my martini order got completely mangled, so much I sent it back. Had a sip of my friend's and it was weak and lukewarm.

Burgers this round = four stars, but overall down to three stars. I'll go back some time in hopes of that "wow!" burger I got the first time.
author: John Z.

description:
Burger Bar is just awesome!  I have not had a good burger in the FiDi since... ever!  I had waited for Burger Bar to open in San Francisco since it was first announced a year ago.  I am a HUGE fan of burgers... from McDonald's McDouble to the succulent juices of Balboa Cafe's burger and now Burger Bar's Kobe Beef Burger!  My history of burgers started because my Dad used to operate an American restaurant serving burgers, pasta, and sandwiches.  Ever since I was young I have been addicted to burgers so this place just was beckoning for me to try.  FYI: I was a proud fan of Burger Bar SF on Facebook stalking it until they opened today!

What I ordered:
-Kobe Beef Burger
-Peppered Jack Cheese
-Bacon
-Caramelized Onions
-Onion Bun

This burger was smoking hot when it came out! I touched the onion bun and felt a surge of joy rush through my arms.  I had the BIGGEST PERVERTED GRIN on my face as I picked up custom created burger.  My eyes moistened and grew the size of hamburgers themselves much like the ones you see in Japanese Manga/Anime.  I trickled my fingers over the bun to give the sensations of touch on my fingers and began the countdown.... 3... 2... 1... FACEPLANT right into the hamburger like a merciless Tazmanian devil ravaging through its prey.  The beef was so tender that I barely needed my teeth!  I was pretty sure I could have eaten the beef with my tongue... every turn of the burger showed the kobe beef crevices.  This was EXACTLY what I was looking for in a burger.  Boy did this place deliver a good burger!

Liked:
-Excellent burger. Best I have had in the Financial District!
-Nice attentive staff. Our waitress (I think her name was Ashley) was very nice and came to check on us multiple times before and after our order.  She even told us that our burgers were coming out shortly while we were waiting for our meal.  Even when getting the check... when my eyes met hers she instantly came over to make sure everything was alright.
-The view was rather splendid and the environment was very nice and amiable

Constructive Feedback:
-We did order our burgers medium rare, but it seems more medium to medium well. no biggy for me, but it did bother my coworker a tiny bit.
-The wait time for the burger was not too bad although if you have a 30min-1hr lunch there is no way you can eat here and enjoy the full meal.  We rushed and ordered as quickly as we could.  Getting the waitress for both ordering/check was no problem, the food coming out was what took a bit longer.  We came @ 11am which is before the lunch rush and it was pretty empty so I would caution the 12pm crew to make some time and be prepared for a 1hr+ long lunch.

Conclusion:
Much thanks to Hubert Keller for bringing this place to San Francisco!  I loved the service, I loved the food, I have yet to try the shakes but I have no doubt they are great!  This place is indeed the best place for gourmet burgers!  The price may be a tad more than your average burger joint, but remember this is downtown/fidi area we are talking about and not the Sunset!  Next time I come... I am going to up the ante and make sure I get a custom shake as well!  I will update this again when that time comes!

Pro tip:
They only take reservations for parties of 13 or more!
author: Benny S.

description: I'd come back for the view if I could get a window seat again.  My wife was really happy with that, and they had a good selection of beer. Pablo, our server, was terrific. But the burgers were not good.  I'd give it 2 stars for the food but the ambiance and the view bumps it up to 3 stars.
author: Mike O.

description: I got the american burger and my boyfriend got the "le frog". Im giving this two stars because i called in advanced to see if they had the twinkie shake and was told they have it, but when i got here i was told they no longer serve it but it appears on the menu. I would recommend to not put something on your menu if you no longer carry this drink.
author: Stacy H.

description: While the staff was very courteous, the food was not this evening. The "Le Frog" burger was tender and juicy (I substituted the Angus for Kobe), however was on the greasy side and lacking seasoning. The icing on the cake had to be the hair I found on my plate as I finished. Great staff, but just didn't meet a great burger experience for me.
author: Wickliffe G.

description:
Good from far, Far from good. 
 
I enjoyed the location because one can look over Union square. Burger bar serves alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, I enjoyed the strawberry shake very much. I also tried the nutella shake which was filled with way too much chocolate so the straw ended up clogging. 

As for the burgers, I've tried the sliders which were decent. It wasn't anything special or memorable. The shoestring fries were average. 

All in all, the experience wasn't anything spectacular but could have definitely been better.
author: C M.

description: Had the Kobe burger with pepper jack and sweet potato fries. Very very good burger, as one would expect with Kobe beef. Sweet potato fries were good, but could use something to enhance flavor (think brown sugar, or sea salt). The Pinot noir was ok. I was surprised they didn't have a California merlot by the glass. This is San Francisco!  The restaurant has a great view and the lovely hostess made sure we had a table with a view. Waiter was great and very attentive without hovering.
author: Patrick G.

description: I really think the Burger Bar deserves a higher rating than its receiving right now. Keller does a great job of taking something as simple as a burger and transforming it into a high class meal. I had the buffalo burger, plain with no cheese. This was sort of a stretch for me because I generally do not order burgers, but you could taste the quality of the meat. I have to say the highlight of this particular lunch was the Butterscotch Milkshake I had. The glass was coated in caramel and filled with a coffee, butterscotch milkshake. It was topped off with whipped cream and a graham cracker. Next time, I'd probably just be happy with the milkshake! The reason for 4 stars is that it was REALLY crowded and the wait staff seemed really buys and a little pushy to get people out of tables.
author: Hayley H.

description:
This review is for the Rossini ($60) burger.  I brought my husband here for lunch as a surprise on this birthday.  Given that it was his birthday we decided to splurge and had the Rossini burger with black truffles and lobster.  It was AMAZING.  I would have never thought of the concept, it seemed when looking at the menu that they had just tried to think of the most expensive ingredients for a burger when in reality the flavors together were divine.  The lobster's salty flavors enhanced the meat and the black truffle pulled it all together in a savory yumminess.   I cannot attest to how their average burger or lunch is, but this "special occasion" burger was to die for.  One of the best burgers I have ever eaten. 

The staff was friendly and attentive.  The house drinks were ok, not great but it was impressive that they had tried to come up with some house specialties.
