The views of Union Square are stunning and seeing alcoholic milkshakes on the menu made me giggle.  I would definitely return!
author: Morgan E.

description:
My first dine at the Burger Bar was last night, and here's the verdict:

Food: GREAT. I got a vanilla shake, which was delish (they had bad whipped cream, but that's okay) and a "build your own burger" with a plain bun and black Angus beef. The woman I went with is a "cleanser" and doesn't eat many things like nuts, dairy, gluten, meat, etc., so she got the SF Vegan and LOVED IT. She was over the moon. 

Service Staff: Nice. Not exceptional, but no complaints. 

Environment: You'd expect it to be crowded on a Saturday at 7, especially on one of the Macy's deal days, and I suppose it was. The reason I'm not sure: this is a pretty big restaurant. I saw many people eating, but there was no line and we were seated almost immediately. The food came quickly (10-15 mins) and was quite good. TVs placed all over were playing Access Hollywood (Kanye might be cheating on a PREGNANT Kim!) and some nice music was playing at a reasonable volume. The bathrooms were nice. 

Prices: Good. $35 for a build your own burger, SF Vegan, and Vanilla milkshake. 

Overall, great dining experience. I will definitely be back.
author: Margeaux W.

description:
A pretty limited menu if you ask me. There's about 1 page of "Make it Yourself" burgers and 1 page of "Chef-Selected" burgers. Aside from that, there are shakes, beers, desserts, and a side menu of sides.

Their patties are literally over 1-inch thick. With all and condiments and the bun (which is also over 1-inch thick), this makes the burger "bigger than your face". Also, their patties could use some extra flavor. I ordered a Black Angus Beef burger (medium rare) which could have been why my burger didn't not have as much taste or smell too it. But regardless, their patties could use some extra flavoring.

I HIGHLY recommend SKINNY FRIES... they're absolutely amazing.
author: Morgan P.

description:
Went into the city for lunch and saw at Macy's that they had another restaurant besides Cheesecake Factory. We were seated right away which was very nice considering it was a Saturday afternoon, I thought we would have to wait.

Immediately noticed the overpriced menu and then realized it was mostly a la cart. OK, I can get over that if the food and service are good.

Ordered a diet soda and the turkey burger. Something was wrong with their fountain as the soda tasted like the machine needed cleaning. Took one sip and then had to push it aside. The server either didn't notice or didn't care, probably didn't care. The turkey burger was very dry, which is very surprising since this is a Hubert Keller restaurant. I only ate half of the burger, again the server didn't notice or didn't care, probably didn't care.

My husband had knocked some of his fries on the floor (he picked them up), when the server came by he mentioned it and the response was "that happens a lot around here". Really? If it does happen a lot then maybe the serving vessel should be changed so you don't knock over the long handle. I thought a more proper response would have been "would you like me to get you some more?" at the high prices, that would have been appropriate. Although, again, our server didn't care.

Later, she did ask my husband if he was done and cleared his plate, didn't ask me and never cleared my plate. 

Overall, poor to mediocre food, poor service and overpriced. Close to 40 dollars for 2 burgers and non-alcoholic drinks should get you a better experience. Will not return.
author: Michael W.

description:
blah. 

i recently started eating beef again and i was excited to get a "fancy" burger. i even upgraded to the kobe! i mean, if i'm paying $25 for a burger and sweet potato fries, i want that ish to be EXQUISITE. like, slap ya momma good. 

i ordered the burger medium (easing back into beef, remember?) and is was D R Y. like, i had to slather it in truffle mayo just to get it down. do i need to order it bloody just to have it be palatable? or juicy? nah, bro. shouldn't be that hard to make it good. and the bacon just tasted like smoke. did not enhance my burger at all. 

two stars for the convenient location and awesome view. i had just finished shooting an event downstairs and was starved. next time, i'll make the trek elsewhere for great food. heck, even the food court at the bottom of westfield would have been a better bet.
author: Ashleigh R.

description: Beautiful view of Union Square, especially this time of year. We got to watch the Christmas tree be decorated and people ice skate. The food was ok. The dessert was amazing. The nutella burger is a must try!
author: Naydynee H.

description:
Very good burger, however not cheap. Big enough to split with someone & still be full. Drinks were delicious, especially the specialty cucumber infused vodka one. 

Good place to go for birthdays because it's pretty loud with music playing & just a good time. And the birthday person gets a free unique dessert burger (note the "cheese" is actually fruit rollup which I thought was cute). 

Our waitress told us the jalapeno pickles were to-die-for but they were just okay. Nothing special.
author: Alysha K.

description: Was really bummed to get a less than stellar meal at Burger Bar. This was my go-to spot for lunch break and I'm always pleased with the quality of the food; I don't mind paying extra if it's worth it. However, today the burger was just okay and the fries were cold. Not not hot - cold. The whole scene just seems to have slipped a few notches. Too bad.
author: Robert M.

description:
I try to go to a place at least 3-5 times before I make a judgment call, just because experiences can be so variable. After giving this place a truly fair and square shot, I'd say... 

Just... don't do it. Unless someone dragged you to Macy's and you're so famished that you can't make it another step without eating, just... don't. Because:

1. No matter what time you go, it is usually full of noisy rude mixed  tourist/professional crowd that is probably rude because they are impatient because...
2. It is busy with tourists/professionals all time and there never seems to be enough staff to cover the amount of folks in the place
3. The seating arrangement is terrible. You're practically in someone else's lap in many tables in the place, which also makes for difficult conversation without shouting
3. It's pricey for a burger. You can actually find way better burgers in SF in a place that will make you feel happy inside (Oola, Starbelly, Zazie, Zuni, etc.)
4. Service is mediocre
5. Drinks are icky. 

I shudder to think what this place will be like in the middle of the holiday rush. Steer clear! Two stars cos the burgers taste pretty good! It's all the rest of the experience that makes it not a fun place to go.
author: crystala t.

description:
Went with a large group.  We were seated in the room on the right side, where the décor was somewhat ordinary.  The waiter, Enrique, was excellent and was the most capable person of handling a large group order that I've ever seen and experienced.  I was very impressed with his service.  Basically he had other waiters help him.  He took the orders sequentially with the usual many different choices and substitutions that large groups tend to have.  The orders came out right and the food came out somewhat together with not too much wait.  Usually in large groups, I'm hate the long wait for food.

As for the food, I ordered a Huber Keller burger.  I wanted the best burger that wasn't the Kobe burger.  It tasted pretty good.  However, the price to performance wasn't stellar.  The burger was moist, but the taste or eating experience wasn't memorable.  I usually don't rate things 3 stars when I won't be going back, but the service by Enrique was excellent.
author: Hank C.

description:
I've been wanting to try Burger Bar ever since I discovered Hubert Keller opened a location in the Mandalay Bay in Vegas. I didn't get the chance to try it on my last Vegas trip so I was excited to see that he opened one in San Francisco. I am a bit bias since I was rooting for him the whole time during his run on Top Chef Masters. However, even that favoritism cannot earn Burger Bar a good review due the very poor service and the extremely overpriced burgers. 

It's hard to argue with the location of this Burger Bar. The 6th floor of Macy's downtown gives diners a wonderful view of Union Square. The view is great especially during the holidays because of the ice rink below. Knowing how busy this place can get, we called ahead and they held a table for a party of five even though their website says they only take reservations for parties of 13 or more. Once we got there, we were a little late and they had just called our table, but they accommodated us pretty quickly. The booth seating is both impressive and practical. There are coat hangers on the sides and the best part is the built in television set, which was set on the football game.

After being quickly seated, this is when it all went downhill. Service was extremely slow and poor. While our milkshakes came out pretty quickly, we had to wait a while for the burgers. When the burgers did come, mine was split into two orders, which I didn't ask for. It didn't really make sense since each person ordered one burger so why would we have one split into two orders? They didn't apologize for the mix up and I ended up eating a split burger. I think the delay resulted in an overcooked burger. But everyone's burgers were overdone compared to what they asked for. Apparently medium means medium-well and medium rare means medium, etc. The sweet potato fries were also dry and soggy at the same time, a result of the wait time. The highlights of the meal were the Nutella milkshake and the peppercorn cream sauce. I think the sauce would be more practical if it had been put in a small dipping cup over a pouring jug. If you love hazelnut, the milkshake is like drinking liquid Nutella.

Overall, the food did not merit the price paid. I've also never been to a place where they charge to split something like a milkshake. Our server didn't even check on us once until the very end. I understand that it's a new restaurant and the kinks will be worked out. But it was still a disappointing meal and I think I would have gotten great satisfaction eating at Red Robin. Yes, you heard me correctly. Sorry Mr. Keller, I'm still a huge fan and it's great to see you at the restaurant seeing that everything is in order, but I know you can do better.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
This place isn't as hyped up as it may seem on their online menu.  Haha.

We went on a Wednesday night and it was pretty empty.  The ambiance is Ok, I like the Cheesecake Factory a little bit better.  Everything on the menu was pretty pricey, but I still settled for the American Kobe Burger.  Which came out to be pretty small.

The drink First Kiss was good though, but after awhile it got very sweet.
author: Tina L.

description:
Spent the weekend in San Francisco with my boyfriend and ended up meeting up with a large group of friends at The Burger Bar as soon as we got off the plane. The restaurant took our group but only assigned one server to us. I felt so bad for her--she had the deer-in-headlights look the entirety of our stay--but I wasn't going to skip asking for something because she was overwhelmed. Also, her manager could have stepped in and helped at any point but chose to stand at the perimeter of the room and do nothing instead. Also, no modifications to the burgers. We couldn't add anything, we couldn't make our own burger. 

Our beers took forever to come out. And they didn't come out in the right glasses. I don't care about the shape of my glass but for a place to make such haughty distinctions and then not live up to the expectations it made for itself is lame.

Everyone's food took different times to come out. By the time I got my burger, I was STARVING. I had ordered the American cheeseburger and was hoping it would be good. It was not good. It was so far from good I was offended that this place had any reputation at all. The burger was completely tasteless. My boyfriend got the buffalo burger and he didn't fare any better.

The only pro is the strawberry milkshake. My friend ordered one. It was so tiny that she ended up ordering three. She said it was that good. I can't vouch for it because I didn't try it myself but she said it was delicious. I ordered the nutella milkshake and it was average at best.

Meh. Go somewhere else.
author: Becky P.

description:
It's just a novelty.

We just had to try the $60 burger and the beer float sampler.

The $60 burger was good but it's nothing that I will crave. Yes, it has foie and truffles and more truffle sauce and kobe beef and all the hype, but it's just not something that I will crave and will come back for.  I've had juicier and tastier burgers before and better prepared foie and truffles. 

The beer sampler was more for just ooohing and aahing and having other patrons ask us what the heck was this paddle with 6 different floats. Some tasted ok, one was down right gross and undrinkable... but again, they looked pretty.

In our party we also tried the buffalo burger (which was also just blah) - had tastier ones in San Jo.

Since I should end on a positive note, my favorite out of the entire meal was probably the chocolate dessert burger because the chocolate mousse was so rich and creamy. But it's not worth the wait to get a seat.
author: Rosiella I.

description:
IT was ok. I got a vegetarian burger with fries. It was ok. It is nice to be up top of macy's and hangout on friday or weekends though.

as for service......it could be better.
author: Sophia W.

description:
I came here for happy hour so I didn't try a signature burger but the happy hour apps were great!  Had the:

- Sliders: meat cooked to the right temp, bun perfectly crispy, not boring like other sliders you often get
- Quesadilla: crispy and yummy, fixins tasted fresh
- Mozzarella sticks: not over-battered or over-cooked, perfect amount of cheese and crispiness

My friend had the vanilla shake with hazelnut... AWESOMENESS!! 

Waiters were super nice, famous chef was there that day, and view was of course phenomenal of union square.  Giving it 3 stars only because I need to go back and test the burgers...
author: Anh D.

description:
Pretty good overall - stopped by on Black Friday since we were starving and wanted to try something new. I wasn't really in the mood for meat so I had the Veggie burger with buttermilk zucchini fries. The burger itself was really good - the fries not so much. 

The BF ordered the american classic which came with "skinny" fries - not sure why they're called skinny when they tasted and looked just like your standard fries. The burger otherwise was good. 

I would come back if I was in the mood for some burgers, but would not come out of my way to return. There was a 30 min wait for a party of two at around 2pm, but we sat at the bar which had plenty of seats.
author: Leily P.

description: Gotta try another HK's restaurant.  Sweet potato fries weren't fresh but the burgers were good. Pricey but good.  Truly enjoyed the Buffalo! good with caramelized onions and the Country Natural was also a great bite despite the plain look.
author: Allen C.

description: While the food was good, the service was horrible ... I've never written a Yelp review but felt compelled to do so after this experience. We waited for our server to even acknowledge is for 20 minutes and another 10 just for water... After taking our order and serving my party the food, the sever informs us that the soup 2 people ordered is no longer available and then just leaves... He does not offer them a chance to order anything else... We asked for another ketchup as ours was empty and he took about 10 minutes to come back empty handed... Drinks sat empty, 2 in our party wanted to order something in place if there's missing soup and were given the cold shoulder... I've been here 3 times before to excellent service... After today I can't say that I will ever come back ... Burger bar, if you want to charge 20 bucks for a burger then give better service... I'm very disappointed and can't believe a place as respected as burger bar would give such poor... If I could rate this place with negative stars I would !!!
author: Ely Z.

description:
Been here twice now, so feel like I can make a fair assessment. In a nutshell, pretty disappointing. I get that the location and celebrity chef attachment can command a higher price, but with that said, deliver some decent food. Burger was dry, bun was dry and everything was salty as hell. You would think a swanky place would cut their own fries and batter their own onion rings and zucchini fries, but everything tasted like it came processed from the freezer.

I much rather have the burger at Marlowe, Pearl's or heck even In & Out...

Blah...
author: Joe C.

description:
Burger Bar has been consistently good in the 3 or 4 times I have been here. They have an extensive beer list and I like that you can customize your burger as minimally or as extravagantly as you want. Maybe one of these days I'll try putting some foie gras on my burger...

My typical order:
Black Angus or Country National on Ciabatta w/ sweet potato fries
Add: Swiss, Coleslaw, Avocado

Great that they have veggie options too (veggie patty). My friend who had a veggie burger was satisfied and happy with his meal. 

Can't say I have any complaints about it other than the prices being a bit high. Other than that, it's in a nice convenient location - I'm a big fan of BART accessibility. Go here for your quick burger fix when you're shopping at Union Square.
author: Megan L.

description: I stopped at burger bar while i was in las vegas over the weekend. I ordered a kobe burger topped with cheddar cheese , foie gras, lettuce , tomato and onion on a sesame bun and some fat fries. the meal came up to around $37 dollars. The combination of the beef and foie gras blended well together. so well that I couldnt tell the difference. Overall it was a good experience. I would go back again. Oh yea.. the long island ice tea was Amazing.
author: Michael N.

description:
I don't have a problem paying for good food and service but this place made a mockery of them both. I was thrilled to see that Chef Hubert Keller was associated with this restuarnt but in my opinion, he should stop by soon.

We were greeted in the lobby by a lovely lady who said that we were beating the dinner rush. We arrived in the bar area and were greeted by a pleasant hostess  We decided to be seated in the bar because of the lovely view and open tables next to the windows. Here are my highlights. 

- Bottle of wine 
- Kobe Burger and onion rings
- Server: Richard

The table service was far from professional and prompt. Our food arrived, by a different serve and although it looked delicious, the onion rings were luke-warm. I am OK with warm onion rings but a luke-warm onion and cool batter was quite frankly, disgusting. After tracking down our waiter, who disappeared after we recieved our bottle of wine, I mentioned that our onion rings were cold. He decided to question me and say "The FOOD is cold"? (with a look of disbelief). I kindly asked for warm/hot onion rings which he kindly walked away and they were brought a few minutes later to our table by yet, another server. They were good. The table service made the entire evening far from pleasant. 

The burger (while waiting for warm onion-rings), the meat crumbled because it had either sat for awhile or the burger was made in advance and warmed up in a microwave. I don't believe it was the latter but that's what we thought. We decided to eat the burger after our waiter was surprised to hear that the onion rings were cold. 

Bad food - Bad service
author: Julio L.

description: My wife and I went to burger bar yesterday.  We bot ordered 18$ cheese burgers.  I also ordered an 8$ beer.  It's not AT&T park nor is it Los Vegas so 8$ for a beer is crazy.  The food came and was very dry we both ordered our meat cooked differently but they were cooked exactly the same.  Save your money and got to jack in the box.
author: Ryan B.

description:
I've been here twice and had a good experience both times.  The burgers were juicy and tasty and they have good fries.  The second time I had dessert, a banana split and boy was it good.  

The service was really good, even on my first try which was the day after Thanksgiving.  I also saw Hubert both times that I've eaten there.  Its nice to see an owner who is hands on.
author: Landy G.

description:
I've wanted to go here since this place opened, and finally got to try it out last night. We showed up during the bustling 5pm dinner rush during the heart of the X-mas shopping season. Putting our name in with the host, we were told it would be a 20 minute wait. More than acceptable. We settled in at the bar, easily getting stools within a few minutes. Our first drink order took about 5 minutes; but the bartender was more than nice in apologizing for taking so long. We got about halfway thru our drinks before our name was called and off we go. 

The server was on us from the start. Very attentive, and always there thought the whole meal. First Class service. I mention this because I've seen so many of the reviews ripping on the service. 

Fun fact: After checking out the place for a bit, we noticed that this location used to be the old bridal department of Macy's. The place is overall pretty small, and in my opinion they should have taken advantage of the great view of Union Square and capitalized on it. Instead, most of the windows are blocked and hard to see out of from most of tables. Too bad. 

Now onto the meal. I ordered a rare Black Angus beef burger with provolone cheese on an onion roll, with caramelized onions and oyster mushrooms. Add to that a side of buttermilk zucchini fries. My compatriot ordered a medium-rare American Kobe beef burger on a whole wheat roll with spinach and portobello mushrooms. Add to that a side of sweat potato fries. Both burgers arrived and were cooked exactly as requested. As well, both burgers were perfect in every way. There was a perfect amount of every ingredient, no single ingredient was overpowering. We ordered a few more rounds of drinks and got out of there with a $67 bill.
author: Paul V.

description:
Wow, I think I may have had the best burger of my life.  Worth every penny.  Meat was cooked perfectly, delicious sourdough bread bun, all the fixings were tasty.  We don't usually clean our plates, especially when eating a huge meat based meal.. but my guy and I devoured these burgers and fully enjoyed our meal.

I would have given 5 stars if I was only writing about the food... but we lost a star for service.  We didn't need much, but still felt like the service was a bit slow and inattentive, not really sure if we had a designated server.  Considering the service at Macy's is extraordinary, it would be nice if that attitude carried in to this restaurant.  Service was ok/good, just not on the level I expected.  

We'll definitely go back and I don't think I will ever choose the Cheesecake Factory over this place when I'm at Macy's.   A wonderful and memorable burger!
author: Kris K.

description:
No longer San Francisco's best burger place...
For the past few years, Burger Bar has been a must-do activity every Christmas when we visit family in SF. Already great fans of Hubert Keller, we expected a lot- and it delivered. Until this year...
Service was fun and relatively fast as usual (given the number of guests) but the food has really deteriorated. We ordered the sliders, which were to die for in previous years, but they were soggy, tasteless and simply boring. The fries were just ok - would have preferred McD, actually. The only highlight: the breaded jalapeño pickles - a bit too "bready" and oily but soooo delicious. 
I can only assume this restaurant has become a victim of its own success. Too many customers, too little time, too much of an assembly line without the firm and fast processes that requires. 
What a disappointment - thankfully, we have found another new place to go to for burgers and sandwiches. So I guess that is where you will find us next year. Macy's - from now on only for shopping,
author: Ann-Charlott B.

description:
Meh. Forget the burgers, come for the beer floats.

Truffle sauce, not worth $5.50. I got it to see what the hype was all about. Nothing special. If you're worried about overcrowding, don't be. I came during dinner time and got seated right away. It was pretty empty in fact. You have to order everything separately, which isn't a bad thing, but just be prepared for a hefty bill for the most expensive burger you'll probably ever have in your life.
author: Lily Z.

description: The food is absurdly expensive, and the place had horrible service.  Expect to wait a half hour AFTER sitting down just to order, and after that, they'll leave halfway through taking the order to go talk to a friend for another ten minutes.  We had 30 people, and one of them ordered the "World's Hottest Burger", and they wanted him to sign a gimmick "waiver" before they served it, which he refused.  The waiter bold-faced lied and told him it was "illegal" to sell the burger without the "waiver" and they argued for a good ten minutes over it before we all got fed up and left.  They blew a $700 check over that gimmick and ridiculously bad manners.
author: Mason G.

description: Service was the only good thing. Had the sliders, 3. We're suppose to be different but all 3 tasted the same...tired dry cold. Fries were cold and tasted like they were cooked in the am and kept under a heat lamp. Won't be back
author: Laurie S.

description: They don't know how to cook burgers!  I had to send my first burger back. Second one still was over cooked, and they served it on an un toasted bun, which makes a huge difference!!!  We will absolutely not be going back!
author: Rachel W.

description:
I heard about Burger Bar from a friend who told me about the Nutella shake. I'm a humungous chocolate-loving fan and Nutella is one of the greatest inventions made by man on my list! So when I heard that this place had a Nutella shake, I literally went nuts-ella-ella-ella!!!

I thought I had pictures of the sweet potato fries I ordered yet can't seem to find the picture. Anyways, if I had to compare BB's sweet potato fries with Zebulon's - it's close BUT Zeb's is still my choice to go for SPF!!!

The Nutella shake is a must and yes, you may complain that it's pricey BUT it is definitely WORTH IT!!! I'd spend the $8 on this shake rather than gas! Oh I forgot, I don't have a car but if I did then I would totally opt out and take public transportation to have this in my hand once again! It's just that good, no words to describe it because my taste buds can't talk. BAH!

I came back for another - the Mint Chocolate shake is so gooood! Yes, it's that good that it needed the extra O's! I'm a shake lover, blended with ice and chocolate and you have me flying high on cloud ten!

I'll try the food next time but I can't help going straight to the dessert menu! Besides, the shake itself is a meal already, a well-deserved meal that is!

*sigh*

I have to end this because my cravings are taking over...

Mmm, I'll see you soon BB!!!
author: Jay C.

description:
Fun environment and okay burgers. It's unique because it offers fancy add ons. It is one of the few places I know where you can add foie gras to your burger! For $12 you can add a piece of pan-seared foie gras to any burger. It was very exciting, although I didn't love the combination. If I was rich I'd try their $60 burger which comes with kobe beef, foie gras, AND shaved truffles. 

Aside from the burgers, I like the sweet potato fries and the onion rings. The milkshakes are expensive but delicious. My favorite is the nutella milkshake - chocolate ice cream with nutella, chocolate whipped cream, and hazelnuts. Overall it's not bad, but I expect more from a restaurant owned by Hubert Kellar. For the price, you can definitely get a better burger elsewhere.
author: Alice J.

description:
Disappointing!  I've heard great things about this restaurant  but left completely disappointed.

I came here for a business lunch.  The location is perfect looking down at Union Square.  

Upon arrival the staff was friendly and greeted me.  The place was nearly empty with only 2 other tables at 11:30am.  My greeting was where it all the glitz ended.  After being seated, the entire experience went downhill with service and food.

To start, our server took our drink orders.  I had to remind the server to bring my drink.  He had left it sitting on the counter and by the time it was served to me my ice was melted and received a watered down drink.  I was also surprised that drinks were served in plastic cups.  Not a great look for what I thought would be a high end burger joint.

We ordered two entrees and a side of fries to share.  The entrees were good just not spectacular.  I could have had a similar order at Red Robin or TGIFridays.  Again we had to remind the server to bring out our fries.  We were half way done with our entrees by the time he remembered to bring them out.  When they arrived they were barely warm.

For the price on the menus and the name backing the restaurant, I would have expected more in regards to service.  A great server is attentive and anticipates your needs.  Our server lacked both of these qualities.  

I'd rather go to Super Duper or the Counter for a good burger.
author: Jessica C.

description:
The burger was great, but the staff was much worse than expected, considering its a national, and soon to me international chain. The hostess who sat us just tossed the menus down on the table and walked away, without seeing if the table was ok or not. Well, it was not. I'm not usually picky, but when I can reach to the table next to me and grab their food without leaning, the tables are far too close. My boyfriend went up to ask her if we could move to one a table away that was near the window, and all she said was "no" and then sat someone else there. That's when we sat ourselves at the bar instead.

The burger and side options are great! It's pretty fun building a crazy burger, and it was extremely tasty! Overall, I'd say I'd go back, but likely to a different location..Sorry SF.
author: Stephany M.

description: I went here looking for the fois gras buger I heard so much about, only to find its been banned from california! I was happy to find there were lots of other menu items suited for adult tastes, with a full bar to go with it! The bartenders were great and easy to talk to...
author: Danielle M.

description:
Been here twice, tried almost everything but the $100 burger.
It's all delicious. Fries, burgers, sliders, fried pickles. ALL GOOD.
Enjoy the view!
author: Roxanna A.

description:
Oh Burger Bar, where to begin? Your menu promised artful burgers crafted by a flowing haired wizard. What you delivered was less than magic. 

Surely the journey to hell begins here, in the Macy's lobby. While waiting for the elevator I witnessed a woman hoist a severely distressed, Italian Greyhound swaddled in baby blankets out of a stroller. She then proceeded to rock the dog to sleep and whisper sweet nothings into its ear. 

Upstairs the hostess was blocked by a gaggle of tourists hovering over the lunch special board attempting to figure out what to order. For dinner. About 20 minutes later we were seated in the bar area, where we were treated to So You Think You Can Dance on all the tvs. This must be an attempt on the zookeepers' part to soothe the savage Midwestern beasts. 

We left here $50 lighter, for two small cheeseburgers, fries and a couple domestic beers, our faith in humanity wavering. Literally every burger I have had in San Francisco was better than my Burger Bar burger. 

You can replicate this dining experience for a mere $10: get Carls' Jr. to go, proceed to eat it inside of the H&M at Union Square, followed by 30 minutes of aggressive vomiting.
author: Beth D.

description:
Situated in Macy's below a Cheesecake Factory and serving alcoholic milk shakes, this place screams T.G.I.Friday's with more subtle inward flair.  Thankfully their make your own burger menu goes beyond the realm of BBQ sauce to truffles and foie gras.  Alright, so it's more yuppie than suburban, but still feels mall chain restaurant-ish (which technically it is being the third Burger Bar and located in the mallish Macy's).

Burger Patties: Had the Black Angus Beef and Country Natural (sustainable) which were so similar they warranted the same review.  The insides on both were cooked to request perfectly.  The outsides had a good browning with a some spices: definitely black pepper in the mix.  In the upper echelon for sure.

Onion Bun: Like a brioche with onions on top.  Enjoyed the consistency while the onion flavor was too subtle to notice given everything else that was going on in the burger.

Sourdough: Always a San Francisco specialty.  Was as good as an Acme or Boudin.

Black Périgord Truffle Sauce: I expected truffled decadence and received mushroom gravy.  Granted, the black truffle is not as potent as the white truffle, but it still has a nice flavor when used in proper portions.  This reminds me of those deception lobster bisques that only have flecks of lobster in them!

Rich Red Wine & Shallots Reduction: This was a great sauce to absorb into the buns and give the feeling of a fancy au jus.  Very well suited to make good beef better!

Cheeses: Had the provolone and blue cheese.  In this day of super fancy (and often local/sustainable/organic) cheeses, it was disappointing *not* to see some name dropping (Cow Girl, Cypress Grove, Point Reyes, Andante) or more exotic cheeses listed.

Jalapeño Bacon: A culinary first for me!  When you're tired of smoked, peppered and mapled varieties it's always exciting to see a new pork fat option!  It tasted like the jalapeño juices were coming out of the bacon.  Possibly my favorite topping!

Proscuitto: Cut the thickness of deli ham rather than traditional airy proscuitto.  Definitely better than actual ham, but a let down for afficiandos that only use proscuitto on cheap nights when not eating serrano or ibérico.

Cosmo Milk Shake: You had me at alcohol and ice cream!  The strawberry ice cream, orange liqueur and citron vodka are a good combination, but don't really taste like a cosmo since cosmos are never creamy.  I'd call it more a jacked up strawberry creamsicle.  Too high of a whipped cream to shake ratio for my tastes though.

Irish Coffee Milk Shake:  Whiskey and coffee ice cream are a brilliant combination, why has no one else been doing this sooner?  Probably because svelte bar goers would look like Middle American couch potatoes if all our hard alcohol came wrapped in tasty ice cream!  The caramel sauce and chocolate liqueur make this even more irresistible!

Zucchini Fries: Breaded like mozzarella sticks, but with a much less interesting center.  I can't believe with so much attention paid to burger toppings, specialty fry dips are ignored.
author: Adam B.

description:
I'm a big fan of the food, but I also have some words of wisdom para senor Keller.

First things last, We waited a good 20 minutes, which was no big deal and were seated next to the window with a lovely view of the ice skating rink across the street, until the waitresses start blasting off with MARIA, PARTY OF 3! TOM, TOM TOM!!!!! PARTY OF 6!!!!!! Holy sheep shit, these bitches were screaming in my ace and it was SO annoying. Apparently they spent so much cash making the Macy's 5th floor look good they were unable to pick up those giant black pager systems they use at Cheesecake Factory. Well, maybe you can send one of the 19 hostesses upstairs to snag a few so the guests near the entrance can enjoy a meal without crazy ass bitches screaming in their ears. 

On to the star of the show. The almighty burger!

Sandra and I decided to order a couple different burgers and split them. I had the Kobe beef burger, which could have been cooked a few minutes less, but no big deal. I'm not obsessed with myself that much anymore, so I don't need to nitpick. It was full of flavor and I kept it simple, just lettuce, mayo and tomato.

Sandra ordered the Peppercorn burger and it was pretty good, although the sauce it comes with is a bit funky for my taste, but my lady seemed to love it.

In the end, you pay more than you are used to for a burger, which I know seems odd to a lot of folks, but the flavor is really good and the experience is, well, let's just say it wasn't as good as it could be and they need to make some improvements. 

Love ya anyway Hubert!
author: Hector G.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night - not crowded at all. Seated at a nice table by the window overlooking Union Square watching the swing dancers.

The waiter was fast, bringing waters and giving us the menu. I decided to build my own burger and went with the Country Natural on an onion bun, and added whatever toppings I was craving. This is where it can get a little tricky because it's easy to start picking all of these toppings and before you know it, you just made yourself a $25 burger! Ordered a side of Skinny Fries, although the Zucchini Fries sounded reallly tempting.

My burger came out, and it looked like the smallest burger ever, but thankfully, it was super filling. Meat was cooked perfectly, great flavor, juicy, and very hot.

Would come back here if I wanted a 'gourmet' burger, but for now, I'll stick with Pearl's.
author: Sarah H.

description:
We have gone to Macy's burger bar every holiday season for the past 4 years.. This year was no exception.  We went the afternoon of 12/30/2014.   We went early, before noon time.   We waited only 10 -15 minutes for a table.

We (three of us)  ordered the classic burger with fries.    

Unfortunately, the quality of the burger was not up to their $15 charge per burger.

We asked for medium rare, and got near well done.  All three burgers were dry as a bone, there was no meat juice.      Unlike our previous visits this burger was just not the great $15 burger it  should be.   

I think Chef Keller should be ashamed of himself,   If he cooked a burger like this on the TV show Chopped, he would have been chopped in the first round!!.  I think the quality of the burger was about a 1/2 step above Carl's Junior!!.

Chef Keller should be ashamed to have his name associated with this place.

The fries?  Well,   semi cold and over fried.. not softness in the centers.   The fires at Carl's junior are much better and served hot!.

My whole family was very disappointed,,,,
This is the last season for us at this place.  

What a disappointment;

It may survive on the tourista trade, but for a native , its just a waste.of time and money.

Don't waste you money there are plenty of other places for lunch in the city that will give better tasting food and better value.
author: tom w.

description:
I came here on a date the other day and sat right by the window seat facing Union Square. There was a pretty nice view (a lot nicer than what you would get in the outdoor seating at the Cheesecake Factory up top!) We both ordered the Kobe beef burger medium rare. It was pretty delicious but I expected it to be a lot bigger! The Kobe beef burger was about $17 but what can you expect when the restaurant is known for gourmet burgers? The sweet potato fries were also pretty crisp and yummy as well. 

As for the drinks, my date and I ordered two of their mixed drinks and none of them tasted good at all. I don't remember the names now but I do not recommend getting drinks from here!
author: Vikki K.

description:
Wow, I'm pretty surprised this place averages three stars. I loved it, and I'm a vegetarian!

We were in the city with our son when we got hungry. We happened to be in Union Square when the hubby said he would love to try The Burger Bar.  Can't remember the name of the owner/chef, but my husband had watched his cooking show quite a bit and really respected him. I begrudgingly went, thinking I would be limited to fries and a drink since I don't eat meat. 

Imagine  how delighted I was when they not only had a veggie burger, but they also had a vegan option. I ordered the veggie burger and it was by far the best one I have ever had. A combination of beans and rice held together by a pumpkin puree mixture it was so moist and yummy. It was served on a soft roll with avocado, sprouts, onions and a bevy of other veggies. It was fucking scrumptious.

My guys had burgers they seemed to like, but my veggie option was def the winner at the table. The fries were great and I had the most amazing mixed drink there..Would def go back again.
author: Jenny B.

description:
As a culinarian I enjoy seeing playfulness and creativity in classic creations that can oftentimes become trite and predictable. However, as a Georgia girl raised on a cattle farm, I can really appreciate a well-crafted burger and I do not find comfort in (for example) the ground shrimp concoctions that are taking the place of an all-beef patty on certain trendy menus. This being said, I was excited to visit Chef Hubert Keller's Burger Bar while I was staying in San Francisco this past month; it certainly did not hurt that my hotel was in eye-sight of the Macy's in which Burger Bar is located. My classmate, who works as a Chef in her own state, is just as much of a burger freak as I am and was thrilled at the idea of stopping in on our way back to the hotel from our romp around the Ferry Building. Upon checking-in with the hostess we were told to expect a 15 minute wait and were satisfied that we only had to stall for about 7 or 8 minutes. Even better, we were seated next to a window overlooking Union Square so that we could enjoy the beautiful day outside from our comfortable perch 6 stories up.

Walking the hills again had re-whetted my appetite and thirst so I started my order with a Pyramid Breweries Hefeweizen while Robin went for a flight of sampler pours including the Pyramid Hefe, Deschutes Black Butte Porter, Pyramid Outburst Imperial IPA and the privately-labeled Burger Bar Brew. Robin seemed to enjoy getting to taste so many options and I thoroughly enjoyed my wheat beer; it was the perfect weather for this light, slightly yeasty wheat beer. Before we could make up our minds on burgers (there are SO many options to either pick a composed burger or to create your own from endless choices) we picked out an appetizer to split. The Beer-Battered Jalapeno Pickles were something to behold and provided the perfect combination of slightly pickled, flavorful heat and substantial batter to absorb the spicy juices and create a rich, yet slightly crisp, exterior. The chipotle aioli that accompanied the jalapeno fries provided just enough creaminess to balance the heat; I cannot see ordering these gems with any other sauce offered on the menu. Finally, as if the fun flavors were not enough, the battered peppers were served in a cute miniature fry-basket; this was a first in presentation for me!

Mulling over the menu while I munched on jalapenos helped to inspire my customized burger and Robin and I agreed that we were ready to place our next order just as our waitress approached. I was allowed to order first and chose a toasted onion bun as my base, the sustainable Country Natural burger (cooked mid-rare), caramelized onion and pan-seared foie gras for my add-ons and the rich red wine and shallot reduction as my sauce. After placing my order I guess Robin decided to simplify things and just asked for one of the same, right down to the skinny fries with a classic aioli. Despite my longing for the $60 Rossini Burger (a Kobe creation oozing black truffles and foie gras) I was thrilled with my own composition and I am comfortable to say that this ranked in my top five favorite burgers and is kept company by the Black Tie Burger of Minetta Tavern in Manhattan and the 10 O'clock Burger of Holeman & Finch in Atlanta (In-N-Out holds a spot near the top as well, but for totally different reasons). The burger was perfectly cooked and rich without being fatty and the foie gras added a beautiful element of creamy caramelization and decadence (gotta get your fix of California foie gras before July 1st!). The shallot reduction was the perfect finish to the structure and the fries were an excellent accompaniment without being too starchy, yet still satisfying.

I will go back to Burger Bar again next time that I am on the west coast and would definitely check out Chef Keller's Las Vegas Burger Bar location next time I am in Sin City. And for the icing on cake, I got to meet Chef Keller a few nights after my Burger Bar visit and was able to get an autographed cookbook from the Chef while I had dinner in his top-notch San Francisco restaurant, Fleur de Lys.
author: Abby M.

description:
Hubert Keller for president!  Seriously, all he has to do is pass out kobe burgers and black & white shakes to the voters, and Keller could rule the free world.

It's hard for a burger to get much better than this: you have an amazing selection of meats (kobe is my fave, but there's also buffalo and salmon,
 to name a few), a huge variety of toppings, and a delicious array of buns.  The only thing that sucks is it takes a while to peruse the menu and make all these decisions.  But it's so worth it.  What you get at the end is a truly custom burger with amazing flavor. The only thing I'd love to see added to the topping selection is peanut butter (for New Orleans style PB and bacon, or my fave, thai style PB and jalapenos).  

Setting aside the burgers for a second, let's talk side dishes.  The fried pickles are salty-crunchy deliciousness on a stick (well, technically on a plate) and the fries (of which there are several different varieties, of course) will please even the most persnickety fry connoisseur.  I think I would come here just for the fries even of that burger wasn't that great.  

And then there are the milk shakes.  Don't you dare leave this place without trying one of their signature shakes.  They even have shakes with various liquors in them (like cocktail-shake hybrids).  The nutella shake is particularly fantastic.

Overall, this is the best burger joint in my book.  Is it cheap?  No.  Is it the best burger you've ever had?  Most likely.
author: Laura K.

description:
Upon arrival our host/manager urged us to sit at the bar.  After I requested a table because there were three of us and asked him if he could change the channel for our t.v. (yes they have personal table t.v.s)  he was very rude about it.  We were about to walk out right there.  Luckily our super nice waiter made up of it along with the fried pickels and the American Burger.  Order yours medium rare!
Hubert needs to look into nicer management :(
author: Kirsten M.

description:
2.5 stars.

I've been here twice and both times were just OK. You'd expect so much more from a Hubert Keller restaurant!

PROS: Cool views. TVs. Big bar.

CONS: The bad food. The long wait. The untrained servers.

Bottom line: If you're in Macy's deciding to eat dinner either at Cheesecake Factory and Burger Bar...you best go to Cheesecake Factory!
author: Krystle I.

description: Ordered the Kobe Beef burger ($16.50) medium and the meat was dry and brittle. The quality of the meat is subpar to other Kobe burgers I had in the past . Probably the high price is for the view of Union Square, but not for the burger. Service good, burger no so good. Go for the Angus, will save $6.00 and have a better experience.
author: Giovanni P.

description:
We had a big party and they were nice to accomodate our menu request for an "a-la-carte" style rather than a set one, that was a plus! They also waited for some of our party members who arrived a little tardy and didn't try to kick us out even thought it was pretty crowded there! Now, onto food...

Got the classic burger, regular fries, and nutella shake. The shake was rich but super good!! I would get it again. The burger was decent and the fries came in a little basket, it didn't look like much food but it filled me up. Other people really liked what they ordered too, there was something on ciabatta bread that they really liked. I think they did get one of the orders wrong, but other than that everyone's food was good and we had a great time. 

Interesting that it's inside macy's, we couldn't find it and the elevator to it was broken so we went up many escalators to get there. They have 2 women's restrooms, but separate not like stalls.
author: C M.

description:
There is quite lot of hype around Burger Bar, but it doesn't seem to live up to it on the burger end. The venue is very classy and clean, and service was on point. You are pretty much buying into the experience, which wasn't bad at all. 

I had the surf and turf burger. It presented in front of me very clean, and popping with lobster, asparagus. Both are very tasty on a plate, but in a burger they are quite difficult to bite into. Lobster meat can be pretty tough,  having you just pull out that entire piece right out of the burger. Asparagus was toothsome, but still a little sinew-y. Wouldn't order this again. 

The plain jane burger seemed to be good. Although the almighty burger is quite the delectable meat vessel, with countless variations and traditions of preparation, I've still had better.
author: Ray C.

description:
In an effort to continue my search for guest recommendations in the Union Square area, I decided to give Huber Keller's "Burger Bar" a try.  Spending $$ on a corporate, touristy place is rough on me, but need to do my own research.

Bartender Dominic was awesome, acknowledged me right-away and offered a taste of the beer in question.  Lovely, hoppy...  I was in.

Menu...  A bit contrived but pretty easy to navigate:  Here is your protein, here are your add-ons and here are your sides.  By the time I would actually "build my own" the burger would be about $25.  I WILL NEVER SPEND $25 ON A BURGER.  The beer alone was $8, but I get it-you pay for the real-estate.  Still, pretty ridiculous when I can go to a neighborhood joint and get a burger for $10.

Chose the sliders because I wanted to "test" the different types of burgers but when they arrived, they looked exactly alike so I had to ask the difference.  Seriously?  They all had the same garnish, except for a shred of caramelized onion, the bit o' bacon, and a piece of American cheese.  Couldn't tell them apart.  Waste of time and money.  Annoying.

Had another beer, which at $8 was probably a bad decision but best part of my meal.  Well, except for the skinny fries which were delicious.  

Would go back for a beer and a chat with Dom, but will save my pennies for that $8 beer.

Crowd was tourist/business dudes.  Lots of hotel guests too, but I won't be sending anyone over anytime soon. 

Total bill for sliders and 2 beers=  $32.00.  Oye Ve.  I'll stick to Bill's on Clement. 

Score:  2.6 pints.
author: Gina H.

description: The view is nice. Hmmm. Yeah, the view is nice. The food... I don't really remember so I guess that's a bad thing.
author: Andrew V.

description:
I had dinner here just yesterday and while I understand this the beginning of the holiday season the wait time for a table and food was ridiculous. I waited 45 minutes for a table and then another 30 for a hamburger... I tried to make a reservation the morning of, but they do not allow same day reservations. 
      Our table was in the middle of all these other group parties which made it a loud and annoying ambience, not to mention the 2002 Rihanna track playing in the back. The waiter even moved out table half way into our meals just so they could fit another large party. 
       Being a server myself I understand the need to upsell, but this guy was so obvious and obtrusive that it made me feel bad about what I was ordering. The food was overpriced and did not live up to the quality. The menu was also very limited. Overall I would not recommend this place to someone else even if you do make a reservation. The Cheesecake Factory two floors above would've been a better option.
author: Diana F.

description:
DUDE. This place is awesome. 

I "made my own burger" and got the Buffalo beef burger with sweet potato fries, this Chipotle sauce, added avocado and swiss cheese and ohmygoodness, I think I was in burger heaven.

It is pretty pricey for the amount of food you get, but it's kind of worth it! I think. Maybe I'll just have to go back and try it again! (:

The service was great; our waiter was super friendly and helpful. When I go back, I'll definitely have to try their alcoholic milkshakes ... THEY LOOKED SO BOMB.
author: Chrisy Y.

description: Burger Bar is alright, but just that. There are tons of seats, and it's cool to have a view of downtown and Union Square. The prices are really steep (most burgers are north of $15), and aren't justified by the quality of the meat or ingredients. Both times I've been I've been left wanting for a more memorable burger.
author: Bill H.

description:
The spicy burger looked good, but you can tweak the ingredients and make a better burger. The ingredients are of good quality. Did not try the higher end meats. The views are nice too. 

Ambiance is nice, friendly, and relaxed. Prices are a bit high though. I'd go back if I were shopping in the area, but i wouldn't go out of the way for it.
author: Raymond H.

description:
A few things about this place to take note of...

I suppose I wasn't expecting something absolutely amazing since it's in a very touristy area, but despite my low expectations, Burger Bar fell short. The service was absolutely abysmal. We were constantly trying to flag down our waiter who seemed to never be around. When our food finally came they made mistakes on three of our six orders. Then, when it was time to pay the bill, the waiter dropped the tab and left. The bussers came and started cleaning/MOVING our table while we were still seated waiting for our waiter to come and take the tab with our card. Ten minutes later (after the bussing staff forced us out of our chairs to stand) we took the bill to the Maitre D' table ourselves to close it out.

The food was decent. Certainly overpriced for the quality. Every single one of our 6 burgers was overcooked. (I ordered mine medium rare and it came completely grey)

Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Jon S.

description:
Love Hubert Keller's food at Fleur de Lys (who doesn't)?

Burger Bar is a fairly disappointing tourist trap.  The $22 Keller burger (buffalo, blue cheese and blanched spinach) was tasty -- but the commercial bun, crappy pickle and mediocre frites were disappointing.

Service was dead slow -- with food being dropped off with no follow-up until we asked for the bill.

About $70 for two burgers and two beers with gratuity.  Definitely not a meal HK would want to have associated with his name (hopefully).  Smells of selling out.
author: Mark B.

description:
To call Burger Bar a disappointment would be somewhat of a stretch but part of me wants to call it that. After hearing so much about it, we finally came here after the Yelp Holiday party across the street. 

The establishment is a lot smaller than I envisioned, long and very narrow. I ordered the American Kobe beef burger that everyone raves about. While the chuck itself was excellent, the rest of the burger left something to be desired. I'm not sure what I expected - maybe because Hubert Keller's name is all over the place, I wanted something exotic, a twist on the classic burger. But what I got was a plain ol' burger with special meat. It wasn't bad by any means but I've had better (using just regular ground beef at that). 

My cousin had the peppercorn angus burger and while I can't speak for her, she also seemed far from blown away. The Nutella shake was awesome the first few sips but became overload quickly. They should blend the Nutella into the shake instead of just piling the syrup over it. 

Not bad, if I'm in the area I'll give it another try. And I love how the booths have the little LCDs with HD cable.

Oh and they charge the 3% "Healthy SF" tax here on top the 9.5% sales. Look out for it.
author: O'Shea J.

description: The most amazing burger I have ever had hands down!! Several different buns to pick from as well as several different kinds of beef and ever topping you can think of. The only thing that keeps the place from getting 5 stars is the service, our server never checked on us after he took our order, a different guy brought our food out and we had to ask another guy for the check when we were done eating.... Good thing we didn't need anything in the middle of the meal because we weren't going to get it. If your in the mood for a great burger and can put up with awful service, this is the place.
author: Terrance I.

description:
Alcoholic milkshakes. Nutella burgers with passion fruit gelatin "cheese". Mind blowing house veggie burger made from caramelized onions, pumpkin (!), green peas and brown rice.

Tables by the window look out onto iconic Union Square.

Service is fast and friendly.

Unfortunately a two star penalty for being overpriced.
author: Jason B.

description:
Yes, yes, and YES!! 

The service was great, but who really stood out above the rest was the front of house staff Zack - on a busy Friday night with a packed house, the wait was well worth it! He checked on us multiple times and is one of the most professional and pleasant individuals I've had the pleasure of encountering in a long while. What a fabulous start to an even better dining experience! 

By far the best burger I've had - Kobe beef!!!!!!! Mr. Keller's adaptation of an American classic should make every other diner in the continental US take some notes on how it should be always be done!! Bravo! Will be back and waiting with bells on.
author: Meghan W.

description: We were told there was a 15 minute wait but 45 minutes later when I went to see why it was taking so long I found out there was some sort of problem with the texting notification.  This happened to a number of us and instead of calling our names, since we were right by the hostess stand, they just went on seating others.  After we were seated it took another 45 minutes to get our food.  The onion rings were very good and the hamburger was okay but it certainly was not worth the 90 minute wait.
author: Nancy B.

description: Great view, reserve a window table ahead.  Noisy yet private. The Hubert Keller burger with Kobe beef is to die for. I recommend a Nutella shake to end the meal...yum!
author: Laura C.

description: This place had the worst customer service that I have ever experienced. We were waiting for the hostess to come back and seat us for almost 20 minutes. When my grandmother ( 80 years old) went to sit down just to wait they told her she could not sit and needed to wait for the hostess to be seated. We kept getting told conflicting information about what was being severed ( full meals or just drinks) by many servers. After finally getting seated our waitress did not smile once and was very cold. Finally when my grandmother was paying the waitress made a crack about how much money my grandmother had in her purse and how her money was organized. It was a bummed because we were looking forward to having a nice drink looking at Macy's Christmas tree. Hope the service improves as this was the worst and oddest service I've ever received.
author: Chelsea G.

description:
The hostess needs an attitude adjustment and the cooks are chintzy with the beef. This had to be the smallest burger I ever had. The classic was the size of a slider. 

If you want a good grass fed burger, go to Brickhouse. 

This place is a joke and will never go here again.
author: James T.

description: The service was terrible! We waited and watched while servers walked by and basically ignored us. We ended up going to the bar to get our drinks, and order the appetizer. We actually just ended up leaving after we finished our drinks. We ordered the Calamari as an appetizer, its wasn't anything to write home about, actually I think it was a little under cooked. Besides the view into Union Square, I would say its probably best to skip this place.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Was seated promptly, and there was ample seating. we got a booth/bar table against the window overlooking Union Square, except that one of those Macy's banners was covering it. 

The server came several times, to see if we were ready, i kinda felt rushed or that was no need to come so often. 

i had higher expections, but it was more casual and not as hectic as the cheesecake.

ordered the Country Natural with cheddar and avocado, and thought it was delish.
the portions were right, and i didnt have that beef flavor in my mouth after you eat beef lol. 

thought it was pricey esp w/ all those add-ons.
and most places the hamburger comes with a side such as fries, but not here.
author: Amien P.

description:
Avoid at all costs.

Took my girlfriend for dinner and drinks. Jeez what a mistake. Bad service, annoying as BALLS to get to (no stairs! elevator only!), prices are way too high for what you get, burger was INCREDIBLY sub-par... I mean, wow. What a tourist trap. I should have expected better (I'm not a tourist!)
author: Omid F.

description:
Was seated immediately great table with a view. Waitress was rude!  Our order took forever to arrive!  When it finally arrived the forgot my sons fries. My order was incorrect. When it arrived again, we asked for silverware and napkins!  No luck!  We had to go to the Manager.  She apologized and brought us what we needed.  I told her the service was horrible and she said she wouldn't charge us for the fries!  Really?  The waitress never came back and refilled our drinks or asked if we needed anything! My son had to walk up to the bar to ask for a refill on his Coke.  I always tip well, however this time, she got a big nothing!    Don't recommend at all!  By the other reviews on YELP, I know we are not the only ones! 
Forgot to mention, if you order Avacado on your burger you get one slice, for what they charge your should get at least a half of one!
author: Chuck T.

description:
Looking at the reviews I think most people's problems are just their high expectations because of the hype, and also ordering pricey burgers. Just stick with normal ones then you will be just fine! 

We had a Country Natural ($10) and US Kobe beef ($16). Nothing too fancy or pricey. They were both very tasty with tender meet. Actually paying extra $6 for the Kobe beef was a waste since Country Natural tasted even better. Maybe it could be just because it was cooked to absolute perfection (cooked medium with pink in the middle) compared to the Kobe beef which was slightly overcooked. Well I don't except much when it says "US" Kobe beef because that is nothing like the real Japanese Kobe beef ;) 

If you order $20+ for a burger, you are just setting yourself up for a disappointment. Hamburger is just a hamburger, it is not filet mignon! Don't try to get all fancy and I assure you your experience will be a positive one :) 

I will come back here for a simple burger if I'm feeling like a burger, and I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Cartman P.

description: The only thing that's even close to acceptable is the food. They are horribly understaffed and it took and hour and a half to get drinks! Mc. Donald's is looking pretty good right now.
author: Ellen F.

description:
Came here hoping to get a good view of the Chinese New Year parade. Ended up with an obstructed view because we had no reservation.

They have a good selection of beer. I ended up getting the Old No. 38 Stout which was smoother than Guinness. The wifey had 3 different sliders with sweet potato fries and I had the Kobe burger. The meat in all burgers were big and juicy, but I don't think Kobe is worth it in a burger. It is slightly more tender for twice the price. I wished the buns were thinner because I prefer less carbs.

Overall, it was a good experience and wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Kien M.

description: Service was great but the food just really didn't stand up to what I would expect from a chef Hubert Keller restaurant. The surf and turf burger was ordered medium but the Kobe beef was dry and the lobster was okay.  we also ordered the Hubert burger which the buffalo was much tastier. The sides were good though.
author: Betty R.

description: Didn't even get to taste the food. Took 30min to have them just bring waters, no drink order or anything. then after that nothing. Just said eff-it and went up to Cheesecake Factory. If it took 30min to meet our waiter with waters I wouldn't want to wait and see how long it will take to get a 60 dollar burger. At least Cheesecake Factory has efficient with service. Shoulda know by how snobby the hostess was.
author: Christian L.

description:
We have been to Burger Bar in Las Vegas about 6 years ago and this Burger Bar about 2 years ago. Those were great experiences but things seem to have gone down hill.  Burger Bar used to be a high quality restaurant and we didn't mind paying for the extra attention to food and service. Now, however, it seems like a run of the mill touristy burger restaurant.  

First off, the wait was long but to be expected as it is busy in downtown SF around the holidays. They underestimated our wait (45 min) but overall got seated within an hour or so of putting our name down.  For whatever reason, there were many tables empty even though there continued to be a long wait.

Our server was very nice but still the overall service was poor.  

1.  We had a TV in the booth but it was showing an inappropriate show (for children) with curse words, etc.  We asked to change the channel to the Warriors game but our server didn't know how to find the remote.
2.  My son ordered a kids sliders meal and was told that it came plain.  When it was served, the burger had cheese on it. Since our son doesn't eat cheese we asked for a new one and the waitress was understanding and replaced it. However, when my son got his burger, it was obvious they just scraped the cheese off.  My son chose not to complain about it and tried eating it but it really ruined his meal.
3.  My daughter went to use her napkin and it was really dirty. Gross!
4.  The milkshake was good although they initially brought the wrong milkshake to us. But it was nothing we would seek out.  
5. Overall the service was slow and unfriendly.  The servers just dropped the food off at the table without saying anything.  We hardly saw our waitress. It was hard to even pay our bill.
6.  Lastly, the food was not even very good. The chicken burger had no taste.  The other burgers were pretty bland. The french fries were not even crunchy and were also very plain.


We were hoping to have a nice holiday meal with the kids at Union Square however it really was a disappointment and we have no plans to return or recommend this restaurant.
author: Courtney T.

description: I came here with two of my friends for lunch and a burger sounded good. We were seated right away. It took a while for them to take order, although we weren't too phased by that. The reason why I'm giving a two star review is because they had bad service. It took 40 minutes for us to get our food... We also saw other people who were seated after us who received their food before us! They slightly redeemed themselves by giving my friend a free order of fries, only because they forgot to bring it out and we had to ask for them again, and because we waited so long. I believe our waiter was new, because someone was shadowing over him training him. Probably won't be coming back.
author: Victoria V.

description:
Got to finally try out this hot spot last Friday before the infamous Foie Gras ban.

I must say that I was surprised at how the casual and laid back feeling I got when eating at this restaurant. Being a Hubert Keller restaurant, I half expected semi formal attire and really fancy ambiance. In fact, I was completely wrong. It  was and felt like a local bar that happened to serve unique burgers. If it were in my neighborhood, I would probably visit every other week.

For the food, I created my own burger. Angus Beef (Medium Rare) on a Sesame Bun with Jalapeno Bacon, Provolone Cheese, Prosciutto, and Foie Gras on the side. The beef was cooked exactly how I wanted and the Jalapeno Bacon added that needed "kick" without being overpowering. However, that "kick" may have numbed my taste buds to the Prosciutto and Foie Gras because I was unable to taste them. Go figure. Anyway, I washed down my meal with a Coney Island Beer. It complimented the burger well.

I definitely plan on going back and making another unique burger.
author: Jesson d.

description: Bad customer service. Hostess forgot about us had to wait 20 extra minutes to get table
author: Richard S.

description:
it took us 15 minutes waiting to be seated and about 5 minutes to get a waiter and 20 minutes to get our orders. My order came without some stuff I ordered and they had to bring it later. The food is just ok the prices are high the service is not good at all. each table has a small TV screen that is mute and you can't change the channel so some lucky people were watching baseball while we were watching a silly sitcom. It was out first and last time
I gave them 2 stars for their milkshakes
author: Medo N.

description:
Good Burgers. Drinks are kind of pricey and they small handful of fries left me kinda sad. But overall an ok place with a great view of union square.

Oh ya they take FOREVER to get you a drink, so order your 2nd before you're done with your first.
author: Spenser G.

description:
Medium-rare burger with avocado and fried egg on a whole wheat bun.

Add in a beer (Pyramid), Irish Coffee milkshake, fried zucchini sticks and only a 10-minute wait on a Friday night at 7.

Result: perfection.
author: Tori S.

description: They didn't bring our food for 45 minutes after ordering and part of order was missing when it arrived. Food was ok and service was mediocre. Would recommend if you  have nothing better to do.
author: Linda J.

description: Never going back to this location EVER . not only did they charge my brother the wrong amount for his meal , but they charged him twice. lucky enough I checked my account and they did the same thing to me. apparently this is something normally happens at this location so the general manager could care less. Sanchez then said he would call security because we were telling other guests about the horrible service they gave us. worst experience ever , never going back.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
My family and I were having a festive night in the city and thought eating at the Burger Bar would be the perfect location to have a good burger and beautiful view of the Christmas tree and the ice skaters in Union Square. It was a beautiful view but that was about it.

4 out of 6 of us got VERY SICK after eating there, the food was not good, extremely greasy, we were over charged, waited an hour for our food, were told they did not have enough menus for each of us, were told they did not have enough silverware, had to ask 4 different people for silverware, charged for a substitute when we were told there would be no charge, there was an extra $5 added on to our bill we had no idea what it was for, the service was terrible, and way overpriced

I have never written a Yelp review but my experience was so awful I felt I had to warn others.
author: Laurin R.

description:
"Do I want to eat near this tourist trap?" "WHAT?!?" "Like...NO." 
Don't even try to drag me to the restaurants around Union Square, I kept saying.

So I said "Fine, we can have a drink at the Cheesecake Factory (their food is not designed for humans to eat, but their drinks may be) which is something I have wanted to do for a long time just to get the view...

He kept saying how great this Burger Bar is. I had heard about it before. I didn't even want a burger! In fact, I thought it was at the basement of Macy's mixed with Boudin and the other places in there...the ice cream place...the dumpster smell...

But no! Are you kidding me?! We walk to the top floor and this place is a club almost! This place is packed! This is where everyone went to after Union Square. We can't even get a table. So we go lounge around the bar, then sit at the bar and get full service. The beers were the most precise selection. I think they had 3 of my favorites: Stella, Hooegarden, Blue Moon. The f, this is better than some random bar selection!

I got a salmon burger. Oh, damn, it was a really good burger! It was so good I didn't even talk for the next 15 minutes while I ate it (I didn't really time it, by the way). I mean, it was unbelievably good! I don't know if this is a chain (I would think so), or what it is, but they are doing things right! 

As busy as they were, the waiter had time to laugh about my stupid jokes.

I. Like.
author: Alexia R.

description: Went here with my partner for a late lunch during our shopping trip into the city.  The worst service!  We wanted to spend more money but with no server around we could not.  I called the following day to tell the manager he just seemed annoyed with the phone call.  The food was good, the view great but we will never go back!!! Save yourself and don't ever go!
author: Mark K.

description: Had the Kobe beef burger. It was juicy but I felt like it feel into pieces on me. Solid burger.
author: Logan N.

description:
After reading some of the reviews about the poor service, we were reluctant to try the Burger Bar. We were very pleasantly surprised.  We went on a very busy Friday night during the holidays and were told the wait would be 50-60
 minutes.  After 30 minutes they called my cell to tell us our table was ready.
We sat down and the server was at our table within minutes.  Service was great the entire night.
All of our burgers were good, with the buffalo burger topping the list.  All three of our burgers were cooked exactly like we ordered them and each came with a very generous portion of fries.  
The beer selection is great!  (We were really happy to find Firestone Union Jack IPA.)  Some of the menu items are expensive, as one of the burgers is $22.  However, we had 3 burgers and 3 drinks  and the total was a bit over $60.  Not bad!!
Our family will be back!
author: Kelli B.

description:
I just ate here for the first time.  I didn't even notice the elevator across from the cheesecake factory elevator until this visit!

It was a fun time but I think the burgers are overrated and the food, although good was just average restaurant food.  It is also very filling.  I couldn't hardly stand up after. What I would have liked to of had room for was the alcoholic milkshakes.  Yes, you heard correctly.  Everyone around me that had one looked like they were in heaven and I was feeling pretty jealous.  That's the only reason I'd come back though.
author: Britt B.

description:
Finally came to try this place for lunch.  On a Saturday at 1:30, it was only a 15 minute wait.  Not bad at all.  We got to sit in the bar area, which was really nice as we got to see the blue sky and Union Square right outside.

The menu consists of burgers, sandwiches, and milkshakes so if you're not into these, this is not the place for you.  Although I was tempted to try the buffalo burger, I decided to go with just a regular beef burger instead to really see if the plain burger tasted good.  Since I had just recently watched an "Oprah" episode about being conscience about where our food/meat comes from, I opted for the Country Natural beef burger, which comes from a family owned ranch AKA sustainable ranching.  Ordered it medium with a wheat bun and extra Swiss cheese and Fat Fries.  So many extra toppings to choose from that you can pretty much customize it to your liking.  I couldn't believe they charge for homemade dijon mustard too!  My husband ordered his burger with a side of onion rings.  

Food took awhile, but it was worth the wait.  I ate very slowly to prevent myself from getting full too quickly :). The Fat Fries were definitely fat, but it didn't taste as greasy as some other places.  The onion rings were the best I've had so it's a must try!! 

It was cool to see Hubert Keller just walking around and greeting people.  Service was friendly and prompt.  Everyone around us also seemed to be newbies to the place and they all seemed to enjoy their burgers as well.  

Better than the Counter, but my favorite burger is still at Serpentine.
author: Erica S.

description:
I went to Burger Bar at the recommendation of a family friend who goes into the city all the time. I had never even heard of it despite there being a ton of hype. It's located IN Macy's so keep that in mind if you're going there for the first time. 

Upon walking in, we were snapped at by the 2 gals up front when we asked about reservations. Did not appreciate the attitude. Our server made up for the girls rude behavior however. He was really nice and tried his best to always pay attention to our needs. He gave us updates on how long our food would be, which made me like him even more.

The menu offers thick or thin fries which I really appreciated considering I like thick fries and my dining companion likes thin fries. I got the Kobe beef burger with pesto and carmelized onions. It was cooked medium well like I had asked and was pretty good. I couldn't eat the whole thing it was so big. My friend got a buffalo burger per our servers suggestion. He said it was just okay, not as great as it was made out to be. It was pretty crowded when we went, even for being lunchtime. 

The reason I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 4 is because while I enjoyed the food, it was not the best burger I've ever had in my entire life. I've had much better burgers at WAY cheaper prices. I know it came with customized toppings but that doesn't matter much to me. I don't want to drop 40 bucks on an average burger.
author: Courtney J.

description:
Sitting atop of Macy's, outshined by The Cheesecake Factory, is the Burger Bar. First, the elevator takes forever to get atop at. Trick: if the direct elevator is taking too long, take the store elevators or escalators to Level 4 and just make your way around. I love how it's snuck in a cozy corner in Macy's. Seems fitting. 
The young hostess when I walked in was friendly. Table for two please. I was meeting a girlfriend. She asked me where would I prefer to sit. I chose a booth in the back, the personal mini televisions were turned onto Sports. Baseball was on. She even asked what my girlfriend's name was and mine, so she could escort her when she came in. Good Maitre' D. 
The waitress was calm. Polite. Calamari was surprisingly fresh! I will definitely get that again. The Happy Hour drink for fall is sweet, crisp. Recommend that as well. Good happy hour liquor. We split the Hubert Keller Burger. Meat was juicy. Definite tastes. The red wine shallot sauce on the side was a good add on. The curly fries are good. 
Come here if you're in the Union Square and need a quiet, quick, simple, happy hour where you can have your own personal tv to watch the game!
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
I came here because Cheesecake Factory was packed, otherwise I normally would not have ventured in.
