That being said I was amazed by the selection of burgers! Actually not really, because they're supposed to for a burger bar and I've had better tasting burgers elsewhere. Still, we got the Burger Sliders, an assortment of fries, and the Salmon Burger. I didn't like the Salmon Burger, sometimes things aren't meant to be switched around like that. My sliders were cute and okay, but a little on the dry side. The buffalo burger looked tempting, but I've had real fresh buffalo (read: buffalo steaks at a buffalo farm in Wyoming), so I didn't want to try it here. 

Can't comment on the setting/view, since we sat right at the bar. Mmmmm beer. If I was rating this place on drink speed I would give a 4 for the quickness. Drinks-wise I've had better. What's up with all the old Vegas-themed drinks though?
author: Jean L.

description:
I know everyone complains about the price of this place, especially for burgers. Yes, I did too.  BUT, to be fair, you can't walk into a designer burger place in Union Square on top of Macy's owned by Hubert Keller and then dock stars simply because the burgers are $20.  In reality, it really isn't that different from Carls Jr. charging $8 for their fancy burgers either, I mean...it's Carls Jr.  So with that said, yes they have $20 burger, they even have a $40 burger,  it just all depends on how fancy the one you order is.  I mean I ordered the buffalo sliders, which comes with fries and it was only $12.

Ok, on to the food.  They burgers are good but it didn't blow me away good.  I have definitely had better at small local burger joints.  I read a few reviews here raving about the sweet potato fries and all I can say is, yalls are trippin.  My husband got regular fries and they are so much better, it fits with the burger meal.  The sweet potato fries are just too sweet for the burger so it doesn't compliment well, and it isn't crispy (insert sad face).  However, the shakes they have are to die for.  We got the twinkies shake and it has chunks of twinkies in there and half of one as a garnish.  It was SO good, taste just as you would expect. 

The service is very mediocre and slow.  The wait staff seemed over work as it was a full house and I only saw the same 2 -3 waiters, so of course we didn't get much love and had to wait a while to get anything we needed. 

Will I be back again? Prob not.
author: Krystal C.

description:
Great burgers but when my companion and I each ordered a burger and asked to have them cut in half so we could trade halves, the waiter informed us there is a $2 charge to cut burgers in half, and wouldn't budge even though we both got burgers.

The burgers also were not impressively large.  It's not normal for me to finish a restaurant burger because of their size, but I finished this one easily.

The "beer battered zucchini" was obviously previously frozen and tasted like it, but the fries were tasty.

The waiter was a little creepy and seemed to be either on or recovering from some itchy drug.

The view is beautiful and the best part of the experience.  I would go so far as to think about eating elsewhere if I couldn't get a window seat.
author: Lauren J.

description: Let me start by saying we came about 30 mins before it closed so that may have had an impact on why the food was so mediocre. I ordered the basic cheeseburger. My bread was dry and hard and the meat was bland. The curly fries were probably the best thing on the plate. I wouldnt waste my time going here again.
author: Krystal P.

description: Meh, just a burger....an expensive burger.  Nothing worthy.
author: Mars Y.

description:
Fancy schmancy burgers are a weird concept, but it's won me over.

Okay, so I wasn't brave enough (..err... ballin' enough?) to order the $60 foie gras + truffle + American kobe burger, but I at least shelled out for the American kobe burger and added some bleu cheese, caramelized onions, and aioli mayo. The burger was nice and juicy, and the toppings I chose worked very well with the flavor of the meat. The only thing though, from personal experience, is that I'm not sure if I would've been just as satisfied with their [cheaper] Angus burger, because it's very difficult to differentiate high quality meat from a mediocre one in ground form. I have had really great burgers for about half the price, so I'll really have to try the $60 burger some time to see if this place deserves all 5 stars.

Beer selection and a fully stocked bar makes the long wait painless!
author: Kazu O.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco and was craving a burger. I thought I couldn't lose with a place called Burger Bar, but I was wrong!

I choose a simple build-your-own burger with natural beef, bacon, and cheddar cheese. The beef was beyond dry although I ordered medium rare. The bacon was way too salty and the cheese was tasteless. I was disappointed with the minimum flavor and maximum price. As a side, I chose the french fries which could have easily come from a McDonald's deep frier. There was absolutely nothing unique about them, or this meal for that matter, especially considering that Burger Bar seems to be marketing to an audience who appreciates details.

Even though I was SO HUNGRY when I ate this meal, I was left unsatisfied. If you are looking for a gourmet burger, you won't find it here.
author: Anna P.

description:
A place that has BURGER in their title should really push out some better burgers.  Granted, I got a turkey burger and my friend got a veggie burger, but it is possible for these to be tasty!  I mean, really...Red Robin makes a way better turkey burger than Burger Bar does.  My turkey burger was DRY.  The only saving grace was the chipotle aioli (which was good) and the avocado that I had also added.  

My build-your-own-burger ended up being almost $18.  For $18, that burger better make me sing, but instead, I found myself choking down a dried out mess just because I paid so much for it and didn't want to waste my money.
author: Jen M.

description:
I am a big fan of burger and this place is a total disaster. 

For a burger that costs $20+, you will expect it to be amazing! But you don't get that here. I am surprised that anyone will give this place more than 3 stars. The service is okay, but I thought waiter/waitress could dress more properly. For the price you are paying, you will expect them to be more professional. 

The food was hard to swallow because it just doesn't taste good. The bun is hard and dry. The beef was way way way to thick. The fries here are equivalent to fast food's quality (try the fries, if you don't believe me).

The lobster that came with the surf & turf burger is about the size of two shrimps, and yet it costs $12 more than a regular burger. 

The waitress that served us even handed wrong changes to us. And yes, I will not be back again :)
author: Amy Y.

description:
The San Francisco Burger Blog has been to Burger Bar:

http://sanfranciscoburgerblog.tumblr.com/

I have no idea why somebody would suggest the burgers here are too small, because it's a 1/2 lb. patty as the standard. Wanting more than that from just a burger sounds like somebody won't be happy until you top the thing with a boneless fried chicken breast or fried egg or foie gras - and they offer the last two! 

Everybody from the blog enjoyed their burger, but this joint is gonna require more coin than the average burger. There's a full review available at the link above (if you're interested).
author: Drew H.

description:
First. The location is in the heart of San Francisco (Union Square). The tables near the window gives you a spectacular view of union square and the city. 

Second. The burgers are delicious. They look kinda huge, but once you bite, you engage in the delicious taste. I personally like two burgers. I usually take the peppercorn burger which is so delicious with the exceptional herbs used in it. And I add portabello mushrooms on top, to give a better taste. My second favorite, which is so pricy also, the $60 Rossini Burger. It has a piece of truffle on top of the burger. SO DELICIOUS and a MUST. 

The milkshakes are amazing too.
author: Talal A.

description:
The Burger Bar reminds me of The Counter but not as good, have smaller portions, and is more expensive. I was expecting more out of the place since there has been so much hype about it due to it being Hubert's restaurant. I possibly would have had a better experience if I didn't have any expectations going in.

It gets fairly crowded on weekends since it's located on the 6th floor of Macy's in Union Square. I'm guessing many of their customers are hungry shoppers dropping in for a meal. The service is a bit slow and the food isn't quite worth the price. The average price of a specialty burger is $20. If you want to build your own burger, it costs about $8-9 for just the meat. All the add-ons are charged separately so the cost of the burger ends up being close to $12-15 ($0.75-$0.95 for a piece of cheese, about $1 for grilled vegetables, $1-$2 for sauces, etc.). If you want fries or a side salad, that's an extra $2-4. The burgers at The Counter are typically $9-$11 but the price of the burger already includes the toppings and sauces.  The portions are bigger at The Counter too.     

Review of what we ordered:

Marinated Chicken Breast with Whole Wheat Bun - $9.25
+pineapple $0.95 + side salad $2.50
-Chicken was somewhat dry and oily. The side salad is a typical mixed greens salad. The bun was possibly my favorite part because it was toasted just right. 
 
Marinated Chicken Breast with Whole Wheat Bun - $9.25
+ avocado $1.55 + sweet potato fries $3.35
-Sweet potato fries were good and not too oily. However, The Counter's sweet potato fries are definitely better...better tasting + bigger portions. 

We wanted to order dessert but most of the desserts were $9-$12 milkshakes so we decided to pass. 

Overall, very mediocre and doesn't live up to all the hype.
author: Angela F.

description:
I heard from a bunch of people that I should check this place out. I went with a few friends, and wasn't all that impressed. In fact, I was a little disappointed. Let's start from the beginning.

We walked in, and received a warm and welcome greeting. Excellent point for that. I always like that. But then it kinda went downhill after that. Our waiter was really nice, and was cute too. It's always nice to have a cute face to stare at when at a restaurant. :)

But after that, it was a little upsetting. :(

The menu was pretty limited, and even when I ordered a custom burger, I wasn't satisfied. The meat patty was a small ball that wasn't cooked very well, the toppings were just kinda thrown about in an odd way, and it was (for the most part) dry as can be. Blech. 

Aside from that, they forgot one of our side orders and it took forever to flag down someone so we could get it. And the waiter left for a moment, and then disappeared for about 30 minutes. He went on a lunch break, and kinda forgot to tell us. 

Overall, it was a pricey experience that didn't equal out...i.e., we didn't get what we paid for. I tried it once, but I won't be going back again.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Great place to have a burger and fries. Today was beautiful in the city and the views here are spectacular. Overlooks Union Square. Our service was good. The burgers are usually cooked any way except well. However, I recommend the Kobe burger. Good quality. There are several options of fries so this would please even the most finicky eater. We headed to china town to burn off the calories.
author: Monica G.

description:
The first thing i will say is, I am never going to this place again.

First of all, the prices are beyond ridiculous. The bill came out to 60 bucks for two people. Being someone who used to live in the area I know of a couple of places that offer better tasting burgers and offer buffalo lean meat for way cheaper.

Secondly, the burgers sucked. They didn't taste like any special burger, although I did only have the bacon, cheese burger still, Pearls burgers on Post is beyond better and cheaper than this place. 

lastly, the service was horrible. It took forever for us to get greeted by our waiter. he didn't even really greet us, he just gave us our menus and walked away. The service was bad the whole time we were there and the place wasn't even packed.

NEVER EVER AGAIN.
author: Victoria G.

description:
I was here last weekend with my girlfriends before shopping.  I had already ate, but decided I'd get drinks with them while they ate.

The service here is some of the most atrocious I've ever experienced.  We had to wait 20 min just to get our drinks.  This was very confusing to me because we were sat right away without a wait.  We would only see our server once every 15/20 minutes.  When they finally brought the food out they had forgotten half the order-

Bottle off beer with no way to open it.  My friends finally went to the bar herself.
Friend pickles/onion rings no dip, even though it said it came with it.  Asked for it again, never came.  Three burgers came, but they somehow forgot the three orders of fries.  It wasn't a pretty sight.  We complained and they gave us 20% off the bill.  

Maybe the place was suffering from bad management.  They seemed to have been staffed pretty well and the cooks knew what they were doing(decent food).  I hope this place gets it together soon.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Good Food, But Dangerous Exit Plan

Staying at the Westin St. Francis right across the street we (group of 3) saw the signs for Burger Bar and the Cheesecake Factory. We had planned on going to the Cheesecake but after stepping off the elevator into a tourist mob scene, we decided to try Burger Bar. We walked right in and were sat down immediately at a table with a great view of Union Square. 

The service was good, but our waitress could have used some help. She was the server for all of the tables in the bar area and had a guy shadowing her awkwardly and not doing much of anything to help. That being said it took a little longer to get help, but we were in no rush. She gave great suggestions on the burgers and was knowledgeable about the beers on tap. 

We ordered a pitched of Magic Hat #9 (I highly suggest it as well)  and I ordered the "Le Frog" Burger with sweet potato fries. My girlfriend and her dad had some buffalo burger with a red wine reduction and caramelized onions that they were raving about. We were very satisfied with the food and when it was time for desert the milkshakes sounded too good to pass up. We ordered a half vanilla and half chocolate shake and it was to die for. They come with huge straws to make for easy drinking of the thick and tasty shake. 

Now this is where things went south, Like I said earlier the waitress had no real help for all the tables in the bar area. So we finished our shakes and sat there for what felt like an eternity waiting for her to come back and check on us or bring the check by. We had to stop her before she went to help another table because she would look at us otherwise. So once we finally got the bill we got up to leave and noticed a line for the elevator backed up into the bar. We thought no biggie we will just take the escalator.. but it wasn't possible, Macy's had closed and the only way out  was via the elevator. But of course with the cheesecake factory above every elevator coming down was full of people already.  BTW the max occupancy was 10 people on the elevator and every one was packed with almost 15. Crazy!

We asked the Hostesses if there was another way out and they told us that there were stairs but that using them would set off the fire alarm. We demanded to speak to the manager and when the Hostess told him we wanted to talk to him he told her there is nothing I can do and didn't even make an effort to apologize to us. 

I doubt it is the first time that this has happened, but it should be dealt with. I am sure the Fire Marshall would not be okay with this. I know I wasn't. 

Anyway go before Macy's closes and you will have a great meal and experience. After Macy's closes Burger Bar is for the birds.
author: Cody F.

description:
We were walking around Macy's and decided to stop here for a drink to watch the Niners/New Orleans game. We walked in just at the right time because the Niners started to score. For everyone who saw it, it was the most exciting game and the last 4 minutes was just knuckle clenching. Anyways, we ordered beers at the bar and managed to get a seat there too. They had Lindemann's Framboise on tap, so I started with that. When the seat opened up, we ordered a kobe burger. It was so juicy and delicious with more beer. I asked the bartender about one on tap and he let me taste it. He told me it was stella on steroids, but it wasn't for me. I ended up getting the Kirin instead. 

The wings that someone ordered next to me smelled absolutely delicious and my mouth started to water. Unfortunately I did not get those since dinner was coming soon. The view is pretty awesome here. If you get a booth in the back, you get your own tv. It's an awesome idea, but I'm sure your neck is cramped by the end.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Tried this place for first time last weekend.  Had great seating next to the window overlooking union square.  It was fun to people watch from that height :)

Didn't realize this was an Hubert Keller (of Fleur De Lys fame) joint.  Enjoyed everything about it.  Server was very friendly and helpful.  Grilled shrimp salad was yummy and it was fun to get the sliders and get to try out 3 different style burgers.

Will definitely be returning to try some of the other yummy looking burgers.
author: Lev E.

description: Burgers were good and beers cold and delicious.  The views are outstanding overlooking the San Francisco skyline.  I would definitely recommend this spot for a nice relaxing lunch
author: Craig M.

description: I had been craving the "Burger Bar" experience since I ate at the one in Mandalay Bay in Vegas.  This definitely did not measure up.  Service was "so-so" (we kept having to look for her and ask people walking by to get her).  Food was "okay", nothing spectacular.  Atmosphere was comfortable.  I probably wouldn't come to this location again. For that price, I would rather wait til I go back to Vegas.
author: Tina E.

description:
Came out here with my girl and my sister. We were seated next to the window that overlooked Union Square, which was awesome!

I ordered the American Kobe Beef w/zucchini fries and a side of ranch.  The burger was small, but yet very tasty! To top it off we had the banana split, which put us in a food coma... Thanks to our waiter, Eric! Five stars from food to service...
author: Jeffrey N.

description:
This place is good.  Don't get me wrong..But its wayyyy overpriced for what you get.  They charge for every single topping you add to your burger.  I understand charging for avacado, egg, cheese, etc..but for hot sauce, chipotle mayo, and dijon mustard? its just a little excessive.  Kobe burger was delish..and my friends said the buffalo burger was good too.  each burger came out to $23-$28, not including fries.  sweet potato fries were way too thin, you could hardly taste them..the thick fries were definitely a better choice...service was really good, and the view is amazing, but that goes without saying..

overall its a good place to go for the experience, but i still think i'd rather go to super duper and spend about $10 for a burger and fries, and not have to deal with parking in union square..
author: Gary H.

description:
decent food, but for the prices I dont think Id be coming back any time soon.

Service was pretty sub-par as if they forgot the customer is always right (and I didnt have any issues- just felt like they were stressed out and not accommodating.) The salmon was great, Kobe is great but its not $18.00 for a 1/3 lb burger great... 

try the onion rings and curly fries..

oh one good thing-- alcoholic milkshakes!!
author: Milt I.

description:
So I came back a second time just to see if it would be better. First time the service was unacceptable. I didn't get silverware so at first I felt ok with being a tree hugger. Slowly I started to feel too eco-friendly and asked for a table cloth and silverware. Fast forward to today.  I ordered something different - the Kobe burger with my usual "healthy" additions of swiss cheese, bacon, and avacado.  The server asked me how I wanted it cook and I said, "medium rare." After eating 1/4 of it, I was upset about how it was more well done!  I told the server, but first asking for his feedback as I showed him the missing redness from my burger. He apologized and brought it back. My family witnessed this mess. I mean it's a $24 burger at Burger Bar...get it right!  

2nd burger comes out and I eat half of it to feel the same discomfort because it was well done again or close to it. I have the server look at it again after he asks me how's my burger. At this point, I'm over it and just deal, but the server was embarrassed and took it back to the kitchen and told his manager about it. 3rd burger is better, but I usually get more blood/redness at other restaurants. The manager and server repeatedly apologized for the previous attempts and offered a free dessert. We get the most expensive one - banana split with the works!  

I really respect Chef Hubert Keller, but I am sure he would fire the chef that prepared my order 3 times! Thank goodness my brothers kinda helped me finish my 3rd burger because we don't like to waste food. So 10lbs later, I was not happy that it took so many attempts for this place to get my order right. I think I'm done with Burger Bar. I'll leave it for the tourists and those who love their burgers cooked well done. I gave it 2 stars only because server Eric was nice despite the issues.
author: Chad A.

description:
My first visit was amazing! I could not wait to go back. Best salmon burger I had ever had. It was a perfect center cut and delicious.

I went back on 5/7/12 for lunch.  Our server was pretty much absent, couldn't get our orders right, and didn't seem to care when we pointed out that our orders were wrong. She literally shrugged her shoulders and mumbled something that we didn't understand.

The salmon burger was terrible.  It was some odd, pieced together scraps of the blood line parts of the salmon. Because it wasn't actually one cut of salmon, but about three pieced together, all of the salmon fell out on my first bite.  Which is how I noticed all of the dark meat/blood lines, so I guess it was to my advantage that it fell apart.   I then had the luxury of separating the edible parts of the salmon from the inedible parts at the dining table.

My sister had the beef burger and said it was nothing special.  The fries were great.

The craziest part of the experience is that we actually saw Hubert Keller as we were leaving! The day the owner is there and the service and kitchen were seriously lacking.  I probably won't go back.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I recommend the $60 Burger: Rossini - Kobe Beef, Sauteed Foie Gras, Shaved Truffles, on an Onion Bun. So Good!!

For dessert, the Nutella Burger is awesome!

When it comes to beverages, the Mint Chocolate Chips Alcoholic Milkshake and the Beer Float Paddle are my favorites!

If I want burgers, I go to Burger Bar.
author: Mariel F.

description:
Don't bother. Sliders were very dry, fries were cold and the service was abysmal. 

The build your own burger menu, celebrity chef owner and ambiance made me think this would be a great experience. Not so much. It took the server 10 minutes to come to our table. The food came out quickly, but they didn't bring a sauce we ordered. It took a few minutes to flag our server down to ask her to bring it. She was not very sharp, noticeable at every interaction. She had a hard time separating our check for payment - we had to ask for change for the person who paid cash. The change was $5 and instead of giving us 5 x $1 so we could tip her, she handed us a $5 bill. Duh! 

My friend had a Cobb salad. She said it was good.
author: Brooke L.

description:
Like alot of carnivores, I like a good hamburger.  As a matter of fact, after dating a "gourmet" hamburger addict, I've become rather an expert on all things hamburger.   That said, when my daughter suggested we have our post Black Friday Shopping Expedition dinner at the Burger Bar, I was sooooo "in".    

Imagine my huge disappointment when my "Kobe" burger arrived way, way, way over cooked.  It looked more like a charbroiled hockey puck than a top-of-the-line hamburger. It was so dry and overdone I sent it back...in spite of a lifelong pledge to never, ever return food.  So, the sweet waitress acknowledged the meat was over done and returned it to the kitchen...they quickly sent out another burger...only slightly less over cooked.  

I suppose I should back up to clarify that I had asked the waitress how her chef defined as burger with a "sliver of pink"...medium or medium well.  She said the kitchen had a tendency to UNDER cook their meat, so she recommended medium well.   Now, one would think when I sent it back, the chef would rethink the original order and go for medium...e.g., that sliver of pink.  At any rate, beyond being over done, the burger really had no flair.  It didn't taste like the kobe steaks I've had in the past....quite honestly, it tasted like a plain, ol', regular, not overly flavorful hamburger.  Not to mention, with all of the rework that was done to the burger, my bun was dry...dry...dry.  

Not to mention, one of the managers stopped by to ask how we were enjoying dinner...I told him about the over cooked burger and he mumbled something about the kitchen having a tendency to under cook and walked away!?   

My daughter said her burger was nicely done...

Oh, well.  Either I got a sous chef who was overworked and tired, or this place really isn't the hamburger heaven so many people say it is.  Let's hope its the latter, but quite honestly, I was not impressed enough to go back/give it another try.
author: Marie B.

description:
Great idea here, however, during our visit things didn't meet the expectations I had for chef Keller.  I asked the hostess when she seated us if the chef was working and she told me he was out of town.  Bummer.

The good:
- great concept, views, milkshakes
- lots of build your own burger options
- friendly server

The mediocre:
- burgers ordered medium rare, delivered a shade less than well. This is such a basic expectation especially from a celebrated chef.
- luke warm fries and onion rings.
 
It's better than Red Robin but not by a whole lot.  I would give chef Keller another try though. Hopefully it'll be better next time.
author: Marcus M.

description: great spot! we snagged a window seat and got to watch the folks down below at the park... i love that you can make your own burger... and that i did!.  it can get pretty pricey that way tho... but worth the experience if its your first time dining. next time i definitely must try the shakes!!
author: Gina M.

description:
Visiting San Francisco is always a treat. (Kind of like how rice-a-roni is a sf treat.) I love trying out new places to eat and revisiting old places to eat good food. (see Swan Oyster Depot)

How we ended up at the Burger Bar on the 6th floor of Macy's is still a mystery but it could have been a combination of eating breakfast at the Daily Grill (don't) but we needed Bloody Mary's and beers stat and then the subsequent walking around the city until the Levi's store opened at 11am on Sundays. (c'mon! people need to shop before 11am!)

Whatever the case, we sat at the bar. I think the other reviews refer to the great view--I guess it's cool if you like overlooking the square--we were watching PX90 commercials and old hockey footage at the bar. The beer selection seemed good. I had the lambic, which I get wherever I find it on draught and there were a full side of the menu that listed all the beers they have.

The service was slow, we weren't asked if we wanted anything until we were there for about 15 minutes...at the bar...on a slow rainy afternoon...
We ordered wings, the American Classic for me and Peppercorn Burger for HungryD. 

1. The wings were good. I asked for them dry. I know. I know. HungryD likes his smothered in the sauce too but I personally like them cooked and then dipped, by me, in accompanying sauces. I just do. I think it makes for a better wing experience. This way the wing stays crispy and the sauce stays kinda cold and gives it a nice dippy taste. Shrug. The wings came out steaming (yum!) and the hot sauce was tangy and good.

2. Subsequently about 2 seconds after our appetizers came out. (Yes, I said 2 SECONDS), they brought us our burgers. I saw the bartender give the runner a look that said, "OH HECK, but i JUST brought out their appies...what should..I...uh..." Well, the runner made the executive decision to bring us our burgers anyways. Eh, I didn't really mind, although it would have been nice to at least have a moment or two alone with the wings so I could give them the mouth time they deserved.

3. Fries were cold. gross. It came out in mini-fry baskets...they were the thin kind and they were cold. UGH. that's all I can say. 

4. The burger was okay. There was lots of meat that tasted good. The bacon that came with it was kinda crispish and the lettuce/tomato looked the way they were supposed to and you get a pickle spear. Not bad but not worth the $15 it cost for me to eat it. HungryD's burger? $17ish or so and he didn't look so impressed either. I guess we could have just shared the kobe/foie gras burger they have for $80 and at least had bragging rights or some sort of cool story to tell. Nope, just some cold fries and a pretty mediocre experience.

So...overall?

I guess if you're there for the view and you like the novelty of eating in a department store, this might be the place for you. I just realized that after paying the bill, I would rather stand in line at the airport and get a McD's Cheeseburger combo with hot fries right out of the fryer in a red recyclable container and buy $70 of booze instead. I'm just saying.
author: jina y.

description:
If you're in the city early for a game, come here instead of going to one of those abundant and unoriginal bars close to AT&T park.  You know, the noisy overcrowded places packed wall to wall with wanna-bes.  Why not sit down leisurely and get a beer with a delicious burger by Hubert Keller instead?
Conveniently situated inside Macy's at Union Square, it was not crowded at all when we arrived. To be fair, it was the middle of a late Wednesday afternoon.  You get a beautiful view of Union Square nonetheless.
Our waiter was very helpful in our selection of beers and burgers.
Got the "le frog" burger cooked medium and american classic cooked medium rare on the chefs menu.  Juicy and flavorful.  So good, that I will try to recreate at home.  Can substitute skinny fries with any of the other fries on the menu, but will have to pay the difference.  Not a big deal.
Skip the bars. Eating here is far more relaxing.
author: Janine L.

description:
Hubert Keller's burger doesn't pass the bar.

Of course, the gourmet chef's establishment is a mecca of ground beef.  Burger Bar offers diners numerous choices, including organic, free range, buffalo, vegetarian, as well as many other forms of burgers.  Diners can choose from a list of Chef's Selections or create their own monstrosity a la carte.

However, this plethora of selections comes with a stiff price tag.  From a Country Natural Burger for a mere $10.50 to a Kobe Beef Burger for more than $60, Hubert reaches deep into diners' wallets.  To add insult to injury, the ever-shrewd business man has the gall to charge for "extras" like tomato, lettuce,and mustard that should be included.

If diners are paying dearly for their burgers, they are entitled to good service, right?  Not so at Burger Bar. While there were numerous, friendly young servers clad in black pants and white shirts running around, the wait for drinks was nearly 20 minutes and delivery of food took even longer, indicating serious "production" problems in the back of the house.

Well, at least patrons can relax while getting their pockets picked, right?  No, not at Burger Bar.  Far from being an calm oasis in the melée of shopping crazed Union Square, the brightly lit and noisy dining room is not conducive to a relaxed dinner.  With an atmosphere reminiscent of an upscale Wendy's, Hubert's business plan obviously relies on volume rather than quality.

If you are looking for a really good burger, there are far better (and less expensive) establishments in The City.  Take a pass on Hubert's Burger Bar.
author: CJ G.

description:
The wait for The Cheesecake Factory was too long, so two friends and I decided to head to the Burger Bar instead. It wasn't crowded at all when we got there, even though it was a Saturday night, so the wait time and service wasn't a problem at all.

The burgers are pricey, but you get what you pay for. I started my meal off with a beer (why wouldn't I?) and fish and chips which were perfection. I ordered the sliders because I didn't think I could couple my appetizer with a full burger. I really enjoyed the three different types of meat, but I'm going to be honest and say that I couldn't tell them apart. My friend ordered the Hubert Keller burger and he really enjoyed that as well.

Here comes the meat (oh hardy har har) of the story: our other friend decided that "The World's Hottest Hamburger" couldn't possibly that hot, and one bite into it he started turning red. Our waitress who was walking by immediately went and got him a cup of milk... and another. And another. Let's just say they weren't joking with the peppers. A tip for anyone thinking about attempting this burger: scrape off as much sauce as you can because it 1. burns 2. numbs 3. throbs. 

I had a really good time laughing at my friend while enjoying my food. It wasn't too oily as far as fried food and burgers go, so I'm happy. Service was excellent and knew when to refill our beer!
author: Katie M.

description:
We stopped by here while out shopping and needed some hearty grub to keep us going.  They have a pretty good selection of beers, and I was happy to see that my favorite, PranQster, was on tap.   

My fellow diner got the slider trio, and they were really tasty, but they forgot the extra bacon she ordered and then brought it out on a plate for her.  It was a little odd to see to sad little pieces of bacon all by themselves brought to our table.  

I got the Country Natural burger with prosciutto, provolone, and carmelized onions.  It was cooked perfectly and really delicious!  I wouldn't eat this burger regularly, though, because it was a big hit to my wallet, but in this case it was totally worth it. 

Overall, the service was friendly and helpful, but a little slow.  

Bottom line: Not my choice for a daily burger fix because of the price, but I'd come back.
author: Kellie T.

description:
CONS: 
Was craving so badly for a juicy burger...but was disappointed in my Kobe Beef burger $16.50. It was made medium-well and was SO DRY. I was very bummed.
The add-ons were a must (bacon & cheese), also an add'l $.
Aoli sauce (another add-on $) but it looked and tasted like normal mayo. Blahhh. 
1 stall bathrooms.

PROS: 
Fries, onion rings, and sweet potatoes fries were alright. Nothing special that I couldn't get from somewhere else.  
Milkshakes are yummy but be prepared to pay $7-10.   
Nice View of Union Square.
author: Oanh N.

description: Dissapointing.  The lack of response is further testimony of poor service.  Judging from other reviews service seems to be an ongoing issue....interesting.  Considering that one burger can cost upwards of 22 dollars, one would expect the highest level of customer service.  I have no doubt that this location makes enough off of tourism alone to stay open, but your options and premise suggest so much more.  I would still love to try your product.
author: Durwood F.

description: Good atmosphere, great service, food, and location. Would definitely recommend and suggest their sweet potato fries :)
author: Daniela O.

description: Great burgers, good menu, nice view of Union Sq. However, two of us asked for sides of Dijon mustard, since they only have yellow hot dog mustard on the table, and they charged us $4 bucks each! In & Out Burger, along with virtually any other eating establishment  will provide it free on request. I mean his cheap can you get? Nor do they offer cylindrically sliced pickles that can be put on a hamburger bun, only long sliced ones; good quality though. If not for the insult the food deserves 4-5 stars, prices notwithstanding.
author: Dr. B.

description:
I am a huge fan of Hubert Keller and I first heard about the Burger Bar in Vegas and when I found out they opened one in SF, it was definitely on the top of my list of places to try. 

I ordered the Atlantic Steak Salmon burger and a side of sweet potato fries. The salmon was cooked perfectly, a little over medium rare. I've often had really dry salmon in other restaurants but this burger was a winner. The was perfectly proportioned and was definitely satisfying that I only finished 1/3 of my fries.

The sweet potato fries were delicious and a must-try. I like how they are sliced thinly but each bite was savory and perfectly seasoned. 

The restaurant is located in the heart of downtown and we had a gorgeous view of the skyscrapers from where we sat. Friendly service and nice touristy lunch/dinner spot. Definitely recommended.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
I thought Burger Bar was a restaurant would only continue to help cultivate the budding crush that I had on Hubert Keller. A man who I had a crush on based on everything he created on Top Chef and his cooking shows....

But sadly, it did not.

I finally tried this place out, and honestly was just not impressed.  It had the uberly fancy burgers, but all in all. It just was meh.  Three tired gals who wanted a yummy comfort meal were left feeling just not the best..

- Black Jack Burger: Ordered this item, because it was a Chef Menu.  It wasn't bad. It was alright.  It just didn't wow me at all.
- Veggie Burger: I've done my fair share of veggie burgers, but the consistency of this item was really grainy and had a funky texture to it.  It was definitely not trying to be meat, but was in no way hiding the fact it was a veggie burger.
- Black Angus Burger w/ mushrooms and cheese: Again it was just mediocre
- Nutella milk shake: Swapped out the chocolate ice cream and this was good. The guy split it into 2 little baby milkshakes, so that was cute.

Service was good.  Great hostess. A little slow in the initial greeting with the server, but eventually he caught up.

This palce isn't bad.  But I just wouldn't make an extra trip to see it.  We were seated at the window and the view was gorgous. But still.  I still have a crush you on Hubert Keller.. just not of this restaurant.
author: Natalie G.

description: Good food & service. We had the hangover burger and a couple of IPA's. Can't be the view of Union Square.
author: Gabriel P.

description: Burger are pretty good! The dessert Nutella Burger is a must try! Great prices and nice atmosphere with friendly people. A bit small but accommodating.
author: Jay B.

description: Fantastic drinks : 'gold coast' and 'french kiss' !
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Stopped by the Burger Bar mostly out of convenience and a bit on reputation of the owner.  Good looking spot on the 6th Flr of the Macy's building on Union Square.  if you sit on the window you get o people watch without being in the elements. 

Solid if not great experience.  I had the Natural 
Burger with cheddar, bacon, and fried, egg on a sour dough roll.  Asked for AND received my burger medium rare.  Major props for that.  (nothing is more annoying then being given the choice of meat temp and not delivering).  Everything about the burger was right on and hit the mark,  The thick cut fries were crispy , hot, and seasoned well. 

The build you own shake is where I got let down.  I asked for a chocolate shake with a shot of Jameson's, chocolate coffee bean and whipped cream (I was think Irish Coffee-ish).  When the shake arrived, everything looked great but when I tasted it there was no hint of Jameson's to be found.  When I brought it to the bartenders attention he claimed he brought the booze back himself.  That might be the case but there definitely was not any booze in the shake.  For $13 i received a mediocre, overly rich, chocolate milk with no kick.

In the end the burger delivered on the goods, the shake did not, service was adequate and friendly but seemed dismissive to my complaint.  The lost a star on the shake and 1/2 a star on the service related to the shake.

I would come again but probably won't go out of my way to do so.
author: Rich T.

description:
I must agree with a lot of the other reviews so far on Yelp that Burger Bar is over-hyped and too expensive.  After reading about the launch of this restaurant and knowing that my fiance loves burgers, we were happy to have to run some errands in Union Square so we decided the stop by.

First never take the elevator within Macy's as it takes so long.  Once we got to Burger Bar we had to wait about two minutes to be seated but then we were all set.  The inside was nothing fancy at all but they did have great views.  We got a booth towards the inside of the place and I was happy as we went on a Sunday and football was playing which was a nice touch.  

We were excited to look at the menu and there were some good options on their but the prices were a little outlandish.  Of course it'd be worth it though we thought.  We each had a milkshake that was pretty good and then our burgers came out.

The burger was tasty but definitely not worth the price.  We ordered one of the special burgers and it was pretty annoying that we couldn't make any changes to it and it had to be made just their way.

It was worth it to say we've been but Pearle's is much better, cheaper and not as pretentious.
author: Blake B.

description: Great burgers, fries, & adult shakes!  You can share with a friend & be plenty full. Service was friendly & they did the best they could to keep up with the very busy afternoon.
author: Johna W.

description:
I never thought a place in Macys would be so good and not taste like it was "safe" for tourists! 
These Burgers are top notch, cooked to perfection and you can build your own with anything you want on it with any kind of bun! They also have various different fries and awesome sauces to go with your burger. 

Their dessert menu looked amazing even though I got one of the signature shakes. They have tons of specialty shakes there too! 

Definitely going back- so awesome!
author: Brie S.

description: I stopped here on my way to a bar. met up with friends and had a drink or two. Service was ok however, what really got me was the friendliness of the staff. After leaving the bar, I couldn't find my cell so I assumed I had left ot at my table. I rushed back to this place and explained the hostess and she quickly recognised me and where we were seated, she told me that the table hadn't been cleaned so it should be there. I didn't find the cell, when I went back to her she handed me her cell phone and asked me to call my phone. Stupid me, it was vibrating in the back pocket of my jeans. I felt really bad but was happy to know that the staff were so very helpful. Thank you so much guys!
author: Sunny E.

description:
So busy, so crowded, yet still so delicious!

I am hooked on the basic burger with just the regular fixins. Last time i was there I was very sad cause they ran out of sweet potato fries and I die for them they are so good. I was sad.

Love coming during the holidays cause you can watch the ice skaters and the rain fall. Check in with the hostess at the bottom level of Macys to see what the wait is and you'll be thanking yourself later. 

Minus one star for the lack of sp fries during the mad rush at the holidays and for not having a "JR" sized burger for the ladies.
author: Natalie N.

description:
This was my second time at Burger Bar, and my second (and last) disappointment.  Where do I start...

1.  The blond at the host station was rude and had a major attitude.  I know it is a stressful position, everyone wants to know if they are "next", but it's your job, AND you are the first contact.  Basically setting the stage for the entire experience, and you failed miserably.

2.  The entire restaurant is arranged very tightly.  The waiters and hosteses plow through the crowd with attitude and wreckless abandon.

3.  The bartender was obviouslsy hired on looks, and not ability.  Slow, inattentive, and totally rude.  The HUGE selection of beer is second only to the HUGE price.  4 beer cost more than dinner.

4.   A TV in our 3x3 "booth"....really?

5.  French fries were luke warm, and not one of them exceeded 2" long.  We were served the scraps from the bottom of a bag of frozen fries.

6.  Deep fried jalapeno pickles with recommended housemade garlic aioli.  There was no hint of jalapeno, and the "aioli" tasted like mayonaise from jack-in-the-box.  I had to ask the server if it was plain mayo or the aioli.  There was not even a hint of garlic.

7.  And finally, the icing on the cake.  A trip to the bathroom was not for the faint of heart.  The floor was covered in what had to be pee.  Napkins and paper towels everywhere.  And this is not an exaggeration...litterally, there was a collection of assorted boogers stuck all over the wall around the urinal.  If this is the bathroom, I dare to see the kitchen.

Needeless to say, I will never return or recommend.
author: Mike M.

description:
Came here tonight, the second night they were open. My friend who was in town for the weekend checked out the menu and it looked pretty good. Make your own burger and make your own milkshake. Sounds awesome.

We had a party of five. The wait was around 20-25 minutes. We got there around 5.50. The seating was decent but it was really loud in there. I can barely hear my friend talk across the table. They also played the same kind of techno music the entire 3 hours we were there. 

One of my friend ordered a coffee milkshake. He said it sucked and is not the ultimate milkshake. Another friend order a corona but they didn't have it. What kind of bar is this? We all ordered a different burger. Three of us ordered a burger off the menu. I made my own burger and so did another friend.

One of my friend said no onions and pickles, not even on the side. It took like a 25+ minutes for the food to arrive. And my friend did not get any sides, no tomatoes or lettuce. She asked for just tomatoes and lettuce and they gave her the entire side, with pickles and onions. She wasn't too happy. 

My burger was pretty good but I would not consider it the ultimate burger. I have had better. It is a plus that you can choose what you want on it. 

We ordered the desserts that resembles a burger. It is really cute and pretty good. 

The service was pretty good except for the onions and pickle thing.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Ok, based on the name, thought this would be fabulous.  My waitress could barely speak English, and when I asked if the whole wheat bun was dry; she absolutely could not understand the question.

Well, it was dry.  Toasted dry.  Crispy.  The medium well burger was a well done brick. Glad I had water...

The "grill" about a block away has  much better burger, on a "daily" basis.
author: Randy R.

description:
Wow, what a mega disappointment.

I reserved a table for 3 at Burger Bar mostly out of affection for Chef Hubert and his many Top Chef (Masters and otherwise) appearances. While the fact that this restaurant lives in a Macy's went a long way to manage my expectations, I was beyond disappointed with my experience .

Although I had made the reservation over 2 weeks ago, we were led to a table in the middle of the restaurant with a pretty mediocre view and quite close to the bathroom. When I asked our waitress if we could move to an available table closer to the window, she told me I couldn't, because there were other people in the lobby waiting for a table (ummm hello? they can have my old one!) 

When we asked about their fairly comprehensive wine selection, our waitress had tasted none of the wines on offer, and instead pointed us towards their most commonly ordered white, which was pretty nasty. Although our burgers were definitely tasty, at $15-20 a pop they were definitely overpriced. Our fries came cold (even after we sent the first order back) and overall the service was fairly dismal.

Booooooooooooooooo.
author: Amanda F.

description: The worst Burger I ever had! Thank God they didn't charge me. The bun was stale and the hangover sauce had no flavor. and yes those skinny fries are just frozen potatoes like McDonalds. Save your money!
author: Dianna H.

description:
Oh Hubert Keller!!  Ok, so I am a vegetarian and I would never think of going to the Burger Bar being a vegetarian... but I was invited by friends and so I went.  I was surprised to see a vegetarian burger on the menu (though not that surprised, this is San Francisco!) and was so excited to try it.  I love Hubert Keller, I think he is a brilliant chef.  Well I have to say I was highly disappointed.  The burger was just plain gross. It was like mush.  Why do people think vegetarians want to eat mush that is flavorless? I sure as hell don't.  I mean Morning Star Farms makes a veggie burger that looks like and tastes like a burger, how come Hubert Keller can't do that? 

Why even have a vegetarian burger if you are gonig to serve that crap? I suggest starting a "baby" or "infant" menu. You could have the veggie burger there as an option and I bet it would be a great hit.
author: Ivanna C.

description:
Hubert Keller, you did me dirty and I loved it!

While in town on an extended stay, I traveled up to the 7th floor of Macy's in Union Square to find this. The insides are warm, inviting, and sexy - the windows fully take advantage of the gorgeous San Francisco views.

Customized a salmon burger (topped with pickled cucumbers) with sweet potato fries. The salmon was flaky, yet still held together - making it enjoyable as a burger. Sweet potato fries melted into the two sides of chipotle mayo I ordered on the side.

Also had to try a milkshake. I don't remember what was in it, except chocolate chips, vanilla ice cream and chocolate whip cream... but that was probably because I was having orgasmic convulsions. So good. Best milkshake, hands down.

A definite place to try.
author: Kim D.

description:
Good burger but nothing out of this world. A little on the pricey side, but you do get a decent sized burger and a side of your choice of fries. Sweet potato fries as usual will work for me. 

I ordered my burger medium and it was just slightly pink which is how i like it, this was very filling and made me a happy camper. Unfortunately though, I made the mistake though of ordering the hummus and pita. Bleh, dry and bland pita and the pita was too doughy and not grilled enough to make it useful for dipping. 

Granted I stuck to the more inexpensive side of the menu, I could definitely see how you could put a serious dent in the wallet by going nuts on the kobe burger, apps and milkshake cause honestly there should be no reason to spend close to $100 for a meal that includes a burger in it.
author: Phuoc K.

description:
It's quite rare that I'm able to eat at the city. So I asked Pei ( Another foodie photographer! http://ppk.yelp.com/ ) she told me about Burger Bar. It took us a few minutes to look for the restaurant. After a bit of confusion, we found Burger Bar located within the Macy's building. The menu is very pricey, this is has a large part in experience pricing. The real estate and the presentation of our meals were probably added into the price of our tab. There's also my first time seeing a SF Healthy Fee of 3.5% added to our overall check. 

Our server was fairly out of it, he had a blank indifference vibe whenever he was taking requests. Even though he's not the most friendliest server we had, he was fairly prompted with our orders and checked up on us frequently.

One friend went for the Burger Bar Sliders with onion rings, another for the American Kobe with cheese and a side of sweet potato fries, and I went for the Hubert Keller burger. The Hubert Keller burger is supposedly the signature burger named after the founder and owner of Burger Bar. I stole a sweet potato fry from my friend's plate was amazed how sweet and crispy it was. My Hubert Keller burger was pretty interesting spinach and cheese topped  it came with a side of sauce that I topped onto my meat. I asked for a medium rare burger and it was perfectly done, the sauce actually did kind cooked parts of my meat through. The ciabatta bread is nicely toasted it got a lil soggy from the sauce I poured over my meat. The spinach was nicely cooked and it's a uniquely accompanied helping the to the burger. The skinny fries was put into a little mini deep fryer basket. It was my first time actually having a burger done medium rare since I still have beliefs of any meat that goes through a grounding process. The burger was quite good.

Surprisingly with my huge appetite, I'm stuffed three-quarters from my meal. I barely able to finish my skinny cut fries. To accompanied the burger, I ordered the Nutella milkshake since it's strongly recommended by Pei. I can see why some people like the milkshake a lot. The milkshake made of a generous amount of nutella, I would say that more than half of the milkshake was actually nutella itself. This milkshake will be definitely be a big hit with the sweet addicts and children whom come to the restaurant. 
-----
+ Pro: Excellent view, great presentation.
- Con: Very Expensive.
( ^_^) Overall: a great place to dine in especially during the shopping season.
author: James N.

description: Great burgers but avoid the shakes. Nice view of Union square so get there early. Excellent service!
author: Gerald H.

description:
If you're looking for the BEST burger you've ever tasted...you won't find it at Burger Bar...This place has been over hyped and is definitely overrated...

For a party of 4, we ordered:

Desert before dinner:
Nutella Milkshake- best one out of the bunch
Mint Chocolate Chip Milkshake- really good for the first 5 sips, but gets overwhelmingly minty to the point 2 people couldn't even finish it...
Caramel Latte Milkshake- whipped cream overload...couldn't even taste the shake.

Building your own burger:
This is where it gets complicated.  Great concept, everyone can customize, but we're not all food scientists...Here's the room for error.  only 1 out of the 4 burgers we each ordered passed the taste test.  Note to self, to not get the bun toasted (it was rock hard), do not order the sweet potato fries (they were soggy), and do not order your meat well done (way too dry).

I'd give it another try only to order a set burger on the menu and for the ambiance which is located on the 6th floor of Macy's in downtown.  But if you want to build your own burger at a GOOD burger place, try The Counter!  

Overall, I'd be more than happy with an in&out burger with a vanilla milkshake instead.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I was really excited to check this place out.. mainly because of how much I watch reality TV and have seen Hubert Keller on Top Chef and Top Chef Masters.  I really thought it would dazzle me.. but alas, it did not

The atmosphere was pretty cool, we got to sit by the window and look out at the busy street below, so that was nice.

As for the food, We each built our own burgers and ordered one order of fries and one order of onion rings.  It was a decent burger.. the onion rings were pretty spectacular and the fries were nothing to write home about.  

Service was pretty poor.. I think he stopped by our table to refill the waters about 2 times.. im a naturally thirsty person and the tiny glass of water just wasnt cutting it.  The people next to us ordered milkshakes and they looked phenomenal, but at 9 dollars a pop we decided against it as our 2 burgers fries and onion rings was already a 40 dollar tab.

In the end I gave this place 3 stars just because I think my expectations may have been too high...after all this is a burger restaurant, not a nice sit down chef's restaurant you know?
author: Sam S.

description: Stopped in for a quick shake and fries. The location is convenient, we were seated right away in one of the high tables against the window. It was beautiful looking over union square especially the holiday ice skating rink. The fry selection is great garlic, curly, sweet potato and onion rings. We got curly fries which were the same you get anywhere, actually is prefer the ones from jack in the box. But, the onion rings  were AMAZING!!!  Thick buttermilk batter, fried to a country perfection.  The chocolate shake was also delicious and they seem to be big on shakes with tons of customizable toppings and syrups. I got the standard chocolate which was rich and creamy, served in a curvy glass. It's a bit pricey for a burger joint but you're obviously paying for a location. Overall it was good but not a must go for my next trip to SF.
author: Samantha A.

description: I've given the manager up until now to call me to discuss what had happened but I have yet to hear from him/her. I left my phone number and was expecting a call either that day or a couple of days after. It has been over a week now. I am a true believer of following up with customers to make ensure problems were handled. Oh well.
author: Jenny T.

description: Great views, but OK burgers and sides, and mediocre service. The burger had nearly no flavor whatsoever. The onion rings also seemed bland. Service wasn't that good, either. The bun was good, and my wife's chef's veggie burger was good, but I'll pass on going again. Beer selection didn't seem as great as they make sound, either. Overall, I was disappointed because I enjoy a good burger.
author: Jason P.

description:
I usually check reviews then go, but we were in SF only for a day and my cousin reccomended the place. Had I checked YELP, I would NOT have gone, which would have been so sad. I am shocked this place has such a low rating, and I am very critical. 
on a busy Saturday for lunch, we were seated within a minute, a waiter came by immediately and we were put by the window corner we asked for. It was busy but they kinly accomodated so we could have the gorgeous view of Union Square.  The waiter was so friendly and gave wonderful suggestions. The milkshakes were awesome, the dessert (we ordered the nutella burger), the sides, the burgers, everything was top notch, and tasted amazing. We got our food within ten minutes, and the waiter would peak in frm a distance and when he would catch my eye give me a thumbs up to see if we were ok, but wouldnt disturn our private conversation. I appreciated that. It was peaceful and when I asked for the check he brought it and made sure we had what we needed when I asked for it. 
Made my weekend with my sister absolutely wonderful. Great food, atmosphere, view, service. What mroe do you want?
Oh wait the icing on the cake, the prices are not insane at all, pretty reasonable in my opinion for a celebrity chef, did not break the bank at all, and I feel like you pay more at chain restaurants like Cheesecake factory . please eat here
author: Sophie K.

description: Our server today, wyn, was amazing, knew which drinks to recommend, knew what food we would like based on our tastes. Loved her! She didn't even flinch when the table next to us have her a hard time! Food is also really good, although it was a little hot in the restaurant.. Only complaint we had!
author: Megan D.

description:
I went here a couple months ago with my bf and his family when they were visiting from SoCal. It was the only restaurant they knew of, and wanted to go.

I dont want this to be a biased review just based on burgers because I really haven't eaten hamburgers in a long time so I can't give that a review to its full potential. But my bf n I split a salad and something else that was alright. Their sweet potato fries were delicious but served cold. The dipping sauce was bomb. Drinks/ beer from the bar was good. Server seemed like a fake airhead. When she talked to us, it's as if she wasn't really listening and looking passed us.

Now that I live in the city, when I see a restaurant that is way too overpriced I am just not impressed. Since I live in the sunset and make most of my own food, if I can make the plate for myself at home, I dont see the point of slappin' $10 on a plate of leaves-- what for? Presentation? The fact that there are TV's at each booth, so need $? There are so many other DELICIOUS restaurants out there that are fighting to stay alive and open in SF. They have recipes that have been passed down by generations, including the same pan that their grandparents used (collects allllll the deliciousness people). Big chain companies just don't understand quality, and the reason they even get massive amounts of $$$ is because so many people have been brainwashed with fast food---they don't know real flavor when they taste it. 

What bothers me is that it seems that restaurants these days keep trying to compensate quality for quantity. If you slap up a buncha big screens and little tv's then that is supposed to entice the customer to enjoy the ambiance. However.......please realize that customers are ALWAYS going to remember the food and the service the most--accounts for 80%. That many tv's is good for a sports bar, but not in a restaurant. Why are you trying to sell the idea to customers that they all need their own tv to watch, instead of sitting down to a bomb meal and talking/laughing/drinking with each other. Isn't that enough?
author: Julia D.

description:
If Hubert Keller opens a restaurant, it's going to be under more scrutiny. So right out the gate he's got to meet a higher standard. He doesn't meet it. 

I've definitely had better burgers elsewhere (and for slightly less). I have a list of places to try and a list of places to revisit before coming back.
author: Erika C.

description: SO hot and stuffy! I'm sure the food is delicious, it smelled and looked that way. However, we only lasted in there for less than 5 minutes because of how hot and stuffy the restaurant is! I looked around and even noticed people near us wiping sweat off their faces! When we got up to leave, we were approached by a couple of staff members who wanted to know why we were leaving so soon (they were very nice and polite.) We told them why, and said if it had been any cooler or less stuffy we would stay. They apologized and let us know that Macy's controls their air too (and, they agreed with us about the temp.) We would definitely give this place a chance if this issue changes (we weren't even there on a hot day!)  Too bad, we're a fan of Chef Keller's and really want to like this place.
author: Kelly K.

description:
A great location on Union Square inside of Macy's, and the menu and beer selection look promising, but the food falls just short of good.  Service was good, they went out of their way to get us a great table with room for our huge stroller.  

I really want them to pick it up a bit, so we can go back.  But until they make some changes, I don't think we will return.   http://www.burgerbar.com.
author: Carin G.

description:
I'm not sure what people are expecting from a place appropriately called burger bar.  Maybe if it was named burger joint instead, people wouldn't come in with such lofty expectations?

Like so many others, i did come in with those same lofty expectations since this was after all, a burger establishment opened by Hubert Keller... had to be great right?  Damn right it was great! I've had the one in vegas and in SF.. and i enjoyed my burger, and anyone else's burger that i could try out.  

My favorite burger so far i think has to be the Hubert Keller burger.. not a big fan of blue cheese.. but it worked damn well here.  The shakes? fantastic.  Nothing to complain about the service as i felt they were attentive.... and they seem to like hiring a certain type of waittress... that guys will probably enjoy.

Why only four stars after such a glowing review? Well.. a burger joint is still a burger joint.  And that elevator is a chore to wait for... but come on, if that's the only complaint a patron has, It can't be a bad thing.  A great burger at a good price.  I think Hubert did well for himself here.
author: Felix W.

description:
I came here for dinner during the holidays and I loved the view.  All the holiday lights lit up Union Square and you can see everything from this restaurant.  

The deep fried pickles were pretty good.  Rather than small round slices, they had them cut in spears.  The sweet potato fries were just standard in my opinion...and as for the burgers, meh.  The best part of my burger was the truffle sauce I ordered along side of it, but then again I think this condiment would have made any meal better.  I probably would have been just as satisfied with an animal style burger from In-N-Out.

One plus was that they had Hoegaarden on tap, which I haven't seen at too many other restaurants.  Unless you happen to be stuck shopping at Macys or a nearby shop, I wouldn't find this place to be enticing.
author: Agent X.

description: this place would be good if they actually pay attention to what you order. They got mines and my wife order mixed up. I ordered kobe burger medium rare and my wife ordered the kobe burger medium well. I got medium well and she got medium rare. We could of just switch but all the items we order for our burger were different. I found 2 pieces of hair on my bacon. Are they not wearing hair net when they cook. I wouldn't come back for a 2nd time. Burger Bar... wack!!!
author: Logan P.

description: Stumbled on this place while shopping at Macy's. The do burgers with a high-end flare. Great selection of beers on draft and they know how to cook a Med-Raw burger!
author: Ray K.

description:
I thought I had reviewed this place last year when we first tried it out. Guess I must have missed it. 

Since then, I frequently come here with the Eggs, friends or co-workers for lunch. I like their burgers and I always order the burger sliders. I think tiny things are cute and tiny burgers are even cuter. The beef is so tender and juicy. The portion is perfect for me. Put together, it's probably 3/4 of an regular sized burger. The fries are cut fairly thin and the amount is just right. Pair your burger with their milk shake. You can order 1 and have them split it into 2 tiny glasses, for you and your friend, or bf/gf...

To further your dining experience at Burger Bar, they are located on the 7th floor of Macy's women in Union Square. It's quite a sight, especially during the Christmas season. The view is so pretty. 

I do agree about the lag time of the service others complain about. They are constantly busy. But, it's not going to hinder me from coming back for more burger sliders.
author: Cindy W.

description:
After all the hype on yelp and my obsession with Top Chef, I simply couldn't wait to try Burger Bar. Considering the ho-hum yelp reviews and the newness of the place, I was very much prepared to underwhelmed and dare I say, disappointed. So pleased that it wasnt the case at all.

730 pm on an Thursday? We were certain to have beaten the crowd. Nope. We ask the hostess in the lobby the wait she told us an hour. We weren't quite convinced as it was pretty apparent she had taken a leaf out of Tim Lincecums book if you catch my drift. 

Alas indeed that it was an hour wait. There wasn't even seating at the bar,  it was so packed. I jet off to the restroom only to return to find HUBERT KELLER himself mingling with us minions waiting. 

So my friend (who doesn't quite have my sense of celebrity chef awe) says to him: "Well I hope the food is good enough for an hour's wait" 
....I DIE.... 
But just like that Hubert takes our name to the hostess, they look intently at the computer, and we are seated five minutes later. AMAZING. He's not walking around fishing for compliments, he is clearly a hands on chef who is in the trenches ensuring the success of the resto. He took pictures with us and came by several times to check on us. I also noticed that when people were seated around us (those who had been waiting longer than us, oops) he made sure to bring a milkshake over to each table and greet each guest and apologize for the delay. whatta charmer. 2 stars right there.... 

Walking past the dozens of folks throwing some SERIOUS shade because of our luck (or my friend's big mouth?) we are seated in an area that had several open booths. Tsk Tsk hostess girl. Server comes, seems a little harried but is certainly attentive when its our turn. Clearly the staff was on edge. Who wouldn't be with the "Michelin Man" standing by and overseeing everything?!?

Food: I had the country natural w pepper bacon, Monterrey jack, caramelized onions and aioli. After noticing yelp says it comes about a half bit more done than specified I ordered it well-medium. .... 
it came rare..... 
I hope that means that folks are taking notice of the feedback on yelp. However, a little too over-corrected for my plate... 

Friends had the veggie burger which was dense, nicely seasoned and very satisfying because of its cohesive texture. She RAVED about the pickled veggie root that accompanied it. 
Turkey burger was also good, with nice smoky flavor without overpowering burger. onion rings and fries pretty good. Aioli best on fries, lost punch in my burger and turkey burger. 

Overall, we were quite satisfied (surprisingly). We had an amazing meal which was somewhat pricey for a burger but its Hubert, in Macys, in Union Square.... so I anticipate tourists packing this place for a long time to come. 

sidenote-I really wanted him to win Top Chef so I appreciate his having the fancy resto w great views, while Rick Bayless' Frontera is banished in the basement food court. HA! burnnnnn
author: Ali R.

description: Great Buffalo burger! The view was epic, service was very good! I'll be back for sure!
author: Mr R.

description:
My husband and I visited SF for the very first time. The food was pretty good, we  created our own burgers and had some spicy wings. The service was exceptional! Thank You ENRIQUE for your recommendation. 
4 Stars for food/5 stars for service.
author: Janet G.

description: Definitely recommend kids sliders over the Mac n cheese which is undisguised kraft for $8.  Would expect more from a Hubert keller, or at least adding a sprinkle of parm or truffle, or warning guests...  Everything else great!  View great!
author: Bethany N.

description: Decent food and service. Wonderful view. The buffalo wings tasted like they took them out of the freezer and flash fried them. Horrible. They did take them off the bill after we complained. Took too long to get a table cleaned and for us to get utensils however, staff was great once we complained. The fish and chips and buffalo burger were excellent!  I would try this place again.
author: Katrina H.

description:
What a disappointment, Hubert Keller. You are no Top Chef. The Burger Bar is overpriced and overrated. Don't let the pictures on the website fool you!

I came to eat here about an hour before the restaurant closed, which may be a reason why we had such terrible food. I ordered the Kobe beef burger medium rare with a bunch of toppings, and when the burger finally arrived it was cooked well done. Of course I sent it back, and when the new burger arrived, they forgot some of the toppings I ordered and sweet potato fries. By this point I was so hungry, that I didn't care and just wanted to eat. The burger was flat and mushy, aka gross.

I will hand it to the waitress -- she provided good customer service and ended up comping our entire meal (except for the beer), and gave us complimentary mini-sized milkshakes. The whipped cream on the milkshake was TO DIE FOR. Best part about the meal -- and it was free.

The only thing good about this place are the milkshakes and beer (but how can you really go wrong with that?). Otherwise, don't waste your time. At least I got 100 Open Table points for the reservation.
author: Patricia Y.

description: SO DELISH. Bartender, host, and server were all friendly and helpful. My girls and I had drinks at the bar while waiting for a window view...worth the wait. Menu took me about forty minutes to decide through. Burger was epic. Loved the "special" elevator. I felt like a badass.
author: Rachel W.

description:
1 star for the gorgeous view
1 star because I didn't have to pay for the meal

Uncle's company is smacked in the middle of Union Square so since we happen to be there around lunch time, he suggested we ate there.  We wanted to check out Burger Bar when we're in Vegas recently, but didn't have time, so we were cool with his suggestion. Also, it's his treat, so again, don't really have a say on where to go.

The view is amazing. It looks out to Union Square. It was a nice day too, so it was an amazing view. 

Our waitress was attentive but not too overly friendly, but not mean either. Just regular, nothing special. 

Food took a while to come though. The restaurant wasn't crowded so not sure why it was taking so long.

I had SF Vegan Burger. The Mr. ordered the sliders and the uncle ordered some kinda low-carb burger. 

Conclusion: Overated. Overprice. Bland. 

Also worth mentioning, this place seems to be a tourist trap. Everyone in the restaurant was out of towners with big giant cameras and snapping pictures left and right. 

Blah.. won't go back. Nothing special. Glad I didn't have to pay for it. Would take one star off if I had to.
author: Angie L.

description:
A-OK, surely, but I dunno man.

Fleur de Lys is the best place in the world to eat as far as I'm concerned, so I may have had sky-high expectations for Hubert Keller's burger joint in Union Square. 

All in all, there's really nothing wrong with it. Service good and friendly, and they easily accommodated a last-minute group of 10. Burgers and drinks good and, from what I remember, not *too* expensive considering where it is. But if I'm just itching for burgers and beer, I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to come back to this particular burger joint.

Those sweet potato fries were off the chain, though, word up to those.
author: Tara R.

description:
This is the place to take your dad or any other guy who is new to the city and wants to go to a touristy place.

The burgers are a little bit expensive but they make for it with a great ambiance, nice  waitresses and awesome fries.

Plus its one of the few places where you can ask for a "Wine reduction" and "Blue Cheese" burger. 

Go with your dad or boss and you will enjoy this place.
author: Gonzalo M.

description: I get the idea here; its way too expensive.  But for being in the tourist laden Union Square Macy's, it is probably about right.  The problem here is it is fun but unimaginative.  The shakes aren't really creative.  The burgers are rather straight forward.  I would have enjoyed something more whimsical...but the tourist crowd here seems happy.  If you do wind up here somehow, get the sliders and a side of the truffel sauce - that works pretty well.
author: David S.

description: Arrived at 8:30pm on Sunday and was advised that they were closing early at 9:00pm and only drinks at the bar were available.   There was nothing u l dated on the web site or at the desk at in the lobby area.  6 additional parties arrived after us and all turned away.  will never go back or try in any other city.
author: Aimee D.

description:
We had super awesome service and the best seat in the entire place! They sat us center at the huge glass window looking over the park. it was not only a nice view but also kind of romantic for me and my boyfriend, so that was a good start I guess.

Our waiter was sharp. I really liked him. He was attentive but not annoying at all (you know what I'm talking about - the "how are we doing here?" every three minutes; yeah, he didn't do that). 

It's a little pricey but doesn't quite "rape" your wallet. It's more like "surprise sex!"
I had been to the location in Vegas before this one so I knew what I wanted: a kobe beef burger on a ciabatta roll, with swiss cheese, bacon, mushrooms, guacamole, onions, and lettuce. The ciabatta felt like it came right out of an oven... crunchy on the edges but a soft, fluffy roll nonetheless. The guac was flavorful, creamy and I could taste the fresh tomatoes in the spread. The mushrooms, well, they did not disappoint. The price I paid for the Kobe beef... well, I didn't feel jipped. Could most definitely tell the difference in the quality of the beef. It was a decent size and if it weren't for the fries (which were crispy and realllll fresh) I wouldn't have felt totally fat waddling out of there back to the hotel.

I'm also not a person for sweet things, but I do love their shakes! It's real ice cream and they have different things you can get blended into it and different toppings. I had a vanilla ice cream shake with cookie dough and Reese's peanut butter cups pieces in it with chocolate chips and whipped cream on top. The shake is honestly like a meal in itself.

So, five stars for the food + the great service + the luck we had with getting the table we did. That might seem a little generous but it was perfect. :)
author: Kellee N.

description: Best burger I've EVER had!!! Great service...  Robert the bar tender was entertaining and recommended good options. I will be back.
author: Kristina O.

description: I must say as busy as they are...they manage to have great customer service.  I had made a reservation a week in advanced and then on the date I arrived to only find out they they did not have my res. I was with 16 people to celebrate a birthday.  I was livid but under control.  I spoke to a manager and they still could not find my res.  They told me they were slammed with customers but wait we will fix this.   Wow really?  Still calm but boiling inside!!  And in 10 mins at exactly the time of our original res the manager escorts us to the table for 16.  They accommodated fast!!  Thanks Burger Bar!!  16 very happy folks!  Not to mention the good burgers and desserts we had.  Super pleased!
author: jennie r.

description: I find the reviews on this website regarding this venue somewhat amusing. I do not eat beef, so I opted for the salmon burger on a wheat bun. Personally, I found it delicious. My salmon was incredibly moist and tasty and the bun was not hard at all. My burger was $12. Not bad, methinks considering the prices one usually gets charged for seafood. I also had a Pomegranate Daquiri, which was quite good (the bartender did not skimp on the alcohol, as so many others do). Maybe the beef eaters ought to switch to seafood.
author: Carolina G.

description: The burgers were overcooked  and dry. The buns were stale. The side salad was inedible. The sweet potato fries were mediocre. Only positive was my beer. Never again!!
author: YP G.

description:
