Would have given it four stars if it wasn't for the "reception" desk. We were told 45-1hr. Waited the time then checked with them. They claimed to have already called us. If they had it was in such hushed tones only my dog could have heard it. We were no more than 10 feet away.  

Vegas has much better service. 

The wait staff and food was top notch.
author: Kory F.

description:
Wow.   Just went here with a group of 10 good friends.  Tried to do the responsible thing and make a reservation but alas, this place won't take one unless you have 16 people or something ridiculous.  

Checked in the with the snotty hostesses.  Told us it would be 45 min.   Went to the bar, had some drinks.  Pretty sure they had a staff of about 5 people on the floor of this place.  Waited about an hour, checked in with the hostesses, they kept saying that they were waiting for a party of 12 to clear out so we could take their table.... do they not have other tables in this place to put together? 

It's not like it was that crowded tonight, at about 10pm, it was dying down.  FINALLY we sit, half of us got our drink orders.   Same with napkins, ect.   They brought us cold fries, literally cold,  to bad we couldn't have em' bring us fresh ones, such few interactions with the waitress.   The WAY overpriced burgers were decent.  For the 3 hours we had to wait for them they should have been free.

Such a let down, times like this remind me why i NEVER eat downtown.  

It is what it is, if your a tourist, knock your self out.  Shop and have fun eating at a mediocre chain in Macy's.  

If you live in SF, you should know better.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: View is nice, came here because the line at the Cheesecake Factory was too long. The food is NOTHING special. I don't ever want to try it again, would not recommend.
author: Lissette V.

description:
After reading my numerous friends' reviews, I waited to give this destination burger spot a try. You can either use the side elevators on Geary Street or ride the escalators to the restaurant. Arriving on a late Saturday morning, getting a table for six wasn't a problem. Seated in a booth facing Union Square, we were impressed by the "personal" TV screen at our table, showing the Cal game (Go Bears!). The menu offers a variety of selections where you can follow their suggestions or build your own burger. To buy more time, we ordered each of the side dishes except for the pickled jalapenos to share. The list went like this: 
a) Crispy thin fries - nicely cut, but just lukewarm. 
b) Sweet potato fries - tasty and sweet, but again just warm 
c) Thick cut fries - came hot and melt-in-your-mouth soft. 
d) Onion rings - came hot too and crispy thick. 
e) Zucchini Fries - served hot but not as health as it sounds.

Asking our waitress' recommendation of meats (Kobe - "fattier flavor", Angus, Country Natural), I followed her suggestion for the Country Natural, a local organic beef ($16.50 before accompaniments). One of my friends did his homework on the Internet, noticing a burger combination on the website menu named MBA. The description listed grilled mushrooms, bacon, and avocado. This is not listed at this location's menu, but we borrowed this idea in ordering, substituting the avocado with guacamole. Our waitress was spot on in saying that the Country Natural is juicier. I did not need to add catsup to the burger with the natural juices and guacamole. Hope to try one of their shakes or desserts on the next trip here.
author: Mike C.

description:
Dear Brian at Burger Bar (Waitstaff) in San Francisco,

Just because I didn't have my boobs hanging out of my shirt and wasn't part of an all girls night out (table next to us) OR part of an obnoxious group of dudes trying to get trashed at happy hour that happened to order the $60 truffle burger (also next to us) - doesn't mean you should IGNORE my table. It took you a good 20 minutes before you took our order and it WASN'T even busy on a Wednesday Night. We weren't asked about the drink menu, were barely checked on, and the only time you hurried up was when it came to paying for the bill.

And why do people automatically get seated at the bar area and are NOT asked if they want a table? Lame. 

Sigh. I still get mistaken for being a college student because I am often dressed in flip flops and jeans (I have a casual dress code at my job) and I am lugging around a backpack (my work laptop stays with me at all times). It seems like at Burger Bar to get decent service you have to dress up. Seriously? Burger Bar has comparable atmosphere to Cheesecake Factory next door. No need to get fancy for this place.

So much for trying to have a decent meal with my boyfriend after a so-so week of work.
author: ally o.

description: One of the few places open still tonight on New Year's Day. Burger bar was accommodating to seat us before the kitchen closed. We ordered right away and received our food very quickly. Service is average and food is average. I decided to try the sliders which were fine. Beer selection is ok but not a ton of choices.
author: Diana G.

description: Okay but nothing special. I expected a high-rise restaurant to be better--to me it was no tastier than an Applebee's. So I didn't see why the extra expense.
author: Megan R.

description:
Its hard to give burger bar a 3 star, it really should be a 3.5. Located in Macy's, union square, the views are incredible. Im assuming (as Ive only been to cheesecake) during  the holidays, the view showcases the christmas tree and ice-skating rink.

since this was my first time to "the bar" I decided to order the trio of sliders. Allowing my taste buds the differences between the angus, buffalo and conutry natural, I cant say that I could tell the difference between all three. Perhaps to help distinguish, there should be little signs accompanying the baby burgers. 
NOT that this takes away from the quality of the meat itself, I think it would just help clarify which ones you like for the follow up showing. 

Def recommend the sweet potato fries and onion rings.....delish!
author: Jenn H.

description: We went again on 2/15/14.  The food was hot, fresh and tasted great.  The service was another problem.  She had an attitude.  Didn't ask if we wanted dessert.  Stacked dirty dishes on one of our party's plate, when there was food still on the plate, without asking if he was finished.  Very rude.    If the service is like this again, I will remove them from my list of places I enjoy in San Francisco.  They are on probation.  One more mess up, you are done.  This is the second time the service has been sub pare. Two out of the last five.  Not good odds.  I would give 2 stars for service, 4 stars for food.  The price is high for a burger.
author: Mark S.

description:
1 - The server tried to tell us that their "medium" is bloody ("Like in Europe" she said incorrectly.) We repeated that we didn't care what this place called it, we wanted it red in the middle (normally medium rare). It came back pale brown like cardboard. 

2 - Asked for another round of drinks and didn't get them. 

3 - The fries were cold and I swear they were originally frozen. 

4 - Dry dry dry burgers so if you do find yourself there, make sure that you order some of their extra sauce stuff on the side. 

*********It was a total disaster.**************** 
And 4 of us ate for $230. And we didn't have something to start, and we only had 2 desserts. Gimme a break.....
author: Penny A.

description: Interesting experience inside Macys.  Not bad, and not outstanding.  Simple something different.  That's all I can say ~
author: Mark F.

description: Super yummy. I've only been here once but I really enjoyed it!.It's great that u add whatever u want to yr burger.. And the location is great. You can walk around Santana row right after to walk Off all the food. Haha
author: Elvira G.

description:
Somewhat disappointment . $25 burger was dryish and no amount of  saute onions with blue cheese could save this dish. The best part about french fries was cutesy little metal basket. We came on Sunday night. The place was almost empty.

 To my amazement the Huber Keller himself was there checking the wine cellar and making rounds at the kitchen. That was almost 10 pm. He still was busting his ass on Sunday night. Respect!!!

He even came to our table and asked about the food. I wish i would ask him why they have that stupid yellow mustard on the table as a condiment. Instead I just froze in great moment shaking his hand. Great guy. Huber looked much thinner and l really exozsted- nothing like a robust happy guy on PBS show. 

I have waited several months after the restaurant opened and saw all the mediocre reviews. Just could not believe it and had to check it for myself.

We processed with food and drinks. Great selection of beer but no prices mentioned.
  Japanese beer  which sounded so interested and exotic lost it 's flare when the bill had arrived with $14 per glass tag. Really??? 
******************************************************************************
I have came here 2 more times after that and it was a better experience.
author: Xela H.

description: This place is a solid 3.5 and serves a purpose. It's good for a downtown lunch for work that is fast, casual, but in good taste - great views, fun menu -- overpriced as hell - not awesome service. I had a burger with bacon, and thin fries and I'm not complaining. No Michelin stars though.
author: Andrew K.

description:
We love this place when we are in the mood for cocktails, burgers and a wonderful view. (we live in SF part of the year) We like to sit at a table by the window, so we can enjoy the gorgeous view of Union Square. I always take my camera and I have some lovely shots of the buildings around Union Square, taken during dusk/twilight from my table at the Burger Bar. 

This place is great because the service is super friendly, the martini's are to our liking, the burgers are tasty, the atmosphere is upscale and the view is breathtakingly unique. 

(To find the Burger Bar, walk inside Macy's and get on the elevator (located on your left) go to the sixth floor and you are in cocktail/burger heaven.)

If there are just two of you, ask for the super-private-window-alcove table for two (very cool).
author: Miep G.

description: OMG! So shocked at how bad the service was! Sat for a solid 15-20 min before anyone came by & we had a 2 year old in a high chair so we obviously needed to get going. Then ordered drinks...beer & shake didn't come forever! Had to ask about them. Ordered a salad with dressing on the side but it came floating in dressing! And the child in the high chair got no food! When we asked the server, he said, "what did you order for him?". We had to ask for refills on soda, tea, & water. The server didn't know the soup of the day. It was just bad bad bad! So sad! It's a good location & the Vegas Burger Bar has always been a great experience. Won't be going back here EVER again!
author: Amy G.

description:
This place was made for tourists.  It's across from the Cheesecake Factory on Union Square....you don't anymore touristy than that.  And unlike the Cheesecake Factory, they don't have the outside balcony, so you only get the gorgeous view from the inside.  Considering how windy it gets up there, that's not necessarily a bad thing.  

All that being said, the burgers aren't bad.  Sure, they are a little frou-frou and every single one on the menu is over $10.  But how many places can you get a Kobe burger with grilled fois gras?  On the other hand, how many times are you going to pay $60 for a burger?  I didn't get the Kobe/fois gras burger.  I got something a little more down to earth; something that would let me taste that meaty beefy flavor that I love so much.  I didn't ask, but I would guess that the meat is like an 80/20 mix.  Certainly not any leaner, otherwise you wouldn't have the taste.  

The Black Jack burger was good.  Done properly, though maybe a little over.  Still tasty and not dry at all.  The thing is is they serve their burgers on a cibatta bun.  It's nice, and makes it a little classier, but it doesn't have the same consistency as a regular hamburger bun.  It does soak up all the juices pretty well though and does contribute nicely to the taste.  And it holds up better as well.  

The fries were good, though very under seasoned.  I had the "fat fries" which is another term for steak fries.  The portion that comes with the burger is pretty small, though the place is called the Burger Bar, so they make it clear what they want you to see as the star of the show.  

I would say I'm a fan of this place. This was my second time there, but the first time I really got to really think about the meal.  Service was good and the place was clean.  I would definitely come back here.
author: Adam E.

description:
Best thing about this place is location.  Felt ripped off after meal, very weak value.  Draft beer $9, bison burger $20+, kids mac n cheese $7 and all very average.   Our waiter wasn't helpful when we asked questions and hostess very "out of it".  Bill for wife and I $79, should have spent that on a real lunch.  

One star for the location, one for warm food.
author: slbvic c.

description: Yummmm. The burgers here are delicious and so are the sweet potato fries and the alcoholic milkshakes. It only gets three stars because the food took forever! Not acceptable when it's your friend's birthday. The burgers are pretty expensive. I think the priciest one is $60. Another plus is when I went Hubert Keller was there...I saw him didn't get to meet him though :(
author: Ashlee H.

description:
I came here with some friends and family on a Saturday night around 9:00PM. It was jam-packed. We waited for about an hour for a table. We could hardly walk to it. This was for sure a health hazard. I've never seen so many people in a restaurant. 

Our server was very friendly and accommodating. She was the only thing that saved this review from getting no stars. Well, her and the curly fries. There were TV's at each table but featured nothing I would want to watch. The burger that I ordered (medium) was really piecy and crumbled. The beef did not even stay in the shape of a patty. It was kind of gross. Two other people ordered theirs both "medium" and got burgers that were obviously cooked differently. 

After we finished, we asked to talk to the manager. Now, mind you, we are NOT the type of people to do something like that EVER! It's just something you don't do. However, we told him we were not looking for a discount but simply wanted to let him know that the burgers were not cooked the same and were of somewhat poor quality. Well, Mr. Macho seemed like he didn't really want to hear it. All he said was that he'd take them off the bill. It seemed like he didn't care about the point of it all and actually copped an attitude. He actually tried to correct us. What happened to the customer is always right? We were simply trying to do him a service and this man was not equipped with the proper social skills to take constructive criticism. I hope management changes.
author: Hilary C.

description:
The hype was crazy when this place opened and I finally made it down here during the day. I was kind of surprised by the decor. It was far more dineresque than high end. Somehow I imagined a Hubert Keller restaurant having a little bit more refinement. The booths with their own mini-flat screens looked cool.

I ordered the lunch burger special, which was a good deal. A slightly smaller burger, fries and a drink for under $12. And you can also go the make your own burger route with all the fixings if you want. The burger itself was good and the sweet potato fries were yummy. I can only imagine how the $60 burger tastes...
author: Natalie S.

description:
DELICIOUS DELICIOUS DELICIOUS!

My coworker introduced this establishment to me and said she tried the Las  Vegas location. Visiting SF with my friends we were about to eat Cheesecake Factory until I noticed the restaurant from across the way and suggested we try something we haven't had yet.

A base burger without any add ons can range in the $16 area to as high as $60. Service was great and a party of 12 got seated in 10 minutes. Everyone ordered different burger but I tried the buffalo burger with egg and fat fries. I was excited to try this meat since I heard good things. Low fat lean meat. 

I took a bite of this burger and it took me to heaven. It was juicy and the combination of the egg was just perfect. 

Ended up paying about $24 after tax and gratuity but it was all worth it. I wish I lived closer to a Burger Bar because I'd love to try out more of their items but I guess this just means I gotta pay SF another visit or go to vegas.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
Who doesn't love a juicy burger?  I do, wish I got one though. 

Our server Pablo was awesome and a needed bright spot.

Our two Turkey Burgers were way overcooked and dry as a bone.
author: Scott W J.

description: I am utterly shocked this place only has 3 stars. It is HUBERT KELLER (hello Top Chef fans, he is HILARIOUS) and the single most delicious milkshake in the world. As if they chopped up sunshine and added it to rainbows and happy and served it in a glass. Build your own burgers is convenient, but my salmon burger was dry so that is a negative. I didn't have a car/to park, so I had no inconvenience, we were sat right away, and because I was at a conference all day in the city, they let my coworker and I charge our phones the entire time. Great service. Oh, and its super casual, which was nice :)
author: Beth C.

description:
5- Ambiance-the view of Union Square!!! One of the only restaurants that has a view overlooking beautiful Union Square!!!

5-Love their milkshakes!!!!

Burgers and fries are good too!!!  A little on the heavier side but what do you expect when you order burger, fries and a shake!  

Great place to come when you have just finished a shopping spree downtown, or when you want to take kids out to lunch,  there aren't too many kid friendly places in the city, but this does the trick.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
This review is for the milkshakes only....they're awesome. The Caramel Latte and Nutella shakes are no joke. They're also pretty big so be sure to share. 

My main gripe is that $8.75 for a milkshake is a little ridiculous. But if you ignore the fact that this is a "celebrity chef restaurant," and that you're overpaying for blended milk and ice cream, you'll enjoy your experience a little more.
author: Shreya O.

description:
Couldn't believe how they converted that space into a restaurant.  I remembered working in domestics over 10 years ago at that Macy's... walking in that area trying to sell overpriced porcelain figurines to tourists!

I'd had heard some pretty good reviews of this place, and I was craving a burger so why not try it.  I ordered a buffalo burger with cheese, portabella mushrooms and peppered bacon.  The burger was season and cooked to order, mushrooms were tasty, bacon was well... awesome bacon.  A friend ordered a burger and also the onion rings.  Rings were crispy and not oily at all... the "skinny" fries (named after shape, not calorie count) were good as well.   Did not try the milkshakes since I overstuffed myself with burger, fries and onion rings.  

The service was fine.  I know many other Yelpers had bad experiences there, and I think they're reading the reviews because I felt everyone was uber (perhaps even creepily) nice.  The hostess asked my friend how her day was, what did she do that day, and why were we in the city within a 1 minute walk to our table.   But hey, that's cool... I'd rather have that then rude or slow service. 

Overall the place was good, but not somewhere I'd think of going to again.  The price point is a bit high for a burger (mine ended up costing around $24 because the buffalo burger pre-toppings was $16), even though I know you're paying for the Hubert Keller name and the Union Square views.
author: Angie M.

description:
Meh. To be fair it is located in tourist-central so everything is overpriced IMHO. The wait staff is a bit slow, and the food is mediocre. They do have a $60 burger  that you can buy which still mystifies me.

The one thing they have that's pretty unbeatable is freaking amazing milkshakes. Get one. Trust me.
author: Jason M.

description:
Why did I try this Burger Bar, when I know it was going to be mega expensive?  They have all the burgers, milkshakes, and fries goodness, but $15 for a burger? $8 for a milkshake? I can get better and tastier all american goodness at Nations or In n Out.  Plus, the waiter must have fallen into a coma because he forgot about us, and I had to get up to get someone else to help us.  

:(
author: Emily P.

description:
This place is a tourist trap and a rip off. The servers are not very intelligent, screwed up our order 2X, to the point where the waitress had to RETAKE the order,  and did NOTHING to remedy the situation. They charged $8 for my daughters mac and cheese which was kraft out of a box. Our buffalo burgers were around $22 -$24 each only adding 2 toppings. 

The bartenders do not know how to make cocktails local to the area, and don't know common brands of liquors. The food is decent but in no way justifies the absurdly high prices. 

The only good thing about this place is that it is easy to bring small children here compared to other places in the area so they get a star for that.

San Francisco is a huge food city w/ literally HUNDREDS of dining options so there is really no reason to waste your money here. 

I guess Thomas Keller has sold out and no longer cares about his reputation as a chef.
author: susan c.

description: Turkey sandwich was amazing! Prob one of my favorite turkey sandwich.  I also had the zucchini fries and they were amazing with ranch dressing. The view of union square is spectacular! This burger bar in inside Macy's.
author: Brian T.

description: The Hubert Burger was exquisite! Needless to say the best burger I've ever had! The price point is high for a burger joint but this is no ordinary burger joint! The atmosphere was lively and comfortable. The sweet potato fries are a must and the fried pickles are addictive;) I love coming her for date night with my hubbie or with a group of burger phening, milkshake (Nutella is my fav) drinking gal-pals! I'll be back...
author: Maria C.

description: Service was terrible.  Tea came with no ice.  When I asked for a glass of ice I got a glass of water.  When I asked for ice, I got a new ice tea that was a different color than the original ice tea I had.  The burger was dry, gross, and frankly not worth the price.  Did I mention how slow and terrible the service was?  There were not many people there...so they can't say they were busy.  I won't waste my time there again.
author: Kara O.

description: Burger Bar is exactly like what it sounds. It is a restaurant that has a bar like atmosphere that serves upscaled burgers. They have a variety of burgers for you to choose from and even a build your own burger option. Since this place is conveniently located in SF, there are also veggie burgers for the hippie folk. They also have plenty of beer and wine options to compliment your burger. What I like best about this place is the way it is set up. Plenty of TVs around for you to watch the game and they even have booths with their private TV. The only bad thing I would say is the price, which is expected from a restaurant in SF. Your average burger is going to cost 10-15 and the Kobe one is 20. Overall, I would recommend this place for the experience, but as a casual place to come with your friends expect to come with some deep pockets.
author: Owie N.

description:
The first time I tried Burger Bar the experience was great. I had the veggie burger and the beer battered pickles. My friend had the Kobe burger and a milkshake. The food was very good, especially their milkshakes. 

The reason for giving Burger Bar only 2 stars is because the second time that we went (this evening) the service was a joke. We came here for a family birthday and I called 2 weeks ahead to make a reservation for a semi private booth. We got there and we were seated in the middle of the busiest area right in front of the milkshake making station. We waited 1 hour to get the booth that we had originally reserved because we wanted a little bit less noise and more privacy for a birthday dinner. 

Pros: 
-Our 2nd server was friendly 
-they gave us a free appetizer because they messed up the reservation than 2 free milkshakes because we complained to the manager
-the food was good
-the girl in the grey sweater who seated us again was very kind
-the location and view is great especially during the winter holiday season

Cons:
-Most of the snooty servers including the manager couldn't care less about what we had to say at the end of dinner (we complained at the end)
-When we were ordering we couldn't even finish ordering because the server would run off when he thought we were done (this happened 3 or 4 times) so we ended up ordering 3 milkshakes (he ran off) 20 minutes later the milkshakes came...we wanted 2 more so again another 20 minute wait  before he showed up and than another 20 until the milkshakes actually arrived. 
-we were there for a total of 3 hours
- we had to walk the bill up to the waiter even after we complained about the bad service and the place was half empty ( I have no idea where they were running off to or why) 


Hubert Keller would have been ashamed of how his staff (especially his manager a brown haired european gentleman) were representing the good Hubert Keller name. I have a lot of respect for his cooking but we will never ever go to the Burger Bar again. This experience has turned us off, no matter how good the food is paying $200 is just not worth getting treated like crap.
author: stephanie w.

description:
Probably about 2.5 stars.  

I was getting really hungry after shopping one day and needed protein, so I decided to try the Burger Bar. I admit I was also intrigued by their build your own milkshake/sundae option. (Hey, there's protein in ice cream, right??) It was fairly busy that Saturday afternoon (no big shocker there), so my husband and I ate at the bar.  Now, I don't expect a bartender to be fully conversed in the details on a restaurant's menu, but I guess I expect a certain level of awareness.  And heck, if you don't know, just say so.  I asked the bartender about the peanut butter topping and whether it was just plain peanut butter, or some sort of PB-based sauce.  He thought it was the latter, but it was just plain ol' peanut butter. That was a disappointment.

Okay, so he didn't know that much. Fine, I'm not going to dock them points for that.  But when the sundae came it was... lackluster.  I didn't feel there was a good ice cream to topping ratio.  And the chocolate sauce was only so-so. I'm not expecting Ghirardelli hot fudge, but I was still left unimpressed. Oh well. I doubt I'll go back and brave the tourists unless I'm desperate.
author: Jennie M.

description:
I didn't have huge expectations coming in here...I just wanted a good burger and decided to treat my boyfriend one day after work. This place had been recommended, but I doubt I'll be back. 

First off, the place clearly is a touristy haven. You get a good view if you're by the windows...but I was not. No big deal, wasn't going for the view. They had hard cider on tap, which is always a plus for me, so I got a Magners and happily sipped while I decided which of the 40 or so toppings I wanted on my burger. 

Boyfriend got a cheeseburger with bacon, I got avocado, bacon, and...something else. That'd be part of the problem. The burger was okay, but it wasn't anything special. Size was decent, but you can spend less and get more. 

Fat fries were okay. Sweet potato fries were tasty. Just doesn't have a vibe or quality I really prefer. No problem to find a better spot to eat, especially in the Union Square area. 

Spent about 50 bucks for the two of us.
author: Jamie B.

description:
Burger Bar met all my expectations (except a teensy expensive for what you are getting) and I would definitely go back. 

I ordered the sliders with skinny fries and both had great taste, not fatty at all, and a good portion. I wish I had saved enough room for dessert because their dessert list looked fabulous (a 6-mini milkshake sampler! a dessert burger!).

The only thing I would say is that only 1 out of our 3 servers had good customer service (yes, they kept rotating our servers). The other 2 we had to keep waving down to get our attention, they didn't check on us at all and when they cleared our drinks didn't ask if we wanted more. But the one good server did everything right and made up for the other two. 

Can't wait to go back and try the dessert!
author: LuLu M.

description: Very disappointed with the slow service.  The food is still good, but the reason for the one star rating is no regret or appology from the manager.  He didn't even appreciate that I'm a regular
author: Shadi K.

description: Went here after trying to get the attention of a stinky Cheesecake Factory hostess- (in the same building on union square) .  Couldn't be happier that we ended up here- the food was great, the waitress outstanding she  spent a few minutes talking with us giving us some tips - in turn a great  tip for her.... Great onion rings! Would return and recommend highly to anyone wanting a nice hamburger dinner with an assortment of beers
author: Chris S.

description: I am an all American guy, and I like my burgers thick and my beer cold. Burger bar hit the ball out of the park with the peppercorn burger and the sweet potato fries. It is kind of hard to justify a $15 hamburger but they hit the nail on the head and the view is outstanding. When you have Sierra Nevada on draft and sports going with that view it deserves 5 stars.
author: J.P. H.

description:
There's two choices; build your own which seemed like a lot of work at the end of the day, or a predefined burger.  I ordered a classic and a beer.  The beer, which was from Napa Valley, was excellent.  The burger, which was first delivered to the wrong table, so what, was good but not great.  The price for a burger and a beer was $30.

I don't know about you but I can do a lot better for $30.

Good, but not great, and expensive.
author: Andrew W.

description:
The antidote for slow/bad service and/or long waits: go during odd hours (too late for lunch, too early for dinner) & don't go on obviously busy days (fri, sat, sun.) It isn't rocket science.

Earlier this week (on a weekday), I took my Mom to Burger Bar for a late lunch with a view (which our table by the window provided.) The restaurant was only about 25% full. No wait, excellent, fast service.

Neither of us are strict vegetarians nor are we hardcore carnivores; we wanted the best of both worlds so we shared:
* SF Vegan (grilled roma tomatoes, eggplant, zucchini & peppers sandwiched between two portobello caps): as a former sometimes-vegetarian, I give this "burger" two thumbs up. 
* black angus burger (well done) w/ avocado, caramelized onion & cheddar on a sesame seed bun: I've had some rockstar burgers recently & BB's ranks directly below those (that's a compliment, if you're reading between the lines.) I would get this exact combination again.
* Irish Creme milkshake: I'll never look at Irish Creme the same way again. Alcohol & dairy mixes really well in this amazing concoction.
* sweet potato fries- just so-so. Could have used a little more seasoning, but otherwise pretty crunchy on the outside & nice & potatoey on the inside. I asked for their aioli & that made it A-OK.
* Total: $41 (not including tip)

I cannot wait to come back & try: their Twinkie milkshake, the Peppercorn Burger, Surf & Turf burger, Beer Battered Pickles, their different bacons, etc. I'll have to see when my Mom is available for another lunch/gossip combo!

And the antidote to cheaper burgers: Don't eat at Burger Bar; before even walking through the door, you already know it's some gourmet, frou frou, overpriced eats made even pricier because it's made by a celebrity chef in one of the higher rent areas of SF. If you can accept that, then you'll have a delicious, wonderful BB experience. If you can't, stick to crapass Whoppers, Double Doubles & Big Macs.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Burgers. I love really delicious burgers. Not when they're $20+ though.

I came here for my friend's birthday a month back. It was my first time but after reading my fellow Yelpers' reviews, I was already set on getting the sliders (3 mini burgers) with sweet potato fries. I really liked that it didn't cost extra to have sweet potato rather than regular skinny fries.

Anyway, my boyfriend ordered sweet potato fries with his burger as well but they mixed up and gave him regular fries. After letting them know, they brought out his sweet potato fries and also let him keep the regular ones as well! More for me! Hehe

One of my friend's asked for her meat to be cooked 'medium rare' but when it came out, it was bloody red. She asked them to re-do it politely but when it came back out 20 minutes later, it was WELL-DONE. Like..SUPER WELL-DONE. I don't know what was their problem...either the cook was just pissed off with her or they forgot about it on the stove. Anyway, she decided not to have it and asked our waiter to take it off her tab. The waiter offered her another drink and she accepted. 

Everything else went smoothly but I probably won't be back. It's not really worth it. :p
author: Judith L.

description:
Wow.. This place was a bit of a disappointment... 
 
Came here on a Saturday around 4 pm.  We ordered drinks and they took almost 25 minutes to come out!  Two of the drinks were bottled beers!!  When the drinks began to arrive they came one at a time several minutes apart.  And the bottled beers were the last to come out! 
 We had told our sever that we needed to be downstairs to our bus at 515 and hoped our food would be ready in time.  He said no problem your burgers should only take 15 minutes.  Well, that was not the case.  It took almost 30 minutes for our food which  by then has just requested to be boxed up since it was just after 5 and we still had to get through the crowds of people and down the elevator and across the street on a Saturday during Christmas shopping season!  Luckily our bus driver waited for us to arrive.  
 The burgers were not bad but from this experience and one we had earlier in the day I became a little put off by some of the San Francisco restaurants.  This day made me think twice about coming to sf to dine and shop again (especially during the holiday season).
author: Audra M.

description:
I don't recommend ordering food from the bar. Not only was I passed up many times by people that just arrived, they were sending plates to people that weren't even ordering. Those that did order ended up getting. Not a huge deal because it was really busy and I sympathize with the overwhelmed staff. What I don't understand is a place named "Burger Bar" that doesn't allow you to order how you want your burger cooked (i.e. medium rare). Surely a place that has "Burger" in its company title specializes in burgers right? Wrong! 

If you like to drink with a nice view of Union Square, Burger Bar's for you. If you're looking for a solid burger I don't recommend this place, especially for the price you pay.
author: R B.

description: 4 stars for the service. Not the food. Had the spicy burger and so not worth the price. I might as well make a plain burger and throw on some Hans myself. But glad I tried anyway cuz I'll never know right? Still searching for that one burger that will knock my socks off
author: chi l.

description: Nothing quite satisfies like a burger when you return from an extended trip overseas.  I only wish the "medium well" was actually medium well.  Oh well.  A burger is still a burger.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Review by G. as I only had a salad at B.B.

Me- Greg, how would you rate your burger at the Burger Bar?
G.- It was great!
Me- How many stars would you give it?
Him- I would give it 5 stars.
Me- So you're saying it's as good as Father's Office? (Santa Monica)
Him- Well it was really good. Maybe 4 1/2 stars.
author: Carnley P.

description:
You can spend a lot of money at this place. I just wanted to start this review out saying that this isn't a cheap burger place...and that's ok. Just know that going in. 

I was thoroughly impressed with this place. I built my own burger with Angus beef, ciabatta, avocado, caramelized onions, and cheese (I forget which kind). My burger didn't turn out overly expensive, but it wouldn't be to hard to get a $20 burger. I got the sweet potato fries and my wife got the skinny fries, both really good! Some of the premade burgers looked great, and I'll have to come back for those. 

All in all, I can't imagine a much better place to enjoy a late lunch after a day futzing around Union Square, as long as you are prepared to spend some coin (and if you are futzing around US, you likely have already done so). Less wait time, less noise and better food than the Cheesecake Factory right above it.
author: Scott C.

description:
Ok- I heard about this place while I was at a swim meet and overheard a coach rave it. 
So I decided to try it out- the Kobe burger seems interesting. It's $16.50 with NO sides or trimmings- that's a crap load of money for a college kid. Burger was juicy- bread had no flavor, but compared with the Kobe- it is hard. 
Sides are ordered separately, wish I knew this because my burger was lonely.
Service is slow... So I'm waiting for my check. Ok just got it. And guess what?
I'm still hungry!
author: Jenn H.

description:
Found Burger Bar via the internet severaal months ago, prior to my trip to San Francisco. Decided it was a place I wanted to visit. 

Glad I did. 

Sat at the bar not wanting to take up a table. Enjoyed a Samuel Adams beer with a Veggie Burger and side salad. While a vegie burger does not have the 'density as a meat burger does, this was very good and really very filling. Salad was good also. Travis the bartender/wait person was friendly and did a good job. 

Really, the only thing surprising was the price of the beer ($7), but then again, this is a big city, so it should be expected. 

A great place to dine, definately will be back!
author: Terri S.

description:
Decent burger joint. It gets EXTREMELY crowded on a weekend though. It's located inside Macy's Union Square store where pretty much all tourist visit. I recommend making reservations if you plan on having lunch here. Prices are a bit on the higher side, but that's because they serve alcohol and have a bar inside too. 

Service was great, but I did come with my client and he was a regular there. All the servers knew him, so we had good seats and didn't have to wait long for our burgers to arrive. I had the hawaiian chicken burger and it was so-so. I luv anything with pineapple in it, so I enjoyed that part. However, the chicken was a bit tough for me to sink my teeth into. 

I would say this place is average.
author: Joanne T.

description:
I gave Burger Bar 3 Stars because it's your typical over-priced burger joint.  You're there because of location, convenience when you're shopping in Union Square, and you want a place to sit and relax a bit.  My husband ordered the Peppercorn Burger and I had the American Classic.  Our burgers were cooked perfectly medium-- juicy and not overcooked.  It came with fries and we asked for an onion ring replacement.  The onion rings were delicious. Crispy and thick!  Each plate ran about $15 to $17 bucks.  Pretty pricey for an A-OK burger--if you ask me.  But then again, I've been lucky enough to have eaten the All-Mighty "Office Burger" from Father's Office in Los Angeles....which will ruin you for all burger moments to come.  

We sat at the bar and the bartender was pretty good.  Did his job, polite and helpful.  Can't ask for more.  It was a bit over priced for what you get, I wouldn't come back here.
author: Jacky F.

description:
Went here for lunch after staying in the city for a Girls Night Out.  It definitely hit the spot after a long night of drinking and partying. :)

Probably the closest "gourmet burger" comparison for me is The Counter, and this place is so much better!  It's exactly the gourmet burger experience that I expected from Counter that they did not deliver.

I got the Kobe burger with swiss cheese and sauteed portobello mushrooms.  We also got both the skinny fries and the sweet potato fries...both were good but the sweet potato fries were my favorite.

Definitely a great stop if you're in the union square area.
author: Arlene M.

description: Not impressed. Fries were alright. Burger was sub par. The Nutella shake tasted nothing like Nutella. Decent selection of beers on draft ( the ones that they had). I will never go back simply because of how bad the service was. You want the best burger? Santa Monica. Father's office. Hands down.
author: Tori W.

description:
Bad place, tourist trap.  Should have known better.  
I suppose it may be worth it if they seat you by the window.  But we walked in for early dinner, place was half empty, and got a booth by the bathroom.  Food was nothing to write home about - bf got a large grilled shrimp salad for $12.75.  The dish was 5 (five!) medium shrimp on a bed of greens. Boring.
author: Alina C.

description: The burgers here are delicious! Wow, I am still thinking about the Kobe burger-so good! The servings are plentiful, even though they are pricey. However, you do get an amazing view  and your right at Union Square.  I just wonder why there was a large open space where more tables could have easily been added, and  yet  there were people outside waiting to be seated.
author: Anne G.

description: 4 stars for a burger joint. ...just steer clear of that surf and turf burger; it's WAY overrated and a bit tough.
author: Venice Beach Dad K.

description: Tourist spot. Had a salad and mini burger sliders just to play it safe. Waiter was too busy with all kinds of stuff other than helping customers :) The view is stunning, that is about it!
author: Ray K.

description: WOW. That was the best burger I've had!!! AND IT HAD A GOOD VIEW! BOOM! Lol I got the chance to sit over by the huge window and look out to see the awesomeness outside of Union Square, then I devoured my mini burgers and omg, it was all sorts of awesome in my mouth. MUAHAHA! What a great way to end my day. The service was great here and I must say, by it just being a burger bar, it had a classy feel to it. That I very much enjoy! I'll definitely come back!
author: Marevie T.

description:
The place was a burger haven for those that like burgers. Honestly I wasn't impressed with the food. It was moderately priced for the standard burgers and got more expensive for the fancy burgers. If you don't like hamburgers don't go here because there isn't much else to eat. 
We had a part of about 8 and received terrible service. It was faster for us to go to the bar and order drinks then wait for the waitress to show up. I probably wouldn't go back there on my own accord.
author: Adam S.

description:
Just say the word "burger" and I'll come running down the street faster than Usain Bolt at the Bejing Olympics.  Thats right people, I am a full fledged burger fanatic.  I eat burgers, I sleep burgers and sometimes I even double fist burgers (although not too often).  So when the opportunity came up to have a burger and a beer at the famed Burger Bar in San Francisco, I simply could not have said no.

Now for those of you peeps out there who don't know, Burger Bar is Hubert Keller's take on an modern gastropub.  They've got tons of beers, wines galore, and gourmet burgers, so for a burger fanatic like myself it begs the question "what's not to love?"

Well for starters this place is expensive, yeah you can build your own burger and make it just the way you like it, but when it was all said and done my burger came to a whopping $23 and thats before beer, tax, tip, and a second tax deemed the "sf health tax" (WTF).

Anyways I went with the Kobe Burger, and topped it off with blue cheese, carmelized onions and a little aioli for some added fun.  Now while it was a pretty good burger it just didn't do it for me.  I guess I'm spoiled with all the fabulous burger joints we have in LA or maybe I was just stuck on the fact that this burger was way too expensive and not worth the 23 dollar price tag.  

Overall I would say that I expected more from this place and was a bit disappointed in what I got.  I do have to say that they have an amazing selection of beers so if you enjoy great beer and don't mind spending 30 to 40 bucks then you will probably like this place.  As for me...I will probably not be coming back!
author: Michael C.

description: World's Hottest Burger! enough said! Howza
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Best Kobe burger EVER! My other 3 dining companions agreed. Glad we found this place 6th floor Macys Union Square.
author: Kelli W.

description: Food and service was great!  I was able to get my burger topped with a fried egg and it was fantastic.  The view of union square was awesome.  My only complaint is that the tables are really crammed together, it feels like you are eating with the people next to you.
author: Ernesto P.

description:
Service 2 Stars.

I mainly went to eat there and sat @ the Bar b/c the Giants Game was on. Since I'm not a Huge fan of burgers, I'm giving the burger a 2 star.

Siting @ the bar sucks.. it smells..

Fries, Burger + water = $20 w/ Tip. 

pricey.
author: Emily L.

description: The BAD service outweighed the excellent but overpriced meal. A real turnoff. I love Herbert too, was sad about the experience. I had a reservation so no wait to speak of.  Staff very confused on who ordered what.. With the food AND the milkshake service. My friend was missing items that she ordered. The guy who took our order hardly came back, ever. Other staff were trying to cover for him. THEN left us hanging at the end of the meal for WAY too long to get our check. FINALLY we get our check (from someone else) and then the prodigal server pops up w/ the check. We were finished, too little too late. Word of Advise: KICK UP THE SERVICE!
author: Jill D.

description:
A pretty restaurant in a good location.  A little on the pricey side, especially given that the food wasn't anything special.  Nice views of Union Square, if you can get a table next to the windows.  Rest of the restaurant is a little crowded, with the tables a bit close together.

Wasn't a bad experience, as we were seated within 5 minutes even though they said it would be longer.  Waiter was prompt and delivered our drinks and took our order quickly.  Food was ready in a good amount of time given how busy it was.

Burgers are on the pricey side, and nothing to write home about.  Had both skinny fries & sweet potato fries, both of which were average at best.  I'd agree that they undercook their burgers a little bit, so you might want to ask for your burger cooked little more done than you normally ask for.  Did not order any drinks, but did see some of the milkshakes presented, which looked great.

Overall, a decent experience, but given the location and prices, was hoping for better food.
author: Steve C.

description:
My brother's birthday is coming up and he's been wanting to try this place so I figured why not. We head over to Macy's on a pretty nice Tuesday evening. It was surprisingly empty  but I figure it's a Tuesday night.

I decided to stick to a simple burger and got the Country Natural burger (under build your own) on a ciabatta. My brother got the same and my husband for the American Classic (he loves his bacon). My brother and I both got sweet potato fries. 

Man for the price and for the hype (since it is Hubert Keller), I really expected a lot more from that first bite into the burger. But there was nothing special or amazing about it at all. It was pretty messy and not even that well constructed. When the bill came, I almost fell off my high stool and into sheer convulsions. I couldn't believe how much we just paid for 3 burgers. I would rather go to In-N-Out and then go buy myself a nice pair of shoes with the rest of the money I just saved. Guaranteed I am not coming back unless someone wants to pay for my overpriced burger. Sorry Hubert. Maybe when I make my first 6-figure salary I'll give Fleur de Lys a try.
author: Lang T.

description: So my family and I came to have dinner here. I was looking forward to their burgers and it was just average nothing spectacular. I got the Nutella milkshake I didn't care for it. My meal was just ok I think red robins is better I don't know what's the big deal of these average burgers are. My meal was over $20 it's not about the $ but if it's going to cost that much make it delicious and it was ok nothing to rave about. I won't be back unless I really have to.
author: arlene d.

description: I love the place... It has a nice view of the Union Square.  The host was friendly. The waitress we had Lauren I guess her name took a wee... bit of time getting our  order for the drink. We have  a large party so probably she got overwhelm...(but definitely not an excuse). Everybody seems to enjoyed the burger but my complain is that I ordered a slider it suppose to come with cheese... no cheese in it. Will come back with family next time it might be a different experience...
author: Ailynne P.

description: I don't have high standards for service. Bring my stuff and don't leave me hanging on a drink refill. That's about it. But at a place that is willing to put a $60 price tag on a burger, I expect you to have the service to back that up. The server took the time to take our cook orders and almost none of the seven people in my party asked for the same thing, we had a range from medium rare, medium, medium well, to well. They also charge extra for various types of beef and for non-hormone fed beef, etc. With these incredibly customized orders, the delivery of the food was a joke. A guy, not our server, came out and basically just threw seven burgers at us without announcing at all which was which. The person next to me got a bun with a giant thumbprint pressed into it. Seriously? I have no idea if I got the regular Angus beef or the non-hormone-fed beef I ordered (and paid extra for). You cannot do that. I even asked the server if she could tell the difference between my non-hormone classic burger and the Angus classic someone else got and she could not say for sure. So we both just ate what was in front of us with no idea whether we were getting what we ordered. The burgers are good. The onion rings are good. The milkshakes look really impressive. But I would never go here again or recommend that anyone do so. If you cannot be guaranteed you're even going to get what you ordered, with the cook you ordered, then it's all a waste of time and money.
author: Resident E.

description:
The best burger you can have in Macy's! Actually the burgers are quite good even if you had them somewhere other than on the 6th floor of a department store. The sweet potato fries are great, and a must get. 

Nice views of union square too!
author: Dave S.

description: Burger Bar seems to be Hurbert Keller's take on the divey burger joint. The ambiance is certainly forgettable, as you pretty much have been to this place before. Service is OK, as the staff seems somewhat poorly managed. The food, on the other hand is excellent. Not a place for vegetarians. The only reason to come here is to build your own burger. One of the things I like is you can have an egg on your burger.
author: Michael B.

description:
I love trying new burgers in the city, so why not patronize the much talked about Burger Bar? I ordered the Black Jack Burger and my friend had the American Kobe Beef burger. In sum: not bad, but definitely does not live up to the hype of the establishment. Biggest disappointment was that both our burgers were overcooked. My medium rare came out medium well and my friend's medium well came out well, well done (big bummer for her when spending $16.50 for a hamburger). 

Not all was a bust. We ordered a chocolate milkshake which was AMAZING. Definitely worth the $8! The atmosphere and view are nice (we were fortunate to be seated by the window), and the service was also great. We agreed that we would definitely come back to sit at the bar and order the "grown up" milkshake (they have liquor addition options that we can't wait to try). 

All in all, with a pretty commercial place in the toursity Union Square, you walk in knowing that the best places aren't in the high traffic zones. If want the fun view, come to Burger Bar. If you want a killer burger, I definitely recommend walking the extra 4 blocks down to Pearl's!
author: Monica M.

description:
I usually don't try places with a 3 star Yelp rating but I decided to try this place anyways..especially since Cheesecake was busy (as always) and I was hungry and there wasn't a wait.

The burgers were decent. Nothing super amazing but not as bad as some other places with burgers, say- a diner. As for ambiance, I was a little bit surprised as I was expecting more of a lounge feel because that's what it seemed like from the outside when you're staring at it from Union Square. It really was just a big sports bar/restaurant. Was over priced and nothing fancy. 

Would probably come back.....  if I was seriously hungry .. like if I was too lazy to wait at CheesecakeFactory and the food court downstairs were closed.... and since I'm already inside and too lazy to walk .
author: Mila B.

description: Despite this place is in one of the worst areas for good food in the city, there are a few things at burger bar that are reasonable. I've had the thomas keller burger a couple times and I have to say, it's pretty good. In general portions are always way too much food.
author: Ken S.

description:
3.5

DRINK/FOOD:
Just came up for a drink at the bar, and I looked through the menu. But I definitely would not want a $22 burger. 


SERVICE:
The bartender wasn't very warm or friendly. The girl bartender was though. Except I think she got my drink wrong. Eh... 


ATMOSPHERE:
Kinda cool, it's high up, and you can see a view of Union Square out the window. It's too bad they don't have food that I'd want to come back for. But maybe I'll come back for a drink or dessert.
author: Angela L.

description: Good place for a date..lots of milkshake selections and great burgers with many extra toppings. i will be back for sure.
author: Terrence T.

description:
Hmmmm....I was very intimidated to try this place. I thought it would be way to trendy for me. I'm more a Dinners, Drive-ins, and Dives kind of girl. 

I live in a small Az town....So, something I learned after spending a week in San Fran.....Eat dinner during Happy Hour. 

First, the view!! It was a clear day, and it was spectacular. I'm very much an "enjoy the view" person. 

As I said, it's Happy Hour, so we ordered the appetizer specials...All 5 of them, to share. 

The pulled pork potato skins where fabulous. Very tasty. Also, to my surprise, the chicken wings. They were crisp and had just enough heat. I didn't like the sliders, they were not cooked enough for me. 

Service was OK.
author: Kari D.

description: Came here last week for a friend BD. The place was nice, up on the 6th floor in Macy Bld. We had our table near the window, pretty nice scenery. ...had couple of shots and beers, ordered Le Frog Burger..... taste like any other regular burger.....maybe I was drunk........
author: Ben B.

description:
Upscale of the up-scales, the Burger Bar delivers haute cuisine to the common hamburger. Try to pronounce hamburger like Steve Martin did in the Pink Panther movie remake. All guttural and entirely unintelligible, and extremely funny. HAMbuerrrgrrrl, Haamburggger! No you fool! It's HAmmmburrr-glerrrr! That will take the pretense out of any restaurant. But you have to do it without laughing. I fail every time.

The food here is good, the regular burgers are well priced, but the specialty burgers go up to $60! Gadzooks man! You can get a whole tank of gas even for a Giant SUV for close to $60! Specialties aside, we got the Country Burger for me, and the Salmon for my friend. We were both 'appy with our food, I got the skinny fries and she got a side salad. Priced just right at $$, the service was extremely good. 

I will come again when I am in town with someone else's money,  maybe a huge expense account. 

Oh, and one more thing. On the 6th floor of Macy's. What's up with that?
author: Riley W.

description:
I was so excited to try Burger Bar! I had been wanting to go for quite some time, especially after going to Fleur de Lys and loving that place. 

We ordered the kobe beef burger and the buffalo sliders. I enjoyed my sliders, but the kobe beed burger was just "meh". We expected something remarkable about it, but it tasted just like any other burger. I'm assuming it's because Kobe loses what it's known for when it's ground up: tenderness. It was no where near worth the $16 price tag. The sliders were enjoyable, but didn't have anything about them that made me go "wow!". I'm sorry to say it, but I think places like "The Counter" on the Peninsula make it hard to enjoy this place.
author: Amanda D.

description:
a favorite spot of the boyfriend and mine. although the burgers are quite pricey...you get what you pay for. Kobe beef burgers around $15 then your additional toppings  can get a little pricey but very decliciouso! All burgers come with your choice of bun: wheat, onion, ciabatta, seasame (to name a few) and lettuce, tomato, and a pickle. If Kobe beef aint your thing, they have several other choices of meats including chicken and a salmon patty if meat ain't your thang. Starter menu items include salads, soup, fish & chips. Dessert items are fab! They also include build your own shake, if your into that stuff.

With my burger, I always order the sweet potato fries and Abita's Purple Haze beer. This beer is amazing! Berry infused beer, very girlie :)

Love the view of union square, daytime or nighttime. I have ate here several times usually around dinner time, and there is always a wait on the weekends. However, the boyfriend and I usually catches a seat at the bar to watch a game.

Service is great too! Recommend this joint if you are craving a burger while shopping downtown!
author: Aileen F.

description: Food was plain, drinks took a long time and we had to ask several times for utensils (I ended up going to an empty table and get some). To say the least service was not that great.
author: Juliana G.

description:
I really want to give this place 4 stars.  The meat of the burger was the best meat I've had.  But, the bun was too big for the meat, if it was a touch less doughy, it would have been the perfect burger.

I don't like the fact that all the toppings cost money, but to be fair they're fairly cheap. 

The milkshakes are a little bit pricey, and the amount of ice cream definitely did not validate how much they were.

The reason this place gets 3 stars is that the service was absolutely horrible.

I mean, the majority is a bar, why is it so damn hard to serve tables.  My friends waited 20 minutes to be served (I arrived late, which then became on time)

After ordering, food took 40 minutes.

Then I made the horrible horrible mistake of ordering a shake midway through eating.

One of our friends took a long time to eat... to say the least.  Probably, 25 minutes.  By the time our food was long done the shake finally came.

And then it took another 30 minutes to get our bill.  Absolutely ridiculous.  I have no problems with celebrity chefs, but running restaurants is not about waiting for lines it's all about the experience.  When you experience bad wait staff, people take notice.

I definitely liked the food here and I will go back one more time, but if they fucking have bad service again, it will be inexcusable.
author: Adrian E.

description:
Although I do give Burger Bar 4 stars, I probably won't be going back any time soon. The food was good and it IS worth a try. But when I can go elsewhere and get a nice, big, tasty burger for cheap, why come here? 

I had the surf and turf. I figured if I'm going to spend 20 bucks on a burger, might as well go all out. My burger had a nice piece of meat with a couple pieces of lobster and grilled asparagus. One of the lobster pieces was pretty tough to chew, but, all in all, it was pretty damn good!

One menu item that caught my attention was the SF Vegan burger. It's a breadless "burger" with eggplant, zucchini, peppers, and some other veggies between 2 portabello mushrooms. If I could fit all that with a meat patty in a burger bun, that'd be AH-mazing! My friend ended up ordering the SF Vegan. Hers, of course, with a side of bacon.

My sister went with a regular burger with avocado. She was satisfied with her choice.

So, go ahead, give it a try! I definitely recommend going with one of their specialty items, though.
author: Lisa G.

description:
We were invited to join our son at the Burger Bar for his birthday. The reservation was made for a Sunday night 2 weeks in advance. Upon arrival we ended up waiting an hour for our table because an error was made with the reservation. Once we were sat the service was terrible. The food was pretty good but it took forever to get anything ordered and delivered. The overall experience was extremely disappointing and the staff including the manager could care less. 

It is also worth mentioning that when I went to use the bathroom it was a complete mess and there were no paper towels to dry your hands. Being that it is a restaraunt, it would be useful to be able to wash and dry your hands prior to eating. I did mention it to the staff but again, they seemed to care less.

This was my first and last time going to this restaurant. I would never recommend it.
author: Shana S.

description:
This place caters more to tourists and is pricey. If you're all for building your own meal and know what will make a tasty burger then do so, as that is what this place is known for.. The few times I've been here, I always go with one of the ready mades. 

All in all, nice service, awesome view of Union square if you sit by the windows and not a bad burger.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Awesome food - HORRIBLE service!!!

Bar was not too crowded but took a while to get the bartender to even glance our way.  Several empty tables yet we had to wait an hour to eat on  Saturday night.  Manager had to come over and wait on us because the waitress was too busy and when she finally made it over, she asked if we needed anything, we told her ketchup and an ice tea and she NEVER returned, except of course to give us the bill.  It was awful.

That being said, the food was sooo good!  Milkshakes with alcohol, now you can't beat that.  It's unfortunate that the horrible service is what I remember the most.  It seems these days that most places in the city have an arrogant wait staff, makes staying in seem more appealing.
author: Tara R.

description:
Great atmosphere. Met Hubert Keller. Very friendly and thanked us for coming.

Make sure you get the sweet potato fries, don't waste your time with anything else. 

also PLEASE order your burger RARE--otherwise just go to mcdonalds and eat their crap. 

service was sketchy--slow and confused. to their credit they were only open for two days before i ate there.
author: Brian B.

description: Burger way over cooked and way over priced....ice tea was pricy and except for the brown color I couldn't even tell it was tea at all. I definitely felt like I was had :-(
author: Wendy A.

description: We were roaming the area for some place casual to eat but with great food. Stumbled across this bar and it was amazing. Great bar. Burgers are good. On the pricey side but what do you expect from a gourmet burger place?
author: Jessica K.

description:
What happens when you step out of G-star, bags in hand, smile on your face, but a grumble in your tummy? You desperately think of the closest dinning options and head there PRONTO. 

Burger Bar seemed like a decent option. Within walking distance, reservations available in the next 10 min on the OpenTable app, and hopefully quick service. 

I was contemplating something on the alternative portion of the menu (ie. turkey, garden or salmon burger) but then thought why the hell am I here if it's not to eat a 'real' burger? So I opted for the Jack Black burger, medium rare, with a salad instead of fries. Good thing I opted out of the fries, because my fiances fries came out cold and stale! Hahaha. Burger was good, nothing too special, and overall experience was okay. Service was a bit lacking and food took a little while to finally make it's way over to us. But when you're desperate, hey... beggars can't be choosers! Next time we will prep a little bit more before making our SF dinning option!
author: Miyako L.

description:
Been to this SF location this weekend for a private party event. Visited the Vegas location in the Mandalay Hotel as well. This one by far had a much better atmosphere, easier layout and MUCH more attentive staff. 
Burgers are suprem-o as far as the fresh quality ingredients. Fell in LOVE with the deep-fried jalapeno pickles. I thought i was biting into a perfectly tender potato wedge, and BAM!! I got a snooki-sized pickle  lol...
Unless you are specifically looking for this destination, may be hard to find as it is located on the 6 th floor of Macy's on Geary. Beautiful  panaroamic views of Union Square with a VIP view of the city sights below. 
All in all, a great burger spot!
author: Gina M.

description: Dude Don't do it. In and out makes a better burger. the charged me $8 dollars for a shake that was served in a shot glass. I got ripped off, Fenton's ice cream milk Shakes are less expensive and the cup is huge. i wont go back. i don't know the deal but it feels like one of those places were you just loan out your name out for 20% of the profit.  C'mon Fleur DE Lys
author: Robert C.

description:
I went here with my girlfriends on a Saturday night after work because we wanted something good and we wanted it fast. Here's my quick take on it...

One star for fast seating

One star for mini television screens playing sport highlights in booths (World Cup baby!!!!)

One star for the view - inside and out

One star for the amazing dance mix they had playing - forget eating lets just get up on these tables and start dancing!
author: Cynthia P.

description: Good view of union square, good fries, cute bartender/waitresses but probably the saltiest burger I've ever had and bun was super dry, kinda pricey for what you get. No need to go back
author: Jimmy A.

description: The ambiance and energy are great. Found the food to be pricey and below average. The chicken on my Cesar was dry and     chewy. My friends buffalo burger was just so-so. Nothing impressive. But our bill plus tip (and 2 cocktails) was $90!!!!
author: gina b.

description:
The first thing I text my friend when I sat down was:

"Do not come to Burger Bar if you have a hangover, suffer from lack of sleep and/or have a headache. It's like a bad club at BJ's"

Burrrrnnnnn.

Wholeheartedly agree with anyone who came to Burger Bar because you like Hubert Keller but was disappointed.

It was really loud in there. Great place to get your fist pump on (really. There was tons of fist pumping going on) - not so great if you just want to have a nice, semi-quiet evening. Burger Bar reminds me of a more expensive TGIF's/BJ's. Not a good thing.

The service was good. Nothing bad to say there :)

The food was above average. Typical diner food with a few Fleur De Lys-inspired splurges (foie gras, truffles, sauces, etc). But to me, a burger is a burger, no matter what you put on it.

Unless...

IT'S FLEUR DE LYS BLACK TRUFFLE SAUCE ($5.00 additional)!!!!

My one piece of advice is splurge on this sauce. My boyfriend got the truffle sauce and I ended up getting the red wine sauce, which wasn't nearly as tasty as the truffle sauce.

Yea, we pretty much shared it (enough for 2 people) and dipped just about everything in it - burger, bun, foie gras, fries, yum, yum yum!

Absolutely love their extensive alcohol menu too.

I liked the food but I was expecting a bit more from Burger Bar. I'd recommend it this place for a group of friends or coworkers but definitely not a first date kinda place.

And I'm not a fan of your run-of-the-mill burger joints, which I feel Burger Bar is. The only thing that sets this place apart from others is their offerings of the more high end ingredients.

But if you're going to go to Burger Bar to try the foie gras or truffle sauce, why not just try Fleur De Lys? :)

We'll be back --- when the moons align again.
author: T L.

description:
patty, meat, lettuce, pickle, tomato = 11 dollars. plain. wtf o_o
no cheese
boooooooooo
author: Trang B.

description:
top of macy's...below cheesecake factory....burgar bar...time passing from popular openning day...no crowds and no wait....extensive beer menu....chimay, duvel, arrogant bastard ale and other fancy....broad range of burgers with topping selections a la carte if desired to right...prefabricated burgers with skinny fries left.....fancy beautiful milkshake and sundae creations popular...

selecting prefabricated option...american classic or classic american....basic bacon and cheese burger medium rare....juicy burger served with plenty of good fries....moist and thick patty...juices dripping....great burger and fries....deep fried zuchinni and pickles battered too thick, and not liking....enjoying skinny fries more...

down to dirty details...roughly $twenty burgers with added toppings...more $change for sides....get by with $twenty for a basic prefabricated burger, fries and water (non-sparkling)....few errors....chimay in a beer glass?...near $ten chimay should always be served in a goblet....chimay goblet....quick change and chimay goblet presented....five burgers ordered...all medium-rare....four perfect....one well-done and dry....complaint and correction made....$thirty per person...burger, side and a beer....
author: Hen A.

description:
For right now I'm giving this place an average rating. I stopped here cause I had extra time before Brain Henson's Stuffed & Unstrung show at the Curran Theater, which is just up the street. 

Since I had already ate, I wanted just to have a few beers before the show.
The bartender was nice but just a little aloof.
The menu looked good, which I plan on eating from when I go back In January.
From my observations, the service seemed good and friendly.
author: John S.

description: No wonder they got only 3 starts! I never had a problem with their food but I walked in there at 10:30 pm and they told me that the manager just decided to close early because it was a slow day! They said they close at 12! People count on your words! I made plans! That sucks! I don't think I will be here anytime soon!
author: Vida R.

description: The service and food was really good. The hostesses were extremely nice and accommodating. Asked for a window seat and they made it happen. Go with the Kobe burger.
author: John D.

description:
Bah, so disappointing :( I was pretty excited for Burger Bar because I've heard great things about the one in Vegas but man oh man... my tummy was full but not super pleased.  I don't think I would go back... unless it was for happy hour.

The elevator that takes you straight to the restaurant is pretty cool albeit the long wait. Fortunately, we didn't have to wait too long for a table on a Friday wait. I ordered the black angus burger medium rare with jalepeno bacon and zucchini fries. The best part was the jalepeno bacon and zucchini fries. The patty itself was really bland and not medium rare. It was medium for sure. It wasn't red enough for me. The only way I could have eaten a better burger was if I added on a crapload of toppings and end up spending $30 on a so-so burger. The ciabatta bun was good though! It was not hard to chew at all which is always the concern for ciabatta. 

The zucchini fries were moist on the inside and crunchy on the outside. They were really good. We also tried the deep fried pickles and they were delicious! I love pickles! Deep fried makes it even better. Watch out though because the crust likes to come off real easily since there's nothing to hold onto the pickle spear. YUM.

I had a bite of Joe's Kobe burger and it was good. I think I would have spent a little more money for that burger instead. He also got this milkshake that was DELICIOUS. It had chocolate and baileys and all this delicious goodness. I think it was called the French Kiss? I tried the truffle sauce and the truffle was too strong for me. My friends loved it though.

Everything on the menu looks awesome and it's a great experience but I'd rather not go back and waste my money here. For the price, the quality wasn't that fantastic.
author: Linda Y.

description:
We went there for my best friends party. We were a group of about 30, so that was a plus that they could accommodate large groups. Although we didn't have the full menu, the selection they gave us was pretty grand. They even let me add things to my burger (like the egg) and substitute fries. That was a plus.

I had the American Classic burger with a fried egg on top. I really thought the burger was delish. It looks small on your plate, but the patty is super thick, i had to cut it in order to eat it. Overall I enjoyed my burger!

The only downfall I thought was my sweet potato fries. I love those things, but mine came out cold! It seemed like they were sitting out there for a while since we had a large group. They would have been much better if the fries were warm.
author: Alyssa T.

description:
I am usually not a type of girl to go out of her way for things, unless I feel it is worth it. However, I am a good friend especially to friends who love to go out and eat! So last night, I got invited to the Burger Bar. I thought to myself, "YUM, let's go"!

The hostess and the woman whom I thought would be our server were very nice and professional. We let them know we had never been here before and they were so friendly and nice explaining to us that our server for the evening would help us answer any questions. Seems like we were off to a good start right? Wrong!

The booth we sat in was super comfy, the lighting was pretty low for my taste but the small built in tv screen playing ESPN, made me feel like I was in a sports bar? I'm not sure if Burger Bar is meant to have this vibe, but I def got that from the feeling of it.

On to the server. Our server did not seem to want to help us much. He was very small talk and when I asked about certain items on the menu, he seemed to be surprised as if I would already know. To get to the point, I hate when people make me feel awkward, it's rude and weird. 

Food: I ordered the Natural Beef Burger with the toppings of my choice. All toppings and bun were fresh and delicious. Fries were great too. I didn't order any milkshakes, though they look tempting and from other reviews, I regret it!

Halfway through our meal, our server came back from break and seemed to be in a much happier mood. At least he changed up! 

It was a good burger and a okay experience, nothing wowed me. Anyways, I heard Burger Bar should be closing in the next few months to make room for Wolfgang Pucks Fine Dining. We'll see how that goes.
author: Sarina I.

description: Wife wanted to come here for a burger because she has never been to a Burger Bar, but I got my way and we went to Super Duper Burger because I've already been to the Burger Bar in Vegas a few times (which I've always enjoyed). The deal was that I would stop by and grab one of their dessert burgers to go for her and my daughter to share back at the hotel. I sat at the bar and had a beer while I waited. The bartender was fast and friendly. He even let me sample a beer that I asked about after I ordered my Dogfish Head. I had a little trouble finding it from the directions on the Yelp app, didn't realize it was on the 6th floor of the Macy's building until I crossed the street and saw the sign on the side of the building. There was a really long wait for the elevator (five minutes, don't know why), I almost gave up and left. The dessert burger looked and tasted great.
author: Paul L.

description:
This is a good place for the burger fans out there. 
What I like is that they have lots of options for gluten free people, or people on a diet, or people who want to splurge :-)
Not cheap though (burgers are $16-$30+) but you also pay for the location and the views...
author: Pascal L.

description:
Burger Bar is a solid 3 star restaurant. They have a great selection of meats and toppings so you really can have whatever you are looking for. I like that it's in Union Square; very convenient when you are out shopping and need a bite to eat!!

The staff is pretty friendly and the restaurant is very roomy. So if you have a stroller or lots of shopping bags, you won't have any problem navigating through the space.

I think it's a little pricey for a standard burger and a drink, but I guess that's the trade off for convenience.
author: Kandace K.

description: Meh. The burgers are okay but are definitely not anywhere near great (Cheesecake Factory one floor up makes a better burger IMO, which isn't saying much). The bartender made a mean martini, however, which is a positive in my book.
author: Pierre B.

description:
Great food! Great veggie pattie, unique in flavor without being loaded with bell 
Peppers (veggie burger rookie mistake) 
Unlimited amount of toppings (for a price) 
And I loved the sweet potato fries. The burgers are HUGE!!! 

Don't think you'll get a table fast during their busy time, 15 mins turns into 30... Uhg. Big downfall for burger bar, minus one star!!
author: Courtney M.

description:
This place is just alright!  I mean come on a burger for what almost $11-$12, you would think that it would be pretty delish!  I say it was just OK, nothing uber special! 

We wanted to try it out because there is a burger bar in Las Vegas, so we wanted to see how the SF one would compare.  The LV one is by far, a whole lot better.  I had the bacon burger on ciabatta bread and the waitress that we had suggested the fried zucchini, so we thought we'd give it a whirl.  Well, damn was she wrong.  Those things were whack!  Stick with the seasoned or steak fries, man!  

I don't really care to come here again, unless it was a friend's bday or something and this is where they decided on going.  Blah!
author: Mary T.

description:
Hubert Keller has done it again

Crappy service.  Sub par food. Condiment charges.  Tourist trap.  Trust me you don't want to wait a couple hours for this...

The Kobe Beef burgers didn't taste very Kobe like.  The regular burgers someone ordered showed up with mushrooms, and a hefty add on charge for that.  Also came with some attitude once you point that out to the waiter.  Oh and the fries were bland.

But seriously, kudos if your food makes it out, because from what I counted that night there was about a 45% chance you were going to get something to munch on, and the chance that it was what you ordered was about half that.
