If you insist on going, save your self some mulah and bring your own condiments.  You know those all those extra packets you get when you go to those other restaurants.  You know what would be cool?  If they started a penny tray for condiments....like the give a penny take a penny at the convenience stores...but instead it was full of condiments....like give a mustard take a ketchup leave some del scorcho, borrow some relish....I might just go back for that....but yea don't expect to see me out here again, even if I am entertaining guests from out of town....

Do yourself a favor and go to  Burgermeister instead.
author: Summit S.

description:
While in San Fran, I came to Burger Bar to grab.....Burgers. And that's exactly what I did. It's a little weird that the restaurant is on the 7th floor of Macy's but if you get passed that, Burger Bar is pretty cool spot.  

I got the sliders and hot wings and I was extremely satisfied. The service was great and the beer list was above average....which is important because I like to drink alcoholic beverages. 

I would suggest coming to this place if you aren't from San Francisco and need a go to spot that you know won't let you down. Check it out.
author: Aaron N.

description:
This place would have been even better if I had sat in one of the tables right next to the window that over looks union square! But we got a table that was by a pole and it just seemed like they were trying to fit as many tables in here as possible. 

I got the regular Kobe burger... not the $60 one... and then asked for a side of the Truffle Oil, really amazing, but way too much food. The sweet potato fries were also really good and my nutella milkshake... oh man, I felt like a kid again. But I'm warning you now, it's a lot of food, so think about splitting... especially if you get the milkshake, it totally fills you up. 

Some of the booths have tv's in them, good if you want to watch a game I guess, I didn't really care for it. Also if you are going around 9 when Macy's is closing, make sure you ask for the special elevator that takes you directly to the restaurant, only one does. All of the other elevators don't work or wont take you to that floor... found that out the hard way!
author: Rona Y.

description:
Went here instead of cheesecake factory only because I needed to dra my coworker somewhere new. We were in SF for a geek conference, and found this place conveniently in union square. We both ordered burgers, and the burgers came at a quick pace.

Flavor was ok, didn't do anything much more than filling me up. Bill was a little bit high for burgers, but it definitely matches the locale.
author: Nilo M.

description:
First of all, I don't really know how many stars to give this place... I want to give it 1 for the confusion of the hostess, but I want to give it 3 for the food... Oh well, 3 it is!

Momma, sister and I usually enjoy a day of Holiday shopping in Union Square followed by dinner at some delicious restaurant (last year was Pucini and Pinetti). This year, sister couldn't make it, so Momma and I headed up ourselves. We decided to opt for lunch, rather than dinner, so we could head home a little faster. 

By the time we hit Macy's, we were pretty hungry, so we decided to try Burger Bar (a first for us both). We stopped to put our name in and gave them my number as we headed up to the top floor for the Holiday Lane shoppe. They said it would be about 25-30 minutes. Perfect! We browsed around, made our purchases and were in-line for gift wrap and they called my phone. We headed over. We wanted a table against the window (Momma is NOTORIOUS for not being happy with where she's been seated...) So when we asked about a table right behind the host stand, the hostess said sure, it just needed to be cleared. No more than 30 seconds later, a rude customer came up and said she'd been PROMISED that table. Fine, we'll wait for another. We went back in the system and headed over to gift-wrap again. Got some boxes and got another call. No table yet, so I decided we'd just wait there, another 15 minutes, we were sat at a window table. Great. 

Momma loves sliders, and I've started taking after her. We each ordered the sliders, her's with sweet potato fries, mine with curly fries, we also ordered an onion ring appetizer. I was intrigued by the sliders because there's 3 different kinds of meat: buffalo, Angus beef, and natural country beef. The tastiest of all, for me, was the Angus. The onion rings came out with the meal, bummer! But over all the burgers were juicy, tender, and well seasoned. 

I don't know if I would return here - though my husband is a big fan of buffalo, so I might offer to bring him here. The milkshakes looked great, too... Maybe I'll try one.
author: Lauren S.

description:
After a marathon shopping experience at Macy's with my 86 year old Auntie, I needed sustenance, STAT. It was interesting to watch this elderly shopping pro have no less than three sales clerks hopping in Fine Jewelry. It made me exhausted just watching. We started at 12:30 and she was done with her transaction by 3. We didn't have lunch before getting there either because she made a beeline to shop with her coupons in hand. She was fine. I was starving. 

She says there are two restaurants in house at Macy's: The Cheesecake Factory and the Burger Bar. At that point, I felt I was too weak to go through the phonebook sized menu at CF so we chose the Burger Bar. At 3pm, there was no wait and we got a great window seat view overlooking Union Square on a sunny, beautiful SF day. While this menu wasn't as big as the Tolstoy's War & Peace Cheesecake menu, there were a fair number of pages. One whole page was devoted to shakes. Good thing this was the first day back on my diet!! FML. Anyway, I ordered the lo-cal ass reaming priced burger (no bun) and she got her usual burger with cheese and mushrooms and a side of fries. As others have said in their reviews, the prices here for a hamburger are pretty steep so I was expecting a pretty effing fine tasting burger. What can I say.... I was unimpressed. While the burgers are hefty sized, the taste was okay. Nothing spectacular. My Auntie got a side of spindly fries with no taste (McDonalds and In n Out Burgers have better tasting fries) and an undercooked burger when she asked for medium. My lo-cal meal was okay. The cole slaw was pretty tasteless. The food was mediocre but not for prices they are charging. Good thing she paid for the meal and I was starving or else I would have given them one star. Lol...really, I am bumping it up one star for the view and service. The food was overpriced and just okay. 

I guess we paid for the view.
author: Barb B.

description:
Not so sure about Burger Bar.  Were the Burgers good? Yes, but so are the burgers at thousands of other restaurants. Were the Burgers outstanding? No. I wouldn't necessarily say that Burger Bar is over priced, seeing as it is San Francisco, and owned by a "Celebrity Chef".

Some nuances that must be noted, EVERYTHING is an option. We're talking any type of sauce, condiment, vegetable. I'm just not sure where Hubert was going with this. It seems to carry the attitude of a higher end restaurant with out delivering on it. Am I saying it was bad, no. But there are many better places for a burger in SF. I guess it's popular and people want to come here so they can name-drop it.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
In terms of expectation management, I'd pick In-N-Out Burger over Burger Bar any day.

I know it's annoying to get a customer who can't eat the bun--but I also know that there are alternative ways to serve a burger (take In-N-Out Burger's protein burger, for example). When I revealed the situation to the server, she said "No problem. I'll just make sure they serve it with a bunch of extra lettuce."

When the burger arrived and I saw no lettuce on my plate, I said to the person who delivered it, "the server said I'd get extra lettuce since I can't eat the bun." To which he promptly replied "We don't have enough lettuce to do that." 

Ten minutes later when the server came to check on us, we asked "Is there really not enough lettuce in the kitchen for this burger?" And she replied "Oh, I guess not." The next time we saw her was with the bill.

Seriously? You couldn't go into the kitchen and check for yourself? You couldn't offer me an extra side? You couldn't remember that moments ago you had promised me extra lettuce? You couldn't take one or two pieces of lettuce off the TRAYS of salads that left the kitchen for a private party in the next room? Come on! My burger was $12! In-N-Out burger found a way to satisfy me despite my annoying allergy and I only paid them $3!
author: Courtnee C.

description: The burgers and shakes here are delish! Recently the level of service has declined, but it won't stop you from going. Try the Nutella milkshake! Yummy!
author: Roxy B.

description:
Ate here last Friday at around 7:30 pm. I was expecting it to be a madhouse just like Cheesecake Factory but it wasn't; we were seated right away! My boyfriend and I got a seat right next to the window facing Union Square, right behind the Tony Bennett banner, it's a great view...people watching to the max! 

We ordered:
-kobe beef burger with egg
-buffalo burger on wheat bun with foie gras and alfalfa sprouts
-breaded zuccini fries
-skinny fries
-irish coffee shake
-diy shake made with vanilla ice cream, chambord, and banana malibu rum
-truffle sauce

I'm picky with my shakes but this one was delicious. I finished the whole damn thing! It was the perfect consistency. I just wish it was more boozey.

The buffalo burger was nice and juicy, so juicy that my bun broke halfway through. The foie gras piece wasn't skimpy or too thick, just right. It tasted kind of gamey though and that's the first time I've ever had gamey foie gras.

The truffle sauce is the business indeed. I wanted to pour that little pitcher down my throat like it was water.

In conclusion, Hubert Keller's milkshakes bring all the boys (and girls) to the yard and he's like, "it's better than yours". Damn right it's better than yours (talking to you Mel's Diner). He could teach you, but he'd have to charge (about $70 something for my boyfriend and I).
author: Tatiana D.

description: Burger Bar is a fantastic place to go for great food, fantastic drinks and amazing service.  If you get the chance to go to Burger Bar you should ask to sit in Nate's section.  He provides excellent service that will make you want to keep coming back. You will not regret choosing to eat at Burger Bar.
author: K A.

description:
Definitely not worth it imo.  Was walking around the city and saw the name plastered on the side of Macy's Building.  After waiting for all of the shoppers to get off the elevator and to their floor, arrived at the Burger Bar.  The hostess was busy talking with a coworker so when I asked if I should "just sit anywhere?"  She just nodded.

The server could not be torn away from his co-workers (I had ordered pickles and raw onion as my toppings; no pickles came with it until after 1/2 the burger had been eaten).  Expensive.  Nothing great.  Burger was OK; again, nothing to write to yelpers about.  

For the amount of money it costs, I'll stay with eating at the Counter instead - at least they have yummy onion strings and better service!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
First off I will proclaim that I never give reviews on anything but after  a very positive experience at Burger Bar I wanted to share.

I chose the location because it was close to the hotel and kid friendly. We were coming back to sf to visit friends with our 3 year old in tow and we wanted a place for a group lunch. I changed the reservation 3 times to add people at prime lunch time on a Saturday and they did not flinch. The final count was 15.

We were there for 5 hours... Yes 5 hours. With two 3 year  olds. 

They were super patient. And accommodating . And we didn't feel any pressure at all to leave. Sooo nice. 

The food was good and there was something for everyone. the margaritas were delicious! And I have lived in tx for 5 years, so I've had good margaritas.

Thanks burger bar!!!
author: Janet P.

description:
I ate here on Monday and the service was great!  I ordered an American Burger which included cheese, and crispy bacon.  It came with two pieces of fatty greasy bacon and the burger was just not that great.  The French fries were good but not great.  

If the menu says crispy and you are a famous chef, make sure the finished product matches what the menu says.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Short Review: very packed restaurant with overpriced (but delicious hamburgers) and awesome booze-filled shakes.

We spent Saturday afternoon ice skating on Union Square, trying to figure out why a group of deodorant-lacking, embarrassingly-revealing drag queens thought it was appropriate to come out to play at 2 pm.  Needing food and (more importantly) alcohol to hopefully erase this image from our brains, we decided to go to Burger Bar.

Our expected wait time was 40 minutes, so we decided to hit up the bar for a bit.  There's a huge selection of beer, which was great.  As expected, though, it's overpriced.  $7 for a Stella?  MEH.

The selection of "chef-made" burgers was underwhelming, but the ability to build your own burger pretty much makes up for this.  I got a Greek salad and the Peppercorn Burger, which was pretty filling for two.  The olives in the salad were particularly delicious, and the burger itself was very well made.  I was definitely satisfied after my meal ... and finished it off with another $7 beer.

I think the best thing we had was the London Cloud shake.  Beer + ice cream?!  :: drool ::

As a burger joint / bar alone, I wouldn't see myself coming back often.  But it's the urge to try all their booze-filled shakes that makes me want to try this again.
author: Cain D.

description: Awesome Buffalo burger, great view if you can get a seat by the window. You have to get the dessert burger!! Seriously that burger is very creative and very good.
author: Montey F.

description:
I am a huge fan of Burger bar in Las Vegas so when I found out that there was one in San Fransisco I had to make a special trip. 

It's interesting how a restaurant concept can work so perfectly in one city but not in the next. In Vegas The Burger bar seems so natural and at home, nestled on the sky bridge between Mandalay Bay and the Luxor. 

The service and food items were all the same at this location. They were all very good but for some reason the Burger Bar in San Francisco just didn't feel as right. 

First of all it was hard to find. That's because it was in a mall. Secondly parking is insane. Thirdly our server was waiting to get off and sitting in the booth next to us, ease dropping on our conversation. Despite all of these things the food is what makes this place worth coming to. 

Yes, it is a bit overpriced and those hogh prices seem to fit the environment in Vegas but in San Fransisco it seemed a little out of place. I put it to you though, that this may very well be the best burger that you have ever tasted. 

The San Fransisco Burger bar is a tasty experience but for the total package check out the one in las Vegas!

Enjoy!
author: Jay K.

description:
I have to say, my review might be biased because I had the most AMAZING window seat in the entire place on a clear summer night. And, I am not from San Fran, so It was extra awesome. So if theres a chance you may never go here again, I would request a window view. ;)

With that said, the food was delish. I got their House burger and fries. And the beer menu?!?! AH-Amazing! (They even include what percent alcohol it contains along with a detailed description.) 

Prices seemed fair, nothing out of the blue.

My sister is a Vegi and she said the Portobello Burger was the best she had ever had.

Overall, great experience. =)
author: Meredith M.

description:
San Francisco should throw in the towel and forfeit the burger war.  Los Angeles does it too well.  Or at least try to do without the hype.

It feels like every time I head down to SoCal, there's a new king of the hill on the burger scene -- 25 Degrees, Father's Office, Slater's 50/50, Umami.  Unfortunately, I'd take any one of those over Burger Bar.

I came here with a large group of 12 on a Wednesday and we got seated without too much of a wait.  My friends were paying so I got the $60 Rossini burger with Kobe beef and foie gras.  I wanted to like it, but I think it's just not meant to be.
author: Vu N.

description:
Oh Hubert and Burger Bar I had such high hopes for the two of you, and the experience was such a let down.  

Let me start out by saying that I LOVE BURGERS. I LIVE for a good burger, and I take my burgers seriously.  I ordered the Kobe burger, medium rare with Cheddar cheese, avocado, grilled onions and aioli.  The burger was good, but not $30 good.  I get better burgers (and more topping choices) at The Counter (which I loveeeeeee)... IDK as a culinary school graduate and avid foodie, I guess I just expected much much more from Hubert Keller.  

Oh and dont get the buttermilk zucchini fries, Ive had better at fast food restaurants. These were mush on the inside and limp on the outside.

So yeah- Two burgers, fries, and two drinks came to $85... Next time ill go to the Counter or Burgermeister and spend $30 TOTAL for a delicious burger.
author: Evan O.

description:
I toyed with giving this place two stars for a while, but eventually the quality of their burgers won out.  The burgers were very tasty even though they were small.

Hubert Keller does do a good burger, but even attaching his name to it and putting it on top of Macy's doesn't warrant the price tag.  The service was sub par too.  I'd leave this place to the tourist visiting union square in the future.
author: Brian G.

description:
Expensive for what it is but great food and ok service.restrooms are dirty and I mentioned it to a staff who didnot care

Went there for lunch today and kinda was disappointed again. Service is soso. Bathrooms are dirty and when mentioned to the wait staff, she did not care. Food is good but pricey which I can understand because of the location.
author: Christophe K.

description: The food was good but not great. However our server was fantastic. He bent over backwards to be sure that we were well looked after. The overall ambiance was cool but not super unique or creative.
author: Abigail K.

description: I would recommend everyone to try this place. it was by far the best burger I ever had. I had the world hottest burger and they made me sign a waiver, that is how hot my burger was. make sure you have the sauce on the side cuzz it's extremely hot. small burger but very tasty. and their french fries and alcohol shakes are just amazing.   I will definitily  go back soon.
author: juju k.

description: The burger was 4stars (Country Natural. chopped jalapenos, truffle mayo, fried egg, pepperjack cheese) but the service provided by our waitress was a -1star. She seemed like she either didn't want to be there at all, or was doing a triple shift and couldn't wait for it to end; she never introduced herself, never refilled our drinks, talked to us like she was the paying customer the entire time. If I ever go back and get seated at her table, I would request a new table.
author: Cate A.

description: We came to The Burger Bar Saturday night May 23rd to celebrate our daughters Graduation from SFSU. This is where she wanted to eat because of the sentimental reason of it being where she ate her first meal in San Francisco when she was a freshman. We had 6 people with us including Hayleys Grandma and the rest of our family. Everyone was very pleased with the appetizers and the food. What was most impressive was the wait staff. Shawn was amazing. My wife and I go out to eat a lot where we live. Shawn was the best waiter we have had in years. He was able to expertly handle my picky mother who asked a lot of questions. He gave her a sample of a drink to make sure she would like it before ordering it. He went above and beyond the call of duty. He heard me say to my daughter that we were proud of her and her accomplishment of graduating. At the end of dinner he told me privately not to leave yet because he had a treat for my daughter. He came out with one of the chocolate burgers on a plate all decorated. He brought the biggest smile to my family. I cant thank Shawn enough for making this meal and the celebration such a great memory. I highly recommend
author: James Y.

description:
How can we find the perfect burger? I think that is the question!

My fiancee and I went to Burger bar to try and see if this place might be it..

We're not big on red meat or burgers but had a massive craving for one.

I have to admit it was probably the best $17 Kobe Beef burger i've ever had. The 
quality of the burger was excellent. Soft, melts in your mouth, flavorful, you 
name it.. It's an art in and of itself to bring flavor from something as conventional
as ground beef and this chef seemed to pull it off. 

When you go to a typical burger shop... the meat is browned in crude way (more or less).
Not the case here at all, the patty was subtly seared on both sides. One could
easily tell apart the sophistication of the Burger Bar kitchen.

So, if you don't feel like having another one of the usual weeknight pasta dinners,
surprise your girlfriend or boyfriend and take them out to the Burger Bar.  ;-)
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: Ah the vegetarian burger -- back on track and quite delicious (and this time I remembered to order it without bread). Slather on some hot sauce and it is delicious. Also... if the person you came with ordered the Hottest Burger, you are in for a world of entertainment because it's pretty hot.
author: Shauna S.

description: This resto has a great location and great views. The wait was long when we went but we just spent that time browsing around Macy's which made it seem shorter. As for the burgers, I thought they were okay, a little on the drier side and I've had better at places w/o a wait. The real highlight is the sweet burger dessert which I thought was very interesting, and actually had good flavors in it.
author: Miko L.

description: The burger I had here was one of the best I can remember. The chipotle aioli is amazing. A little bit on the expensive side, but not outrageously so. Considering the location and great view of Union Square, not bad. We were there fairly early before the lunch rush so there was no crowd to speak of. Service was good and again, the burger was awesome.
author: Justin G.

description:
Ok so to me, burgers need not be fancy. They can be, but if they are going to be, there are some bare essentials that have to be covered first. Good bread (kaiser, ciabatta, whatever, it just should be a good base) and patty (make sure it's a tasty or well seasoned piece of meat) and texture. I have been here on a couple occasions and I think it's a tourist trap at this point because I didn't even think the basics were covered. The situations I have had, have all been relatively the same. Recently we came as a rather large group, and I ordered a burger, on ciabatta with a fried egg and jack cheese, medium rare. Well what I got was a dry burger with what tasted like a dry scrambled egg on top and a rather hard bun. Nah not my thing. I ate it, it was ok, but you can't charge $16 if you are going to give that quality. I mean the egg should have been over easy or at least sunny side up. The burger was just cooked through, and yeah the bun was not fresh. :-/

The shake was good. Super thick and super rich. So it's not a traditional shake at all. Just really strong flavors.
author: Greg G.

description:
Being huge fans of Hubert Keller, my boyfriend and i were really excited to try Burger Bar when it opened downtown.  We had such a wonderful time at Fleur De Lys and wanted to see what this place was about.  

We had heard such great things about the Burger Bar in vegas but were slightly disappointed. The burgers are just mediocre.  We each did the build-a-burger and the choices are very extensive, toppings such as jalepeno bacon, fried egg, prosciutto, lobster and black truffle to name a few.  We've been twice and have been underwhelmed each time.  

Surprisingly, Hubert Keller was also their overseeing his restaurant.  You can definitely tell he still has quite a hand in all of his establishments which is pleasantly surprising for such a famous chef.
author: Christine I.

description:
It was a freezing cold night in SF, we had just returned from Healdsburg and really wanted a great burger.  Burger Bar seemed the obvious choice.  It really wasnt that great.  I ordered a regular burger with pickles, aged cheddar and tomatoes on Onion bread.  Not that great.  It seemed like glorified Applebees burger.  The only redeeming feature was the quality of the beef itself.  It had a really good fat to lean ratio.  For having 20 taps, the beer selection really sucked.  They did have bear Republic Racer 5 and though Im not much of an IPA guy, this was the one beer I had.  also, I only ate half my burger.  

PS, Amanda had the fries and they sucked.
author: Tony A.

description:
Food was slightly above average
Service was pretty good
Prices were fair for being in a touristy part of town
author: Raymond F.

description:
Sad to say, a complete and utter disappointment.   I heard people had to wait in line for hours, but I guess since now all the hype died down, the restaurant seemed a bit slow. And, I could see why...

So, it's understood that this is going to be a more upscale place... but man I didn't think it would be that ridiculous. 

*Large bottle of Chimay: I love my Chimay but what a F'N rip-off! I could buy a large bottle for $8 at Trader Joes.  Tell me why the restaurant charges me $30?! LAME.

*Veggie Burger: I love veggie burgers (don't hate). It was good but definitely something I could also order elsewhere and still be equivalent in tasting yet, half the price. 

*Fries: Probably my favorite part of the meal (shoe strings!) 

Pros:
- Not your typical burger joint for sure, you can add lots of interesting stuff to your burger (ex. truffle oil)

Cons:
- Way over priced


In the end, I don't think it's right for burgers to be costing so much.  Although I can appreciate the idea of gourmet burgers, I'm cool with just sticking to In-N-Out or Fuddruckers.
author: Kathy D.

description: Skip crowds upstairs in Cheesecake Factory and eat here. Good local beers and prompt service. Not too $$$ fries are good and nice spot to unwind at the end of the day.
author: Beach G.

description:
If you're looking for varieties of burgers...look no further, this is the place! They have 2 full pages of different types of beef burgers and they even had vegan, vegetarian and turkey burger options! If you're not up for any of those, you have the option of creating your own. They have every possible topping you could ever want on a burger. From the usual grilled onions and mushrooms to fried egg, bacon, guacamole, truffles, jalapenos and a whole lot more. Oh and your choice of bun.

I had the build your own turkey burger with caramelized onions, grilled mushrooms and pepper jack cheese on a sesame seed bun with an order of onion rings. My turkey burger was perfectly cooked and juicy and the onion rings were fried in a light batter to create a nice crispiness to them. 

My friend order the vegan option which was grilled eggplant  and veggies between two HUGE grilled portobello mushroom caps as bun substitutes. She said everything was delicious except for the eggplant. It had a strange flavor to it.

The restaurant is on the 4th floor of the Macy's building with great views of Union Square.

We even saw Mr. Hubert Keller himself chowing down on a burger there. :)
author: Dianna S.

description:
With its elegant mid-rise location overlooking Union Square and the HOUR AND A HALF wait we endured, I had huge expectations for this place.  My initial choice was The Cheesecake Factory upstairs, but I figured to try something I haven't tried before.  Big mistake.

I have honestly had better service at Denny's.  It was a challenge just to get our server's attention.  Our waters were served in plastic cups!  When we asked why, they said they ran out.  But why is it people that are seated after us were given glasses instead?

Our food finally came about 25 minutes later.  So after about 2 hours of waiting I'm hoping for the burger of a lifetime.  My Kobe Beef burger was mediocre, at BEST.  I've had much better Kobe Beef burgers in Sacramento at Bistro 33.  Lackluster in flavor and not juicy at all; I hate to say it but it was very...plain.

The price: ridiculous for what they are serving.  Unless you plan to spend $40+ per person for a meal (mind you this is a BURGER meal) you won't be satisfied.

Well earned 2 stars that they can thank the Beer Float for (but maybe I'm being too nice?).  People probably come here for the view, which I can't argue was beautiful, but from where we were seated I felt like we were in an underground pub.
author: Philip I.

description:
No Bueno.

Not worth the wait.  Seriously not worth the wait.  The burgurs arent even that amazing.  I would be happier with a Mcdonalds burgur.  I was even more sad because this place really doesnt cater to children.  I see a bunch of kids but there is no menu for kids.  The waiter just recommends the slideres which can only be cooked medium-rare.  Then before you know it you will have a giant bill and feel sad because the food wasn't worth it

The only saving grace about this place is the desserts.  If you want a delicious amazing diabetic colma shake..or a shake slider where you can try every shake omg go to this place.  I say eat at cheesecake factory then go to burger bar for dessert.  Then go to the gym.
author: Monique M.

description:
If you're fiending for a Twinkie milkshake (which sounds like something dirty) and an expensive burger then it's worth it to check this place out at least once.  The wait can be long and once Macy's closes you have to squish into the waiting area with the elevator or find space at the bar.

All in all I think I prefer the one in Vegas better.  But then being in Vegas might play a factor in my decision.
author: Vicky C.

description:
After hearing about Burger Bar since it first opened in San Francisco, I could not wait to try it! Over a year long wait, I finally had dinner here and what a disappointment. 

I had dinner with 3 others for a friend's birthday. The birthday girl made the reservation for 4 at 6pm for a table by the window. We got seated pretty quickly, but not at the table by the window with the "reserved" sign on it. We ask the waitress if we can sit there instead and she says "that table is reserved for another party". WTF?! Ok. So we were nice about it and took a seat. 

3 of us ordered the sliders. Each plate has 3 sliders with different beef and different toppings on them. Interesting concept, but after trying each one, I prefer my sliders to be consistent. So it wasn't the whole one-topping-per-slider deal that deducts stars from me, but it was the rock hard brioche buns the sliders came in. I seriously took one bite of a slider and the bread split into pieces onto my plate and I swear it made a "thud" sound.

For dessert we all shared a banana split which was good, but the sugar coating (?) on top of the bananas was painfully sharp. 

Our waiter was pretty good, but unfortunately I've still gotta give Burger Bar 2 stars.
author: Joy L.

description:
What a disappointment!  Hubert Keller is one of the celebrity chefs I've always liked.  I've been trying to go to Fleur de Lys (which is closed now, not that it matters much).  And now, I think I'll pass on restaurants with his name attached.  My husband and I decided to go here for a birthday lunch.  I didn't comment to the wait staff about my burger but for the rest of the day I wish I had.

My burger was over cooked and just not that great.  Especially when it all cost $20  Sourdough bun was at least a day old.  And there was no mayo.  Here's the thing with mayo:  You don't need much.  It's not about the taste but more the glue for a burger/sandwich.  It's a bit of a buffer for the ketchup taste (yep, I've thought way to much about mayonnaise).  Our server said I would have to pay for a small bowl of it.  No thanks.  I got a fried egg that was undercooked.  This irked because it cost $2.  I can make a fried egg with a runny yolk but without the runny white.  And it costs less than $2, why can't a professional chef do this?  My husband ordered jalapenos on his burger... he got a little cup of sliced jalapenos.  Nothing else was done to them.  They weren't smoked, fried, anything.  Just a stupid little bowl of jalapenos that cost $.75, which is about the cost of 2 jalapenos from the grocery store.  I think I was saddest about the pickle.  Why give a pickle spear as a side to a burger?  I want it on my burger, not as a palette cleanser.  

They get 2 stars because the restaurant and bathroom were clean.  I liked the music they played too.  And the zucchini fries were pretty damned good.  Never again though.
author: Mary Ann R.

description:
I just happened upon Burger Bar on a busy Saturday night. I got a seat right away. I ordered a veggie burger which was awesome. I also accidentally knocked over my glass and cut my finger. The staff was great and patched me up. It was pretty noisy but a great place to sit down after a shopping marathon.
The view was great. I will go back again.
author: Jewli J.

description: The Burger Bar is an overpriced restaurant with watered down drinks.  The staff was friendly, but the food was mediocre at best.  I know that I  decided to order and pay for a $20 burger, but in so doing I expected a homemade bun, homemade sauces and a larger sized patty.   I ordered the turkey burger.  It was well seasoned and the only reason I gave this place 2 stars,  but that was the only bright spot. The sweet potato fries were awful and I sent my apple martini back because it tasted like tap water with a salty aftertaste.  Very disappointed in this place. Will not return. My advice,  don't waste your money or your time.
author: Marsha M.

description:
I was super excited that SF opened a Burger Bar.  When I go to Las Vegas, I always eat at the Burger Bar in Mandalay Bay.  It's one of my favorite burger places.  There's always a 30+ minute wait.

But, I was disappointed when I went to this location.  The burgers didn't taste the same.  I always get the Kobe beef burger which is typically super flavorful and melts in your mouth.  It wasn't the same burger.  The quality of the meat was off and the meat wasn't cooked properly.  It was cooked but maybe the grill wasn't hot enough (meat wasn't properly browned, had the same texture as if you microwaved raw meat).  I'll definitely will go to Burger Bar in Vegas but will skip the SF location unless they can increase the quality.
author: Shelly W.

description:
Thursday night out with a few friends, trying to decide between a sushi place in downtown or try out Burger Bar?

We chose Burger Bar, didn't know what to expect... burgers and alcohol?
So out of 4 people, 2 were vegetarian, 1 meat eater and me, the vegan.
Most of us chose the 'build your own burger' deal.
You choose your type of bun, patty, 30570575 toppings, and different sauces. 
The charge you per topping, each are different prices. I think all are under $4.
They have a vegetarian patty but it has cheese mixed into it. 
They also have a 'chef's burger' where everything is already picked.
It had a bunch of grilled vegetables and instead of a bun, it was all packed in between two portobello mushroom caps. Even though I'm vegan, I still wanted an actually burger, bun and all. So I ended up doing a patty-less burger with caramelized onions, avocado, portobello mushrooms, and I can't remember what else. Oh, skinny fries too!

The food took a while. When the server brought out our food, the portions looked tiny but when I picked up the burger, I couldn't even take a full bite. It was like a never ending burger/fries. My burger and fries alone came out to a little over $10. Not bad. 

They have alcoholic milk shakes, too bad they don't have a vegan ice cream option! I'd be all on that.
author: Justine L.

description: If Pepsi was ditched for Coka Cola, I would have given this place 6 stars!! With that said, this is the greatest burgers I have ever had, now some broke welfare junkies would give low stars for the price of the food, I disagree! You get exactly what you pay for, PERFECTION!!!!!
author: Jeromy M.

description: This was a great experience. We were seated quickly and we had 3 high chairs! It was happy hour so we got fish and chips for the kids (plenty and only 4.50). We loved the appetizers and drinks (50% off) for the adults. The food came out fast and accurate. Our server was fabulous considering it was nuts with 3 two year olds and exhausted parents. We even met Hubert Keller! He took pics with us, brought us out 3 complimentary appetizers, and came and said good bye when we left. This is the 3rd time we've been here we've never been disappointed. We love it!
author: Danielle K.

description: I've had better burgers, but what I enjoyed were the 6 mini milkshakes I had. I think the best was the Nutella shake and I'm not even a big Nutella fan. I haven't tried the Rossini burger yet, but it's on my list.
author: Sheeva G.

description: Great selection of beer, unique menu and the food was good. The only thing is the hostesses seemed annoyed like they were counting down the minutes until their shift is over. Kinda a turn off if you ask me!
author: Robert P.

description:
OVERALL:2.6   FOOD:3   SERVICE:2.5   AMBIANCE:4   VALUE:1
Yeah, yeah....you got a coupla burgers that're $30+ cuz some French dude sprinkled magic truffle dust and foie gras juju on them.  OK, they taste good...not eye-rolling-ridiculous-good, but solid.  And fine, there's a sick view over Union Square.  But, you're still no match to TL's Pearls Deluxe (http://www.yelp.com/biz/pearls-deluxe-burgers-san-francisco#hrid:arZC6CpdlrFCqt_ZNEc6DA)....sorry.  Thick lines, tourists, and bills overshadow the thick, beefy patties and all their juicy meatiness.

Super-overpriced ($7 plain, tiny milkshakes?!?), plus hostesses have got a major case of stink-eye and general biatch-anger, and not in the sexy way.  Stick to Cheesecake Factory, if you're trying to get your Union Square on.
author: Amy K.

description: A great place for lunch in Vegas or San Francisco. You can go healthy or not with this large menu!
author: Vicki L.

description:
We went here with some friends who raved about this place like it was the best thing since electricity.   I was amazed that even though there was a crowd at the entrance, there was no wait, and we were seated right away.

Some of the booths have TV's in them which were neat, and if you like sports, the TV was tuned to ESPN.

Our waitress was very nice for about 1/2 of the experience.  She took care of us, and then all of a sudden our food was delivered and that was the last we saw of any of the staff.

I mean after 25 minutes of being done and sitting around trying to get someone's attention, i had to stand in front of a bus boy and ask for the manager.

When the manager showed up, I ask him if the waitress quit or what cause she left us here for dead!!!  He said she had a 'episode' and asked 'what do you want?'.   He was more rude then a thief in New York.  I was going to say more, but at this point i was done with the place.

The burger was no more exciting then any other sit down restaurant's burger.  The prices were not even close to the value of this experience and to think that they got a burger on the menu for more then $50.00.

I will say this, I might give them another try, but if I get seated in the section of the waitress that we had that last time, a big 'oh hell no' might fly across the place!!!
author: Jason H.

description:
Disappointment on a bun.


So look, no one is going to read this review.  The only people that would go to this tourist crap, er trap, are tourists who are shopping at Macy's and couldn't get into the Cheesecake Factory (which I've never been to because I have an idealized vision of what that place is like and I really don't want it shattered by reality).

In any case, pox on Hubert Keller for lending his name to a stale-concepted, poorly-executed fancy burger place.  My excuse: a 16 year old's birthday party.  The bottom line is that the burgers sucked.  How so?

I ordered the Kobe burger with bacon (I'm a purist except for bacon) on a plain bun, rare.  It arrived a very solid medium and the other two adults ordered their's medium-rare and they were sold well-done - brown shoe leather well-done.  When the waiter stopped by, we asked him (really in a friendly way) whether he thought they were rare or med-rare.  He smiled and said, no that they looked well-down and quickly turned around back to the kitchen.  That was cool, he was going to re-fire everything... mistakes happen.  Five minutes later he comes by to see if we wanted more drinks... then he asks how we like our burgers (uneaten except for 2 bites).  What?  The f*cker had just walked away and hoped that we'd be compliant tourists and eat our overcooked burgers.  So we again asked for them to be recooked.

Replacement burgers show up 5 minutes later... but, no, really?  Mine is still cooked medium?  The bacon tastes of cold pork fat (you can't heat bacon?).  The bun was stale.  The burger had a crumbly texture from too little fat (just because it's Kobe doesn't mean it has the right fat content), was only about 2/3 the size of the bun.

This place is a crap, cynical restaurant that can't execute on its basic premise, as dated as it is.  I hate it so much that I will never, ever go to Fleur de Lys again. 

One star because  I was able to pick up new underwear at Macy's.
author: Michael B.

description:
Randomly came here for a weekend lunch after shopping in Union Square.. I had a friend rave about the Burger Bar in Las Vegas so was dying to try:

Pros:
- Burger is delicious
- Menu has a lot of different options (including various price ranges)
- Beautiful view of Union Square if you get a seat by the window
- Service was quick and efficient

Cons:
- wait was really long and half of the restaurant was empty!
- the elevator to get up there has a long line and stops at every floor of Macy's for shoppers to get in and out.. there should be a dedicated elevator just for Burger Bar
- Bar tables and stools near the large window and wayyyy too close together

We would go again, maybe during the week though!
author: Seema M.

description:
What's nice about this restaurant is that I've never waited more than 10 minutes for a table. I don't know if that's a good or bad sign but it's very convenient.

The sole reason why I keep coming back here: the Buffalo Burger. I've been here about 5 times and 4 out of the 5 times I've ordered the Buffalo Burger. I think that's the best burger I've ever had. Buffalo meat tastes just like regular cow beef but it's so much leaner and healthier for you. 

At Burger Bar you can build your own burger and you can choose what kind of meat, bun, and toppings you want. The menu has A TON of options! They have the usual like  bacon, avocado, cheese,etc. but they also have toppings like jalapenos, aioli, fried egg, and chili. I like how Burger Bar has so many options when you build your burger, but some of the toppings are kind of ridiculous. I mean,why would I put black truffles or foie gras on my burger?

Also Burger Bar has happy hour, but it ends at 6pm (so early!) so when I go there after work I only have about 10 minutes to order drinks.

Bottom line, if they didn't have the buffalo burger then I probably wouldn't come back so often.
author: Therese M.

description:
I've been to their Vegas location, and was happy to see them open up a new one in Union Square.  I figure, the more places that offer sweet potato fries, the better.

I don't know.  Maybe it's because they happen to have a decent veggie burger, and I like the variety of fries.  Or that the times that I've been there have been off peak, just before the lunch and dinner rush, so dining was less chaotic and service was more attentive.  Or that they serve a unique burger dessert.  Or that they allow you to split their alcoholic milkshakes with a friend for a smaller portion, so as not to feel like a fat, liquored up, cow.

But I happen to like Burger Bar.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
We went to a birthday party hosted at Burger Bar last night. We have heard of Chef Hubert Keller, so had much expectation even though we understood it was a casual American food outlet by him.

The evening view over Union Square was the only good part. Then again, any restaurants who can afford the 6th floor overlooking the square can create the exact same experience.

I ordered American Kobe Beef with Pan Seared Foie Gras. It was a total waste of Snake River Kobe cows. The chuck was chunky and tasteless. I've had Foie Gras at many restaurants who served it, this was the one totally without Foie Gras taste that I had to wonder whether it was real. $16.50 + $12.

My husband and son ordered Black Angus with Foie Gras and Salmon burger. Not any better.

We ordered a milkshake paddle, but was obviously missed. If we didn't ask when our burgers came 30 minutes after order, the shake would never have arrived.

I was much looking forward to Chef Keller's Fleur de Lys some day. But after this experience, I don't know what to expect.

If you could afford a luxury dinner, walk a few extra steps to Michael Mina in Westin St. Francis; if you are stuck at Macy's, Cheesecake Factory on the same premise is a much better choice; if you simply want tasty burger, McDonald's on Van Ness!
author: Melmel B.

description:
Good place for tourists to have a nice lunch overlooking Union Square. Okay place for locals, but there are plenty of other better options if you've got a car and know the area. You can't beat the convenience of Burger Bar and the price isn't too bad either.

Turkey burger with blue cheese and sweet-potato fries. Diet coke to drink. Lunch on a busy Saturday.

Seated in 10 minutes. Service was fast and friendly. 

Burger wasn't amazing, but wasn't bad. I give it a 3 out of 5. Sweet potato fries were tasty and well cooked. They were crispy and slightly brown. I always order blue cheese salad dressing for dipping. The blue cheese dressing wasn't great. It tasted like Marie's dressing from a jar--very vinegar-tasting. 

View from the dining room can be fantastic. Not all tables have a great view. Initially they tried to seat my 6'5" friend and I at a tiny table about 10 inches from an out-of-service cash register. 

The worst: The men's restroom was a disaster. Toilet paper all over the floor and trash can overflowing.
author: scott h.

description: Great food and service. I loved my shake with Nutella, and would go here again just for the shake bar. Lol. Our server, Carly, was awesome. She told us of great places to see while in S.F. I will definitely return. Only weird thing is that it is located in Macys? But I guess that is city life.
author: Trisha G.

description:
I'm astonished by some of the reviews! I was here last year and I had some delicious shooters and some amazing sweet potato fries! My date had the American Kobe burger (if memory serves) and she loved  her meal as well. The prices might be a tad high but you're in SF, it's tasty, the plate presentation is lovely, and the portions are massive!

The only part of the experience I didn't like was the inconveniently located table I got. Not only was it in a bad spot in the restaurant but I was seated next to a table of loud and obnoxious patrons. But I'm not going to give them a bad rating for that, it's not their fault. Why do people give bad ratings for things that the restaurant has no control over? I hate that.
author: Blake O.

description:
I'm fortunate to work at a place that is willing to splurge on lunch every once in a while. Yesterday, we went to Burger Bar. Since we were a large group, we ate in the private dining room (which, for the record, can probably hold 40-50 people).

The portions are generous--perhaps too generous. I ordered a turkey burger, which was nice and juicy, but so large that, with the avocado, lettuce, and tomatoes added on top, it was almost too large to bite into. I can't imagine how big it would have been if I'd ordered more of the many toppings on offer. 

Four of us decided to split two orders of fries, one sweet potato, the other regular. This was a good decision. The fries were great, but whereas we finished ours, the people who ordered their own orders of fries couldn't. 

I might return sometime, particularly if I was with meat-loving out-of-towners who are looking for a view with their American food. Plus, they have milkshakes and I'm always looking for more additions to my milkshake list (http://www.yelp.com/list/how-many-boys-do-their-milkshakes-bring-to-the-yard-san-francisco).
author: Katie I.

description: I love that Hubert Keller's signature mousse mouse has found it's way to the dessert plates, but I'm really sad to only give the Burger Bar 3 stars because this place needs better service!  I usually base my reviews on food and price alone, but when it's not too busy late on a Saturday night and we need to call over the waitress to refill our waters not once, but twice, that is not cool!!  Hubert, I love you and your food, but please raise your standards for service!
author: Beatrice W.

description: As always, awesome burgers and great beer selection.  We love stopping by here over the holidays to catch a glimpse of Union Square and get some great food.  We got there just as it opened around 11:30am and there was no line, and plenty of window seats.  I highly recommend the Buffalo Burger.  It was fantastic.  The sweet potato fries are delicious.
author: Brad R.

description:
First off, this is definitely a touristy spot in the busy Union Square district.  So, expect it to be crowded, especially on the weekends.  Second, those who are expecting a large, greasy burger will be disappointed.  This is not your run of the mill burger, so you should expect a bit of pretentiousness here.

If you know that going in, you'll find it a lot more enjoyable.

We found our burgers to be very delicious.  I also enjoyed one of their cocktails (unfortunately don't remember which one).  The ambiance has that busy, trendy downtown feel to it.  The wait was definitely shorter than Cheesecake Factory (which had a 1 hour 45 minute wait - Burger Bar was only 30 minutes).

Service was fine - no problems here.
author: Dennis K.

description:
This is one of those instances where Yelp was pretty right on.

I'm a fan of burgers. I'm also a fan of Hubert Keller.

So why was Burger Bar underwhelming?

In a word: under-seasoned.

I also wasn't too crazy about the host sitting us in what he called the vip room, which was literally a closet sized booth overlooking Union Square. Sure, the view was great, but the area was really really tiny, it felt more like sitting inside a store display window than at a restaurant, and the air didn't circulate much in there either, so it was kind of stuffy.

The bill? Peppercorn burger, American Kobe, a beer. Forty-something bucks or so.

Worth it? Not really.

Get a burger elsewhere.
author: Tony L.

description:
I love burgers.  Especially big juicy ones with TONS of flavor!

So you can imagine my excitement upon hearing that my friend's birthday dinner was going to be at Burger Bar.  In preparation for the event, I more or less fasted the whole day, eating what was necessary and in small portions so that I could appreciate the deliciousness of Burger Bar.  I spent a good half hour perusing the official website and menu before we left to head downtown.

We had a reservation, so we opted to wait at the bar while they prepared our table.  It only took a few minutes and we were escorted to our booth...which had a TV in it, with the HD feed!  I was pleasantly surprised, and got to watch the Giants game while we were dining.  

My dinner choice was the Black Angus Burger with provolone cheese and grilled onions with Fat Fries.  My boyfriend got the American Classic.  I think it has got to be hands down the best burger I have had in the Bay Area, let alone anywhere else.  It was expensive for a burger but worth every penny, I am already planning my next trip and considering showing up in elastic band pants (I sure was glad I wore a flowy top to conceal the food baby I developed after my meal).  I had no idea this place was even downtown.  I love Burger Bar!
author: Sonya T.

description: really pricy for a burger place, but I'm sure you're paying for chef behind the name. i get that his a famous chef but really a make your own burger for $20 seems a little too much. and there was a burger for $60, that bettef be a BOM ASS BURGER!
author: Grace K.

description:
Finally had a chance to eat at Burger Bar after hearing that they opened late last year.  I was really looking forward to this since I ate at the Las Vegas location last year and had a great experience.

We arrived at 6:30 pm on a Wednesday, and since it was relatively empty, we were seated in one of the outstanding window tables which was great for people watching.  Within the next half hour more tables filled up, but they were probably running at 50% capacity for the night.  

I ordered the American Kobe Burger (med-rare), with cheddar, and jalapeno bacon!  My party also had the skinny fries, fried zucchini, and beer battered onion rings.   They had a great selection of beers on tap, so that was a big plus.

Unfortunately, despite being half full, service was very inattentive....  Our drinks took almost 15 minutes to arrive at our table.  When we got our myriad of fried goodies, we didn't have any plates to put our ketchup on.  Which is fine if our main dishes come out immediately after, but they didn't.  I asked one of the waiters for some plates to put ketchup on.  He gave me a puzzled look and pointed at the ketchup bottle on the table.  Shocked, I responded with a "I don't feel like pouring ketchup on the table and dipping my fries in it!"  

As for the burger, it came out red (completely raw) in the middle and lacked any kind of juiciness.  The other guests in my party also agreed their burger was less than satisfying.  The sesame seed bun was dry and hard, possibly from over toasting.  For the better part of the night, we had to keep asking for service, rather than the waitress coming to ask if we needed anything.  

To sum it up, the selection of beers was good, sides were pretty good, the burger was blah, and the service was horrible for a half empty restaurant.  

I'll have to give this place another shot in the future, but my first impression was not good.  I believe in Hubert Keller, so I'm thinking the management here needs to step it up.  Maybe eating in the bar for happy hour is a better option.  I would've been much happier at Burger Meister or my personal fav Big Mouth Burger in the Mission.
author: Neil W.

description: Now I love a good burger and this place has it. Service was on point too. Went to lunch with a colleague on his recommendation and glad we did. Had the classic burger with cheddar and bacon. Ordered medium rare and holy Christ on a crutch it came out perfect! I thought for sure in this town they would take it upon themselves to do what's best for me and burn it to all hell. No sir, the seemingly west coast hipster from the heavens put it in proper. My soda never fell below half without him coming over to freshen up. Now this doesn't sound like much, but I like to keep a wet whistle. Also had the fried jalapeño pickles. These were tasty. Fried to perfection and spicy but not overwhelming. I mean I knew backing these little bastards out would be an issue later (and I was correct), but really they were perfect. Get a side of the chipotle mayo to round things out.
author: Robert B.

description:
I have to admit, part of the reason I chose to dine at Burger Bar was because it's Hubert Keller's restaurant! 

Sad to say though, I was not impressed. It felt somewhat like a tourist trap...and almost like Hubert Keller has been "Emerilized". C'est nes pas bien!

I opted for the Kobe Burger for $$ with pepper jack cheese cooked medium. Though tasty, it didn't wow me. 

The highlight of the evening was when the lights flickered to signify to us that Hubert Keller has stopped into his restaurant. I caught a glimpse of him while he walked by our booth.
author: Sue L.

description: Great views of Union Square. Burger was good but definitely overpriced. We ordered the app trio which had onion rings, zucchini strips and deep fried jalapeño pickles. A little disappointed in the jalapeños but the other two where good. Overall id say grab a table by the window, order a cocktail and split some fries :)
author: Bri R.

description: I knew about this place because I have eaten in the one in Vegas.  It is a great burger and excellent options for toppings.  It is definitely high end burger dining vs. a burger dive but definitely worth every penny.  If you are shopping in Union Square its located in the Macy's Women's store.
author: Greg F.

description:
Of course we had to try Chef Keller's Burger Bar.  I must say that we were not let down.

The build your own burger was excellent.  Kobe beef, bacon and red wine reduction?  Glorious.  The sweet potato fries?  Slammin'.  Being able to watch the game at your table was pretty cool too.
author: Chris E.

description:
If there is one thing I am an expert in is a great burger.  In the brief 35 years that I have been on this earth, I have experimented with many burger restaurants and chains. 

I have created my own blends of different ground meats with varying levels of leanness and fat,seasonings and dressings.  I have used almost every cheese under the sun on top of the burger, between the burger until the cheese oozes out and even under the burger.  To make a long story short, I know my burgers.

Just call me Wimpy, a 34 year old (almost) 300 lb Burger fiend; "I'll gladly pay you Tuesday for a burger today" should be tattoeed on my ass.

So last Saturday, my wife and I visited Burger Bar.  Needless to say, great ambiance, elegant seating and more tv's than I can count in one shot.  We sat in a booth near the entry way to the kitchen where the traffic back and forth was distracting me from enjoying the company of my lovely wife.

It did not help any that the tv in the both we sat in was playing old classic reruns of wrestling matches from the 80's.  Nothing more romantic than watching two sweaty over sized men rubbing up on each other and beating their bodies in to ground beef. Sorry no pun intended.

Next, the extensive list of  beers highlighting the best the world has to offer was lacking in the one I drink most frequently, Heineken.  I opted for the Milk shake instead.  It was great  but when a shake is served on a concaved glass and they do not give you the tin tumbler in which is made, makes for a bad joke of a tease. I swear, I could down that shake in three gulps max.  In this economy, although tasty, not worth the price.

On to the main course.  the burger.  $60 For a freaking Burger?  are you that self indulgent?  (Sorry, I've been watching American Idol too much).  Give me a break.  Who has discretionary income to afford such an unnecessary and decadent "luxury"? 

I've already spent too much time at this place and on this review to keep thinking about this financial/ time sink.  

Take it from me, go to Fuddruckers!!!  Fuddruckers offers a great selection of Burgers that are 100% USDA fresh ground beef.  Or, you can choose, Buffalo, Kolbe beef, hot dogs or chicken from their menu.  

What I find impressive is that their buns are made from scratch every morning  and throughout the day on the premises.  Equally impressive is the farm-fresh produce and all the other fabulous "fixins".
author: Javier O.

description:
Burger was DRY, service sucked dry burger, over priced for what you actually get, and they forgot my fried egg. Plus their skinny fries sucked dry burger too.

You're paying for the brand name and the rent, not the quality of the food.
author: Anna S.

description:
The burgers here are decent. They actually get a 3 star from a pure foodie perspective. The prices can get ridiculous if you choose the lavish options (truffle anyone?) 


The view over Union Square though is priceless. And the beer selection is amazing considering the restaurant is sitting on the 6th floor of a Macys.
author: Rich B.

description:
Absolutely amazing!! I ordered the burger sliders. On each you will find something a little different: bacon, american cheese, or grilled onions. They come with a side of skinny fries. My boyfriend got a buffalo burger and he loved it. His had blue cheese, spinach and grilled onions on a ciabatta bread. 

For dessert we split an alcoholic shake, coffee flavor. It was soooo good. We left feeling super full but it was well worth it...we couldn't pass it up. 

Something was up because all in all it took 2.5 hours to have lunch. They were super nice about it thought. The chef sent out deep friend zucchini with ranch sauce because we were waiting so long. The breading and their ranch sauce was so tasty. 

I saved the best for last, the view. We came during the day and got to sit next to the window...next time we are coming at night. I'm sure it will be spectacular!!
author: Anosha S.

description: YUM!! This place is your classic all American burger joint w/ a twist. I came here with a bunch of girlfriends for dinner & drinks and we literally stayed here from 530pm to past 8pm. I'm a sliders kind of girl because they're just so darn cute and I just couldn't resist! The burger bar sliders are probably the best sliders I have tasted to date. The great thing about them is all 3 of them are differentiated (instead of the same 'ol thing over and over again). 1) bufflo meat w/ caramelized onions 2) angus beef w/ bacon 3) regular cheeseburger. I also had the raspberry beer float (which was sooo DELICIOUS)! I cant wait to go back and try their beer float sampler. Oh and PS I saw Hubert Keller there! =P
author: Krystel M.

description: Good burger and fries, nice view of Union Square, friendly but quite slow service. I ordered the most basic burger and waited for quite a long time (I am guessing 20 to 25 minutes), and it was also long to get the check and pay.
author: Rodrigo B.

description:
I'm such a fan of Hubert Keller and he's awesome.  Btw - when I was there the first month they opened, I loved seeing him running around and fixing tables.  We accidentally knocked over a fork, and he picked it up :)  Great to see him so hands on, and not hierarchical at all. 

Unfortunately, besides him, I was pretty unimpressed by Burger Bar.  I been there twice for lunch, once during the first month and again recently.  Both times was eh, blah.

The first time, the service was HORRIBLE.  They had sooo many people and just couldn't figure out how to staff and divide and conquer.  Let's not forget the hostesses (plural during lunch time) who had no idea what they were doing.  They obviously were getting paid hourly, and didn't have any incentive to make more money, greet people or be informed about what was going on.  The first time I went, they were so slammed  that the bartender ended up taking our order and serving us.  Btw - this was not his job, we were sitting at a table and didn't see a server for almost 20 minutes.  How he came about to serve us was we asked him if he could send our server over or if he's seen him/her and he actually couldn't find the person at all... go figure.       Btw - the bartender was a decent server and pretty pleasant considering the clusterfuck going on.

Of course, it was the first month so I recently went back to try it again. Just as blah.  The place was much more empty, but the service was still kinda blah.  I'm not expecting the creme de la creme here, but I feel like in SF, there's a higher caliber than if we were in say, San Jose.  

I'll probably won't initiate plans to eat here, but if in a big group I wouldn't object.
author: Laura H.

description:
I've been here about 3 times, and I've had a different experience every time, ranging from 5 star "This place is awesome and then some!" to 1 star "this place is sub-par and no more". 

The atmosphere is consistant. With a beautiful view of Union Square, you can sit right up against the floor to ceiling windows, without the threat gale-force winds.

At my 5 star visit, a friend and I went right before the dinner rush on a weekday. We started with a french fry duo. The sweet potato and the skinny fries were good, but what made them great was the chipotle aioli. Yes, it was an extra 40cents for the side, but our attentive waiter let us know it was worth it. What wasn't worth it? Paying extra for not only sauce but fries. 

Entree time: my friend had a standard beef burger, and I opted for Salmon. Our server was very helpful and even gave me the choice of ordering my salmon burger "med". So, with a side salad, I tried the "med" cooked salmon and found it actually pretty amazing. If you're not a fan of cooked fish (aka, a big fan of sushi or tare tartare) this would be the seafood burger for you. It was seasoned well, and most importantly, not dry.

To end an overall great meal we went for the gusto and had the beer float sampler. Say it again: B E E R  F L O A T. Ice cream and beer. With 5 beerfloats to sample, we were elated. I'm not a big beer drinker, but of course curiosity got the best of me.  My favorite of all of them was the Raspberry Velvet. It was sweeter and the ice cream and berry beer seem to mesh better rather than the strawberry ice cream and pale ale float (that one had a sweet/savory thing going on. Still good though!) There was one float you should stay away from. I'm not sure about the name, but it was the only minty one. So when you get to one that tastes like mint, set that one aside, or cover it with a napkin. Do what you can to forget about it. 

The 1-star visit? Let's just say
Horrible service, even though it was dead in there: Monday night, hour before closing. I and a few friends did a round of beer floats that were late and practically thrown at us. 

Veggie burger was very tasty, but again, slow service with not a smile. but with more of an irritated grimace. 

Dessert? Why not a burger again!? The Dessert burger had a krispy kreme-esque donut bun, nutella & chopped hazelnut "patty", strawberries, kiwi, and a mango jelly "cheese slice". All together, the components of this dessert were good. If you're a fan of dessert mash-ups, like ice cream sandwiches you'll like this. Some of my friends disagreed, and would have opted for just the nutella patty, making it a protein style dessert burger.   

Overall:
Pros - Go at an earlier hour, where the servers are at a better disposition. Sit by the window, if there are no window seats, leave, or get really drunk off beer floats. Try the non-beef items, ironically, but no matter, what, try the beer floats.

Cons - Bring 40 extra cents if you want to make your fries stand out, and avoid the surly servers.
author: Veronica G.

description:
I don't know what people are talking about - this place is not super expensive.  Sure - you can't get a "combo" for $4.99 but when you want a good burger you have to pay a little more.

They basically have two sets of burgers - your more basic burgers (beef, turkey, veggie, salmon, etc.) most for less than $10.  What makes them killer and adds to the cost are all the many, many toppings you can put on the burger.

The fancier burgers are definitely more expensive but judging from the plates I saw - might be worth it.  I may spring for one next time I go.

I love of BEEF so that fact I saw the description for the Veggie Burger, ordered one and LOVED it means something.  Because me and my lady are trying to be good, we opted to do side salads instead of fries.  The vinagrette dressing was amazing.

What's also cool?  I got to meet Chef Hubert Keller!  Our very nice waiter said that he is in the restaurant all the time!!

Go to Burger Bar if you want a little something different than the norm.  Yes it's not the cheap combo you can get at a fast food place but it's fresh and there are a lot of options to make the burger the way you want.
author: Jen P.

description:
First, why are there so many strollers in Burger Bar? While waiting for our table, hubby and I counted six or seven strollers- and that was only in the waiting area!

We arrived at 2:00 PM on a Sunday and there was a ten minute wait. We must have beat the rush, though because shorty after we put our names on the list, we overheard a man tell his dining partner that he'd been quoted a 90 minute wait! Wow!

We were seated at a small table for two near the back of the restaurant, by a window overlooking Union Square. The view was great as they still have the ice skating rink running so we saw so many cute families down there.

Hubby ordered a buffalo burger with bacon, a fried egg, and cheddar cheese. I ordered the SF Vegan (grilled eggplant, zucchini, roasted peppers and tomatoes between two portabello mushroom caps) and asked them to add blue cheese- because I'm NOT vegan! We also got some zucchini fries, sweet potato fries, and regular fries...what, we like fries!

Hubby LOVED his buffalo burger and the zucchini fries. I liked my SF Vegan, although I found it to be a little too oily. The sweet potato fries were great, as well.

We were too full to try the dessert burgers, although we did toy with ordering the cheesecake version. Oh well, next time.

Oh, and to the guy sitting at the table next to us who complained about everything on the menu being loaded with chemicals...don't eat here then...hmph...
author: Kayla N.

description:
Oops!  We made a detour... Walked in the entrance of Macys - see 2 elevators leading to Cheesecake Factory and Burger Bar.  Hmm, Burger Bar?!  We knew the Factory was going to have a long wait so we stumbled into this joint.

I see that many reviews are complaining about the prices of their burgers, but c'mon - the MENU is right there in the front for you to look at and see the prices ahead of time!  If you're complaining about the prices you have other places i.e. Lori's Diner, Mel's Diner, the hot dog stand and other neighboring places.  

I ordered the Surf and Turf Burger with Sweet Potato Fries.  The burger had lobster and asparagus inside.  It had a great presentation.  

My daughter ordered the sliders, which she enjoyed with her skinny fries.  It had all of the typical burger fixens.  

Hubby had the kobe beef burger which he killed instantly, again, when he's not saying a word he's enjoying his food! :)

Lastly, we had a hard time picking the shakes!  TOO many!  They even had beer floats which I stayed away from... not sure how my stomach would be!

We ordered the Caramel Latte milkshake, which had graham crackers and crumbs, coffee ice cream, whip cream and it was GOOD!

We also ordered the Twinkie Milkshake, which was not my thing, but my daughter enjoyed the sweetness.

BTW if you go there, request for the booths!  They have their own tvs that only show ESPN!!!  SWEET for watching SPORTS!!!!
author: Natalie O.

description: I got the country natural burger and it was okay. I've had better burgers for a cheaper price at other burger joints. My boyfriend got the Le Frog burger. It was cooked medium rare and it was nice and pink. Truffle mayo on the side is to die for. The truffle mayo was nice and creamy and you can really taste the truffle. Has shaved asparagus and portobello mushrooms. The burger was too greasy because it soaked the bottom of the bun.  Onion buns and the fries were nothing special. Anyway, the service sucked. The guy only checked on us once and it was hard to get his attention, we waited about 20 minutes just to get a refill on our water and order dessert. When we finally ordered dessert, we got the Nutella burger and I must say, it was delicious. Definitely recommend that if you're gunna get anything at this place. The presentation was cute too. Overall, service sucks, and pricing for burgers was kinda expensive when the burgers are mediocre. However, the dessert was great and the table we sat at had a great view of Union Square and that's why I'm giving this place 3 stars. But if you're craving a burger, don't eat here. Eat at pearl's or super super burger.
author: Catherine M.

description:
Good burgers and casual service.
Make sure to have the kobe beef burger it is to die for.
You will definitely enjoy if you love burgers.
Don't go if you are looking for a trendy place.
This is really a casual place for a quick night out.
author: C C.

description:
They do not take reservations, but there was plenty of tables on a weeknight though the place was pretty busy. We got seated immediately, but our server took a while to get to us. She took a while to get to us multiple times the entire night actually. Our orders also took a long time, though burgers grill pretty fast. I did enjoy getting a look of the beautiful pink patties on my way to the restroom.

There was a good selection of burgers ranging from your basic black angus to american kobe to grass fed sustainable. The most expensive burger is only so expensive because it has some foie gras and shaved truffles. They might as well throw some gold flakes on it because I think these are unnecessary garnishes. I do recommend getting the sauces as sides though. The peppercorn sauce was just lovely. It was not spiced at all, incredibly creamy and sweet. I think my favorite part of the burgers here is the bun. It's nicely shaped and a plump thickness. I was sad that my burger was served with only one slice of tomato and one leaf of lettuce. I had the american kobe beef burger, which was thick and juicy. The meat was tender, but crumbly. It was not packed too tightly, so it was nice and loose. I usually order my beef medium rare, but I didn't want to risk it for a burger so I decided to go safe with medium. Still, it came out medium rare.

Hubert Keller is the shit, but this restaurant is not exemplary of his culinary talent. Now if he had a Paella Bar, I'd totally be there. Burger Bar is a novelty restaurant. Get yourself to Fleur De Lys instead.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Top of the macy's union square building.  Walk into a huge bar on the left and on the right an amazing view of Union Square.  Too bad the burgers was not memorable.  The burger was very average... Wish I could say more about this place but I really stop by for a quick bite.  Maybe I'll try this place again for a better experience.
author: Ying F.

description:
4 stars for the food. The burgers that we had were wonderful.  I had the Kobe burger and my wife had a classic.  We washed that down with a Murphy's and an okay cocktail.

-2 stars for the service.  We were told a 15-25 min wait.  No problem. We browsed around Macy's came back at 15 min.  "Oh we called you and weren't here. We'll get your table ready." Okay, our fault for not hanging around.  15 min past, they seat 8 parties of various numbers ahead of us.  I check in and asked if they got our table ready.  The hostess says," Oh you were waiting? Well, sorry about that let me check if your table is ready." She gets distracted by a disgusting ladies restroom and a fat guy in a black silk jacket... something about how he was going to show his buddies the table.   Well, I got her attention again and she sat us right after.... 

Our server was not good at all.  At least she wasn't rude.  She just didn't take our complete order. Never checked in on us.  At least we got all of our food.  She didn't even asked us if we wanted drinks first... quote "You know what you want?" 20 min after we were seated.  It wasn't busy, she had 5 tables... 3 two tops and 2 four tops.  Wow.....

Our past three visits were great.  We had great service and great food.  However, I was unimpressed this visit.
author: Stan V.

description: The food was ok, but our burgers were not cooked as we requested and not as juicy as i would have thought. My hub had the spiciest burger. I had a turkey burger. My son had kids sliders. We got 2 beers, and a few extras on the burgers because you build your own-nothing major and a milkshake. It was $85 without tip. Service was awful. I had to grab silverware off an empty table. We had to ask for a waiter a few times, especially before we ordered. He disappeared again after our food came and I grabbed a busboy to try and find him to get another drink. I really was shocked-I have respect for Hubert Keller from the way he acts on tv. It's clearly very touristy but that doesn't excuse poor service.  I was very disappointed and I think you can do a lot better.  The view is very nice.
author: Sam L.

description:
Why doesn't In-N-Out charge extra for their thousand island sauce?
Why doesn't Carl's Jr charge extra for guacamole in their Six Dollar burger?
Why doesn't McDonald's charge extra for f*ckin' pickles in their Big Macs?

Because they're not cheap bastards, and they know that patrons don't appreciate being charged for condiments. They realize that even from a fast food joint, minor embellishments should be included with a burger.

Burger Bar: Country Natural Burger $10.50
Doesn't come with ANY sauce or flavoring- nothing but ONE slice of tomato, ONE leaf of lettuce, and ONE 2mm slice of red onion. 

Thanks, Burger Bar, for charging me an extra $2 for guacamole, $0.95 for a slice of green tomato, $1.15 for bacon, and $0.75 for a slice of cheddar cheese.

So my ten dollar burger actually ended up costing over fifteen bucks. I LOVE feeling jipped and cheated like that. My boyfriend really enjoyed his twenty dollar burger too. I mean, who wants to pay the actual menu price for anything? How blasé. Getting an honest meal wouldn't match the obviously high class establishment you have on the 6th floor of Macy's. Gary Danko ain't got sh*t on you.

Hey, why not charge extra for ketchup too? That way you'll for SURE get to tack on an extra dollar or two per table! Since we ordered your zucchini fries, we had to order ranch sauce or we'd be stuck with dry fries. Smart one.

We also really enjoyed the table, which was basically set up in what was clearly supposed to be a hallway. Keep it classy, Hubert. (And yes, I DO feel kinda awful about having to target one of the nicest top chefs ever. If this were a review about his personality or gracious demeanor, it would be seven instead of just one lonely star up there.)

If you are STARVING, and you're already in Union Square, take the next level up and go to Cheesecake Factory. Or pick up a ciabatta sandwich at Jack in the Box, where they *gasp* give you all the buttermilk sauce you desire. FOR F*CKING FREE.
author: Elaine T.

description:
Food: 4+ stars
Ambiance: no stars on Saturday nights, 1 one star on weekdays. 
Math: not my thing, it works out to three stars IMO

Our bartender was awesome. We glided in on a Saturday night and there was a huge wait - but two spots at the bar so we jumped on them. The drinks were served up fast and tasty and he had a great sense of humor without being annoying.
