The burger was pretty darn good. I didn't expect much, but it was very tasty. The fried jalapeno pickles were awesome and the sweet potato fries hit the mark too!

The place itself though - ick. The bathrooms were a wreck with water everywhere, no TP, long lines and just gross. The music was too loud and the toddlers running under the feet of waiters carrying hot food were just dangerous. I can't figure out why this is in a Macys - like, really? What was the idea behind snapping up THAT location when property all over Union Square is opening up? 

I hear it is better on weekdays for lunch - but I can't testify to that claim!
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
Okay I dont care what people say Burger Bar is the isshhhhh, hella good food hella good dessert but price isn't exactly cheap. Have been here over 3 times and have never been disappointed. 

Always get the Skinny Fries extra crispy and build my own burger. Would recommend everyone to try it out.
author: Mike T.

description:
Went to San Francisco hoping to eat at The Cheesecake Factory, but seeing as the wait would be 2-3 hours at 5pm, we decided to go Burger Bar.  The wait was only like 20 minutes.  My husband checked the reveiw for this place on yelp and told us it had good reveiws.  

Our first server was great, but when we switched to another server, she wasn't very good.  She didn't come to our table to introduce herself to us and she never came to take our order.  Someone in our group had to flag her down and let her know we were ready to order.  
Throughout the our meal she didn't come by once to see how we were doing or if we needed anything. 

I ordered the Build Your Own burger cooked medium.  I found the burger to be on the dry side and not fresh tasting.  I'm sure it was cooked fresh, but it didn't taste that great.  I wish it hadn't been dry tasting.  I did notice that the top of the beef was quite dark like it was a little burnt.  Even my husband agreed with me that the burger tasted dry.  

Overall the restaurant is nice inside, and has a nice view, but very crowded and tight so all all the waiters were struggling to get through the crowds of people.  Food wise the quality wasn't good, I've had better burgers elsewhere.  This is a restaurant I can skip.
author: Rosetta C.

description:
After twice visiting Burger Bar, I feel it is my duty to add to the growing reviews. 

The food: mostly very good. Sadly the Hubert Keller Burger looks and sounds better than it actually tastes. The buffalo meat fails to compete with the toppings, and it seems unbalanced. Their American Classic cheeseburger and the sliders are all very good. The fries are well cooked, crispy and delicious, and the fried pickles are a great treat.

The service: I've had very good service here, both when the restaurant was busy (8pm Friday night) and winding down (10:30pm Monday night). 

Etc: they have a great beer list and a good wine list. I can't comment on desserts as I've not had them (it's filling). The prices are by and large not bad - it's not cheap, but hey, this isn't In 'n out. The space itself is pretty nice, and a view down to Union Square, especially when the Christmas Tree is up is delightful.

I'm not 100% sure if I should be rounding up to 4 stars or down to 3 at this point, but I'm feeling generous today, 4 it is. I'll come back, as much for the location and variety as anything else. If I'm just craving a great burger, there's another place I'd go to, but Burger Bar is actually reasonable as a destination restaurant, with the atmosphere and drink list as an added draw. And yes, the fried pickles.
author: neil c.

description:
Came here with a couple friends to grab a snack and drinks.  They didn't have much of selection in terms of the typical "bar" food.  The sweet potato fries were not so great.  I did however really like the garlic fries.  Reminded me of the spuds I got when I was in Ireland.  We liked them so much we got a side order but this time on the fat fries instead of skinny.  The skinny ones were better since they seemed to stay crispier.  Oh and I got a scoop of vanilla with some strawberries.  Scoop was the size of a baby's head!  Good for sharing.

Good view of union square.  You can probably catch a couple good bum fights and enjoy the rest of your night.
author: Michael S.

description:
Purely reviewing this for their daily lunch specials. For a "designer burger" place, the price is certainly right for lunch. I came here on Tuesday, which meant I got coffee, sweet potato fries, and a juicy burger for $12. With McDonalds prices rising, this seemed like a steal.

I have to admit, I was first interested in coming here because of an article I had read about famous chefs turning to burger joints for higher margins (Hubert Keller earns 35% on Burger Bar, as opposed to 9-12% on fine dining: http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748704312504575618450888182376.html).

Higher margin for him, but way cheaper for me than Fleur de Lys. Anyway, the burger was Fantastic(!) and the sweet potato fries were good. This might sound silly, but what I liked most was the coffee, which I don't think is their selling point. I don't know what kind of coffee that was, but it was magically delicious. And I drink a lot of coffee.

Problems: it's cramped and service isn't great at all. I had to request things that I would think was commonsense to give me: spoon for mixing coffee with milk and a napkin.
author: Sylvia L.

description: Second trip to Burger Bar, first one out to the SF location. My first experience at Burger Bar Las Vegas was positive, but I had heard the SF location was way overrated, which I can agree with. However, the view is awesome if you get a window seat overlooking Union Square, so it's worth it to check out Burger Bar once if you get a view along with your meal. I ordered a custom burger- kobe beef w/foie gras on ciabatta, and the piece of foie gras was TINY, barely covering half the burger patty. $12 should get you a bigger piece than that! I did think the zucchini fries were really good, but they charge you extra for ranch sauce, and they don't mention an extra charge when they ask you if you'd like it on the side (shady!!). The service is ok, typical of chain restaurants. I really don't understand how Chef Hubert Keller is so popular, as I am always disappointed after eating at his restaurants (Burger Bar Vegas & SF, Fluer de Lys)- maybe it's his pleasant demeanor? Anyhow, come to Burger Bar if you must try it, but come with low expectations.
author: Amy D.

description: Offers very good turkey and veggie burger options. The onion rings are prepared nicely.  Definitely, there are other local options for appetizing burgers that are not as pricey. The best part is the convenience of being in Macy's.  So, it was a nice way to end a shopping day at Macy's with my best gals with some comfort burgers served with a side of some yummy adult cocktails.  Ask to be seated near the windows for a view and feeling an openness.
author: Mary G.

description:
A big disappointment. For such an expensive burger, I wanted something that would taste better. Part of it might be what I ordered (the buffalo burger). While it was good, it was underseasoned and a big unwieldy to eat. 

I like the fact that there are TV's in the booths. It's a good place to watch the game.
author: Kaanon M.

description:
I'm a little on the fence about this place, but that's only after one visit. I walked in and thought I was in the Cheesecake Factory, JR. They look very similar. 

I met a friend for lunch since I have so much down time now. I was expecting to be WOW'd. Instead, it was just an OK meal. I tried the Peppercorn Burger, medium rare, which was more medium - medium well. The patty resembled a hockey puck in shape and size. A little too perfect. I opted for the Fat Fries over the skinny fries, because I like them thick. The extra Pepper cream Sauce went great with the fries. 

My friend had a Veggie Burger with Sweet Potato Fries, and reports that everything was very good, and wants to go back. I tried the Sweet Potato Fries and they were no better or worse than any other fry.  Both of us were sorry we didn't order a milk shake.  There was one that was brought to a table that may have been three different kinds in small glasses ... we both didn't see it on the menu, but will look for it or inquire next time.

We opted to have some wine with lunch ... why not? The selection seemed impressive, but we wanted to limit our consumption to just one glass. I wanted the Merlot but they were out, and chose something else. You won't have any trouble finding a bottle to your liking. 

For dessert we had the Chocolate Donut "Burger" with the same hockey puck shape chocolate patty. It was interesting and good, and I may order it again. 

I want to go back after the holiday madness, provided I am still out of work! But I have a feeling I'll be working before then.
author: Michael M.

description:
I've been here a couple times.  The burgers are decent.  The menu could be a little clearer so that making a selection is easier.  The service does seem to be lacking.  Since the place always seems to be busy, there probably isn't much incentive to improve upon it.  

The burgers are a bit pricey, but do think they use a better quality beef than your average burger place.  They do have a great view of Union Square and plenty of flat screen TVs around to catch a local game if that interests you.  The volume is kept off so the game is there to watch or ignore it depending on your preference.
author: Bill P.

description:
Disappointing.  I'll jump aboard the hate-train along with the professional food critics out there.  I believe it was an article in the Chronicle that said Chef Keller should have left Burger Bar in St. Louis and Vegas - places where he couldn't tarnish a good reputation.  Couldn't have said it any better.

I could not imagine dealing with the wait here.  The first two times we tried dining here, the wait was over an hour for a party of two (dinner on Friday and lunch on Saturday.)  Finally, we wised up and tried dinner on a Monday night.

We both opted for the American Classic, which was unimpressive.  The bun was kind of blah - not toasted at all, and the meat was just meat.  No real seasoning.  Fries were okay.

The best part of the meal was the view of Union Square while we ate.  I definitely won't be returning for a burger - the only reason to come back would be to give their milkshakes a chance.
author: Allen L.

description: Came here to have lunch with my friend and enjoyed the view of Union Square. I had the Low Carb Burger which came with no fries but being gluten-free, I prefer a little bit carbohydrate, ordered a side of skinny fries. The beef patty was cooked perfectly to my preference (medium rare). It came with pesto sauce and cole slaw. The damage was $19.30 for burger and fries. Not cheap especially when the service was not attentive. Being tugged away in the corner we were forgotten. My friend's soda was not refilled until he had to wave someone down. Not good when you charge this kinda money.
author: Matt Y.

description:
I had been here once before and remembered the burgers being really good.  So I had recommended my friends and I come here again since they wanted a good burger.  Well, the burgers were still delicious, but the service was crap!  The manager had to take our order because our waitress was too busy.  She unfortunately was "too busy" the rest of our meal because we had to ask for everything two or three times. 

 I recommend trying out Burger Bar because they have a great selection of beer, the food is really good and the Milk shakes with alcohol are fantastic!  But just don't expect great service because you probably won't get it!
author: Amy M.

description:
I feel bad giving Burger Bar two stars because we did have a friendly and eager waiter...still...

After exiting the Yelp Unwrapped party still on the hungry side, my boyfriend and I went to check out Burger Bar. I'd heard that it wasn't that great, but I needed to confirm the suspicions for myself. 

Confirmed.

The atmosphere inside is a bit weird. I suppose it's casual upscale, badly done. The granite tabletops were so cold (I mostly mean this figuratively) and reminded me of my kitchen counter at home. I was also confused about why it took 10 minutes to seat us, even though the restaurant was only about 1/3 full. Moreover, we got seated all the way in the back of the restaurant, near the bathrooms. Never a good location! 

The food was pricey. I know it's in Union Square, but really, the atmosphere they created for the restaurant did not lend itself to such an expensive menu. We ordered the sliders to split, which was $12.75. The sliders looked pretty, but were very small, dry, and not very flavorful. There was bacon in one, but the bacon was chewy and tasteless. The string fries were similarly tasteless. I really wish I had trekked to Taylor's instead. 

I'm not sure what Hubert Keller was thinking because this is not at all a San Francisco restaurant. Ambiance is gaudy yet still without personality, food is mediocre (or worse), price is...overpriced.
author: Ada T.

description:
This quote from Top Gun sums up Burger Bar. 

"Son, your ego is writing checks your body can't cash."

Save your cash, quite honestly Lori's diner has better service and burgers than this trainwreck.
author: Patrick W.

description:
OVERPRICED. OVERHYPED. 

This is one of my worst dining experiences ever, I swear. Now for me to go through the list of why I will never ever dine here EVER again. Did I use "ever" enough?!

Decor-Shitastic. If they are charging, on average, $15-20 burgers . . . which in my book . . . is a bit pricey, they better have put money into an interior designer. I felt like I was dining at a fast food restaurant/Irish pub? And why are the walls stark white? I think the decor in the food court at Westfield is better than this!

Service-What's an antonym to awesome? That would describe this place. How can they hire such incompetent people? It took them 30 minutes to bring us our milkshakes, and OUR food came before the smoothies. What in the hell.

Food-My friend and I ordered two different burgers, and wanted to share it, but there was a $2 CUTTING FEE!?!? F-ing ridiculous. Are you f-ing kidding me!? Give me a damn knife, and I'll cut it MYSELF. $2!? I can get a thick mounting board cut for me TO SIZE at Aaron Brother's for a buck, and that seems more difficult than cutting an f-ing burger in half. What a rip. And the kobe beef, by the way, tasted like a regular freaking burger. How sad is that!?

Again. I repeat. NEVER EVER COMING HERE AGAIN. I'd take In n' Out over this joint. Oh yeah, the one star is for the milkshake; it was actually pretty good, but not sure if it was worth the $9.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Christine C. and I came here after a disappointed evening at the Yelp Unwrapped Holiday Party. Both Burger Bar and the Holiday Party was not worth it. 

Inside Macy's waiting for the elevator, which took far too long on a Wednesday night at 9:30 pm to come. What?!?!  This isn't an express elevator? Nope, I was wrong. 

5-15 long wait for a table for two. When we finally go into the restaurant we discovered it was completely empty beyond the bar. Where is everyone? Obviously smart enough not to eat here. There were plenty of servers so I don't get the wait... 

Food was expensive. I got the American classic burger with zucchini fries. I wanted to order a drink, just a soda but everything was $3.25... Stuck with my water. Christine C. made her own sandwich and asked the waitress about the Peppercorn Cream Sauce. The waitress said in the most unenthusiastic voice ever that it was good. Great job selling us on that.... Nonetheless Christine got the peppercorn sauce. Our food took 30 minutes to come! Again we were starving since we didn't get to eat anything at the Yelp Holiday Party. 

My burger was decent. Nothing special and definitely not worth $15. My zucchini fries were soggy! Not crispy at all. I think I had about 2 of them before I just couldn't look at them anymore.  Christine liked the peppercorn cream sauce but for about $3 she could have used more...

Overall a sub-par experience. You can skip it. Next time I'm going to stick with The Cheesecake Factory and ordering my ginormous salads...
author: Tina Y.

description: It's a burger: ok. It's a $20 burger: ok, but not $20 delicious. I feel the way I do about most Union Square places: it's how much for that? I got the peppercorn burger, medium. I'm a bit relieved that while living in SF has elevated my taste buds from a $1 dollar menu burger to $10 burgers, it has not made me believe a $20 burger is twice as tasty as $10. 2.5 stars rounded down. Decent food, but just not my thing.  Keep in mind, I'm not a huge meat eater. No waiting time when I came here around 9pm Friday night. I love the fact the fries come in a mini fryer basket. Good service. Nice view.
author: Yan E.

description:
This is probably as good as it gets, when it comes to burgers. The ingredients are top notch, which help give the burgers their rich robust flavors. You can choose what kind of meat you want; angus, american kobe, country natural, and buffalo. Next you can choose pretty much any topping you can think of or choose one of their prefixed burgers creations. They serve salads and sandwiches as well. The service is so so, no different than a TGIF's or chili's, still pretty good. How panache does the service really have to be for a burger joint anyway? 

It's amazing how many bad reviews this place received. I think everyone was expecting a "Fleur De Lys" experience since it has Hubert Keller's name tied to the place. Lighten up nay sayers, relax and enjoy a quality burger with your family and friends.
author: Marco M.

description:
around 3.5.

My mom & I visited today, both wanting to check out what the hype was all about. We shared a meal of sliders & fries (it was lunch, after all, and we both need to watch our girlish figures), and we both enjoyed them very much. My favorite was probably the buffalo slider, which we would have thought was regular beef if we hadn't known better. 

The skinny fries were a little disappointing, as they were very, very unspecial. I really enjoyed our service...not only were we told who our server would be upon being seated, but our server also walked through the menu with us and let us know the ins and outs of the place.

I look forward to returning and perhaps trying a milkshake!!
author: Annie F.

description:
3 for the Burger, 5 for the Bar. I feel as though the obligatory house veggie burger is a head chef's golden opportunity to exercise some real creative license and wow the pants off of jaded vegetarians. It was a big simple burger, and pretty tasty, but my pants are still around my hips, thanks. Patty ingredients included a bland-ish lentil, mushroom, sauteed onion, and pea mixture that was a bit too deeply fried. Could have spiced the lentil, included fava/chickpeas, or caramelized the onions perhaps?

Items keeping them out of 3/3.5 start territory: extraordinary draughts (abita!), craft brews (stone double bastard!), local favorites (hell or high watermelon!), and import bottles (hitachino nest white ale!) - nutella milkshake with whole hazelnuts and a boba-sized straw to such them up with - innovative 3 mini-slider sampler plate - legitimate beer floats.
author: Alex B.

description:
My friend treated a bunch of us for his birthday! He was kind enough to reserve a room and treat us all to a set menu.  We had appetizers, a drink, and a choice of a burger.

The ambiance of the place is great, especially since you get a nice view of Union Square (go at night!), and the bar seemed to be a really fun hang out spot. 

My burger wasn't all that different from the other burgers I had, but I do need to compliment the bun!! I usually ALWAYS skip out on the bun, but I actually thought the bun was the best part of my burger! It was so chewy and buttery! Definitely not good for you, but man I loved it! I wish all burger places had buns like Burger Bar!
author: Connie C.

description:
Have you ever had something for lunch/dinner and thought it was the best thing you have ever tasted? You loved it so much that the following day you have it somewhere else only to be left disappointed? i.e The burger I had today in Half Moon Bay, eh

On a recent late afternoon, I met up with a friend to celebrate the fact that her mother was finally after seven months moving out of her apartment. Did it cramp her style? She may not realize it, but it kind of did. 

My friend decides to head into the City and find the best burger possible. She was a bit afraid that downing a huge grease filled burger may add a few unwanted inches to her butt so she armed herself with her tight butt building walking shoes and hopped on Caltrain. I offered to pick them up at the station but was told that she needed the walk and get trim for the much anticipated calorie packed burger. 

I was a bit skeptical of her choice to try Burger Bar. The reviews were not the best and my favorite burger place in the City is just hard to beat. 

The place was packed and a little more ritzy than I expected. There were lots of pretty people and a pre holiday vibe that added some excitement. Since we didn't have reservations, we chose to sit at the bar. It turns out the bartender is from Burlingame and opened up his burger playbook and helped us with our orders. He recommended that I try the basic Angus burger, which at under $10 was much less than I had expected to pay. My friend upgraded hers to the organic which was only like a dollar or two more. 

Our bartender suggested I get the sweet potato fries, which I must admit did not thrill me. But the "skinny fries" on my friends plate were very good. Just wish they were more willing to share.

The hype here is that you will spend a small fortune, but I found that you can keep things more than reasonable by ordering the basic burgers and keep your toppings to a minimum. 

Burger Bar is not my number 1, but is in now in the ballpark as one of my favorite burgers in the City.
author: V B.

description:
My facebook buddy posted this on his recent status.

"Mcdouble 1 slice cheese=$1 dbl mc cheese brg 2 slice cheese =$1.19"

My trip to Burger Bar would of resulted in this facebook status.

Kobe beef burger with pepper jack cheese and portobello mushrooms and an Irish Coffee Shake = $33.

Although my burger tasted pretty good because it was juicy and had good flavor I would get the same overall satisfaction by going to Mc Donalds... Yes, it is because of the price.

The Irish Coffee Shake was also good but I was full by the time I was done with the burger.

The menu was a little hard to read at first until the server stepped us through it. We had an option of creating our own burger from a selection of buns, meat, sides, etc. Also, another option we had was to select from a preset burger meal ("no substitutions please").

The overall experience was just ok. The service was a little off for something a little more upscale. Our booth had a tv set to ESPN and we saw Hubert Keller roaming about the restaurant.

Other than that I would say stick to your local favorite burger joint. 

Bullshead, Burgermeister, Big Mouth and Slow Club comes to mind.
author: Sam T.

description:
Such a big disappointment!  Four of us came here because we wanted a casual dinner after a movie and Cheesecake Factory had a 45-plus minute wait.  Next time we will go to Carl's Jr. for a burger.

Food = 2. My boyfriend had the turkey burger which he described as a regular preformed piece of meat without any special seasoning or preparation. I had the salad with overcooked and way over-salted prawns. Our friends had burgers that were "pretty good."

Service = 0. This is my first zero for any category but here are the reasons: The food took forever to come out and when it did arrive, the plates were missing all of the essential burger fixings - mayo, pickles, etc. The waiter also brought us out an empty ketchup bottle and forgot salad dressings for the side salads. We had to ask three times before everything we needed was on the table. If we were asking for out of the ordinary items, delay could be excused but our condiment requests were really quite commonplace. When dinner was done, our server was no where to be found and we asked a busboy and then finally the owner to send the check!   

Atmosphere = 2. Two stars for being clean and streaming ESPN on a tableside screen.
author: Eddie L.

description:
An extremely nice Johnny Rockets.

With the fanfare around Burger Bar, the fellas decided to celebrate a few Birthdays last night here, and while we had a good time, this is no where near the Burger mecca it promotes itself as.

There's nothing too fancy about the decor, it's rather bland, however I did enjoy the private tv in our booth. As we settled into our table, it was nice to catch the end of Game 1 of the series with a cold beer in hand.

The menu has variety and allows for total customization. You choose the meat, bun and all the toppings you could want. 

I had the buffalo burger with bacon and pepper jack, and wasn't disappointed, but the meat was the only thing that stood out. Served on a blank plate, with lackluster sides, it really is hard to believe my burger was $20.

I would choose a burger at Polkers over here, any day.  

They do have a fairly decent beer menu, which came as a surprise. Showcasing such delights as Duvel Green, but overall, this place just never won me.

I'm sure during the Holiday season with the rush of shoppers, the idea of a burger will sound fantastic while passed out on the 5th floor linen sets, but for now, my burger cravings won't draw me here.

Jenny W, I'm going to have to check out this burger at Slow Club you speak so highly of!
author: Mike K.

description:
Hyped.  Garish.  Excessive.

It's tough to give an unbiased, healthy review when the "recommended" burger (Country burger) doesn't drip with juice and the bottom of my plate is caked with mustard.  Foie gras and truffle oils seem gimmicky when it shares a menu with iceberg lettuce and Heinz ketchup.

If this is an attempt for some sort of restaurant equality for diners of all economic sizes, I'll give it a B+.  If it's an attempt for a delicious, reliable burger joint, see you at Nopa or Chez Maman.

Service is unexcited and impersonal.

Slightly enticed by the shakes.

$$-$$$$10-65 for a burger, depending on who you're trying to impress here
author: Jane L.

description:
*                ============================
                 \                                                             /
                   \                                                         /
                      \              (*************)                /
                         \             Kobe Beef               /
                            \        (***burger***)          /
                               \      **************        / 
                                    \                           /     
                                         \========/
                                                [][]
                                                [][]
                                                [][]
                                                [][]
                                                [][]
                                                [][]
                            [][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][]][][][][][]

Burger Bar Review No. 30

Lucky me missed the Opening Night last Friday and I waltzed into the dining bar without waiting (and Hubert Keller walked by and greeted me with a hand shake).  

Michael (a very handsome 6 foot 2 wonder) with a shirt that read "Fresh Meat" on the back, was my server *sigh*.   I faltered abit on whether to have him or the American Kobe Beef Burger$16.50) on Ciabatta.  All the sides, i.e.  bacon, avocado, mushrooms  and (assorted)  sprouts were not included.  Unless you order the Chef's Burgers, i.e. American Classic Burger ($14.50)  Black Angus Beef, American Cheese, Bacon, Tomato, Onions on Sesame Bun.

I chose the Skinny Fries($3.35) to add with my Kobe Burger.  My order came as I had requested medium-rare.  Unlike, Sha M's review, my meat did not have any gristle and it was very tender and flavorable.  I was disappointed with the skinny fries though.  It wasn't even warm, I surmise it was sitting around for awhile.

On my next visit, I plan to order Surf & Turf Burger ($24.50) Black Angus, Grilled Half Lobster, Grilled Green Aparagus on a plain bun.  Skinny Fries are included but I will ask for the Fat Fries.

Oh!  Lest I forget the impeccable service I received from *sigh* Michael, I left him a 25% tip!!!!
author: Marian G.

description:
I know there are a bunch of Not-so-supportive reviews here, but I had a good experience at Burger Bar.  I was a little anxious because it was a) in Macys, which I hate going into for so many reasons, b) they don't take reservations (is it that hard to keep a reservation book?), and c) we were going to be there at 7:00 on a Saturday night during the holidays.  But the promise of good meat and milkshakes spurred me on in spite of it all.

When we arrived we heeded a fellow yelper's advice to avoid the elevator...it takes forever and people really jam themselves in there!  So we scurried up the escalators without any problems.  We checked in and were told that the wait was 45 to 60 min.  So we wandered about the china and glassware department to make fun of the crap they sell at Macys...really, who buys a casarole dish with a lid shaped like a bunny?!?!  After a while we just loitered near the door and listened for our party of 6 to be called.  To our surprise, we were seated in about 30 minutes.  WOW!  Didn't see that coming.

We got a nice table right in front of the milkshake bar.  Our orders were taken promptly and our drinks came out before we knew it.  My caramel latte shake was fantastic.  Very smooth and creamy...not  a super thick consistency that requires vacuum suction to get up the straw.  My only complaint is that for an $8 shake, the portion could have been more generous.

Our food came to us fairly quickly.  The food itself was good.  Not out of this world, but not bad either.  I mean, they're burgers!  I had the sliders and they were tasty, nicely presented and filling.  They came with skinny fries that were good, but I have had better.  My friends had a variety of burgers:  buffalo, angus, kobe.  Again, all very good.  One person thought her burger was a little over cooked, but the truffle sauce more than made up for it.  The sides were pretty good, too.  The sweet potato fries were great and so were the onion rings.  The fried zucchini were good and even better dipped in the aioli.  My friends reported that the fried pickles were a bit disappointing...I didn't try them myself because, well, they were fried pickles.  eeww.  

I will definitely want to come back to try some other things on the menu.  The Peppercorn cream sauce was calling to me.  As was the Surf & Turf Burger (a burger with half a lobster on it...HALF A LOBSTER!!!)

As for price, yes, it's very spendy.  But when you go to a place like that, what do you expect?!  It's in Macy's for godssakes!  You're paying for the Hubert Keller name, the view and all the fluff.  But I think people have overlooked the fact that you are also paying for some quality ingredients that go into these burgers (even though they are just burgers).  Foie Gras and truffles ain't cheap (but they are oh, so good!).

Our server was a very nice young woman who checked on us often and was not judging as we greedily slurped up our truffle sauce.  A small troop of servers helped her bring our food to us so it all hit the table at the same time:  one of my standards of excellent service.

Will I go back to Burger Bar?  Yes (remember, half a lobster!).  Will I go there often, No.  It's a good place to go, but it's definitely a special occasion kind of thing.  I LOVE burgers and there lots of good places all over the Bay Area to get tasty "everyday"  burgers.  But when I get a craving for something fancy and special, I will bite the bullet and step into Macys to get to Burger Bar.
author: R J.

description:
Hold the ketchup, the verdict is gonna remain out for me on this one. There is no doubt that Hubert Keller is both a culinary star and a good guy -- when I ate lunch at his new Burger Bar location on the 6th floor of Macy's, he was all smiles -- and despite being a celebrity chef, the man is still in the trenches, and that's admirable. 

That said, the service from nearly everyone else was in shambles. The hostess was practically lifeless and didn't seem to know where she could seat us; we waited five minutes for water, five minutes to order drinks, and spent another 10-15 minutes trying to flag down someone, anyone, to check on our beers. Yes beers, and we were actually sitting in the bar and not even the dining area! Our waiter was overwhelmed by the lunch rush, but was doing his best, clearly put in a situation he didn't have control over. But when at least 5 other servers and busboys passed us without any help, despite our efforts at flagging them down, something was clearly off.

The menu is all about (guess what) burgers, with toppings galore, and there are even some of Fleur de Lys' famous sauces to choose from if you're feeling extra decadent. I tried the buffalo burger, which was a serious piece of beef (and should be at $17), and came out full of flavor and juice, sandwiched between a toasty sourdough bun. Sadly, the sweet potato fries were a disappointment, as they came out lukewarm, and the fried jalapeno pickles we had as a side were also underwhelming.

Sure, the place is brand new, but this is a high concept restaurant in a gastronomic city, filled with raving foodies that thrive on buzz. Still, Mr. Keller deserves his reputation, so I'll try and go back at some point... but I guess for now will let the savages and tourists have their go. The search for the perfect burger experience continues...
author: Nish N.

description: On the 6th floor of Macy's my auntie, cousin, and I came here for lunch. The wait was short and we got seated by the bar. I did not know what to get. My auntie and I decided to share a burger with zucchini fries (get this!) The burger was not memorable and I totally forgot which my auntie ordered which says a lot! I also got a lindeman's framboise beer float. This was more like a dessert than a drink hehe delicious but order it for dessert! BEWARE: when you try to mix the vanilla ice cream into the beer the beer starts to overflow uncontrollably! I don't know if I'll go back ever but if I do I would get the dessert burger because I hear the bun is a donut! !!
author: Katrina D.

description: Love the Nutella Shake and the burger but this place is pretty pricey.
author: Fabled O.

description:
This was one of the worst burgers I have had.
Got a 10.00 burger with one witled piece of lettuce , unripened slice of tomato and A pickle as garnish..all for 10.00 which was the cheapest on the menu.
What got me the most was they CHARGED .30 cents for a tiny side of ranch dressing!
So insulted and the help was pathetic.
I HIGHLY recommend you don't waste your money and go down on Market St. to "The Great Burger" at half the price and much better.
So tired of wasting money on overrated "celebrity chef" meals...I'm done!
Laura
author: laura a.

description: This is for the Rossini burger I had right before the foie gras ban... It was totally over the top but worth every bite!  I wish it never ended, it was that good, definitely worth the $60 we paid for it.  Service was slow, but every time I was saying something bad about the waitress about how slow she was, she would appear.  Maybe I should've started my comments earlier so she would show up faster. Dessert... let's just say they should just stick to making burgers.
author: Joy-Lu B.

description:
HUBERT KELLER... In person?? Had I died and gone to heaven? No, just went to Burger Bar.   Jokingly on the way up in the elevator I said "wouldn't it be great if Hubert was there".  Sure enough, we walk in and BAM.  We even took pictures with him and he was soooo sweet!  

OK so yes, this review is biased because I met Hubert in person so now for the real review....

The food is good, really good. I got the buffalo burger and it was delicious.  Well seasoned, juicy and tender.  I got onion rings as well which were also very very good.  They have no BBQ so we got a side of ranch instead which was the good kind of ranch (you real ranch lovers out there know what I mean).

Ambiance and service was also great.  We waited maybe 5 minutes for a table on a Friday night around 7:30 or so.  Beautiful views of Union Square.  And the service was very prompt.

So the only negative side of the whole place is the price.   It sure is pricey.  Mind you I did get a buffalo burger which is like a whopping $16 JUST for the burger alone but still, it's pricey.  With a beer each, 2 burgers, fries, and onion rings it ended up being like $70 with tax and tip.  Oh yeah, and we got the dessert donut.  My bf loved it but I would definitely pass.  Something about eating a dessert that looks like a burger psychologically doesn't stick well with me.

Anyway, seeing Hubert really was one of the highlights of my life (seriously!!), and the food was great, but for the price, I probably won't be back unless someone else is paying.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Avoid this place unless you got money to blow. In that case get the $60 burger with truffles.

Don't get me wrong, everything about the burgers were excellent: meat, buns, and all the accoutrement. Except for the price tag.

I walked out of burger bar with a full stomach and a head full of perplexity pondering how it was that I just spent $50 on 1 beer and 2 burgers! 

I got the American Kobe Beef Burger $16.50 with caramelized onions .95, portobella mushrooms ~$1, provolone cheese, and bacon ~$1.15.

Date got Burger Bar Sliders $12.75. 3 sliders: Black Angus, Buffalo, and ___.  All of them were delicious with the black angus probably being my favorite. Fried were included but we switched them to sweet potato fries. Sorry, no comparison to Pacific Catch SP fries. Plus, they didn't give you any different condiment for it, had to use Heinz Ketchup.

Also ordered the speakeasy blonde ale $5. My mistake on this one, normally blonde ales are a little weak for me.

All in all, would schedule a company dinner here but would not pay out of pocket for burgers here again. For a great burger joint in tropical California, check out my review for Tyler's Burgers in Palm Springs.

2nd Trip:  Ordered the Hubert Keller and brother ordered the Surf and Turf (Lobster and Steak) Burger.  Both burgers were excellent again, but again, pricey.
author: Kuishinbo E.

description:
The food wasn't bad.   Wasn't great but wasn't bad. The veggie patty was mushy and I wouldn't recommend it but the other burgers were good.  

The service was so-so with staff who kind of mumbled (weird)... again, not bad service, just blah.  Two ick factors: I was given a dirty plate with bits of dried food stuck on it.  Yuck.  For a long time were also surrounded by messy empty tables that needed clearing.  Ick.

For a place that sells $20+ burgers the restaurant is a bit sloppy.  I don't think I'll be back again.
author: H K.

description:
When you have limited options at night in Union Square, there isn't many places to go to unless you are willing to walk through the rain and the cold during the winter time.  So we ended up at Burger Bar - wait, correction... we ended up at Burger Bar after finding out there's at least a 2 hour wait time at the Cheesecake Factory (I know, not that much better...).

The wait time at the Burger Bar will almost always be better than the alternative (50 minutes versus 2 hours).  

Once you take the elevator upstairs, you immediately arrive at the Burger Bar - which is nice.  And the hostess is already there to write your name down.  Immediately after seeing this, I thought that it was a bit inefficient.  Granted, not all restaurants have the pager system that hand out, but I felt that with the long list that they have - they should seriously consider in implementing it.  This way, their hallway will not be crowded with guests waiting for their names to be called.  Moreover, that they don't butcher people's name when they call them out. Also, since it's inside Macy's people will be able to move around and shop to their heart's content and not have to return every 5 minutes to ask if they've been called yet or what their status on their list is (which I've done 3 times and another person has done... even more frequently than myself).

Moving on, once called the waitress shows you to your table and the place is crowded with not much room to move around (my mom is legally blind and it was a bit of a challenge to help move her around all the standing people, waiters, and chairs in the way).  I felt that this place needs more space or a better controlled environment.

Once seated, it took a long time before the waters were handed out (it would have been nice to have straws to accompany the water, but I suppose you have to request for them around here).  

It took even longer before our waiter (it changed from the waitress that we initially had, I wonder where she went...) came to take our order.

The prices on the menu is a bit higher than I anticipated, but considering that this is a tourist area and inside Macy's it shouldn't be too surprising.

This is what we ordered:

Kobe Burger with Sweet Potato Fries (19.85)
Burger Sliders with Skinny Fries (12.75)
Kobe Burger with Pepper Jack (17.45)
Caramel Latte Shake (8.75)
Black & White Milkshake (8.75)
Large Pellegrino (8)

In short, I repeat that a lot of things on this list is too overpriced (note the milkshake, the latte, and the sparkling water.

However, I have to say that the milkshake is almost worth it.  The sweet potato fries is recommended, but the kobe burger is a bit bland for my taste.  It needs more seasoning or something but it was still decent.

In short, this place needs a vast improvement in terms of service and the way the position the tables and handling crowd control.  The food is decent, but needs more work.  A part of me wonders if the food would taste better if their cooks had more time to prepare them.
author: Nina M.

description:
I had my birthday dinner here last Friday. I was running late, so I called asking if I can move our reservation from 8 p.m. to 8:15 p.m. The hostess said that was fine BUT all my guests can't arrive no later than 8:15 because they were holding a table for us - whatever. My guests arrive at 8 pm. and were seated. I arrive around 8:30 p.m. and the restaurant is empty! Our party was the only one occupying tables. I thought there was a ridiculous wait at Burger Bar according to previous reviews? Hmmm...

The burgers are good and cooked to your liking. It's more fun to build your burger than ordering the Burger Bar concoctions. The skinny fries are good, the fried zucchini and onion rings had too much batter. The milkshakes are my favorite! I ordered the Nutella milkshake with Godiva liqueur. Yum!

The service was sketchy. Our waitress forgot a lot of items we ordered and didn't apologize for her mistakes. Sketchy service. Sketchy.

I'll come back again, hopefully service will be better.
author: Jocelyn P.

description:
Ok. Freaking expensive burger, bad service, eh on quality, and we were stuck in a booth with no view of the square.  I don't see myself going back.

I admit that I ordered my burger medium rare, but that doesn't mean charred on the outside and red on the inside. No. That is not medium rare - yes, it should be a dark pink, but I shouldn't smell raw meat. Gross.

Also, our waiter was subpar.  Didn't get our drink order right, was extremely inattentive (we had to get the hostess to grab mayonnaise at one point...), and seemed kinda clueless.

Don't see myself going back any time soon.  Maybe, maybe to try the milkshakes, but otherwise, blah. Don't bother.
author: Adam T.

description:
Seriously?! SERIOUSLY!? I just paid $25 for a American Kobe Beef Burger which tasted like regular ground beef. I had way better burgers at other restaurants that weren't devoted to burgers. Something was missing on that burger... YES! THE SEASONING! SEASON THE BURGER! It brings the burger a long way! Nonetheless... they have great toppings, great beer selection, and great service! 

Would i come back?.... maybe for the Rosinni... Until next time burger bar!
author: Brian P.

description:
The milkshakes here are amazing. Everything else is pretty lame. I've been here twice now. Once for just a milkshake and again for a burger and a shake. 

The shakes were excellent both times -- especially the "Nutella" shake which is made with chocolate ice cream, Nutella, chocolate sauce and chocolate whipped cream. When I went back for lunch I ordered the Rossini burger. Made with American Kobe beef (which they falsely describe on the menu as the "most expensive" beef in the world), seared fois gras and shaved black truffles. It goes for a whopping $60. At this price I would expect an amazing burger, especially given the fact that you can get amazing burgers in SF for $15 at quite a few places. This burger was nothing close to amazing. I ordered it medium rare and it was overcooked. My friend's Rossini burger was also overcooked so it definitely wasn't a one-off mistake. It didn't melt in my mouth... it wasn't even that flavorful. Not even close to the best burger I've had.

The ambiance also leaves a lot to be desired. The whole place feels more like a scam aimed at people with underdeveloped palates than a legitimate attempt to make the best possible burger. The burgers at Mission Beach Cafe and Spork are way better.
author: Aaron V.

description:
Im in no way a burger guru.  Hell, i just recently started eating red meat.  And while Burger Bar may not have *the* best burgers in town, i was certainly happy with what i had.  My 4-star rating is mostly due to their extensive menu.

Right off the bat, im a little blown away by their long list of beer offerings.  I wasnt expecting that at all.  All listed, separated nicely, in categories.  I love me some organization.  First time i came here, i had the Hitachino (how many burger places do you know that serve this?!) second time, i think i had the house ale.  Either way, both were good and i was pleased.

I went simple with my meal and had the kobe burger and skinny fries.  Everything was really good, my burger was nice and moist and my fries were perfectly crispy.  The extra add-ons and sides are endless, the list of things left me speechless.  You can add just about anything on your burger.  I was tempted to add lobster, but that not only would have made me a fatass, but would have been way too indulgent.  Next time.

Dessert was just as delicious.  I, again, kept it simple, and had a strawberry chocolate sundae.  But i was very intrigued that they had beer floats.  Yes, boys & girls, BEER. FLOATS.  Ive never had one, never even seen one, but it looked absolutely mouth watering.  

Overall, i was surprisingly pleased with Burger Bar.  The extensive menu really bumps this place up.  Our waiter was not only sickeningly cheery, he was a total rockstar - on top of everything.  Sure, its a tad overpriced for a burger, but wtf, are you really going to eat here everyday?  Quit your whining.  Once in awhile, it is indeed nice to have a burger that might be topped with truffles or lobster or whatever you feel like indulging in at the time.  Plus, c'mon, they have beer floats!
author: Juv C.

description:
I really want to like this place but I just can't.  I don't mind paying $$ for a good burger but this just wasn't the place.

I ordered the sliders to get a little variety (and was also curious with the buffalo meat).  The meat was really dry.  The presentation was okay.  The skinny fries were alright. I tried the zucchini fries and it was too much batter and not enough zucchini.  Overall it was just okay.  

I did have several sips of the hazelnut milkshake that my sister ordered and actually really liked it.   Also they had a good selection of beers.  

Oh one more thing...the service was just alright.  They were a bit slow.  We had kids with us and she kept forgetting their orders every time she came to our table.  Talk about attention to detail.
author: Johannah P.

description:
This place is bizarre.  When you think of Hubert Keller, you probably think of fine dining from a French dude.  And whenever I hear of a high end chef doing burgers, I get really excited (think Danny Meyer's Shake Shack or Jean-George's ABC Kitchen burger).

However, Hubert (or "Bert", as I like to call him), didn't really cut it.  The restaurant was just a shameless example of tacking on a celebrity chef's name to a restaurant without running the restaurant to the standards one might think such a chef would expect.

The burger wasn't bad at all.  It was just OK, and certainly not worth the price (many of the burgers are over $20, which is unwarranted given the taste and experience).  But what gets me is the tacky scene of the place.  I suspect it's a partnership with Macy's (it's on the 6th floor of the store) and Macy's had more input than Bert.  It felt like an Applebee's/Chili's crossover.  Not that there's anything wrong with those places.  My recommendation would be to hit this place up when you're just out with the boys and want to grab a beer and a burger.  But don't go here thinking you'll get a fancy burger from a fancy chef.
author: D H.

description:
Now THAT is a tasty burger!

I've been to Burger Bar twice now, and enjoyed both experiences. Yes, it can get crowded, but if you plan ahead and know to expect a bit of a wait, then it's fine. Their menu is kind of limited, but that was fine by me. If I have too much selection, then I tend to feel overwhelmed, and in an already-crowded, busy place, that's a bad combination.

I've had the Kobe beef burger, and their standard burger, both time with sweet potato fries, and they were delicious! 

Pros: High quality burgers and sides, large beer selection (I love that they serve Lambic Framboise), attentive service, great views, convenient location while I'm shopping.

Cons: it gets pretty loud in there the more crowded it gets, the burgers are quite large (I've never been able to finish one) and fall apart when unattended, and you can't change the channels on the tvs in the booths. But, these are all minor complaints.

The pros outweigh cons in my opinion.
author: Mehgan K.

description: TRUFFLE MAYO.............................holy cowgirls in California, this place was really good.  Each burger was perfectly cooked.  The BB Brew was tasty as was the Milkshake that I stole from my friend!  I would totally go again! On a dul note, my fries came out kinda stale...boo
author: Destinee W.

description:
2nd Hubert Keller spotting in a week, but this time, he actually said HELLO and greeted us!!!! I love him.

Now to the food. Oh my great goodness was that milkshake BOMB.  They have a good selection of shakes to choose from, but we went w/ the hot fudge vanilla shake...The shake was the PERFECT consistency with just enough hot fudge placed directly into the middle of the glass, which made for easy, delicious scooping up of the fudge! 

There are also a variety of burgers to choose from including this $60 burger (what?? I knowwww, a little ridiculous) called the Rossini, which Chef Keller recommends (duh), which comes with foie gras, shaved truffles, and madeira sauce.  

We ended up splitting the classic, and the peppercorn burgers.  The classic comes with cheddar cheese, bacon, tomato, and onion, on a sesame bun. The peppercorn was my fav! Super spicy, it comes with dried peppercorn on the patty, dijon mustard, and a peppercorn cream sauce served on the side.  The fries were skinny and crunchy; I wish I could've finished them all.  

One thing I loved about burger bar is that they have BOTTLES OF KETCHUP on the table! I was a bit concerned, as Hubert is originally Mr. Fancy Pants, so I figured the ketchup would be served in ramekins, which isn't my style.  I need a lot of ketchup, especially with burgers and fries.  This did not disappoint me!  

Only complaint is that the ambiance feels as if you're in a chain restaurant and that the burgers are quite expensive, at around $15 a pop.
author: Jenny W.

description: Great burger and alcoholic mint chocolate shake is awesome.
author: Sammy T.

description:
Summary: NEVER AGAIN!  This place is SHIT-ASTIC.  This place SUCKS BALLZ.  Why? Burgers were bland--had no seasoning whatsover, decor/menu looks like a sad chain restaurant you'd see at an airport . And the fries, all 15 of them on a sad plate, were equally bland and flavorless.   After reading about this place all over Urban Daddy and 7X7, etc. I was excited.  Man, what a let down!!!

Two of us came here for dinner, 6pm, no wait.  I got the Angus Burger with cheddar, caramelized onions and a side of skinny fries.  Friend got the country burger, both medium.  We were in consensus regarding this review.  First, while the meat was juicy, there was surprisingly no flavor. It was as if the chef had no salt or anything.  Same wth the fries, which, as other reviewers noted, were paltry.  Tiny portion of fries, all laid flat on a side plate. Who are they kidding?!  Also, the beef was way too small for the bun.  Also, one burger was actually RARE so we sent it back. (Friend has stomache ache now). Come on Burger Bar, cook the meat properly!

This wasn't even an "ok" burger. It was *completely forgettable.*  I neatly cut my burger in half, intending to take half home for a tasty snack. But it was so bad and flavorless, forget it, I didn't want it.  Take my money and take the food, just get me the eff out of this sorry "restaurant"!

America, stay away, save your money.  It's not that pricey for a regular burger, but...the food, ambiance, service, it all SUCKS BALLZ.  This place makes Cheesecake Factory seem like a five star restaurant. Ugh. Johnny Rocket's is 100x better.

The ONLY redeeming thing about the dining experience is that Hubert made the rounds, which really pleased my dining companion.  I was too pissed about the burger to care.  But I acknowledge that he was a very nice guy.   So nice that I smiled and shook his hand while I silently fumed at my burger.
author: Caroline I.

description: This place is great.  They have a location in Las Vegas and St. Louis.  I will definitely go back.  If you want good quality, this is the place.  I had a Buffalo burger and zucchini sticks.  The meat was very fresh and tasty.  By what I see on the menu, they have really good drinks, but I ordered a Stella Artois.  Great atmosphere and friendly staff.  It is open until 11PM and 1AM on the weekend.  I'm not sure if chef Hubert Keller from Fleur de Lys is the chef here or if it is just a type of franchise opportunity.  Regardless, it is a great idea and a great place to chill downtown no matter what time of day.
author: Don J.

description:
Hubert Keller is a genius. 

The wait was nearly an hour when we were told 15 to 25 minutes. We showed up around 1 on a Sunday, and there was the Nike Women's marathon and everything going on so the wait was understandable. Plus this was the 3rd day it was open so everyone would be eager to try it. 

So after we were seated, the waitress came and took our order. I had the Kobe Beef burger, with caramelized onions and portabello mushrooms on an onion bun. When it finally came, it was beautiful. I can't put into words how excited I was. I took a bite, and it just was heavenly. The burger was nicely rested, so the juices were in the burger instead of the bun or the plate. It had a great flavor, like almost having a King cut from House of Prime Rib, in burger form. Very fresh beef. And being that it was Kobe beef, it melted as soon as it reached the palette. The combination of that, with the Earthiness of the mushroom and the sweetness of the onions was just edible nirvana. There were condiments such as tabasco, ketchup, A1 steak sauce, and mustard available at the table, but believe me, those aren't needed. Those will just mask the true flavors of the burger. 

She had an angus burger, with baby spinach, and portobello as well. I kind of preferred the angus over the kobe. The angus was more of a burger-burger. It was meaty and it had incredible meaty texture and flavor. I honestly have never had a burger that good. (Sorry Darla's but you've been dethroned). What kicked the most was the aioli. It comes separate, and costs an additional $.45, but it's worth it. It gives the burger such a great kick. Plus it's great to dip the sweet potato fries in. 

Which brings me to the fries. I can kinda do without them. At $3.35 or so a plate, it was a pretty pathetic portion. Granted, one shouldn't eat too many sweet potatoes in general unless they're asking to become a foul smelling musical instrument for the next few hours, but hey seriously, why skimp out on the fries? It was almost a half portion it seemed to me, coming on a white plate with lots of gaps and holes, the presentation was just awful. 

Aside from that, the experience was great. Service was a bit slow, but I'm forgiving since they just opened. Hubert Keller was walking around, greeting people and giving out mini milkshakes...which I noticed that he gave them mainly to parties of all women. I didn't get one =[. But seeing Chef Keller walk around, greet people and welcome them to his newest restaurant was a treat. Almost like seeing a celebrity. 

Next time, it's time to kick it into high gear, and get a burger with Foie Gras on top!
author: Derrick L.

description:
I'm going to start by saying that this is an incredibly biased review. 

The atmosphere was more like an upscale Chili's (complete with oversized plastic menus) than what I would expect from a high caliber chef like Hubert Keller, the prices were over the top expensive and we had to pay extra for mustard for our burgers. So why the five star review? Because we met, chatted and had our picture taken with none other than Hubert Keller himself. Does it negate the above mentioned flaws? No. But it does make for a foodie fan moment. 

Instead of going whole hog and scarfing down the $60 kobe beef, foie gras and truffle laden burger, I decided to take it down a notch or two and built my own burger, starting with the country natural grass fed beef, then chose the house-made pickled beets, grilled onions and yes, I paid extra for what the menu said was homemade dijon mustard. The burger was really amazing, as far as burgers go. I'm no beef aficionado, but I have to say, the beef was so flavorful on its own with no seasoning and it was served perfectly pink, just as I requested, which doesn't seem to happen a lot of times.  

Unfortunately, I didn't save room for what sounded like a dreamy way to end a nice meal; a Nutella milkshake. I can't even begin to describe what a Nutella fanatic I am and to see that on the dessert menu nearly sent me over the edge. However, after a couple of drinks, a burger, sweet potato fries and a conversation with Hubert, I really couldn't fathom how I was going to enjoy that shake. Just another reason to return. 

The conversation with Hubert about his grandmother's apple meringue pie from his "Secrets of a Chef" series on PBS was enough of a dessert for me. 

What can I say? It was a foodie fan moment.
author: Lee H.

description:
It was a toss-up between 2 and 3, but I'm going with 3, because I like knowing there is this option at Union Square.  Frankly, the extra star is mostly because I am a Hubert Keller fan and I just want to root for him.  I will try Burger Bar again, with the hope/anticipation that my next burger will be cooked properly.

Positive:
--friendly, fast service
--good selection
--offer beef from sustainable farms

Negative:
--decor
--burger temperatures far from spot-on (my medium-rare request was medium on half and medium-well on the other half of the burger. weird.)
--no substitutions policy (seriously?  I can't swap out American for Cheddar, even though they have the same price on your menu?)

Come on, Hubert--work with us here.  xoxox
author: Em P.

description:
Here is how it started, downstairs of Macy's i ask the hostess in a jovial voice if i should get excited now, or once I'm in the elevator?  her response, "you might want to wait till you see the line upstairs before you get excited..." 

-Wow, maybe i should just gone to Fish & Farm for their amazing burger a few blocks away?  But, wait its Monday at 6:30pm, line?  

Upstairs,  5 parties wait for the hostess. the restaurant has 20+ empty tables.  she simply tells everyone that its going to be at least 15-25 minutes...  What?  I take a little stroll around,  comment to the hostess about the obscene number of empty tables (over half the restaurant)  my favorite, "we don't have enough servers on staff to seat those sections, you're just going to have to wait"  

Nice work Management, understaffed your first week of operations.  I ask her to just let my business associate and i grab a table as we have work to discuss and we are OK with waiting an extended period of time- DENIED.  

We then go to the bar to squeeze into two seats jammed so close together. terrible design of the bar, are you kidding me?  After, and i kid you not, 10 minutes of staring a hole through the 3 guys behind the bar, not ONE hello. Not one offer to take a beer order NADA... 

I won't even get started on the god awful (worse than a Chili's)  ambiance.  We didn't even get to the food as we left in disgust. 

However i did see the guy next to me have his overpriced, Angus Burger come out and frankly it looks like a Mel's Burger (not a problem) but they charge twice the amount.   Upon leaving the found the assistant manager or second hostess, exclaimed what an awful 30 minutes we've wasted here and rather than offer to make it right- she ignored my statement and literally walked away.    Over-Under:  6 Months and they'll be out of business. 

Best Burgers in the City:  NOT HERE

1. Fish & Farm
2. Spork
3. Sprice
4. Mission Beach
5. Bix

If you can't get the front of the house in line or nail a decent ambiance how can you ever prepare top quality food...

Its going to take a lot to get me back.
author: Ryan M.

description: While you can definitely order/build-your-own extremely expensive burger, there are plenty of decently-priced items as well.  The veggie burger I ordered came with lettuce, onion, tomato, cheese, and pesto  along with a pickle spear and was only $8.50.  That is definitely in the same range as most restaurants.  And it was a completely satisfactory portion.  No complaints about not getting my money's worth!  I also tried the Mint Chocolate Chip Alcoholic Milkshake on my last visit...delicious.  This was a bit expensive, $10.75, but again, not that much more than if you ordered a cocktail somewhere else.  Service has always been great, and I've always enjoyed coming here with friends!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
Ohhh, Hubert....... :( How ashamed you must be.

Really, man? Your buns are packaged, your fries are delivered frozen, and your place is filled with the ugliest fixtures from the cheapest catalog. It's ok - you can be honest - please tell me you didn't actually have anything to do with this hot mess. 

You have one of the greatest views of Union Square in the City and your bar faces away from the windows? Really? A twinkie shake? Really?

P.S. You're in Macy's - knock it off with the $60 burger unless it's going to stand up to it's name.

Shame, Mr. Keller. Shame.
author: Katelin H.

description:
I went to the original Burger Bar in Vegas a few years ago and remember it being this swank little burger joint set in a shopping mall with kick ass burgers and fries. The new Burger Bar in SF? Not so swanky, set above Macy's with good burgers, ok fries and fantastic (expensive) milkshakes.

We split the American Classic (hello, bacon cheeseburger!) and the Peppercorn Burger. The American Classic was, well, classic - cooked a perfect medium rare with melted cheese and bacon. I enjoyed the Peppercorn Burger a bit less - the whole peppercorns were a bit much for me. The meat for both burgers was tender and fell apart with each bite (in a good way) 

I wasn't a big fan of the fries. They were skinny and crispy but for some reason felt fake to me, like they were cooked hours before and just dropped back in the oil for us. The milkshake on the other hand was fantastic, as it should be at almost $9!

The overall ambiance reminded me of a slightly upscale Johnny Rocket's and felt very chainy. With such an amazing space I was hoping to be transported to this burger paradise but ended up feeling like I was in the nicest chain restaurant somewhere in the midwest. And our server was either clueless or ambivalent, not quite sure which.

Three stars for the combination of good food, expensive prices and the generic shopping mall like atmosphere. I do appreciate the fact that they are open until 2am on the weekends but at this price point I could easily name a dozen restaurants in SF that serve a better burger.
author: phil h.

description:
I came here for lunch on a whim in my continuing quest to find an ever more excellent burger.  I'd heard from my sister, whose opinion and taste in food is much like my own, that it was a decent place, though certainly not worth the price of entry.  Her main gripe being that for as much as they charge, they should be able to properly prepare a burger.  

I was hungry, I was in the area, I was curious.  So I ordered the Hubert Keller burger: buffalo meat with blue cheese, caramelized onions, and baby spinach served on ciabatta with a reduction of something on the side.  The fact that I can't remember what it was should tell you it was not memorable.  I ordered my burger medium rare, as always do, and the server seemed very happy about my preferred done-ness.  

When it came, it appeared to be perfectly done, as there were obvious signs of red juice on the bottom half of the bun and the outside of the patty had a handsome sear.  But, as I was warned by my sister, the burger was severely over cooked.  There was hardly a shade of pink anywhere to be found in the meat; it was medium-well at best.  I'll grant that I really prefer a really rare steak, but medium rare is the standard doneness for steaks and only slightly less the norm for burgers.  I've had buffalo several times before, both in burger and steak form, the latter being one of my favorite things to cook, so I know what to expect.  It's kind of a delicate meat that requires attentive care during preparation that this piece was not afforded. The flavors were okay, but were obviously marred by being woefully over cooked.  

Had this been a less expensive burger without the staff touting about how wonderful everything was going to be, and the care they take, I would not feel the need to be as critical.  But given the intended dining experience, the fact that they served a horribly improperly cooked burger is very disappointing.
author: Lewis M.

description: Honest opinion? It's good, but it's not great. I get the high quality ingredients, the foie gras, truffles, kobe beef, etc... but when kobe is ground up and cooked so far done, it tastes like regular beef. Rossini... it was good, but too rich, and not worth the $60 price tag. Might as well just get the ingredients and make it at home yourself for half the price. The SF Vegan is definitely something creative, but was extremely greasy to the extent that the grease ran all over my sweet potato fries and my fries got soggy. Buffalo burger, also great, but you can get the same quality stuff at a lower end burger joint. It just wasn't a memorable meal. I'd come back again to entertain foodie friends, but not just for the heck of it.
author: Judy L.

description:
Oh soooo sad. I have to say that my burger was delicious; angus burger with cheddar, fried egg and caramelized onions. We also ordered the fried pickles and sweet potato fries, both were tastey as well. Unfortunately our service was so atrocious that I can't remember the last time I had that bad of service, it has probably been years, YEARS.

Our experience:

15 minute wait in the afternoon on a Saturday, not too bad. Looking good so far. We get seated and know what we want, so when our waitress comes with the water we are ready! We order our food and a float of the 6 beer shakes for dessert. That is to come at the end of the meal though, after our food. 
There was a problem with one of the glasses on the table, so it was removed and replaced promptly. Handled slightly strange by the waitress, almost like her reaction was, "I didn't do that!" No shit sherlock, but a new glass would be lovely, thank you.
Food comes and one of our burgers is wrong. They whisk it away and apologize, no worries guys-these things happen. The waitress comes over to double check the wrong order, apparently that was the problem, she wrote it down wrong. While she did not admit that, it was obvious by her approach and questioning of the order. No apology was really made, just that it wouldn't be long. OK. About 10-15 minutes later it finally arrives, cooked wrong but consumed none the less. We are now in the better part of an hour of waiting for food, we are both starving and don't want to wait for another 20 minutes to be cooked correctly, it was too rare.
During the consuming of said burgers we never get a check up to see how things are, I feel avoided. :(
Once we are about 90% done with our burgers she comes along and asks if we still want the shake float, yes we do. She says she will put in the order and leaves.
About 10 minutes later the manager comes by to check on our experience. Bad move buddy, bad move. Walked into that one! Our convo:

"How is everything ladies?"
"OK"
"Just OK"
We eyeball each other and smirk a bit, "yeah, it was not fabulous"
"Uh, oh, what happened ladies?"
So we tell him everything; the burger, the glass, the horrible sub-par service, the MIA shakes, the plates still on the table, all of it. He ripped the lid off the can of worms.
He apologizes, tells my friend (Chelsea B) that her burger will be comped and he will check on the shakes immediately. At this point it is almost 2 hours at the table and while we are in good spirits, it really has been a bad experience. He comes back to us and lets us know that the shakes are not yet made because more information is needed. We just say cancel the shakes, bring the check we are done.
Stupid waitress girl brings the check and tries to walk by our table 3 times before I have to flag her down to pick up the obviously ready bill to pay that has the credit card laying out in the open on the receipt. 

She should not be a waitress in such a quick moving environment, if not for her, our experience would have been substantially better than it was. She continued to amaze me with how bad she really was. By the end of the meal, I was shocked she could get worse than we had already experienced. If you go, opt for a guy, wish I would have remembered her name then it would be easy to avoid her.
author: Mandy L.

description:
Note:  I am limiting this review to the veggie burger and side dishes I tried.  

The veggie burger at the burger bar is like nothing I've ever had.  It doesn't try to be meat which I appreciate.  It is delicious and multi-layered.  I got mine with jalapeno and pepper jack and it was a delicious decision.  My only critique of the burger was the sheer volume.  It was impossible to finish and quite difficult to take bites of.  The patty sort of dominated the whole sandwich.  

As for the sides, the fries were delicious.  And the dipping sauces, mmm.  We also ordered some of the fried zucchini sticks and they are not to be missed.  

All and all it was a fun lunch, but for the price and touristy location I'm not sure it will become a regular spot of mine.
author: Amy N.

description:
This place is an embarrassment to San Francisco's fine cuisine.

Given the hype, the prices, and the pedigree of the chef, one would expect something from at least mid-season of Top Chef -- something with some style and some nice high quality touches.  Instead, you get a TGIFridays atmosphere (admittedly with a good view of Union Square) with very slow service.  

We had the kobe burger with foie gras and the Huber Keller buffalo burger with blue cheese.  Both were mediocre at best -- although the foie gras was tasty.  The buns themselves weren't quite right -- why not toast the bun for the foie burger?  

The only upside to this place is the beer list, which is extensive.  Save yourself some money and hit up some of the great burger places in this town (e.g. the Bullshead Tavern in West Portal or any Barney's).  Burger Bar had none of the flair that Keller showed on Top Chef Masters and had all the annoying bits just right.  Charge you for condiments?  Check.  Small patties on too large buns?  Check.  Not enough onion in the onion rings?  Check.  Blue cheese bland?  Check.  Disgusting bathrooms?  Check.  

Avoid this place, please, and stop rewarding the celebrity chef for an uninspired offering.  For us, Burger Bar was so bad that we're going to skip Fleur de Lys as well.

I should have read the URL of this place more closely:
www.burgerbarsf.com.  Only one letter off from burgerbarfs.com.
author: David A.

description:
Great concept, lots of hype....colossal disappointment.  Love the Las Vegas spot, but not the one in my hometown.  

Interior:  Any sports bar in Denver or St. Louis...expecting something much different.

Service:  Poor...effort applied, but just couldn't get it together for a party of 10.  Half the table was served and finished by the time the other half was served.  Couldn't remember who had what, plates set down at the wrong diner, etc.

Food:  Mediocre.  Completely mediocre.  Our table was all over the menu in terms of meat selection and toppings, and not one person could rave in any way.  The veggie burger was a soggy mess.  

I love you Hubert, but this place is a flop.  Spent a whole bunch of money and the unanimous consensus was we should have just gone over to Joe's Cable Car.

The bathrooms were also a mess...no paper towels, no soap - felt like I was in Denny's at midnight.   

Maybe things will improve.
author: Linda C.

description:
What makes one hamburger better than the next?

Obviously this is subjective, but for me I would like:
a toasted bun that does not have hard crust (that means no baguette please), 
a good quality beef patty that is between 1/2 to 3/4 of an inch thick (after cooking), cooked to medium and has good texture and meaty taste, 
some vegetables (I will take lettuce, tomato and some form of onions), 
some sauce to bind them together (mayo is fine but I can take aioli or thousand island dressing, too) and 
be structurally sound (the whole thing needs to stay together in a stack while I am eating).

What makes a burger exceptional for me is if one or more of these ingredients really stand out to make the experience memorable.  I did not expect a Fleur-de-Lys experience at Burger Bar SF in terms of service or atmosphere.  If I wanted a fancy Hubert Keller experience I would have booked a table at Fleur de Lys but that's for another time.

I went back to Burger Bar SF and had the much-discussed Rossini burger.  Yes, it comes with Kobe beef, foie gras, and shaved truffles.  Yes, it is $60.  More than anything  I loved the concept of pushing the limits of flavor profiles of burgers. 

The Rossini burger came out on a big plate with a side of  au jus, sea salt, black pepper, and skinny fries.  The truffle aroma was instantly released when I poured what I assumed was a truffle au jus.  I love that earthy smell.  Foie gras  added decadent richness, and the Kobe beef was perfectly cooked to medium doneness and had more of a "chopped" texture than the average ground meat texture and it tasted fantastic.   

Was it better than the sum of its parts?  This is what made me think about this experience for two days and a visit to another one of my favorite burger places over the weekend, to mull it over.  In the end I felt  that the three kings of flavors were competing for attention and they did not necessarily come together as well as I had hoped.  

Because it is a burger I have to put the meat first.  And I realized they had to go with Kobe beef for it to stand against the truffle and foie gras.  The truffle and au jus were great flavor enhancers for the meat, but that left the poor foie gras out in the cold.  I like the classic pairing of foie gras with something sweet and fruity to offset its richness, but in this case the contrast was lacking.  Structurally it fell a little short, too,  because while the onion bun was a good choice for this ensemble, I don't think it was toasted, and it became soggy after the  au jus.  I ate my burger with a knife and fork.  

Nonetheless, I was happy with the experience.  Why?  Because it made me think for TWO whole days!  

Incidentally you could get the truffle as a side with their other burgers at $30.  they have some interesting alcoholic and nonalcoholic milk shake options in addition to other beverage options.  I also had a dessert chocolate burger in which chocolate mousse serves as a 'meat' in a donut pastry 'bun'.  Cute. 

I am still a fan.  You know this because I almost fell off my chair twice upon sighting the Chef himself.
author: Alice A.

description:
Good Burgers, you pay for what you get...

Sure this is not a cheap fast food place, so please expect a real restaurant experience. Our service has always been on point and promt for what you get (if you order a burger well done it takes time to cook). I always get blue cheese, onions, and peppered Bacon, and sometimes a red wine reduction. 

The place is great.

NOT FAST FOOD!!! if you want that got to burger king down the street.
author: Brian K.

description:
Creating delicious burgers - is that innovative?  Not really, but the burgers at this place are really good - especially because you can make your own.

Either take one of the ones there or create your own - either way, I'd recommend the yummy sweet potato fries.

Fantastic beer and cocktail selection as well!
author: Joe D.

description:
Im not much of a burger lover, but i really loved the food here! 

+1 Came here for dinner on a wednesday around 6pm, and we were seated right away. 
+1 waitress was very nice, hospitable, and knowledgeable about the menu
+1 great locations. 6th floor of macys. I hate the elevator to get up there because it literally took like 15 minutes for the elevator to actually come!
+1 food was awesome: I order the regular burger $10 and added sprouts and provolone. They already come with lettuce, tomato, onion, and a pickle. My boyfriend got the house burger with the cheddar cheese and bacon which was also delicious. We order a caesar (half order), skinny fries, and my favo.....sweet potato fries :) The burger patty was cooked to my liking and really really thick. I had mine on onion bread, which made it even more tasty.
