I think this place is overpriced for a burger joint. There was a burger that was $60. But it is definitely touristy, which explains the prices. Also thye are "gourmet burgers". They also had alot of milkshakes and floats that i wanted to try, but was wayy too full. They also have an amazing location. Its really nice inside as well. 

I would definitely come back.
author: Heidi M.

description:
This is a shame.  A real shame I spent my hard-earned $$s here.  A shame my 100% success rate is tarnished.  I moved to San Francisco from Dallas 3 months ago, and this was my first bad food experience, at any place, any price.  Unfortunately it came at a relatively high price.

Had my first ever $25 burger, the surf and turf.  As a marketer, let me applaud you oh Burger Bar and chef whatever your name is.  Your  margins must be incredible as you generate incredible revenue per unit while saving on seasoning - none used on my burger - offer just enough lobster to be visible - thanks to good lighting - and call it "surf", and source your french fries from McDonalds. 

My recommendation to consumers...take your $25 to All Star Donuts, enjoy a superior burger yourself and share the remaining 6 with the needy folks waiting outside.
author: Cory J.

description:
The food definitely was not bad.  It was quite tasty actually.  Just know that you're stepping into a Hubert Keller restaurant, so don't expect some $5 burger.  Actually, expect something a little better, but for about 3 times the price.

I ordered the Black Jack Burger.  I'm trying to figure out how to describe the size... bigger than a Big Mac/Whopper... maybe a quarter pounder?  But it looked bigger b/c it was on a ciabatta bun.
Cost: $13.75
Taste: 3 out of 5. it was tasty, but it wasn't like I had died and gone to burger heaven.  The fries that came with it were just normal fries.  A little underseasoned, but not inedible. 

One thing to remember is that this place is TIINY, so expect a long wait at lunch.  I recommend getting there early, like at 11 or 11:30, or really late, like after 1:30 if you don't want to wait.

Another thing, don't take the elevator that says Burger Bar.  Unlike the Cheesecake Factory elevator that takes you directly to the 8th floor, this elevator (situated to the left when you walk in), is the normal Macy's elevator, so it stops at every floor.  I ended up taking the escalator, and that was much faster.
author: Jessie H.

description:
I had not been here in forever, so, I decided to meet the BF and some friends there on a Sunday night. As always, it was packed with annoying touristi, but, once off the elevator, it gets better. Waitstaff is overworked, and know NOTHING about food allergies. The temperature was weird, the heat was stuck on full blast in the back, so we moved to a different table. 


Finally settled, we ordered, received rather speedy service, and the food was good. I had the buffalo, BF had the World's Hottest Burger (for which you need to sign a waiver! VERY fun!) and friends had lo carb burger and the buffalo. The meat was cooked to perfection, the guys really enjoyed the beer selection, and, as always, the view was great. 


Oh, and there are TWO women's restrooms for the one men's. This is genius, and should be the case in EVERY establishment. 


I will go back if I have out of town visitors. Prolly not if I don't.
author: A. H.

description:
burger bar has all the makings of an awesome dining experience. a convenient location atop macy's in union square, the star quality and attraction of celeb chef hubert keller (who recently placed third on top chef masters), and a stake in the oh-so-now gourmet burger trend. and they had to go and ruin my experience with their careless and indifferent service. 

seated at a tall table by the bar, with a spectacular view of union square, two girlfriends and i prepared to indulge in burger bliss, having talked about it for a solid two weeks prior to the opening. we began with the alcoholic milkshakes, and both the irish coffee and the mint chocolate chip are incredible. i don't think i really have to sell you on alcoholic milkshakes, do i? next we moved on to some thick, crunchy onion rings, paired with a buttermilk ranch sauce. we all opted for the sliders, so that we could taste three different kinds of meat: the buffalo is paired with caramelized onions, the black angus with smoky bacon, and the country natural with a sharp cheddar. delicious! as were the salty and crisp shoestring fries on the side. a couple of the sliders were on the rare side, but i'm not a girl who minds her burgers a little bloody. 

the food was great, the view was fantastic, and the bar ambience was quite nice. BB was headed for a four-star review. but the problem is the service. our dizzy server was disinterested and MIA the entire time we were there. dishes were brought out by food runners, so we saw her only sparsely anyway. but at the end of the meal, plates cleared by another BB staffer, we sat and watched her gab with the folks two tables away for a solid *eight minutes* (timed!). we tried to grab her attention or at least read her lips to find out what was so engaging (something about "pale and pasty?"), but ended up sitting there growing evermore annoyed as she yukked it up with her new friends. 

servers should never wait that long to turn over a table, especially with the long lines at the possibly over-hyped BB. one would assume that in a new restaurant the food is what most needs to have the kinks worked out, but i'd say the staff at BB could use with a little attitude adjustment.
author: Kris G.

description:
I wanted to love Burger Bar. Burger Bar had all of the right ingredients to be a huge success, yet managed to come up short. Opened by one of San Francisco's most renowned chefs and Fleur de Lys proprietor, Hubert Keller I couldn't wait to try Burger Bar. Add in that it is located in a prime location in Macy's at Union Square, has a full bar and is a restaurant dedicated to burgers, I was excited to try to this new bastion for burger lovers. 

I need to preface this review that I ate at this restaurant at a late time and so it could have just been an off night. I plan on going back and will update this review. But for now, here are my thoughts. 

Let me break down the Burger Bar experience. 

(1) Burger ---- I ordered the black angus beef burger, medium with jack cheese. I expected to bite into a juicy, tender piece of meat that would be oozing with flavor. Instead, I got a burger that was overcooked, crumbly and noticeably lacking in flavor. I could tell that they used good quality meat, but the lack of flavor failed to excite my senses. 

If Burger Bar wants to improve their ratings, this is the area where they can improve the most. When people walk into a Huber restaurant, they expect something different and exciting. Instead, it was more of the same. Yes, you can add foie gras for $30, but who wants to pay that for a topping? 

Bottom line in this area (1) add some more flavor to the patties, (2) do something different and more exciting for a reasonable price and (3) be sure not to overcook the burgers. 

(2) Bun ----  I had the wheat bun and was impressed. The bun was tasty, healthy, fluffy and exactly what I look for in a hamburger bun. Not very many burger joints offer wheat buns and those that do usually mess it up. I thought they did a great job in this area. 

(3) Garnish ----- The burger came with onions and a pickle as garnish. I thought they did a good job here and I don't have much to add in this area. 

(4) Sweet Potato Fries  ------ We ordered a side of sweet potato fries and found fries to be cold and over-salted. It could have been because I came here late, but this was a disappointment. 

(5) Drinks -----  I was impressed with their range of drinks and beer on tap. They also carry Lotus vodka, which is a favorite of mine and not too many places carry it. Good marks on this point. 

(6) Atmosphere ----  I thought it was a little too much like cheese cake factory and not quite unique enough. I wanted something a little more Huber-esqe in the feel, something a little more San Francisco and different. Although I recognize that they probably had a lot of design limitations given that they were in Macy's and were probably instructed to mimic the Cheesecake Factory formula. It was just a little too similar to Cheesecake for my taste. 

(7) The Hubert Factor ---- So, perhaps the most redeeming part of the experience (and why this restaurant gets three stars) is that I got to meet Hubert after dinner. He was at the bar and was chatting with diners. As a huge food network fan and as someone who admires Hubert, it was fun to meet him in person. He was extremely nice and took the time to thank my friend and I for coming to his restaurant, and I could tell that he meant it. 

I need to go back again and see if I was just there at an off night or off time, but for now I hope this helps other burger enthusiasts.
author: eric h.

description:
visiting san francisco for a few days. michael mina at my hotel could not accommodate us....so my friend recommended burger bar for its good view, and that some famous chef had established the place...

well, this is one of the stupidest places i have ever been to in my life....had their kobe burger, blue cheese, grilled onion, and chopped jalapenos on the side. two large bottles of sparkling water, skinny fries, and a milk shake...my friend ordered a glass of wine and a caesar salad with chicken. $100 later, i felt the mom and pop shop in our chicago neighborhood is much better for a lot less...

this place is kinda baskin robins of burger shops...only in the process made itself kitsch at best....should not be rated any higher than a chilli's or TGIF or bennigan (sp?) type of place....if these places are your usual hangouts, then you may fit right in...

good service...a bit slow but they were very busy...pleasant staff.

this place is cheezy like hell. good for tourists who also are happy to rush back home to tell everyone they have been to the fisherman's wharf .... 

not worth my time to write more about it anymore. 
yelp powers of beings: please establish a zero star rating too....
author: Mehran F.

description:
Don't sit near the back - I was so sweaty I dropped my glass of water the minute it arrived.  Just slipped right out of my sweaty palms.  

If you aren't seated near the kitchen, the experience improves significantly.  I agree with the rest of the reviews; it's touristy and not cheap, but the window seat overlooking Union Square is great.  Good people watching while you wait for your 20 dollar burger.  I started with the cucumber cooler?  Or something.  It had a cucumber in it.  And it was pretty good.  It wasn't good enough to make me enjoy the Oscars, though, or all the red lipstick on pasty white celebrities I saw.  (Except Sarah Jessica Horseface, she looked like a piece of bacon.)  

Anyways, speaking of bacon, you can get it on your burgers if you choose....  I chose Kobe beef and added pepperjack and guacamole.  And that brought my total near 25 dollars for one burger.  But it was good.  I would actually strongly suggest the Buffalo - my hot date got that and we ended up splitting the two...  Hers was better.  

Good service, (some little terror next to us was flinging french fries and spilling her mother's cocktails, so she kept the bussers busy,) good drinks, clean crappers.  All the making of an "A-OK" review.  

I'll be back once I get my next bonus check.
author: Sean O.

description:
There's a burger here that costs $60.

Because it's made out of gold?

Not sure how amazing that burger (Kobe beef with virgin hog-picked shaved truffles) is, but our burgers were very tasty. In an age where even your local burger shop charges near $10 for a thin, greasy, fatty (in a bad way) patty, coughing up three to four mored dollars shouldn't be that big of a deal.

And don't even get me started on the Chocolate-Hazelnut-Nutella shake. Oh. My. Word. This concoction is surely the Devil's work-it's that decadent.

My BF first went in Vegas, and he thinks our location is better. Our service was okay, the wait was maybe 10 minutes, but our food was very good, and the quality of meat was well worth the price.

My only gripe? We received about 7 french fries with our burgers, but between the burger and the shake, I only made it through about 4 anyways.
author: Sachi T.

description: Beef is mediocre and the burger buns are never fresh. In fact the bun that came with my burger was so old, I was crumbling apart. Overall a waste of money and a waste of location considering the great view (overlooking Union Square)
author: Ramoun M.

description:
I have nothing truly negative to say about the Burger Bar, but as the words next to my star rating say- "Meh. I've experienced better."

You can certainly get very creative with your burger here, but I wasn't particularly impressed with the preset "chef" creations.  They only had a couple of options and none of them thrilled me.  When I received my burger, it was cooked fine.  Nothing to write home about, just fine.

Personally for the cost of the food here, I don't think it is worth it.  Perhaps if you want something other than traditional beef this allows you more options, but my local burger shop now serves buffalo, turkey and other options as well.  For less.  And cooked about the same.

The service was fine for a busy day in union square.  The sweet potato fries were tasty and the zucchini fries were insane in the quantity.

Some pros and some cons, but like I said- I've simply had better.
author: Karey G.

description:
I have a thing - no - more like an obsession with burgers.  All burgers.  Veggie burgers, beef burgers, chicken burgers, turkey burgers.  I llllllllllloooooovvvvveee burgers.  I also love Top Chef and watched every episode (multiple times) of Top Chef Masters.

So when UrbanDaddy sent the email about Burger Bar opening in SF, my entire weekend was arranged to be there.  The wait wasn't too bad - about 45 minutes.  (hint: ladies leave the guy to wait for the table and head down to 2 to look at shoes) I was VERY excited that Chef Keller was there, signing books, and was quite friendly.  Our waiter was kinda meh and you have no control of the mini-TV at your table, but you're really there for the burger.

Which is quite good.  After falling prey to the Father's Office burger (aka the most over-hyped burger ever) I wasn't sure what to expect.  I got the Hubert Keller burger (buffalo, blue cheese, caramelized onions, baby spinach, on ciabatta) and it was great.  Considering that most of the ingredients are the same as the Father's Office burger, it's SO much better.  The buffalo was cooked perfectly and the proportion of each ingredient was great.

I can't say when I'll be back for a pricey burger, especially now that I have the cookbook, but this is one of the best burgers out there.
author: Gracie B.

description:
Mmmmm...  Nothing special!

I had the Kobe burger with peppered bacon, american cheese on an onion roll with the sweet potato fries.  It was solid.  Didn't blow me away.  Sweet potato fries were cold and a lil soft/soggy which was disappointing.  But what was more disappointing was that I ordered it med rare and it was soooo well done (BOOOOOOOOOOO).  Should have sent it back, but the 2 pitchers of Stella that my friends and I threw back while we waited impaired my judgement.  

The onion rings and the zucchini fries my friends got were sooo good though, I'd go back for that!!!  Oh and that $60 foie burger.  Geah, I love foie and truffles...

Oh and plus I didn't quite get the decor.  It was on the level of freakin Burgermeister.  We did appreciate the in booth television sets though :)
author: Jammir G.

description:
Hubert Keller. In person. Live @ the Burger Bar last night! He's wonderful, talented, and really, everything that a celebrity chef should be. At random points of the night, he would appear suddenly from the kitchen, all smiles, greeting various guest and even personally serving his signature milkshakes. Definitely enhanced the dining experience to see such a revered chef being so personable & present. And...that's pretty much the only 100% satisfactory thing about my experience at Burger Bar.

I had no problems with the hostess, as other yelpers had mentioned. She seated us within the time quoted, but the seats were HORRIBLE. Although there were other 2-seater tables open in various parts of the restaurant, we were seated behind a wall. Bless her heart, she sold it to us like it was a great seat - you get a window!-but she didn't mention that there was a solid wall blocking our view of the restaurant (and most importantly, the view of our server from seeing our needs for refills and such). The table was also squeezed between the smallest of spaces (i couldn't even hold my arm out).  It was very uncomfortable & claustrophobic. 

Our server seemed a bit frazzled. Seems a bit understaffed here. Most of the time, she was nowhere to be seen. She seemed to have little experience and because everyone was probably just as frazzled, she had no help. Hopefully this is something that'll get better and not worse.

My friend & I ordered:

-Kobe Beef w/ Bacon
-Veggie Burger w/ Shiitake Mushrooms
-Skinny Fries
-Soda & Iced Tea 

The burgers came with lettuce, tomato, and onion...but let me tell you, it was the saddest thing ever. The lettuce was about 1/2 the size of a regular piece. Maybe it was for presentation purposes, but really? they could only spare 1/2 piece of lettuce? Disappointing toppings aside, the burgers were both good. The veggie was especially soft (might be too soft for some) and had a nice flavor that hinted at the pumpkin puree. Neither, however, were mind-blowing. The fries were tasty..similar to the kind they have at McDonald's, except without as much preservatives or a documentary spotlight.

The Drinks deserve their own paragraph. The pepsi was completely flat. Completely. The iced tea tasted watered down. It was shocking to say the least. For a newly opened restaurant, I can give them slack for not getting their service in order or maybe even for a kitchen that is not at its full potential, but getting Pepsi and iced tea wrong? That's inexcusable. They cost about $3.50/ea, by the way.

Our bill came to about $50. For what we had/experienced, it was pretty damn overpriced. The burgers get 1 star each. Hubert gets one star for being Hubert, whom I still love with all my heart despite my unhappiness with the meal. I really hope this restaurant does well because he deserves that, but until things turn around, I don't think I'll be contributing to the Burger Bar Fund again.
author: Rona J.

description:
Came on opening day and even met chef Hubert Keller himself, who's really down to earth and personable. 

I had the Hubert Keller burger which came with buffalo meat, caramelized onions, bleu cheese, and sauteed spinach on a ciabatta bun. Everything came together perfectly from the perfectly cooked juicy buffalo, to the texture of the bun, and the extra savoriness from the bleu cheese.

The rojo diablo cocktail was amazing, with hangar one vodka, clamata juice, muddled jalapeño, and celery salt around the rim; this was some spicy goodness. 

The skinny fries were nice, sort of similar to nopa's fries. The onion rings and steak fries were pretty standard. 

4 stars since the wait can be long, and my burger was a pricey $22. Sometimes you gotta pay for quality.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Can you say BUFFALO Burger??!!

After a day of shopping with a friend, we had worked up a good appetite for a burger.  She had heard about this place so we decided to give it a try.  I'm so glad we did....

At first, when sitting down to the menu I was a bit taken aback when I saw the prices.  Seriously, this much for a burger?  "This better be good," I thought to myself.  Then as I continued to read the do-it-yourself menu, I came across the meats, which included buffalo.  At first I thought what the heck is this?... and my friend started raving about how good buffalo burgers were.  Being skeptical I couldn't see myself ordering a whole buffalo burger.

So I ordered the slider sampler.  It was three burgers all different meats.  One of which was buffalo.  When our orders arrived, the food smelled and looked so delicious.  I randomly chose my first burger and bit into it.  OMG, this burger was freaking awesome!! Moist, tender, full of yummy goodness...  I wish I had ordered a whole one of whatever it was.  After eating the next one, it didn't nearly compare with the first.  When the waitress passed by I asked her to ID the sliders.  Undeniably, it was the buffalo I had fallen for.

Will I go back to this place? I sure hope so.  I could see coming here with my brother on our birthday's or something.  But just make sure, whoever's gonna pay, knows up front, this aint no Red Robbin.

So good - go try it - and enjoy!
author: Nancy O.

description:
Loved: Hubert Keller on Top Chef Masters
Liked: Burger Bar's Buffalo buger w/skinny fries & Macy's 6th floor view of Union Square
Disliked: Tourist trap prices
author: Tina T.

description:
If, for some reason, I wanted to pay $35 per person to eat at a TGIFriday's, I would go back to Burger Bar. Otherwise, I can see no reason to return. 

The "ambiance" consisted of grease-smeared tables, spacey teen-aged waitresses, and dirty bathrooms. The menu is a chaotic mess using no fewer than three different ugly fonts; it looks cheap, like the design I used to do for my company newsletter in Adobe PageMaker circa 1998. 

This is the kind of place that makes me pity tourists from Ohio who stumble in, thinking they will get an authentic San Francisco food experience from the renowned chef Hubert Keller. They will leave feeling ripped off (as they should) and vaguely nauseated. I live in SF and expect to pay more for everything; however, I also expect the quality to be commensurate with the price. 

We had the Hubert Keller burger (spinach, blue cheese, and buffalo on a ciabatta bun). The untoasted bun was dry and the burger was half its size. The cheese was good, the spinach completely untaste-able. It came with a side of decent "skinny fries." Price: $22. Seriously.

We also had the kobe burger with a slice of foie gras. This was ok, if the meat a bit mushy in texture.  Again the bun (plain this time) was dry and untoasted, and melted into a greasy mass under the burger before I even picked it up. Only the awesome power of foie gras redeemed the dish. The onion rings, while passable, were over-coated with breading and had little or no onion flavor. We were charged $1.50 for the ranch dressing. This was not mentioned on the menu nor by the waitress. 

The beer selection is very impressive. I enjoyed the Imperial Oktoberfest on draft and my husband liked his Three Philosophers. 

The service was amateurish but friendly. 

I wanted to like this place, so much. I had hoped to take my husband to Fleur de Lys for a special dinner in the near future, but after this disastrous meal, I will not be giving Keller another penny of my money. This felt like a crudely designed wallet-emptying machine, not a restaurant. Save your money and go through the In-and-Out drive-thru.
author: Mel A.

description:
If I were so inclined, then MAYBE I'd consider spending $60 on a burger with foie gras and shaved truffles.  But, since no part of that sounds appealing to me, I went with the peppercorn burger.  I actually really liked it...had a kick, which always works for me.  

What was most surprising was that the prices weren't AS outrageous as I would have guessed.  But, let's get real...for $8 you can get a decent burger and fries at Flippers.

Great beer selection, though...especially the Belgians.  And next time, I'm definitely gonna grub on the dessert menu...if there IS a next time.  is it worth it to go to Burger Bar just for beer and desserts?  

Maybe...
author: Susan L.

description:
I think I went here with high expectations, and no real craving for a burger. I just wanted foie I think. I got a turkey burger with foie and the truffle sauce and sweet potato fries. next time Ill just order the fries and a shake. The shakes look AWESOME. 
Note to self: Christmas shopping will be augmented with a shake. And a beer.
The beer selection was great! Not Holy Crap Am I in Portland great, but pretty good for mall food great.
I'd go back, and was happy to see that Hubert himself was hanging out during the nascent time of his new project. Respect.
author: Catherine R.

description:
4 stars because the food, atmosphere, and location are great! Our server was not so...he was just ok.  Came here a little early (around 5:15-5:30 on a Sat. night) w/ a group of 7 people and were seated right away (woot!) Our menus and waters were brought quickly....then we waited for our server to come back to take our order....and waited.....and waited....and freakin waited for about 15-20mins (am i being too impatient?)  We tried several times to flag him down but he went to the larger group next to us and took their order first : (  Boo now our food wouldn't come for sometime.  Luckily I was in good company and there was a tiny little TV at the end of our booth playing sports, which is kinda cool.

The food was definitely worth the wait! I had the Hubert Keller Burger w/ skinny friends and O.M.G. this was more savory and delicious than I could imagine!  Carmelized onions, spinach (I think sauteed), crumbled bleu cheese, and buffalo meat combined on a ciabatta bun would be so yummy! I think it was love at first bite.

So server aside, the food here is scrumptious and prices are basically what you get for being in a nice SF restaurant.  But it was my birthday dinner...so I'm allowed to eat and splurge a little, right?
author: Tracy N.

description:
I never knew there were so many options to make a hamburger...including a $60 burger they have on the menu which includes foie gras and truffles...I'm still perplexed why anyone would want that. If I pay $60 for some beef my cow better have been treated like a king with the best grass in the state.

The burger I ate (black angus) was very juicy but if you want things like cheese, french fries or grilled and/or caramelized onions be prepared to pay extra on top of a minimum almost $10 burger.

The Burger Bar is an excellent choice for a "gourmet" burger with gourmet prices.  The service is great and the people who work there seem pretty down to earth.  Nice set up and ambiance.  Will be back when I'm prepared to pay $15 to $20 for a cheeseburger which honestly may not be anytime soon.
author: Tia L.

description:
I'm going to have to take away a star now.

The food is still excellent,  however, this is the third time that I order a burger medium rare and it came out well done.  

This is me ordering the Rossini burger too that they messed up on.  I hate sending back food, but I just cant have my burger well done.  They did rectify the situation and brought me another burger but not before I ate the rest of the foie gras.  

Service is still great here, They felt really bad that they messed up, but if Im forking out $60 for a burger, this should come out perfect.

I will still return to this place, hopefully they will not mess up again.
author: Tony Y.

description:
If you have cravings for sweet potato fries and Yummy amazing sensational milkshakes, this is the hottest spot.
We were going to catch a movie and decided to stop here to get a snack for the theater.
Got it to go, and it was the best thing we did all day!

We ordered the black and white milkshake and strawberry milkshake. It was really really good. It is not your regular milkshakes, it really has the flavor and the taste of real ingredients! I would definitely come back again when I visit SF in the summer!
author: FOODY L.

description:
1-7-11:
I'm modifying my original review because I returned with my boyfriend 2 weeks later, after having raved about the zucchini fries for the past 2 weeks. How embarrassed I was... they were overcooked and soggy in the middle, not to mention that the burgers weren't cooked properly, the bun was not warmed up, and the patties had an overwhelming pepper flavor to them, which I don't recall from my first visit. The pepper really turned me off. AND it is expensive, especially considering that the food is not that great. You're really going here for the experience of the window seats right on Union Square.

12-4-10:
Went with a friend on Saturday afternoon about 4pm. I ordered the Angus burger with mozzarella on sourdough roll. Burger was cooked correctly (medium rare), though the sourdough roll didn't really taste like sourdough. Zucchini fries were to die for!!! Hands down my favorite part of the meal, and the reason I will be returning.

My friend ordered the vegan burger, which was quite the compilation of ingredients, ranging from pumpkin puree to potatoes to lentils, but had an excellent flavor and crispness.

Overall, it was very enjoyable experience. It was busy, however the wait was only 5-10 minutes, and service was good considering how busy they were.

YEA FOR THE ZUCCHINI FRIES!!!
author: Katy S.

description:
Despite the mixed reviews, I'd bring any burger aficionado to try Hubert Keller's secondary restaurant for the quality of the ingredients even if it's not the best execution or deal.  It may not have the French flair, but it provides a better convenient dining option than the food court with a great view of Union Square on the 6th floor of Macy's for those who can afford to indulge and lounge around with some burgers, fries and fried zucchini sticks.  The three complementary sauces that are worth a try include mayo, pesto, and a thousand island like dressing.  My favorite burgers are the Hubert Keller burger, which was served on Top Chef Masters with roquefort blue cheese, and the American Kobe beef burger with oyster mushrooms and truffle sauce.  Unlike the Rossini deluxe Kobe burger for $60 with foie gras, truffles and the works, the other burgers are range between $17 - $23 or more depending on what toppings, sauces and sides you add to your customized creation.

Service was friendly and helpful even though it was a tad bit slow without lines and crowds to pack the room.  Although the ambiance and decor is simple and clean with an upscale feel for a trendy burger joint, the way the staff carries themselves doesn't quite match.  Parking is tough on the street, but there are nearby garages.
author: Jenny L.

description:
When I saw the episode of Top Chef Masters where they had a burger quickfire challenge, I knew that I had to eat one of his burgers.  I told my girlfriend, "Next time, we're in Vegas, we are going to Burger Bar."

Luckily for me, I don't need to go to Vegas, just Union Square.  So my $20 dollar burger will remain just that.  In Vegas, that could be coupled with a night at the craps tables or blackjack, so that burger could cost me much more than $20.

Yeah, I'm Chinese, that's my weakness.  I deal with it, sometimes literally.

I had a Kobe beef burger, with bacon and dijon mustard.  I tried to keep my burger as neutral as possible so I can truly taste the Kobe beef, I've never had it before.  When I received the burger, the taste was not exactly as I had expected.  The beef was rich, and definitely not lean, but not what I was expected, I wasn't disappointed, it was still a good burger.  After I was done, I ate the pieces of Kobe beef that had fallen off the burger and that was a nearly life changing experience.  The beef was some of the best beef I have ever had.  Putting such beef on a burger, even a gourmet burger, did it a great disservice.  Next time, I will not order Kobe beef.  I'll still have a great burger, but it will be much lower in price.

My girlfriend had the Hubert Keller burger, that should be the gold standard of what a gourmet burger should be.  I'll let her review that, but in a nutshell, it was full of good snobby toppings, none of the toppings overpowered a good burger.

Still, at $20 a pop, this should not become a habit.
author: Kenny L.

description: I would not go back to the Burger Bar for any reason unless they were giving away free burgers! Even then I would have second thoughts. The first thing that you're probably going to experience is the lack of customer service attitude with the very young women at the reception desk! Someone should take one of these young ladies and teach them two things. 1 should be respect, 2 should be courtesy! Apparently they don't connect their paycheck with the customers that come into spend their money! My significant other and I went in to get a bite to eat and to see what all the hoopla was about and it was busy because it was January 1st and most restaurants in the area were closed. So when I asked for a table the woman snickered and laughed when I asked for a table not sure why. This person asked for my cell phone number and then said it would be a 15 minutes to 20 minute wait. So my girlfriend went and got 2 seats in the bar and we ordered from there. The bartender was very gracious and assist us with a couple of drinks water which was a milkshake and the other one and alcoholic beverage. Now this young woman really knew what customer service was all about. The burgers were delicious they were served in a timely fashion so that was a plus for this place
author: Jim S.

description:
Rating 2 Stars: Meh. I've experienced better.

THAT IS CORRECT. I was shopping one day and I've heard of this new place that opened inside Macy's, Burger Bar. My friends and I decided to come try it. Since we had 5 people, wait was a bit longer (45 mins). They seated most of the 2 seaters first, so that's no biggie if you're going with 2 people.

The view is nice, overlooking Union Square. The larger tables have a little tv screen to keep you entertained, but no volume.

After we got seated by the host, it took 15 minutes for a waiter to come greet us and asked what we would like to drink. They have a pretty large variety of beer, wine, cocktails, and milkshakes. The wait time for drinks were 10 minutes or so.

Then we put in our orders for food. I decided to try the Burger Sliders so I ordered that. One of my friend ordered a chicken burger and the waiter asked, "How would you like it?". WELL DONE OF COURSE!!! *knocks on head* I thought that was funny. HAHA! Wait time for food was 45 MINUTES!!!!! We were all so overly-hungry that we weren't hungry anymore.

Food was ok, but we all definitely had better burgers.

After eating, we decided to get the heck-on-out of this place so we asked for the check. Whoopie doo, check came in 2 minutes. You know what i mean right?

Overall, 45 minutes wait time for a group of 5, 15 minutes for a waiter to come greet us and take our drink order, 10 minutes wait time for drinks to come and order food, 45 minutes for food to come that were EH! and 2 minutes for the check to come.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Burger Bar is on the sixth floor of the Macy's building, and overlooks Union Square.  The atmosphere is very tourist like, and the view is gorgeous on a clear night.  It's usually clear, I think.

Foodwise, burgers are burgers.  It costs twice as much as the Counter, and aside from the $60 burger with truffle & foie gras, I honestly don't see how it's that much better.   

Go try it and see if you like it.  it's good, the burgers are tender, flavorful, and juicy, but so are the burgers at many places.  I prefer to go to the Counter.  But it's worth it to try at least once.
author: Carrie-C N.

description:
Overhyped

I was really excited to try Burger Bar, after all that's all I've been eating since moving to Pittsburgh and it seemed like a great meal before boarding my flight back to PGH. The prices were a little high, especially if you come here for lunch. I don't think the menus change for lunch/dinner. I got the classic cheeseburger from the chef's section of the menu and it was okay. I loved the beef patty but it sogged through the bun and the bun fell apart making it very awkward to eat my cheeseburger :( I'm all about hands, knives and forks are for little kids. The portion was more than generous though, so I didn't feel like my $16 burger was a complete rip off, it came with fries too (which were delicious, and thick!)

The service was top class, super fast and attentive, I loved it!

There are better places to get a burger in this city.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
I've been to Burger Bar 3 times since opening, always on a Friday or Saturday night after a comedy show.  The first two times were two consecutive Saturdays, and Hubert Keller was there for both.  He actually said "welcome back" when I came in the second time, meaning either he overheard me mention my previous visit or he has an incredible memory. 

Anyways, on to what matters.  I've had two beef burgers and one turkey burger, and they were all delicious.  The skinny and sweet potato fries are great, although I'm disappointed to see they don't offer garlic fries.  You'd think with the ridiculous number of other sides / add-ons, garlic fries wouldn't be much of a stretch, but I'm sure Hubert has his reasons.

They have a great beer selection and some interesting alcoholic milkshakes.  I had one of these booze shakes, and it was good but I prefer a regular shake or drink.  Prices are pretty high here of course, you can easily spend $20-25 a person between food and drink.

Service has been attentive, but one thing that was kind of stupid was this:  I wanted to try the surf-and-turf burger (you know, the one that comes with lobster on it) but instead of skinny fries I wanted to substitute sweet potato fries.  They said that's not an option.  Skinny fries and sweet potato fries are the same price on the menu, so I can't really fathom any reason that they wouldn't let you do the substitution.  So instead of ordering the $24 surf-and-turf, I got a $9 turkey burger (and added oyster mushrooms, cheese and avocado).

Still, the food is damn good so I recommend trying it at least once.  Between this and Pearl's, there are great burgers to be had in the area.
author: Joseph N.

description:
On the very first day God created the Quarter Pounder.
On the next He created the Whopper with cheese.
On the third day He created the Famous Star, again with cheese.
On the fourth day He created the Bacon Cheeseburger Royale at Bistro Burger. Amen.
On the fifth day God created the California burger at Barney's. Yup, He did.
On the sixth day He created the Double Double with grilled onions.

And on the seventh day, our Lord finally got it right. He created a burger at Burger Bar. Not content with creating just any burger, He created a plethora of options that defy conventional accepted truths of what a burger should be. He created Hubert Keller, who in turn created the most perfect burger that ever was.

So there it is. So there I was. Hubert even came by our table and I met my own version of God. I proceeded to order a peppercorn burger. Pouring the most perfect peppercorn sauce over the most perfect burger is a pleasure that I hold dearly, that many take for granted, but one that I will not soon forget. Fortunately this sacred temple of beef is close to home and I shall most definitely be getting my ass back to worship the Burger Almighty in the very near term. Amen.
author: Matt H.

description:
I'm thinking I was expecting a little too much out of a burger experience. I thought I would experience something out of the normal burger eating process, but that only turned out to be the price.

I had the turkey burger with some veggies on a wheat bun. The bun was huge! It was about the same size of the patty (which was pretty huge in size). I ate mostly the turkey, which was quite tasty, and left the bread. 

The sweet potato fries were really delicious, however! The view of Union Square was nice, too. 

The waiter was really nice and helpful, but did make us feel rushed when the restaurant wasn't even full. Maybe he had to go home or something... 

Also, it might just be my stupidity, but their dessert menu comprises of milkshakes...only. Which is kind of a bummer, but I guess it fits in with the whole "burgers and shakes" deal. 

There are definitely other places to go for burgers, but at least I can say I ate at a restaurant run by a top chef...?
author: Angela A.

description:
This is a review for Vegetarians:

Veggie Burger: Reading the menu I was quite pleased that the veggie burger was not the typical Gardenburger.  It went downhill from there.  The burger was total mush.  Tasted like sweet potato baby food with a crispy outer crust and served between two pieces of bread.  In foodie verbage: no texture.  Salt, Pepper, Ranch, Ketchup...I kept looking for things to make this burger tasty.  FailBlog!  

Zucchini fries: Serious issue here, the outer bread crumbs were nice and crispy but the zucchini was mushy.  These seriously are no different than the grocery frozen food variety.  I knew I should have gone for the regular skinny fries.

Decor was a downer but service was friendly.  We walked out paying $35 for 2 burgers + 1 side + 2 beers.  We expected a lot from a Hubert Keller joint; sadly we were left taking home leftovers that even a bum wouldn't eat.
author: Sheetal S.

description:
I can't believe Chef Keller runs this place. The food was mediocre. 

We got the wings as an app, veggie burger and BBQ burger along with a side of fries. All in all, it was "Hm, that was okay" The wing app are nothing more than fried wings tossed in Franks Wingsauce...seriously, I know. Further, the veggie burger was underseasoned and doesnt pair well with the pesto they put on it. The pesto is distinctively sharp and given the under seasoned burger, it overpowers everything. Further, the veggie burger is so soft that there really isnt any texture to the dish. It should include crispy onion rings with it. The BBQ burger was ok, run of the mill burger. Really nothing more to say about it, honestly. 

Not worth the money you will shell out. I'm all for paying up downtown, but c'mon.
author: Ben D.

description:
I like burgers.  When I heard there was a fancy burger bar that recently opened in town, I had to check it out.  I've seen Hubert Keller perform on Top Chef Masters and boy was I impressed.  While I haven't had the privilege of eating at Fleur de Lys, I can imagine it is wonderful.  I figured this may be a chance to try something more recession friendly.

After reading the reviews, it seemed like a casual place, so I marched over to Macy's and rode the elevator up to the sky.  This restaurant is interesting because it is literally In Macy's.

The first thing I noticed was that the lighting was excessively bright.  The easiest way to make a restaurant classier is to dim the lights.  What you can't see won't hurt you.  And everyone has heard the expression, everyone looks good in the dark.  On a side note, ladies, always go on a first date in a dimly lit restaurant because you will look hot.  As I was thinking this, they did dim the lights, which they probably do at the start of evening.  

I sat at the bar where it was easy to find a seat, but hard to find service.  The two bartenders were about twelve years old and both ignored me.  I had to find an abandoned menu from some previous patrons and ask for service every time I wanted to order something.

The menu is a la carte with a few predetermined burgers on the other side of the menu.  However, if you order from the fixed menu there is a strict 'no substitutions' policy, which seems a bit ridiculous.  I also noticed some sweet burgers for dessert, like a chocolate burger.

I ordered an a la carte burger, which nearly resembled the Classic burger, with a few changes.  It took a while to order a drink after that because I was getting no service.  I did hear that they were short staffed one bartender, but the two that were there did not seem very skilled.  Watching them tap a few beers was embarrassing.  I have never seen anyone pour so much head on multiple beers and then serve them to guests.

When my burger did arrive, it was short my order of sweet potato fries.  I reminded the bartender that I had ordered them, and he had neglected to put this order in.  I tried to eat my burger slowly while I waited for the fries, but as my burger turned cold, I reminded a server about my fries and he brought some for me.

The burger itself was middle of the road.  I ordered it medium, but it was about medium well, which is okay with me.  The burger was the perfect size, not too big, not too small, with a thick pattie.  However, I found the meat crumbly, rather than juicy.  The bread was nice and the condiments satisfactory.  I love sweet potato fries, so they were probably the best part of the meal.  The selection of beers is very extensive, another highlight.

This seems like a nice place to eat while downtown, and I would come back to try some other burgers, but the service begs improvement.  I am surprised to hear that Hubert Keller is on site running this ship, because it feels more like a Cheesecake Factory or another chain.  At one point during my meal, the previously dimmed lights had a minor 'malfunction' and came back on, to everyone's surprise.  It was one of those aha moments, perhaps indicative of the service and inconsistency.  I hope H irons out the kinks here and gives the Cheesecake Factory a run for their money.
author: apple r.

description:
So disappointing. I love burgers and I love Hubert. But I do not love Burger Bar.

After a failed attempt at Christmas shopping, my friend and I decided to have a late lunch/early dinner here. Because of the odd hour, we were seated immediately. We started with sweet potato fries and the fried jalapeno pickles. Both were a let down: the fries were sad and overcooked; the jalapeno pickles were heavily battered and cut in spears and tasted like boring pickles and had no jalapeno flavor. 

My friend debated ordering the $65 burger and then the $23 surf and turf burger. He then debated ordering a burger a la carte with a half lobster on top. He finally settled on the country natural beef patty, seared foie gras, swiss cheese, carmelized onions, and oyster mushrooms on an onion bun. 

I ordered the country natural beef patty with jack cheese, and a fried egg on ciabatta bun. We also decided to try the truffle sauce, which was not as good as we hoped. The flavor did not match our burgers but that was our mistake for getting overly ambitious. 

While decent, the burgers were not impressive for the price. The quality was good and the flavors were fine but not phenomenal. The burges were also very difficult to eat. We finally gave up trying to eat with our hands and busted out forks and knives. While the idea of so many interesting and fancy toppings is great in theory, attempting to eat such a thick and messy burger prevented me from getting bites containing all the components of the burger. 

The a la carte menu is great in theory, except that the price of one burger really adds up the more ingredients one adds. There are so many great burgers in SF that are a fraction of a cost of a fully loaded burger here. All in all, I am glad I tried this place but I have definitely had tastier, less expensive burgers in town.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Sucks pretty hard.  Debated between 1 and 2 stars.  I think there are probably at least 100 restaurants in the city with better hamburgers than this.  This was dry in the wrong places and soggy in the wrong places and uniformly tasteless.

I realize they were trying for something a bit more humbly, stereotypically American with the decor, but the decor really looks out of place in this particular part of America.

Service started off very poor, but ended up okay.  It took them 15 or 20 minutes to seat us in a restaurant that was less than half full, and when they finally did, they gave us a bad table in the back, walking past all sorts of better, empty tables to get there.  They kept apologizing for keeping us waiting.  However, once we got our server, things were okay as he was much more competent than the hostesses.

Since it is inside a department store on Union Square, anyone could predict that it's overpriced, but I loled when I saw that Chimay Grande Reserve goes for $36 here (it retails for $9-$11 in stores).  Also, if I remember correctly, they have PBR on tap for $5.  So the beer list is decent, though things of PBR quality and things of Chimay quality are given approximately equal representation, but plan to overpay in spades, particularly if you want to get a good/somewhat unusual beer.  Best to forget the beer list and get a milkshake, methinks.  I got a Strongbow since they have it on tap, and it tasted like dishwashing detergent.  Rinse your glasses better, people!

Will not return.
author: Brendan M.

description:
The higher expectation, the greater disappointment. 

The inefficient services ruined our appetite. 

We'd waited to be seated for 30 minutes, another 10 minutes waiting for taking order, 45 minutes for having our burgers served. It only took us 20 minutes to finish our dishes, yet, another 15 minutes waiting to pay the bill. Ugh..way too much waiting, waiting and waiting. 

The burgers are ok but not worth the the price, plus an hour and an half water and beer drinking. Ugh..again!

I'm glad that at least I've tried but would never go again.
author: Chiqui H.

description:
I'm only rating the bar it self, there was a young bartender short a little tan....Bad bad bad service! 
2 of my friends ordered a drink (forgot what it was) the drink had no liquor what so ever. My friend asked for a shot to make up for the light drink he made for the both of them. He mumbled and walked a way.... (uhmmm okay wth!!) so we ended up waiting FOREVER!!!!!! To get our check. We waisted 44 min's that we can't get back because he was a slow server... WTF!! If I was another the bartender would have asked us how we are doing? Of we wanted another drink or even take our card upon ordering the drink... Well he gave us horrible service!!!! 
I will not go there again....
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
So we've all seen the famous mane known as Hubert Keller on Bravo, PBS, and gracing the advertisements of Macy's. I was enthused when I discovered that Hubert Keller was bringing this place to SF, telling everyone I knew the week it was opening. 

Fast forward to last Friday, a week after their official opening. We arrive at around 9:30p and are promptly seated. My first impressions was that this place had a feel of an Applebees or a TGI Fridays (you know trying to be something bigger than it actually is). Upon sitting down at the table, I discover that the table is a little sticky and greasy. More people we know ended up joining us so we switched tables. STRIKE ONE - Dirty Table.

Also, the first waiter we had seemed like he was a bit in a hurry. We sat down, he comes over and we politely say give us a second as we hadn't even opened our menus. No more than 45 seconds later, menus still closed and still getting situated, he comes back and says, "Are you guys ready now?" But, then we switched tables so not a deal, just kind of annoying though. 

So I go to order my beer; it's true that Burger Bar has a huge beer menu... IF ONLY THEIR SERVERS KNEW WHAT THEY SERVED. I order a Goose Island Bourbon Stout, to which the waitress then said, "I don't think we have that." As I look back over the menu, I seriously thought I was loosing my mind because it wasn't there. I quickly grab another menu and discover that there are two menus, one with more beers than the other. I point to my selection and they DID have it. STRIKE TWO - Not knowing your beer list, not knowing you had  two beer menus (admitted to me as a new and old menu), and not updating the two menus. 

We got our food. The food was pretty good, I mean it's a burger joint. But it wasn't the epicurean revelation that I hoped it would be. Additionally, someone at our table ordered the fried jalapeño pickles. When ordering them he asked if these were whole jalapeños that were pickled or if they were pickles brined with jalapeño spice. The waitress had no idea how to respond and stalled a bit. My friend slowly asked, to make the distinction clear, "Are they fried jalapeños or pickles?" She looks back at him, with that, I hope I get this right look and says, "Jalapeños." The end up being the pickles. STRIKE THREE - Know your menu! 

Training, training, training... the service here makes what would have been a decent experience into a mediocre one at best. And for that price, I could probably get better service at the afore mentioned food chains (though I haven't been to either of them in at least 7 years). 
 
Bottomline, if your stuck in Union Square and you want a burger, save your money and go to the food court in SF Center because I'm sure there's something better there. If you want the best burger in SF with no BS, go to Chez Maman and make sure you get the egg topper.

Monsieur Keller, I think you're better than what was portrayed to my visit to Burger Bar SF. I really wanted to like this place... check that I really wanted to LOVE this place. I'm sure there are people like me who were/are excited to have a Hubert Keller experience that would motivate me to finally make that reservation at Fleur De Lys, that I've been stalling on. But for now, when I think high end food, I'll trust my palate and pocket book with the other famous Keller in Northern California, Thomas.
author: Douglas L.

description:
There was so much hype for this place, it got my hopes up. This place is good, but it's not the best I've had. It's pretty dark when you first enter, and even more darker if you sit near the dimmed lights. Although the restaurant is nice and the personal little mini screens at the tables are even more awesome. The times I've been here, I came for dinner, so it's most expensive than lunch. 

My fave are the sweet potato fries and the regular chicken breast burger with swiss cheese. I really like this place, but for such a known name (Hubert Keller) I guess I just expected too much and instead realized that this place was just another high end burger place when I can get the same elsewhere for cheap. 

I guess it was good while it lasted. I'll be back when I can afford it because broke college students shouldn't be eating here. haha!

anyways happy eating! :)
author: Liberty C.

description:
We were came to Burger Bar on opening weekend around lunch time and were shocked to find no wait.  Three of us split the Buffalo Burger and the Black Jack Burger.  While the burgers were tasty, they weren't worth the hefty price tag as our service was absolutely awful.  Our waitress repeatedly poured us the wrong beers and instead of substituting the regular fries for sweet potato fries on the Black Jack burger as we requested, ordered us two additional plates of sweet potato fries.  The total bill came to close to $75 and it certainly wasn't anywhere close to an ideal experience.  They are really going to have to step it up with their staff if they want to charge me more than $8 for a burger again.  

On the plus side, they do have an amazing selection of beers on draft and bottle, but that doesn't help when your server keeps bringing the wrong one.
author: Lauren L.

description:
First off, the owner, hubert keller is so very nice and modest even. I can't say that this is the best burger i've ever had, and i have had many kinds... but i suppose this place is more about the add ons. sauces, gravies, onions, bacon, etc. etc. the list goes on, but i just got a reg. burger with the gravy like sauce. Plus I went the day after they opened, so things weren't running as smoothly as it probably is now... the first 3 beers i chose to order, were not in stock; the burger was rarer than i ordered, and our server wasn't quite sure what was going on... but they have a great beer list, if they have it all.

oh and i have been to the vegas, mandalay bay location before. i liked it better there. but maybe because i got the kobe style burger with caramelized onions, reduction sauce, bacon, and an egg. oh yes, not many things could really beat that.
author: Sydel S.

description:
Everything on this menu is quite pricey, but that's what you get for entering Hubert Keller's restaurant.  If you're lucky, he'll come around and you can shake his hand!

Get the sliders.  They are AWESOME!  (And probably the least expensive thing on the menu.)  It comes with 3 different little burgers, all different, and very yummy.  

I'm going back for more!
author: Suzi T.

description: I have decided to write a review to remind myself to not come back. This is my 4th time here and it's the same story each time. We waited 1hr 20min. With so many people going in and out of this place and being located inside a Macy's, you would think they could afford a pager system to let people know their table is ready. At least if you could do a little shopping while waiting over an hour it would feel less painful. When we finally were seated, we waited another 25 min for our food. Yes, I understand it's a Sat night, but after waiting almost 2 hours, you've got some grumpy ass people hungry for anything. My son ordered a nutella shake. It was $8.25. Most places give the metal mixer for the rest of the shake that could not fit in the glass. But no. It was literally only a small fountain glass. Why do I always forget that they do this? I ordered a build your own, a natural patty, spinach, bacon, blue cheese with a sesame seed bun. Every time I get my burger the bottom bun is soggy from the grease. I hate holding a soggy burger. Their curly fries weren't flavored. My son had the sliders. The description said that it comes with american cheese, bacon, caramelized onions. 1 of the 3 tiny burgers had bacon on it. The only positive things I can mention are their zucchini fries were good and our table location was breath taking. We sat right by the window. Our waiter was good. Those 3 things is why I gave them the 2 stars.
author: Larissa W.

description:
Truffle sauce does make everything better.

Our wait was 45 minutes on a Saturday night and we were fine with that. One BIG PLUS about waiting at Burger Bar is the sheer hilarity at the ineptitude of the bartenders. It was really sad. I'm sure they'll get better, but I expected all of them to be very experienced ones right off the back... That was not the case. One guy was really good, he's short and bald. The other two, Jesus. One of my friends ordered a stout beer (they have a great beer selection) and the bartender simply poured the beer straight into the glass with no tilt and with the glass about 6 inches below the tap. As expected, all head. He did this again and we all looked with shock. SHOCK! The experienced bartender looked at us, then looked at you know who, put down his beer and said, "Let me show you how to pour a stout (or any beer)." Parenthesis were in my head.

Now we waited 45 minutes for a group of 5, though they said it was going to take an hour and a half. Take that as a good thing or a bad one, your choice. I ordered the Angus Beef cooked medium, with jalapeno bacon, peppered jack cheese, and truffle sauce. The burger was cooked perfectly and was very flavorful. Adding jalapeno AND peppered jack make the burger slight spicy and drizzling that amazing sauce simply increased the greatness of it all. I'm so hungry now.

Side note: when you order the Fleur de Lys Sauces, it comes on the side and you can order ONE for TWO people. They simply give you too much, but again, not a bad thing.

Everyone at the table said their burger was amazing. Everyone. I got the fat fries and they were perfectly crispy and flavorful. I tried the sweet potato fries and even though I am coming off of my initial amazement of sweet potato fries, I thought these were particularly good.

Decor is blah. We got a seat by the window and I felt like everything was plasticky.

Altogether, we paid about 50 bucks each and we all had about three drinks, which is ok in my book. I will go back.
author: Robert P.

description:
Heard the hype so had to try it out.

If you're looking for a good burger, i think the place offers a decent one.  It's not bad, but definitely not worth the wait/hassle of Union Square.  I ordered the sliders (3 for $12) which I think is the best deal on the menu as it comes with a side (they had fried zuchinni! :D) and lets you try both the normal beef patty and the buffalo.  Larger burgers do not come with fries and can add up to be a lot more if you make your own.

Food aside -- the place doesnt make too much sense as they fairly empty separate "dining" room by the entrace which doesnt let you... dine.  Their explanation is that its for large parties who reserve in advance, but yet anyone can go in for drinks. ...to be honest..i'm STILL not sure what the hell she meant.  When the wait it 45 min on a Saturday night -- you'd think it makes business sense to utilize all the tables they had.

Another complaint -- my beer cost $8...that's at least $3 too many for a burger place.  

I might come back if in Union Square and the Cheesecake factory's line is longer...but otherwise...I'll stick to my Pearl's Deluxe thank you :)
author: Kendra W.

description:
If you come here late night during the week, the service will be speedy and the environment chill.  With the hard part out of the way, I found this place to be a good option for the after theater crowd since they are open late. 

Due to the fact this place has a view and a celebrity chef, the prices are more than they should be. However, since I'm a picky burger eater, this place really hit the spot with their buffalo burger. Paired with a cheap glass a malbec and it's as good as it gets.
author: Roger H.

description: Good Burgers, Insanely great chocolate milk shake...
author: Shayne T.

description:
Fancy burgers.. do they truly exist? Apologies to Claire C. - I couldn't wait to try this place. 

But I have to say no such thing as good fancy burgers @ burger bar. The meat was OK, the fries too bland, the fried zucchini sticks too airy (where was the actual zucchini???) and my alcoholic milkshake tasted like an ice cream cone. The best part of the meal was the TV @ the booth and the semi OK potato fries... Except they charged me for aioli sauce. 

The service was prompt and our waitress was very nice and competent. Not sure if this will last, but it is another option in the area if you don't want the cheesecake factory or the Rotunda...
author: Lisa L.

description:
Disappointing from first to last.

Initially I expected to find Burger Bar in the food court basement of Macy's at Union Square.  Sound the mall food alarm.  When I discovered that instead, it's situated on the 6th floor and serving up Hubert Keller fare, I was actually enthusiastic about only a 15 minute wait.

After walking through the dining room and taking a seat, the mall food alarm went off again.

Then came the food.  High school cafeterias do a better job with presentation.  It wasn't kitschy enough to appear intentional, it just looked like there'd been a sale on large white plates in a world with no garnish. 

We ordered the veggie burger, the description of which (portobello mushrooms, carmelized onions and pumpkin puree)  instilled disproportionately elevated expectations, and the chef recommended mid-range burger (not low brow black angus, but not american-grown kobe either).  The veggie burger, though somewhat cripy on the outside quickly took on the form of a not-quite-warm-enough squash mash on a bun.  The beef was juicy and cooked to the right temperature, but not served hot and overpriced for what it was.  The fries were also a huge disappointment: round white salad plates with a smattering of dehydrated sweet potatoes, and completely mundane fried (frozen?) potatoes.

If you're going to call yourself burger bar, you may want to concern yourself with getting the burger and fries bit down before you go offering to top it off with foie gras or half a lobster.

I wanted to tell myself that Hubert Keller wasn't aware of what was going on.  I fantasized him unleashing a profanity-laden Gordon Ramsay meltdown on the place, but then I had to step around him as he stood in the bar talking.  So disappointing.

For a good expensive burger you'd be MUCH happier at Absinthe or Zuni.  Better yet, save yourself a few bucks and try Burgermeister instead.
author: Matt O.

description:
So I went here the other night with my boys, and after having dinner here, I was pretty unimpressed.

Pros: 

* Burgers were pretty juicy, tender and cooked exactly how I wanted it
* The decor is pretty nice. You get a nice outside view of Union Square, and inside, you get the feel of a pub. Plenty of TVs abound, and a whole bunch more in the booths
* You get to specialize the burger the way you want it. There's about 6 different buns to choose from, 20+ toppings and a couple of sides

Cons:

* I understand that this is a fairly new place with some hype, but the wait is ridiculous. My friends and I waited a little over an hour and a half, and it definitely wasn't worth it
* The food is extremely overpriced. Depending on the kind of burger meat you want, you're looking at $9-15. But that's it, it comes with nothing else. All of the sides, toppings and drinks that you want with your meal are all at an extra cost. So depending on how hungry you are or how good you want your burger to look, you're looking to spend $25-30 per person
* Burgers were kind of small. My bun was a lot bigger than the burger patty
* Bad/slow service with getting our orders and refilling drinks

Overall, this is one of those places in downtown that will thrive on suckering in on the tourists. You're better off going to a place like Red Robin, where you'll get more bang for your buck, with a burger that's just as good, minus the long wait.
author: Syed A.

description: Love the blackjack burger . Went there for my bday.  Group of 8.  I called 5 places and the reason why I picked BB is when I called and asked them when I can make a reservation they said " whenever you want"  that was awesome. I made my reservation at the time I wanted.  When we got there exactly at 8- when I made my reservation- we only waited 5 min for them to clean up our table which wasn't that much. The main wait time was when we were expecting a waiter to take our order. The waiter forgot our side sauce.  Other than that I love BB
author: Rez A.

description: Love this place! I've been twice now and have had great experiences. The view is absolutely incredible.  My favorite burger is the black jack burger substituting kobe beef on ciabatta. It has Monterey Jack cheese and olive tempanade. I love how you can customize your burger exactly the way you want it. Great choice on a busy day of shopping!
author: Bethany D.

description:
Day 2 of Burger Bar's existence in SF.  

"Rossini" burger for $60?!?  I was tempted, but the life of a starving student precludes such lavish indulgences.  So I opted for the $16 dollar American Kobe Beef Burger instead.  HA!  There are a lot of add-ons such as a variety of cheeses, mushrooms, foie gras ($12), truffles ($30), among many other things.  You can basically customize everything, even the bun.  I opted for swiss cheese, portobello mushrooms, and black Perigord truffle sauce (no not $30, this one was only $5.50) on a sesame bun.  My medium rare "kobe" burger was good, but I'm not sure if I feel that comfortable paying more than $10 for ground beef between two buns.  

The night had a lot of bumps (slow service, 3 mixed up orders), but they comped us on a few things so it wasn't too bad.  It was also my friend's birthday (perhaps the first bday Burger Bar SF has had?) so we brought a cake and they kindly accommodated us.  Chef Keller even brought out a 6-shake treat for my friend.  He went around chatting it up with all the tables and making sure everyone enjoyed their meals.  That was pretty cool seeing him after watching Top Chef Masters.  I hope that the same hiccups do not continue past a few weeks.  

PLUSES: Nice View; Customizable Burgers; Huge Beer Selection; Made an effort to fix mistakes.  

MINUSES: Service is a bit shakey (our server was very nice though); In the end... its still just a burger.
author: Bert N.

description:
-1 star: Touristy crowd, location and wait
-1 star: pricing

Beyond the lost 2 stars for this tourist attraction, the food was great and even though I didn't order one of their insane alcoholic milkshakes, I really wanted to because they looked AMAZING.  I had the veggie burger, which sounds lame, but instead of your standard veggie burger it contained lentils and pumpkin puree; I highly recommend.  The service was a bit slow due to high traffic I think, but overall it was a good experience.  Prices are a bit high, but that's expected of an establishment located INSIDE Macy's.
author: Laura S.

description:
The two stars are for (some of) the men that work there.  Nice eye candy.  It almost makes me want to apply for a job there just so I can be around hot guys.

Now for the burger....you've got to be kidding me. I bit down on BONE.  And dont get me started on the sweet potato fries...how can you get those wrong??? yuck
author: Katie H.

description: Wow, This place is Hopping!! We went on a Friday Night, and this place was packed. We actually had friends from out of town, and they kindly saved us a seat while we made the Trek from the East Bay to S.F. on a busy Friday night. We were obviously late, but the server (Chris), was warm and welcoming. He offered us Drinks and brought us up to speed with the Menu. We started with the Minty Chocolate shake, and our friend ordered the Irish Milkshake. I also ordered Onion Rings. Both of the Shakes were Luscious and the Onion Rings were very crispy and very good. I did not taste the Alcohol in our Mint Shake, but the Irish Cream was very potent. We were taking our time with the Menu, but decided on Sliders for the Wifey, Peppercorn for Moi, and a Black Jack for one of my friends. My other friends ordered a Burger to split. We were so engaged with the conversation, that we did not realize that our Burgers came out. The Peppercorn came out perfectly cooked and the Sweet potato Fries were very good. My wifey loved the Sliders and that says a lot since she only eats In & Out and does not eat Beef. The Sliders come in 3 different Varieties Bacon with Apple wood Bacon, Buffalo Burger, and the Angus. My other friend had the Black Jack and said it was okay. The Black Jack has Black olives and Monterey Jack. We ended the meal with a nightcap. We ordered a Cappuccino, Coffee, and my friend ordered a London Cloud. A London Cloud is a Beer Float. Irish Stout with a scoop of Ice cream. I saw that she liked it, but I was happy with the Cappuccino. The Server was very friendly and was quick with the check. He even split the bill 3 ways and was very upbeat. I forgot to mention that we had a Tv. in our booth and were comparing notes on the Opening Ceremony between China and Canada's Festivities. Canada definitely dropped the ball and it was more entertaining without volume. Great experience and a little pricey but definitely worth the atmosphere for the Great food and Service.
author: Robert R.

description: Mid-afternoon I was able to get a table with an awesome view of Union Square.  The burger was ok.  French fries (fat, skinny) were great.  Starter Caesar salad was skimpy.  Was charged $3.50 to add shrimp and I got exactly 3 shrimps!!  Disappointing.
author: John S.

description:
Let's get the bad over with: 45 minute wait and no cheese fries (even after I asked). 

The good: The food! 

A breakdown of my meal: 
Angus burger cooked med rare, avocado, cheddar cheese, sourdough bun. Perfectly cooked- was rare enough that it fell apart. The avocado was sliced and spread so it fit on the burger- a nice touch that is often overlooked. Tried some truffle oil and it only enhanced the flavor without covering it up

Milkshake- went with plain chocolate, whipped cream, cherry on top. The milkshake could have been thicker but the chocolate could not have been better. It's been 12 hours since I had it and I'm ready for another one. 

The fries: not very many for the cost. A side was $3 and there were maybe 20 fries on the plate. They were delicious but i was still dejected over the refusal to put cheese on them.  

The beer: Nice taps- HIGHLY recommend the Eel River porter

The bonus: the staff are nice. And the boy's shirts say "fresh meat" on the back
author: B S.

description:
Open letter to Chef Hubert Keller: Oh, Hubert Keller, how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways... from your French accent, to your charming personality (at least on Top Chef Masters), to your food... all I can say is, if you had been about 30 years younger, or I had been 30 years older, your wife would have had some serious competition!!!  I've tried 3 of your burgers at Burger Bar now (plus a bite of your $60 burger that my companion ordered), and I've been impressed all 3.5 times.  From the Buffalo Burger, to the American Kobe Beef Burger, to the Hubert Keller Burger, you knocked my socks off! And your skinny fries are excellent, too, but you tease me with the name because ain't no way those fries are going to keep me skinny.  I was afraid to drink an entire Nutella milkshake by myself, but I took a sip from someone in my party who ordered it, and I got transported to chocolate heaven!  Please find a way to lower the sugar and calorie content in that drink, so I can order it without feeling guilty, otherwise I will just have to content myself with devouring it with my eyes, and you wouldn't want to do that to me, would you?

Can you also please tell me what in the hell your waitresses eat at your restaurant?  Do they even eat at all?  Because they're all pretty skinny, and I know they didn't get that way from your skinny fries.  Maybe they eat your fat fries?  Or only one fat fry?  But can you do me a favor and tell them to improve their customer service because it seems like it takes them a long time to come around and take your order, or check up on you.  Tell them to eat 2 fat fries if that's what it takes.  Oh, and maybe you can expand your restaurant in the near future, too?  When I come with a party of 3 people we're always seated right away, but any bigger than that and I end up waiting 30 minutes or more.  You don't want to keep me away from your burgers that long, now do you?

Keep up the good work, Hubert.  I'll be back...
author: Meg P.

description:
After much awaited anticipation, i finally got to the Macy's downtown. The elevator takes a while because it's the same one they use for getting to the other shopping floors but we got to the 6th floor at about 5pm. I'd hate to see what it would be around dinner time. No crowd and plenty of tables. The place seats about 200 people but doesn't take reservations. Much like cheesecake factory. 

Here goes the ratings....one word: OVERRATED. 

I had the Kobe Burger $16.50 with swiss cheese and a side of onion rings. The meat was okay, i asked for medium and it was pretty much still mooing inside. The blood soaked the bun, making it extra soggy and just wasn't anything to rave for. Onion rings were okay, too much batter, similar to the ones you can get at Burger King for a buck. I didn't taste any honeymilk at all. 

I also had the black and white shake. Nice presentation but a little overpriced at $9, don't you think?

My friend opted for the sliders which had 3 different types of patties: Buffalo, Natural, and Angus. They were okay but also nothing to write home about. 


Food: 2 Stars
Service: 4 stars
Decor: 4 Stars
Overrall: 3 stars

I don't mean to be a prune but they sat us next to a table with two kids that were screaming their heads off and throwing utensils everywhere. just ruined the whole dining experience. i can see that this place is gonna be another tourist trap with way too many people. Maybe i'll give them another try, but it'll have to be for their $60 burger with foie gras and truffles.  In the mean time, i'll just keep going back to Barney's.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Unfortunately, there is nothing special about this place.  I am quite surprised Hubert Keller has put his name on Burger Bar.  I was personally expecting more from the renown owner-chef of Fleur de Lys.  

I had basic cheeseburger and there several critical things wrong, first the bacon was not crispy - it was kind of soft and opaque looking, they used American Cheese - that was obviously intentional, but probably a bad choice, cheddar would've been better, my bun was soggy with meat juice, and the burger had cooked like a small ball in the middle, not like a paddy -- and it was noticeably unsalted.   This was a fifteen dollar burger that was more like a 7 dollar burger. 

Now, to be fair, the fries were great: crispy and hot, and the service was also good ( with the exception of the hostess, who refused to seat us at a table at the bar unless we were going to eat).  I had two glasses of white wine, and while slightly over priced, the selection was good.

What this place has going for it is the amazing view of Union Square, but as far as vibe it is full of tourist, large groups of women/girls, European gigolos, and grandparents.   The decor is completely basic, like any bar on Main Street, USA.  Brown chairs and tables, neon beer lights, and basic off white walls with little decoration on them.  It was not impressive.   And you have to fight your way into a crowded elevator in the lobby of Macy's to even get there -- which is probably somewhat expected, but still a crowded ride up.  Last thing to mention is that they are short a few stalls in the women's restroom. .

Don't think I would go back.
author: claudia v.

description: Badass milkshakes. Bomb freaking burgers. all of sort of different types too. sliders are my fav.The worlds hottest will knock your eyes juices out of your seeing balls. The Hubert Keller has so much freaking flavor it's ridiculous. Really a damn classy joint. Full bar. Great beer. Sexy and friendly workers. Awesome view. What's really not to like. O ya maybe the tourists...
author: Jakob C.

description:
I had no idea this place even existed before my Cali BFF suggested we eat before we tackled our shopping endeavour. I decided to order a veggie burger because it was calling my name. 

This place was packed!!! And I mean PACKED!!!! We had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated and that was nothing. The view from so high up was wonderful. 

It took about 20 minutes for our food to come out and I don't know if that was good or bad, I just know I was starving and it felt like forever.

My burger was great!!!!  It was also huge. I'm an old fashion burger eater so I refuse to knife and fork my burger. Unfortunately, I had to cut my bad boy in half because there was no way for me to eat it without having it fly across the room.  I also ordered skinny fries which they called it but in my book were regular fries. It was great!!! 

I minus one star for three reasons: #1 - the woman's bathroom was HORRIFIC!!! No toilet paper, paper towels over flowing the bins, and only one stall. WTF??!?!?! I expect way more from this. It was nothing short of looking like a bathroom at a gas station. I've seen cleaner bathrooms at Greyhound. #2 - Cali BFF and I decided we were in the mood to have a milk shake.
