We wanted to share one so we told the waiter we wanted one and was going to share.  He bought us out two glasses the size of maybe an oz more than a shot glass. We were like WTF but wasn't tripping because we knew our food would be out soon.  Once we got the bill, we were charged the full amount as if we got the regular glass full. The regular glass was about 12-14 oz so I was pissed that the waiter thought I was stupid to believe what we received was equivalent to a regular glass. When the manager came out to talk to us he didn't compensate us and try to beat me in the head by saying we actually get more ice cream in that size cup...WHATEVER!!!! #3 - Nothing comes with anything in this place. You're burger doesn't come w/anything but lettuce, onions and tomatoes. Cheese...extra, fries...extra.  By the time we were finished our food, for 2 burgers, 2 pieces of cheese, 2 shot glasses filled w/ice cream, 2 fries, our bill was about $20 each without tax and tip. YIKES!!!!!

The food was good. The service was good but could have been better. I constantly had to flag my waiter down. And while I know it was super busy, a sister needs her water refill.  Would I go back...Yes :)
author: Sandra S.

description:
First off--the burgers are good, as is to be expected.  So if you're concerned about food and food only, know that the burgers are tasty.

Aside from that--this was the absolute worst service I've ever had at a restaurant.  A thirty minute wait on a Sunday evening is fine, except when you get seated and there are at least 6 open tables all with silverware and menus waiting on them.  The atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired, with bare white walls, garish neon lights, thumping and repetitive techno, and crowded tables.  

The deal breaker was the service.  After 5-10 minutes of being seated we were able to flag him down for a drink, received said drinks 10 minutes later, and did not see him for a solid 25 minutes after that.  It was so terrible that, after noticing that we weren't going to see him and noticed other tables in the same scenario, I went up to the bar, ordered drinks, and came back without seeing him for another 5 minutes after returning.  Truly the worst service possible.
author: Danny G.

description:
My first time here - we came for a friend's birthday. We had a big party, a party of 14. Unfortunately, I guess they don't have tables or seats that accommodate such a large group because they stuck us in a walk way, someone had even mentioned in our group that it was probably a fire hazard to stick us there - & we had a new born baby! The staff was nice, but where we were seated, it was kind of a disaster waiting to happen; the waiter spilled a milkshake on my coat hanging on the back of my chair and on my boyfriend's leather jacket. They couldn't place a Caution Wet Sign and one of their staff members slipped and fell pretty hard. We know the restaurant is really popular, but the staff didn't really check on us during our time. However, I do commend the management, as soon as all of this happened, the GM came up to me with his card and let me know that they would take care of my dry cleaning bill & he even comped my meal & for any inconvenience to our group, they removed the gratuity as well. 

I had the kobe burger with the button mushrooms and a nutella shake - the nutella shake was pretty good, but our kobe burger was pretty cold when we got it. But, it was still really tasty & we're not ones to send back our food..

It was an unpleasant experience, but it may have been because we were with such a large group. I think this restaurant would be better for a date or small group.
author: Diana P.

description:
This review is for the Bar only.  
 So after a while of blowing some cash with my BFF, we decided to go get some drinks at Burger bar, since both of us have never been.
The drinks take a while, and they are strong! This is a great place if you want to get drunk, but if you want a drink that tastes good, this is not the place. I had a Gin martini drink off the menu and my BFF had the knob creek drink, which was like pure alcohol. We both had sips of her drink, and we couldn't force ourselves to finish it.  If we had, we would have been dancing on the tables or gotten into some adventures like we used to in college, but now we are more mature, (plus get baaad hangovers) so we were smarter.
 The alcohol milkshake was good, It was thick, rich and like my BFF mentioned, probably a 1000 calories. 
 Also, we saw Hubert Kelley a bunch of times and I have to admit it made me feel special...
author: Marlene D.

description:
If your entire raison d'etre is burgers then they better be *damn* good.  I had a wonderful experience at Chef Keller's Fleur de Lys but was disappointed here. 

We arrived at 4:30 pm on a Saturday afternoon for an early dinner amidst the Xmas shopping madness. 

Waited about 15 minutes for a table, which wasn't bad considering how crowded the restaurant already was. But then we were led to the bowels of the restaurant, and seated at a small booth right next to the kitchen. 

It was *extremely* hot in that area, to the extent that we both peeled off all the layers we decently could and were still sweating from the heat of the kitchen coming through doors that were rarely closed.

Our waitress took our order fairly quickly. We both opted for custom burgers: I had the Country Natural beef with caramelized onions, Monterey jack cheese, and oyster mushrooms. He ordered the American Kobe with caramelized onions and the truffle sauce on the side, both burgers on onion rolls.

And then we waited. And waited. And waited. In the heat, with an annoying TV in the booth playing a basketball game from a decade ago, awful music blaring on the sound system, and our waitress nowhere to be found. 

After 45 minutes the waitress finally dropped by to check on our order and it was brought out a few minutes thereafter. 

You would think in our ravenous state we would have found the burgers delicious. But they were very average burgers with thick patties, too much bread, and no real stand-out flavor. The truffle sauce was watery and had very little flavor at all, much less the kick that even a smidgen of truffles brings to food. The sweet potato fries & onion rings were better than the burgers.

I love burgers and am a fan of those at Burgermeister and Spork (two very different burgers), but the entire experience at Burger Bar (heat, intense noise levels, glacial service, and mediocre burgers at a high price) left me dissatisfied. 

All in all, definitely not worth a $50 price tag for two burgers, sweet potato fries, and onion rings.

Some suggestions for improvement: 

1. Buttons or remote controls for the annoying muted TVs. That way we can either turn them off or at least soundlessly watch a game that was played in *this* century.

2. Better air system when the kitchen gets hot and the resto gets crowded. I do not enjoy sweating along with my food.

3. I understand it's a busy resto, but a 45-minute wait for a burger?  Unrealistic and must be addressed. At least you could have offered us a milkshake for the delay.

4. Change the music from cheesy pop to something soothing & cool. That will prevent customers from being driven batty by the long, hot wait.
author: Sharand N.

description:
i actually really enjoyed my meal. My burger was just right. I ordered the angus beef and everything was just perfect. I had it medium rare, and it came out exactly how I wanted it. I didn't add much to my burger except just cheese because I knew if I added more stuffs, my burger will be falling apart and I will have trouble eating it. I definitely want to come back and try other burgers as well. 

Wait wasn't that bad. My cousin and her boyfriend came by at 630 to put our name down, and we got seated a hour later. Which was just in time for dinner. 

The sweet potato fries were a bit soggy, wish it was a little crispier. 

One big bonus is Hubert Keller, himself gave my cousin and I free sample of milkshakes (my cousin was staring at him making them and she gave him sad puppy eyes). So Hubert Keller delivered it to our table. He is extremely nice. At the end of dinner, we thank you again personally. I wish I had my camera on me so I could take a picture with him.
author: Willa L.

description:
The burger was amazing!! Surf and Turf burger with lobster and asparagus... ummmmmmm!! and a side of sweet potato fries. Next time I crave a burger I will have to go there (but order to go). I also had the alcoholic mint chip milk shake, it was way too sweet and I did not taste that much alcohol, I would not recommend that one. 
The service was not great and you can only enjoy the view of Union Square if you are seated at a window. The space felt a little congested and if it was organized a little better than it would not be as crowded, I think.
author: Marie-Claire R.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The website and menu looked interesting and I was definitely looking forward to a awesome experience.

The Good:
Prime spot in Union Square, the bar had a large assortment of cool/unique beers on tap, milkshakes were good (but be prepared to wait awhile for them), and Choco Burger looked great.

The Bad:
From the extra 30 minute wait time (1 hr 40 mins total) to end up sitting in the bar section, the dining area overflowed into the bar section which I thought was pretty tacky (and so did everyone else seated there too), food served 20 minutes apart from each other (to make for some COLD $15 burgers), incorrectly cooked burgers for half of our party (I ordered MR and there was no pink to be found), and HIDDEN included gratuity.

Overall:
The Burger Bar let me down. Overpriced and improperly cooked burgers, long wait times, hidden gratuity with a blank space to write in more gratuity is just ridiculous.
author: Hendrick T.

description:
We finally braved the crowds and ate at Burger Bar.  We arrived early, at 11:20, figuring it was our only chance to get seated.  The place was already packed!  It's a small-ish restaurant with as many seats packed in as possible.  The hostess and staff did their best to seat people as quickly as possible but even at that early time, they were slammed. 

However, in spite of that, our server was funny, friendly and fast. We couldn't have asked for better service. 

I ordered the Hubert Keller burger and I have to say, that was probably the best burger I have ever had.  The Hubert Keller burger is a buffalo burger on a ciabatta bun with baby spinach, carmelized onions and bleu cheese, served with a red wine shallot reduction.  The combination of flavors was amazing and two days later I am still thinking about that burger!  The "skinny" fries were delicious, too.

My daughter had the sliders and ate every bite!  She loved them.  My husband ordered a "make your own" Kobe burger, which he liked, but he wished he had ordered mine!

If it wasn't for the crowds and the wait, I'd go back often.  Unfortunately, the popularity of this restaurant requires that you plan in advance and have a lot of time on your hands.  But if you do, it's well worth it.

P.S.  Biggest problem with the restaurant?  Only two - yes, that's right, two - women's bathrooms!  That's just craziness! There was a line for the bathrooms the entire 90 minutes we were there.  Just be prepared (and don't drink much!).
author: Lynn S.

description:
Not bad, but not the Ad Hoc to HK's Fleur de Lys.

Pros:
- Extensive beer, wine, cocktail menu
- Extensive SHAKE menu, including beer floats!
- Meat is well prepared
- Large DIY option choices, including foie
- Great friendly service that's not overbearing

Cons:
- Decor is a step above Applebee's.. maybe
- No substitutions?  Why wouldn't I just "build my own" the way I wanted it, then?  Isn't that the same thing?  I just wanted an onion bun on the Peppercorn burger, not plain.

I'll come again, but I'd rather spend the money on two meals at the Triple Rock (or a tip at FdL!).
author: K M.

description:
My family and I landed in the Burger Bar after doing some last minute shopping in Macy's just a couple days before Christmas. While the restaurant was jammed we were pleasantly surprised to see how fast they were seating guest and our name was called well before the quoted wait time.
 
About five minutes after sitting down at our table, which overlooked the beautiful Christmas tree in Union Square, we had drinks (raspberry beer, yum) in hands and orders placed. I went against the norm by ordering the Greek salad, which was lite and refreshing, and the added mint is a great touch too. Being in a burger joint I decided I must try the tasty burgers everyone speaks of, so I dove into my mom's caramelized onion sliders paired with sweet potato fries. Maybe I'm just a sucker for sliders but I thought the sliders were super flavorful and cooked to perfection. We finished off with the milkshake paddle sampler thingy, ah sweet heaven, this desert is a must have. 
Over all I'd say the Burger Bar has fast and friendly service and great food!!!

p.s. We had a Chief Kelly sighting.
author: Angela S.

description:
Wow, is all I can say...to be succinct, I arrived at 11am today to beat the crowds for a nice early lunch. :)  Smart move, because it got packed..:-)

I sat at the bar, had THE BEST customer service from the Gentleman tending the bar section, "Tim".  If you sit at the bar, and Tim is working, tell him that Patrick sent you...:-)  If you get the luck of being in his area, you're in for great conversation, kindness and informative info on beers. This guy knows his stuff.

He suggested a Maui Brewing Company, CoCoNut Porter beer, it was sooo good, I had a 2nd.  Thanks Tim!

For my decadent feast, I only eat meat when I am out...well, I had the Kobe burger, and it needed NO adornments of ketchup, mayo, mustard...N A D A.....BLISSFUL!

And, I ordered a side of sweet potato fries to boot, delicate yet with just the right amount of crunch and soft inner texture.

All in all, would I go back?  Hell yes. I love having great customer service, quality food, and a fantastic view of the Square...resplendent with the Ice Rink and Xmas tree.

I hope Tim does read this review as I told him that I had to brag about him on Yelp...:-)

Patrick ;)
author: Patrick I.

description:
Went with a friend to see the Union Square Christmas tree. The place was jammed. I went to the podium and a very nice young lady said "well I only have one reservation for two before you so, if they don't like that table you can have it." It was in the window and 15-minutes later we were sitting at it.

Loren the manager was the one who served our champagne bottle and she was very professional (as if we were in a fine dining restaurant). Our server Mary could not have been more personable and professional.

There was a group of young women standing behind my friend at the table and their conversation was so loud that we could not even talk to one another. One word and Loren asked them to relocate themselves to the waiting area where they had been asked to wait.

I had the peppercorn burger again. It was just as good as the first time. The onion rings, however, are not as good as upstairs at the Cheesecake Factory but otherwise everything else was great...excellent skinny fries.
author: Lee S.

description:
Very disappointed by experience.  From the premise of having a well known chef like Keller I would have expected more.  The decor and environs attempt to bring one into a hip and urban San Francisco eatery and that is open and inviting.  With a wonderful view of Union Square there is a mix of tourist, Macy's accidental shopper than happened into Burger Bar and those who are looking for a spectacular burger.

I don't think it is asking too much for a superb offering, quality, service and innovation--but you get none of it.  The pricing structure should command a better offering and more attention to detail.  My burger--a simple Angus burger was of a mediocre quality--the standard fixings were all there but unexciting: a pickle spear, a very small slice of red onion, tomato, and a uninteresting lettuce.  Additions could have been baby greens, early girl tomatoes, a quality pickle, an outstanding bread, a special sauce?  

The onions were just as interesting as the entire experience.  Just because they are large and crunchy does not make an onion ring--a dash of pepper and even a splash of beer could have made them sing.

The wine offering by the glass was mainly California wines--and at that uninteresting.  Here a mark of difference could have been struck and a wine list that could zing.  The beer offering was a bit more generous.

The service was friendly but challenged.  I had to ask a couple of Burger Bar staff for my bill; I was never offered additional water and it was not that crowded which made my wait even more frustrating.

I also look at ways Chef Keller could have departed from a standard diner burger to a gourmet burger; I would like an organic or natural ketchup and mustard and sea salt.

A disappointment and I am surprised Hubert Keller would give this restaurant his signature.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
Let's be honest, this is a glorified Burger Joint... while I love Hubert Keller from what I've seen on Top Chef, I sincerely doubt he would back this food if he ate here regularly. I'm not saying it's bad, it's just nothing amazing.

Since yes, I am veggie, I got the veggie burger. I had it on a whole wheat bun with grilled asparagus. My first bite I thought was excellent, but that may have been due to the fact that I was absolutely starving. Their veggie burgers are made with a combination of potatoes, lentils, mushrooms, peas, rice, pumpkin, and mozzarella cheese- all of which sounded like a really, really good idea. But it was too mushy and I think made with too much potato, so it really fell short. No crisp to the outside, and a good veggie burger needs a more solid consistency. 

Our fries, while cut just the way I like them (and sweet potato option!!!) came out cold, which I think is pretty inexcusable. If all you really have on the menu is burger and fries, both better be really frickin good, or at least served fresh.

My man got one of the 'signature' burgers but said it was pretty bland, which annoyed  him since even the waiter mentioned 'flavor profiles' for the signature burgers. 

We didn't try the milkshakes, but they looked damn good. Lots of options there too. I did want to laugh at our waiter though when he was giving his "We're all about building options here at Burger Bar speech" - I mean, really, it just seemed a little too "flare"-ish. Schpeels like that don't belong anywhere besides movies making fun of TGI Fridays. I do, however appreciate all the array of options here- you can put anything and everything on your burger (or in your shake)- so that is a plus.

The view of Union Square is cool and the overall atmosphere was nice. 

Overall, this had a slight feel of a tourist spot and seems a little generic. Don't think that just because Hubert's name is on this place it's going to knock your socks off.
author: Kristen L.

description:
I understood before I went to this place that it was basically a high priced burger joint  but thats the reason why I decided to go here.  We went here to celebrate a special occasion but needed a place we knew 3 toddlers would enjoy too.

It was a  little confusing trying to find the place, suggestion just take the elevator to the 6th floor in the Womans Macy's Building.  It takes much longer and a little searching if you take the escalators but I didn't have any problem since I pretty much stopped on every floor to "window shop".

Once you step into the restaurant you can see the beautiful view of Union Square, pretty much the same view if you were eating @ the Cheese Cake Factory.  You can either sit on a regular table, tables that are next to the window view, or huge booth that has your own personal tv and you can request them to change the channel to your hearts desire (Direct TV) Nice option for the kids or to watch any sports games.

I ordered a customized burger,  with Onion bread, portobello mushrooms (YUMMM) American Cheese, Peppercorn Bacon & Peppercorn Cream Sauce.  There were so many other options but I'm a tiny person and didn't want to do too much on my first time there.  The food was delicious!!! The portobello mushrooms are a MUST!!!  My boyfriend ordered the Surf N Turf Burger and I tried a piece of his fresh lobster and it was delish!

For dessert we ordered the cheese cake burger & nutella burger.. They're both good but it was the first time I ever tried nutella and feel in love with it.

The atmosphere was okay.  The only place I would sit is either by the window or in the nice booths.  We went there on a Monday night so it was a little slow.  I don't think this would be a place I would think of going again to if it was just to drink and hang out.  But def if you want to eat at a fancy burger joint thats kid friendly~
author: SevenFourTwo M.

description:
I love you, Chef Keller, I really do. Your food is amazing. I think you are immensely talented, a culinary genius, and your charisma and charm are not to be denied. Sadly though, as much as I am enamored of you and of your flagship Fleur de Lys, I wasn't as blown away by the Burger Bar. 
I was underwhelmed by the decor (as mentioned here many times) however found it preferable to that of the Cheesecake Factory, which is overdone to the point of spectacle. I don't need a 3 ring circus to accompany my meal, just make the food good enough that I forget all other ills. 
At this, Chef Keller excels. I would absolutely eat here again, despite the patchy service, slow food, and various intervals of waiting. Waiting for our names to be called (and while I respect the prioritizing customers willing to wait within vocal calling distance, if waits are more than 15 minutes for a 2 top, one should have a more advanced system than "you need to be here to hear your name called". Page me, call my cell, I don't care, but let me wander about while I fill the time betwixt entering my name and receiving a table. 
Food: Delightful. I could happily order 3 sides of foie gras, and a cosmo milkshake, and I would leave happy every time. The free-range beef was tasty, the wine shallot (?) reduction sauce was fantastic, and bizarrely enough, my boyfriend's order of fried pickles was edible! HE loved them, I thought they tasted of a pregnant woman's fantasy, or the flavor of the smell of a county fair in August. Weird, but delicious. 

I'd like to return when service/administrative issues have been worked out, because the food and the concept are fantastic. If I'm going to eat in Macy's, and I have at least an hour and a half for the meal, I'll 100% return here.
author: Sarah H.

description: So after a pleasant first visit, I came back to Burger Bar a week later with some friend. This time I ordered the garden burger. Although the taste was everything the menu described (i.e. pumpkin), the texture was definitely disappointing. Mushy like baby food! I highly recommend NOT to order this burger.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
20 bucks for a burger!?! Honestly, I've had much better burgers for less.  But I guess for the price you're paying for the view and location and the novelty of being able to have a $20 to $60 burger.  I just had the buffalo burger with oyster mushrooms and onions and a side of sweet potato fries.  

The places I think actually have better burgers are Chez Maman in Potrero Hill, Jack's Prime in San Mateo and marginally Custom Burger (only because you can get a buffalo burger and sweet potato fries all for $12 instead).
author: Ming L.

description:
Managed to beat the much rush on a wednesday- had a somewhat hidden table behind a pillar but gave us a view of Union Square. ordered the Chef's sliders- 3 mini burgers- one was buffalo, one was angus with bacon and one was nieman ranch with cheddar- all three were excellent. Skinny fries were crispy and not too salty! 

Great place to go for an great burger!
author: Scott W.

description: Our group of four eat at Burger Bar at least once a month.  We always attend after our theatre events in the city.  Years ago we used to venture out and try other places; but had little success.  We always know that when we come here we will be well serviced and have great food.  I usually have the salmon burger and skinny fries.  I am not really a fries guy; but I do love these skinny fries.  One of their specialties is their milk shakes - these are extremely delicious.  We usually hold ourselves back from this indulgence unless it is one of our birthdays.  I highly recommend this restaurant for good food and good fun.
author: Stephen B.

description:
Oh Hubert, we had such high expectations.  

To make a long story short, we arrived right before the dinner rush.  It took about 15 minutes to get seated, which was the amount of time estimated, so + for the accurate time of seating.  After we sat down, the experience as a whole went slowly down hill. 

To start, my coke was a bit flat and it took me a few minutes to wave down a waiter to switch to something else.  It took me another few minutes to get his attention so that I could get a filled bottle of ketchup.  It seems like the staff has laser eye line of sight and don't see anything except whats in front of them.  It improved by the end of the night, but we were about finished by then - so negative points for that.

The food was prepared well.  I got the Hubert Burger and it was moist for a buffalo patty.  Unfortunately the toppings weren't applied with much care.  The spinach was all to one side and the caramelized onions weren't evenly distributed either.  I had to open up the burger and center everything myself.  Also, by the time I got the burger the bottom was already a bit soggy, so taking time to center everything didn't help with the already drenched bottom half.  All-in-all, this burger was probably worth $12, not $22.  I guess the extra $10 pays for the experience/location/ambiance.  Unfortunately only the location deserves anything higher than a neutral recommendation.

We also ordered the sliders.  They were OK.  Nothing noteworthy either way.

One potential positive note is that the milk shakes looked good.  I'm not a big milk shake person and my fiance doesn't handle them well - (TMI, I know) - so we didn't order any, but the presentation of their milk shake sampler looked quite delish.
author: Johnny C.

description: Chicken burger was VERY DRY and TASTELESS.  Milkshake was SUPER EXPENSIVE (close to $10) and tasted like a regular milkshake.  It was NOT worth it.  I guess this is a tourist spot.
author: Cherry L.

description:
This is a great new location for a meal while shopping downtown.  Portion sizes were perfect (hate places that give oversized platters) and it was very tasty.

Interestingly enough I thought their beer list was way too long.  I couldn't make up my mind because it was overwhelming.  So Plan B was a chocolate shake which was very satisfying.

Booths not near windows have mini TVS which is a bit distracting.  You are too close to actually watch it comfortably and there is no way to shutter it or turn it off if you don't want it.  I think next time I would ask for a table without one.
author: Jennie M.

description:
How is it that a Burger joint can have such horrible service! 

I waited so long to get beer and it wasnt even a fully occupied restaurant. Even when I asked for a different beer because the sampler ones I got weren't that great it took my server a good 20 minutes to come back with a new beer. I have to say, this burger joint has Blue Ribbon Pabst on tap for the hipsters. At 5 dollars a pint. Are you serious? That's like serving Schlitz on tap and charging the same...oh wait. I tried a watermelon brew in one of my samplers, holy poo that tasted like shit! 

I like heavy stouts and wheat ales, yeah I know opposites ends of the beer line, the watermelon brew is basically made for the person who doesn't like beer but likes to look cool by ordering a beer. 

The food was OK. And by ok, I mean I could have gone to in and out and I'm sure it would have been better there. I asked for fat fries and got skinny fries instead. I ordered a custom burger medium and it was well done.  I really wanted to try the shakes, but if I get disappointed with a shake I'll go crazy. So I stayed away. 

I expected more, but now I know why this place got three stars. Its such a shame too. With the great view of Union Square and nice interior decor, the owners need to up their game by a bunch.
author: Donna W.

description:
Burger sampler: Like the concept and it's 3 cute little burgers but taste was average

Salmon steak burger: It's not your normal salmon patty but a really thick fillet, which is different, but then it was kinda bland, since we didn't add any other toppings on it.  Probably would have been better if there was a tastier sauce than to use ketchup and mustard

Nutella burger: This was fun.  The dessert looked like a burger with a donut being the bun, a chocolate hazelnut patty, kiwi as the lettuce and strawberries as the tomato and this tart passion fruit gelatin as the cheese.  Best of all the dishes! 

Oh yeh, and the beer is available in sampler sizes so that was good option for a lunch.

For just the burger, I'd give a 2 start.  The dessert made it a 3.
author: Irene C.

description:
Perhaps it's the NYC B!tch in me that's just used to higher quality restaurants but the H.Keller empire sucks.  Actually everything we've had in SF was subpar with the exception of ofcourse the FL.

DB Bistro 1, Burger Bar 0.

Let's compare DB Bistro's Foie Gras/BlackTruffle short rib burger w/ Burger Bar's "zenith" foie gras & truffle burger.

DB = $32 & fries.  BB = $60, no fries. 

Yes BB is "american kobe",  But what annoyed the crap out me was that the foie was ON TOP of the burger and not classically French style = aka stuffed into the meat.   Anyone could have seared the foie, but it takes time to stuff something properly.

AND the AMBIANCE...more like lack thereof.

DB = ironic.  It's in a hotel so most of the patrons are dressed up decently and seated on white tableclothed tables.  Actually, we're usually the lazy ones so we just get it take out.

BB = Midwestern fatties, SF Fatties aka troublingly unfashionable women who stuffed their kilbasa like legs into sheer casings which is def. not one size fits. all.  On to the formica and garish "martini" glass details.  Hurl.

Finally the nail in the cheap-Halloween-copy coffin --  our beer glass rim was chipped/cracked.  WTF.

Oh Hubert, we thought you were so adorable on TC.  But you are a beacon of what happens when a chef over extends himself with too many projects.  tear.
author: Jae H.

description: I came here with my co workers for lunch one time, and that was the last time we came here.  The burgers are just average, everything is a la carte, and in my opinion, overpriced.  $14 for just a burger where you have to add on condiments, toppings, and fries.  For $20, I'd rather go upstairs to the Cheesecake factory and get a lunch special, a strawberry lemonade, and a slice of cheesecake for dessert.  Try it once if you like the fru-fru type of food, but you'll be unlikely to come back here again.
author: Chris L.

description:
I went with friends on the evening of New Years Day.  The view was Awesome of Union Square & the ice skating ring! (Get a Window Seat).

Food was OK, didn't seem like anything special, but maybe it's just what I ordered. (The Burger Sliders, which consisted of 3 mini burgers, which had average quality taste, nothing special)

I would like to try something different sometime, since this location is very cool, given the views of Union Square.

Our waiter didn't seem very friendly, however it probably was just him since the other people working there seemed very friendly.

Mine was on the pricey side and didn't seem worth the price, BUT I guess if the other more expensive burgers taste really good, then it could be worth it.


Would like to try them out, as my friends had the more expensive burgers and added extras to them.

Their Curly Fries were very good though!
author: Andrea V.

description:
I have been here a handful of times in the past few months, and have enjoyed it each time. I don't live in the city, but visit often and try to avoid Union Square. However, when I am in the area, I am amazed at how early restaurants close. Burger Bar is open late, and serves decent food.

I have had the sliders and the All American Burger - both of which are great. The Build Your Burger feature is great too, but the price can add up quickly! If you love sweet potato fries like I do, you HAVE to try Burger Bar's.

The milkshakes they serve, both alcoholic and non, are delicious. My favorites? The Caramel Latte and the Adult Mint Chocolate Chip.

I've never had to wait long, no matter what time of day - including the Friday before Christmas - and the view of Union Square is phenomenal. It's pricier than your average burger, but still reasonable for downtown SF.
author: Andrea H.

description:
I can't give this place higher than 3 as I just haven't sampled enough stuff.  With only two weeks into it's opening, I think they have things running pretty well.  I got the Hubert Kellar signature burger which was buffalo + caramelized onions + blue cheese + spinach on a ciabatta bun.  Honestly, I had a hard time telling it was buffalo because of the other flavor profiles.  Even my friend who had the seem thing didn't know it was buffalo.  This is probably one of the better burgers I have had in a long time.  It comes with 'skinny fries' which remind me of Mickey Ds.  They properly salt them which is a very big deal for me.   

So what sucked it from 4 star or higher?  Well the elevator takes forever and there are tons of tourists in there.  Service was above average and the view is pretty nice up there, but I'm not sure I can justify $20+ for just a burger and fry.  

If going for the best burgers and variety, this is definitely top spot in my books.  But as far as value and uniqueness goes, I still like Moes.
author: Simon Y.

description:
I wanted to try the Burger Bar in Vegas, but it was too far away (in Mandalay Bay) so we didn't end up going. Luckily, I got to try the one in SF out before going ice skating in union square. 

I shared Keller's favorite burger with a friend, and it was just the right amount. The burger was pretty big, I don't think I could have finished it by myself. It was pretty good though. 

What I love the most about this place is their MILKSHAKES. My friend and I got the milkshake sampler, which is 6 mini milkshakes coming in 3 flavors: nutella, strawberry, and caramel brulee. it was amazing~~ Totally couldn't finish though. It was a sugar/cream overload. But I'd definitely come back....if the wait wasn't so long. =_=

I guess this place is similar to the cheesecake factory in terms that the lines are hella long
author: Louisa L.

description: Not a great experience.  Might as well have gone to a Friday's.  We went in on a sat around 1pm.  The place was effectively empty and yet the service was terrible...the waiter brought only one of two glasses of wine and the beer we ordered, not easy to toast with an incomplete order.  My the time it was corrected, half the other two drinks we gone.  As a gluten free/celiac, I expect to have a little trouble or at the very least ask a few questions.  My expectations are not that the menu should cater to me, just that it be easy to get information on what works and doesn't.  It wasn't easy here, at all.  Considering this is one of those "institutions" I hear about for shopping downtown, I was left disappointed.  In a city with amazing Burgers (Roam! Spruce! Umami!), I would give this a pass, even after a hard day shopping.
author: Alexis B.

description:
To be frank - I came here for a corporate event, and it was the first private function for the SF location, so maybe that's why the folks at Burger Bar were super special to us.

The menu of the night consisted of an open bar, sliders and various fried sides - all were DIVINE. I had a chance to sample the Angus, Kobe, chicken and salmon. Sides wise my favourite was definitely the sweet potato, though I was quite impressed with the fried pickles. They also bought out some dessert burgers... yes it's a heart attack in a mouth full but it was so, so good.

Some guests preferred ordering a milkshake (these are decadent), but I stuck with the red wine and they had a pretty sweet selection on offer!

We had the whole bar section (right hand side of the restaurant when you exit the elevators) closed off and they did a great job setting up the room so folks can mingle/ eat/ access the bar pretty much all at the same time.

I did have a chance to look at the menu - mainly to see if this is a place I can afford to come back to - and yes, it's a bit on the steep side but for the experience, and the view, and the Hubert Keller spotting... occasionally, it may be worth it :P
author: Joyce L.

description:
This place is not worth it. 
The service is terrible. I can understand that a new place still has some kinks to work out, but this was beyond bad. The hostess looked at us like she wanted to kill us when I asked  if we could be put on a waiting list. The bartender never even looked as us while we sat there waiting for our table, we had to flag him down. Our server seemed to have a little more promise, but then she disappeared when our food came out, I had to go find her to ask for extra condiments and water. Who doesn't bring water? Who doesn't even offer water? 

I got the Kobe burger and although it was cooked right, the beef is completely flavorless. The french fries and onion rings were the frozen kind, and the little piece of lettuce they give you looked really sad and wilted. $23 dollars per person later (Kobe burger, cheddar cheese, bacon, and french fries) I at least expected that the hostess would say thank-you as we walked out, but even that was too much to ask for.

The worse part of it all was the Mr. Keller was there and it was still a disaster.
author: Rocio P.

description:
I have dined at this restaurant on two occasions. The pluses, the view of Union Square is beautiful  and the milkshakes are wonderful.

But, the service leaves much to be desired. The first time I dined here, I was alone, and the restaurant had plenty of open tables. The hostess wanted me to sit at the bar, I had to insist with her that I didn't want to sit at a bar, but rather at a small window table.  On my second visit, I was with my daughter. We were seated near the front. A waitress took our order and our food was promptly delivered,  however, we never saw our server disappeared, never to be seen again.  At the end of the meal, a server named Jason came over and asked us if we needed anything. 

It turned out that our original server had left and never communicated with the rest of the staff that our table needed another server. 

I told the hostess at the desk that I was very disappointed with our service this evening. The only reply I received from her was a hollow insincere, "I'm sorry."  She didn't offer to discount our bill or even offer an amenity for our next visit.  I was rather surprised at her attitude because Chef Keller was "in the house." 

I extremely disappointed and surprised that the management  doesn't train their staff in regard to customer service. Even though this is a casual dining place, the prices are high and I expect a much higher caliber of service at a Chef Keller restaurant.

Re the food, my daughter and I ordered the sliders. I asked our server if I could have mine without onions, and was curtly informed, "No substitutions." (What is this, the diner from "Three Easy Pieces?" The only way I could have no onions is if  I was allergic to the onions. "OK, I'm allergic."  The sliders came with skinny fries which looked like frozen fries from Costco. Since Chef Keller is French, I expected the fries "frites" to be more exciting.
Quite frankly, I think the food is better at Pearl's on Post Street. 

The view is great, but be prepared to spend nearly $50.00 for burgers and shakes. At these prices, I expect much better service.
author: Joan J.

description:
Great location, good food, horrible service at the bar. 

We sat at the bar to dine on a Saturday afternoon. Cheesecake Factory had a 2 hour wait, Burger Bar didn't have a wait at all. The bar wasn't cleaned off between us and the previous guests, nor were the drink coasters changed for our beers. The bartender claimed to be very busy, however there were only 2 or 3 other couples at the bar. The entire staff were carrying on conversation regarding their evening plans, we felt as if we were intruding. 

The veggie burger was really good. The kitchen has it together... The rest of the staff needs a lot of help in customer service and providing their guests with better (more welcoming) experiences. 

Unfortunately, we will not dine at this restaurant again.
author: Bo E.

description:
FOOD: I loved the fries--they were to die for. My USD16 bison burger was very good. The meat was dry yet held together with very little fat. A little pricey but it is the leanest of the burgers offered. The downside is that it does not include fries so you have to fork up another USD 3-4 to get those.

Shakes are a big deal here but we could not really fit it in. There was just one guy doing those drinks so I guess they take them seriously. So it you are into them you might be in for a real treat.

SERVICE: They told us the wait would be 45 mins but it ended up being only 30mins. We missed the call but when we inquired they sat us right away. This was GOOD.

They got my order wrong: I had ordered buttermilk zucchini fries and got regular fries but frankly I did not care and the fries were just so good anyway. It worked OUT.

We really did not like our table--narrow booth for 2 with a TV monitor that we could not control. I thought that was kind of weird--the TV is just such a downer. This was BAD.

We would have stayed at the crappy table but somebody from management stopped by and asked us if everything was OK and when we mentioned our dislike for our table they gave us another table. This was GREAT.

The big PLUS is seeing Hubert Keller just working away, giving away shakes and being cute with the kids. We did not meet him but he seemed really nice and just very normal.

AMBIANCE: It is noisy and I wish they put some time in improving the lighting. Right now it's like being in a Safeway.

THE MINUS: The Burger Bar should get rid off the TVs in the booths in the back. In fact, the narrow corridor with booths close to kitchen and coffee station is a downer. We felt like we were being punished when we were sat there. Your view is either the kitchen doors or the coffee station.

HUBERT TO DO LIST: Get rid of the 2 top booths--they are uncomfortable. You are too much of a nice guy to have a Siberia section in your restaurant! Also, the TV have to go. You can't control them and you can't hear them so what's the point. It's awkward on a 2 top.

OVERALL:

It was obviously the 2nd day after opening so you could tell with some of the staff but overall there was a real effort to ensure we had a good time and that is really commendable. Good job! The burgers are a little expensive but they are good. The beer menu is great--kudos on that aspect. I would just come back for a beer and an order of fries! And maybe a shake...
author: Florencia P.

description:
First of all, I love Hubert Keller. He's one of the most humble, gracious and talented Chefs out there. I was really excited to try out thew 2 month old Burger Bar in San Francisco.

The food was delicious. I had the Kobe burger with a fried egg. My burger was so moist and juicy.  The side dishes were amazing (onion rings, zucchini fries, etc.)

The best part of eating here was when Hubert came out to greet our table after we ate and made sure our food was up to par. It was like a dream come true!
author: Alan T.

description:
I was really torn on this review. My want to really REALLY like it was high. I mean, come on, it's Hubert Keller! I rarely get to see the chef/owner when I go out, but there he was, sitting right there and walking around Burger Bar. I had a little OMG moment. 

Anyway, my review. So I won't deny it, the burger was good. I got the Black Jack Burger which is one of the ones you cannot change from the menu. No really, don't ask. You can't. We just can't do it. Don't try...or so the waiter kept telling us again and again. Okay, okay I get it! The skinny fries were just that. They were skinny and they were fries. Nothing more, nothing less. The pickle was a pickle. So basically it was a pretty good burger with nothing more than average stuff to go with it. Why I struggled with this review is because I think I was expecting the sky to open up and see some form of deity or something. Didn't happen. 

The location is great (Union Square view) and in Macy's if you really wanted to make a day out of it. Decor was nice, but nothing to write home about. And that brings me to the service. Not horrible or anything, but here is where I really think things should have been outstanding. Here is where you make a burger more than just going to eat a burger, even if it is a really good burger. 

First, there seemed to be three to four hosts hovering/working at one time. Yes the place was busy but it felt like three airline employees trying to rebook 100 people who's flights just got cancelled. When we were seated, the TVs were really distracting. Why would you make me watch infomercials while I'm trying to eat? Our order took what seemed to be an unusual amount of time. More time that a really good burger should seem to take, then our waiter started to acknowledge it too. Clearly something had happened, or the kitchen was just really slow. Oh, and my friend's drink order was messed up. I'm not trying to be negative about the service, but there really wasn't anything spectacular about it. 

I'd go back, but only after I've tried a few other places I've been meaning to give a shot.
author: Mike C.

description:
discretion* This review is solely written for drinks at Burger Bar. Burgers were not consumed.*

Before heading into Burger BAR, marlene says "There better be a BAR at Burger Bar or I'm gonna be pissed.

There's a Bar alright, but with a very limited cocktail menu. No alcoholic  frozen drinks or anything strawberry flavored? WHAT?! 
You have alcoholic milkshakes(ew), why can't you make me a strawberry daiquiri?! 

Hubert Keller is adorable walking around in his purple shirt and silver haired pony tail.
author: Linda L.

description:
Can't say it is the best burger I have had it is just ok. Nothing special, nothing to write home about, nothing to say bad things about. It is a burger bar in Macy's with a little more hype because Hubert is the owner. And by the way he was there today walking through checking on his empire. 

The fries, onion rings, fried zucchini, etc were nothing to write home about. I have had much better fried stuff elsewhere. Being a "gourmet" burger place you would think the batter they fry this stuff in would have a twist to it or come with some sauces that make you just want to dive in again and again. How about some flavored salts? Maybe throw in some truffle salt? 

They did have a fun dessert for the birthday girl. It was a cheese cake in the shape of a hamburger. The cheese was passion fruit gelatin and there was chocolate underneath with a bun made of a donut dough. 

If you are in Macy's and shopping and tired and you have a choice between Burger Bar or one more floor up to face the madness of Cheesecake factory I say hit Burger Bar. At least the customers were not as overweight as they are at Cheesecake factory.
author: Scott P.

description:
Eh, at the most. Despite it's convenient location atop Macys, you will likely find me waiting the hour at Cheesecake Factory than eating at Burger Bar. Service was slow and the food was not worth the wait. The burger was a la cart and each add-on cost money, including the fries options. The Country Natural burger ($10.50) with cheese ($0.75) and chipotle aioli ($0.45) was a little too thick and over cooked. Zucchini fries ($3.95) were the size of fried mozzarella and tasted ok, but nothing to rave about. Onion rings were good and crispy ($3.55) and probably the best thing I tried. Managed to stay away from the whopping $3.25 soda though. 

Tip: grab a booth in the back for a table with your own TV. You will need the entertainment while you wait for them to take your order and for the food to come.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
This place is lame.  A tourist trap.  I'm not giving it a 1 star only because I can imagine worse.

The Kobe Beef patty was littered with gristle.  My friend and her friend also complained about gristle in the first bite.

If you want a great burger then go to Pearl's.  It's only a few blocks away on Post.  If you want a lame gimmick that costs too much, then go here.
author: Oren F.

description: They have an option of creating your own burger and that's what I did. Because they do charge for add ons the burger was a little pricy, but the burger was epic! Service can be a little better, but the food is great
author: Christian G.

description:
My experience at Burger Bar was good, simply OK for me. I've been to other places which serve gourmet burgers but of course, you won't find the $60 burger anywhere else unless you're at the Burger Bar in SF. 

The service was meh; service was spotty. This place was so crowded upon arrival. (Of course, you wouldn't expect anything less especially sitting right on the 6th floor of Macy's Women's building overlooking the ice skating rink!)

I ordered the sliders as my meal. They were so cute and juicy. Plus it came with a side of fries. It didn't hurt at all when it came with bacon. 

I'm still on the fence about coming back here. I just want to try a shake next time. Eh, who knows...
It's just a tourist trap.
author: Mika D.

description:
If you are looking for overpriced burgers in a bar setting in a mall... then this is the place for you!

It was pouring coming back from the convention that I was attending (my dumbass did not bring a jacket either), I stopped off before I went to the Westin (read review on that dump) and saw the sign and decided.. hell this sounds cool... Wandered into the mall and apparently they decided that it would be best to hide this place. I got the floor it was on, but apparently this game of hide and seek makes one get hungrier.

Finally after wandering through linens and pillows I saw the place and walked in. Instead of being seated by the smoking hot hostess, I just walked up to the bar.

I sat down and checked the menu and was blown away by the pricing. It is a freaking hamburger for god sake. Two buns and a hamburger patty should not start at $15.

Ordered a beet, ate a hamburger that to this day does not really stand out other than the fact that the cost of the thing makes me gag slightly. The beer was pretty solid.. then again it is a BAR so I am not sure how badly they could screw that up.

If you are on Powell and near the Burger Bar and nothing else is open and you somehow find the place, check it out, but if you near powell and want something to eat that is not going to kill your wallet with a non memorable burger, then check out anything else that is around.
author: Danny M.

description: Would have loved to rate this better, service was slow and basic at best. Beverages only refilled once, dirty fork, had to request another. Had burger and fries ( very good) but no ketchup and none offered, took it from another table. Cobb salad also very good. Hostess dropped the menus and walked away.. Etc... Too expensive for such poor service
author: Bill P.

description:
I'll allow my review to be somewhat brief compared to the others. Interesting concept, however its being done much better by places like The Counter in CA and 5 Napkin Burger in Manhattan. 

VERY touristy destination on this 6th floor of the Macy's in Union Square. Made a reservation and still needed to wait more than 15 minutes for a table (why make a reservation?) Menu had a great variety offered from various cuts, meats and even included a veggie and salmon steak. The taste was ok at best - nothing to write home about. Nice full beer selection and unique selection of blended/ice cream drinks. Very limited selection of sauces which makes no sense. Side order of fries was sub par knowing whats available by the competish. Prices begin for burgers at $8.50 and run as high as $60 (yes $60 for a premium grade burger). Service was typical for a tourist destination... just ok.
author: Jonny M.

description:
I had heard a little bit about this place before I went, and was curious to try it out when my friend suggested it.  We went at about 6pm on a Sunday night, had about a 5 min wait, and were lucky enough to be seated right by the window with an AWESOME view of Union Square and the surrounding city.

I ordered the Kobe burger(medium rare) on ciabatta with pepper jack cheese, sauteed onions and sliced avocado.  I also ordered a side of sweet potato fries and a Murphy's Irish Stout to top it off.  The wait time for the food wasn't too bad and our server was helpful.  Now to the food.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  The Kobe beef was super flavorful and juicy and the toppings were very nice as well.  The sweet potato fries were cooked very well and were nice and crispy on the outside.  The beer menu is pretty extensive and I definitely had trouble picking from such a good selection, both draft and bottled.

I wish I had tried the deserts, but I don't think I had the room in my stomach or my wallet.  Cool location, hip atmosphere(little noisy, but whatever) and great food.  It's not your regular burger joint, so don't expect to come here and pay for a regular burger.  I saw Hubert Keller walking around too which was cool
author: Will D.

description: Finally got to try a Hubert Keller restaurant and I was not disappointed.  I went New Year's Eve around 7PM with two people just taking a chance that we may squeeze into the bar seating at least.  We fully expected to either get turned away or encounter a long waiting time, an hour or more, but we were pleasantly surprised.  We crossed our fingers as we ascended to the 6th floor of the Macy's building through crowds of tourists and street entertainers across from the, decked out for the holidays, Union Square Park.  The hostess was exceptionally pleasant and welcoming despite the throngs of people jammed in front of her podium anxiously waiting to be seated.  She acknowledged new people almost instantly and assured us that she would find us seating ASAP.  We were mentally prepared to wait for quite awhile but we were actually seated within 5 minutes. For a celebrity chef restaurant,  the menu was very reasonably priced and diverse enough for even those in our party with dietary restrictions to appreciate and enjoy.  Of course at a burger place I NEEDED to have a burger and yes it was amazing!  I ordered the Chef's special Black Jack Burger medium - a black angus burger with jack cheese and black olive tapenade on ciabatta bread accompanied by skinny fries.  Yum!  cook temp was perfect on the burger, the flavor of the olive tapenade melting just perfectly with the cheese into the burger was salty savory goodness. The ciabatta roll toasted golden and the skinny fries were so crazy fresh that I could smell and taste real potato as if it was just hand cut moments before frying - crispy outside and comforting tenderness inside.  I usually avoid fries because they aren't made well but these were something spectacular.  I just wish I had saved room for the milkshake paddle that I kept seeing people order.  It looked sinfully good. I guess I will just have to go back!
author: Bia R.

description:
Find yourself exhausted from trying on too many clothes in Union Square and feel like taking in some sinful refuel calories? Two words for you: alcoholic milkshakes. And two stars... because those milkshakes are the only reason I'd go back to Burger Bar.

The combination of Hubert Keller's rep and the buzz around Las Vegas' Burger Bar gave me high hopes for burger nirvana at this place. Sadly, although the burgers were good, they definitely were not great, and the price was so much higher than other "luxury burgers" in the city it didn't sit right. 

But back to those shakes. Where I grew up in WI the frosty liquor spiked beverage is more common. I hadn't seen it here. Burger Bar has about 4 different kinds, and the one I tried was super-spiked with not only liquor, but also tons of gooey hot fudge and mint ice cream. Mmmmmm.
author: Shoshana D.

description:
I expected more from Hubert Keller!  I know its just a burger place, but come on!  The prices weren't "cheap".  It was on par with most chain dining restaurants in the suburbs.  I should have expected that since it was located in Macy's.  I would give it 2.5 stars if I could because I did enjoy the light crispy fries.  

It wasn't bad-- but "Meh. I've experienced better. "
author: Sun M.

description:
6th floor in the huge Macy's store at Union Square. 

View: would probably be better at a different time of the year. The windows were almost all blocked by the gigantic wreaths!

Food: 
Carmel Latte Milkshake - pretty good. I thought it was a little too sweet (there was a pool of fudge at the bottom of the glass!), but I don't have much of a sweet tooth.

Friday special (salmon burger) - yum! Comes with grilled vege condiments and a side of cole slaw, but I substituted for skinny fries instead! The salmon was a super thick piece of fish, flavorful, and still moist. The veges were also well seasoned. Fries were unfortunately not too memorable. 

Would I go back? Probably! Maybe on a sunny spring day where I can really soak in more of the view. Would probably skip on the milkshake and skinny fries, but will definitely have another burger and other sides.
author: Belinda O.

description:
LOVE the buffalo burger.  other standard  beef burgers were just okay.  they make great milkshakes and the beer float paddle is an awesome deal if you have a group of people to share.

i've been here for happy hour as well and the appetizers and specials were decent but nothing to write home about.
author: Helen T.

description:
Service:

Abysmal.  

Hostess didn't want to be there, and certainly didn't want to give me the time of day.  Forgive me for wanting to eat alone, I don't really need dirty looks. 

I'll sum up my complaints: I shouldn't have had to spend two hours getting a burger and fries.  It was a Monday afternoon, not a Saturday night.  My waiter was really nice, but so. very. slow.  I know I was not alone in being annoyed at the waitstaff.  Other couples (with different waiters) had a lot of the same service problems I had.  

Food:
Eh.  Burger was overcooked.  They put the wrong cheese on my burger, but after waiting 45 minutes for it, I wasn't going to say anything.  Fat fries were decent.  The best part of the meal was the chipotle aioli.  I was overcharged for a beer, which meant I had to spend even more time sitting at my little table, staring out the window.

Oh yeah - I had a hard time finding the place (didn't realize there was a dedicated entrance).  I figured I'd smell delicious meat wafting through the 6th floor - not so.  However, you CAN smell the burgers elsewhere....  Like the women's section two floors down.....
author: Kat M.

description: This place is loud and mediocre.  I've been here twice, and I was angry at myself for returning (but it was convenient.)  The hostesses seem frustrated and annoyed and the servers are more interested in chatting with each other than with customers.  The burgers are good, but are good burgers really that hard to find?  The food is not exceptional, and there are so many better places to go in the Union Square area.
author: Augie R.

description: Very unique and amazing tasting burgers! Order one of the specialties or build your own from a huge list of ingredients. They have truffles!!!
author: Mike P.

description:
Bad experience-- from the beginning, the person on the ground floor told us there was no wait. Our wait actually turned out to be 45 minutes.  I ordered the Burger Bar sliders (buffalo with carmelized onions, Angus with bacon, beef with American cheese). For $15, I'd expect those 3 little burgers to be at least a tiny bit better than ordinary.  Nope. My husband ordered a customized Angus burger.  Also mediocre.  The best part of the meal was the skinny fries.

Only reason why I give it 2 stars instead of 1 is that I have hope that if you're willing to pay more (ie $30 for truffles), the burger will be spectacular.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
I was too tired to fully take advantage of the menu.  I love the build your own burger idea.  We were exhausted so I just ordered one of the special burgers and it was great.  The wine was lacking.  I ordered a Sav Blanc that tasted like buttery sugar water.  I guess you can't expect too much from a burger place.  Next time I want to try the lobster & kobe burger with asparagus!  Yum.

I wish the location wasn't in Macy's.  Wine & location are the reason for the 3 stars.
author: hilary w.

description:
I wish I could give this place a good review because I do like Hubert.  We went around 5 on a Saturday.  The place was fully be we quickly got a table for two.  There is a small selection of pre-built items otherwise it is all custom burgers and shakes.  The waiter said Hubert like the "flavor profiles" of the pre-built burgers.  Unfortunately, my Black Jack Burger had no flavor.  My wife got the veggie burger which also wasn't that great.  

I'm tempted to give this place two stars because I'd be pissed if I waited an hour or got an average tasting $60 burger.  The best thing about Burger Bar seems to be the views of Union Square and the sweet potato fries.
author: Garrett D.

description:
Went to The Burger Bar with my 2 granddaughters.We were seated at
the window which was wonderful.The hostess was a doll

Then we had our fabulous waiter,Eric.We thought that he was great

Then the food which was heavenly

so skating,santa,burger bar,shopping and tree.Priceless
author: Jane M.

description:
A burger joint opened by the renowned chef of Fleur de Lys (Hubert Keller).  They have average to expensive gourmet burgers.  It's in a nice and convenient location (on top of Macy's in SF Downtown) and it's a great place to stop by for a burger before continuing shopping. 

We ordered the sliders, the meat was great, done well and the veggies were fresh. Service was friendly and casual and the customers are very diverse (tourists, local, etc).  I think overall it's on the pricey side for a burger joint and the interior decor, but I can appreciate the great view of Union Square and location that other burger joints don't have. 

I would definitely come back again for more burgers next time I shop in the area. May I'll try the $60 Rossini burger (with foie gras and truffles)...
author: Jay T.

description: This place is a disaster when it comes to service. Sat at the bar (not busy) with 5 open seats. Took the bartender 15 minutes before he actually came over. Tossed me a menu without saying a word and then 10 minutes later asked if I wanted something to drink. Couldn't help noticing that he looked tweaked out if his mind! For the price, the food was mediocre. This experience = fail.
author: Michael A.

description: The best service and such an availability! :) I got salmon burger. It was huge!! And the salmon was perfectly cooked. They have so many interesting burger desserts too. Everything is burger-ed. Unbelievable.. :D I recommend this place for an experience.
author: Hee Jung R.

description:
First off, i dont know why people are going there in hopes of the experience of something amazing. 

The best thing about living in the city are the hole-in-the wall restaurant s that offer excellent food, great atmosphere and amazing experiences with family and friends. Burger Bar is in the middle of union sq (that should be enough said) so obviously its going to be over priced, long waits with tourists, with probably not the best atmosphere and/or tasting food. Why would it be any different than its cross-corner counter part; cheesecake?

And for people who complain about the waits while there are open tables have never worked in a restaurant before. It has nothing to do with the server or the hostess not wanting to sit you. Its from the kitchen that has placed a hold due to the amount of orders coming in.  There is no point in getting upset over a wait either; by the time you sit down you already have a negative connotation towards the place; grab a beer and chat. 

Best advise, go to Burger Bar when Emily and Michelle are the hostess. They seem to have everything set and know what they are doing. The others seem to be a little lost, new, confused or just plain don't wan to be there. 

Good Luck...
author: casey p.

description:
A gourmet burger joint. Everything is fancy, even the milk shakes. 

The burgers were delicious, but of course you're paying $15 for them, so they better be tasty. I ordered the sliders and I loved that it gives you a taste of 3 different types of burgers. Really excellent onion rings too.

The atmosphere is loud and hip. The servers are all young and beautiful. The booths have TV screens. The service was fast and friendly.
author: Grace Y.

description: The food was quickly brought over. Great atmosphere and amazing view of Union Square since all tables are pressed against the glass. The burgers are huge and all the fixings cost extra. I ordered one well done but it still came a little bloody. As I bit into it, it squirted blood and juices more than 6 inches on to the nice clean glass window!!
author: Mohamed A.

description:
Burger Bar at San Francisco just didn't live up to my expectation on both the service and the food.  I have been to the one in Vegas and it was better for a high end burger joint.  The reason I complain about service is because two of us went there for late lunch (after 1PM) and I had to tell three different wait staff we needed a table for two and the place was less than 50% filled.  Then they sat us in a small corner and I asked can we sit in one of the booths or the other open tables, but the staff said "I'm sorry we do not seat two people in the booths," when place is only 40% filled and non-peak hour.  That is just bad business practice.

For a $15+ (regular) burger, you did expect to get a pretty good size portion, but not what I got the meat patty was quite small compare to the one I had in Vegas this past summer.  And they forgot to include the extra pesto sauce (they charge for all these different toppings and sauces) my guest ordered.  

Overall, the food was just okay , it is more of a hype and the table service was good (besides assigning us a small table).  I ordered the Nutella milkshake and it was one of the best milkshakes I had; it was $$$ but it was excellent and you can see the shake specialist put the attention in creating the milkshake behind the milkshake station.
author: Johnson Y.

description: My first bad review. This place is horrid. The host is a bitch, the server incompetent and the food is shit.
author: Sergei T.

description:
I had Sliders and wife had all American burger with strawberry milkshake for about $40. Roughly 4x more than a comparable meal from In-n-Out with only about equal level of burger satisfaction. 

The handmade shake was good and the skinny fries were a fine hybrid of McDonald's-like flavor with a Burger King type of crisp exterior.

In a pinch, Burger Bar would be good for medium size people groups of 6-10 people.  We saw several groups at the restaurant on our visit Sunday evening.
author: Jeff L.

description: A good list of burger selection and meats are not bad as well. Just right downtown so that's good. The bar is plus as well!
author: Meredith C.

description:
Got here in time for an early lunch, fifteen minute wait.
The decor is really disappointing, it tries to give off a vibe of luxury but honestly beer signs and cheap looking tables tell me differently.
I just went with the American Classic this time around, bacon cheeseburger was really dry. Fries were pretty decent.

I've had so many better burgers here in SF that this isn't worth my time.
Honestly this place is like if fine dining and Applebees had a love child- it'd be Burger Bar.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Other than the lovely company I was with when I went to Burger Bar, nothing was really memorable. I am perhaps a poor judge for this type of restaurants since I don't eat burgers, but nothing really stood out. The decor is like a Sports Bar version of Cheesecake Factory (not sure if they were going for symmetry or what.) The service was a bit erratic. Waitstaff is clearly busy and I can only imagine how difficult it is to manager such a large restaurant. 

I had the grilled shrimp salad that came with grilled zucchini and peppers. It was fine but nothing special. The sweet potato fries I shared with friends were fine too. Some complained that they were too soggy, but I think I love sweet potato so much that I simply have a hard time disliking them ever. 

The friends who did order burgers said that they were too dry and not as good as the Burger Bar in Vegas. 

The only thing that really excited me was the booth. I love booths in restaurants! I love that cozy feeling of sitting with friends in this semi enclosed area where we can talk about whatever with lots of privacy. And yes, Burger Bar is noisy enough so you don't have to worry about your roaring laughters bothering neighbors during a meal.
author: Candice B.

description:
This may be strange, but I haven't actually tried the burgers at Burger Bar...

However, I am giving it 5 stars due to my love for Hubert Keller. He happened to be at the restaurant on the day my sis and I visited. We had just eaten brunch with our parents and as they left to return to the east coast, the two of us decided to grab beers at Burger Bar because of it's location and sweet view of Union Square. As a longtime Top Chef fan, I had recently fallen in love with Hubert following the last season of Top Chef Masters during which I was convinced that I was his biggest cheerleader. So you can imagine how starstruck I was when I saw him pacing on his cell phone behind a set of closed doors - though you can barely see through the doors, I'd know that white ponytail anywhere. I kept turning around and staring like a fool, and finally decided to get a hold of myself. After sometime, he decided to come out as my sister grabbed me across the table and exclaimed "Pia, he's gonna walk by us!" Not knowing what else to do, as I saw a flash of white go by, I screamed out "Hubert!" (to this day I scold myself for not calling him "chef"). Anyways, despite  my lack of eloquence, he was so polite and sweet and was truly flattered that I was such an adoring fan. He asked us if we had tried the burgers and we apologized that we had not as we came here on full stomachs. He then asked if we liked milkshakes, and we both nodded eagerly. Chef Keller himself then had 2 complimentary milkshakes (which were delicious!) sent out for me and my sis. Truly one of the most memorable moments of my life. 

After this experience, I will forever be a Keller groupie.
author: Pia S.

description:
I hadn't heard too much about it, but they were open later than most quality restaurants in the Union Square area, so I gave it a shot.

I ordered their slider plate, which they should rename to "teaser"!  All you get are 3 EXTREMELY small burgers...not your typical sliders which are small, yes, but it takes more than two bites to finish'em.  These were basically a small meatball between a tiny bun.  It was listed as being cooked medium (with no option to change how you wanted them cooked, strange), and yet I still received 3 "well done" sliders.  Disappointing.  One was so dry, I was at least glad I finished it first.

Still, from what I was able to taste, the quality of meat was pretty good, and the fries were delicious.  The selection of beers is pretty awesome and the staff are quite friendly.

I'd go back, but not for dinner, the place is SO LOUD, it's not the type of place I would visit for a quiet evening of dining.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I went to the las Vegas location a few years ago and had a great experience. So I 
was surprised to see this dilapidated spot in union square called burger bar.
Wow what a difference a city makes. Being a Keller restaurant located in a "higher end" store I thought they would have brought the same great food, service and ambiance. Guess not.  We all ordered medium rare burgers and were all given well done taco meat. My friend even had the minerals to get the "signature"  $60 Kobe, lobster and truffle burger. His analysis, "I wouldn't pay $6 for the burger. The lobster tasted frozen and microwaved, the truffles were a joke, the wine reduction added nothing to the meal and the meat was painfully overcooked".  Lastly this place feels like ur in someone's old apartment that hasnt been swept or cleaned for months. $20 or so for a burger barely ahead of red robin.  This place will surely shuffle in all the shopping tourists that think they are getting a high end meal. As for this local, I am severely underwhelmed.
author: Mark N.

description:
I walked in here on a Sunday night expecting a crowd for the NBA finals game and just for the fact it's right in the middle of "tourist-ville"...however there was no wait and plenty of seating to choose from. 

I picked a seat at the bar and was immediately overwhelmed by the choices of milkshakes, burgers, and beer. Wow - I could have easily eaten a week's worth of calories in a few hours. Anyway, I ordered a juicy turkey burger with cheddar & pineapple..and it was AMAZING. It was the most satisfying burger I have had in a long time. It was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right. 

The service was also good, despite the fact the bartender forgot to order a whole wheat bun & cheese (which they brought out later). He made up for it by not complaining when my husband and I stayed an extra 20 minutes after we paid our bill to watch the big game. 

A+ for the decor (most booths had their own TV to watch games, etc), the view (of Union Square - 6th floor), the food, and the ambiance. 

I will definitely be back!
author: Heidi B.

description:
My boyfriend and I go to the Burger Bar when we're feeling like spending some money on a dinner. It's good food, and I especially love the Low Carb burger. It's pretty pricey, but like I said- we only go for some special occasions. It gets pretty noisy and busy, but that's not a big problem because it has that great view.

Ps. the build your own will get you on price! Don't split a shake, I think it was a $2 charge just for an extra cup. And get an already built burger- just as good and won't empty your pockets- as much. :)
author: Maggie J.

description: I've been here twice ... once for take-out and once for dine-in . Don't get their peppercorn burger ... it's bland and very dry . They forgot to give me my fries . Their BB twinkie shake is really good but also very fattening . I love how they have twinkies and little pieces of twinkies in the shake ... it makes the shake have some texture . A few hours ago , I came here and ordered The World's Hottest Burger and let me just say ... it's no joke ! I didn't expect it to be all that spicy because I've had all kinds of spicy foods and rarely ever come across that I find as a spicy challenge but this burger defininately was ! It was almost unedible !! What's really spicy about the burger is their sauce . I took a couple bites and I felt like my mouth was on fire . I was surprised to find that a tear rolled out of my eye . It was so bad I found myself grabbing whatever was in site ( fries , water , beer , my friend's burger ) right after taking a couple bites to put out the fire in my mouth . I didn't want to waste the burger so I took it apart and ate it . It wasn't as spicy when I ate the meat , bacon , and bun separately but it was still spicy as hell . I ordered an Irish Coffee Milkshake which tasted really good . Too bad the waiter gave it to me so late because it sorta helped calm down the fire in my mouth . I was able to finish the meat and almost all the bacon after taking apart the burger but then it just got to the point that I didn't like the feeling of my mouth burning . No wonder they don't allow you to order The World's Hottest Burger to go and make you sign a waiver before serving it to you ! The skinny fries that came with the burger had some red pepper powder on it so it was a little spicy as well . The fries were really yummy . It is comparable to McDonald's fries . If not , better .  I was curious about their Purple Haze draft beer so I decided to try . It tasted like shit ... it tasted like someone's puke . My friend's Buffalo Burger tasted pretty good . The buffalo meat was really yummy and flavor ... it tastes better than cow meat . I'm not a big fan of sweet potato fries so I was surprised to find that I really liked their potato fries . Their beer battered jalapeno pickles are pretty good ... it's nice and spicy and I like the texture of the beer battered outside coating . I eventually found it fattening so I ripped off the beer battered outside coating and just ate the jalapeno pickle . I would definately recommend coming here for their shakes ... they're really good . If you plan to try The World's Hottest Burger , proceed with caution .
author: Eileen L.

description:
Small place- make sure you make reservations if you have a large party.

Kind of pricey burgers but they are pretty big and juicy! ($9-60) I added provolone cheese and pineapple to my regular angus burger and it was around $11. The meat could have had more flavor, but it was juicy.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Overall, a really mundane and unpleasant experience:
- small portions
- basic/boring presentation
- poor quality ingredients
- hectic Macy's atmosphere
- uncomfortable bar stools and tiny tables

Had the veggie burger which had decent flavor, but the mushy texture was hard to swallow (literally). The sourdough bun was dried out and actually broke apart as I was eating it. The side salad was extremely overdressed, soggy and the greens were wilted and had a few brown pieces (!). Fries were hard and similar to Burger King fries, except 2-3 times the price.

My husband and I both had veggie burgers, side salad, fries and it came to $37. Way overpriced for the quality and lack of flavor. Very disappointing!  Having seen Hubert Keller on Top Chef Masters, I thought his food would be creative and imaginatively presented.
author: Emily C.

description:
An excellent meal......
Didn't know exactly what to expect, but as we passed a very friendly Hubert Keller on our way in to the elevator I was excited to try it. We arrived early since it was the 2nd day after opening and a Saturday. We walked right in and were seated next to the window at a table with a fabulous view of Union Square. The beer selection was impressive, and the menu was fabulous. I ordered the angus burger with cheddar, avocado, and homemade dijon on ciabatta with the "fat fries."
