It was so good, I want to eat it all over again! My husband had the angus burger with avocado, caramelized onions, baby spinach, and mozzarella on sourdough with zucchini fries (so good). We planned on splitting one of their amazing looking milkshakes, but we were way to full. I can't wait to go back and just as we told Hubert Keller on the way out it was excellent!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Very disappointing.  We were looking forward to having the best burger ever, and our burgers wouldn't even have made our top ten in SF.  For a place that has a very reputable celebrity chef at the helm, they can't even do good burgers.  The Kobe was a total disappointment.  And they charge for condiments (other than the yellow - yes yellow - mustard and Heinz ketchup on the table).  The decor is pure tourist trap/chain restaurant.  Was I sitting in Cheesecake Factory or Burger Bar?  I wouldn't really know.  They did comp our check after our complaints, though, which gives them 2 stars.  The two couples on either side of us were also comped due to complaints about the sub-standard fare.  At those prices the consistency and quality had better be good, or people won't go for it at all, especially spoiled San Franciscans.   No money in that now, is there? 

Hubert, really?  What are you trying to pull over on the foodies of San Francisco?  You might do well with the tourisimos, but we went the second week and walked right in (expected a wait), so I think the word is already out.  Might want to re-think your quality control in the kitchen, and in the front of house (socializing wait staff - pretty uninterested).
author: Cami B.

description: The Customer service is beyond below standard the Waitress who served us needs a Customer service class bigtime. She is very ungrateful to be at service for customers. Perhaps she did not realize she survives because of customers. I have not experienced such poor customer service before. she is rude and impatient. She behaves worse than the Garbages in San Francisco.  Surelu will never go back in this Garbage place ever. even i starved to death.....Its not worth the wait....beware of this place....
author: Joseph D.

description: Amazing burgers! The Keller was off the charts! The assistant manager Forrest made for a great experience as well! Recommend to everyone.
author: Justin N.

description:
I give it 3 stars, because the burgers were great!
but, i wont be back anytime soon.
the service is perfunctory
the atmosphere is way too loud
it's extremely overpriced - buffalo burger for $22?!
the nutella milkshake was also very good, but $9?! come on
burger house on powell is just as good but half the cost
author: Deka M.

description: Here for a dear friend's big birthday bash. We were in a private room and served by about 6 servers which kept the drinks and hors dourves coming. When dinner rolled around for the roughly 60+ of us, the burgers came out pretty quickly and orderly. Not sure if they were all cooked to order (they were asking) but my classic was. Bouquets of plain and seasoned fries plus onion rings were also served. Considering the large party, everything went very well. I actually believe there were more us in the private room than outside in the main room. Only bad thing I can think of is waiting for the elevator. The escalators are a better choice.
author: Ed L.

description:
I am coming out of my yelp hiding because I cannot even begin to wrap my mind around the horrible experience I had at Burger Bar. As a fan of Hubert Keller's I was excited to finally get to eat at one of his restaurants. We arrived and waited and waited, even though we were told we were next multiple tables were seated in front of us...finally we were seated and again we waited, and waited, and waited....we literally sat there for 5 minutes talking about leaving, then finally flagged a hostess to ask for our waiter...who ran over and without even saying hello said "are you ready?" we each rattled off our orders, the burger, toppings, sides, etc...each time as if he wasn't listening and was robotically programmed to upsell "would you like a side" and each time, "yes, we already ordered the fries, salad, etc" my friend ordered a salad for an appetizer, he never asked what dressing he wanted (flash forward to later when it arrived dressing-less haha), didn't take his drink order.and literally ran from our table as if we had just inconvenienced him. 

Things began to come..drinks first, but no refills without almost literally grabbing someone as they ran by our booth, a salad with no dressing, a burger missing the mustard that they charge extra for, my friend asked for no pickles and was assured they were not on the burger but would not be on the plate at all, hey look at that a pickle on his plate! One time I think he ran by to check on us once we finally got everything we had ordered after multiple trips to the kitchen, but he didn't even stop long enough for a response from us, he just mumbled something and ran off...Actually he did come back, to try to sell us dessert, which we may have ordered but at this point were ready to put this meal out of it's misery. 

We got the check, after asking...and we had each ordered totally different things, especially me because I am unemployed and even $20 (which is difficult to do here) for a meal is a lot for me right now, and this was supposed to be a treat. We explained to him which card got which amount, confirmed it twice...he came back, hands me my card "sorry sir I accidentally put a $53 charge on your card, but i voided it then charged you $20 again, but it probably wont even show up.) This was Thursday night, It is now Monday afternoon, the charge is still on there, and that $53 is being held from me...did I mention how broke I am right now?! 

I was going to just ignore it, but my money is still not available, and I called to try to discuss it with a manager today, hoping for some kind of a resolution, they weren't there, and I never got the call back I was promised hours ago, even though I made it very clear how upset I was.

I am not sure if you read your yelp reviews Mr. Keller, but if you see this here is my advice...spend less time and money on the massive flatscreen portrait of yourself, and more on training your staff in proper customer service so that when you charge 3 people $88 for a burger meal with no booze, they dont feel like they have been punched in the face by the entire staff to boot.
author: Dan B.

description: Burgers were good, a bit pricey, but worth it. Beer could ve been better wasn't cold at all. Service could be better. View is great. If you are going to get fries, get the curly fries really great.
author: Richard M.

description:
MMMM, i love me a good burger and that is why me and the boy had to go to BURGER BAR a few wknds ago while shopping in Union Square!!  We were told it was a 35 min wait, but were pleasantly surprised to only wait about 15.

The menu is amazing and I had a REALLY hard time picking the burger I wanted....I settled for a "make your own" w/kobe, cheddar, carmelized onions and lettuce.  We also got regular skinny fries and sweet potato.  They had soooo many add-on options and I really wish I had the appetite and $$ in the bank to try 12 different variations.

Finished Results:  They mixed up my burger buns, I ordered my burger MR, it was more on the MW side.  Fries were DELICIOUS.  

We also HAD to order dessert, how could you not with a menu like that and a view of the sweet shop?  Ordered the cookie-dough milkshake....it took FOREVER for the lady to take our order and even longer for the shake to appear.  Apparently they ran out of cookie dough and the waitress told us they had to buy some more?  (where in the world were they buying it from?  there's not a safeway/grocery store in sight!)

Serivce:  our waiter was friendly and nice, but holy burger she took FOREVER to get us drinks (I got my diet coke, no joke, 20 minutes before the boy got his beer!!!), take our order, check-up on us....ext, ext.  I ended up having to grab other servers for help numerous times.  And there was about a 25-30 minute gap between finishing the burger and waiting for the shake to come!

Our bill for 2 people was $70 (w/out tip!)!!!!!!  Goooood lord that is ridiculous!!  It was also LUNCH-TIME.   Pretty dang steep Burger Bar.

If given the change, i'll probably return, but just for those yummy fries and milkshake....maybe I could serve myself?  :)
author: Jana S.

description: I am a fan of their $60 burger and truffle sauce.  Yes, I said $60 burger.  Call me and my bff crazy but we bought it.  It didn't cost that much when you split it and it comes with free dessert.  If you are a fan of Kobe beef, short ribs and truffle sauce then try the $60 burger.  The seasoned fries were also good and we ordered an extra side of truffle sauce which they charged us $6 for.  Would I pay $30 for half a burger again, probably not but it was worth trying and I'd go back for a different, less expensive burger.
author: Grace P.

description:
Pure comfort burger.
Kobe beef burger with homemade Dijon mustard along with zuccini fries.
yummy!
author: Eliza T.

description:
Went to Burger Bar for lunch today.... 

ordered a burger... 

wasn't bad, though I had the standard "bacon-cheeseburger-onion-ring heart attack" as opposed to any of the more exotic burgers that they offered.

cool view.  no wait.  attentive service.  i didn't feel ripped-off or anything, though the cheesecake factory never disappoints, aaaaaand is 2 feet above.  

fyi: the pics/posters all over of girls being seduced by the milkshakes is a classy touch.

fyi#2: my friend threw a pretty cool holiday party there one night; it's definitely a venue with a lot of promise for events.

go there if it's convenient.

LV
author: Lawrence V.

description:
The food I had at Burger Bar was actually rather good. Overpriced, and definitely not the best burger I've ever had but good nonetheless.

However, the service was absolutely horrible. Our waitress visited our table a total of 2 times during our meal. The first was to take our order, the second was to give us our check. Note that we waited for our check for a good 20 minutes until she noticed me waiving my arms around wildly trying to flag her down.

Now if my review was based on food alone I would definitely have rated Burger Bar a little bit higher, unfortunately the combination of our waitress and an atmosphere that feels awkward at best, Burger Bar falls down on my list.

Will I try Burger Bar again in the future? Most likely not.
author: Hooman Z.

description: This is the second time i came here and will be the last. The place is nice, confortable but the service is horrible and the food is nothing special. Everything is overpriced. I waited for the waiter for more than 15 min to be atended. Bad service, food meh and long time waiting to be served.
author: Luis F.

description:
Where do a couple of tourists who are dead-tired from biking across the Golden Gate Bridge grab a comfortable bite to eat within walking distance of their over-priced hotel?  Why, at the over-priced burger joint, of course! 

Don't get me wrong - the St. Francis is a lovely place, but definitely not a good value for your hard-earned dollar. And the Burger Bar was a really great burger place, but again not the best value out there. My burger had lob-stah though!  Yummm...  But I ended up taking the lobster out and eating it alone because the burger overpowered its delicate flavors. And my husband really liked his Kobe beef burger, but  couldn't appreciate the distinctiveness of the beef because the peppered bacon on the burger completely overpowered the beef. 

All in all, it was good and it was different. But with burgers, like hotels, I prefer less fancy and more value.
author: Kristin C.

description:
Came here for a buddy's bday dinner... always great to see old faces and eat amongst those that are close to you.  This fact probably help mask the fact that I wasn't too impressed with Burger Bar.  For a $13.00 burger, I've had way better.  Onion rings were ok, nothing special.  The homies weren't at all impressed with their fried zucchini either and the dessert was gross - a chocolate burger.  I took one bite and was done with it.  

One thing that was cool, was the alcoholic milkshake.  The sound of it didn't sound too appealing, but it ended up looking real good - as evidence of my friend killing it before getting his overpriced burger.
author: Jason S.

description:
This was our first visit to Burger Bar. We all liked our burgers. One person in our party ordered the sliders. They looked cute, but I don't think the meat in the sliders was as juicy as the regular burgers. We ordered the caramel latte shake and the nutella shake. Both were good, but over-priced for the small amount of shake that you get. I was the only one in the group that ordered sweet potato fries, which were excellent. Everyone else had the regular skinny fries. They complained that their fries were overdone and too crispy--I guess they all had fries from the same batch.

Overall, the service was good. The hostess and waiter were both very friendly. 

We will most likely revisit this restaurant again, but probably won't order the shakes again and we'll make sure to let them know again about the overdone french fries!
author: Miki C.

description:
1 hour wait on opening Sunday. Eclectic mix of SF food mavens and random Macy's shoppers.

There were some suggested burgers (like the crazy $60 one) but I liked the fact that you can basically make your own.

I don't see the point of Kobe burgers, surely the whole point is marbling which disappears when you grind it up? So I went for the country ranch, medium rare, on ciabatta, with cheddar, caramalised onions and portobello mushrooms. I was tempted to go for bacon too but thought it would hide the taste of the meat.

YUM - it was a damn good burger. I'm not sure if I've had better actually. Although I expect burgers to be greasy, this was slightly over-greased, even for a burger.

The sides were OK, thin fries pretty standard, fat fries were dissapointingly thin. And the portions were kind of tiny. The onion rings were solid though.

Fantastic selection of domestic and foreign beers on tap, better than any restaurant I've been to in SF and not far off the likes of Toronado etc in SF. I didn't get a milkshake but they look INSANE. It also looks like one may contain more than your daily reccomended calorie intake too though!

The space was nice, bright, upscale diner. The booths are cool, each with a little TV!

Other interesting points:

My friend ordered a vegi burger (she's a meat eater) Even though they put it on the menu, they probably weren't expecting anyone to actually order one and I'm guessing had to make an emergency Costco run.

The same friend went to what looked to be apoplectic shock when she saw Hubert Keller in the distance. Rather than scaring him away, somehow it enticed him to our table and he duly took a picture with us (my friend had returned to normality by that stage) - which I thought was a nice touch :)

Overall, a great burger place, not overly expensive if you avoid truffles, foie gras etc. If the queue dies down, I'll be back. A good place to take international peeps who want to eat burgers in the US (even though they're made by a Frenchman).
author: Jeremy H.

description:
You know, even though Hubert Keller owns Fleur D'Lys (which is an AWESOME restaurant that has great service), he really didn't put too much care in Burger Bar.  

The wait to get a seat at burger bar was a lot quicker than we expected since the restaurant had just opened up not too long ago. HOWEVER, we sat there for a good 20 minutes before I had to ask the hostess when a waiter(ess) was going to greet us and give us menus and some water.

I was sooo pissed off at how slow they were to even come to our table greet us, even though we were seating RIGHT AT THE HOSTESS STAND.... and it took us another 15 minutes after we were ready to order for the waitress to come back, and then it took 35 minutes for the food to arrive at our tables. 

All the burgers on the menu were overpriced.  I really wanted to try the truffle burger, but $60 for a burger?  Seriously?  That's a 5 course meal at a better serviced restaurant!  

I'm sure that they're still ironing out the kinks, and hiring service staff that has better experience in customer service, but why would anyone in their right mind, in this kind of an economy, want to just stroll into Burger Bar for a meal that they could have cheaper elsewhere?  Money doesn't grow on trees, ya know.  I only wish. *sigh*
author: Jin B.

description:
I'm sad to give the awesome burger bar a 60% rating but this is mainly due to the poor service. Long story short and as the other reviews indicate - the wait to get a table, ordering, getting drinks, and getting your food took a looong time. Granted we sat at the bar and the bartenders were running around like chickens with their heads cut off, but honestly, the total 45 - 1 hr wait prior to eating deliciousness totally sucked. Either they need to hire more people or train the existing ones better. I went to the LV Mandalay Bay Burger Bar and had none of these issues with service. Quite, efficient and lovely staff in LV. 

Don't get me wrong - the surf and turf burger was AMAZING, and as were the fries. I'm a huge fan of Hubert Keller - love his pbs cooking show, and he totally rocked it in Top Chef Masters. Chef Keller was at the restaurant the day I came in, and although the waitress said he was in a bad mood, he was all smiles and very pleasant & gracious when we introduced ourselves. He signed a napkin for us and even took a picture with us! 

overall, I would definitely come back. but maybe have a slight snack if service continues this way. the food speaks for itself and worth the price. If you ever want to treat yourself, their $60 burger is ABSOLUTELY worth every penny. they even come with a dessert burger.
author: katrina c.

description: I was excited to try this place since I just adore Hubert Keller. But my expectations were low from what I had heard from friends who had eaten here before. So I guess it was just how I imagined. We had made a reservation about a week ahead of time. I had to call - guess they're not on opentable.com anymore. Although after trying to get into the city on a game day proved to be difficult, we called and pushed back the time of our reservation - it wasn't a problem. Still when we got there. A line going all the way to the elevator and no hostess in sight. So we had to wait for the hostess to get back, help the people in front of us and then wait some for the table to be cleared for us. Finally we were seated on the right side of the restaurant, which is kinda the empty side. We were at this table that looked like they just put it in the middle of the room. There's some tables by the windows that have amazing views of the City - wish we gotten one of those. Anyways, I ordered the American burger. It had mushrooms, cheese, bacon and a giant patty. Most everyone else got a customized burger. Seems like a good thing but pricey. And of course we got the fries, regular and the sweet potato variety, for the table. Also a couple things of truffle sauce for everyone to try. It's pricey at over $5 per order for a small thing of sauce but the table wanted to try it and how many times in your life are you ever going to have some truffle sauce. The burger was huge so I really struggled to finish it but I did. Had a few bites with the truffle sauce and it was tasty but not sure it's $5 extra worth of deliciousness. The fries were one of the best I've had. So crispy and hot and tasted like sweet potatoes. Mmmm. Service was just ok - nothing special. Although everyone that worked there didn't seem very happy - I saw very little smiles. It's just burgers so I can see it as a bit overrated. Just because Hubert Keller's name is attached, it's famous and expensive and hard to get into. I'm glad I tired it but not sure if I would seek it out especially to come back.
author: Alison W.

description: If I'm going to pay $17 for a hamburger it better be cooked right. I ordered mine well done and the middle was still pink. I would have asked them to replace it if the waiter ever came back to ask how everything was. By the time he came back I was tired of waiting and had finished my meal. Also we were served our food without utensils and napkins which was inconvenient. Normally I wouldn't mind but for the price you pay at a place like this you're really not getting what you pay for. I shoulda ate at the hot dog stand on the sidewalk.
author: J N.

description: Burgers are dry, Fish and chips are gross and service is bad. Had to ask 3 times just to get silverware and some napkins.. Maybe the servers aren't trained to handle a busy night or something. Get it together!
author: Jessica S.

description:
I love a good burger. I especially love a good buffalo burger.  Done right, a buffalo burger can be as satisfying as a beef burger but with much less of the guilt.  It's as far as I will stray from a traditional beef burger. Turkey burgers, salmon burgers,veggies burgers are not substitutes for a real hamburger.

Given the above, I was eager to try the buffalo burger at Burger Bar. It was priced much higher than their regular beef burgers and the same as their Kobe burger.  The one I had here was pretty good, not on a par with Ted's Montana Grill, which serves the best Bison Burger I have ever had.  Hell it is one of the best burgers I have ever eaten.

I like the Burger Bar's approach -  where you basically design your own burger - you select your meat, cheese, condiments, roll, and whatever else you wish to have on it.  All the ingredients are top notch, fresh and from great purveyors.  If you do not like your burger here, you only have yourself to blame.
author: Steve S.

description:
Ate here last night. I think this is the best burger ever. The flavor of the meat is indescribable!!! We loved our burger and it was perfectly cooked. After eating millions of burgers, this was was the best tasting overall. The bun was great too. 

We saw Hubert Keller running around the restaurant too. I am impressed as he was working pretty hard on a Saturday night. The drinks here are great. Our server was excellent and we LOVED the chocolate donut cheesecake dessert. I wished I could have pigged out on a custom made milkshake.... 

We will definitely be back since I need another excuse to stroll Macy's.
author: K L.

description: Ate here for lunch with my cousin Jenn.  I had a salmon burger and she had the fish and chips.  Yes...I know...doesn't sound like something you should be ordering at a burger joint but we were "TRYING" to eat healthy.  Hahaha.  My burger was pretty good...the salmon was thick and the rest of the ingredients was pretty average.  Didn't get to taste my cousin's fish but I sure ate all her chips (fries) that was served in this cute little basket that resembled one of those basket they use in the deep fryers.  Not the best burger joint I've been too but the location was fab since its smack dab in the middle of union square.  Oh how I love the city!
author: Dimps I.

description:
Just came back from the Burger Bar and I am disappointed and regretting spending that $30 - and I am not tight with money when it comes to food

I ordered the sustainable beef burger, with the red wine reduction sauce, on cibata - Wanting to keep it simple so the burger could speak for itself. On the side, sweet potato fries and a chocolate milkshake. The wait was an hour long (we arrived at 1pm) so we took our food to go and ate in union square. 

The burger - such a disappointment. To begin, I'm not even sure they gave me the red wine sauce with shallots. The sauce looked like any other au jus - not red, no shallots, and tasting bland as could be. Such a disappointment because I am a huge fan of redwine reduction sauces and this was just no where near such a sauce in my book. The burger was cooked to medium, which must be their standard go-to doneness level because I forgot and was not asked how well-done I wanted the burger. It was standard. Not overly juicy or flavorful in anyway. The bun was good, but should you really come out to Macy's for a 'good' bun? No. If you want bread go to the Boulaungerie. Don't go here for the burgers. 

The fries - standard, nothing special, not even great. For someone who has been on and judged Top Chef, Mr. Keller should know a thing or two about seasoning. There are so many sports bars with great fries around. It's a must. A must. So don't go for the fries.

The milkshake - My best guess is that the milkshake is made with whipped half and half and then a bit of ice cream.  It was really thick, and room temperature in about two minutes, and barely cool to begin with. I was expecting a cold creamy milkshake, not chocolate whipped cream. BTW if you do get a milkshake (but you should skip it) don't get whipped cream. I think that just drowns out the flavor even more. 

I guess I am saying - I know you want to go for the experience, but seriously save yourself the $30 or more and go anywhere else for a burger. Infact try Nopa. The burgers and fries are delish, and surely they have a dessert that can top that sad milkshake. 

Honestly, I can't even give the benefit of the doubt since they just opened on this one. Everything was disappointing, and I don't think a month or two will make any difference.

On a positive note, Mr. Keller is delightful. I had about a 30 second interaction taking a photo with him when we first arrived and he was nothing but pleasant and happy to see you at his restaurant.
author: Erica L.

description:
first visit, Friday between lunch/dinner time, was told the wait would be 35/40 mins, walked through the place to the wc and saw some empty tables and lots of big tables with two people.  Anyway the wait was only 15 mins and Chef himself was there.

We ordered drinks and a "Country Natural" Berger.  The menu says:  "sustainable ranching is the pride of this family owned ranch.  Burger Bar's favorite choice."  $10.50.  So when we ordered, we asked our server if he knew the name of the family owned ranch. He went away (for a loooong time) to inquire and finally came back with our drinks and told us "the 'country natural burger is made with meat from an assortment of ranches."  Hmmm.  The remaining choices: The Kobe Beef from Snake Farms in Boise, Idaho;  the Buffalo is from Wyoming; and the Black Angus is 'the pride of the heartland.'  No locavores here. 

The skinny fries were as good as McDonalds.
author: Carolyn S.

description:
Came here for drinks and dessert at the bar so can't speak to the quality of their burgers.  We had the chocolate burger and it was a fun dessert - there was a little whipped cream mouse and the burger was a concoction of donuts as the bun, chocolate ganache as the patty and kiwi and strawberry as the lettuce and tomato.  And at only 5.75 it was well worth it, and a perfect dish to share w/ your beau.  Great view, not as crazy crowded as Cheesecake Factory (I'm guessing 45% of the customers here just got tired of waiting for the elevator at cheesecake).

Glad I dropped by.
author: Ricky S.

description:
It's never a good sign when the best thing about the place is the view.

Given that it was the lunch hour, the service was slow, but ridiculously for a place called "Burger Bar" -- they cannot cook a burger according to order!

I ordered mine medium rare and got it rare -- disappointing, but whatever. One friend ordered her's medium and got it medium rare -- silly, but no big deal. Another friend ordered hers medium well and got it almost raw!  FAIL!! Sadly, we were on our lunch break and didn't have time to send them back. Nothing special in the taste department either.

The onion rings were okay, the skinny fries are better at In-N-Out, and the fried jalapeno pickles were just weird.

For a great fancy burger, try NOPA. For a good cheap burger around Union Square, try Best-O-Burger.

I would maybe come back with a date for a milkshake and the view or something, but definitely not for a meal.
author: Adam Z.

description:
We arrived just 15 min. after it opened for lunch and were thrilled to see that it was still pretty empty with no wait line. We placed our order, then, just waited and waited. No matter though, since we were just relaxing and enjoying the downtime from our very productive and efficient morning of shopping. We were just looking forward to our burgers. So here's the quick lowdown. 

Food: 3 stars
I got the Hubert Keller favorite (buffalo, caramelized onions, sauteed spinach, and blue cheese on ciabatta bun with skinny fries. My husband got the American Kobe w/bacon and cheese on ciabatta w/sweet potato fries. We both agreed the burgers were good but nothing particularly outstanding. I ordered mine medium but it came out well done. I didn't complain though since I was hungry and tired and didn't particularly care at the moment as it still tasted good. The fries were fries (i.e. tasty), but nothing special to note...equivalent to The Counter.

Service: 2.5 stars
Slow but friendly -- It took about 30 min. before our burgers came out
I usually don't dock points for slower pace service because it's not a pain point for me when dining out unless I've got somewhere to be afterwards. That said, I would've given 3 stars if they hadn't kept rushing me to finish. I only ate about 1/3 of my burger and stopped for a sec to rest when 3 people came by all within 15 min. to ask if I needed a to-go box or if I was done. I just got my burger, back off!!

Decor/Ambiance: 3 stars
To be honest I thought it was going to be more posh than it was. With the uniforms and branded items for sale (panties, tees, and wifebeaters) it was more gimmicky than I would've expected of a Hubert Keller eatery. It makes me think perhaps Hubert is a fan of establishments like Cheesecake Factory, Hooters, and Hard Rock. The acoustics in that place aren't great either so it gets pretty loud during the rush.
author: Thu S.

description:
Came here on a Friday night around 9pm and the wait wasn't so awful for a party of two -- it took about 20 minutes to get seated and we were placed in a little corner next to the window with a sweet view! I had the peppercorn burger, which I liked, although it was a little plain for being the price that it is. I also had the deep-fried pickles which at the time sounded like a really good idea (I was thinking it would be like jalapeno poppers), but it was pretty disappointing! It really just tasted like pickles in batter, not a miraculous transformation of any sort. I wish I had just stuck with fries, even though they also looked just ho-hum.  Also, just so there are no surprises for you, the portions for the sides are really tiny. I think my boyfriend got like 4 medium sized onion rings as his side. 

One highlight of this experience were the alcoholic milkshakes! I've never had them elsewhere, so I was pretty excited. Albeit, $10 is pretty pricey for receiving such a small portion (it didn't come with that requisite extra bit of milkshake in the mixing cup). However, the mint chocolate shake was pretty tasty, provided that you drink it really quickly! Halfway through my meal, the milkshake was already becoming lukewarm and was getting pretty gross-tasting. 

Service was sub-par, the waiter forgot to bring me back my credit card and I had already left for the grocery store before I realized it. I guess maybe I was irresponsible for not making sure I got it back, but damn, the waiter should have just done his effing job correctly. For the price, the wait and the annoying atmosphere (I mean, its Union Square), I probably won't be back.
author: Ruby H.

description:
I didn't experience the insane wait that everyone else did.  Only about 30 minutes - which was the perfect amount of time to grab a beer and enjoy the great view of Union Square.

Unfortunately things soon took a turn for the worse as we were seated right in front of the cashier's station (where they print bills) and the whole time we had the staff crowding over our table and blabbing as they did their thing. At least the restaurant died down a bit and we were able to move - where we had a lovely view of the Macy's kitchenware department.

My $10 alcoholic milkshake just didn't work.  It was watery and tasted like a decent cocktail, but certainly not a milkshake. The Hubert Keller burger was better than I expected, quite good with an excellent pairing of cheese and other toppings. And the sweet potato fries were actually one of the best I've had, I just wish that there was a better dipping sauce.

Unfortunately the price for two people was around $100 including just one drink (the milkshake). That's a bit ridiculous for a burger and fries per person.

All in all, a decent place - but you're paying fine dining prices for a sports bar atmosphere.  I'm a huge Hubert Keller fan from his appearances on Top Chef,  and I'll give this place another try.  But the prices are a bit hard to swallow.
author: Rishi G.

description:
I have to revise my opinion  of  Burger Bar.  I went and had the chicken breast and it was dry and chewy so that is out.  I went back again and had a bacon burger and the bacon was all fat and limp.  Also I've always gotten good service there but the last time the place was empty and I got crappy service.
 
OK it is a $10 dollar burger. That is before you start piling it on.  But it is a REALLY good burger.  I had a simple blue cheese and bacon burger done medium.  It was great juicy without being bloody or under cooked.  The bun was a little too big for the burger a lot of bread.  Bacon was nice not as crispy as I'd like but all and all taste.  The blue cheese was creamy and rich not too over powering.  I also had a side of onion rings that were nice and crispy.  Not the least bit greasy.  Ice Tea was good and the server was quick to refill it.  All and all a good meal cost about $20 bucks
author: Kevin C.

description:
Delicious. Got the sliders. Really interesting to compare three different types of meats.

The wait can be long, but if you're willing to sit at the bar, it's usually not that bad, if you don't mind slow service. They just opened up, and they're still getting kinks worked out, so that's fine. 

Dessert burger wasn't amazing, but still very good and very interesting. I saw Hubert Keller in the restaurant earlier and I almost wonder if he himself had made that dish, there was an elaborate flourish of some type of red syrup, as well as a little whipped cream mouse.

Very cool.
author: Mark A.

description: Me and my wife were in San Francisco and we decided to try this place since i love burgers. I seen a lot of people giving it 1 or 2 stars because of the service or the long wait. My review is simply on the food, and the food was really good. I had the Kobe Beef burger and my wife had the Buffalo burger and we both loved it. The fries were also good but nothing special. Plus they have Delicious Alcoholic milkshakes!! The place was a tad pricey but I knew that before we ate here. The wait is long on weekends so be prepared or make reservations.
author: daniel g.

description:
I went on a Sunday night.... got into the place on the early side of dinner and had a great table overlooking Union Square.   

The service was great.... helpful, friendly, quick... i had no problems with it as other people have had... based on some of the reviews. 

The wine list was nice... had a great glass of wine with my burger.

Burger was tasty... fresh hand made burger..... very good.  Not amazing, but very good and tasty.

I had the regular slim fries... they were ok.  Not great... not horrible.  

I enjoyed this spot and would go back in a heart beat.
author: David C.

description:
The average review of three stars is correct.  I've been here a few times, including the first weekend it opened.  I had high hopes for this place but sadly BB did not meet my expectations.  

Let's start off by saying I met Hubert Keller who was gracious enough to shake our hands while we were waiting and chatted with us for a while.  He does seem like a genuinely nice guy.  

Onto the food...

The burger in my opinion is too small.  I've had the regular Angus burger and also the Kobe burger.  The kobe is much more flavorful and juicier but not that much more.  The issue and why I am giving it three stars is because the burger is just too small.  If it was bigger it would probably get another half star or full star.  So the burger is small and if you build your own burger it doesn't come with fries, you have to order it.  The sweet potato fries are yummy but the other fries are so so.  When the burger is small, don't put it on a large plate where half the plate is empty.  That doesn't look good; it makes the burger look even smaller.  

Let me just say this, I love burgers.  I have tried to try as many burgers as possible.  I have a delicate stomach so I can't eat at every place but I love burgers.  

I would rather pay a few more dollars and to have the combo of fries and burger than to have to pay separately.  Put some fries on the plate so the burger won't look so small.  

The dessert burger, to be specific, the cheesecake burger with a hint of mint leaves, passionfruit, pineapple, strawberries, that is the best dessert burger there can be.  Just thinking about it makes me want to up this review to 3.5 stars but unfortunately I can't so let's stick with 3 stars.  

Burgers need to be bigger, juicier, and all burgers need to come with some kind of fries.  If that happens and when it does, I will give it four stars.  

I haven't tried the burger with foie gras despite loving foie gras.  I will say that it usually doesn't go together.  I've had it a few times at other places (NY, Vegas, Hong Kong, LA) and the best one was LA because they made it into a cream.  

Will I go back to BB?  Yes I'll go back but mainly for the dessert and the milkshakes which my gf said is one of the best.
author: Pierre L.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect, given all the mixed reviews. I got a chance to go last night and I'm happy to report that I was seated immediately and my server was very attentive. Maybe you just have to go on an off night...

I had the angus beef burger with portobello mushrooms and monterey jack cheese, with a side of sweet potato fries and the peppercorn sauce. The burger and fries were good and given the size of the burger (definitely on the smallish size) the meal itself was filling. I don't really get the point of the peppercorn sauce - it did absolutely nothing for the burger flavor-wise. I didn't bother getting any drinks because I personally could find better ways to spend $13 than on a bottle of Duvel (even though Duvel is delightful). 

Overall, it's a pretty solid burger although it's comparable to the Counter. I would give it another star, except that there's so much hype around this place I would expect it to be better.

Go on an off-night (for a better chance of not standing around for an hour), expect high prices and you should be a-ok.
author: Leilani H.

description:
Three hostesses intently studying a piece of paper. Finally, they look up at me and ask "What can we do for you?" Lunch, I say. Really wanted to add a Homer Simpson "Doh." 

Seated right away. Had to flag down a server to take my order after quite a while. Meanwhile the same guy had passed me three times and was just standing around when I flagged him down. I don't think I was originally his table.

The food arrived and I was underwhelmed. I had the Black Jack Burger cooked medium with Skinny Fries. The burger was medium well to well. The fries were limp. I would have sent it all back if anyone had ever come to check on me. Finally hunger gave in and I ate the somewhat dry burger. By then my water was empty and my waiter nowhere to be seen.  The burger was alright, but no thrilling flavor combination. 

They need to send the fry cook down to Catch Isle in the Westfield Center to learn how to cook fries.

It certainly wasn't worth the $$.
author: Scott R. D.

description:
Stopped in here for dinner with friends on the way to an event.  Wait time was great, given the time of day and number of people in the waiting area.  Our server was personable and fantastic.  
There were actually several errors in our order (missing toppings, things billed but not served) that he corrected quickly and apologetically.  Service was very attentive given the number of people in the restaurant, and the food was delicious - I love the sweet potato fries, and the milkshake was amazing.  Pricey, but worth it.
Stars still deducted because around the table we were missing bacon, cheese, and sprouts from various orders, and things showed up on the bill that had been missing.  Everything was fixed, but 3 errors?
author: T T.

description:
We just got back home and I was busting to write my thoughts down. 

My anticipation was off the scope, in alignment with most of the other gracious yelpers. I know who Hubert Keller is and was ready for a first class, standout memory to be firmly etched in my brain cells forever. 

NOT! 

Not in a good way though. It was not a horrible experience by any means. The experience was just not was I was hoping it was going to be. 

I don't know what it was, if was the afternoon, the building or what...but the restaurant smelled like a Denny's or some other roadside establishment you can only dream of seeing off in the distance after 125 miles without a stop across I-80. Not just the experience one was hoping for after all the hype. You would only imagine that an establishment that was selling itself on "burgers" would smell like grilled meat. Charcoal and burnt fat yes, Dennys...NO! 

I did enjoy the weizen on tap as my wife enjoyed the strong cider on tap as well. She ordered the Turkey burger and I ordered the Black Angus burger. I was hoping the Black Angus would whet my appetite for the Kobe Burger on the next visit. 

The food arrives and the let down started it's trip south. The meat tasted as Black Angus should and was worth the 30 minute wait to get seated. The rest of the meal was not worth the bus fare though. The fries were only warm and nothing out of the ordinary. Additionally, out plates were garnished were another remembrance to roadside eateries across the land...the obligatory lettuce, slice of tomato and slice of onion. Again, hope was over ruled by what one could only perceive as strict business practice, nothing but the normal red ketchup, yellow mustard, salt, pepper and hot sauce on the table. The little TVs were nice the intimacy of the booths really were not conducive to TV viewing as much as they were to conversation. 

The menu was quite interesting I want to point out. You can order from already selected burgers such as the All American, The this and the that. They all come with preselected goodies on them that is exactly what you get. You also have the option to build the burger exactly the way you want it. Your selection of meat, toppings, cheese and bread plus the fries. One heck of a Dagwood burger could be built this way and that is were my wisdom kicked in...stay away and go with the normal everyday selections. 

The price was what a person could expect for this part of town as well as what a person could expect for the meal. We didn't have any complaints as far as the service goes. Very attentive, friendly and helpful. 

Overall a pretty decent experience. I just expected more due to the name and location. I will go again, especially to try the Kobe Beef Burger.
author: Wayne B.

description:
I always come across this place when I'm in Union Square. But I never thought that this place is a cool place to sit down and have a good meal. I always had the intension that it was a five start super expensive burger  place. My co-worker told me to go there and try it out.

I was AMAZED that it was completely different than what I expected. Great portion of food, fair pricing and DELICIOUS. The burgers are made the way you crave it. 

This place is not a must go at least once a month :)

ONE OF MY FAVORITE BURGERS EVER
author: Motaz H.

description: It was very very good - very crowded but lively and the 4 of us ordered custom burgers with many different condiments and the waiter / cooks got the order perfect! will go back.
author: Sara P.

description:
Big deal. Some hotsy totsy chef opens a restaurant in Macys and now its like they have two tourist traps. Too busy at Cheescake Factory? Burger Bar is equally as corny.

If you want to wait in a line to get in an elevator, then pile inside until its over capacity...then spill out of the elevator only to find out the wait may be ten to twenty minutes...(not too bad I guess).....then be seated by a hostess who is so spent and over it that she can barely muster up the energy to smile as she passes you along to someone else who will sit you next to a pole so there literally is NO VIEW...give Burger bar a chance.

The menu is very fancy. I'll give them that. As a Vegetarian its refrshing to see some options on there. As a beer drinker...I will readilly admit that the beer list is amazing. The prices...not so much. I paid 10 dollars for a pint of Unibroe Blanche de Chambly. Thats a bit much.

My veggie burger was good, but certainly not amazing. To be honest, Whiz Burger makes a bigger impact on my taste buds.

What really made me realize that this place was a glorified Cheeze Cake factory was the television monitors playing sports in some of the booths. Where am I Chevy's? Can I have an order of Jalapeno poppers please?

Dont waste your time, unless you want a $65 Kobe burger or some shit like that and you dont care about ambiance or have any pride what so ever.
author: Go Cat Go G.

description:
Came here on opening day and had to leave due to the line being so long and my friend having only an hour for lunch. The next morning I picked up a friend from the airport, and persuaded her into going to BB with me at 9:30 a.m. in the morn...since it was my b-day weekend. We were in and seated as soon as the doors opened at 10 a.m., got to greet Chef Keller, and enjoy our breakfast of champs: burgers. 

I had the Angus burger with prosciutto and jalapeno bacon, Dijon and zucchini. I also had the fat fries which were yummy. 

I do remember the burger being super tasty but small. Fast forward to this past Tues. when I went in again. Same burger, this time it was significantly larger, and more satisfying. 

It's not the greatest, but it sure is a tasty burger, and why not support some as likable as Keller, right? 

I'll definitely be back!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The specialty burgers looked fantastic, but I'm a vegetarian so I was disappointed to find out that you couldn't simply substitute the veggie burger for the meat burger. I decided that I wanted the Hubert Keller burger, so I had to order the veggie burger and add the toppings from the extras menu. That said, it just may have been the best vegetarian burger I've ever had. So good.

The only issue I had with the place is unfortunately a biggie, otherwise this would have been a 4 star review: they charged me $3.25 -- 3.25! -- for a fountain soda! Craaaazeeee. And I didn't even get a refill. Seriously, who do they think they are?

Next time, I'm definitely getting the Vegetarian Hubert Keller burger. And a water.
author: Joshua K.

description:
As burgers go, this is the absolute best in the business.

I've made the pilgrimage to the 6th floor of Macy's twice now, and each time left very satisfied with my meal, even if I was a little light in the pocketbook. The premise of the location is simple and accessible: provide a list of super-high quality ingredients and let the customer build their own custom burger to taste. On my first trip I built a kobe beef burger with blue cheese, bacon, jalapeños, and mushrooms. My second burger was a country farm patty with mushrooms, swiss cheese, and jalapeño bacon. Both were excellent, though the kobe patty was clearly superior in flavor.

Diners B&T were at both excursions, and reported somewhat mixed reviews on the vegetarian patty, but on the second trip B enjoyed his salmon patty and T experimented with the buffalo patty with good results. Much to everyones great envy, B had the foresight to order the peppercorn sauce and it was amazing, I'll be sure to add that to my next burger concoction.

I think the one thing I most like about the burger bar is the ability to make small incremental changes to a base set of taste to discover what appeals to you most. Like, the difference between my first two burgers was relatively small, but the taste differences were large. If it weren't so expensive -- to say nothing of unhealthy -- one could setup a series of fun taste experiments.

To top off the whole experience I recommend getting a milkshake. Both arty and delicious, they are well worth the price to ensure the complete evening. Oh, and be sure to try the beer battered jalapeño pickles at least once.. they are freaking awesome.
author: Sean K.

description:
The View was amazing, a truly coined scene of SF. Wheeeeew glad we got that out of the way. 

° Burger itself was Ok however a bit of worcester sauce, salt, and a ton of pepper is not impressive. 
° They had nearly every extra you would want on a burger, burger bar I get that. 
° The bacon I received seemed deep dried or sun baked, seriously why do I want bacon that has been cooked like a gourmet hippie joint? I want BACON, fried the way its suppose to be.
° The Avocado wasn't amazing 
° The Bun SUCKED seriously!
° Burger Joint Done Medium Stale.

Did I mention the View?
author: Joe G.

description:
Very Yummy Yummy burgers. Its something i would try it once just to see what the big fuzz is all about. 
Came with a group of 4, waited for about 30 min. We each ordered something different so we can have a sample of what it taste like. All the burgers were good. Its very different from what you would normally see at a burger joint of course. Each burger cost around 15-25 dollars. From what I remember I think there was one that was like $60 =) that'll better be some incredible burger. 
The drinks selections looks really tempting. Especially the smoothy =)
There is also another location in Las Vegas at the madalay Bay if you're in the area.
author: Cecilia T.

description:
We were here the Saturday after Thanksgiving.  It was a decent sized party (9) and our original plan was to go to the Cheesecake Factory.  Since CF doesn't take reservations, we were told our wait was going to be 4 hours.  So we went over to Burger Bar instead where we were told the wait was going to be 1 hour.   We were actually seated in less than 30 minutes.  And that maybe should have told us something about what to expect (the place wasn't all that crowded either, like there were still empty tables when we were seated).

So first the positives:
Our server was super friendly.  Not the most attentive of fellows, but he did an adequate job.

And that's about it...

The food was mediocre at best.

I had the Chili in a sourdough bowl and I actually would have preferred a can of Hormel Chili.  At least Hormel Chili has chili spices to it.  This chili just tasted like a southwest-inspired hamburger stew.  It was barely warm.  It had no flavor.  The sourdough was pretty bad too.  I usually expect burger joints to do a decent chili, especially if they use good meat, which this place supposedly does.  But man, the chili was pretty bad...

My cousin got allegedly the hottest burger in the world (they claimed it was a million scoville units and hotter than the jolokia pepper) and even had to sign a waiver for it.  We were all pretty skeptical about it, but wow, the burger was a TOTAL joke.  The only reason my cousin even started to sweat was because he ate the raw habanero pepper that came with it.

My other cousin got a turkey burger that was overdone and dry.  Supposedly because people were complaining that the burgers weren't well done enough.  My two cents, if people don't know how to order a well-done burger, I think that is their problem.  I don't think the restaurant should be pre-emptively making everybody's burgers well-done.

Everything else we had was merely OK, probably two stars.  The reason why this place only gets one star is because of the prices.  I know we are in a touristy area and they can get away with inflated prices, but seriously, the food should at least be decent.   There are plenty of places in SF to get good food at good prices, this just happens to be one of the places where you can get mediocre food at mediocre prices.

There is absolutely no way I am coming back to this place.  I would rather wait the 4 hours for the Cheesecake Factory next time rather than go back to this place.  Or better yet, try another family styled place in the area.
author: David K.

description: Great food. Awful, unfriendly service.  It's got to a point when the service outweighs the food and we've been here many times over the years.
author: Jason S.

description:
As a huge fan of Hubert Keller, I was really disappointed with my experience. I came here on a early Sunday afternoon, hoping to beat the crowds. While waiting for the super slow elevator, Hubert comes rolling in through the double doors. He greets us and heads for the escalator. He either (a) doesn't want to spend the next awkward moments with us in the elevator, or (b) knows better than to the wait for the super slow elevator. For the amount of money spent here, you would think that the decor would be less blah. But blah is about all you're going to get with the white walls, like the one I sat next to when there was huge window display of Union Square to be seen. 

My sister and I weren't too hungry, so we opted to share a kobe beef burger with mushrooms, grilled onions, and a side of sweet potato fries. We also ordered a chocolate milkshake to share as well. The milkshake came in two separate and very small cups. Although cute, about half the cup was filled with cream, a forth filled with chocolate syrup, and the other forth, you get your "milkshake." I overheard this older couple ask the waiter to get the same as us. But the waiter loudly proclaimed, you're getting ripped off if you get those cups and it's not really worth it compared to the individual size. First of all, I did not ask for my drink to be separated and secondly, how rude is it for the waiter to say that so loudly within our perceptual range? 

The food comes separated in two plates, which was appreciated. But it really highlighted how much food you're getting. Overall the burger was lackluster and flavorless. Fries were alright, but I've never met a fry I didn't like. The meal all together cost $40. A bit steep for burger, fries, and milkshake. Would have been $7 at In-N-Out and I would have been happier. At least Hubert smiled at me and for that I am content.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
Well there are better places to go for a burger but since you are reading this its probably becuase you are heading to this place and want to know what to expect upfront..

Elevator to restaurant a cluster because its in Macy's. My recommendation use the escalators for all six floors.

Prompt seating at lunch time. Waitress was friendly enough.

Great view, try to score a window seat if you like people watching and aren't afraid of heights.

As for the food,

1.Great beer selection. You name it they probably have it!

2.Beer batter jalapeno pickles...soggy at arrival. nothing to write home to mom about..(we took these home and threw them into the toaster oven the next day as leftovers and they ended up much better once they were actually crispy)

3. Fat fries..again sorry...only thing i can think is that whoever is frying in the kitchen has no clue what they are doing..

4. 
Burger #1: American Kobe beef with swisscheese, onions, pickles, tomatoes, lettuce on Chibatta med well: This one came out more on the med to rare side.... who the hell is cooking back there, we know it aint mr hubert K back there flippin these things.

Burger #2:Country Natural with cheddar chees, onions pickles, tomatoes and lettuce on sesame seed bun med well: THis one came out more on the well side...again who the hell is cooking back there..Hey HK  that is your name on the restaurant, you might want some people back there who can produce to your expectations and your customers.

I've made better bugers in my backyard, I have no intention of going back.

Again both burgers werent special by any means, they were just ok.  Huge portion size but not worth the pricing. Difference in the beef  also not noticeable and lord knows i have a discerning tongue.( I make a living off of it people :)
author: Sandra M.

description:
I wish I could give a 3 1/2 star rating. Not necessarily an A-OK but I won't be frequent returnee. 

We arrived at 11:30 am way before the lunch rush and glad of it. Had a window seat with a nice relaxing view. 

I ordered the Hubert Keller Burger, the rest of the family custom burgered with either Buffalo or Black Angus. 5 stars for the cooking of the burger. Buffalo is hard to get medium without being dry as a bone. The taste condiments and well prepared. Son and hubby didn't like the chopped jalapenos were sliced - but OK. Ordered the Twinkies shake to share and it was filling. 

So why not 1 1/2 more stars? Service. Ran out of soda and no refills offered. And the price. Over $130 for four with tip is a little pricey for lunch. Enjoyed, will try again for another special occasion.
author: Karen H.

description: This has got to be the worst place ever. I would be embarrassed if I were Chef Keller. First we ordered iced tea. I looked and tasted like it was from the Bay. The we waited 40 minutes for a dried, tasteless turkey burger that was half the size of the bun. The sweet potato fries came out burned and full of grease. All this for $35.00. We asked to speak to the manager, Rick, who then told us that bad service and waiting 40 minutes for a turkey burger was normal. And that the sweet potato fries always come out like that. All we wanted was some new fries and an apology but at that point we paid the check, told him to go to hell, and never looked back. This is the worst hamburger joint, which I use very lightly, EVER!! Avoid this place like the plague!!
author: Lisa B.

description:
I built my own burger - marinated chicken burger with skinny french fries here. Both the burger and fries tasted good. I especially liked the french fries. It was well made. 

On the menu, we saw a burger advertised as the world's spiciest burger for $60. We just asked them for a bit of sauce that they use on that burger to taste and even a small dip of it was so spicy! Wonder who would really pay $$ to eat that kind of spicy burger. I'm not eating it even if they pay me $$.

The ambience of the place is really nice. It gives a nice view of Union Square. It must be one of the cool places to eat when there is some event going on in Union Square.
author: Govind R.

description:
The only draw that enticed me into trying a somewhat pricey burger chain restaurant located in a mid range department store next door to a Cheesecake Factory, was that it is a venture of Hubert Keller.

 I really, really wanted to love my meal and approached Burger Bar with almost excitement. I went for lunch and as I usually eat very light for lunch ordered the Burger Bar Sliders which consisted of a trio of different mini burgers accompanied with a side of skinny fries $12.75. The three sliders were 1.Buffalo with caramelized onions, 2. Angus with plain bacon and 3. Country Natural Beef with American cheese. "All sliders cooked medium. No substitution on temperature or toppings."  All three were very tasty indeed. Not incredible but very tasty. The buffalo had the most delectable flavor and was the juiciest. None of the burgers were cooked medium. The buffalo burger had a hint of pink and the other two were cooked through. All were moist and tender and I do realize that cooking a silver dollar burger medium  takes some extra attention but hey, this is Hubert Keller's place and being so I would expect perfection in the cooking preparation. The fries are a completely different story. Being in a restaurant purveyed by a renowned French chef I was anticipating yummy fries. What I was served were hot and salted perfectly but were dry and tough with only the flavor of the oil they were fried in. Simply put they were atrocious and disappointing.

All in all the 3 mini burgers were very tasty but not incredible and the fries were awful. For $14.75 tax and tip included I expected to be served something  more worthy from Mr. Keller. My first lunch experience left me feeling like Burger Bar is indeed nothing more than another Cheescake Factory type chain restaurant.

I will give Burger Bar another try, order a full size burger and hope for a better culinary experience.
author: Steven B.

description:
We just went tonight and really enjoyed it.   There were still some service issues, but, the guy was very friendly and knocked some of the sides we ordered from the bill.  The country natural beef was extremely good.

I had a medium rare burger with cole slaw, carmelized onion, chipotle aioli, bacon and american cheese.  The burger was perfect and the bacon is very good.  The combination was delicious. 

My husband had natural beef with cheddar cheese, fried egg and bacon.  He ordered it medium, but the burger was cooked medium rare like mine.  Nevertheless, he still enjoyed his burger, and I think next time we're going to try the burger with egg and truffle sauce.  We also ordered skinny fries and sweet potato fries.  Both were good, but not particularly special.  I had hoped they would offer duck fat fries, but that was not on the menu at all.

We split a banana split that was quite good other than that the pineapple was not really ripe and should have been chopped into smaller pieces. The banana with a brulee coating was quite good and an excellent addition to the classic banana split.

The decor is a little bland - the tables and chairs are super generic, and I always thought something by Mssr. Keller would go for a little more flair.  There is a view, but, at night it wasn't really easy to see it especially at night.  

Hubert was dashing around and managing the staff, so, it was fun to see more of Hubert.

I definitely plan on returning - especially since they are open until 2am on Friday and Saturday.
author: Jim K.

description:
No. No. Bad. Bad.

Whatever you do, DO NOT order their over-hyped Vegetarian Burger.  It has the consistency of doughy sludge and absolutely no flavor whatsoever.  I'm still scratching my head figuring out what it might be made from - oatmeal? clay? paste? Something sorta vaguely whitish, that's all I know.

Because the burger thing they served was inedible, I was SO looking forward to the sweet potato fries.  Wrong again.  Soggy and frightfully consisting of the same doughy texture as the burger type thing.

Oh yes, and lets get to the most DEElightful part!  The milkshake! Your glass arrives at the table about 3/4 filled with canned whipped cream with just a smidge of ice cream at the bottom of the glass.  The whole thing tasted like, well, canned whipped cream.

There are far tastier and less expensive neighborhood burger joints in the City - skip this awful place.
author: Lulu C.

description: I stand corrected.  Different day; nothing is the same.  Why?  This type of place should be able to deliver with great consistency.  Burger not cooked as ordered.  Not as flavorful.  Onion rings by-and-large are still excellent except for two of them which were greasy, tough, and inedible, like they were from a batch from yesterday and were just thrown in.  I know I sound insane but it's true!  Again, why?
author: Mike B.

description: Well, it was okay, but very "corporate tasting," if that makes sense. Good view.
author: Daniel F.

description: Pricey burgers that are not worth the price or your time.  But, if you you're looking for a nice atmosphere to dine in with some burgers then I suppose this would be for you.  Cool date spot.  Has a bar.  Can also get alcoholic milkshakes.  You can choose from one of their already put together burgers or make your own burger such that you would pick your own toppings all for a fee.
author: Pink L.

description:
Came on my 21st bday

Boy were they lucky I was too drunk and happy to start complaining about their service. 

We waited for 20 minutes just to get water and for a greeting from our server and over an hour for our meal. Yes, we were a big party but the rest of the restaurant was not packed at all. (was a tuesday night) I think they knew they were getting a tip no matter what (because of the added gratuiuty with a party of 6+) so they decided to give us crappy service. 

The burgers were great, the sweet potato fries and milkshakes were yummy too..A little on the expensive side just for a burger WITHOUT fries. 

Will I come back? Probably only if a friend is having a celebration here but wouldn't go out of my way to get a burger from here.
author: Joy A.

description: Overrated! That's the first thing that comes to my mind when I hear Burger Bar. They have the Rossini Burger which is $60. It is a Kobe beef burger with truffles and foie gras that came with fries and either a shake or a dessert burger. I had a kobe beef burger with bacon jalapeno and provolone cheese with chipotle aioli in a cibatta bun. That was about $30. I personally thought it tasted like a Carl's Jr $6 burger. The shakes were pretty good but pricey, ~$9 for a nutella milk shake with chocolate ice cream. Overall, this is a good place to try out and the food is decent but I will not come back again.
author: Shirley W.

description:
Oy, this place was pretty sucky.  I know we went in late but we chose it because it's got a bit of a late-night bar scene. Apparently, part of that scene includes being TOTALLY ignored by the staff.  Couldn't order, couldn't get a refill, etc.  The waitress came over at one point and gave this long rambling apology about how she thought someone else was taking care of us.  She rambled on for so long and in such a hysterically giggly fashion that I thought maybe she was under the influence of something. And then, after that apology, she continued to ignore us for the rest of the meal.

The burgers were pretty tasty if a little pricey. But I wouldn't be so mad about dropping $100 on fancy burgers for four people if the service had been a little more "upscale" and the bathroom had been a little more "clean."
author: Maggie Z.

description:
I've been here a few times.  Specifically at the bar for a drink or two.  Yesterday I finally had dinner.  

I had the Veggie Burger.  The patty was full and filling.  It was pretty thick in size.  I had the side salad with grilled onions.  The side salad (with balsalmic) was literally field greens with like a drop of dressing, but i was fine with it.  My guy ordered onion rings, which were yum.  They weren't greesy, but even if they were.. onion rings are the bomb.  

I'm sure meat eaters love this place more than i do.  But next time i'd have to try dessert!!
author: Brenda H.

description: I guess the philosophy here is to reduce burger width in favor of increasing burger height. 16$ burgers from a place with 6$ atmosphere and a 10$ view.
author: Mike L.

description: I think I was more impressed by the Twinkie Milkshake than the burgers.
author: Suz L.

description:
I'm another one of those that didn't expect to have a good experience here, but ended up enjoying the meal, the food and the service.First, I had the "natural" burger with green peppercorn sauce and it was delicious used to go to Fleur de Lys a looong time ago and get that sauce on steak and it is as good as I remembered. My burger was a tad undercooked but pretty tasty and I loved the crispy - to my specs- fries. I  also appreciated the right sized sourdough bun - just what a burger in SF should have covering it. Servings are not overly large but really just what you actually can eat and not feel overly stuffed.. 
I expected to have to wait but we were served promptly, efficiently and had a lovely waiter with a big smile. 
Pricier than your average burger place but for the view ,location, and the premium beef, not outrageous. The tourists were digging it and I need to come back and try one of the shakes that look more like sundaes. chocolate whipped cream? Have to say I want to try that.
author: Marie K.

description:
Finally hit Burger Bar last week--the highlights of the evening were the milkshake and seeing Hubert Keller in the dining room.  Note that the highlight of the evening did not include the purported star of this place . . . the burger.

I have to echo some of the sentiments of the other Yelpers--the burgers here are good (except they are shaped in that obnoxious way where you have like half the damn bun left over with no meat).  The problem is that the burgers are pretty much as good as other joints that offers burgers for half the price or less.  I also ordered my burger with sweet potato fries, which were incredibly disappointing.  They were lukewarm and subpar given the "upscale" decor and prices.  

The milkshake, however, was excellent.  Ice cream blended into a shake--can't really mess that up.  If I ever hit Burger Bar again, I would skip the burger and go straight for the shake.
author: Alexis N.

description:
I'm not normally a huge burger fan.  But WOW, it was a super fun and delicious experience!  I got the Hubert Keller burger--with buffalo, spinach, caramelized onions and lots of vavavavoooom!! And the skinny fries that came with it were made and salted just the right amount.  

I would highly recommend this place. Only slight downside was that our service was slightly slow. Not enough to deter me from coming back again.

Oh, and I met Chef Keller too. He was lovely.
author: Kat D.

description:
I had some doubts about Burger Bar but when my friend Lisa wanted to meet after her shopping trip, I suggested this for lunch. I wish I hadn't waited so long, because now I want to try every burger on their menu. I had the Hubert Keller burger, buffalo on ciabatta with blue cheese and caramelized onions. It even had a little bit of sauce in a cream pitcher, and I knew what this was for instantly - buffalo burgers tend to be a bit dry. Alone it was a good burger - but with little drips of the sauce on it, the burger became heavenly. 

Lisa had the $8.75 milkshake. I had the same reaction that John Travolta had in PULP FICTION about $5 milkshakes before he tasted it and after he tasted it. That was a damned good milkshake, as much a work of art (swirled hot fudge in patterns on the glass) as it was a beverage. 

I'll be back, and as soon as one of my friends comes to town on an expense account I'm eating that $60 Kobe beef burger with shaved truffles and foie gras. Count on it.
author: Darren M.

description:
Their burger was delicious especially with the truffle sauce. Not gonna lie, I devoured my burger.

The desert burger was VERY disappointing, bringing my rating down to a 3-star because I'm a girl, and dessert is a HUGE deal to us.

So the burger came out all cute and pretty, but don't judge a book by its cover... the donut was almost stale tasting, not like the fluffy hot kinds you get at a more upscale restaurant like this. The chocolate was really, just a piece of cold chocolate, not melted and doesn't have much flavor. And the passion fruit jelly was too sour. Overall, unimpressive.

We racked up a $38 bill for a SHARED burger, some sweet potato fries and that disappointing dessert... eh. 

Still would go back for that truffle sauce though...
author: Lynn C.

description:
I had a pretty good burger in the one in  las vegas mandalay bay but .SF burger  bar was not that good..HUBERT try teaching your cooks how to cook a burger med rare thats not too hard to do..pretty good milkshakes..
nothing much to write about just another burger joint ...that charges big $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
IS CLOWN ALLY STILL IN BUSINESS..xtra star is for the waitress good job..you tried your best..thanks
author: kobe b.

description:
Now there's a burger bar nearer than Vegas?  Man oh man, things are turning around for ol' Ben!

Like the other two locations, Burger Bar encourages you to build your own burger, bun and all, and then devour it in the most wonderful way possible.  Trust me, if there's not juice falling down your hand as you eat, you're at the wrong restaurant.

Since it's new, the lines are very long, and that may change as the tourist seasons change, but for now, be prepared for a wait.. but if you're lucky, you might get a seat next to the window like we did.  What a view!

Yeah, I'm a fanboy.
author: Ben K.

description:
Burger Bar was so yummy!!  We ordered the yummiest alcoholic shake - mint chocolate shake.  Fantastic.  Our waitress was super friendly, we liked her a lot.  

The burger was cooked perfectly, it fell apart easily on the plate, but I love the idea that you can build your own burger.  Sweet potatoe fries were delicious. The view is great, overlooks Union Square.

I would absolutely recommend this place for a date or fun night with the girls.  The owner (Hubert) was walking around and friendly.
author: Melissa V.

description:
I had pretty high hopes for this place, and was happy that it met expectations.  A note of warning ... if you decide to splurge, it can start adding up pretty fast.   

I ended up with the surf and turf burger and added a fried egg and truffle sauce.  The burger was great, and plenty big enough, and the egg was properly runny.   The bun and fries soaked up the truffle sauce nicely and I would have been fine drinking the whole container like a shot. The only downside was that half of the lobster was tough and chewy.   The dessert burger was overkill at this point, but chocolate and fruit in a warm donut bun was all kinds of awesome.  

I'll definitely be going back - the desserts and beer floats look awfully tempting - but will probably go with the less extravagant burgers.
author: Chung Y.

description:
I should've saved my money and put it to a fund to go towards Fleur De Lys...it's not to say that the burger I had at burger bar was bad in any way...it just wasn't impressive either. It tasted like any burger I could've gotten at a diner. No one at our table was very impressed with their burger. My friend who got the chef's choice wanted her burger to be more compact...she said that the meat in her burger sort of crumbled when she bit into it.

We also ordered the black & white shake and the dessert burger. The shake was amazing, the dessert burger was fun to look at, but the flavors did not work well together, and I would not order it again...more of a gimmick than an actual dessert.
author: Cindy C.

description: Food was good, service was pretty good for the Saturday before Christmas in Union Square.  The ambiance was NOT good in that they were playing music so loudly that you could not have a conversation.  It was loud enough anyway because it was crowded.  I asked the greeter to tell her manager to turn the music down, but that never happened.  Also, if you are going to blast music, it should at least be Christmas or easy listening music.  People in their 50's should not have to be subjected to hip hop or rap music if they don't want to be......With tip we spent $240 for 8 people.  All in all, not a good value considering I am giving the place a two star rating.  The only reason we ended up here was because it was convenient and every other restaurant around Union Square we tried had a long wait.
author: Kristina M.

description:
Hate to do this to Hubert, but I am sure the droves of tourists will keep the place going . If your are in Macy's and are jonesing for a burger, you are better off getting sliders at the cheesecake factory. 

The burger was not bad. The quality of the beef itself was good and they even managed to make it rare.... However, the alleged "skinny fries", were everyday fries that came straight out of the freezer bag. The bun was pretty dense. The atmosphere was Planet Hollywood on family night.

I did spot some thicker and better looking fries on another table.

I got a dirty martini in a regular glass and it came warm. Warm $12 martini, no good. When I asked super nicely if they would mind making me a new one cold and putting it in a martini glass, they blamed me for getting it in a regular glass. They brought me a new one when we were already done eating.

My position is that if you call yourself burger bar and you are owned by a pretty well known French chef, then you better rock the burger and fries.

I have to say that I wasnt a fan of Fleur de Lys either. At the expense of sounding like a food snob, I think Hubert caters to the out of town anniversary/birthday crowd that says, "oh look at this, this looks interesting".. When the tuna tartare tower shows up at their table and who put one pinky up when they sip their rosé.

I read this and cringe at myself, but with the amount of great food that we have in this city, there is just no need to eat here and in this economy, $60 + tip for a burger dinner for two, better be good.
author: Claudia O.

description:
The girl treated me to lunch here this past weekend, so keep in mind that I have no bias regarding the priceyness of this place, other than to assume it is fairly spendy.
First, they have booze-filled milkshakes.  This is a great concept, and I don't know why more restaurants haven't thought of it.
Pretty solid beer list as well, though serving every beer in its own branded glass is a little cheesy.  The Belgian ale I had came with its own little wooden support thing.  Novel for the first sip, but just give me a pint glass and I'll be fine.
You can build your own burger or get one pre-made.  We both opted for the build your own.  She got Kobe with cheddar and onions on an onion roll, I got the Angus with provolone and jalapenos on ciabatta.  Both medium rare.  The bun selection turned out to be important, as mine held up to the juiciness of the burger, but hers didn't.  Both burgers were very good, though.  Quality meat, perfectly cooked, very juicy, as I just said.
We also got an order of the deep fried pickles, which were outstanding (though I swear the menu said 'deep fried pickled jalapenos'..eh).    
Our waitress was friendly and helpful, 5 stars for the service.
Overall, if someone else is paying, this is a 5 star place.  However, I saw the prices on the menu, and it's pretty spendy.  I think my 2 beers alone were around $25.  That being said, it's a great burger place with the added bonus of booze-filled milkshakes.  A solid four stars, more if you're on someone else's dime.
author: Ken V.

description: I know giving a restaurant 5 stars before it's even opened is very premature, but after going to their mock dinner tonight, they brought my 5 star experience from Vegas (http://www.yelp.com/biz/burger-bar-las-vegas#hrid:y_RcyFVtRBHNxT1MxB8uGg) back home to the Bay Area.  Sans the Kobe beef and dessert burgers of course.  There was only a limited menu to choose from since it was a soft opening, but they still had a nice selection of toppings for your burger.
