I ordered the Angus Beef burger with Aioli, Peppered Bacon, Provolone Cheese, and Portobello Mushrooms in a Ciabatta Bun (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tjn-0kb7M6DQmaLsQIxO7Q?select=pDoRoPzBxHgOWtWbcZr-Bw).  It may look small on the pic but believe me, it was huge and so good!  Our service was great and we got greeted by the manager a few times.  He's a cool guy!  I'm actually looking forward to going back here again to try the Hubert Keller Burger, their famed Blackjack Burger, the Surf & Turf Burger ,and the Veggie Burger, and maybe, the $60 Rossini.  So far, so good.  See you soon Burger Bar!  I'll BE BACK!!
author: Rodney H.

description:
I heart Hubert Keller.  But I definitely do not heart Burger Bar.

He didn't really adapt the restaurant for SF (we didn't enjoy the space at all).  The food was nothing special and is completely overpriced for what it is.

It'll take a lot to get me back in those doors.
author: Alyssa W.

description: not to bad having to wait for a seat. but once we left we realized the waitress charged us the amount of our bill. we called the restaurant to get it fixed and they charged us a 2nd time. still for the same amount. they also did the same to my sisters tab and she was charged double. we went back into the restaurant & spoke with the general manager and he says "this happens all the time" & was laughing at the situation. overall we were out of $300 & there is nothing he can do on his end. he says he voided the transaction, so we will see monday morning. not helpful what so ever. i will never go back.
author: Erica L.

description:
I expected a lot from Burger Bar and yet again I was disappointed. The hubz and I went to Burger Bar for lunch on Saturday and left there feeling taken after spending $55 dollars on two burgers, no appetizers and no drinks. I customized my burger with American cheese, caramalized onions, jalapeno bacon, and chipolte aioli on a Ciabatta bun with zuchini fries. The hubz got the American Kobe burger with steak fries. 

Service: Our server looked like she was going  teach a class at the gym with a red headband on her forehead. I get that we all have bad hair days but at a "fancy" burger place do not come at me like you are working at the diner off the freeway. Her attitude was rushed and far from nice. On a plus note it was nice to see Hubert Keller there and very involved....it says a lot about him and his caring for this restaurant.

Decor: Eh I expected more it looked like a nice dive bar/upscale fast food restaurant...the direct TV in the booths did seem different but who wants to watch TV when they are out...

Food: It was really not that great I can make a better burger at home given the ingredients, personally we have had better burgers at Cheescake Factory. My burger was not cooked to the right temperature I asked for it to be medium and it was more well done, my husband enjoyed his Kobe but kept saying that he expected it to taste better.

Overall Experience: I am not sure that we would come back especially after getting such a high bill for two burgers that really did not knock our socks off....we have had burgers many places..hell my husband even ordered a burger at Spago's (which he said tasted better than this) and this did not live up to the hype. I would rather go to Pearl's deluxe and get better service and better atmosphere than come back here again.
author: T H.

description: At first I thought it was gonna be a great experience. The matrone d hooked me up with a seat up front with little to no wait time. I had the Hueber Keller burger and i would have to say he lived up to his name. Great burger however the customer service was so so. Ive had better customer service at Burger king and that's to be expected because there not charging me 50 bucks for food. Could have been an off night but i would spend my money elsewhere for a burger.
author: Jc W.

description:
I was dying to check out this venue since I heard so much about it.  I think it's amazing that they were able to build a restaurant here in a retail space.  The venue is bigger then I expected and 2 less hours of wait then Cheesecake Factory during the week between Christmas & New Years.  
Service was adequate, prices are avg-high.  I had the sliders and brown cow milkshake.  Both were average, no WoW factor but I must say I would come back for convenience.
author: Meredith K.

description:
I stepped in here right before the lunch crowd was about to hit.  I sat at the bar and ordered a pint of ... some beer (i forgot) and ordered the Hubert Keller Burger and some zucchini fries.

Unfortunately, the dude at the bartender messed up on the zucchini fries and gave me regular fries.  However, I wasn't angry at all, since I fully understood that this was their first day with the restaurant.  He was even nice enough to fill up my beer (I guess that counts as a comp), and didn't charge me for the fries.

I couldn't find the heart to get angry at all at the guy, since he was pretty much the only guy running around at the bar.  And he was serving everyone else at the same time.  I had to double-tip him out of pity, and wished him good luck for the rest of the day.

So everyone, please check yourself at the door and remember that these guys are still learning, so please be patient!  You will definitely get rewarded with great food (the Hubert Keller burger was the bomb) and great service along the way.
author: Ren L.

description: Over rated, over price but great view. Unless chief Keller is there don't expect the food to look or taste like the menu description.  You can save alot of money, get more bang for your buck if you eat at BJs Restaurant.
author: Cee B.

description:
One star for the man himself approaching our table as we were leaving and shaking my hand. Minus the other four for his creation "SF Burger Bar", the hype that led up to its opening, the sub par experience and the Fat Tire neon sign and Macy's linen department I stared at while dining.

The sliders were okay, I've had better. What I'm opposed to is the audacity to have such expensive fare and hyped up hype over nothing more than Red Robin decor and sitting among bath towels on Costco furniture.

The swanky music on the website didn't lead me to think I was going to the department I'd normally go to source 1000tc sheets. I believed I was headed to a plush lounge with loungy music. I believed I was headed to upscale meets easily obtainable food aka burgers. That's the gimmick right? Unexpected food in an unexpected environment. Common' Mr. Keller you can do better. But thank you sir for escorting us out, that was very nice of you.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Burger Bar.  Catchy name, located on top of the Macy's building........hmmm, let's check it out.

A lady friend of mine was turning 31, so she says, and decided she wanted to have her party at Burger Bar.  We arrived, the table for 14 was all set and ready for us, and the server, who was easy on the eyes, was ushering out water as soon as we were seated.  Reviewing the menu didn't take long, as they a build-your-own-burger option, and about half six or seven chef's creations.  I'm not trained in beef science, so I truly don't know the difference between black angus, kobe, or buffalo, but the choices are there for those who are beef divas.  I got a black angus burger, known as the Black Jack.  My choice was based more on the toppings accompanying, rather than the type of beef.  It was served on ciabatta (I do love ciabatta), with pesto, olive tapenade, jack cheese, and tomato.  But let me tell you, I should have ordered a pitcher of water with it.  That burger, which I had cooked medium-rare, was so dry, that a photo of it would be placed in the wikipedia entry under Mojave Desert.  So, they may not shine in the core product, however, the skinny fries, which come with each of the chef's burgers, are excellent!  They were crisp, and salted just right, yummo!  I tore those fries up!!!!!  Can we get a standing ovation for the skinny fries!  At my table were 13 others, and their commentary was similar to mine, and they weren't thrilled about the high price tag attached to the burgers.  

In an nutshell, their pricey burgers aren't something worthy of my to-do-before-I-die list, but their staff was pleasant to deal with, and they're not overwhelmed with long wait queues, like the other popular restaurant on the opposite side of the Macy's building.
author: Damon Z.

description:
Where else do you go for a fine dining experience in San Francisco but Macys?

The burgers at Burger Bar are fantastic! 

Be prepared to wait though.     It took over an hour to seat our party of seven on a Friday night - which one can expect.  And then another hour for food to actually appear on our table - which is a bit unexpected for a place that features a $60 burger called the Rossini (Kobe beef, foie gras, shaved truffles, etc, etc).    My Hubert Keller buffalo burger was a comparative steal at $22.

The room is modern and many of the tables overlook Union Square from 6 floors up, which is quite nice.

I'm sure I'll come back for more, although probably on a weeknight.
author: Peter G.

description:
I've been wanting to go to Burger Bar ever since I've seen it in Vegas. I finally got a chance to try it.  Me and my gf went there on a Friday, it wasn't busy when we got there, only part that was busy was th e bar.  

We had to wait for 15 minutes, I don't know why.  When we got a table half of the restaurant was empty, but they sat us near the restrooms and where this huge plant that made sit way into the table.  Yes, there's other tables they could of put us.  

The burgers, I had the Huber keller favorite, buffalo burger with blue cheese and grilled onions with slim fries.  GF had the cheese burger with fried zucchini.  Blue cheese over powered the burger, but that's ok, the fries were good.  Her burger was good too, but the zucchini was way over battered and didn't taste right.  The meat of the burgers are really good tho.

Service was ok, they didn't come around much. 

For the money you can go other burger good burger places like Big Mouth and Bull's Head.  They have just as good burgers.
author: Peter L.

description:
Cheryl E.
I have been to the burger bar twice.  The first time I had the Angus Burger and it was okay.  Service was awful they charged my friend $110 for a burger and fries.  The second time 1/18/11 I had dinner and tried the chicken sandwich which gave me food poisening and made me sick for three days.  I would not recommend the chicken sandwich.
author: benjamin p.

description:
I've been here twice now, and both times have been very good. While you can definitely rack up a bill with a custom burger, it's really easy to keep things reasonable. If you order the sliders, you get 3 bite-size burgers: buffalo, angus and country beef. All three are on a plain bun and come with a side of fries. If you don't have a huge appetite this is the perfect serving size for you. And you can't go wrong with the price -- under $13. Who can argue with that? 

I will go back, and continue to order the sliders. And for the record, I have been there for lunch and dinner without having to wait a long time. I felt the waitstaff was just fine as well. 

Don't miss out on this place, it's not Fleur de Lys but they have a lot to offer.
author: Lori M.

description:
We got there after 8pm. Not really busy. First got seated in the bar area under a air conditioned table which was blowing pretty strong. After a couple of mins we had to change seats cuz it was getting to cold and want to the back. 
Got seated next to the window which was cool, but after bout 15 mins the lights want out. Asked if it was going to get turned back on and waiter said he would check but never came back n the lights never turned back on!! 

My girlfriend had 2 different Grey Goose drinks, but said there wasn't much alcohol in it. $10 bucks each!! 
I had the $10 dollar milkshake, that wasn't to bad.

Had the black angus beef burger (med rare with swiss, bacon and portobello mushroom). Let me just say my burger was DRY!!

My friend had the buffalo burger. Not sure what he had on it besides the jalapeno bacon which he said had a kick to it. 

Sweet potato fries.... thumbs down

The vegas one i would have to say is alittle bit better, but is still hit or miss as well!!

Would we ever go back to this location?? NO
author: Doris L.

description: The burger was okay, I mean you really just pay for the place your in not the food. Service was slow, and over all not really a good experience.
author: Kent P.

description: Burger Bar is okay I came here on a date. There's never hella people eating here so I guess there's a reason why =/. I wasn't really hungry so I ordered the sliders which came with 3 different patties aka buffalo, angus, and country natural beef. I think the buffalo was the best. Their sweet potato fries are good. My date got the Peppercorn burger and it was pretty good. I regret not getting their signature burgers.....I did want to try to Hubert Keller burger....if only I was hungry! All in all, Burger bar is just a "fancy burger joint" with average burgers for a pricey fare.
author: Diane L.

description:
I came here for lunch with some coworkers today.  Since I have never been to any of Hubert Keller's restaurants, I had no idea what to expect.  After reading so many mixed reviews of the Burger Bar, I am glad that I had a pretty good first experience.

i actually tried to make a reservation for our party of 8 but was told that they only take reservations for parties of 13 or more.  They did assure me that there will be plenty of tables to accommodate our party and true to their word, we were seated promptly upon our arrival.

The infinite number of burger combinations was too overwhelming for me so I ended up ordering the Burger Bar Sliders.  The buffalo with caramelized onions was definitely my favorite.  I've never had buffalo meat before until today and knowing how lean it is, I half-expected it to be dry but contrarily, it was was moist and juicy.  The Angus beef with bacon was pretty good too but the Country Natural beef was nothing special at all.  I subbed the skinny fries with sweet potato fries and those were pretty yummy ~ not greasy at all.

Most of the people in my party seemed to enjoy their burgers as well, with the exception of one person who ordered the Chef's Veggie Burger (with lentils, peas, brown and white rice, etc...doesn't sound appetizing at all).  But then again, who would expect that to be good?  If you are a vegetarian/vegan, then you are probably better off with the Vegas Vegan (with grilled zucchini, eggplant, tomato and peppers sandwiched between two portabella mushrooms), as another coworker who ordered it said it was delish.

For dessert, we shared the Milkshake Sampler Paddle, which consisted of two chocolate, two coffee and two strawberry shakes.  I had the coffee one, which was really yummy.  I tried it before mixing in the caramel on the side and the chocolate syrup in the bottom of the glass and liked it better without them as it made the shake too thick.

Overall, pretty good meal.  Service was okay...nothing spectacular.  Expect to pay around $15 or so for a burger.  For those who have the money to splurge, you can try the Rossini for $60 which has Kobe beef with foie gras and shaved truffles.  I would love to come back for their buffalo burger and to try their chocolate burger as well.  If you are a burger lover, you should definitely check this place out.
author: Katelynn L.

description:
Waited to get my burger - 30 min. By that time I finished my first beer. Tried to get second beer for another 20 min, by that time I finished my burger. The burger was good, I had low carb one ( $16 btw ).
Overall-  crowded ( which is ok for a burger place inside of Macy's) , loud, overpriced ( shouldn't be considering the service ), underserved
( the owner is cutting corners on employees, obviously). 
$70 with tips for 2 burgers ( one was with lobster, so-so) , 2 beers and tomato juice. Definitely, not coming back.
author: Tatiana G.

description:
Where do they get the people who work at this place? The owner must have said lets round up all the jerks in SF and we will hire them!!!

First time I went service was was bad but the food was good, then I went back again and now both suck. I ordered a medium rare and they brought me a uncooked burger. 

Great idea but the place sucks, the owner should be embarrassed. My recommendation would fire everyone and start over again.
author: Tyler D.

description:
I was really excited for the Burger Bar to open, that I decided to check it out on their first official day. Normally not a great idea as most restaurants are still figuring out the "kinks" ....but all in all I think they did a great job on day #1!

The place was packed, and the staff seemed a little nervous but they were all definitely service oriented and trying to do the best they could on day #1. 

I ordered the Sliders and have to say some of the best sliders I've ever had! Would be more fun if you could build your own sliders so that you can try more variety but I was definitely happy with my order. 

Also fun bonus that Hubert Keller was there, passing out free shakes and seemed like the same nice guy that was on Top Chef Masters. Super friendly and more than willing to take pictures with anyone that would ask.

I will definitely go back, even though I HATE going to Union Square~
author: Wendy W.

description: At this price point, I expect everything perfect.  I came on a Thursday, at 6pm and it was pretty slow. First strike, I went to order an ice tea and was told they ran out. Huh??? How do you run out??? Can't you make more??? I then perused the menu and noticed that most of the toppings (other than lettuce, pickle, onion, tomato) are extra. Really?? So cheese is extra...grilled onions extra, bacon extra...different sauces are extra.Anyway, I got the Kobe beef patty for 16 dollars and it was OK - nothing mind blowing.  I got the skinny fries (which aren't fresh cut) and onion rings. The fries were expensive (3.75 for a side) and you don't get  a lot. As mentioned, they aren't fresh cut (like In N Out for example) and they were old to boot.  Again, at this price point, I expect perfection. I had to send them back. The onion rings were good and  hand battered I believe. Expensive though. Total bill for fries, onion ring, soda, and burger -28 dollars.  I could have gone to the Nordstrom Cafe, ordered my usual steak sandwich, had an apettizer, and dessert for about the same price.
author: d h.

description:
when we decided to eat here, i had low expectations.  being in macys, i assumed burger bar would be touristy with mediocre food at best.

well was i surprised!  we shared a burger with blue cheese and aioli on sourdough, a small cobb salad, and an order of half zucchini fries and half skinny fries.  the burger was cooked exactly to medium rare, as requested, with a good amount of blue cheese and a nice little cup of aioli on the side.  the salad wasn't anything special but was still good.  the fries...well, they were pretty average fries.  the zucchini fries were larger wedges of zucchini than i expected but was a good size to retain some crisp and the skinny fries were pretty average.  service was excellent.

all in all, i was happy with the experience and it wasn't super overpriced like i had expected.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I was excited that they opened a location in SF because I passed by the one in Vegas but didn't get to try it.

Food...
I had an Angus Beef +Swiss+Caramelized Onion+Sweet Potato fries.
It was about $15 (if you are not getting foie gras or black truffles or kobe beef) for a burger that doesn't taste very different than other ones I had.  The meat looked like a meat ball on the bun that is 2 times big.   The meat was juicy and taste great but I'm not sure if the burger worths the price.  After lunch, I asked myself if  I'd rather have In-and-out ~$5 or pay three times more for a burger at Burger Bar. I can't decide yet so I might give it a second chance.

Environment...
I was kind of disappointed that they are so stingy on the deco.  It definitely looks just like a regular burger place with full bar and a nice view of Union Square, which makes me wonder how much I paid was for the location/view.

Parking...
I spent $7 for parking... that's almost half of the burger...
author: D C.

description:
Gourmet burgers? Sure, why not? $20+ for a burger, on average? Well, OK, maybe just this once.

Seeing as there are only three locations in the US, and since we were already here, we dipped into here based on the recommendations of our local friends.

My suggestion, come here only if you know you're going to spend a bit on burgers, but know that the quality of beef is good, Oh, and if you're into beer, there is an amazing selection to choose from.
author: Vanessa A.

description:
Went with 2 friends last night, Saturday, walked right in at 7:15.

We had a great view of union square and were able to watch the Temple of Poi performance while we ate.

The burgers are the stars, I had a sustainable beef, with jalapeno bacon, peppercorn sauce and sautéed onions.  Fantastic.  The onion rings and fries are good, but honestly, nothing great. The burger was cooked just right and really can fill that spot when you want a big juicy burger.

Save room for dessert and get the "irish coffee" which is a adult milk shake. 

The service is corporate and sterile, and a little bridge and tunnel.  Probably best to go mid week to avoid the tourists.  It's not cheap but I felt that it was worth it.
author: Ken p.

description: For a place that charges what Burger Bar does, you'd expect the food to be excellent but this place only has above average burgers. Nice views of Union Square but the service isn't the best and the place is always slammed with tourists.
author: James K.

description: If you're Jones-ing for soem carne - you won't do wrong here. Nice juicy burgers with all the trimmings. Kobe was fantastic and super tasty. Get it any way you want - but get it!
author: Steve M.

description:
My gf suggested going there since she heard about it on, View from the Bay.  The menu is fairly simple, choose a meat burger or a veggie/turkey or desert burger.  You really can't go wrong.  They have this $60 Kobe beef with froie gras and truffle burger that sounded delicious but also a heart attack waiting to happen.  So, on that note, I ordered the Grilled Shrimp Salad.  Was that a faux pas?  Oh well, whatever.  My gf ordered the sliders w/steak fries and a side order of sweet potato fries.  

First off, I love sweet potato fries and when I asked my gf if she did, she said yes with such enthusiasm that I had to get a separate side order hence the two different types of fries.  

The 3 sliders were all different.  
1.  Buffalo w/carmalized onions
2.  Angus w/bacon
3.  Country natural beef with American cheese
I had the Angus slider w/bacon and my gf had the other two.  She said she couldn't tell which one was buffalo just by taste.  I guess that's a good thing.  They weren't awesome and they weren't bad.  

The grilled shrimp salad was sooo yummy.  Actually, the salad was mediocre, but the shrimp was what made the salad.  I normally will pass on shrimp because of the cholesterol but since I was sharing I thought, who cares?  I'm so glad I got it.  It was the one thing, ironically, at the Burger Bar that made the meal.  The sweet potato fries were good.  They were cut shoe string which I love but nowadays you can get that almost anywhere.  

With all of the choices to eat downtown I probably won't come back here again unless a friend really wants to go.  Oh, and the view is pretty good but you have to be sitting at the right table to enjoy it.  We weren't.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
I really want to give Burger Bar more stars, but they weren't that impressive, except for the awesome view.  

When we first walked in, we were greeted by this tired and sad looking hostess.  She had no smile, no personality and looked very annoyed.  

Our waitress was ok.  We had to flag her down through out our meal.  It was obvious that our drinks needed refills and she was able to see it from where she was standing while chatting with other wait staffs.  She was however, good at explaining the menu .

The burgers were better at In-&-Out and Teddy's Bigger Burger in Hawaii.  My husband ordered the Baffulo burger and I ordered the cheeseburger with additional condiments that costs extra money.  I was tempted to add truffle to my burger, but didn't want to spend the extra $65.  Overall, it was ok but not Hubert Keller great.
author: Chris R.

description:
Yummy.  Went for lunch.  I suggest going before noon... no wait.  There was a line of at least 20 when I left.  

I wanted the Hubert Keller Burger (buffalo meat, caramelized onions, spinach, and blue cheese on a ciabatta bun), but I didn't want to pay $22 for it.  I asked to substitute the meat, they said no, so I ordered a Country Natural burger with caramelized onions, spinach, and blue cheese on a ciabatta bun ($13).  It's a great combo... reminds me of the Father's Office burger  in LA, but not as good.  I ordered it medium-rare, but it came out closer to medium... but still a really good burger.  The skinny fries tasted pretty average.
author: Todd K.

description:
I must say, I had quite possibly the best experience I could've asked for at a restaurant during my trip to Burger Bar.  I have no problem giving the 5 stars in this case--if I could, I would give more.

First, after being told there would be a 40 minute wait (and happily choosing to wait because we got the opportunity to shop a bit in the meantime), we came back after about 20 minutes to check in. Although we were still pretty far down on the list, the maitre d' just bumped us to the top and sat us immediately (what luck).

The place was super busy (I think it was a Friday night or something) and although we managed to get our drinks promptly (two Speakeasy "Burger Bar" Blondes--which, by the way, are quite good), the food took quite a while.  Our waiter, however, was amazing.  You could tell that he was extremely busy--he was sort of frantically running around--but never failed to check up on us.

After the food finally arrived, it was worth the wait.  Everything was just simple, fresh, and impeccably well thought-out.  I had the sliders and fries while my boyfriend had the country natural burger.   Even though the meals are simple, the food just tastes good.  It's the combination of great meat, freshly baked buns, and fresh veggies.  And to top it off, everything is pretty reasonably priced.

But here's the icing on the cake:  during various parts of our dinner, Hubert Keller was walking around to all the tables and asking the patrons how their meals were.  He seemed to truly have cared about the service and everyone's satisfaction regarding the food.  He even agreed to a few photo-ops from other customers, and didn't seem even remotely perturbed, nor did he try to run off (though he appeared to be busy as well).  It isn't every day that you get to eat an amazing meal and then have the opportunity to meet the chef, who has become sort of a celebrity because of his appearance on Top Chef.  It was amazing.  I could not have asked for a better experience.
author: Lauren W.

description:
THIS REVIEW IS FOR RENTING OUT THE PRIVATE ROOM FOR OUR WEDDING REHEARSAL DINNER IN APRIL:
We spoke often with elizabeth conrad to organize the burger bar to hold our event.  there were many times we were given incorrect information that we would find out later (like price per person).  It was a hassle to get all this situated, but Matt the manager and the chef worked with us to get a menu that we wanted.  In the end the event was a nice venue and our guests were happy.  
many of the burgers were rare when brought out which could of been a huge disaster but the staff and cooks quickly took all these burgers back and brought out fresh well cooked ones within 15 minutes or so.  It was a small inconvience for such a fun venue.
author: Natalia E.

description:
Hubert Keller's brand as a chef is clearly expanding, as seen by the huge amount of people which crammed into his latest venture, Burger Bar SF.  On a Thursday evening, the place was packed with a 45 min+ wait.  Tables are cramped, it's fairly noisy, and it's just kind of sensory overload at this point.  None of this is really surprising, but it's worth stating.

The Burger Bar is terribly named.  The logo is terrible.  The font faces throughout the menus are hideous.  The photos which the Burger Bar team use for promotional purposes seem about 20 years out of date.   The photo of Keller on a motorcycle drinking a milkshake.. well.. let's just say that HK isn't too concerned about being taken seriously anymore.  (To be fair, he's pretty much the nicest guy in the world - we met him at Fluer De Lys a few months before the whole Top Chef Masters madness).

The burger selection and selection of condiments  is quite impressive (in addition to a sizable beer/wine menu), although the basic menu seems like it could be designed in a much simpler format. It's so incredibly busy.    I went for the buffalo burger w/ avocado, sprouts, and peppered bacon w/ a vanilla milkshake.   The portions are fairly large, and the burgers are so large that keeping them together is a definite problem.  Everything tasted quite good, and afterwards, I was in a definite meat coma.

Two people.  Burgers, milkshakes, one beer, 70 bucks pre-tip.  Expensive burger meal, no doubt, but that's to be expected.  You can even go big and get the $60 Kobe burger w/ foie gras and truffles.  Oy. I like the concept of the Burger Bar, I just don't really like how it was executed.
author: chris c.

description:
On a saturday evening we thought the wait was going to be crazy but for 2 of us it was only about 10 minutes. The menu wasn't anything too exciting, except the shake options w/ liquor choices - those were very tempting and delicious looking! 
I had whatever the most basic burger was and it was huge. We split some regular skinny fries which was just ok. It hit the spot as we were both hungover, had shopped all day and were beat and in need of something greasy and tasty. But, i have no desire to go back to spend $25 on a burger/fry meal. We both suggested buying our own bottle kahlua then going around the corner to BK to get a burger, fries and milkshake and make our own special shake for a quarter of the price. We probably should have. It was just ok I think.
author: Audrey V.

description:
For you ADHD types who can't read more than a sentence, I'll get this out of the way- the burger at Nopa tastes much better.

I figured I'd check out the quality of their simplest burger offering and  tried the basic no-frills grain fed Black Angus Beef burger.

The burger came out cooked to order on an onion bun (you get several choices, including standard issue burger bun and ciabatta, just like at Jack in the Box...) with the optional blue cheese that I added. The onion bun had a nice, sweet, buttery taste with good spongy texture. The accompanying dill pickle slice had a nice tart briny taste to it and was nice and crunchy. The tomato, red onion slices and lettuce were good quality and tasted nice and fresh.

The big letdown came in the form of the beef patty. It's probably better than what's in 90%+ of the burgers you encounter in the City, but it wasn't anything special. The patty itself was nice, juicy and thick, around 1/2 inch thick. Unfortunately, the patty was pretty bland. Perhaps chef Keller doesn't believe in over-seasoning the beef in the patty, but it really could have used something stupidly simple like salt to improve the taste.

I suppose the "flavor" gets introduced in the $12+ signature burgers via the additional sauces and toppings.

In contrast, the grass fed burgers at Nopa (which currently costs $13, and includes fries) do not require ketchup or A1 steak sauce to taste good. Nor salt for that matter. Incidentally, Burger Bar provides those condiments along with good old yellow mustard. It's a bit of a shame that no attempt is made to serve up house versions of those condiments. Maybe it's cost control, but it would be nice to eat the gourmet burgers without using typical foodservice condiments from Heinz and Kraft. To be fair, I asked for aioli for my fries and I was pleasantly surprised that I had a choice of garlic and chipotle.

The skinny fries (ordered separately, not included in burger) were good, although they could have been a lot hotter temperature-wise.

The onion rings (ordered separately, like fries) were quite good. Surprisingly so. In fact, I'd come back to this place just for the rings. The fat onion rings had an awesome panko breading batter that had a very nice crunch when you bit into them, the oniony innards releasing tendrils of steam.

The rings and fries were both expertly fried with good quality frying oil. Not a soggy fry or ring in sight. Kudos to the cook manning the fry station!

I also tried the Caesar salad. Nicely executed. Good quality chilled romaine lettuce was tossed in a creamy dressing with a hint(?) of anchovies. The shaved parmesan added a nice kick to the salad. The wafer thin crouton slices added a nice crunchy contrast to the lettuce. I was surprised that the server didn't offer freshly ground pepper for the salad, but then again, it really didn't need it.

I was eyeing a milkshakes and/or desert burger but the preceding burger, salad, and rings did me in. Perhaps next time.

Both bottled and draft beer lineup was decent, with a good selection of micro and macro brews. Wine list? Yeah, they have that too, but I couldn't be bothered. Their full bar is a nice feature for a place located in a prime location on Union Square. The Red Bull logo'd cooler in the bar kinda tells you who the targeted demographic is for the restaurant.

Service in general was efficient. The front of house hostesses were okay, going through the motions. They did their best to manage the quiet chaos in the front lobby. They could have been work release workers from Cheesecake Gulag Factory for all I knew.

Burger Bar provides a decent dining alternative in Union Square to the madhouse cum tourist trap and formulaic corporate restaurant known as Cheesecake Factory. Oh hang on, Burger Bar is a formulaic corporate... At any rate, after a long day of shopping, you're probably going to get a table at Burger Bar in the time you manage to get one of those buzzer gizmos at Cheesecake Factory that starts your long-ass wait.

Oh, and I managed to get a dinner and a show on the night I went. Chef Keller was chatting up with guests and mugging for photos with starstruck diners. Bah. Gimme a break. I wished chef was in the kitchen checking on my burger before it was served to me. One can dream, eh? Maybe I'll get that pleasure when I visit Fleur de Lys, if he's actually there...
author: Bono B.

description: I like to take out of town visitors to this place. The location is good to take a walk around downtown SF after the meal. The view is nice and the environment is laid back and fun. The fries are delicious!
author: Mildred R.

description: Hubert Keller should be ashamed to have his name attached to this place. I've been to both the Burger Bar in Las Vegas and Fleur de Lys and both places were excellent. This place? Not so much. My brother had to return his burger twice cuz it was wasn't cooked medium rare but more on the medium well side.  I ordered mine medium rare also but it was medium.  If you are called Burger Bar and paying 15 and up for a burger, this is unacceptable. Also, I almost spit out my water when I saw that a Guinness pint was 8 bucks.  Must have special nitrogen in the tap or something.  This place definitely caters to the SF tourist crowd and probably does great business because of that.  Don't think I will be coming back anytime soon.
author: Brian A.

description: While the burger meat itself is not very impressive, I thought the menu options were. I loved how there are so many varieties to a simple burger! I ordered a Surf-N-Turf burger with a side of pan-seared foie gras and fat French fries, and I enjoyed every little bit of it. The strawberry milkshake I ordered along with my meal was also quite scrumptious. The milkshake presentation itself looked fabulous! I definitely want to go back in the future - I'm dying to try their banana split sundae!
author: Erica J.

description: I loved dining at Hubert Keller's Fleur de Lys, so I was really looking forward to trying his Burger Bar.  It was conveniently located inside the huge Macy's at Union Square.  At 6:00 P.M., my friend and I only had to wait 5 minutes before being seated in the bar area.  We had a great view of the Christmas tree, ice skaters, and holiday lights outside, but it was dark, crowded, and noisy inside.  The music and and noise level was so high it gave me a headache.  As I walked to the restroom in the back of the restaurant, I noticed the booths had TVs on the enclosed end.  When we got to the restaurant, I was planning on having the $60 Kobe burger with foie gras, shaved truffles, and truffle sauce, but opted for a less extravagant meal.  There are several specialty burgers to choose from, but there is also the option of getting a plain burger and loading it up with a variety of toppings, including cheese, vegetables (both raw and cooked), other meats (bacon, foie, prosciutto), etc.  My friend chose the $12.75 Burger Bar Sliders with skinny fries.  Her trio included a buffalo with caramelized onions, Angus with bacon, and Country natural beef with American cheese.  All three burgers were cooked just past medium rare, and the fries were plentiful and crispy.  She also tried the pickled green tomatoes, but they were so sour they were inedible. I decided to have the $16.50 American Kobe beef burger, and added bacon, grilled onions, and sauteed button mushrooms.  My burger didn't come with fries, so I ordered a side of zucchini fries, which were just strips of battered and deep fried zucchini.  There was no dressing or sauce on my bun, but ketchup, mustard, and A-1 are available on each table.  I LOVED that I could order my meat prepared the way I like it, not the standard medium-well preparation at most burger joints.  The waitress said the rare is pretty true, so I ordered my meat medium rare.  It was cooked correctly, and the American Kobe beef was tender and moist.  The onions and mushrooms weren't seasoned well, and were a little on the skimpy side.  After eating half of my burger, I got rid of the dry bun and ate the meat and veggies alone.  It wasn't the best burger of my life, but it was good. The quality of the meat was obvious, but I don't think it was worth $20 (including my toppings).  I wouldn't make the drive from San Jose just to eat there, but if I was shopping in the area, I might stop by for a snack.  The milkshakes and desserts looked interesting.
author: Lorianne L.

description:
Feel bad about single star but an individual by the name of Lauren seemed to try to sabotoge my meal at Burger Bar at every turn.  If she could at least temper her contempt for the customer with a fake smile or a little charm, she might have been able to pull it off because despite Lauren, the cocktail was exemplary and my salmon burger even good.  Fries not quite as good as MacD but they do come from Cisco in big frozen bags as a worker confded.  Is that what we get from Keller?  Back in the kitchen dude; putr on a real chef's coat  'cuz your reputation is being tarnished.  Would it hurt you to cut your own fries?  Having said that, the onion rings (also frozen) were good despite themselves. 

I found that even though organizationally and structurally, the concept is set up for failure (inexusable for being their 3rd incarnation), the individual players (service people) were busting their butts and I appreciated that.  Too bad, the Lauren character was just so ugly mean.  I had linkage with her at the hostess stand where she would repeatedly come over and disrupt flow, to the bar where she told me what I had go to my table NOW before finishing my cocktail.  When I resisted, she walked by my table where I ate with my children and repeatedly and puposely bumped me.  This is an angry angry woman.  

I asked who her supervisor was and she refused to tell me.  I think she may go postal.  Don't be there for that.
author: snoopy s.

description:
Oh, chain restaurant.

For some reason, I expected more from a burger joint; moreover, a burger joint by Hubert Keller.  Just like any chain restaurant, the Burger Bar falls victim to a rowdy atmosphere but most importantly, mediocre food.

My boyfriend and I both ordered the kobe burger with blue cheese and grilled onions.  Maybe the beef was under-seasoned on purpose to showcase the beef? 

This place just isn't worth $60 on burgers.  I don't think I need to go here again- I'd rather go to Rick  Bayless' Frontera Fresca  in The Cellar.  

The view is fantastic; however, if you're seated in the booths, it's super annoying to have a tv intruding on your conversation.
author: Teena O.

description:
So my friend came in from SD, and he wanted to try this place out, after I told him about Hubert Keller....so anyway, we met upstairs in the Macy's after taking the  one way elevator, and of course it's raining in February in SF, like always....

So he had the "Hubert Keller Burger" which I think was bleu cheese, caramelized onions, spinach, and your choice of bun, and I had the Kobe Burger....both came out pretty quickly and hot....there were probably only like 20 people in there since we had lunch around 3pm, so it wasn't very crowded....

Burgers were juicy, and portioned right....if you're looking to get "full", then you'll being paying a bit more since most burgers go for around $15+, and even a burger that was $60 (included foie grois, truffles, etc).....coupled with the window view of Union Square, it was a pretty good....

A cool thing was that we saw Hubert on our way out, and asked us how our meal was....it was funny cause he was dressed in his daily clothes, with some ornate printed t and washed out jeans, lol.....

For a different spin on your conventional burger, I would recommend this place if you have a few extra bucks to spend....a 4 out of 5
author: Eddie O.

description:
I think I set myself up for failure. I heard too many things about this place and I think I set the bar too high. About 10 of us went out for burgers and drinks for my friends 39th birthday. I was with good company, excellent cocktails and just average food.  

Everything looked great but lacked seasoning. It wasn't bad it just wasn't the best I'd ever had. I ordered the veggie burger and beer battered pickles. The pickles were actually really good but the veggie burger was just okay. I am still trying to figure out what it reminds me of..... mashed potatoes.. that's it. It was very mushy and lacked favor, I even had pepper jack cheese and mushrooms added and it still was bland. 

My friends all thought the food was okay and they had Kobe beef, lobster, turkey and Black anus burgers. The drink were the highlight, 

For what the price was for these burgers we could have gone to Applebee's or Chill's.

Also the service was slow at the table and the bar.
author: Terri L.

description:
First of all, the elevator here is lame. I could've gotten here faster via escalator. Second, if you suffer from vertigo (I don't), don't sit by the windows. Too bad a giant banner covered up what should've been a spectacular view of Union Square.

As for the burger, it's pretty good, and thick. I think it was called a country something-something and I added cheddar to it. Fries are nothing special, but the tap selection is decent (I had some ale from St Louis I think). A super-obnoxious pre-wedding party next table over (bunch of drunks at 7pm!) took away from me enjoying my meal though.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Been to the one in Vegas and it was awesome.  I had high hopes for the one on Union SQ. 

Located on the 6th floor of Macy's it has great views of Union SQ. 

Bellied up at the bar for happy hour. Half off their beer selection which is a great variety.  Also they have $5.00 appetizer selections.  

We stayed for a beer each and the BBQ pork potato skins.  The app was very tasty and they have a great beer selection.  Our bartender was pleasant but not personable, almost made me feel like he had better things to do than to be tending bar.  Which was a shame because I probably could have been there for a few hours but instead left after just 45min.  

May not go back from this experience alone, I feel like there are other burger restaurants in the city that are more warm and inviting.
author: Mayying W.

description:
Came here on a Friday night for dinner. 

The restaurant and bar were pretty busy, but we only had to wait about 15 mins for a table for 3. 

The burgers were yummy, so were the (sweet potato) fries.  My burger was cooked perfectly.  A little greasy, but quite delicious. Done in a true "Medium" rareness. The ciabatta bun was good too. Despite a high quality burger and fries, I thought it was still overpriced. $20 for a burger is still a bit high end for me.  

Service was good, nice view of Union Sq, lots of drink choices. The milkshakes sounded yum, but $9.
author: Cindy Y.

description:
I should've known that a restaurant in Macy's was going to suck.  Its upstairs neighbour is the Cheesecake Factory, which is just food for the tourists, and Burger Bar is more of the same.  It's got a nice view of Union Square, but I live here, so it's not like I haven't seen Union Square before.

I got the American kobe burger.  Whoever bought that beef has obviously never tasted real Kobe beef.  That burger had no flavour at all.  I ordered it medium-rare, and it arrived as specified, but I've had better-tasting burgers at McDonald's.  I ordered it on an onion bun, which was similarly bland.  My husband got the country natural burger on ciabatta, and his was just as bland and boring.  We ordered fat fries with our burgers, which were the high point of the meal.  

Service was okay.  The waiter seemed a tad stoned, and every third word out of his mouth was "cool", but he was mostly polite.  Someone else delivered our food, and he came out to deliver a long soliloquy on how he had gone looking for it because he thought it was the next ticket and oh he was so glad someone else dropped it off.  That was a bit weird.

The bill for the two burgers, one order of fries, and one soda came to $45, which was way too much for food that was so low-quality.  Even worse, I spent most of the afternoon possessed by some of the smelliest gas ever.  (Sorry, I know it's gross, and I'd normally consider such a thing TMI, but a restaurant shouldn't do such a thing to your intestines.)  There are way better burgers in San Francisco, starting with the humble In-n-Out. 

If I've got some out-of-town guests and they insist on going here, I'll do it, if only to see if maybe they can figure out how to make a milkshake that doesn't suck.  But I'll try to steer them towards better burgers: Zuni, Marlowe, Bar Tartine, and so many others.
author: D C.

description:
I hadn't had a burger in ages so maybe I was expecting too much, but I thought it was merely 'ok'.  I would still give it another chance and maybe try the kobe burger next time.  
The menu is definitively exciting!  I wish the burger was juicier/better seasoned and the shape a bit more flat and wide - I'm really not a fan of uber fat burgers that you have to take the top bun off to be able to fit in your mouth.
author: Mrs. G.

description: View is great & service was good. Went in for lunch n had the salmon burger with grilled onions & sweet potato fries... I enjoyed it. Also tried the cucumber square cooler & it was refreshing. The drinks are overpriced.. That's the only downside
author: Ruchell F.

description:
Hmmm....not what I was expecting. 
Everyone at the table ordered the burger sampler, since we were all Burger Bar virgins. Not one of the burgers measured up to my expectations and the fries were just OK. We even ordered one of the sauces from Fleur de Lys in hopes of spicing things up and there was just no hope...so sad.
author: Kathleen E.

description:
Stopped into the Burger Bar for lunch today.  I spilt a Kobe Beef Burger and order of Sweet Potato fries with a friend.  Although they charge an extra two bucks to spilt the burger, the nice presentation and proper portion was great!  I requested my burger to be medium-rare which was a good call.  The meat was high-quality and well seasoned.   I would not eat the whole burger alone because (a) it is too big and (b) it is too expensive. 

The Burger Bar also has an excellent selection of beers on tap.  The selections include local breweries such as Speakeasy and Fullers (UK).  I had the London Porter which as excellent..  

The view of Union Square from the Burger Bar is also really nice, especially at night.  

Snag a spot at the bar and enjoy this new addition to the otherwise poor food scene of Union Square.
author: Moe J.

description:
Kobe burger - excellent 
Milk shake - above average 
Fries - above average 
Fried pickles - sounds much more interesting then it tastes 

Chocolate burger for desert - A perfect 10, def. one of the most unique deserts items I've ever had.

Overall, the food was 4+ stars.

Service: I went on opening weekend so I assume they're still getting the bugs out, they said the wait was 45 mins so I went for a walk outside and came back in 30, at which point they said they had already called us, they did sit us within 5 mins so it wasn't a big deal

Price was pretty high for a burgers and fries but you are paying for Hubert Keller after all...
author: G S.

description:
This is the place affiliated with Hubert Keller, and home of the $60 burger (includes kobe beef, foie gras, truffle shavings and truffle sauce).  I expected super chi-chi, but found a place that feels a bit more like Cheesecake Factory.

The pluses:
- build-your-own burgers, as well as fancy combo burgers
- delicious sweet potato fries in addition to usual potato fries (string and fat steak fries)
- many burger options: angus, kobe, buffalo, chicken breast, salmon, veggie options
- AMAZING alcoholic milkshakes - I got the Irish Coffee (shared with a friend to lessen the guilt).  

The main minus is that not everyone is up for burgers that cost $10-$20.  They have salad options as well.
author: Fontane L.

description:
All the elements were there to make for a great restaurant experience.  The quality of service was far above average, but should be the standard for all professional wait staff, and restaurants.  One can't ask for more than quality of food shrouded in great service.

In my quest for the perfect burger, I've devised a set criteria that I use to make my assessments.  However, i've realized that my assessments have been incomplete because I've been excluding cost as a criterion.

I paid $22.00 for a hamburger at the Burger Bar, and that was the most expensive burger I've ever eaten.  Do I want to equate quality with cost?  NO! Because my taste buds won't be bribed!  This was a beatifully crafted hamburger beginning with a plump, hand-formed freshly ground chuck patty perfectly settled between two artisan buns admidst a back drop of earthy colors of red tomatoes and green lettuce..  Take my advice;  Take a picture of this burger and the next time you order a burger at any other joint show the chef this picture and demand that he make yours just like the one in the picture.

This is a vibrant environment with great views, and a comfortable feel.  A great selection of beer and creative milk shakes.  I found the mini television at the table very cheesy, but oh-well thats media-tech.  Your experience at the Burger Bar will be worth every cent.
author: Oscar M.

description:
This place is almost nothing short of phenomenal. Sitting next to an open glass window of Union Square on a friday date night was beautiful.

It's a tad bit depressing that everything is a la carte: your burger, your fries, additional items, your drink etcetera. But I wasn't too surprised about that. Sweet potato fries are always a favorite and a definite recommendation if you've never had them before - you'll never order "regular" ones again. 

Some waitresses did dress a little skanky, or rather the word I'm searching for is...unprofessional. I'm sorry but wearing a high skirt and leggings with heels you can't seem to walk in don't enhance the atmosphere... not one bit. Although our waitress was very polite and very accommodating so we did appreciate that.

The make-your-own sundae was also a sweet touch to the end of the meal. (You could also make your own milkshake) But alas, the catch of course is paying for every item put into your little spazz of a creation. I did, however, not agree with the 75cent addition of graham cracker to our sundae. They were not kidding when they said graham cracker and not graham crackerS.

All in all, a very nice place and I definitely enjoyed it. I will come back again!
author: Liane T.

description:
Mmm, burger. 

My roomie and I finally got the chance to eat here last night. We arrive around 10 to 6 and were seated immediately. Service was great - attentive server who checked in on us and made sure we always had water. I ordered the sliders - they were all fantastic. my favorite was the one with the cheese... mmmm.

And... as an added bonus Hubert Keller was walking around. He said hi to us on the way out. Totally made my night.

We will be back to try the shakes though, since we were both full and had to get to the ballet.
author: laura f.

description: Nice view, friendly, prompt service with a great bar tender. When ordering your burger tell them to hold the salt on your meat. Way over salted that I actually sent it back. I rarely if ever, send back food. Second time around with new burger was better. The Le "Frog" was great.
author: Lisa F.

description: The perfect tourist trap - one have to wait one hour before being served - but only eith water, takes another hour till the waitress is coming. Go to the hit dog guy in front of macys!
author: Robert P.

description: I would really like to give this place zero stars... But I guess the food brought it up a notch. Food was great, everything expected if not more. Service was horrendous! We were greeted by a semi courteous staff, and seated promptly. It then took awhile to be recognized as a new table, for a wait staff to come and take our order. When we finally got our drinks, which by the way, arrived after our menu order was taken, and were awful tasting- Not even tolerable. No one came to inquire about our welfare... Then got our food from a food runner, which was just ok- but still... No inquiry about our welfare. If I wanted to just order without service I would have gone to a cafe.... We even requested to get things taken off the bill for being unsatisfactory at the end of the visit- and still no check by management- overall awful customer service!!! To sum it up and Save you money and time and go elsewhere.
author: Roxana A.

description: Burger Bar your service is pretty bad and your food is ok.  Now I have to warn everyone, they claim to serve Kobe Beef burger, however, this isn't truly Kobe beef, its KOBE STYLE BEEF.  Authenticate Kobe beef is from Japan and would cost a lot more than $16.50 per burger.  The burger was good, not fantastic.  The sweet potato fries were AMAZING, very addicting.  I went through two orders just for myself.  My biggest complaint is the service.  It plain stinks.  Our waitress was pleasant to our face but barely came to our table.  She literally waited until all the tables in her section were filled before returning to our table and was snooty with my date over her request for non buttered buns.  In hindsight I should have given her a small tip.  Overall, I'm not returning to BB and would advise anyone that wants a good burger to go to the Counter in Santana Row before going to BB.  The Counter has better service, quality of the food is better (everything is custom ordered) and bigger portions.
author: Mike M.

description:
Our party of 3 waited over 45 minutes only to get first available seating which ended up in the bar area...no biggie.  My two lunch companions loved their milkshakes and burgers (although one reported her medium rare burger was overcooked).  The burgers come a la carte...so we ordered french fries and deep fried pickles on the side.  The fries were just okay, but the deep fried pickles were just god-awful.  For some wacky reason, they batter and deep-fry whole dill pickle spears NOT the customary dill pickle chips.  I won't get into the semantics of properly making deep fried pickles, but needless to say it was basically deep fried batter covering a mushy pickle spear.  I only managed to eat one and got so grossed out that I couldn't finish another....  

I don't know, maybe I'm wacky...but I thought my buffalo burger was okay but nothing stellar, especially since there was more bun than burger....certainly far below what I would expect from a Hubert Keller establishment.  I guess you can't win 'em all, but I'm kind of at a loss why Keller, the owner of Fleur de Lys, would open such a kitchy Cheesecake Factory style restaurant...aside from the obvious monetary implications...the place was packed from the time we got there to the time we left.  This guy was on Top Chef Masters.  Service was perfectly fine given how busy it was, but I don't think I'll be going back to the burger bar anytime soon.    

Oh, and our bill came out to $76 (including tip) for 3 burgers, 2 milkshakes, fries, deep fried pickles and an iced tea....
author: D C.

description:
Overlooking Union Square was the highlight of this top floor diner. Most tables can get some sort of view of Union Square, but unless you are up against the glass, it's not as impressive. 

The burgers were solid, but nothing out of the norm. I think the plating could have been more interesting considering you are there for the Hubert Keller's genius. The burger menu was what I expected.  

I think this would be a great place to crash after an exhausting day of shopping, but I wouldn't trek there for an evening out.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
what i ordered... american classic (cheeseburger w/ skinny fries)

...burger was nothing special except for the price. when it arrived on my table it looked so small but i was totally wrong 'cause it was filling. the meat was formed like a slightly flattened italian meatball which fooled me of it being small, it was of good quality and coarsely ground but a bit chewy. bun was untoasted, crusty outside and a bit grainy inside. bacon was so curly and small. and the worst part it was topped with dime a slice cheese......

though fries were served in a fancy container it had the look and texture of mickey D's but without the yummy taste.


ambiance... ok(but without the view of union square down below, the place was just as simple as a diner)
service... good(nice and went back to check on me, host was nice as well)
cost...$$(expensive)
author: Gors P.

description:
Having eaten happily at Burger Bar Vegas a few times, I was pretty stoked to hear there would be one opening here in SF.  However, after seeing the multitude of negative reviews, I wanted to wait a while for things to settle before eating here.  I've always felt it's sort of unfair to solely judge a place just after it's opened - of course there are going to be bumps in the road.  

Well, it's now been a few months after they've opened, and I gotta say it's not bad at all.  There was a bit of a wait (on a Saturday night), but nothing horrible, and expected for a place with this much buzz about it.  Our waiter was attentive, and we got our food in a reasonable amount of time.  

Sides:
- Fries  were very meh.  While hot, they still weren't crispy.  They really should fry them longer.  Pommes frites they are not.
- Sweet potato fries were okay - still not that crispy, but better than the regular fries.
- Fried zucchini - decent, but nothing to write home about.  Would order again though.
- Onion rings - nice, lightly coated in panko, not too greasy.

Burgers were a tad on the rare side, but still within the acceptable range (ordered medium-rare).  The meat wasn't overly seasoned, so you could still fully taste the beef.  My ciabatta bun was nicely toasted and lightly buttered with a nice crisp consistency (not uber-crunchy/crusty/chewy like some places).  Their bacon was ok, a tad on the chewier side than crisp, but that's a personal preference (I also prefer it a lot smokier).  Another thing of note is the Perigord truffle sauce has a rather light truffle flavor.  So if you order it, you probably shouldn't get other toppings with strong flavors which would completely mask the truffle flavor.  It's a thin sauce, served on the side in a tiny pitcher (and not a bad dipping sauce for the lackluster fries).
author: T C.

description:
Admittedly, my review is clouded with my total chef crush on Hubert Keller.  Nonetheless, I had a fantastic burger here and will come back again.  Great options for you to select one of Hubert's favorite burgers, or you can create your own perfect burger bliss.

Ambiance really isn't all that -- feels someone food court like once out of the bar area. However, the presence of the chef himself changed that for us!  The bar area is good; the bar snack menu seems to offer great options - my friend was very happy with the sliders.

Service is friendly and attentive. It is a pricey spot, but a good spot for my fellow foodies!
author: Danielle R.

description:
WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT!! I had been looking forward to trying a burger here since they opened this place and geesh what a let down. I was able to get past the touristy factor as I walked through Macy's but first the decor is kind of blah. Too bright and bland looking. But I'm really not basing this review on the decor. 

We ordered one burger with the regular beef and then one kobe but medium. We wait FOREVER and are given our burgers well done. I"m trying to flag down our waiter but the person who served us was apparently not our waiter. In the meantime we're starving so we eat the regular burger which was good but not worth the price. We waited on the kobe because for almost $20 for that burger (not including fries) it better be cooked right. Finally, after about 25 minutes we get someone over and they didn't even apologize. They were just like "oh you don't like this?" and then it took him a minute to even think to offer to get me another one. Hello? where are your service skills. Second time around it was about medium well but at that point we just wanted to get out of there. I think the first burger was better. We should have just headed back to our neighborhood and gone to Roam burger (best burger in the city) - I recommend you do the same unless you want an average burger with a side of slow and awful service.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
I am a HUGE fan of Fleur de Lys, so it was a no-brainer to head to this place after work one evening.  

Thumbs-Up:

1) Genius idea to put a bar in a shopping mall.
2) Bartenders serve you within seconds of waiting.
3) Touristy, but not annoyingly so.
4) Beer selection is PERFECTION.  The only domestic brew is Blue Moon, which is good, despite being owned by Coors.
5) Super-nice Celebrity Chef.  Hubert Keller came by our table to meet and greet.
6) Alcoholic milkshakes(!!!)

Thumbs-Down:

1) Overpriced Beer:  Chimay Red small bottle is $12, as opposed to the tall boys at the store for $9.99
2) Kobe burger not worth the price.  Cheeseburger not as good as Taylor's in the Ferry Building.

More stars than not--definitely a great place.  Stick to tap beer and the Buffalo burger.
author: Hannah A.

description:
The only reason this place got two stars was for the view, otherwise it would have been 1. I usually don't like to give bad reviews unless I have been to a place more than once and since this was my second visit (one that I regret) I want to review it. 

The place was not busy at all, maybe four tables in the bar area had people yet the server was rushing me. I got the veggie burger with blue cheese and sweet potato fries. The veggie burger was cold and mushy, it had the consistency of oatmeal. There was no flavor in it was so ever. The blue cheese did nothing. It tasted closer to a queso, none of the good punchency that blue cheese usually has. The sweet potato fries were a joke. They were lukewarm with no seasoning. The size was also comically small, about the size of McD's kids size. It was so small I actually counted and there were only 22 fries. That is crazy when charging $3 and change. Yes, all of the burgers are stand alone, all fries/sides are extra. 

To finish off this awful meal, when I received my change, it was short the actually change/coins. Yes, it was a small amount but that is still not right.
author: J Z.

description:
I would have gave them 5 stars, but as the previous poster mentioned they need to iron out service details.

The food, however, was YUMMMY!  I got the sliders.  You get three different kinds, American cheese, bacon, and grilled onions. They're very picky about their sliders, and don't allow you to change anything about them or even choose how well you want them cooked, but trust them because they know how to cook sliders to perfection.  I also had the twinkie milkshake which was very interesting. You can literally chew on the tiny crumbs of twinkie mixed in.  Next time I go I want to try the Nutella shake, and if I win the Lotto maybe I'll even try the $60.00 burger.
author: Adrianne J.

description: Everytime we come to San Fran we hit up this place.  My dad and husband love the milkshakes and believe they are worth the $10 the cost!!  I always get the turkey burger and sweet potato fries.  The view is very nice, over looking Union Square.
author: Bree M.

description: I had an ok experience, the burgers are very high priced my sliders were good as well as the skinny fries our waitress was nice, but when a friend complained about her well done burger being burnt; the customer service was mediocre.  If you have a customer complain about their meal the manager should be notified immediately and when manger is notified have a little bit more compassion for the customer's complaint, at least offer to cover cost of meal.  Overall good company, good waitress, but way too prices for a burger.
author: Nichelle B.

description:
Hostess was great when we asked for one of the best seats (arrived very early before crowds).
Waitress was another story, very cold attitude, no refills on coffee, no offer for dessert, would want to pick up plate when we were still eating but leave other empty plate on table.  Poor service in general from waitress.  Food was good but paying for location.  Did like the menu selections.
Music too loud
author: Denise H.

description:
Best burger I've ever had.  Worth the 10 minutes wait for a table to sit above union square and enjoy the view and the absolutely amazing kobe beef.   

Had my burger on ciabatta (recommended by the staff) and loved that too.

Recommend (again hint from my good server!) going one level up on your cooking preference.  So if you like medium rare, ask for medium!
author: Melissa D.

description: Not impressed. Wait staff was okay. Our waiter was kind of a jerk and always acted like he was in a hurry in service, so drinks were hardly refilled and had to remind him to get the beers too. Wtf. Next time, I will catch the other elevator and wait for better service and food.
author: Dennis M.

description:
So maybe I shouldn't have went to a place called Burger Bar and ordered a chicken sandwich, but that's what I did. The chicken was bland and super dry. I ordered cheese (extra charge) and chose the sesame seed bun. I had to ask for mayo to add some moisture to the sandwich. 

The waitress took forever to take our order, which irritated me because I had a clear view of her leaning against a wall talking to her co-worker, and she had a view of us just sitting there waiting for her. For the first time ever I was the obnoxious customer that yells, "When will she take our order?". 

Overall it was not such a great experience.
author: J M.

description: Super average veggie burger, average fries, average shake, sub-par service, inside of a Macy's. Tourist trap. But... a great view indeed.
author: Mark S.

description:
Had lunch here and started with a bloody mary which was just ok - nothing special
Ordered the buffalo burger build your own and zuchinni fries
all dishes were mediocre
I was a little disappointed considering its a hubert keller restaurant 
unfortunately there was nothing spectacular about this place
the view was nice...
author: Marie r.

description: It's ok. Great for tourists.  You can tell Hubert Keller is not in the kitchen.
author: G R.

description:
More like 2 1/2. Burger Bar presents a nice option for the Union Square area offering decent food at a comfortable price in a casual setting.

Walked into BB on Friday night about 6 and was seated right away; the place continued to fill during my entire time dining here. 

Food: Standard burger fare with all the various toppings one could want. Meat was okay and a bit on the dry side. Ordering a med-well burger and it came out well done. Dining partner ordered medium, but it was more on the med-rare side as were the sliders (only prepared as medium; no substitutions allowed). Sides were ok. Fried jalapeno pickles - sounds better than they taste and server was shocked I was ordering them.... that should have been the first clue. Fries were better.

Drinks: OK. Full bar and average pricing; nothing to write home about. Mixed drink was a bit on the weak side and was served with a cracked glass.

Service: A bit slow, but the place was busy. 

I'd go back, but not make it a point. Maybe will try a different meat option and see if they present any better flavors/textures.
author: Jason C.

description:
Wow, I have to say the burgers here were the best I burgers I have ever had. 

Price is decent, $12.95 burger sliders to pricey $25 kobe beef/Lobster tail burger.

Great view from the top of macy's. 

Great service.
author: Keit K.

description:
First of all, BIG fan of Chef Hubert Keller. When a friend suggested we meet up here for lunch when I was in town to visit I was more than happy to say "hells yeah". Eat at a burger joint crafted by the man behind Fleur de Lys and my pick to win Top Chef Masters? Where's my eatin' pants?!

In retrospect, perhaps that's where the problem lay. Did I put too much faith in the joy a grilled patty of meat would bring me? Was the resulting endorphin rush from requesting--and after, receiving--a healthy helping of spinach on my burger not quite the high I was expecting?

Sometimes a burger is just a burger, and sadly that was the case for my experience at the Burger Bar. No, I didn't order the Keller Special with the fois gras; I opted for the buffalo, which was tasty and a bit above average but lo and behold, my socks stayed on my feet.

(I will mention without going into too much detail that the first burger I was served had to be sent back for, uh, replacing. I was extremely happy with how they dealt with the issue, and to top it off my meal was comped so it has now become a non-issue.)

The nutella shake was a completely different story. THAT I felt like slathering all over my face as if I could drink that stuff with my pores.
author: Raffy E.

description:
We came here for lunch on Sunday and had a great meal.
Unfortunately we weren't able to sit near the window but still had great views of Union Square.
We ordered the following:
Salmon Burger w/ aioli and a side of salad-perfect!
Kobe Burger - excellent
2 Duvels & 2 Stellas later we had no room for dessert  ;-(  
Just a note that the drinks are on the pricier side.. our bill came to $80 w/ tip but it was well worth it. 
Service was ok.  
We'll definitely return to taste some more of the menu.
author: Lizete S.

description: A great place to grab a fancy burger.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Fantastic milkshakes - try the paddle sampler which comes with 6 smaller glasses in three flavors (strawberry, nutella, espresso).  The quality of the meat in the Kobe burger and black angus burger were fantastic although their medium rare was a bit on the rare side.  

On the negative side, the wait was long, the fries were mediocre, and the bill was a bit on the steep side.
author: Dan Y.

description: Good burger just should of upgraded the meat, I just got the american burger and it was just ok. My Wife got the pepper Jack with country feed meat a it was much better. Great view in this place.
author: Brian P.

description: Went the day after xmas. It was crowded. They have buffalo sliders and Scrimshaw. I was happy. Cute wait staff.
author: Jordan P.

description:
So beautiful! You're eating, and have a sky high view of Union Square. How awesome is that?! Windows from ceiling to floor, the place was such a great place for a sunny lunch day. 

The full bar definitely is great plus. They have a great selection of beers on tap, we were sure to utilize those. 

We had two waiters who were both very nice and very helpful. They constantly made sure our drinks were filled and that we were satisfied with our meals. And maybe I was just there on a good day, but I couldn't help but notice all the hottness walking around that was the servers. 

Now the heart of this place, the food. It was all good. I had the Kobe beef burger which was cooked exactly how i wanted. Also, you have some choices on the types of bun you'd like with your patty, which was a nice option. The menu was simple enough where you didn't get lost in picking what you wanted to eat and granted the ability to make your meal highly customizable. Now, I had to dock a whole star because the burgers don't come with the standard side of french fries and onion rings...you have to order them separately. That was uber lame. 

Now all in all, a solid place. I'd definitely come back. A good choice for lunch and I'd imagine a fun place for dinner as well. 

p.s.
I like the name "Burger Bar," it's cute.
author: Jon C.

description:
Nice view, good food, who could ask for more?  
We spent a beautiful sunny Sunday in San Francisco, which is rare.  After a terrible brunch at Carnelian by the Bay at the Ferry Plaza we had dinner at Burger Bar.  We didn't have reservations, but granted, it was Sunday evening.  We were surprised there was no wait for a table, since i've been trying to make dinner reservations on a Saturday night at Burger Bar for a long time.  Anyways, we sat at a table in the bar area, right next to the window, so we enjoyed the Union Square view for dinner.

My Country Natural (grass fed beef) burger was awesome, and my husband's buffalo burger with jalapeno bacon and avocado was great.   We only ordered one side (sweet potato fries, also awesome), because we wanted to save room for dessert (it was either a side of onion rings or dessert).  When dessert arrive, i totally didn't regret it, the Nutella burger was so yummy...donut "bun", nutella & nut "meat", strawberry and kiwi  fixin's.

All in all, this restaurant was awesome, and it was a very nice way to end a sunny Sunday afternoon in the city.
author: Isabella P.

description:
Couldn't resist Burger Bar after the experience at Fleur De Lys. I would finally get a chance to try a real burger from Hubert Keller! It was good but not great. 

Macy's doesn't really need another crowded, wait inducing restaurant. But if no one's buying clothes, then perhaps that prime real estate should be put to use. Even on a Monday night, it's tough to get a seat anywhere in that place. Not sure why they didn't open up that additional space on the side of the entrance to accommodate everyone when they could have clearly filled it. 

Now the goods, the burger could have been hotter as could the fries. I didn't wait long for my food, but it was all just luke warm. Kobe burger was juicy and tasty but tasted like anything I could get at Flippers or Bistro Burger. Jalapeno bacon was very delicious and unique. The $30 truffle shavings or the lobster seemed a little over the top, but that probably works for some. 

Overall, $30 is a bit much for a burger and fries. I won't be back anytime soon. Sorry Hubert!
author: Joyce T.

description:
Ah, another burger joint to cross off my list. I love me a good slab of ground beef smushed (yes, I know that's not a real word) in between toasted bread. Oh wait...the burger I had at Burger Bar didn't consist of GOOD ground beef or TOASTED bread. Darn...

Anyways, to begin with, this place doesn't take reservations. It took us THREE tries to finally get a seat, so I was super excited to actually be able to have my fat butt (THANK YOU THANKSGIVING DINNER!!!) firmly situated on one of their bar stools. The first two times we went, we were told the wait was around an hour (too long, if you ask me), so we finally got in on a Monday night, around 6PM (five minute wait). 

We got a table right by the window, so had a great view of the Christmas tree, pathetic-looking fabric Menorah, and the ice-rink. The ambiance wasn't too bad, but it was quite loud, so I felt like I was yelling at the poor fellow burger-lover sitting across from me. 

Ordered the American Classic (black Angus beef, American cheese, crispy bacon, tomato, onion, on sesame bun). When the burgers came, they looked quite impressive. It was cooked to perfection, medium, just as we had requested. The quality of the beef was OK - I've definitely had better tasting beef. The taste overall...hmm, I'm 100% sure I've had better, juicier burgers. Heck, a burger at Fuddruckers is much tastier, and it would have cost us half the price. The bun was probably toasted at some point in time, but they might have left it out in the cold, because it came to me...NOT WARM & TOASTY!!! The skinny fries are not worth mentioning...so I'm going to fast forward to my conclusion.

Would I come back? Sure, but not for the burger. I'm really curious about their milkshakes. SF has too many burger joints to offer to really give me a reason to return to Burger Bar. A return trip would have to offer me a 5-star burger, not a 3-star poser. The only highlight of the evening was observing the Asian lady in front of me cautiously get onto the escalators as we ascended up to the sixth floor of Macys (where Burger Bar is located). She looked so hot from behind, with her perfectly tanned legs and smoking hot body. And once we got a look at her from the front, we perhaps lost a part of our appetite. Maybe that's why the whole burger-eating experience wasn't that good. Asian lady - you ruined it for us!!! You looked 21 from behind, and 45 from the front. As Baz Luhrmann says...WEAR SUNSCREEN!!!
author: Blenda L.

description:
First time I came here, I hated it. The burger was overcooked and the service was terrible. I ordered the Kobe Beef Burger. When they remade it, it was undercooked. They just couldn't get it right. The burger wasn't even that tasty. I expected more for a $20 burger. On top of that, the server was rude as heck when I told her it was overcooked. I would have given the place no stars if I could have.
