Then family came to town. We strolled over to Burger Bar to eat and watch the Canes game. They put us in a room to the right of the hostess stand in front of a large Flat Screen HDTV. We pretty much has the entire room to ourselves. This time I ordered the Black Angus Burger and it was divine. Cooked perfectly and one of the best burgers I ever had. 

This is really a tale of two visits. I am giving an average of three stars. Zero Stars for the first visit and Six Stars for the second visit. Bottom line, don't spring for the Kobe Beef, go with the Black Angus burger.
author: Adam H.

description:
the place is cool IF you get to sit by the window to look down at union square and the xmas tree... but when it's two and the place is sorta crowded... i feel like i just get shoved to anywhere that fits two people... dislike.

burgers are ok here... i would just say go with the angus patty... the meat is pretty good... but i think it needs a smudge of seasoning... 

i like their fries tho... stays crunchy til the end!  

ok that's it... nothing exciting to rant about...
author: Kelly H.

description:
I was a little discouraged to see that it had dropped 1* on Yelp, but this place was definitely worth my 4*s

Went there on Friday at 11.30a and there was No Line at the restaurant; at noon, there were about 30 people waiting in line. 

We had the Buffalo Beef Sliders as a starter (i know) and it was great; I love buffalo meat. Very flavorful, juicy and the perfect slider size. Not sure I'd eat it as an entree since it's so tiny. 

My entree was:
- Angus Beef, Medium Rare on a Sesame Seed Bun
- With Bacon
- Caramelized Onions
- Cheddar Cheese
- Portobello Mushroom
- Chipotle Aioli

It was the Perfect combination of juicy, flavorful, tasty and my meat was done Just the way i ordered it. 
In hindsight, the aioli was completely unnecessary. 

We had skinny fries that came with the Sliders and they were done just right. 

For dessert, we had the Chocolate "Sweet Burger" which was basically chocolate cream between 2 donuts and it was dressed up exactly like a burger. Very cute...but more like a 3* in terms of taste. 

My friend had the burger with a fried egg which looked great...but got really messy when it flowed all over the burger and got the bun all soggy. He had to eat the burger with utensils. 
My other friend had the Peppercorn Burger and she liked hers too

The TV screens are completely unnecessary. 
It's not the sort of 'bar' where you'd come to watch a game (and frankly, the restaurant wouldn't want anyone to stay that long anyway). 

I'll be back for some juicy, tasty burgers!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: A bit pricey but what can you expect when your in the middle of tourist central union square. I've been here twice first time I had the surf and turf burger which I thought was excellent. Second time I had the kobe beef burger with an onion bun. It was so juciey and the bun was fantastic. I also love the pina cola milkshakes they always have just the right amount of alcohol.
author: Jasmine S.

description: The journey through the linen department is well worth it for the burger at the end. I'd call this place a "hidden gem" because a) I never would have expected to walk into Macy's looking for a burger and b) it's got a pretty righteous view of Union Square. I'll also give them points for fried pickles and Buffalo Burgers. Stay away from the "Smokey Porter" though, it tastes like an old shoe.
author: Adam D.

description: Never going back burger and fries very overpriced. There are so many better places to get burgers in SF.
author: Chris L.

description: Good burgers! I built my own while my SO tried the World's Hottest Burger. We had two of the alcoholic milkshakes. Yum! Kind of pricey but the food is good and you can literally put anything on a burger so the possibilities are endless. Will definitely eat there again.
author: Kara S.

description:
Buffalo!  Oh Yeah!!!  The buffalo burger patty was tasty.

Having said that  I am now hesitant to check out Fleur de Lys as the lack of attention to detail at Burger Bar was pretty surprising.  It was a weekday lunch and it wasn't crowded but the food was unloved.

The bun was somewhat stale :(  The grilled peppers weren't even lukewarm, they were cold.  The biggest crime however was that the tomato, lettuce, and onions that came with the basic burger were so pathetic.  Had I just gotten the basic burger I would have had a single mealy and tasteless tomato slice and a tiny piece of lifeless lettuce and a couple of rings of red onions.  Actually I might be overreacting but the tomato offended me.  If what they had to work with was so bad they should have oven roasted them or made a chutney.  

The pickled green tomato was also bleh and actually was the worst pickled veggie I've ever had.

There are some exceptional burgers in San Francisco and I am so sad this was not one of them :(  I was very much looking forward to this being my oasis when I'm with out-of-town guests or running around Union Square.
author: MJ C.

description:
so tell me why i tipped my server a $22 CASH tip [our bill was $9O, so that was M0RE than a 2O% tip], and she still adds $10 to my boyfriend`s CC bill?  on the tip line, which i explicity crossed a line through.  that`s illegal.  do i hear a call to the BBB [Better Business Bureau]?

now tell me why, when i called Burger Bar to address this problem, i had to call TWiCE M0RE before anything was done about it?  first time, they said the manager wasn`t there.  second time, the manager said that he had to wait til tomorrow to open up the envelope that had all the receipts.  THiRD time because said manager, who promised to call me back once he found the error and corrected it, NEVER CALLED ME BACK.

the problem was fixed, none the less.  but experience wise?  no bueno.  honestly, they made the mistake and i`M the one who has to waste my time following up?  obviously customer service is not one of Burger Bar`s strong points. 

also, tell me why when we ordered the American Kobe [$16.50] [i pointed to it on the menu and everything], once the bill came, our server had given [and CHARGED] us the Japanese Kobe [don`t remember what it was called on the menu...maybe Wagyu Kobe or something] which has a $1O-$15 price difference from the American Kobe.  now price isn`t a thing i worry about, but dude, when i order something, i expect to get just that and not get swindled by someone [whose service was sub par at most] who "THiNKS" they deserve a $32 tip. 

thanks, but no thanks Burger Bar.
author: Dee W.

description:
The burgers are good and decent sized. The fries and sides are ok too.

I just cant get past spending this much money on a burger and fries.

For the same amount of money you spend here you can go to a steakhouse and eat a prime rib or a rib eye. Or maybe even some lobster.

This place is not for everyone, but I wouldn't say its a bad place to eat.

If money is not a issue to you and you wanna have a totally radical and amazing burger experience, by all means...
author: Mario W.

description:
I'd been wanting to try Hubert Keller's burgers ever since seeing his fantastic version on Top Chef but was a bit disappointed by Burger Bar. While I like the concept of building your own burger (I'm notoriously picky abt my burger ingredients and condiments) with goodies such as fois gras and chipotle aioli, I was a bit disappointed with the burger itself (a wee bland) and the not-too toasty bun. 

I still think I prefer the burger at Houston's but that's just me. Thumbs up on the fried jalapeno pickled peppers and Twinkie shake but the feel of the restaurant felt too much like touristy-Cheesecake-Factoryish Union Square. Service was also horrible as the waiter needed an average of two reminders per request and also never came by to check up on us, eventually disappearing after our burgers were served. I'll probably come back after a long shopping day with no other options but otherwise will save my burger fix for Houston's or Bix.
author: Christina L.

description: Super delicious burgers and onion rings, plus a great view of Union Square. I recommend a traditional beef burger over the turkey, which was nothing special.
author: Tori F.

description: Stopped in here for a break from shopping last Saturday. The restaurant was slammed but we were seated at a nice window table in the bar area within 5 minutes.  Neither of us were even hungry just in dire need of a drink. I chose a craft beer from their HUGE draft list and my sister got some kind of pomegranate cucumber drink served in a champagne flute. (suuuuper refreshing!) Two drinks later we had built up an appetite! Our ADORABLE and HILARIOUS waitress (wish i could remember her name!... short, curly brown hair) had sold me on their signature burger, the Hubert Keller burger which was a med-rare buffalo burger topped with melted blue cheese, sautéed spinach, and caramelized onions.  To tie it all together, it was served with a red wine shallot reduction. AMAZING!  My sister is an insanely picky vegetarian and was reluctant to even order anything but our waitress sold her on the veggie burger.  My sister opted for the "build your own" option and added pepperjack cheese, sprouts and avocado.  She said it was the best veggie burger she's ever had! (which means a lot coming from her) All in all, Burger Bar was a surprisingly awesome experience. We will be back!
author: Liz R.

description:
Eh - is the best i can say.  Went there on the openning night...the staff had NO CLUE what they were doing.  Being that Hubert has a few of these restaurants, you would think they would have a better seating system.  The atmosphere is ok; but for such a pricy burger joint you would expect a better design (cheesecake factory is 10 times nicer in the decor).  

One star for the burger (although it was $21) and 1 star for the strawberry shake which was worth the trip.

as a side note...my bf bought a beer, which would be $5 bucks at a regular pub around the corner, yet it was $11 here!
author: Alina B.

description:
The milkshakes are amazing! I had the Nutella Milkshake and it was out of this world. 

Sadly...... that's about it. The burgers are over priced and flavorless.The fires aren't much better.I don't think I will be coming back. 

The two stars are for the Milkshakes and the service.
author: Donald W.

description: I CANNOT believe this place only has 3 stars! This place is THE BOMB. Not only was our server super attentive and great, the view over Union Square is AMAZING and can you say FRIED PICKLES?!?! They are to DIE for!!! LOVED the sliders and skinny fries! 2 thumbs up for sure! I WILL be back!
author: Anne B.

description: The bottom line is that Burger Bar an over-priced tourist trap. This place makes Cheesecake Factory seem worth the wait. The service was mediocre at best, and the burger was dry and tasteless. I asked for it to be cooked medium, but it came back charred on the outside, and cool pink in the middle. I considered sending it back, but the waitress was nowhere to be found. The fries were cooked in old fry-oil and cold when they were brought out.  The total without tip for my burger, fries and diet soda? $19.15. For a $10 burger, I expected better.
author: Wendy R.

description:
I love a great burger.  Especially a great gourmet one.

1st visit: Came on a weekday night, waited about 10 minutes for a table. We were seated at a booth in the back.  The service was pretty slow, but we were waiting for a friend so it was OK. They have a good menu selection - all different burgers including the $60 kobe beef burger with shaved truffles.  Um...we didn't have that.  We did go for the natural, the American Classic, and the Burger Bar sliders, all with skinny fries.  The meat was flavorful, the toppings were fresh, and the ranch was really good.  Oh, and you have to try the onion rings!

2nd visit: My mom wanted to eat at a restaurant where we could see the Christmas decorations in Union Square.  The hostess seated us at a table for four near the bar with a perfect view of Union Square.  We all ordered different burgers - the natural, the angus, the kobe. All different toppings, all different fries - and we enjoyed them all.  The sweet potato fries were just OK.  I like the skinny fries better.

Overall, probably one of the best burgers I've had.  I do have my favorites, but if you're shopping in the Union Square area and want a good burger, this is the place to go.

Seems like a great place to go for dessert.  They're open late and they have ice cream sundaes, beer floats, chocolate burgers...next time!
author: Christine O.

description:
The Kobe burger was a complete disappointment.  It could have been regular beef from any second-rate burger joint.

The veggie patty was a cold mush.

The whole wheat bun was one of the driest and densest buns I've ever eaten.

This place is all hype and no substance.

I won't be coming back.
author: Brian K.

description: Inside the mall, I didn't like the sf tax on top of everything. But it's good to try once I suppose. Came here after bay to breakers. I think I ordered the salmon burger. The view was nice.
author: Claudia S.

description:
If you have the funds, you can be sure your money is going towards good food and a nice atmosphere to chill with your buds!

Their specialty burgers ranged in price from 12.00-60.00 (the higher priced burgers had truffles and duck foix gras or lobster....) They have a buffalo burger that costs 22.00 that my cousin raved about. She and her sister both ordered them.  I got the sliders (an angus, a country(?), and a buffalo) for 12.95.  The bf got the black jack which was angus with tepanade for about 13.00 also.  All of the burgers came with substitutable skinny fries. The bf & I got sweet potato fries (same price ), my cousins got the zucchini fries ($0.35extra) and the fat fries (same price i think).  They all liked their food.  The sliders looked super tiny, but they actually filled me up in the end.  I'd say their portion sizes are just right if you're hungry.

One of them also got the nutella shake which she let us try. It was really good.  Although, it was $9.00 and you don't get the extra silver cup to refill your glass when you've finished. Sad.  Again, though, if you have the money to spend and don't mind paying, then it's good.

For dessert, we decided to share two items: the dessert burger and the dessert cheeseburger?  Get the one that does not have chocolate ganache. The one with the cheesecake filling is really good, although the donut could've been less stale... hahha. It was $6.00 for each of the desserts.

Something cool was that they had a tv in each of the booths.  I see it as both a good and bad thing.. On the one hand, you get to watch exciting sports games, but if you want to have a conversation with someone, it might get too distracting.  I'm not sure if you can choose to turn the tv off... hehe.
Would I come again? Probably not unless I magically happen to find $40 on the floor, but I would recommend it to my friends who are more financially fortunate than me.

The wait for a table was about 20-30 minutes for lunch on Friday (new years day 2010). But because you're at macy's, you can browse ...They didn't validate our parking of the Union Square garage... 

Service was great.  Our glasses were always filled and the waitress was happy and energetic!

Tip: Take the escalator to the 6th (i think it's the 6th) if you can because the elevator takes waaaay too long.
author: Roxanne K.

description: Too expensive for a very average burger. Also, it is quite loud in there, and really hard to get a good sitting overall.
author: Maria J.

description:
ouch $65 for two burgers and two cokes.
sure it's hubert keller, world famous french chef
sure it's american wagyuu beef (kobe style raised domestically)
my first 4 bites included chunks of gristle. ugh!
sure it's portobello mushrooms and swiss cheese with a fresh sesame bun. 
but to use a baseball analogy, (world Champion Giants still fresh on my brain), this was NOT a grand slam. more like a ground rule double.
still an extra base hit but with conditions.
note - the hostess and waitress and rest of the staff were indifferent at best and somewhat rude at times. 
example -  the hostess who sat us, did not greet us, make eye contact nor thank us for coming either before or after the meal.
dude, i just dropped $65 for two burgers and no thank-you?
i would definitely rethink coming here a second time. 
i had a better burger at Absinthe in Hayes Valley for less money and with better service and atmosphere.
not sure what the big deal is all about.
once you get past the hype of the celebrity chef, it's just a good burger. which i have been known to create and serve myself on occasion.
save your coins and go buy dinner for a family of 10 at any Chinese restaurant in SF.
author: Jeff W.

description: Best part about place is their burger dessert that's shaped like a burger. How creative. Other than that, nothing spectacular and nothing outstanding. Nice booths though.
author: Camille T.

description:
I like burgers, for sure...why else would you explore a place with such a name?  Ok, long story short:
The burger was great, but NOT worth the price.  I had the "Natural Burger", cooked medium with a side of the Sweet Potato Fries.  Again, good but not worth the prices.
author: West P.

description:
The first time we went to Burger Bar for dinner, my husband and I saw Hubert Keller making milkshakes. Awesome!

The veggie burger is great and the milkshakes are delicious. My husband has thoroughly enjoyed his meat-burgers, and they have a vegan burger I plan to try next time, so everyone can be happily accommodated here, no fuss. 

Good for lunch especially. There can be a long wait if there's something eventful happening in Union Square, but the view of the square from the restaurant is just about worth it.
author: Heather T.

description:
Had a very good Kobe-style beef burger (with bacon, avocado and blue cheese) with some fat fries, on a quiet Monday night. The place does indeed live up to the hype (though things quickly get expensive as you add on the various extras and fixins...) Service is very good and very friendly. We shared a burger and side-salad between 2, and the order was split in two very tastefully. (Half a Keller burger is almost the ideal meal, in fact.) And indeed, Hubert was there too - the complete experience!

All-in-all, I recommend Burger Bar for a casual weekday drop-by. (And we got a wonderful table with a view overlooking the ice rink in Union Square.) Not sure if I'd want to brave the crowds and wait in line at the weekend, but for a casual meet, it's perfect.
author: donal c.

description:
BRAVO hubert keller!! You have officially made a cash cow in the heart of commerce San Francisco!! I was really REALLY wanting to love this place. My boyfriend is a chef and I consider myself a food snob and the idea of this place really sounded appealing!!

Went here at 3:00 on a Wednesday and still had to wait for 20 minutes. The decor definitely reminds me of some sort of Applebees or TGIFs or something. We didn't get that spectacular view everyone was talking about, instead right next to the shake making station.
We ordered the brown cow shake, which was vanilla ice cream with fudge and chocolate whip cream. A big meh. Had better shakes at Mel's!! Very small too, usually you get the extra in another container BUT we didn't. Not really worth it.

Then my boyfriend and i split the Kobe beef burger on an onion bun with pickled tomato, beets, mozzarella, caramelized onions, aioli and the truffle sauce. The only thing worth ordering in said items was the aioli. The truffle sauce was one big disappointment and all the pickled items were way too vinegary and boring!!

The burger itself was under done. We had ordered it medium and it looked more medium rare!! My boyfriend liked it that way so we didn't send it back, but if that was ALL mine it would have been a goner! The beef itself was very bland. I couldn't believe it did not taste better!!
Also got the skinny fries with the burger, they were another 'meh.' Were not seasoned at all and were very plain.

Didn't have room for anything else but read later the dessert burgers weren't all that great.

If i want a good cheap burger i will go to burger meister, in n out or flippers! If i want an upscale burger that matches its price in taste, i will go to Spruce!!

WILL NOT BE RETURNING!
author: Susanna B.

description: Truly average burgers for $15 minimum. Probably over $20 after a couple interesting toppings. Friday's/Applebee's quality service. What a rip off. Do not waste your time.
author: Jay N.

description: This place sucks...the service is sub par. First they tell us its a 20-30 min wait...then 45 mins later they say another 15 which turned out to be another 30 mins. Then they call us to be seated and they didn't have a table for us...yet there was a perfectly good table with no one in it. They had nerve to tell us that the table was reserved...there was no one there to be seated. They then tried to seat us...a group of 5 at a table for 4 with a couple seated next to us...meaning both parties would be uncomfortable to eat...they tried to apologize with cold appetizers. My momma ain't raise no fool. To top things off...their portions aren't enough for the prices they charge. My first and definitely my last time.
author: Charles M.

description: What great food!!!  What great service!!!  We had a hankerin' for a really good burger and Burger Bar was recommended to us.  Felt a bit weird walking through the home furninhsing section of Macy's to get there but once we got into the restaurant, we had a great table with a view of Union Square.  Tony, our server, was very good.
author: Rob C.

description:
Went back...I got the Angus with caramelized onions, bacon, and the Fleur De Lys Peppercorn Sauce...it was DELICIOUS. My burger was bloody, just the way I like it! I could only eat half, but trust me, I wanted the entire thing. 

I got the onion rings this time, and my boyfriend got the skinny fries. I don't think I'd get either again. They don't' stand out as amazing, and to be honest, it's way too much food and grease on top of the burger. 

I'm sticking with 4 stars for now because by no means is this the "world's best burger" (please see my Epic review), but it is good, and also fun to come up with all different combinations. 

Next time I'm trying the American Kobe...update to follow.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Oh, Burger Bar, I wanted to like you. I *really* wanted to like you. But alas, what an epic disappointment you were. I'm a huge fan of the gourmet burger fad that's sweeping the nation. When I was up in San Francisco this past Sunday, my tummy started grumbling while we were shopping downtown, so my friend suggested we grab a seat at Burger Bar. I didn't hesitate to say yes--gourmet burgers AND a celebrity chef? Yes, please!

So we made our way up escalator after escalator inside Macy's to get to the Burger Bar on the sixth floor. We didn't have to wait too long for a table, only about 10 or 15 minutes, which wasn't too bad considering the number of people waiting outside the restaurant. I was salivating reading the menu while we waited. Foie gras on a burger?!?! Truffles?!?! There was no way I was going to order either of these--I'd rather pay my rent--but the very idea that I *could* was so mesmerizing.

I decided to order the turkey burger on ciabatta with Provolone cheese, caramelized onions, bacon and Dijon mustard, with a side of "skinny" thin-cut fries, but resisted the urge to order a milkshake. Thankfully, we didn't have to wait too long before our food came. But wow, what a disappointment. The turkey patty needed something to hold it together--it was dry and crumbly, falling apart with every bite I took. The bacon was a sad sight--I'd expected nice thick-cut gourmet bacon and got what looked like your average store-bought bacon, stringy and full of fat. The caramelized onions were still gray and needed to be caramelized longer to get that nice golden color and deep flavor. The Dijon mustard was fresh, with lots of mustard seeds, but had absolutely no flavor. I like my Dijon strong, you know, the kind that'll clear your sinuses with every bite? The Dijon I had was too sweet and had no mustard flavor! The fries were OK--nice and thin, but a little too salty for me. This seemed to be a problem with my meal as a whole, actually--both the burger and the fries were so salty I had to down like three or four glasses of water with my meal.

When the bill came, as I'd feared, my meal hadn't come cheap. As other Yelpers have lamented before me, you pay for every side and every addition to your meal at Burger Bar. Let's take a look at the bill, shall we? The burger was about $11, but then you add 75 cents for the cheese, 95 cents for the caramelized onions, $1.15 for the bacon and a whopping $3.80 for the side of homemade mustard. By the time I was done tinkering with it, my"$11" burger came to $18. Yes, you read that right, almost $20 for a burger. Now I'm not one to skimp on the costs of food--I've routinely handed over $20 or even $30 for lunch--but I felt incredibly ripped off after my lunch at Burger Bar. I wouldn't bat an eye paying for the pricey burgers at The Counter, because they use quality ingredients, but the ingredients at Burger Bar didn't merit the prices.

And it wasn't just the food that was a disappointment--the atmosphere was rather off-putting too. What I had hoped to be a hip, yet elegant, spot to grab a burger looked no different than a CPK or Chili's outlet. Some tables seemed very intimate, secluded in an alcove at the windows overlooking Union Square, then there were booths with built-in TV screens. We had the unfortunate luck to be seated in the tables in between, cramped close together in no-man's-land. These tables was rather perplexing, like Burger Bar didn't know if it wanted to be a hip fine dining spot or your run-of-the-mill sports bar, so they designed it to be both--but not really executing either one all that well. There was a cacophonic din of sports fans, loud conversations, a busy bar, screaming children and a busy kitchen. I'm not opposed to loud restaurants per se--but there's a difference between a loud restaurant with a vibrant, bustling atmosphere and the confused chaos at Burger Bar.

I guess I should have expected as much from a restaurant inside a department store. But with Hubert Keller's name attached to it, I had hoped for better. But don't be fooled by a celebrity endorsement and expect a gourmet burger here. I've come to realize, despite its attempts to be haute cuisine, Burger Bar is no different from your average chain restaurant you'll find inside a mall food court. You can certainly find better burgers in San Francisco.
author: Raul N.

description:
This is the same burger bar as in Vegas. Its over rated, and overly priced. I'm sorry but how can people say that their burger was so heavely? Have you ever eaten good food in your life before. I seldomly give 5 stars, and if you give 5 stars for jus an ordinary burger joint, then how are all hte michelin rated restarurants also given 5 stars? Doesnt make sense. We were stuck in union square and starving and was cravng a burger so decided to come here. After a 30 min wait finally got our crampt little table by the restrooms! EW.

Our server was slow and had to ask for water 3 x. Food came out in decent time with help of another server, I had a 3 sliders buffalo, kobe, and regular and all of them tasted the same despite having dif toppings! BF had the regular burger with american and mushrooms and we shared a regular skinny fry.

Everything was OK but at $12 a burger you'd expect at least a flavroful burger. It just lacked some seasoning or salt or sometihng. If you want a GOOD BURGER try buffalo burger in the avenues off Geary for like 1/2 of the price. I won't be coming back!
author: Petri Y.

description:
The elevator is opposite end of the Cheesecake Factory.  We put our name on the waiting list and the wait was going to be about 45 min. so we waited around bar area and sampled some beer.

First, I spotted 2 guys leaving the bar within 5 minutes so we sat there.

Second, I didn't like the watermelon flavored beer (1st sample) then was given the framboise for second sampling.   YYYuum!  doesn't even taste like beer - just tasted like a blackberry drink ($11)

We didn't go for the Kobe $60 burger and went for the Kobe burger that was $16.50, but you have to select stuff you want on it (cheese, mushrooms, etc..)  so that adds to the price of the burger.  Don't worry, it does come with lettuce, pickle, tomato and onion).

The burger had good flavor and it was thick  I only finished a quarter of it and took the other quarter home.  For $5/quarter you better not throw it away!

Rudy (bartender) was energetic and very personable!  He made our first visit enjoyable!!

View was great and the restaurant setting was casual and sportsbar feel to it.  I can get loud in there.
author: R M.

description: This pace gets two stars for the VIEW. The food is solid one star. My Kobe Burger had zero flavor, was super dry, and way overcooked.  Sweet potato fries were dry as well. I never got my Oyster Mushrooms, I later realized I was still charged for them.  I was looking forward to eating here, but food turned out to be a big disappointment.
author: anna p.

description: This place has a nice view and great atmosphere for a burger restaurant.  The burger itself was very juicy and tasty, but the bun does get soggy super quick.  It's definitely a great place for guys to hang out and eat while the wifey shops all day long.
author: Joseph C.

description: The view was fabulous.  The beer, delicious.  I did not order a burger.  It was more of an impulse really when the waitress took my order and I said, "I'll have the fish and chips."  I didn't even realize the irony at the time, but I don't regret it.  These were definitely one of the best (top 3) fish and chips I've had, and I'm somewhat of a connoisseur.  The fish flavor was incredible.
author: Jaime L.

description:
I really tried to like this place, I really did, but the experience was lackluster at best.  

My brother had the Kobe Beef burger, and I had a regular burger with seared Foie Gras on top.  

While my burger was very juicy, it really lacked on the seasonings and failed to awe me.  I feel like I can buy the same thing at Five Guys sans foie gras.  My brother was also not impressed with his Kobe Beef burger.  He said it was good but nothing to call home about.

Do yourself a favor and take that hard earned money to a different place, not here.
author: Minh L.

description:
2.5 stars.  Food is worth 3.5 stars, everything else takes it down a star.

The burger wasn't bad.  In fact, it was pretty good.  However, it really wasn't any better than a number of other burgers at nice restaurants nearby.  Like Burger Bar, those places offer high quality meats and other ingredients.   If it were just the food alone, I would give it 3.5 stars

The big differences? 

1. It doesn't cost over $20 for a burger at those places.
2. Alcohol, while overpriced at those places, is exorbitantly priced at Burger Bar.  Seriously, an extra $2 surcharge for virtually every beer on the menu compared to other restaurants in the city carrying those beers.
3. The ambiance.  It was sort of like a cross between a chain burger place and an upscale sports bar.  Great views of Union Square, but really, it felt less like we were in a hip restaurant and more like we were in an Applebees.

So that is why it is only 2.5 stars worthy.  It is good, but just not worth paying so much for what you are getting.  I mean, for two burgers and two alcoholic drinks it was $70.  You can get the same meal at a dozen other places in town for $50.
author: Brett J.

description:
SWANKY!
Did I just walk into a burger joint or a night club?

Burger bar is a great spot if you want to treat yourself to a delicious, fatty burger.  Great atmosphere, unique menu, and a great view of Union Square.  Expect to pay for the quality and location, it's not cheap but not expensive.

I visited on a Saturday afternoon right in the midst of Christmas shopping.  I was hungry, tired and the place was packed.  I expected the wait to be at least half an hour, but I was pleasantly surprised when my party of 2 was seated within 5 minutes!

When the waiter came over I ordered the buffalo burger and sweet potato fries.  I asked him to bring out the fries ASAP and woo-hooo they came to the table a mere 5 minutes later.  

Fifteen minutes later the Buffalo burger came out and it did not disappoint.  It was a generous serving of flavorful, juicy meat.
author: Betty Y.

description:
Why would anyone want to pay $16.50 for a plain hamburger, then add another $5.50 for a sauce (they said it was truffled but it tasted more like brown water sauce to me) and then another $2-$3 for every other topping (I had spouts and cheese)...all in all about $28.00 and I STILL had to yet pay another $3.35 for the fries!!!! 

Total bill, for one burger and fries, two beers plus tax and gratuity, about $52.00.  Seriously folks.  $52.00?????

I tasted the organic beef and it tasted dry and bland to me. I had Kobe which was better but not $52.00 worth.

In my humble opinion, save your money and find either a nearby Burgermeister or Burger Joint in SF....so much better and you won't have to sit around a bunch of annoying tourists pretending they're rich. You'll have so much money left over you can buy everyone in the restaurant with you a beer too.

I heard the milk shakes were good but they are in the upper $8 and $9 dollar ranges so bring a fat wallet.

As far as I'm concerned, this place is a disappointment, and we're such a foodie town, I had really high hopes.
author: SFCAFOX S.

description:
This is all I have to say:

1 Bud Draft + 1 Extremely mediocre Burger = $27 including 9.5% sales tax and 3.5% Healthy SF Tax

I won't be back.  The place reminds me of applebees and so do the people that work there.  WTF was I thinking by going to this shithole?????
author: John C.

description:
Oh Hubert! Are you not ashamed?!?! I guess when those big checks come in I wouldn't be either. You go to the website, you see Hubert Keller on tv talking about Burger Bar and you envision a slightly upscale, trendy restaurant that serves inventive burgers. 

Reality:
You walk in you're greeted by a hostess who probably just got hired from IN and OUT. The decor is blah. Cheesecake Factory right above Burger Bar has a better decor and Ambiance than this place. 

The bartenders rocked. They knew their drinks and liquors and were what I expected of a place like this.

The servers and hostess just seemed for a lack of better words, very amateurish.  We went on a slow night weren't in a rush so we said we would wait for a window table. Se moved to the bar literally less than ten feet from the hostess so she could see us. We waited patiently and went through a few drinks. Luckily the bartender was knowledgeable so we didn't mind waiting. We even told the bartender that we were waiting for a table. We see three tables seated by windows and we wonder hmm those people just walked in.

So we walk over and ask if a table was ready since we saw three that were open. The hostess goes "oh yes they are". We look down and for no reason she had crossed us out. 

The service from the waitress was just ok. 

Now the food. I've had a Kobe Beef burger on several occasions at different restaurants. This was by far at the bottom of the list. It was cooked medium yet still kinda dry. It was an ok burger. I've had better burgers at Holy Grill for a fraction of the price. 

I'd go back to have a drink and maybe some onion rings and zuchinni sticks but I'd say skip the burgers. 

Oh the topper of the night was the piece of plastic that my girlfriend had to pull out of her mouth from our desert. We got a quarter of the way through and asked the waitress to take it back and off our bill. 

I'd have to say I've eaten at bad restaurants but it's rare that I walk out irritated. I work in the service industry and understand things happen that the waitress can't control. But I can't believe Hubert actually stands behind this restaurant.
author: Hyung L.

description: Went here on a Friday lunch hour with a friend from work.  The service was unbelievably slow.  We each ordered turkey burgers and it took at least 30 minutes before our food was brought out.  We asked for barbecue sauce three times before they finally brought it out to us (when we were 3/4 done with our burgers),  The burgers were merely okay, severely overpriced. Many other burger places in town do a way better job for a lot less money.
author: T. H.

description:
this place is packed but it has a nice view of union square. came for lunch on black friday (which was prob our first mistake) as service was a bit horrid. servers didn't know who was responsible for what tables, our food orders were incorrect and it took forever just to flag down someone for the bill. 

sliders trio 
- buffalo w/ caramelized onions - this was ok but i felt the meat was a bit dry. barely any onions
- angus with plain bacon - this was actually really good but hey how can you go wrong with bacon
- country natural beef - honestly, i couldnt tell the diff.
- skinny fries - is it sad that this was the best part of my meal? fries were crisped to perfection and i had to force myself to stop eating.

also got to sample off my friends' plates..
- zucchini fries - wish it had more zucchini, less batter. it had a nice crisp to it but you can only eat so much fried oil.
- jalapeno pickles - best. pickles. ever. besides the skinny fries, this is what really made the meal. i actually dont like pickles but i could not stop eating these. it had a nice kick, pickles weren't too sour and there was just enough batter on it. dipped in ranch or eat them plain.. delish.

if i was to come back, i'd just sit at the bar, order a drink, fries and pickles. who needs to be healthy.
author: Selena H.

description: Had the Grilled Shrimp Salad and Sweet Potato Fries.  The salad was very refreshing and beautiful.  The sweet potato fries were crisped perfectly.  Both were very delicious.  Service was great as well as the atmosphere for a reasonably priced meal.
author: Maria C.

description: Okay place if you want to grab a quick bite but definitely nothing special. Best thing about it was the view overlooking Union Square.
author: Aretus ..

description: If you're going to charge $17 for a burger (not including any "extras"), you should know how to cook it. For the second (and last) time: medium rare is not the same as well done.
author: Garrett O.

description:
It's a trendy tourist burger joint in Union Square, I went here with a visiting friend and we wanted to try someplace new that wasn't cheesecake factory or too far from the mall. The veggie pumpkin burger was great. Service sucked so much harder than I suck on a straw for the water that never came. Or the dinnerware and napkins. 

They expect tips from people? Maybe they should hire better servers, people who don't run and hide in the farthest part of the kitchen.
author: Myfood Y.

description: This is a tough one. I want to like it more than I do. My biggest issue is service. While its not horrible its a bit slow. Sometimes worse than others. I do have to say the "worlds hottest burger" is one of the best burgers I have ever had. Tried it twice now and it is great. Just wish the service was a bi better.
author: Jim A.

description:
Great American Burger, nice custom burgers available too - albeit the options ( Kobe beef, foie gras?!) can add up. But having options were nice.

The burgers were enormous, the fries available in thin or thick cut (each type was hot and crisp when they arrived) and the milkshakes looked appetizing.  I'd pass on the cocktails next time as they didn't hold up to the food nor to the area's standards. 

Anyway, we went there before a show with a absolute curtain time (hence no time for shakes).  Even with a wait, they accommodated us and we were out and on time (wait + eating = 45 mins).   

Apart from the cocktails the only other detractors is that the place is a little touristy (c'mon it's in a Macy's) and the ambiance is a bit odd for the prices you're paying: the ceramic tile-drywalled decor doesn't make you think of the black truffle-foie gras burger.

All in all though a good effort.   But also try Taylor's in the Ferry Bldg, Fish & Farm, Nopa, Starbelly and, of course, In & Out.
author: Kevin H.

description: I've been here a handful of times... I've had wonderful bugers and I've had just some ok burgers... I got creative, I had lobster on it once, shrimp on it, and then I had it as just a burger with avocado, bacon, and cheese.  The burgers are really good here, it can get expensive adding lobster ($12) or shrimp ($6) or even truffles ($30, which I cannot justify) but even if you keep it simple the kobe is great.   It's nice and juicy.  The burgers really do add up... the least plain one I've had was about 25 dollars... the base of the kobe burger itself is already $16.50.  So be aware before you come here you will be spending a pretty penny.  The milkshakes are delish too, but they are really creamy and will get you full before your burger comes.  I always get sweet potato fries... the first few times I felt I got a lot for the $3.50 price tag, but the last time I came, I felt like i barely even got the size of a small from McD.  The service here is also a hit or miss.  The bar makes really strong drinks too, which can be a good or bad thing LOL... they have a great beer list.
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Wait Time= 15 mins
Kobe Beef Burger=Amazing
Drinks=Delicious
Camote fries yumm!!!
author: Rhea F.

description: Burgers are good. Too small for the price. I know we are paying for the location and name but please....Service was good. It is a good spot for Union Square but not someplace I would return too.
author: Ann P.

description:
Phenomenal Ambiance & Burgers!!

Went for team dinner with both the UCSD Men's & Women's Soccer teams... The staff was very accommodating as there were about 30 of us.  The service was impeccable and the wait between our drink orders followed by our food orders was very prompt & reasonable considering the size of our party.  Above all, each one of our orders came out flawless & made each one of our very exhausted/hungry selves extremely satisfied.

Thank You Burger Bar!!
author: Julien V.

description:
Totally and utterly not  a fan! The pro's will take me 2 seconds, the cons.... let's see... 

Pro
1. I got to see Herbert Keller
2. Great view of Union Sq (but you can get that at the Cheesecake factory) 
THAT's IT!!

Cons
1) SLOW in everything! Getting you seated, taking your order, and getting your food. Oh wait, and getting your check too! 
2) I ordered the Country burger (said on the menu, bar fav). I got this so I can customize it. . I added mushrooms and cheese. The burger was so underseasoned, I actually had to add salt.. TWICE! ( I never add salt to my food!!!) 
3) Skinny fries were, not any better than McDonalds. I think I actually like good ol MickeyD's fries better! 
4) You CAN NOT customize ANY of their signature burgers

So if you want a to pay $60 for a kobe beef burger with foie gras and truffles, this may very well be the place! But if you want a good juicy burger.... go to Joe's Cable car!
author: jennifer h.

description:
I'd give Burger Bar 3 1/2 stars. I suppose I just had higher expectations since Hubert was running around like crazy stopping for an occasional photo op. They use high quality ingredients, but nothing out of the ordinary. I was a bit disappointed with my vanilla, reeses milk shake which set me back +$7 as most of it was whip cream. After a few sips there was nothing left:(
I enjoyed the kobe burger and zucchini fries and would be willing to come back to try something else.
author: Angela N.

description: This place is okay. The view of Union Square is nice. I went here with a couple buddies before going to Vessel. We all got the sliders and they were pretty good but small. Burger Bar is pretty expensive.
author: Brian B.

description: The sweet potato fries were really good and overall presentation of the food was really nice, but the burger was tiny and over-priced. I'd rather just go to chilis and get one twice the size, cheaper and even tastier.
author: Christine K.

description: My friends and I came to this location in hopes of a good beer and a burger. The server was nice but my friend didn't receive her salad until AFTER our friends were finished with their burgers. I waited for her food to arrive to start on my meal so she wouldn't feel left out just watching us eat, therefore, I had a cold burger. The manager didn't apologize and seemed completely apathetic and unprofessional when she dropped off the salad. She ended up dropping off the WRONG salad and we had to wait another 10 minutes for the correct order. If the manager was a little more caring about her customers, i'd definitely not be as disappointed as I am right now. This place is overpriced for their food so the least this place can do is offer good service. I understand mistakes can be made by a server when it is busy, so then it is the manager's duty to fix the situation, which didn't happen today. I will not be coming back to this restaurant and I will let all my friends know my opinion about this place.
author: Hannah P.

description:
Burger Bar.  Say it ten times fast with your tongue out. hehe.  What can I say, Burger Bar's been on my list of burger joints to visit, and must say I'm now a fan.  I was skeptical of Burger Bar after reading all the mixed reviews, but a few disappointed bellies weren't going to deter me from seeing what all the hype was about.  

Went to Burger Bar on a Saturday during your typical tourist/shopper's lunch rush.  Was seated right away with a view nice view of Union Square.  Within a few short moments of being seated, our waitress told my "better half" and I the day's specialties.  After going with my  gut, went with the Old 38 Stout and Burger Bar Slider combo.  Moments later, 3 sliders with a side of sweet potato fries arrived consisting of a buffalo burger with caramelized onions, angus with plain bacon, and country natural beef with american cheese, all served with on a plain bun and the carnage ensued!

Here's the verdict:  Good food doesn't always come at a premium, no denying that.  However, if you want a nice variety, something different, a view, and good food, then I'd recommend Burger Bar.
author: Jason T.

description: Mediocre expensive burgers and inattentive service.  No need to stop here.
author: She-Ra ..

description:
Good Burgers, Good Menu Options.

Went here for lunch on a Saturday and enjoyed it but was not overly impressed.  It is probably more of a price thing since you can get a good burger from a lot of places for less money.

The bar area has a good amount of seating and the booths each have their own television, so it was great with the NCAA basketballs going on.  Extensive beer list is present.

I made my own burger with Buffalo (supposedly better for your health - less cholestoral, lean, etc.) on Sesame Seed Bun.  Add homemade Dijon Mustard, Caramalized Onions, and a side of Buttermilk battered onion rings.  All customer burgers come with lettuce, tomato, and red onion on the side.  Burger was good, but a little greasy.  Onion Rings are delicious!

Also tried the Nutella shake with chocolate ice cream, which was really good.  The GF got the Peppercorn burger that she enjoyed, but not as much as the shake.

Overall, this is a good place to eat a hearty meal and even watch some sports.  Prices can get a bit steep, especially if your start going after toppings like black truffle and foie grois.
author: David M.

description:
I went back to Burger Bar after a great first visit and was really let down. It seems as if Chef Keller has gone out of town for the holidays without making sure his staff knows how to properly cook a burger. I ordered my Kobe Beef burger rare and was very disappointed when it arrived well done, with no pink visible at all. I didn't pay 10 extra dollars to have my Kobe Beef cooked beyond recognition. I wasn't able to send it back because I was with a large group of people and knew they would all be finished their meals before I got my burger. This major disappointment has caused my review to drop to 3 stars. Read below for the review of my first, and better, experience.


My experience last night at Burger Bar was phenomenal! It was a very busy night but my friend and I were seated right away.  I immensely enjoyed  the Kobe Beef Burger and Skinny Fries. The service was efficient and friendly. Meeting Hubert Keller while he was hand delivering milkshakes to our table was definitely an unexpected highlight! You will not be disappointed here.
author: Noel M.

description: My first visit here, but I have been at the one in Vegas. I like it. And we sat at the window with a great view of Union Square. Food was good, service was adequate, and a nice atmosphere. If you want a High end burger, this is the place
author: Tom S.

description:
I wanted to try the $60 burger but I couldn't justify spending $60 on a burger.  Instead I opted to build my own burger for about $35.  I was overwhelmed by the long list of customizations but eventually decided to mimic the $60 burger with the following: American Kobe beef ($16), medium-rare, on ciabatta, with a generous slab of fois gras ($12), caramelized onions (~$1) and truffle sauce ($5).  LOVED IT.  My 3 lunchmates also loved their burgers (we copied each other and ordered the same customization).  We all had the same reaction after taking our first bite which was O_O WOW.  The burger also comes with a side of lettuce, tomato, onion and a pickle spear which you may add to your burger if you'd like.  Shared a side of fried zucchini and skinny fries.  The highlight was the truffle sauce.  Dip your fries in it.  It'll blow you away.

Friendly attentive service. Waitress refilled my Coke 3 times (hey I was thirsty!).  Rather than a restroom with stalls, there are 2 individual separated bathrooms which I thought was weird for a restaurant of this size.  Nice view of Union Square since it's on the 6th floor.  Wasn't busy at all during a Friday lunch.

It seems like there are mixed reviews on the burgers so if/when I come back, I'll probably order the same build my burger that I did before.  I don't think I can justify spending $20 on a regular burger but I CAN justify spending $35 for Kobe beef, fois gras and truffle sauce. :)
author: Justine L.

description: Pretty abysmal. Incredibly overpriced and the service was some of the poorest I've ever had. Try to avoid, if you can.
author: Jack T.

description: This is a great place to take out of towners who have kids.  You get a great view, you introduce people to a little SF Cuisine and you will almost most definitely see Hubert Keller who is super nice and will definitely take a picture with your group.  The Vegan and Veggie burgers are fabuous.  Go ahead and order all of the fries, why not?!
author: Kattya B.

description:
CAVEAT: I have not eaten here, but I sent my mom here last week and feel compelled to relay her experience.

I suggested this place because mom was going to be in Union Square and because I love Hubert--his food at Fleur de Lys is incredible and I found him to be a classy and worthy competitor on Top Chef Masters unlike some of his colleagues (cough, Chiarello, cough).

My mom and her friend remarked on the slow service (rendered by a very friendly waiter) and both very much enjoyed their burgers.  However, just before my mom tucked into her sliders, she asked the waiter for some Grey Poupon as the table only featured French's.  A little odd that it wasn't readily available but no big deal.  Until the bill arrived.  And that bill included a .45 cent charge for the Grey Poupon.  Um, WHAT???  McDonald's provides all-you-can-eat condiments.  Shouldn't a place that features $16 burgers (and is owned by a French chef)?

Mom complained and the waiter asked her to write a note to "management" on the receipt as it was not the first time they had received that same complaint--no surprise there.  Mom wrote to say that she couldn't imagine Hubert would EVER eat a burger without Grey Poupon and that while she expected (and was happy) to pay $16 for her burger, she was shocked by the surcharge.

I was literally blown away.  How can this be?  

Hubert--you're better than this!!
author: Auburn D.

description: We were shopping in Union Square San Francisco, near Macy's and saw the Burger Bar. We've been wanting to try this location since we go to the Burger Bar in Las Vegas. It's located on the sixth floor, and offers a nice window view of Union Square. I wanted to try something different, so I had the buffalo burger with grilled onions, lettuce, tomato and provolone cheese on a whole wheat bun - along with sweet potato fries and a chocolate milkshake...Mmmm. The burger was lean, juicy, and delicious with the grilled onions. It would have been nice with grilled mushrooms too, but Burger Bar does not offer it. My hubby had the Angus burger with the works and zucchini fries. We shared our fries and both veggie fries were delish. My daughter ordered the mini burger sliders and skinny fries. We shared the classic chocolate milkshake which was rich, sweet and with added chocolate sauce on the side of the glass. It was very good, but the serving glass was very small for a $7 milkshake. However, the Burger Bar in Las Vegas would serve you the milkshake along with the extra in the metal milkshake container. The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive, and our food was served right away - nice & hot.
author: Racquel E.

description: It's a nice place to be. Very beautiful very but the servers was very unprofessional. I sat there and waited some condiments which took them 15 minutes. The burger didn't come out to what we expected! Buns were too hard for me. Apparently some people love it but u guess I'm one of the few that dont. The price of the burger was pretty high for something that isn't too tasty. I rather be at in and out than here. Disappointed
author: LisaH T.

description: The drinks are strong, but I've had better burgers at a cheaper price. Come with a party and you'll be paid attention to more. Don't get me wrong, portions are nice and the burger was juicy and well cooked, but I spent almost 40 dollars for just myself, I didn't order any apps :-/ Unless you're sitting at the window, the interior is pretty underdone and poorly made. For a Friday afternoon, most of the waitstaff was just standing around doing nothing.
author: LaKeisha S.

description:
So Yelpers, been away for a little bit..Starting a new job is hard, but ultimately rewarding. I finally have a day off to do a couple reviews.  I have been suffering withdrawals lately, shaking and the cold sweats..Not good..

After work a buddy of mine and myself wandered over here.  We had both never been here, and my phone was dead (couldn't check out the reviews on Yelp, I wish I had...)   We sat down looked over the menu.  We almost did the foie gras/kobe burger, but we both couldn't justify $60 on a burger.  I decided on a normal burger and fried zucchini and my buddy did something I didn't care to remember.  

Ok, now here's where it get weird. The server, a girl in the bar area, was a complete weirdo.  She never once smiled, said thank you, and was a complete automaton.  She would say, "can I get you something to drink," we would tell her what we wanted and she would just walk away.  She did that for everything, "Can I bring you anything else?"  --"Ranch, please."  and she would just walk away.  It was severely odd.  I didn't like it, I seriously almost threw a fork at her just to see if she would cry.  The burgers, I could have had a mimi's cafe or red robin.  There was absolutely nothing memorable or special about this place.  Well except for the price.  Let this be a lesson to all of you, just because the restaurant is owned by Hubert Keller doesn't mean a damn thing.  Next time I will get me some bottomless fries from Red Robin.  At least I know I will enjoy those and the service will undoubtedly be better than what I experienced here..I expected more...


p.s. the milk shakes are why this place gets two stars, damn good!
author: Shaun C.

description: This place is actually really cute. The venue itself is modern and it's a fairly short wait to get a table if any wait at all. The food is a bit pricey for what you get but it's delicious! It's also great for groups of people that like different types of food because they can customize thier burger to thier taste. For example when I took my parents there it was great because I'm vegan, my dad is on a low fat diet, and mom only eats fish, and my boyfriend will eat anything put in front of him. we were all able to get different things that we really liked!
author: Crystal M.

description: I went with a large group of friends (like 12) to the Burger Bar last weekend for the first time and I liked it! It might have had something to do with the drinks before dinner (try the "man's milk chocolate"-have no idea what's in it but it's GOOD!). In all honesty, the burger was well seasoned and cooked and went well with the bacon, cheese, and other fixin's. Really like the mini deep fryer of steak fries that came with mine. All in all a solid late evening burger spot.
author: Dante' T.

description:
I am a big HK fan. Frankly I have a huge crush on him. This makes me want to give this  5 and I can't. The burger WAS delicious. I got a standard with cheddar and a wheat bun, my friend got the Hubert. The Hubert was DELICIOUS. Really delicious. And both were exactly as we ordered them. I just hate the décor. It's very plastic soulless/middle America/strip mall/TGIFridays...

If none of that bothers you then  go there. If it does, or even if it doesn't please join me in begging Hubert to open an Alsatian restaurant in SF. 

Hubert, please make me a flammkuechen. I'd love to sample your baekeoffe in a woodsy, cozy little Weinstube. Cure me some choucroute. Please? I'm on my knees here.
author: MJ T.

description: I came here to eat alone and sat at the bar. The bartender was surly and condescending when telling me that my medium rare burger would be a bit bloody in the middle. He was slow to get to my drinks. I ate my food and left.
author: Ian J.

description: crowded. service food. all two stars. If your on union square and need. I mean really need  a place to go eat. OK its here. But not worth the elevator ride the long wait for the food.  And the burgers are ok. I came with a big group and ask around some people didnt eat most of the food - why? taste!!
author: Ray R.

description: The celebrity chef associated with this place needs to sample this food - JUST AWFUL!  Greasy, over- breaded zucchini strips with freezer burn overtones; dry, thick, and stale sesame bun,  really tired caramelized onions, limp and mealy.  OK beef cooked wrong; mushy, tasteless cole slaw and the saddest tomato slice ever served. Yech. Shame on you people.
author: Richard H.

description: The location is great! The food and service was also great! My only complaint is the seating. They cram people in like sardines. My daughter and I  sat at a two top table next to a pillar. We could not even cross our legs. The wait staff kept bringing people past us to seat them at their cramped tables and we had to squeeze in for them to get past. We are not big people.. It was very uncomfortable. The whole restaurant was too cramped. I might not return for that reason. So many great places in SF. It has to be supreme for me to go to the same place twice..
author: Kim B.

description:
We went tonight for the first time... Great views of course... The night was off to a good start, staff was friendly.  The waiter explained the menu, the Chef selections on the right and those can not be altered or substituted.  Then the "built it yourself" left side of the menu.  We placed our order, 2 iced teas, 1 Hawaiian and 1 low-carb (bun free and no fries) and a side of fried zucchini.  The waiter said, oh you get skinny fries with the low-carb... So I had to point out to him that the menu said "No fries" with the low-carb burger..  He said I should work there!  (was he being sarcastic?) anyway...   then after we are 3/4 of the way done with our tea, he brings spoons for the tea? huh?

We drink our iced teas.... then someone else refills out glasses... still no food...  I spot the waiter, give him a look.. he finally looks at the table and ding ding.. no food.. he goes to the kitchen and after another 5 minutes or so, YAY.. food arrived!!  Everything was hot, and very delicious... The waiter checks to make sure everything is OK...  we eat.. my Hawaiian (chicken) was really good!  And my partner got the low-carb made with Kobe he was it was also delicious!  

Then we finish and he comes by to check if we need anything, our plates are almost empty and he doesn't carry anything away.. (bad move) get the dirty plates out of the way...  Perhaps he was having an off night...  

It's not cheap (total bill before tip was $44) but like another person wrote.. they need to be trained MORE... I really hope this works out.
author: Dale T.

description: Originally we were going to eat at Cheesecake Factory, which is a floor above Burger Bar, but the wait was over an hour (on a Monday nonetheless) so we decided to check it out. I wasn't aware until we ordered that it was Hubert Keller's restaurant. Being a big Top Chef fan, this excited me. I built my own burger and had the beer battered jalapeno pickles on the side. The pickles were TO DIE FOR. I'm salivating just thinking about them. Everyone at the table raved about the rest of their food as well and the service was pretty good. I also loved that there was a television embedded in our booth, though the channel never got changed for me. No biggie. It's a bit pricey but not surprising since it's in SF. There is a parking garage right across the street as well. All in all, I will go back for those glorious deep fried pickles, a cold Anchor Steam, and to try the World's Hottest Burger that I was too chicken to try this visit.
author: Alie C.

description:
Burger Bar was good but not exceptional, I expected more from a Hubert Keller restaurant. 
The meat itself was juicy and well-cooked and the toppings (I had caramelized onion and olive tapenade) were good but he buns weren't even toasted and all sides are additional.
The best thing about the dinner was the view of Union Square, definitely try to get a table by the windows.
author: Erin G.

description:
My dining companions and I stumbled into Burger Bar after a very fun, intoxicating fundraiser, yet they gave us a great table with a view and didn't mind feeding us more alcohol (in really yummy milkshake form!).

But in a city where there are some pretty amazing burgers, you'd better step it up if you're going to stake your reputation on them!  I had the surf and turf burger medium-rare, which came more like medium-well. The lobster/burger combo was okay, but not amazing.  My dining companions felt the same about their burgers as well.

Our waiter, while cute and nice, also could have been more attentive.
author: Marcus C.

description:
VICTORY IS MINE!

Burger Bar has been my favorite restaurant in both Las Vegas and St Louis-and now here it is, in my own back yard! Thanks, Hubert Keller!

True to the winning design and recipe of the other two locations, Burger Bar SF does not disappoint-and is (if I am not mistaken) the only one with any windows at all-which look out beautifully over Union Square!

Most recent trip included a turkey pesto burger with jack cheese and mushrooms, and it certainly did not disappoint.  The view was breathtaking, and it all made for a wonderful date.

The *one* downside-the wait!  I guess Las Vegas and St Louis spoiled me, where there is never more than a 10 minute wait for a table.  However, I've waited *years* for this joint, so an extra 45 minutes is worth it to get my favorite grub on!
author: Monica B.

description: Possibly worst wings ever,over cooked,dry extremely salty.YUK! Burgers were decant, nothing special. High prices mediocre food.
author: Evette M.

description: Long wait, slow service, the food was ok but way overpriced.  So it was very confusing why they also charge an additional health tax for NOT providing health insurance to their staff, and they don't tell you that til you get the bill.  I suggest asking how much that is before you order, and if they have any other extra fees they don't tell you about. Maybe they should put that on the menu or a sign at the door.  Sounds like just another way to gouge the hapless customer.  I won't eat here again.
author: d f.

description:
Ive been waiting to try this place for a while now. Ive read the previous reviews before, so I was a bit iffy about the service.  We had a table of 20+ people and i thought the service was a 8 . The only gripe we had was the time it took to get the bill after asking several times. If you think 25 and up is too much for a burger, it's not like you're spending that much every day. Give it a shot. Treat yourself. You deserve it. Laaaaaaaaaate.

P.S. the foie gras and the white ale beer are  crackish. do it.
author: Bryan Y.

description: I usually have a fun experience here but today was not that great. The bartender was great and attentive to his section, but the hostess was awful. She was very unfriendly, acted as if we were an inconvenience to her, and looked miserable. Not what you want to see when you walk in to such a place in such a known location.
author: Sarah D.

description:
to hell with these naysayers!

it was delicious! kobe beef burger and fried pickles were consumed.

jummy!
author: Evan M.

description: Had good liquor milk shakes. They have the hottest burger I've ever had. The major down side of this burger joint was it was over priced and the service was horrible. The hostess was charming but our waiters were slow and they look like they hated their job. One of the things I learned working at a restaurant is to force a smile even thou you might be having a bad day. I'm not saying camouflage you emotions but at least keep them on the DL.
author: Carlos G.

description: Half star for the view (you can go to Cheese Cake Factory on the rooftop for a better view and better food). Half star for the beer selection (which you can pretty much find anywhere in SF) ZERO stars for the food. Over priced small portions of very average food. I actually sent my zucchini sticks back!! I would not recommend to anyone.
author: Robin W.

description:
YUM! 

yes it is a bit pricey but with all the fresh gourmet ingredient and the acclaimed chef, Hubert Keller, attached to this establishment that is why!

we came in with a group of 12 on a sunday afternoon and were seated after around 10-15 mins after arrival. most of the guys ordered either the buffalo or kobe, the buffalo boys (hehehe) loveddddd their burgers. as did everyone else!

i ordered a black angus burger on whole grain bread with chipotle aioli, avocado, provolone, and button mushrooms. with zucchini fries on the side. I WAS IN BURGER HEAVEN! my burger and fries totaled around $17. but after tax and gratuity i paid about $23-24 dollars. yeah i know it seems a bit expensive for a burger but it was a fancy burger!!

the restaurant is located inside macy's on the 6th floor. but don't waste your time with the elevators. they can only hold 10 occupants at a time and take foreverrr. the escalator is much faster :)
author: E Y.

description:
After wandering about Macy's to look at the Easter flower show, I felt a bit hungry and decided to try Burger Bar. The place was empty since it was between meal hours. The host seated me quickly at a table near the window, with a view of Union Square. I mentioned that this is my very first visit, and he gladly went through the menu with me. So far, so good. After perusing the menu for a while, I waited for somebody to take my order. After another while, I told the host that I was ready to order. He took my order and went and gave it to the server. Said server brought me my drink. No water. Then he came back later to deliver my burger. And he disappeared again. No checking back on how you like your burger, if you need anything else, nope, nothing. While eating my burger, which was delicious by the way, I observed the restaurant. Same server brought water and chit chatted with two young blondes customers. Oh ok. I was not young, I was not blonde. 
After finishing my meal, I would like to order dessert. I asked about the dessert burgers, and settled on the Nutella burger. Said server brought me the cheesecake mousse burger. Then disappeared. I tried to get somebody's attention to have the dessert exchanged. ( the host took a little break, and the waiters took turn standing at the host stand, chatting). When the friendly host returned, I mentioned to him I was brought the wrong dessert. He went to get the server. The server asked me if I was ok with the cheese cake mousse burger ( which I started eating after all the wait! Out of exasperation!! ) and he offered to bring me a chocolate milkshake to make up for his mistake!! Oh lord, a burger, a dessert burger AND a milkshake?? Food coma guaranteed! I declined the offer and asked for the check.
I will come back for the burgers or the desserts and hopefully will not get THAT server again!!
author: lovetoeat a.

description:
A really YUMMY burger. This place let's you choose the buns, choose the meat, and choose the kind of fries.
Service:A
Cleanliness:A+
Food:A+
Atmosphere:A
author: Sophie B.

description: Good casual burgers, nice trendy experience. On 6th floor overseeing union square. Had a kobe beef burger with blue cheese for $16. Very good, but small. Regular burgers are $10. Specialty milk shakes are amazing desserts. Good for a light date or casual meal, nice bar and sports are on tv.
author: Michael L.

description: I wanted to like this place, but  it was a very disappointing experience. I ordered the Country Natural burger, medium rare with cheddar on a whole wheat bun with a side of the skinny fries. For my taste, the meat was packed too tightly into a strange shape. It is a bit too thick to cook well (my burger was just under a proper medium rare), and it was awkward to eat. The fries were cold when they arrived at the table, so I sent them back. The server was gracious and brought back fries that were hot, had good texture but tasted like fish. I guess they used the same fryer as the fish and chips. Yikes. I get better food when I hoof over to the food court at the Westfield Mall.
author: David C.

description: This place is good - location, beers, ambiance, food but the prices kill me. Tourist trap.
author: E R.

description: If the name of your restaurant has the word burger in it, you'd better deliver on that.  The burgers here are good but I'd never write home about them as the best.  I also think it is chincy to charge extra for EVERYTHING you'd ever want to put on it, including charging extra for aioli.  Um, what?!  For the record, I've had a way better bruger and it came with fries at Boulevard lunch menu, so maybe go there if you want a burger to really remember.
author: e w.

description:
giving this place a decent rating because really, i didn't try a burger so i think i'd have to go back again to have the real burger bar experience.  i met up with some friends here for some pre-dinner drinks / catch-up time.  we had a few pitchers of beer (the burger bar ale or whatever) at $22 a pitcher and an order of zucchini sticks.  i agree with all the other reviews... this place is way overpriced for what you get.  our zucchini stick order was only about 8 sticks!  and a pitcher is a pitcher no matter where you go... $22 is pretty steep.  

for me, the group i was with made the experience worth the price.  the service was good and the location is prime so i'd be willing to go back and give this place a second chance.
author: Sara H.

description:
I've been back here 4 times now. I love the food. My favorites:

Black Jack Burger
Nutella milkshake

And if you have never eaten here before, make sure you get the dessert Fleur Burger (very creative)

Make sure to get there for an early dinner, otherwise it gets really loud and busy.
author: Joe R.

description: Well, I finally figured out how to get in without a wait.  Go at 3 PM on a Saturday.  I had the Nutella Shake (way, way, way too much chocolate) with a Kobe Burger on Ciabatta with Blue Cheese and Carmelized Onions.  Meat was well seasoned and delicious, cooked to medium perfection.  I was real pleased with the onion rings, cooked up nicely and hot.  Service was fantastic with a couple of check-ins during our meal.  And the seating was a plus.  We were on the window overlooking the square.  Like the abundance of televisions, a plus on a college football Saturday.  I'd go back, but as I've tried doing this a few times unsuccessfully I'd be careful about the day and time.  And it's a bit pricey, for a burger.  But it's a big space with a good atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious food in a key area to people watch.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Pretty good, but I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  Best burger I've had in the city is definitely still at Magnolia.
author: Ken-ichi U.

description: I really enjoyed my kobe burger. Not a whole lot of burger for your buck, and things that maybe should be free are extra charges, but it is definitely delicious. Attentive staff. The milkshakes are other worldly
author: Lauren V.

description: by far the best item on the menu is the basket of fried jalapeno pickles. order them. bar makes great drinks, view of union square is beautiful, decor is american and friendly. burgers are delicious if you make your own burger and know what to get. i would personally skip the listed burgers. service is hit-or-miss and bad enough that i would give them three stars if not for them pickles. yum yum.
author: Sherman L.

description: Our waitress was great! she was friendly and outgoing.  My boyfriend tried the "hottest burger in the world" and he honestly thoroughly enjoyed it even though it was quite hot.  They have really good truffle fries with aioli...mmmm =)
author: Dani H.

description:
nice spot to go to after a day filled with shopping. nice view of union square from up above.

I've tried the Hubert Keller Burger and their spicy burger (I forget the exact name) with sweet potato fries. Both where pretty good but I feel like I can get a comparable burger for under half the price of some of those served here, or make my own burgers just as well.

Decent beer selection.  I'm embarrassed to admit that I've tried their watermelon beer which was actually pretty interesting and tasty, but probably not worth the man card i just gave up...def. recommend to one of your girl friends though that might be turned away from the 'normal' taste of beer.
author: Ngoc N.

description: Over crowded, over priced, and horrible service.  I was not impressed and expected more being a Chef Keller restaurant. It was a shame.  I actually ended up giving the bus boy a huge tip because if it wasn't for him we wouldn't have gotten anything - our server was the worst and treated us horribly.  I guess that's what you get when you automatically get a place packed with hungy tourist types in Union Square.  Being a local, it was an embarassment when I brough out of towners here and had this experience.  The food was decent, nothing to brag about.  Again, I expected so much more :(
author: Kelly M.

description:
I don't think Mr. Keller cares at all about Burger Bar... to wit, he has not acknowledged or responded to the following:


Mr. Keller-

I just left a review of Burger Bar SF on Yelp... in it, I promised you a letter to be delivered at Fleur de Lys on Sutter.  This is that letter.  I feel compelled to let you know that I had the WORST experience of my dining life the other day at Burger Bar.

My friend and I walked in at around 4:00pm and after being promptly seated, my friend left for the restroom.  Shortly after he left, the server approached the table and asked if I had decided on my drink.  I pointed out that my friend was returning shortly and that I would wait for him to place my own order, but that water would be welcome.  My friend returned.  Five minutes later the water arrived.  A few minutes after that the waiter arrived with a blank look on his face and simply stood next to the table, saying nothing.  I picked up on his passive approach and said that not only did we know our drink order, but that the time we were left alone had afforded us time to decide on our burger choices.  I don't know why, but his silence was accompanied by a rather sour look upon his face.  My friend ordered the daily special (Union Square Burger), cooked medium-well, and a root beer.  I ordered the daily special, cooked medium, with fat fries, and a root beer; two exceedingly straightforward, easy orders.  Presumably a burger with a slice of cheese on it is no sweat for the kitchen.  Presumably a kitchen that cooks burgers all day long knows the difference between medium and medium-well... I would presume to believe this, especially in a restaurant bearing your name, Mr. Keller.  

When the burgers arrived, my friend and I eagerly got started.  Neither of us had ever tried Burger Bar before, but both are fans of Fleur de Lys, and of you as a chef, Mr. Keller.  Clearly, our expectations were running high.

My burger was WAY PAST well-done.  It was grey as concrete in the middle and hard as a hockey puck.  My friend's burger was as I had pictured mine, on the pink side of medium, but certainly not as he had ordered, medium-well.

When the waiter arrived at the table after a few bites to check on the burgers, it was with some hesitation that I asked him to look at both burgers and then told him that I believed that my friend had been served my burger and that the burger on my bun had been left on the grill for far too long.  How could he explain it?  At first, the young man was extremely defensive; this was followed (and made worse) by him arguing that my friend's burger was a perfect medium-well (despite the fact that it was a nice pink inside and had juices flowing out onto the plate) and that mine was well-done, as I had requested.  With his bad attitude, he failed to understand that your name would be dragged into the experience.  How could a Hubert Keller burger be so far from edible?  In any case, he plaintively looked at my friend, then at me, and slithered away from the table meekly, with a barely audible apology escaping his lips as he left.

He next showed up a good five minutes after we had stopped eating.  All the while, I was amazed that my burger was so grey, and so hard, but I ate it all the same.  I am not a huge fan of waste, so I would not have asked him to throw the burger away and build me a new one.
