He should have at least offered to do so; he should have at least comped one of the burgers, if not both, or comped a free dessert, or offered a manager, or offered a gift certificate to come back again, or done SOMETHING other than sheepishly ignoring us the minute he realized we were not happy.  When he arrived at the table and looked at my plate, which I had emptied mindlessly because I was both starving and seething, he asked how the burger was.  I said to him, quite bluntly, "This was the worst burger I have ever eaten."  He looked at my empty plate, then back at me, and said, "Oh, I can see that... you must have hated it."  I replied, "I don't find this funny.  I ate the whole thing fast because it was terrible and I was starving and you didn't offer to make it right, and you ignored our table.  All I want to do now is leave!"  He was floored.  He obviously was not prepared for this.  "What can I do?" he stammered.  "Now?  Not a whole lot.  That was by far the worst burger I have ever eaten, and now I want nothing more than to get out of here."  I was repeating myself to this obviously untrained kid, and he was making me repeat myself again, and again, and again.  I told him pointblank that I wanted him to do SOMETHING to rectify the situation.  He had no idea what to do.  He fumbled with something in his hands and finally said, "I'll get a manager."  Did he not hear me say I wanted to leave, in a hurry?  I wanted to see the manager, so that was correct, but I would expect a manager to come over quickly.  Another five minutes passed, and finally, the young server and a couple of more officious...
author: Tudor J.

description: Top chef master - Hubert Kellers burger joint. Great view & good service. Lots of bar options including hard cider!  Burgers were good with lots of options too!  Well Done Hubert!!
author: Terrone C.

description:
This joint, on the sixth floor of a department store overlooking Union Square, looks very nice. The servers are lovely, semi-competent, and a bit pushy but, then, that's their job.

We ordered 'burgers veggie and buffalo, each exceedingly ordinary, and one order of sweet potato fries (Coda's are much better) that were kindly split for us. There was nothing wrong-enough to complain.

Hot sauce was requested when placing the order. Hot sauce was requested when the order was served. Hot sauce was requested from a passing busser who finally brought it.

The bill, with a small tip, was $35. Yes, that's not an error: Thirty-five dollars! For that kinda money you could, and should, go to Joe's Cable Car.

Even though the toilets were clean and well equipt, we won't return.
author: Swing C.

description:
Was a party of one and was seated at a high-top close to the bar.  The bartender was doing double duty as a waiter in that section and he was my server.  As the bar became busier, he paid basically no attention to the tables he had -- including mine.  I waited for 30 minutes after I was finished eating for him -- or anybody -- to come see if I needed anything else, or wanted my check -- but he never even made eye contact with me -- and I was about 15 feet from him.  The food was below average.  I ordered a $17.00 Kobe burger (that's just the burger -- cheese, and other toppings are extra, and so are the fries) and asked for it Medium.  It took about 25 minutes to get the burger, and once I did it was completely cooked through, no pink at all, and was dried out.

This place is a Union Square tourist trap.  Stay away.
author: Ed D.

description:
There are better burger options around the city. I give an extra star for the shakes and fries.
I would rather go big mouth burger. That's my opinion......
author: Jozee G.

description:
Would be a 1 star:
The quality is not worth the high price
Food is just OK; low variety/selection
Bad service from the waitress (she was nice enough but slow/forgetful)
There is a charge for every little thing!  (IE if you want ranch with your fries, there's a fee for that!)

Reason for the 2nd star:
Great location and friendly hostess.  
The wait was 15 mins vs 2 hrs at Cheesecake (tho now I know why!)
I've only been here once but once is enough!

My suggestion- go to Cheesecake or plenty of other nearby restaurants.  You can save money and have a better experience!
author: Cherry I.

description:
View is SPECTACULAR, service is great and food is excellent! 
I've had the sliders which came with angus, buffalo and country natural beef, and my friend got the signature burgers and french fries, and we ordered the veggie burger for both of us to share!  They are all EXCELLENT.  Pick what sounds good to you, and you'll be happy with it.  There aren't any real bad choices.
If you're in the neighborhood, Burger Bar is worth a look.  Heck, if you're within a few miles, it's worth a detour.
Bottom line: one of the best. 
We'll definitely be back!
author: Douglas Z.

description:
I have been wanting to get over here since I first found out we were getting our very own Burger Bar in S.F., and I have to say I wasn't all that enthusiastic of the joint once my visit finally actualized. I have to say, the burger I ordered (the sustainable beef patty, caramelized onions, aioli, etc. on an onion roll) was good, and cooked perfectly per my request, but was it worth the extra expense just to add whatever toppings I wanted? Not really. Some people find a thrill in the selection process, fulfilling their every desire by adding whatever sounds great in the moment, but in my group, that "make it a Dagwood" mentality seemed to be why we all felt like our burgers were too good to be true once we got to eatin' - things can get a little messy and flavors can be a little heavy if you don't really think about what you're ordering first. And it's not like it's a free-for-all. You can end up with a $30 burger if you get too crazy, which is money I'd rather spend on other things than such a basic and ubiquitous food item. Also, I always find it annoying when places serve fries as a side plate that you have to order separately from the main event; like they didn't charge ya enough for all the add-ons, you gotta buy your taters, too. Pssh. Service was casual and nothing more than what you'd get at any big name chain, not that I'd expect anything more, but with such an extensive menu, it almost seems like our server would have had more of a presence during the meal. Oh well. 
Though I still have a crush on Hubert and his vibrant gray waves, next time I feel like dropping some dough, I think I'll enjoy him at Fleur de Lys instead.
author: Danielle D.

description:
Trust the advice of the reviewers and take the escalators. The elevator took forever and it stopped on every floor. Be prepared to wait. When we arrived, there was a 40 minute wait. Fortunately, we scored seats at the bar. 

The salmon burger was cooked to perfection. My only complaint was the whole wheat bun which could have half the thickness. Just too much bread for my taste.  The kobe beef burger was also delicious, despite the same issues with the bun. Skip the cheese, which only takes away from the flavor of the kobe. The onion rings and sweet potato fries were just ok. The side salad was just a plain bowl of field greens, no tomatoes. 

The specially brewed White Lightening wheat beer was good, but the Barfly whiskey Knob Creek was very tasty. Something about peach bitters works for me. San Fran knows cocktails.  

We were also very fortunate to meet Chef Hubert Keller, who casually walked throughout the restaurant greeting diners.
author: Taste-LIFE D.

description: What a great place for a good burger, the big plus is that it also comes with a great view of Union Square. The menu is very straightforward, each burger is delish and the service is excellent.  I would highly recommend the dessert burger (a doughnut bun with a patty of Nutella among other things). If you can not get a reservation to Fleur de Lys this is just as good (maybe not) but you can get most of the sauces from Fleur de Lys here on your burger.
author: Sarah M.

description: I will give this spot a 3 just because it was not to crowded at 6pm on a Fri night. The food was Ok nothing spectacular the service was uhh not the greatest. Maybe it was that We were in a rush . Would I go here again maybe but I would not go out of my way 4 it
author: Kim R.

description:
I went to Burger Bar about 5 days after opening. It was a Tuesday night so the crowds weren't as bad as indicated in other reviews. Took us about 5 minutes to get seated. I'm not normally the kind of guy to go to an upscale burger joint, simply because most burgers are pretty darn delicious to me, but my friend wanted to try it, so we went. I just got the standard burger, which was very good. Got a side of sweet potato fries which were also excellent, although they were presented oddly, just dumped on a plain white plate. They could do something about the presentation here. 

Oh yeah, and the beer list was extensive and I looooove my beer!


The waitress was very friendly and perky--all good things to say in that department.  She seated us in this hidden nook around a column, completely hidden from the dining room. While this might turn some people off, I rather enjoyed the privacy and we had our own perfect view of the square. Otherwise, the restaurant seemed like it could be a little on the loud side. 

One downside--the interior is lacking in ambiance. White walls in a restaurant--what are they thinking?? They got some work to do on that front. 

So if you  want an upscale burger with a great view of Union Square and don't mind paying the price, this is a pretty good choice.
author: kevin b.

description:
Easily some of the best burgers I've ever had. A bit pricey, but you know what youre getting and it tastes good. I'm usually pretty full after eating my burger and fries, but somehow I'm always able to also finish one of their delicious desserts. 

They also have a great selection of beer here. I tried a beer float once because it sounded interesting. It pretty much tastes like it sounds...beer and dairy just dont mix.

If youre here to meet Hubert Keller, I met him once and he was very nice. I dont know how often hes there but he doesnt mind stopping at your table to chat for a bit and maybe pose for a pic.

Enjoy!
author: JeF m.

description: We had date night and ended up at burger bar cause we wanted to try it. We got seated right when we go there, but after being seated it took awhile for the server to come and get our drinks even though it wasn't busy. The food was good but the service was slow.
author: Jerm C.

description: Extremely overpiced. The burger was not that great but the experience was amazing.  I really like the fact that you can build your own shake.
author: Matthew H.

description:
I got the Hubert Keller Burger: buffalo patty, caramelized onions, sauteed spinach, and blue cheese on ciabatta. The burger was juicy and the blue cheese was very mild. The red wine reduction that came on the side was delicious. Because this was one of the "Chef's Burgers" it came with skinny fries, which was pretty good. I got the Pranqster beer they have on draught. If you like beers like Blue Moon, it's worth giving a try. 

Everything is pretty pricey. $22 for the burger.

The service was pretty bad. After we finished our meal we didn't see our server for a long time. I had finished my beer without being offered another one and our tables waters were completely empty.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Over the summer, I've tried the burger bar in LV and that made me fall in love with burgers all over again. Now that i have a burger bar open right here at home i would get the same experience right? nope i was wrong. My burger came out a bit burnt on one side. From that on, i was just disappointed. My friend loved his burger and even ordered dessert. Their black and white milkshakes were even better than their burgers. The one thing i notice about their service is that you have to order your dessert in the beginning of the meal or tell your server when they are taking your plates because if you don't, they will just give you the bill without asking if you want dessert. 
The night wasn't a complete disappointment when i actually saw hubert keller walk through the doors with his head chef. Never thought i would see him unless you go to fleur de lys.
author: Lynn P.

description:
I entered the Burger Bar and the hostess was blahzey .I told her just me and I was on my lunch. She told me to sit at the bar .I did but she didnt even follow me to give me a menu I had to go back and get it.I proceeded to check out the menu.The bartender was nice and suggested a hamburger after I told him I didnt know what to have.I had the deluxe bacon cheeseburger and fat fries.I ordered it well done. When I got my order the hamburger was small and undercooked and the bun was cold .I had less than a hour
 left for lunch so I took a bite. The burger was tastey but could have been way better.For the price I expected so much more. I doubt Ill go back
author: Kristo V.

description: Visting from honolulu i went here one night when we had some friends drive up from san jose and sac town to meet up. Service was good and the food was even better. We all had a great time catching up. The shakes were good as well. The girls all had the Nuttella shake i beleive and it was super good. We were all able to order our own burgers and even build your own. At the end we all split desert i beleive it was some banana split styled desert as well. That was very good as well. Seating took a little while as there was a wait line but its to be expected i was told. And the bill for 7 people was def. decent  for everything we had.
author: Shige O.

description:
The best things about this place is the view, service, assortment of t.v.s to watch games and selection of unique beers. The food was...ok. I would not go back here to eat.
My fiancee and I were in registering for our wedding  at Macy's and decided to take a lunch break at Burger Bar(if I remember correctly, it is located on the 6th floor in the Macy's bulding. We were seated immeditabley at an awesome table right next to the window that over looked Union Square. It was a fantactic, clear day in the city so the view was really incredible.

Our waitress was very sweet. She came over right away and took our drink orders. I ordered a Pale Ale which was very light and my fiancee ordered a Raspberry Albita. I loved his beer! It wasn't sweet but had a light raspberry taste. Delicious. They also servce milkshakes that look very good and super rich. They are large and could easily be shared.

The menu has a pretty nice slection. From salads(which looked great and I wish I would have ordered those) and many different types of buirgers(salmon, buffalo, kobe beef with foiegras, vegetarian, vegan etc) and lots of different toppings if you wanted to create your own burger. I ordered the veggie burger that had tons of grains and different types of vegetables and mozerella cheese mixed into the burger. It was topped with a pesto aoili, lettuce, tomatoe, red onion and i added avocado and jalepenos. I was disspointed with it because the burger had a gummy texture and no char on it. It was like eating a bananna/oatmeal texture burger. and there was very little flavor even when i added the pesto and mustard. I was expecting more from a burger bar. My burger was about $15 with the additions.
My fiancee ordered the burger sliders that had three different types of burgers on it and came with a side of fries. The fries were good, nothing special. I have to say that my fiancee seemed to enjoy the burgers. His burger was about $12-$15

Nice resturaunt but I really have no desire to go back there.
author: Whitney S.

description: Best hamburger I've ever had. Service is horrible though, we waited 30 minutes for the check which is ridiculous!
author: Martina I.

description: Not worth going. The burgers are mediocre at best. Prices are expensive and definitely not worth it.
author: Darlene G.

description: I have been to this place on 3 different occasions and with 3 different friends. I wanted to give this place a chance and I wanted to like it but seriously, WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER ENCOUNTERED. I have had servers forget to order my food, forget to bring drinks, i have even sat at the bar and been ignored for a good ten minutes while the bartender paced back and forth, and did i mention that my guest and I were the ONLY people at the bar? He didn't even drop menus for us and then proceeded to greet us with the VERY FRIENDLY "what do you want" - Are you kidding me? The staff here is completely incompetent and whenever anyone asks where i have had the worst dining experience in SF i do not hesitate to say Burger Bar, but then again, what was i expecting from a place that is situated above Macy's. Gross.
author: Michelle K.

description: Tasty burger restaurant where you can build your own burger with every imaginable topping.....I had a Kobe burger on Chibata w/ caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon & a fried egg. They also serve their fries (regular or sweet potato) in a cute mini fryer basket. I do think that the burgers are small (perfect for me, but maybe small for the bf). Great views of Union Square if you can snag a table at the right time. Haven't tried the desserts, but they looked tasty!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Burger Bar is on the 6th Floor of the Macy's building, which is cool cause it over looks Union Square.  Last time I was at Burger Bar I chose one of their pre designed burgers and I didn't love it.  I was frankly disappointed. (http://lafoodgod.blogspot.com/2009/11/burger-bar-ahhhhhh-las-vegas-part-2.html )  This time I decided to build my own.  I started with the Country Natural Beef $10.50, I added Coleslaw $3, jalapenos $.65, pepper jack cheese $.95, peppered bacon $1.15 and chipotle aioli $.45 on a ciabatta bun.  I also added fries for $3.35  The burger was fantastic, absolutly great.  The meat tasted great and held together well.  The bun was perfect and the toppings were everything they needed to be.  Burger Bar totally redeemed itself from my first visit.  I did have a few issues with Burger Bar.  The too cool for school tatted up bartender was a moron and knew nothing about the food or beers they offered and my burger was cooked medium not medium rare like I requested.  The larger issue is this burger was definitily one of the top 10 I've ever had but it was also $20.05 before a drink, tax and tip.  By the time I was out of Burger Bar I had dropped $35 plus on a burger fries and one beer.  That's kinda a lot.  Too much even for a great burger.

-LAFoodGod
author: John S.

description:
I was super excited to eat here.  It's Hubert Keller's place!  BUT....pretty much every part of my burger was lacking.

The toppings -  the best part so we can start there.  But it's not called Toppings Bar, it's called Burger Bar.  The jalepeno bacon was awesome.  They had pickled green tomatoes which I was stoked on.  But they weren't slices, they were more like wedges you would put on a salad.  How am I supposed to eat that on a burger?

The bun - if it was bread served before a meal with butter it would have been tasty, but as a burger bun it was way too dense and thick

So by the time you add the thickness of these tomato wedges, the bun and now my least favorite part, the burger, it was impossible to eat this thing.  The burger wasn't flattened enough so it was barely over half the size of the bun and was so thick I had to cut it.  The grind on it was so large that when I cut it, it basically turned to ground beef on my plate.  Gross.  The meat seemed to be good quality and had good flavor BUT was over salted and overcooked.  My medium rare burger had absolutely no pink.  

The service - our server was nice and was working hard and seemed to be efficient enough, but had WAY to big of a section.  I don't know if someone called out sick and no one would cover or what, but good thing I didn't want to send my over cooked burger back because after we got our food we never had her attention until we got our check.
author: McKenzie M.

description:
I went to BB for lunch this past Saturday with a friend even though I knew it was going to be a bit pricy, but I wanted to try the burgers. I had the buffalo burger and my friend had the organically sustained burger and we had the alcoholic milk shakes for dessert .... Delicious!

The service was good and the staff was very nice and we didn't have to wait, I would definitely go there again and recommend it to friends! And the view of Union Square from BB is awesome.
author: G A.

description:
If I were to rate the service and scene, I would rate 5 stars. The waitress was very attentive, sometimes too attentive, sometimes coming over once every two minutes (I guess it was a slow night). The scene is extremely nice overlooking San Francisco. 

The burgers were just OK, I've tasted much better at Fuddruckers and perhaps even at local mom and pop burger joints. The bread was cooked fresh, but the burger didn't leave me craving for more.

My conclusion is that this is a place nice to visit, just once.
author: Anthony T.

description:
We went on a Saturday night for a friend's birthday. We knew it would be busy since it just opened recently, and with a party of eight, we knew there could be a significant wait. We were told it would take about 45 minutes to seat us, which was fine -- but in the end it was more like 15 minutes. Excellent! I guess we got lucky that two adjoining tables happened to open up simultaneously.

Since it was a birthday, we decided to splurge and go all out. I got the kobe beef hamburger with "fat fries" (aren't all fries fattening?) and a mint chocolate chip milkshake, which includes creme de menth (I think ... some sort of alcohol, at least).

My kobe beef was excellent, but a little too rare. I ordered medium rare and another friend ordered medium. Both of ours seemed pretty rare. Maybe it's the style to cook kobe on the rare side? It seemed to only be that way for those of us who ordered the kobe beef. Anyway, it was excellent but I would probably err more on the cooked side by ordering a medium or medium well in the future.

I *love* that some of their milkshakes include alcohol. But it's not a lot. I really wanted to be able to change my FB status to say that I was getting tipsy on a milkshake, but the truth is, I'd probably explode if I drank enough milkshakes to get a buzz. However, the sugar rush had me trembling. That was one decadent shake! Another friend got a beer float. Not root beer, real beer. Actually, it sounds rather gross to me, but he enjoyed it. 

One friend who came with us is vegan. (I know, why would a VEGAN go to burger bar? Because it was a birthday and that was the plan.) For people who don't eat red meat, there are many other options like salmon, lobster, and chicken. For vegetarians, there are other veggie burger options, but they include cheese so they aren't appropriate for vegans. There were a few vegan options, but they included some ingrediants that my friend didn't care for (like eggplant). But here's the thing: my friend told the waitress what sorts of things she liked and the chef whipped up something custom just for her. Now that's excellent service!

Speaking of service -- yeah, it was slow, but it was a super busy Saturday night with long waits. Any new, popular upscale restaurant would have the same experience. And you have to treat Burger Bar like an upscale restaurant, not a regular burger joint.

I really wanted to try the chocolate burger for dessert, but we brought birthday cupcakes and we were already about to explode. Next time -- and there will be a next time -- I'll try to save room for it.
author: Kevin G.

description:
I went here to drown my sorrows in one of their famous twinkie shakes because Louis Vuitton was sold out of the bag I had set my heart on. However I remembered that it was lent, and I had given up all sweets for 46 days! 
instead my lunch companions and I had burgers and fries. Deep fried pickles, deep fried zucchini, and sweet potato fries to be exact! I only ate the deep fried stuff and it wasn't bad. My lunch companions had the veggie burger and a bacon cheeseburger. Both burgers were just "ok" according to my lunch dates.
I was a bit annoyed when my server charged my card for another tables bill. If I didn't check the receipt and just signed it, I would have never known. Yes mistakes happen, but don't let me catch it and correct you. He apologized and voided the transaction and charged me for the correct amount. This did not make up for the fact that he was nonexistent to us during the meal. I felt like i had to hunt him down and yell for him to come by our table when we needed an extra napkin.
The view was great and I think that's all I can really say about this place.
author: N T.

description:
I was confused.

A1 Steak Sauce has no business in any classy restaurant, let alone a Hubert Keller establishment. Something must be awry.

I decided to go basic -- Kobe beef burger without all the frills. Couple that with a chocolate shake. That should have been a winning combo.

However, the beef was not particularly flavorful nor moist. The whole wheat bun was dry. Oh and the shake -- it never showed up because apparently the kitchen was "really backed up." Not a good sign.

That said, I will be back. They'll work out the kinks; I'll get the Hubert Keller Burger next time and all will be right in the world. I just hope they get rid of the A1.
author: Dan V.

description:
This place is full of average at a premium price. The service was pathetic  for Sanfran and when I spoke to the childlike GM she offered no reasonable explanation. I work in the industry and will NEVER be back!!
Tip: Tell the french chef to stick to that because his American effort is quite average. Pearls around the corner is much more delicious for 1/3 of the price.
author: Charles S.

description: Been here a few times already.  The first couple of times it was great, but after that it lost its excitement.  Service got worse every time I've been back and the burgers don't taste as great as the first time.
author: Gordon C.

description: Easily seated in a booth after walking in at 6PM last night. Server was great. Had the kobe burger. Felt the burger was ok but not worth the price. The roll was very disappointing..especially for a place which features burgers. The bread pudding with vanilla ice cream was excellent. Feel the burgers at Gott in Ferry Building and high end burger at Wayfare Tavern much better. Not worth a return trip for us.
author: Larry F.

description: Nice spot and we were lucky to get a window seat, its an awesome view! Food is pricey tho. Onion rings were on hit! No dos equis =( I've heard the $30 burger is worth it, maybe I'll try it one day.
author: SANDY M.

description: A friend of mine and I had lunch here today.  Never been here before and never heard of it before.  No doubt . . . the best burger I have had in recent memory.  Waitress was terrific, flat screen in our booth and no wait.  Burger Bar hit me in a 5-star way.  I'm going back for sure.
author: Paul M.

description: Another perfect meal at Burger Bar - had the surf n' turf burger, the BF tried the blackjack... we finished our meals, not a crumb left on the plate! So good, we went for dessert.  Delicious!
author: Valeria D.

description: After shopping at Macy's, we went for an early Sunday dinner at Burger Bar. We were seated right away, no long wait, and the server was super attentive and nice. Food was good, what you'd expect from a burger restaurant. Best part though was the milkshake. Cookies and cream was great, not too huge and not so sweet that your mouth got sugar burn out. We ended up splitting it and it was a perfect dessert for two. Only incovenience was we finished dinner after Macy's closed, so had to go down in the one tiny elevator that was packed and took awhile. Otherwise this is a good, reliable eating stop in Union  Square.
author: Linda K.

description:
In all fairness I gave this place a try on two separate occasions.  The first time my experience was awful!  There was available seating in the bar area but the hostess would not let us (a party of 2) sit at the raised tables.  We waited for 15 mins and were seated at the worst tables in the restaurant. They put us in the hallway between the main dining room and the bar.  This area was too dark and made it hard to read the menu.  It seemed as if these tables were never supposed to be here based on the lighting.  After being seated we watch as a party walks up and the hostess lets them sit immediately in the section that I had just asked about.  We order...Food comes... my order was correct and my burger was good.  My friend was given the wrong bun on his burger so they took it back and changed it.  Yes they changed it but they gave him a cold bun that was not heated or toasted in any way.  By the time they brought it back the burger was cold.  Service was lacking at best.

Maybe my first experience was a fluke as the restaurant had only been open for a few months.  We returned for a second chance.  There was no one waiting when I got there so we were seated almost immediately.  The milk shake that the waitress told me had no tree nuts in fact did.  Thankfully I did not have an allergic reaction!  She exchanged it for another.  Both my shake and my friends were horrible!  They were no where close to thick.  Both "milkshakes" were more like chunky flavored melted ice cream.  Again, service was lacking at best.

In conclusion, Burger Bar is over priced for the quality of food they serve.  The concept of the menu is good but they are unable to execute this with any success.  The milkshakes are the worst and most expensive I've ever had!  I gave it a try twice and both times were EPIC FAILURES!  Will not return.
author: Brian L.

description:
"you really need to savor this flesh, the way flesh should be savored......"

Burger Bar has a lot of definite pluses, as well as some serious growing pains to get over.  Is it worth a trip - absolutely.  Best burger of your life, probably not, but then I do not think that is the point.  

It's taken me a while to get a table, a few weeks as I have better things to do than wait.  Third time was the charm for me, having tried opening night and of course not having a chance at all of getting in.  But on a quieter Monday 2 weeks in I finally did get a table.

I opted for the sliders, and it was a good decision.  3 burgers, Buffalo with caramelized onions, Black Angus & Country Beef.   All are good, but the Country Beef is special.  I haven't a clue what they feed those cows, but it has to be some tasty crack because this is a damn fine baby burger.  When I come back I am having the full sized version, without condiments I would advise, you really need to savor this flesh, the way flesh should be savored...

What better way to savor but with Chocolate.  The milkshake bar is sic.  I could gain at least 4 rolls on my belly tasting each one....my advice is to share.  I had the nutella shake, yes, the nutella shake, topped with whole hazelnuts and chocolate whipped cream.  Freakin thing must have at least a billion calories, so it counting is your thing, its not for you.  But for those of you into some decadence with your savoring, this is better than Agent Provocateur.

The down side to all this decadence, along with the weight you are going to gain, is the price. I mean sweet jebus there is a $60 Burger on the menu!  Even the sliders were almost $13 for three teeny tinys.  I like my lunches under 10 when I am not bringing something from home, so clearly if you want a bargain bite type thing this aint your joint.  But for a upper crust kind of burger experience, there is no place in down town SF like it, like any good indulgence and worth the splurge.
author: Helmut S.

description: Haven't had the food yet but it took 12 minutes to get a waiter to our table... Didn't even give us a "Be there in a sec" nod of recognition. On top of that, I had to ask the hostess to tell him we were waiting. Could have been here all night.
author: Debra K.

description: I've been in Cali all week for work and feel like I've eaten my way up the west coast!  Staying in Union Square and shopping at Macy's when I stumbled upon in-store restaurant Burger Bar.  I was in the mood for casual and low maintenance, and it fit the ticket.  There is literally not much else on the menu except burgers, but they also have veggie, turkey, and chicken as options.  I got the turkey burger with grilled onions, and pepper jack and Monterey Jack cheeses with curly fries (they have at least 6 different types of fries to choose from.). The burger came out suspiciously quick, leading me to presume the patty was precooked.  Despite that it was average/good and not too dry.  The curly fries were really good!  I also noticed the couple next to me ordered beef burgers an they came out super quick as well.  I think this restaurant could move up to 4 stars if they grilled each burger fresh to order instead of pre-cooking.  It was an ok meal though for a good price and great view over looking San Francisco's Union Square.
author: Christine L.

description:
Union Square at lunch during the Christmas shopping season can be a little crazy, so we came here partly for convenience of location, and we were curious to try it. Everything looked and sounded great, but it kind of fell short on delivery. 

Pros: Best part of my burger was the sauce I ordered on the side, the red wine shallot reduction. That with caramelized onions, was awesome.  I ended up just dipping my fries in it; I liked that better than the burger.  It's because of that sauce I gave this 3 stars. Also, service was really great and accommodating for our large family even when they were really busy.  Lastly, the nutella dessert burger sounds and looks strange, but we were curious so we tried it. It was so good. It's definitely a novelty, but it was tasty. 

Cons: All of the fries we got were disappointing except the skinny fries. The others were cold and mushy. They tasted frozen. The onion rings were pretty good though. 
For me the biggest disappointment was the kids meal. My son is not a big meat eater, so I ordered a grilled cheese. It was literally two end pieces of a loaf of bread with american cheese in between not even melted. Not even grilled! I ended up asking for butter so at least he would have bread and butter to eat while we ate. It was seriously that lame of a grilled cheese.  

So, you may like this place for convenience and that it's good for families and large groups, but overall SF has many tasty restaurants at the same price point that I would rather eat at.
author: Rhonda R.

description:
Heard raves about this place, but the experience was VERY BAD in terms of food AND service. 

First, they said 5-10 min wait. We waited in their empty dining room, watching football with many other people. We had seen them come in and call other parties around us. After 20 minutes, we asked them how far along we were, only to realize they had crossed our name off the list. 

Next, after ordering 2 burgers and some hot tea, took 20 minutes to just get hot water and 45 minutes to get burgers (one beef, one veggie). We ordered the burger rare...

Each booth had a TV to entertain us while we were waiting for the meal. This was very good...except after football was over, it switch to cartoon cats for half an hour. We asked them to change the channel for us. They enthusiastically agreed to, but when the waiter left, it never happened. I guess he forgot. We stared longingly at other TVs playing "5th Quarter". 

The burgers were not good. Beef was over salted and veggie had no flavor at all. If we weren't so hungry from the wait, we would not have eaten them. Very dissapointing. We would have sent them back, but then who knows when we will get fed. At this point we no longer trusted them.

Busers were very quick about taking away our plates and cleaning up. However, not once did the waitress ever come back to fill our water. She avoided eye contact with us. She was very nice when she took our order though...just not aware of anything the guest might need after that.

Lighting was weird...would get really bright and really dark in 2 minute cycles for 5-10 minutes. Eventually it calmed down. 

When asking for the check, I asked for a comment card to let the owner know about our experiences here. I don't normally do that, because I don't like to cause a scene. She said there were no comment cards, or other way to communicate with the manager or owner at the moment, but offered us a business card instead to send a letter. It did not occur to ask her if I wanted to comment on a good or bad experience. I felt she did not care.

At that point, I decided since they cannot not convince me to return to this restaurant, I cannot help myself from warning others to stay away from this place. STAY AWAY!!!!!
author: Judy C.

description: quick seating, poor service, decent food with great views.  The slow, disinterested service nearly drove us to leave.  Chef Keller should spend some time judging his own Burger Bar and less time on Top Chef.
author: D S.

description: We stopped by for happy hour during Game 1 of the World Series. Yes the food is overpriced but that's expected. The happy hour deals are great.  The sliders are really flavorful, wings spicy but nothing to write about, and the drink specials are well made. My experience with kobe ground up hamburgers have been a disappointment no matter where I ate. Thank god I ordered the truffle sauce added a nice earthy element to the burger. Come here for happy hour.
author: Randell C.

description: Good burgers but way overpriced.  Not worth the money in my opinion. A cheap glass of malbec for $10 and $9 for a milkshake? ? ? The burgers easily go over 20 bucks when adding cheese and fries.
author: R B.

description: Great portobello burger and the sweet potato fries were delic, the angus burger was cooked to order and tasted fine. Only drawback was the technobeat, not very conducive for a quiet meal.
author: Don M.

description:
Went here on New Year's Day, got there early to get a table and was told about 1/2 hour.  At first the hostess was going to seat us at the very first bar table right next to the hostess stand, but since it was noisy and crowded there asked for a table further in.  This extended our wait another 15 mins.  

As for the burgers, ordered the build your own, they were very good but did feel it just wasn't the best bang for the buck.  Onion rings were very good.  Had to try to shakes, got one build your own and the sampler (which I misunderstood the waiter, thought it was 3 small ones but turned out to be 2 each of the 3 flavors - so it turned out to be too much to drink.  Shakes were good but not out of this world.  Service was decent.  Overall gave it 3 stars, good but nothing to make me return.
author: Jimbo Y.

description:
So I signed up for Yelp because I needed to write a review for this place!  AMAZING!  I had read up on the boards about it and was looking forward to it, but those who wrote negative before now are truly not foodies!

This is now the second time that I have been into Burger Bar and I can tell you that each time was better than before.  I do food for a living- yes I know you are jealous- but I can tell you that you truly get what you pay for.  Definitely not over priced AT ALL for the quality, service, and view and you leave knowing you had a GREAT meal!

I ordered a Kobe burger which showed up at the perfect temperature on this gorgeous sourdough bun with all the trimings.  My husband ordered a buffalo burger and added jalapeno bacon... YUM!

We had sides of deep fried jalapeno pickles and fat fries which were brilliant and definitely not "too greasy or fried" which is so rare these days.  Be sure to order the dessert, the milkshakes are perfect to share!

Met Chef Hubert Keller, who is often in the restaurant and really pleasant as well as introduced myself to the new Exec Chef Ladas who has some kudos as well to his name.  Great guy and great connection between them.  Definitely taking this place up a few notches in my book!
author: Sarah R.

description: Champion place!!!!! Incredible. The chef actually came out and shook my hand, and he was way younger and cooler than what I was expecting by the quality of the food. The view? Breathtaking, the service? Flawless. Heck, the beer list alone is worth the stop and fellas, where else can you have a perfect pint with the game on while your girl can hunt down just the right shade of raspberry pumps to go with that little number that hugs her in all the right places, all in the same dang store!!! I mean seriously the new chef's rocking the kitchen, the food's off the hook, and she can shop while you chill! Awesome!!!
author: Sean R.

description:
i am really pissed that i didn't see Hubert Keller.

i got the sliders.  they were decent.  nothing spectacular.  there are definitely better burger joints in SF, but it will do the trick for you in a pinch (i.e., you're too lazy to venture out of Macy's to find some food).

the shakes were tasty (although i think it's funny that the shakes cost about as much as a burger), but, again, nothing spectacular.

the fries were not great.  come on, Hubert, train your staff to make some awesome fries...i knows you French and stuff...represent, homie.

service was very friendly.

anyway, it was an okay meal.
author: Miss P.

description:
I have to admit, after reading the reviews I was skeptical.  You can buy a burger on pretty much any street corner, so I knew going in that it needed to be a kick-ass burger.  It was.

We got there at 6pm on a Saturday and were seated right away.  The service was good.  I had the Angus burger, medium-rare, with provolone cheese, caramelized onions, red wine and shallot reduction sauce, on ciabatta bread.  With a beer and sweet potato fries it was $30, and worth every penny.
author: Tighe H.

description: If it weren't for the fries & drinks arriving quickly I would have given this place zero stars!  We waited an hour and a half to get our burgers, tables that came after us were served before us but not much. Once we got the food it was horrible!  My sons sliders were charred on both sides, totally unedible. My veggie burger was terrible. The servers were clueless & managers weren't much better. The ladies bathrooms were out of toilet paper!  We will never go back!
author: anne f.

description: I went here to catch part of the Celtics game and get a bite to eat a few weeks ago.  They have a great happy hour special for food and drinks with lots of good beers on tap.  My friend saw Hubert Keller leaving the restaurant but unfortunately I was too busy devouring my sliders and "skinny fries" that I only saw the end of his pony tail.
author: Misty L.

description: Not worth it. $16 for a burger that doesn't taste any better than a Double Double at In-N-Out. Don't even get me started on the $60 burger. Ridunkulous. I liked the sweet potato fries but I won't be coming back here ever. However, I enjoyed the bird's eye view of Union Square. =)
author: Jenny T.

description: First thing, I read some of the other peoples reviews and I have to say that the service for me everytime I have gone was always good. When the burger was put in front of me I wasnt sure what was so special about this place until I took a bite. I fell in love with the burger bar after my first bite.
author: Colin H.

description: Just had the worst experience at The Burger Bar in San Francisco Union Square Macy's. Our food was not put in to the kitchen and our server blamed it on the kitchen being backed up. We told him already we were short on time and asked for the check. The manager came out after we complained again since they brought us the wrong food and check. The manager offer to bring us salads, which was not acceptable. Said sorry and left the table. The server avoided us on our way out. They should of offered a free entree so that we would try the restaurant again. I will not go back!
author: Marsha F.

description: Two friends went to Burger Bar yesterday and they both had the Rossini; they also said it was the best burger they've ever had. Mind you, it doesn't have tomatoes, pickles, mayo, cheese, etc., it's not that kind of burger, but damn, it's tasty.
author: Adam Z.

description:
Burgers were delicious, milkshakes were tasty, and sweet potato fries were crispy and flavorful. Everything, however, was overpriced. Fun for a city date, but not for a regular lunch spot. 

Service was okay but we had to hunt down our server to pay so that we could pay and leave.
author: Sacramento M.

description:
My wife and I were visiting San Francisco from Las Vegas and found ourselves in Union Square.  While in Macys we noticed that there was a Burger Bar. Having never been to the one back home (Vegas) we decided to have dinner there.  The food was great, i ate the Kobe Burger and my wife, a vegetarian, had the veggie burger. The waiter informed us about their famous milkshakes, and explained to us that they have a dedicated milkshake maker.  We had a Nutella milkshake...WOW.

To sum it up, we had a great time.  The atmosphere and view were very  nice, the wait wasn't too bad given how crowded it was, and i never had to ask to have my diet coke refilled.  We will definitely be eating here again.

**update** We moved to San Francisco (Job relocation) and have since stopped in to the Burger bar for a milkshake.
author: Sean H.

description: Came here on a recommendation from a coworker and my burger was pretty darned good. Our server was friendly and efficient, our burgers took a while to come out. I had the Angus beef burger on a focaccia roll with bacon and blue cheese cooked medium rare. It was cooked to perfection, juicy and nom nom nom.basically. We ordered french fries. Super sad sad limpy cold and sad french fries. Don't order the french fries. not nom nom nom.
author: Kristen E.

description:
Yesterday went along with some office buddies, we have offices across the street. 

i was disappointed since this is a Top Chef / Legendary SF Chef's Hubert Keller's restaurant.

Ambiance: Expecting a top notch experience - found the ambiance - generic - chain restaurant look.

Prices: YIKES! please it's located inside a Macy's - a mall like experience.
Come on - $8.00 for milk shakes! 

Condiments are GENERIC - available at any chain supermarket. Expected some great condiments -- even the street food vendors offer better than the Heinz ketchup and mustard.

Step up Mr. Keller! 

We ordered the sliders - fine,,,,but no fireworks...

Keep your $$$ and go up Post Street to Pearl's burgers for less $$ that's been featured on Food Network - Best Burgers favored by Tyler Florence. 


Sweet potatoes very good -- but sparse serving.
author: Liz D.

description: Food sounds better than it actually is. But the service was good. Wouldn't come back again though.
author: Linda T.

description: Very unimpressive. The food was okay. Nothing special but maybe it's my fault for not ordering the $60 burger. The service was terrible. I won't ramble on about how rude and uninterested my server was but I will share one gem: my quest for utensils. I ordered a side salad with my entree and when the food arrived i realized that I had no utensils. Looked around and could not find  any servers. Five to ten minutes later, someone walked by and I flagged her down and asked for a fork. She looked confused, said ok, then disappeared. Maybe five minutes later she walked by but didn't stop. A few minutes after that, my server came by to see how the food was. I asked him for utensils. He looked confused and said ok and walked away. About a minute later, some other guy came by with utensils for me. Now, I'm really not sure whose job it is to make sure that the customers have utensils but I don't think it's a difficult task to accomplish. I work in an office and my job description doesn't include cleaning the kitchen but if I'm in there and notice a spill on the counter, I will wipe it up because, you know what, it's not rocket science. Similarly, if a paying customer asks for a fork, just go get it. It's not rocket science.
author: Peggy N.

description: I've been a repeat customer in LV. Brought the family to check it out, very disappointed to be turned away at 9:30 in the evening (several open tables) I know it's busy during the holidays but really no one dines late in SF? I think I need to find a new burger restaurant oh wait there's like a million of them. Sorry burger bar you lost a fan tonight.
author: Joshua S.

description: Great concept, service was a little on the raw side, but overall, I was able to get the burger I wanted with all the fixings I wanted for a great hangover! The skinny fries were fabulous and the Twinkie milkshake was a bit more on the vanilla side than twinkie. I'd come back again if I was in the area, but of course there are tons more places in the city to eat great burgers!
author: Tara H.

description:
I don't have anything negative to say really.  I've read people complaining how there are only a few tables with a view, but as a local this is really not a problem.  The "non view" tables have little tvs in them, which is a nice touch.
My burger was so good I took the bun off halfway through so that I could just taste the meat alone!
Ladies beware, the female servers here are CUTE  ( I think its a requirement) so you may catch your date's eyes wandering...
author: Jes G.

description: This should be, and could be, a great place.   The burgers are high quality.  BUT, have been there 3 times and two times, the service was horrible and the burgers and fries cold.  Guess they must feel like it is a one time tourist visit -who cares?  I would.........That's is for us and our friends.
author: Carolyn D.

description: since the restaurant was crowded and in a popular location, I didn't have a problem waiting 40 minutes because we could shop for a little while; however, upon being seated, the poor service begun.  it took over 10 minutes to even be greeted by a waiter, who did not introduce himself, which is why I can't place a name on this review.  we then received water, which was never refilled.  Even when I tried to get somebody's attention, simply getting more water proved to be difficult.  after we placed our order, we were completely ignored (and still sans water) until our food was brought by someone else, who placed our food down in front of the wrong people without speaking a word.  when we asked for a side of mayonnaise and more place settings, he looked at me, walked away and never returned.  we had to ask two other people until we got the side of mayonnaise and place settings.  on top of the awful service, and decent (at best) food, the cherry on top of this annoying experience was the fact that the host and hostess were constantly speaking Spanish to each other (I could hear since we were seated right by the podium).  this is definitely not an acceptable restaurant practice, as people will always assume they're being talked about, especially when they are.  in my case, after the third time we asked for mayonnaise, I heard them talk about how annoying we were as customers in Spanish (I am fluent).  speaking another language is not appropriate in this type of setting, especially when you're talking about customers two feet away, in California, where the Spanish language is so ubiquitous.  I have never left a restaurant without leaving a tip, but had no qualms about doing so for this poor and disrespectful dining experience.  clean up your act, burger barn.
author: Kevin K.

description: Yummy! Great burgers and shakes
author: Nathan O.

description: Service was great! Why a 3 star? Well, I ate the hottest burger, wasn't that hot. I have had a sauce that has burned the insides of me. And Adam Richman hasn't ate it, so it PROLLY not the "world's hottest" But great food & all.
author: Daniel B.

description: My burger was overpriced, underseasoned, and altogether unimpressive. I ordered my burger to be literally dipped in peppercorns, and it was still lacking flavor. The fries arrived cold. On top of that, when I asked the waiter for a local beer recommendation, he suggested a $10 pint of Alaskan beer. What?
author: Hayley L.

description:
I'll make this review short and sweet....

Wait for this place to get in the swing of things before you bother trying it out. It's a new place in flux right now and I can only hope the service and food improve.

To be continued....
author: Lisa J.

description: Other than the 2 stars it gets for being in SF, the burgers were overpriced and not at all tasty. You can definitely find something better.
author: Alyssa S.

description: I met Hubert Keller today as we were eating at his place. As soon as I saw him, I said hello and he actually stopped and talked to us for a few minutes. He was very friendly and my friend actually thought he knew me because he was talking to me like we'd met before. It was the highlight of my day. My friend and I came to eat here for the first time for both of us. Loved the ambience and was seated right away. We both got the Wednesday special and got the burger with mushrooms and swiss cheese for me and cheddar cheese for her. We both got sweet potato fries which was amazing. Burgers came cooked perfectly and it was delicious. Meal comes with soda, tea or coffee all for less than $12. I would definitely come here again. I love you, Hubert!
author: Julie K.

description: This place is OVERPRICED!! I heard the one in Vegas was great, but this one was not. First off it was so hot in there omg, they needed some type of air conditioning. I also felt like the tables were squished together. Here's some helpful advice, don't split a shake. You get two minature glasses, I finished mine in a few minutes. There goes $8.75! Just ask for one with two straws. My sister and I split the American burger which was almost $15, the skinny fries were bland and the burger was average. Not to mention after my meal I got a bad stomach ache we had to go to walgreens for tums. Not fun..I will not be returning.
author: Autumn B.

description: They have a great beer selection. The sliders weren't that impressive though and it almost took 30 minutes for my food to arrive...while sitting at the bar.
author: Jackson G.

description: I went with friends and family- party of 5.  I was seated a the top of the table.  4 waiters went by bumping me without saying I am sorry.  I waiter hit the back of my head with his arms raised to pass and did not say sorry.  I went to the host/hostess stand.  the host was rude to me. I asked for the manager. I spoke to her and she did not care.  Food was not great either.  I won't go.  Don't go.
author: Paul A.

description: I'm not really sure what everyone is whining about.  I had a great experience at Burger Bar.  The bartender, Rudy, was extremely friendly and introduced me to what is now my favorite red zinfandel.  The burger was great and the buttermilk zucchini fries are phenomenal.  I would certainly recommend this spot to anyone visiting - or living in San Francisco.
author: Amanda Z.

description: This is between 3 and 4 stars in my opinion. I'm only rating this on the veggie burger. It is huge and decently priced. The other burgers are overly expensive and the meat eaters I've been with have been less than impressed with them. Other than that, their veggie burgers are yummy and I like that you can pick and choose whatever you want on it. It's super filling too - I can barely finish half. It isn't vegan friendly though - the veggie burger has cheese in it already. They do offer a vegan sandwich though. I haven't tried it yet, because I don't think it would be worth it. So if you're craving a yummy, filling veggie burger with some beer then this is the place to come.
author: Andrea N.

description:
In a nutshell: Really good burgers, but the service is not quite up to par yet. 

Service issue #1: we were told that the wait would be 15-20 minutes, but it turned out to be a 35 minute wait. Had we known of the actual wait time, it might have prompted us to return on a day when our tummies would have been more forgiving of the wait (we were starving). In addition, they seated a couple that arrived after us before we were seated. We were also a party of 2 so I can only presume we got skipped. When I went up to the hostess booth to inquire, they seated us immediately. 

Service issue #2: Our burgers were put on the wrong plates. That is, my burger was served with the side order that my husband ordered, and his burger was on the plate that had my side of fries. Thankfully we figured this out before they whisked the plates back to the kitchen. 

Service issue #3: My husband ordered a beer when our food came and the waitress forgot about it. We managed to flag her down about 3/4 of the way into his burger to ask her about it. She promptly got him his beer and apologized. 

Lucky for them, the burgers and the skinny fries were super tasty. This saved the day. 

Our server was nice and guided us appropriately with our order. The forgotten beer was the only issue. 

The host approached us at the end of the meal and apologized for our wait time, so I appreciated that he recognized. 

BTW - our check came out to $50 for two burgers with sides, two sodas and a Shiner Bock. Definitely on the pricey side for a burger lunch, so just be aware of that. 

Like many others on Yelp, we love Chef Keller and FDL. We are glad that the food here is good and hope that the service will catch up soon.
author: Marcela R.

description:
For the people whining that their burgers (which they ordered medium or medium-rare!) have some red in the middle... are you kidding? Order it well-done and shut up about it already.

And for the people whining about prices, go to McDonald's and eat inferior, hormone-filled meat and continue to wonder why your daughters are starting puberty at age 10.

Enough already!
author: Dimitri S.

description:
I'm not a burger fan, but this place is really good. Been here quite a few times and it has never disappointed me.
They have a lunch menu which has a different burger each day.
I love the Salmon burger with roasted vegetables and the Hubert Keller, the place's signature burger, is really good.
Its a bit expensive, considering they're just burgers
author: carla f.

description: Update!   I've gone back a few times with friends (our latest excursion included 20 people).  Service was quick and accurate for each visit, although I'd take into consideration the fact that each visit was for an early lunch. Regardless, the food is still consistently good (the milkshakes are a must too!) and I'll still come in for my burger fix.
author: Kat L.

description: Good view, blah food and just okay service. The buffalo burger was okay. The lobster on surf and turf burger was overcooked. If you want a delicious burger, go to pearls down the street A&R jones and post. Burger Bar is overpriced.
author: Rebecca B.

description: So many mistakes at such a simple place.  This should be easy for Top Chef Keller.  Very slow to seat even though there were empty tables galore. Half cooked burgers, soggy fries. Food came very fast but was under cooked. Burger vegi's were old and limp. Wrong Shake was delivered and was stuffed with whip cream and undrinkable. Individual staff except hostess was friendly but food was a waste of money. I'd pass on this place in future.
author: Cornelius G.

description: The burgers are solid and the different toppings with Fleur de Lys sauces are an interesting add to the menu.  The extensive draft list however, is the icing on the cake.  Despite this, I haven't had a spectacular burger but I may not be ordering the right thing.  I'll try something different next time with gourmet toppings.  Thus, the third star isn't necessarily due to the fact that the food is phenomenal, but because the restaurant is in a fantastic location.
author: Love P.

description:
Dissapointing.  I have been looking forward to going to Burger Bar after seeing the incredible photos on their website.  My group of three ordered a buffalo burger, veggie burger, a regular beef burger, sweet potato fries and fat fries.  Unfortunately, the evening started with bad service.  One waitress showed up promptly, took the drink order and dissapeared for a good 15 min.  Then another waitress showed up and asked if we would like drinks.  We told her we had ordered already.  She skirted off too.  There was some confusion as to who's table we were and about 30 minutes into it, we got our drinks.  Secondly, the food was just so so.  The burgers are pretty, but the taste is flat.  I had the veggie burger.  On the menu, it was described well and sounded scrumptious.  I can tell you that the veggie patty sub at Subway has more flavor and you can get a foot long with all the toppings for $7.  

I wouldn't go back.  There are many burger joints in the city where you can get a tasty meat or veggie burger for less and with better service.
author: Rex S.

description:
so this is actually a 3.5 star review.

i came here today because by *stupid f'n* law school decided it would be cool to set a fire drill for the friday morning before finals. glad to see my 40k a year is going to good planning...

well actually i decided to spend the morning out to avoid the fire drill, and being a poor law school student, my morning consisted mostly of window shopping.  it is amazing how big of an appetite you work up walking from store to store, coming a mere synapse connection from purchasing that, oh so necessary, item of clothing.  i decided that i needed lunch.  i have been wanting to go to burger bar for a while and since i am going to be spending the next three months in chicago, i figured there is no better time to go then now.

**I KNEW WALKING IN THAT I WAS GOING TO BE SPENDING WAAAAAAAY TOO MUCH MONEY ON THIS LUNCH** but, truth be told, if there is one thing that i like to spend money on, more than clothes, its food. (yelpers of the world, unite!).  i came when they first opened. 11 am.  there was no wait. i got sat in the best seat in the house (the absolute center view of union square).  things were going real well.

it was still early, so i was kind of in the mood for a "breakfast burger".  i chose swiss cheese, bacon, sauteed onions, portabella mushrooms and a fried egg on ciabatta bread (on recommendation from the server).  i ordered it medium rare. (i figured if this was "sustainable beef ground fresh 2x daily i could afford it bloody). i also ordered a side of fried zucchini and a beer.

when the burger came i immediately noticed that it looked amazing. (and the side of fried zucchini looked tiny).  to be honest, the ciabatta was not really fresh.  it kind of fell apart a bit (even before i cut into the egg--which i will get to in a minute).  the burger really looked good though. there was a little bit of blood juice at the bottom, which i think is amazing nowadays when so many places are too gd afraid to serve you a burger with a bit of blood. (SEE PICS)

i cut into the burger and the egg burst (just as it should).  i took my first bite and i was in semi-bliss.  it was one of the best burger bites i have had in the city (or anywhere).  the meat was juicy. the bacon was thick cut and a tad bit chewy (yea i do not like super crisp, burnt to the core bacon on my burger, thank you, so i enjoyed the fact that it had a good bite to it, but didnt taste overcooked).  the egg was PERFECT. 'nuff said.  the veggies were there. they didnt add much (and for like 2.50 i thought they should have played a more substantial role...)  the fried zucchini were the second best i have had in my life (behind, only, burgertown usa in redlands).  what can i say? the food was really good. not amazing but really f'n good.

now the important part. the whole meal cost me like 35 bucks. more than id like to admit.  the burger was 21 bucks on its own. do i honestly think it was a $21 burger? no. it wasnt.  it was one of the best burgers i have had. but i also consider in-n-out's $5 burger to be one of the best i have ever had (now i know i am comparing apples and oranges-but still...)  i enjoyed it but it wasnt life altering. (the fact that the only life altering burger here would cost about 75 dollars kind of scares me).

i will probably come back. to experience that $75 burger at one point in my life.  will i come back to eat here otherwise... up in the air. depends on how badly i want a semi overpriced burger that tastes great and a place that offers me an amazing view of one of the nicest places in sf.  (yea. i guess when i am trying to impress a girl-but then again, isnt that what gary danko is for?)
author: Jason B.

description:
This review is more like a 2-2.5 star rating for me.  I went for the second time earlier this week and was disappointed with my experience.  It's a combination of things that led to my rating and they're coming from both occasions.  For the most part my breakdown is pretty simple:
-1 for price.
-1 for service.
-1 for cold fries.
+2 stars because the few times I came to Burger Bar I enjoyed my burger.

To begin with I think the location of Burger Bar is awesome.  Hubert couldn't have picked a better place but the restaurant itself is too cramped and gives off a feel of some cheap pub; it is awkwardly split in half with the hostess stand smacked in the middle.  I came here during Christmas, both times, so it was quite festive inside.  The dining area to the left is nice because it overlooked the big tree and ice skating area.  The second time around we were seated to the right of the hostess stand on the other end of the restaurant.  I wasn't a big fan of this spot because it was just dark and drab looking.

Anyway my first time here, and to burger bar in general, was just horrible.  I wasn't too hungry and decided to go for their sliders with sweet potato fries.  The food itself was ok but I had issues with service.  The bitch seemed like she hated her damn job.  She kept rushing me to order and was obviously annoyed with the questions I was asking her.  Sorry if it was my first time there!  I'll ask all the damn questions I want.  Anyhow my fries freaking came out cold so I sent them back and asked for a new one.  She was pissed about this but I don't care.. don't bring me out cold fries, you fool!

Fast forward to Christmas 2010, a year later.  I really didn't think I was going to be giving Burger Bar my business anymore but I went to the one in Vegas and enjoyed my burger so I thought I'd give this one another shot.  Service was better but still not the best.  My sister and I split a build your own burger and added a side order of sweet potato fries and fried zuchinni.  My BF built his burger as well and added a side of sweet potato.  When our food came out we had a small asss portion of sweet potato fries on each of our plates and like six small pieces of zucchini.  It was a what the fuck??? moment, i kid you not.  How dare they send out these three side orders in that fashion and charge me an additional $12!!!  I brought this up to the waitress's attention and she brings me out ONE full order of COLD sweet potato fries- this brought back a past memory.  Anyway, then comes the bill and here I get charged for THREE full orders of sides when they only really brought me out 1.5.  I mentioned it to the girl and she took out one of the orders, but then replied with "I thought we were cool when I brought out the extra fries".  No, homegirl.. you bringing out one full order of what was supposed to be three full orders (to begin with) does not make us cool.  She swears she did us a favor by bringing out my damn order of fries.

Service in SF and Vegas are not the best and they really need to recheck their employees and do a major sweep.  They all suck and have major attitude.  My $22 burger was not worth the price and definitely not worth paying for crap ass service as well.  I don't care if its even just $12.  I spent $22 on just a burger and an extra $8 worth of sides, thats $30 fucking dollars... give me what I order.

Oh yea, its a bitch just to get to the restaurant.  They've got this one dinky ass elevator that takes forever to take you up and down.  The both times I went it was dumb ass packed with people in line trying to get in and out of the elevator.. how annoying.  I'm just going to throw in another deduction somewhere just for this reason. haha.
author: Reg E.

description: Ok..so I've been meaning to go to this place since it opened and I was craving a burger! I first went to the Cheesecake Factory but they had a 45 minute wait so I ventured over to the Burger Bar and was seated right there and than! Bonus points! haha! I enjoyed the atmosphere and ambiance of this place. Clean, fun and entertaining! Allie my server explained the whole menu concept (which I was kinda lost on) and recommended the Black-Jack Burger which is Black Angus Beef, Monterey Jack Cheese, tapenade, tomato, lettuce on a ciabatta bun. I was in heaven eating one of seven gourmet burgers Chief Hurbert Keller has made. I can't wait to go back for another type of burger! Cheers!
author: Marco R.

description:
our party of 2 was seated promptly around 7:30 pm on a wednesday evening, no reservation was needed and i had a socialbuy coupon in hand (paid $10 for a $20 coupon)

got seated practically all the way in the back, which i didn't really appreciate. but it got the job done.

waitress was fine; nothing to brag about but no real minuses either. 

perusing the menu was slightly painful...in a good way. so many options, it was hard to pick. this is a great place if you like things customized and are picky. i ended up getting the country natural with caramelized onions and a fried egg. dont be stupid like me...do NOT squish the burger down cos the egg yolk will splash out. thankfully none of it got on me, but dang what a waste...

split an order of sweet potato fries; not bad but nothing to brag about either.

but really, the best part was the MILKSHAKE!! i believe i got a black and white milkshake..which has cookie dough in it, topped with toasted almonds and chocolate chips. this is definitely something to share since im sure there are 1500 calories in a glass. but seriously, that was the BEST milkshake ive ever had.
author: Pauline S.

description: Nice for a special occasion due to the price. But the burgers are tasty and juicy. Build your own burger or the Hubert Keller special is a great buffalo burger. Thumbs up for the Red wine shallot reduction sauce!!  Oh Yeah and the donut desserts are fab plus the Raspberry sorbet sundae is refreshing.
author: Melinda L.

description:
I came here for lunch on Black Friday since I was hungry from not eating since Thanksgiving evening and I wanted to visit Chef Keller's burger restaurant.  

I got a bonus as Chef Keller was there and he greeted all of us.  He was very gracious and it gave me an extra boost as I looked forward to trying his food.

I got a Black Angus Beef Burger, medium and a side order of fries.  The Burger was cooked just right and they toasted the buns.  It was just so good that it would digest so 'heavenly' and I enjoyed it much.

The skinny fries were very tasty, but, I was disappointed that I was given just a handful of them.  Remember that I ordered a side of them, so, I would anticipate at least an order of them.  I did not.  They were good, but, I didn't appreciate the amount that I received.

The restaurant itself is decorated well and it offers a great overview of Union Square.  I would definitely recommend this place to my family and friends.  

I recommend!
author: Edward L.

description: Veggie burger had an interesting taste, but poor consistency. Service was quick and friendly. Menu was ridiculous - confusing and poorly organized. Couldn't even figure out if things were toppings or sides. Really ridiculous. Worst part, by far, was the general feeling that the place was a flagship TGIF.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Went here recently for my friend's birthday. It was the first time eating here for all of us and unfortunately it wasn't anything great. For the prices you are charged you would expect way better. I ordered the sliders which I know are suppose to be small but these things were practically none existent. All the different meats basically tasted the same. The buffalo was the best in my opinion. My sweet potato fries came out cold. I noticed a lot of people complain about the service but that is the one area I would have to compliment. We got seated right away at a window, which my friend requested. Our server was very friendly and checked on us frequently. I don't think I will be eating at this place again unless I'm starving and no where else is open.
author: Dani L.

description: I was doing some shopping at Macy's today and wanted to check out Hubert Keller's, Burger Bar.  Popped in around 2pm and only waited about 10 minutes for a table.  It took another 10 mintues for someone to come by and take the order.  I had the Peppercorn Burger with Sweet Potato Fries.  It was tasty but not quite sure if it lived up to it's $16 price tag.  It took the order roughly 20 minutes to come out of the kitchen, which was  enough time for me to check-in on Yelp! mobile & Foursquare. After lunch, it took another 10 minutes to try and flag down a waitress to take my credit card payment.  The staff was attentive, just maybe a bit understaffed today.  I may go back to try their chocolate burger next time around.
author: Stacey L.

description: I went here yesterday for the first time. I had 30 minutes before an appointment. I sat at the bar which is not something I like to do; however, the bartender took my order quickly and told me my food would be out in 10 minutes. He brought me my check so i was able to pay for my food before it came. Talk about great service! Although I had to eat my food in less than 10 minutes, it was delicious. I highly recommend the Salmon Steak Burger.
author: Sara S.

description: We were looking for a place to eat in the area and a burger was the only thing that sounded good. Burger Bar was a bit touristy and kind of like a chillis but all in all we had a nice lunch here. I had the turkey burger with avocado on whole wheat. The avocado was too ripe and the bun was kind of dry - I wish I picked a different bun. The sweet potatoes fries were tasty and the service was quick. Our table overlooked Union square so that was nice. Only had to wait 5-10mins for a table.
author: J W.

description: Some of the best burgers I've had in San Francisco. If you get a seat near the window, there's a fantastic view of Union Square that goes well with the rest of the trendy environment. Sweet potato fries were also extremely tasty.
author: Charles M.

description: Pricy,  but tasty. Beer options on tap were impressive, and the different things you could put on the burger were plenty.  Onion rings..... Awesome.  Not something I'd hit often because of the price, but occasional it was a great meal.
author: Christopher Z.

description: Went here for a hosted reception, the sliders were awesome, the various sauces available for the fries definitely hit the mark. Try to get a table overlooking union square.
author: todd s.

description: This place is a great place to take friends from out of town for American food. It's unique which is a lot of points in my book. It's got a great view and special high end burgers including a really awesome dessert burger with chocolate ganache.
author: Allen Y.

description: Came here on a Friday night and was impressed from the start.   This place was a bit pricey but that was to be expected considering the amazing view and delicious food.  Will definitely return next time I'm in SF
author: Thomas H.

description:
I love me some haterade.  It's true, I'll buy that big tub of concentrate and whip up giant 50 quart little league cooler vats of the stuff then guzzle it till my tongue turns black.  Despite (ha!) all that, I gotta give major props to the Other Keller and his undeniable burger accomplishments.

Super Fiancé' and I ate there on a busy ass Saturday while in mid-Groom outfit shopping quest so I was desperate for a nice distraction.  The initial vibe was less than stellar; reminded me of the Chiles in the Atlanta airport (busy, noisy, a lot of windows, those annoying barely big enough for two people mini-non-booths) but once the food came it all turned around.  I had the sliders due to indecision (3 different burgers, just about perfect) and Uber-Bride had the Kobe burger with a minimum of accoutrement.

Let me pause here to qualify my high opinion.  I am fucking obsessed with hamburgers (right now).  For the last 6 months I've been scouring the galaxy (ok, the east side of SF) for burger excellence.  Burger Bar kicked me right in the mouth nuts.  The hot, buttered buns with just a dusting of toasty-ness.  Man, the bun can make or break the burger and, as we all well know, first impressions count for everything.  The bun is a 5 star thing; not too hard and chewy but not doughy and soft.  It didn't disintegrate under the onslaught of some utterly delicious medium rare beef (or bison in the case of one of my sliders).  Yow.  Good.  Damn.  If you've slogged through any of my other reviews you know I have a borderline medicateable fetish for proper proportions and this place had it in spades.  Fresh veg+light sauce+perfectly cooked juicy meat+Zeus crafted bun = Giddy, 1 year old playing peek-a-boo for the first time ever delirium.

It also didn't hurt that Hubert Keller himself was in the house running the show and stopped by to check on us.  For a celebrity chef the guy was tres humble and seemed genuinely interested in our experience.  I almost gave the place 5 stars based on his drop by but then the famewhore in my eyes faded a little and I realized we paid $50 (with tip) for two burgers, some interesting (but weird) deep fried pickles with jalapeno (NOT pickled jalapenos we were confused to discover), and a couple of drinks in what is, essentially, a Red Robin.

... but oh those burgers!

.... oh, and the service was really excellent but I might attribute that to the owner lurking around as there was a certain peripheral terror floating under every frantic inquiry into our needs.
author: Milk N.

description:
I came here on Wednesday night before thanksgiving.  I thought I would really enjoy the burgers.  I would have if the burgers were cooked right.  The space of the place is second to none.  On the 6th floor of Macy's in Union Square overlooking said square with the view; the space is spectacular.  The selection of beers on tap is amazing, multiple flat screens for sports, and from what I could tell an extensive and impressive wine list.  Although I didn't partake in wine on this particular journey I could see the cellar from where I was sitting and if I wasn't driving that night I would have been very tempted to order a bottle.

Everything that you could ever ask for in a restaurant, except for the fact that my burger was cooked awfully.  My wife's burger was cooked a little better but not by much.  

We ordered our burgers medium rare.  Hers came out rare.  Mine came out alive.  I mean that when I stuck my finger in the middle of the the meat it was luke warm.
