The burger was not cooked medium rare or rare or at all.  I don't send food back to the kitchen.  I actually didn't mind that much that the beef was rare.  Contrary to popular belief it is not necessarily the worst thing in the world to eat raw meat.  In fact it doesn't bother me at all.  Anybody ever had Carpaccio?  

What bothered me was that I ordered the food Medium Rare, not raw.  The quality of the meat was obviously good I can't justify giving the meal anymore kudos.  If I hadn't trusted the quality of the meat I wouldn't have eaten it.  For example had I been served that burger at "bistro burger" I would have eaten it.  But the guy that owns Burger Bar owns Fleur De Lys so I'm thinking that I'll be OK.

All in all I built my own burger and the next time I am going to choose one of the creations on the menu.  In fact fact I'm going to go and have the 60 buck burger with seared Foie Gras and Shaved Black truffles.  I just didn't want to on Wednesday because I was shopping for various gifts for various people and felt like I had spent enough money for that day.
author: Anthony Y.

description: We have given this place two tries but it has disappointed both times. The service was horrible and the food was mediocre I'm sure there are better burgers elsewhere in the city.
author: Ericka C.

description: Very very very good food. The cost was expected ahead of our visit so cost was not an issue. Milkshakes were fantastic, fries, onion rings & fried pickles to die for. Then the burgers came "heaven"!!! If you love burgers this is a must, if you don't really care for them skip it. Service was great, our waitress Sandy was awesome. Some reviews knocked management however our party of 6 was treated very well by the front desk manager.
author: Ron H.

description: Came here in a big group so I got to try a lot of things. The best part about eating here is the view, so try to come on a sunny day and if you're lucky, you'll be seated near the windows. The wings were pretty good, the sliders need some sort of sauce on it, and the other burgers were decent (I can't remember what everyone else ordered).
author: Patrick P.

description:
I've been hearing all the hype surrounding this place ever since it opened a few months back.  Or rather, the hype surrounding the $60-burger that this place serves up: kobe beef burger with a topping of truffles and foie gras and whathaveyou.

The price is really what made me stop and pause and prevented me from giving it a four-star rating.  $25 for a burger.  Really?

Otherwise, the non-Kobe beef burgers were decent enough to satisfy the red meat eaters (mine was pepperjack, medium rare, served with a side of fries) and so were the sweet potato fries and zucchini fries.  There is also an option to create your own burger with whatever toppings you like - the only drawback is the risk of going overboard and ending up with a $70 burger.  Case in point: truffles on a custom-designed burger costs an extra $30! 

To top it off, the view from our table of 17 was amazing - quite possibly the best seat in the house with easy access to bars and floor-to-ceiling window overlooking the festivities in Union Square, giant christmas tree, skating rink and all.  

The damage report of $25 per person for the birthday dinner was not bad - I could think about a gazillion other places that would set you back more than that and I would not have budged.  It's just that it felt so wrong shelling out that much on something as elementary as a beef patty served between two halves of kaiser bun.
author: Ange L.

description: I'm sorry to say, but I think this place is completely overrated for burgers. I came here for a b-day dinner last week and I probably won't be back any time soon. I orders the Kobe beef burger and I didn't think there was anything special about it. I do like that there were different sauce for the appetizers we order. I forgot to order the milkshake so that might be the only thing I would go back to try. I'm given it 2 stars because I feel that  it was over price and not worth it to pay that much for a burger,.
author: Angela T.

description:
This place was suppose to be the bomb from my understanding!  Kobe beef hamburger?  Does Kobe beef come dry and taste like a burger from nations?  hm mm???  I really wonder...  First off it took my gf and i 45min to get seated and when we did get seated we were in a halfway of some sort in between two nice sections.  hmm i sat their and wondered why the hell are there seats in the hallway is it because my gf and look young?  whatever right!!!  We both got the Kobe beef burger med-rare with some sweet potato fries and floats... all of it succed!!!  
After eating their i wish i had just gone to nations and saved me some time and money...
author: James H.

description: Beautiful views and great burgers.  I'm a traditional burger man, which means a burger is medium rare, pickles, onions and mustard, a la Hudson's Hamburgers in Idaho.  Burger bar has some fancy schmancy burgers which I know nothing about.  If you want great meat, come here and keep it simple.  The ceasar salad is great.  The skinny fries are great.   Wash it down with a pint of Racer 5 IPA and be happy.
author: Mark J.

description: Hidden away on the 6th floor of Macy's was the BurgerBar. Since my last few reviews today have been about birthday's I figured I'll throw this review in as well. Getting to the BurgerBar was an adventure itself. I'm known to loathe the freeway. I don't have a problem with the speed on the freeway, and that in itself is another story. I don't even have a problem with changing lanes. It's all about getting lost.. Yes, getting lost on the freeway and ending up somewhere in San Jose or something like that is my problem with the freeway. Long story short, I took Mission Street all the way, and decided to use the 5th Street Garage to park my car. Unfortunately for me it was prom night, so I was stuck sandwiched between two cars in the parking garage. Took me about 45 minutes to find parking, and get to BurgerBar. Lucky for me the food was not served yet, and I made it one piece. I had a shared a burger which was delicious along with jalapeno fries and regular fries. I would go back there, but I would like to share my food since the portions are huge. Needless to say at the end of the night I was happy  with the food, but GPS had to bring me on the freeway to go home. I'm sure one can guess where my thoughts went from there.
author: Evelyn B.

description:
We had lunch here on a Saturday afternoon. We were surprised that there wasn't that much of a line. The wait was only 30 minutes. That was the only good thing about this lunch. It went downhill after that. 

Our orders took an hour to come out. At almost 3:30 pm, the restaurant was half empty. My sister inquired why it was taking an hour to get our orders, the manager said that they were short staffed in the kitchen, some of the chefs called in sick and that they were still waiting for the replacements. The manager was kind enough to check on our orders. She came back and said that the meal would be on them. 

I ordered the veggie burger and after waiting an hour for the veggie burger, I was given a cheeseburger. The server sent the cheeseburger back and I had to wait another 15 minutes for my veggie burger, which I thought was bland and was overpowered by the potatoes in it. 

This was very disappointing. I have dined at Fleur de Lys and I thought this burger joint would be similar to Fleur de Lys, at least in service. I wonder if Huber Keller is aware of the incompetent management of his restaurant. 

I will NEVER go back to this restaurant, even if it's free.
author: Glenn U.

description: I liked thier variations in potato fries..but their burgers weren't the best in the city...and plus we had to wait for 40 mins to get the server at our table and another 25 mins to get our bill....server's weren't so friendly either..always were in hurry and rushed us to turn over the table for next customers..
author: Kris K.

description:
I was very excited to visit a Chef Hubert Keller restaurant, but since we were never served, I can't comment on the quality of the food. 

We arrived a few minutes early for our res. but a server seated us immediately - although we assured him we would wait. And we did wait...at our table. 10 minutes later, the hostess seated another couple nearby (they were greeted immediately), and we asked her to find our server. Someone brought over waters and assured us a server was on the way. Five minutes later, we left. My husband made a point of handing the menus to the hostess on our way out, and she mustered up a phony-sounding apology. 

Living in a tourist town, I've come to expect poor service from restaurants that can always count on out-of-town patrons. I expected better from a Chef Keller establishment.
author: Kathryn D.

description: I've been to Burger Bar a couple of times.  The restaurant looks like your typical restaurant/bar with the exception of it's awesome view of Union Square. But nothing too fancy. I am a big Hubert Keller fan.  My fave burger would have to be the Kobe beef topped with foie gras and Fleur De Lys black perrigord truffle sauce. MOUTH WATERING! Try their buffalo burger too.  Deliciousness!
author: Anna K.

description:
I was skeptical about a high-priced, tourist-focused place, but was very pleasantly surprised.  It IS high-priced and touristy, but we (a local with out-of-towners) all enjoyed our food.  The zucchini fries were quite good (tasting one pickle fry is enough, since they are odd, but trying something different is always worthwhile).  The very best thing, a bit ironically (and most of our group are not beef-eaters, so there was just one hamburger, shared, at our table), was the vegan-friendly portobello burger.  This is NOT a portobello mushroom on a bun -- the mushrooms ARE the "bun," and inside there were tasty grilled peppers, tomatoes, and other vegetables.  Needs a knife and fork, but was both excellent and unusual.  

And we did share a milkshake. Sybaritic.  Delicious.

Why so many complaints about the service?  We had attentive, friendly,  professional service (by Jonathan, according to our bill).    

All in all, a good experience.
author: Em C.

description: Five people in our party for a late dinner on Friday night. Everyone enjoyed their burgers but mine was undercooked, ordered medium and it was medium rare at best. I sent it back and I honestly didnt see a difference which was frustrating as there were not many people in the restaurant by that time so it wasn't a big deal. And then I was super behind in eating from the rest of the group. One gal had a salad that was big and two people had turkey burgers and they all gave the thumbs up.  Prices go up pretty high as you buy extra toppings and different styles of buns. Night lights view was nice.  Homeless people and ladies of the evening were out in full force when we left around 10:30. But I did not feel unsafe. I would go back. Nice beer selection.
author: Randi I.

description: I just don't get this place. My dinner date, a longtime friend in from the East Coast, was in town and staying in Union Square so I suggested this place. I arrived, and the host wasn't at the station, so I had to wait a few minutes. He seated us at this totally rad table overlooking the Square, which was great. Our waitress arrived like a second later, so we hadn't had a chance to look at the menus. I asked if they had half glasses of wine, since (cough cough lightweight), and she seemed confused, then said No. I said, because some restaurants (cough cough, GOOD restaurants) offer a 3 oz glass of wine. I ordered the angus beef burger with no bun, peppered bacon, avocado and chipotle aioli, and my favorite drink, a shot of Patron and a large club soda. I thought it was intuitive that I wanted the shot separate (so I could add as much as I like). It came in a medium glass *combined* that wasn't fizzy and was way too strong. :( Our waitress also disappeared so my GF didn't have her wine until after her dinner came. Dislike. My burger came, and it was fine, but definitely not mind-blowing. I think it had maybe one total slice of bacon. For $1.55 add on. I mean, meh. It didn't come with a salad or anything, just a few pieces of romaine underneath, and the avocado was about 1/4 of one. If that. My girlfriend had 2 glasses of wine and the sliders. Our bill was $78 with tip. I DO NOT UNDERSTAND. There are a zillion places for burgers and most bunless burgers come with a huge salad. Like I said, I don't understand the appeal of this place. My friend and I had a great great time catching up, but the price of this place for the service and a good burger, I'll pass.
author: H H.

description: We were seated at the window overlooking Union Square and what a view.  The food was fresh, pesto dip worked with everything.  Not too pricey.  I had the chicken sandwich, it was pretty good, the sweet potato fries were very good and the zucchini fries were very good also.  Coffee ice cream is a must.
author: Michael D.

description: After ice skating in union square we decided it was time for dinner. A friend of mine noticed there was a burger bar sign below the cheesecake sign, and when we went to try to eat at cheesecake the wait for 2 hrs, so we went down 2 floors to try Burbger Bar. We were all pleasantly surprised! The wait was about 30 mins on a Friday night around 7:30, so it wasn't bad at all. We ordered the surf and turf burger (lobster and beef), sliders (variety of 3 different burgers), and the SF Vegan. This place has a great variety for both meat eaters and vegatarians.we also tried the beer floats.. I recommend the raspberry floater (raspberry beer with ice cream and whip cream, with fresh raspberries in top) :) try it out next time you are hungry for a burger in union square
author: Jennifer W.

description: On top of Macy's. Malou had American Classic with fries $14.95, I had the Salmon burger $11.95.and A.J grilled cheese at $6.50 shake at whopping $8.95. It was good but not worth the money you going to pay for, Service was good. They got us a table by window. They forgot to give the Pliser sampler I ask for. The resturant was clean and classy worth the money.I'll leave this one on you,
author: Albert S.

description:
iron chef has slighted us, done something very wrong to us, by furthering the notion that people on tv deserve money from us. i've been to a few restaurants owned by celebrity chefs and not a single one has stood the test deserving someone of that title. 15 minutes of fame do not equal skill or quality. burger bar is another tick on that list. possibly due to its location, and pandering to, the tourists of san francisco but more likely due to a personality who considers his creations worthy of insane price tags (a $60 burger? really?!? AYFKM??), there's nothing truly notable about this place.

we walked to burger bar during a weekday for lunch last week after one member of our party "heard good things about it". while looking for the restaurant, we noticed the address matched that of macy's. inside macy's? seriously? but isn't cheesecake factory inside macy's? that should have been our first hint. second, there is a television mounted inside each booth. necessary? a feature befitting a "fine dining establishment"? oh, totally! who doesn't need ESPN sport center playing while you're trying to enjoy a burger you had to mortgage your home for? outside of the food, the interior seems to have been designed by whatever famous interior decorator put together the T.G.I.F restaurants.

while i flavor my review of this place with a hefty serving of sarcasm, the food i ate (the $14 american burger) was devoid of any kind of actual flavor that set it apart from a $7 burger you can buy at burger joint. they do offer selections of different meats - beef, turkey, buffalo - but so does pearl's burgers just a few blocks away.

oh, and we saw the famous chef chatting with some friends on our way out. i almost wanted to tell him, "that lunch wasn't worth $25" and that he should head back into his kitchen and put the fear of god into his employees, but then i breathed a sigh of relief when i knew the place would be gone in a year or so - the location open for the next fad in macy's fine dining.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: l Loved my burger and shake...Our waiter was super nice.He gave me a couple extra straws to take home. I wanted to use them for blended margaritas. They have large openings to suck up your shake...
author: Kimberly P.

description:
To cut to the chase: I asked for my burger medium-rare, expecting -- as usual -- to get a burger that was either too rare or too medium, and instead got *GASP* the juiciest medium-rare burger I've had in a very long time. I went straight for the basic Black Angus Beef burger on a sesame bun, with American cheese, raw onions, skinny fries, and some of the best homemade aioli I've tried outside of Catalunya. Kudos on the extensive draft selection -- it's a treat to accompany your delicious burger with Duvel (on tap!). 

Prices are absolutely decent (except for the overpriced soda, for whatever reason)... The quality of the beef is wholly worth the extremely reasonable $11 tag! The atmosphere is Cheesecake Factory-esque, though perhaps more intimate, and has lovely views of Union Square. We went on a rainy Sunday mid-afternoon, which was ideal to avoid crowds, so I definitely recommend either reserving or steer clear of peak hours. Our waitress was lovely and service was fast and pleasantly cordial. Overall, a stupendous meal and a relaxing and satisfying experience on the 6th floor of Macy's (go figure)!
author: G. J.

description: Disappointing, to say the least. The burgers were good, the fries were GREAT, but for the price tag? Not in the least. I felt like I was crammed in there. Not enough spacing between seats.I thought I'd elbow the person at the table next to me reaching for my jacket!
author: Allison B.

description:
Ok, let's not forget, this is a hamburger.  Nothing more.  Just a hamburger.  Just because they give you the option to build your own burger, does not change the fact that it is a hamburger.

Why does the plain hamburger (with nothing on it) start at $10?  BTW, that's without french fries.  Why is it that after I've added bacon and avocado and cheese to my hamburger, and now it's $15?  Wait, I would like some french fries with it....WHOOPS, now it's $18.  And I would like a drink with that, too, please....UH-OH, I'm up to $21 for my hamburger.  

This better be one damn good burger, right?  OOPS, they forgot to make my burger taste good.  They were probably too busy counting all of my money in the back to take the time to add flavor.  I understand, it's an honest mishap.  At least the stingy portion of french fries was really good.  Let me just pay and get out of here.

OH CRAP!  What's this on my bill? HEALTHY SAN FRANCISCO TAX?  WTF IS THAT?  Let me look this up on my smartphone...oh it's a tax that the employer is ALLOWED to charge to help them pay for health insurance for the employees.  ISN'T THAT NICE?  You'd think they could afford to pay that with the ridiculously high priced hamburger that they just fed me.

OH WELL, dear waitress, your service was fine, but I hope you enjoy your health insurance, because I deducted that amount from your tip.

And for the sarcastically-challenged, I will not be eating at this place, ever again.
author: S. M.

description: The Burger was good, but what really took the cake was the Beer Float.... My god. But that, sadly does not a Burger Joint make. Like I said, the Burger was okay. That was it.
author: Thomas E.

description:
This place just made me so sad. I've been to the one in Vegas and loved it. Our visit to this one was a disaster from start to finish - so disappointing! Let's see:
1. Seated right next to the bathroom; tried to flag down the hostess to ask for another table (there were plenty open), but couldn't get anyone to make eye contact. Went back to host station and were reseated. (forgivable)
2. Husband ordered medium Angus burger with onion rings. Burger was well-done and hard. (it's a burger joint - unforgivable)
3. I ordered medium Angus burger w/ pepper bacon. Got well-done burger with regular bacon. (same as above - unforgivable)
4. Had to flag down busboy 3 separate times for: water, food to be wrapped, the bill.
I'm not sure if the problem was what our waiter wrote down, or how the kitchen interpreted it.  We thought about sending the burgers back, but I'm of the mindset that you suck it up and don't send anything back. Maybe expectations were too high? Doesn't matter as we'll never be back.
author: Eme L.

description:
I have an embarrassing confession--I heard about Burger Bar a few months ago and, one day while shopping, dragged a friend all over Macy's looking for the restaurant, only to find that they hadn't even started building it.  So, I had to be patient and, as soon as I heard it was finally open, I nagged the same friend to trust me to check it out again.

What a mistake....we really should have just walked the few extra blocks to Pearl's, where the burgers are consistently excellent and affordable.

Upon arrival, we were told it was a 45-60 min wait.  So, we wandered Macy's for about 40 minutes and returned up to the hostess stand.  She brightly said, "We can take you now!"  I was very pleased, and then, for some unknown reason, stood for another 15 minutes at the hostess stand.  I interrupted her conversation with the other hostesses and asked why we were still waiting and she said she didn't realize they had to clean the table.  So, it takes 15 minutes to clean off a table.

We were brought to what may be the worst table in the place.  It was jammed up against a wall that jutted into the dining room and squished between other tables, but just a stone's throw from a window  seat overlooking Union Sq.  I asked the waitress if we could be seated in the window and she said it was a table for four people, and they had to hold it for that sized party.  I understood and sat at our crappy table.  Ten minutes later, they seated a couple at my requested table.

Although we immediately placed our drink and burger orders, it took a good 20 minutes to get our drinks and then almost 45 minutes to get our burgers.  When I stopped the waitress after half an hour and inquired about the state of my burger, she flippantly said, "We're really busy."  She then yelled out something about checking the burger's status as she walked away.  She never checked and, finally, the food came to us.

My burger was fine, the meat was good and it was prepared medium rare as I had requested.  I got the Country Natural, which is the sustainably farmed burger, and cost $.75 more than the Angus burger.  I was a bit disappointed in Hubert here, if you can provide the sustainably farmed burger, why even bother serving something else?  The burger was thick and the ingredients were good, but it was definitely nothing special--and in no way worth $15.  The sweet potato fries were fine (a bit thin), but without the chipotle aioli, they wouldn't have been as good.  We also both ordered the truffle sauce, about which I was super excited.  What a joke!  It tasted NOTHING like truffles and didn't even have a truffle aroma.  It was clearly just a mushroom gravy.  We brought this to the waitress's attention and she said, "I'm sorry" and walked away.  No offer to bring us another one, to see what went wrong, or to remove it from the check.  She then avoided us, as she filled the water glasses of the tables around us, but never came back to check on us or fill our glasses.  About 15 minutes later, a manager came over and expressed his regret that the truffle sauce was not up to par and shared with us that he thinks it's great and had it on a burger just the other night.  Hey cool guy, that's wonderful, my sauce sucks and that just rubbed it in!  He shared that they would "take care of" the sauce on the bill.  That was fine, and although overdue, was the appropriate response.

Then, we got the bill.  The removed only ONE truffle sauce and, instead of the other, removed one of the orders of fries.  We were so annoyed and over this place, that we just paid the bill so we could get the hell out of here.

As others have mentioned, the decor is bland and chain-restaurant-like, and overall, unappealing.  

Next time, Pearl's.
author: Jessica L.

description: Oh, you know... Another over-priced small chain that caters to the tourists. I might come back here if I didn't know better. It's such a shame that people visiting the city get sucked into eating at places like this and the Cheesecake Factory. We have so much more to offer!
author: Andria M.

description:
next time i think of
buying a thirty dollar
burger, pimp-slap me
author: chester R.

description: My girlfriends and I went here on a day trip to the city and they did an amazing job. Edward did an amazing job and we will be back because of him!
author: Christy S.

description: Really not the best burger I have ever had.  Had the Kobe burger and it did not have that Kobe, melt in your mouth taste - was just like the other burgers only twice as expensive.  Bacon was not very crisp and it was just not impressive.  I did love the buttermilk zucchini fries, but am not sure I would go back just for that.  For my money Barney's Gourmet Hamburger in Noe Valley is a much better burger (although I suggest bringing a friend to share as they are huge).
author: Debbie G.

description: I have been here 5 times and everytime the burger is great. Really juicy. I know a lot of complaints are the price but most places charge a lot for a basic meal-I go to Bistro Burger which is 1/4 as good and is completely over priced and the fries and not included either. Good basic delicious burger and yummy sweet potato fries. Table next to me actually asked the server why there was not more choices esp steaks. Well it is Called Burger Bar. I agree the Buffalo Burger is way too much so I will not try that at thus point. I had the burger with pineapple and blue cheese-try it!
author: Susan s.

description: Eh.. Cute slider burgers and sweet potatoe fries, and I also ordered the grilled shrimp salad. The salad cost me 13 bux + sf health fee+ tax and gratiuity for party of 6 or more... pretty much I had a very nasty salad.. that roughly cost me 20 bucks... umm.. and the only thing I appreciate were the 4-6 succulent grilled shrimp.... sigh.
author: Monika T.

description: Had a reservation for Friday evening at 4:30. Arrived early and was seated promptly only to have to wait 15 minuets to have my order taken and get drinks. Followed by another 20 minuets waiting for the food to arrive. The waitress was unapologetic about messing up my order and by the time I got all the fixings for my burger it was cold. Luckily the view was amazing from the 6th floor and I was able to sit next to the window. I got yogurt after to make myself feel better about spending $21 on such mediocrity.
author: Susan S.

description:
we happened to stumble into burger bar by accident.  on the 6th floor after gift wrapping a present and checking into the watch repair area, we walk to the elevator and at our footsteps is BB.  we were on our way to get thai across the road, but settled for BB for convenience sake -- also to try the infamous spot out.  

two kobe beef burgers w/foie gras in a red wine reduction sauce.  me coleslaw, him fat fries, and a coke =$80 something.  the burgers/lunch costs us more than we had anticipated, but we felt the quality of the meal/meat was worth it.
author: Sheri N.

description: HIs namesake burger (buffalo burger, arugula, blue cheese and caramelized onion on ciabatta) was dynamite, as were the shakes he was handing out to everybody because Mr. Hubert Keller is fabulous.
author: Wakako U.

description:
i wanted to luh-uuuuuv this place so bad!  i wanted to be amazed at how delicious a burger could be. considering Hubert Keller was on Top Chef Masters and has other successful restaurants including two other Burger Bars, i wanted this place to be as awesome as i imagined it. FAIL!!! 

--peppercorn burger  -is this sauce genuinely the same as the one served at Fleur de Lys? completely dissappointed. i haven't made my way to FdL yet but one day i will and i'll steer clear of that sauce.
--Hubert Keller burger- tasty! i wish i'd ordered that one. 
--fries and onion rings were just that. not any different from anywhere else.
--2 nutella shakes- delicious, and the addition of hot fudge was great. but was it $9-a-shake-good? not really...

our bill was $82 for two people. for average food. it makes me sad, really.
author: Regina C.

description: Was really fun! My Kobe beef burger was definitely delicious. I think I'd skip my cucumber drink next time and go with a cocktail or something on draft. Service was spotty, but food was good and hot. Hope to go back!
author: Angela H.

description:
Once we got up to burger bar (after maybe a 15 minute wait), they sat us at a side table close to the bar that didn't seem like a real table.  I was kind of disappointed at first, but then a waiter said they had an extra milkshake and offered it to us so my disappointment stopped there.  Ordered the bacon bloody mary that was sooo delicious, even had a bacon swizzle stick.  My boyfriend and I both ordered the $60 burger. It was well worth it!  You're really paying for the truffles and the foie gras, and they didn't skimp on either.  We also got the truffle sauce to dip the sweet potato fries into, and that was very tasty.  The server was great, very attentive, and also gave us a little bit of truffle sauce to go.

We even met Hubert who was super nice, gracious and bubbly.  He seemed genuinely happy to be there meeting all the patrons.

I live in NY, but I will definitely go back the next time I go to SF!
author: christine g.

description:
Pricey, but the burgers are customized to your order and are very good. The dining area was very spacious too and since my friend had her child/ stroller with her, this was a huge plus.

Service was slow, not just for us, but for all the tables around us. Every time we looked, the servers were by the register area and seemed to be having a hard time of it, so I don't think it was their fault. Perhaps Burger Bar needs to change their processing system or something?

I'd come again, but only if I had the time to take a very leisurely meal.
author: Tammy L.

description: First of all the view of Union Square is quaint, atmosphere is fresh and greeters are very friendly. As for the food, I had the Kobe meat, medium, which was as good as advertised. It is on the pricey side as you can  build your burger  starting with the meat which begins at $9.75, kobe will cost you $16.95 for your beef only. Food came out hot an ready with the exception of the fries, which were hard and cold and part of the reason they don't rate 5 stars. Service was not up to par as well, probably because the restaurant was understaffed, but still underscores the entire experience. Bottom line, one of the best burgers I have ever had and will definitely be back.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Diverse beer selection and decent quality burgers definitely make the case for a 4 star rating, but the prices are just too high for what you get.  There are many places in SF with as good or better burgers that are half the price.
author: Mike B.

description:
Unfortunately, I came a little late to dinner, so I didn't get a chance to meet the great Hubert Keller (like my fellow diners did), but I did see him walk through the dining room on his way over to the private party.  I'm afraid a little foodie squeal left my lips when I saw him pass by...  Luckily, my sister did meet him and she forked over $25 to buy his 'Burger Bar' cookbook so that she could get his autograph.  Lots of lovely photos in his cookbook and I would love to try to recreate some of the burgers in there.

In any case, we had a table right by the windows, so we had a beautiful view of Union Square as day melded into dusk and night finally fell.  Even better than the view was the ridiculously delicious burgers we had.  I ordered quickly since I had been running late, so I went with basic instinct rather than an intelligently thought-out combination of toppings and burger.  I went with the Kober beef burger, medium rare, with bacon, pepper Jack, and button mushrooms on an onion bun.  This burger was so good that it just about wiped away thoughts of my all-time favorite burger, the Shack Stack from NYC.  The beef was a tad over-cooked- it was more medium than medium-rare, but damn, talk about it being juicy, well-seasoned and flavorful.  You almost didn't have to chew any of the meat.  The onion bun didn't hold up particularly well to the juciniess of the meat (the bottom bun got soggy quick), but I loved the onion bits and salt on top.  The toppings were great- lots of button mushroom and the bacon was nice and crispy.  Try the jalapeno bacon if you can- you only get one piece, but the piece my sister got on her burger was fabulous.  We also tried the onion rings, the buttermilk zucchini spears, and the sweet potato fries- ahh, my stomach just growled at me.  Just thinking about this meal makes me salivate and want to go over and try another burger combination.

There were some service hiccups but really, it was their first dinner service and it went relatively smoothly considering how many people were there trying to get in.  All I know is that their burgers delivers and I'm ready to brave the hordes to get repeated tastes.
author: Angela H.

description:
Tried the Kobe, Country Natural, and The Hottest Burger in the world (Black Angus patty mixed with jalapeno and pepper in the patty).  Don't waste your money on the Kobe.  If you love beef, go for the Country Natural.  It's much more flavorful.  Although the Kobe is just a tack softer meat, but it's a burger, so it's really not that much different.
All the patty was overcooked.  Medium came more of a Medium-Well, and the Medium-well came well done.  But I was prepared for it and ordered accordingly.
We tried all 3 of their fries, the skinny and sweet potato were WAY too skinny, some of the fries were only 2mm thick!  We liked the fat fries a lot better.
Alcoholic Irish coffee milkshake was cool.  It was good, but not really worth the $11?
I ordered the Creamy Cheese Cake Burger.  It was good, but not as described in the menu.  It tasted like a cream cheese filling in donut, and no caramelized pineapple, and had strawberry and kiwi instead.
IN CONCLUSION: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE NATURAL COUNTRY BURGER, WITH FAT FRIES.
author: P. C.

description: Service is horrible!!! We didn't even have a server assigned in our area that's what a waitress from another area mentioned when we flagged her down after being seated for 20 minutes.  This is after we were seated after people who were not even on the list!!! If you love to have a great burger and don't mind waiting and getting bad service sure try it out!!! I wouldn't come back here again, my time is more precious and I have choices of where I can eat!
author: Anosha A.

description:
I love a good burger. Always in search of the ultimate burger.  I have to say that so far, the best burgers I had in town are "Bullshead" on Ulloa near West Portal and Il Pollaio on Columbus Avenue in North Beach.

I have actually been to Burger Bar a couple of times and was always mildly dissapointed, but thought hmmmmmmm....this is Hubert Keller.  And I think Hubert Keller is great.  I love Fleur De Lys- one of my all time favorite restaurants- ever.  

But today, I really was disappointed.  Two burgers- one the "Low Carb" and one "Beef Angus Burger" and a cup of Lentil Soup.  Total bill for two smallish somewhat dry burgers and a watery soup was $40!  I found the price shocking because the quality did not come close to matching it.  

Also, to pay a premium for a burger, I would also want perfectly crisp pickles and great greens.  Honestly the pickle was not crisp, and the dressing on the greens was impossibly salty.  

Add to that a somewhat unpleasant atmosphere.  On the plus side, the view from the seventh floor of Macy's overlooking Union Square is nice.  But the harsh music with the overpowering volume and strange music negates any chance of having a pleasant lunch.  What distresses me is the continuing belief that the  target market of 20 and 30 somethings cannot enjoy themselves without an unpleasantly loud and harsh environment.  

The service was no more than bringing the food and the check.  There was a total lack of warmth by the person who took the order with a somewhat friendlier demeanor by the people (bussers?) who brought out the food.

I wish this were a better restaurant.  I really wanted to like this restaurant, but after five tries, I am going to give up.
author: Emanuel B.

description: Beatiful location right in the middle of the union square... if you do go there ask to be seated by the window to get the gorgeous view. It is pretty price just for a burger but the whole experience is well worth it.
author: K. D.

description: Top Chef Master Hubert Keller runs this place.  Talk about a premium burger yum. They have a TON of choices.  (some very unique ones as well)   I like this place.  It's not cheap but you get what you pay for.
author: Jon S.

description:
What an absolute JOKE.  While the burgers are tasty and well built, they have the gall to charge you for....wait for it....DIJON MUSTARD.  You've got to be kidding me.  $22 for a burger and they charge for dijon. Not only that,  'I'm sorry sir, you can't change the chefs choice burgers".  I wanted a Hubert Keller Burger, without blue cheese,  as i can't eat cheese.  When I was told that i couldn't substitute, I was tempted to ask if the server had seen the film 5 easy pieces,   (white toast) but since she wasn't old enough to get into an R rated film, i dropped it.  In any case,   had to build my own. Which cost MORE THAN THE PREPACKAGED VERSION.  The place is unbelievable.   

The other side was we were shown 2 tables right next to serving stations, while there were 1/2 dozen other two-tops available.  We pressed the issue and were awarded a better location right by the entrance to the bathroom.  

Oh, yeah. The lemonade, @ $4 per is watered down country time.  

Come on, guys......

If you haven't figured it out by now,  we won't return.    Keep the place in Vegas,  and hope to attract a lovely touristy macy's crowd.  You'll make your return on investment and your investors will be happy.  Keep teaching the servers to sell sell sell.  That's the point, isn;t it?  I'm guessing that this won't fly with food concious San Franciscans.  Unbelievable is all I'll say.
author: Billy O.

description: Went there tonight (1/29) to celebrate The Supergoober's birthday and dine before seeing a comedy show at the Marine's Memorial Theater. Ordered the Kobe beef burger for dinner. Simply awesome. Finished up the night with the Nutella burger for dessert. Everything was great. We sat in the center window overlooking Union Square. We will definitely be returning!
author: Discourser T.

description: I'm shocked that this place only has 3 stars on yelp. This place was awesome. If you like a good burger than this is the place to go. I had a Turkey Burger with sprouts, jalapenos, tomato, lettuce, and aioli. I also had the Zucchini Buttermilk fries which were amazing. I will definitely be coming back here as long as the wait isn't too long.
author: Kunal K.

description: What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas.  This is true for Burger Bar.  I remembered having the turkey burger at the Vegas Man. Bay restaurant.  I really liked it.  The meat was tasty and juicy.  So we decided to try the new Macy's restaurant.  Nothing like the burgers in Vegas.  The meat was dry and had a gamey taste to the ground turkey.  Also, the seating was so cramp, the server's butt was constantly in my face.  After eating that raw onion, I like a little space between my honey and me.
author: susan g.

description:
Hubby had been to the Vegas version and was much impressed and is a HUGE Fleur de Lys fan, so was very excited that Hubert Keller was opening a branch in San Francisco.

Having walked away from the potential of a 45 minute wait for lunch on Saturday, hubby and I returned this afternoon for a late lunch/early dinner each armed with a book, prepared for the wait.

The eventual wait was 1 1/2 hrs, even though we had been told that the wait was 45mins to 1hr. This is understandable - it's a new restaurant . . . it's very popular and the staff are still finding their feet.

The food was a big disappointment. I had a Kobe beef burger with swiss cheese and caramelized onion with 'fat' fries and a side salad. Hubby had the famous $60 Rossini Burger (complete with foie gras and black truffles - VERY fancy) and 'skinny' fries and we shared a nutella shake.

There were a couple of hitches with the service - we were brought a vanilla milkshake instead of a nutella milkshake and my salad came covered with dressing even though I asked for it on the side - but again, we can let this pass as 'teething problems' - and the waiter was apologetic and sorted things out very quickly.

The big problem was THE FOOD. We really wanted to like the food., especially since we saw the very imposing-looking Hubert Keller wandering round the restaurant. Surely with The Man himself at the helm, the food would be superlative? Sadly, we found the food sub-standard. There were many tough pieces of gristle and fat in our burgers. Isn't Kobe beef, supposed top be tender and of a superior quality? This wasn't. This was far inferior to premium burgers we had eaten at Orson, Slow Club, Zuni, or our favorites Bix and Mission Beach Cafe. Mo's Grille or even humble In-n-Out would not have the kind of unacceptably poor burger grinding exhibited here, and the fact hubby and I both had 4-5 pieces of gristle each makes it hard to dismiss as a fluke. Also the fries were sub-standard - not crisp,  not fresh-tasting, not evenly cooked - neither of us finished our fries and I didn't finish my burger (hubby felt obliged to finish his burger after spending $60 on it!).

The milkshake was lovely, though a bit on the sweet side (the mention of Nutella gives the game away) - we really enjoyed it!

We did complain to a manager about the burgers and were comped the milkshake, but were not offered any explanation for the unpleasant burgers.

Unless the standard really improves or unless I can be persuaded otherwise, I will go to one of my regular burger places for my burger fix in future. Hubby says if you crave a decadent truffle burger, go to Bix instead (the ambiance there is MUCH better as well).
author: Writer G.

description: though i would give them a 3 star for food and a 10 star for service. the staff is something to behold. Elisabeth is the best there is when it comes to customer service. i can't thank her enough for pulling out all the stops for my stepson's b-day. unflappable and professional without exception.
author: I. V.

description: I appreciated being able to order only the sides, no burger, so I enjoyed the grilled lobster, portobello mushroom, and grilled asparagus. Hubby enjoyed the buffalo burger. I plan to go back for a special pig-out day and have their milkshake sampler.
author: Marina N.

description: You have to be a burger balla to eat here.  Its freakin pretty expensive for the signature burgers.  I really want to try the $60 Foie Gras with kobe burger but you can go to Gary Danko for another $40 and get a full 5 course dinner.  The sliders were pretty good and the Jack with Tapanade burger was good.  The meat here is pretty fresh.   I normally get my burger well done but if you eat a $20 burger I am gonna risk E. Coli poisoning and eat it medium.  I am glad I tried this place once.  I am too poor to eat here again.
author: Fatty A.

description:
OK, three strikes and you're out, Burger Bar SF!  I wanted to like you.  I was rooting for you.  I was so happy that you arrived in my City so I wouldn't have to fly to Vegas every time I had a hankering for your burgers.  I really hoped you'd live up to your reputation.

Sadly, it won't happen.  Not here, anyway.  I'll save my Burger Bar excursions for Las Vegas, where the SERIVCE is excellent and the FOOD is cooked properly... which JUSTIFIES the higher than average prices for burger joint fare.

First Visit:  Just about a week after opening.  We waited almost an hour and a half (that's 90 minutes, Miss Burger Bar Hostess) after being told that the wait would be just 10 - 15.  In my experience, when the host says 10 - 15 for the wait-time, they are lying.  But because we were  in Macy's, and because our dining companion had just flown all the way from Hong Kong to see us, we decided to wait it out and browse the store instead of bagging the idea all together.  The server came out and took our drink orders.  20 minutes later, our drinks arrived and my friend who ordered a vanilla shake noticed chocolate sauce at the bottom of her glass.  When we were able to finally locate our server again (10 more minutes) to ask about the vanilla shake, we were told that yes, Vanilla shakes do in fact have chocolate sauce in them.  "It's our fancy-wancy way of making a shake," she informed us.  Seriously? WTF.  The truth was, she didn't want to admit there had been a mistake and didn't want to go back to the shake station (which was probably slammed beyond belief) to fix it.  oy vey.  The rest of the meal was uneventful once the food finally arrived (47 minutes after ordering) and nothing stood out as either good or bad.  I was disappointed.

Second Visit:  My Birthday, about a week and a half after my first visit.  I ordered the Fancy Wancy shake (just to test them) and it came out as a plain vanilla shake.  No Chocolate sauce.  No duh.  I ordered a veggie burger *with bacon* and got a look of consternation from our server.  Service again was  s l o w.  Had to ask three times for water refills.  A lot of staff walking around but not doing much of anything.  My burger arrived cold.

Third Visit:  just a week ago, having promised another friend I'd go with her.  The wait was 40 minutes.  Our server didn't seem to know anything about the menu -- what brand of ice cream they used for the milkshakes... are the rolls and buns house-made?  I waited 15 minutes and had to remind her twice of my iced tea.  My sweet potato fries arrived cold.  

So that's it.  I've had it.  I won't be going back.  Hubert Keller, I expected more from your Burger Bar.
author: Terri D.

description:
Are you kidding me? The other reviews here must be smoking crack (or are professional reviewers getting paid). Nothing about the experience at this place is worthy of five stars, and I'll make an argument for my one star.....

Went for solo lunch today, Oct 19 around 1pm. Was told it would be 30 minutes or I could grab a seat at the bar when they were free. The only place to wait is outside, so unless you hover (which I find annoying) the bar option is a melee. In fact, I kept checking back to the bar and the hostess pushed at least three other parties into seats at the bar ahead of me, despite the fact that I was there first. So, strike one - don't make people fight it out for the bar. Keep a list.

Finally seated and waited a few minutes for waitress. When I asked her opinion she said "we don't get to eat the food here, so I can't tell you. I'd have to come in on my free time". Holy WTF? Hubert - really? It would take a pre-service meeting to cut up a few burgers to get your staff up to speed. Shame on you. Big big big strike two.

Decor was disappointing too. Incredibly generic. Nothing about the place had any personality. It felt like an ill-placed sports bar that was completed in the 90s. Bleh.

Burger took 20+ minutes to arrive. Bun was soggy on the bottom (I ordered the standard angus with "crisp" bacon and skinny fries). Bacon was equally soggy, so much for crispy. Fries weren't well salted. Just ok. Burger meat was ok, but really nothing better than your average TGI Fridays or other crappy chain. If Hubert is gonna put his name on something, I want an exceptional burger, well-seasoned and served with appropriate fixings. Shame shame.

Considering the cost, it was a disappointing experience.  Hubert was there, and I was impressed by that. He made rounds and shook hands. But maybe he needs to get in the kitchen and revamp the burger process, train his staff and add value to his chain. I assure you there will be more reviews like mine once the real guests start eating and posting. Too bad.

Go to Mission Burger for a better experience!
author: Shaka Z.

description: Had the surf and turf burger, cooked to perfection...I definitely recommend it. The wait was a bit long but it was just after happy hour so its understandable. Our waiter was awesome, really nice and gave fantastic recommendations.
author: Jared L.

description: WOW, what a disappointment.  $30 for a peppercorn burger and a pint of beer.  Meat was juicy but a little bland.  Fried pickle was salty.  Would I go back, nope.  Great beer selection.  Great views.   Didnt live up to the hype.  Nova on 2nd St. has a better burger, and I could get a meal and get drunk for $30.
author: don j.

description: A good burger, but not the best I have had. I would say it is top of the middle of the pack. For the price though it should be top of the top. Gotta say the Black and White shake was the best 11.00 dollar shake I have ever had. But, it is also the only 11.00 shake I have ever had. The zucchini fries tasted like the generic ones you get at any diner.
author: Johnny J.

description: It's always been consistently good when we've eaten here. I usually get the turkey burger and salad or fries. I wouldn't say it's anything amazing but good food, decent prices and def. the go to spot when shopping in Union Square. I probably wouldn't come here to eat if I wasn't already in Union Square though. They also have a good beer and wine selection.
author: christina C.

description: excellent jalapeno burger and sauce. nice view from the sixth floor of Union Square.  good service from the bartender.
author: Jingo Django J.

description: Make your own burger!  It's way easier and you get exactly what you want.  The quality of beef here is amazing.  The main problem people have is paying $20 for a burger but this definitely isn't a 99cent mcdonald's patty.  Milkshakes are some of the best I've had.  The alcoholic ones are worth the 9 dollar price tag.  It's a great spot to grab a beer with the guys and eat a huge burger, while watching the game.
author: Steven Q.

description:
If you order the daily special you will get a decent portion of burger and fries for about $12.   Fairly juicy, but really nothing special and nothing worth paying $20 for..... the build your own burger concept is fun, yes, but not at this price; unless you stick to two toppings or less it becomes pretty pricey and not a good value. 

Definitely would not go out of my way to go back when there are other cheaper options that are just as good and not set inside a Macy's store.
author: Mya P.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday. I wanted to like this place, but it just didn't live up to the hype or the name. We put our names down at 7pm and left at 11pm. 

Other than the guy who came to refill our water, nobody else paid much attention to us. The wait for a table was long, about an hour and a half, for ten people. They won't take reservations for less than 13. That makes no sense to me. I witnessed two tables complain while waiting, now I know why. I even overheard someone say she was "babysitting" the staff because they didn't know what they were doing. Nice. Obviously she didn't know what she was doing either because there were still complaints.

The food was ordinary. They need to learn to cook hamburgers and serve them at the same time. 2 burgers came out of the kitchen and it took at least 10-15 minutes for another 6 to come out. The order still wasn't complete, we were still missing 2 burgers. They kept getting the orders wrong AND didn't even know what the burgers were when you asked which was which. 4 our of the 10 burgers were not cooked properly. One burger was asked to be cooked rare, it was well done. Three asked to be cooked medium well, it was cooked medium to medium rare. We would have sent them back, but we were starving and would have waited an eternity for new burgers. Their only saving grace was their milkshakes, thus the one star. It was a pretty good milkshake, but it took about half an hour to make. It's a milkshake for goodness sakes, were they milking the cow in the back?! They still managed to get one of the two milkshake orders wrong. 

I understand that gratuity for large parties is usually added onto the bill. The problem was, they told us it was added, but it doesn't say so on the bill. There's a line for gratuity as well. So, if the waitress didn't tell us, we would have paid an additional tip on top of what they felt they deserved. 20% in my opinion was way too much for lousy service, a long wait time (table & food) and not knowing how to cook a burger. NOT KNOWING HOW TO COOK A BURGER, WHY ARE YOU CALLED THE BURGER BAR? Perhaps Hubert Keller needs to rethink this and call it the Milkshake Bar. Sorry, but McDonald's would have been a better choice, at least you get a toy with your happy meal.
author: Adelina W.

description: So this is my second visit here and first time bringing my boyfriend. The first time here, I was blown away by the meal, but disliked my server. This time around I decided to try something new, which was a big mistake! I ordered the Surf & Turf which included black angus, half a lobster, and asparagus on a ciabatta bun. Sounded good when I ordered, tasted like nothing when I took my first and second bites (stopped after that). There was no flavor to savor or even brag about. The best feature of the meal were the onion rings, which I would definitely order again. My boyfriend ordered the Hawaiian Chicken burger, juicy but no flavor. The saddest part of all, the lemonade tasted more like water than lemon or sugar, yet another flavorless item added to our meal. If I ever return, I'm sticking with the Hubert Keller burger and onion rings. Definitely disappointed this time around. Should've visited Cheesecake Factory next door! I gave it two stars this time around because the waitress was sweet.
author: Angela M.

description: Terrible service .. Hostess was a twit .. Waiter was an airhead .. Not worth the wait.
author: Brian M.

description:

The check said our cashier was Antonio , so I'm thinking that's he's name I really hope you guys find a way to fix this poor service.

This is the email I sent on Dec 18 2012,  2 days after i visited the place... Today feb 18 2013 still no response to my email...
mayor fail... I really hope this place go out of business SOON...
author: Happytobe M.

description: Well the hostess was a little rude at first but i guess she seen me roll my eyes and she quickly transformed into a nice person. whatever so they sit us down at these booths that have tvs. that was kinda cool. the waitresses are very friendly and we didnt wait forever to get our food. The Burger i ordered was just okay. it wasnt horrible but it wasnt to write home about either. i had great burgers and this was about a 3 star.if that . I didnt get the burger i wanted because i was on a bit of a budget but next time im gonna try the colby beef burger. yeah next time so i will be returning, I mean the view was cool and it is worth another shot to see if they have a burger i can actually tell someone about the next day!
author: Daniel C.

description:
What a miserable place this is. 

Just go, grab a menu and walk out. Its the best way to experience this shamble. It will at least make you think you are in for a treat. Ah the trickery!!! 

One would think that such an established name as part of the equation, it would be easy to establish an eatery that was able to function. Nope. Friday, 1:30pm, end of the lunch rush and the chef has to close the kitchen for 20 minutes because they can't get orders out. No, not a fire, not a service person stabbing themselves, not a flooded bathroom or "we've run out of meat" or anything like that. Just the plain old I wish I were Gordon "SHUT IT DOWN" Ramsey act of simply not being able to get food off the service line. We stick around to watch the train wreck since its a slow day at the office...The 18 year old front of house tries to dodge the angry special sauce/lettuce cheese masses. No fewer than 10 tables sit empty for over 10 minutes. The "manager" does her best frightened bunny imitation and stays in back, looking out over the place from the safety of the service window. No effort is made to comp or pacify those who stick around for a seating, although people ordering take-out are being given milkshakes in a sinister tease. 

Finally a table, finally an order in, finally service. I've seen better presentation at Bob's Big Boy, but I'm not holding that against them as this is a BURGER place. But I still feel that there is a gap that needs to be closed between the wilted lettuce and the fact that there's a $60 burger on the menu. Our orders are undercooked, my burger has the wrong bacon, which quivers as the plate is literally dropped in front of me. Sweet potato fries are cold, and while there's always a certain amount of limpness associated with SF, never would I make that a positive attribute of Onion Rings...My milkshake, which is what earned the 2 stars, was an interesting effort. I liked the concoction, Nutella is a unique idea and appreciated, but while I ordered it "thick" it was delivered drippy like a preschoolers nose. 

Other highlights: 
- Dirty table. 
- 40 people waiting and a whole wing of the restaurant was closed. 
- Server not knowing how to work the POS to get me the check. 
- Front of house losing the wait list and explaining how they got 1 hour of training on opening day. 
- Empty ketchup bottles on the table...at a BURGER place.... 

Please someone close this place down....or move it to LA...or to Houston....
author: Matt K.

description: It does the trick if you are in Union Square and craving a burger. Long lines so try to sit at the bar if you can.
author: Johanna W.

description: Fun place.  We went during the Christmas rush season and the wait was only 1/2 an hour. The drinks were good and the burgers were good, but not spectacular. Burger Bar was exspensive given that the food was more or less pub food, but it is in the heart of Union Square. We had a great view of the Square, including the ice rink and Christmas tree. I would imagine the higher prices are part of the ambiance. A good experience, I would most likely return there on another trip to the city.
author: D S.

description:
Ugh, this place is awful. The service is dreadful, the food is mediocre, the physical layout is a disaster, and the prices are absurd. The managers don't care - and why should they, everything about this place screams tourist-trap, so there's no chance for repeat visits anyway. I most assuredly will not go back. 

Oh, and if you need a good burger fix? Check out Taylor's in the Ferry Building, or Barney's in Noe Valley or the Marina.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
I have to be a little critical of BB since 1) it's a brainchild of Hubert Keller, and 2) b/c it is from Hubert Keller, expectations were higher, and 3) $16 base price on some of the burgers demands matching quality. And so sadly, and honestly, I've really had better burgers.

Where BB could have been better:
- More preset combos: While custom designing your own burger can be cool, BB should offer more pre-set designs. Why? Because it guarantees a tasty combo. 

Our group opted to venture out on our own creation. American Kobe with Avocado ($16.50 + $1.55) on sesame bun. While the meat was cooked just right (medium - still pink in center) and the kobe was tender, it lacked flavor. You would have needed a couple of other toppings to make the burger taste more interesting. Otherwise, it's just ground meat.

We also tried the Salmon Steak ($8.50) on wheat. It was really boring. With no added toppings, it was doomed to dry failure. 

- Need softer buns: Ok, what's the point of choosing the type of buns, if they all are overly thick (out of proportion with the meat) and dry. I expected super fresh buns, toasted and soft. These were not. We ended up tossing the buns aside, and not for carb reasons.

- Need Experienced Service: Maybe it was an off day, but we got a server who didn't seem to know how to take orders or remember what we ordered. Again, for an establishment with HK's name on it, we expected the best and it wasn't.

What Made it Bearable:
- Plenty of seating: We came just before 7p on a weeknight. Had no problems securing a table. No waiting is a plus.
- Rockin milkshakes. We split the black and white shake and it was very tasty. Thick rich vanilla ice cream blended with oreos made this a delicious favorite.
- Burger Bar Sliders ($12.75): You get a tasting of 3 meat - Buffalo with caramelized onions (good tasting meat complemented by the sweet onions), Angus w/ bacon (anything is better with bacon), and Natural beef w/ cheese (anything is better with cheese). It's a great way to taste the different meats and with a touch of paired topping. And the order comes with fries of your choice, while the a la carte burgers require additional ordering.
- Cheese Cake Donut ($5.75): Thought this was a creative twist. They take a glazed donut, split in half and sandwich creamy whipped cream cheese in the center with thin slices of pineapple. The "cheesecake" center had a tangy note and made a nice contrast to the glazed sugar of the donut. The whipped cream mouse with almond ears and chocolate eyes was cute as it appeared he was chasing down the donut.

Our total tab with additional orders of skinny fries ($3.35) and onion rings ($3.55), 1 milkshake, 1 dessert, 3 burgers, 1 soda came to $26 (with tip) per person. It's not exorbitant but do you know how many In n Out burgers I could have gotten instead?! I give BB a 2.5 stars.
author: Cindy W.

description: Too long of a wait for just average burgers! Ive been here several times last year and remembered it being better. Maybe the sliders I had were just not good. Sweet potato fries was not good either (pearls that is a lot cheaper is even better) can't hit the 4 stars for okay service, okay food, long wait ( they actually seated the wrong people and we waited extra long). Ehhhh not impressive this time at all.
author: Bren L.

description: Went back there recently.  The food is still consistently good.  Their beer menu has a typo in that they have beer from Fort Braggs, CA instead of the correctly spelled Fort Bragg, CA.  Also, they seem to have only two baby high chairs, and both have broken straps.   One of the chairs even had scotch tape on the fastener which falsely gave a sense that everything clicked properly.  However, if you pulled on the straps it would unlock.  I would sure hate to see a baby slip out and fall.  Strange how for a new restaurant, stuff is already broken.
author: Chris W.

description:
i'll keep this one short. 

really tasty food.... though pricey- probably due to keller's brand name.
pricey - especially the drinks, though the hard liquor ones are strong.
atmosphere - mheh, it's okay.
good view of union square.
poor service.

as much as i love keller as a person, i wouldn't care to pop in & out while shopping especially since it's much higher priced than the rest of the places to eat inside of macys. i would probably head down to the basement to get something to eat instead.
author: Madhu D.

description:
luckily I didn't have to wait long because I made a reservation on open table, which is probably recommended...I made a special request to have my table by the window for the view of union square, but i guess they didn't see that and we ended up sitting next to the bar, close to the window so not that bad....

waiter was nice, didn't introduce himself though...service was just okay =\...

food was good! it was my 2nd time getting a Kobe beef burger, I had it cooked medium well, served on a plain bun, and with American cheese...probably shouldn't have put cheese on it because it kind of took away from the flavor of the Kobe beef, but still was good...had it with a side of fat fries and salad, meh? not that great...

overall I think the only great thing here is the Kobe beef burger (16.75) and the bar area, but it's always full so good luck getting a seat!

will probably come back, there's another Kobe beef burger which is $60 and it's served with some sort of chocolate sauce? but, I'm not planning on it anytime soon...
author: Andrew V.

description: No, I did not come here again.  I would not and will never.  I just out of the blue remembered today that, adding to the bad service, they made us move tables between courses.  Talk about the epitome of classlessness.  You would think after being treated so horribly we would have been comped something but that was not the case.  Ugh, its been two months and I am still pissed off about this experience.
author: Caleb R.

description: Let's just say that the one in vegas is better, but the highlight is that I got to meet Hurbet Keller!
author: Karen H.

description:
The portions are very big! Wish you could split things but the $2 dollar charge doesn't make sense with the appetizers.

The small cobb salad is big enough for two people... go figure! The soup of the day... in our case was a mushroom delight! 

We had the classic burger which is good... but nothing amazing. The fries were ok. Glad I went but wouldn't go back.
author: carmen l.

description:
i've been waiting for burger bar to open in SF for years and i'm so glad that it's finally here!

what makes burger bar work is the variety of burgers, particularly the non-beef and veggie options.  this makes it very accessible to everyone.  that and the milkshake bar but more on that later.

the decor of the place is nice but what's intriguing is that it boasts that it has the biggest beer selection in union square.  when i saw a sign for chimay i naturally asked for a pour of it but was told that the sign was there for show.  huh?!?  in any case, the views from the window areas are pretty sweet.

on to the food.  i decided to go w/ the hubert keller burger and my wife custom made a chicken burger w/ black truffles and truffle sauce.  my burger was beautifully cooked and incredibly juicy.  the blue cheese added a great complexity and tanginess.  yum!  my wife's burger was pretty darn good but what stole the show was the truffle sauce rather than the truffles themselves.  i could just drink this stuff!

we decided to grab a milkshake too but decided to get some help from hubert keller himself!  he looked happy like a school boy when describing the desserts.  we were steered towards the caramel latte milkshake.  the milkshake was very sweet and had a nice coffee undertone too it that worked well together.

my only drawback to burger bar is the cost.  it's pretty freakin costly (the hubert keller burger was $22).  the hostess was working there was pretty incompetent too as she put us in places that were either dark or had no view even though it was 11:15am and the place was not full at that time.  the hostess did a complete 180 though once chef keller showed up.

when we left we saw that the wait here was insane so remember to go here at off peak times or you will have a 1-2 hour wait.
author: Swarup B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  I mean seriously, after I went on a trip to New York earlier this year, I've been searching for a burger place that can meet up with NY's standards.  So I heard about this place because of a friend's bday and I never knew there was such a restaurant inside Macy's let alone a restaurant from restaurateur, Hubert Keller famous for Fleur de Lys, which has been mentioned in pretty much every review on Yelp.  So anyway, I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately I was very disappointed.

First off, I know I'm in a Hubert Keller restaurant, so it's going to be a little pricey, but I find it hard to justify paying more than $10 for a burger.  And if I am paying more than $10 for a burger, it better be damn good because I've had plenty of burgers cheaper than that to satisfy (heck, a Six Dollar Burger that's less than $6 at Carl's Jr. can sometimes do me good).  So the price supported my mind that this burger experience is going to be the one that I'm looking for.

I order from the "Chef's Burger" side and being a little tight on cash at the moment, I order the Black Jack Burger, which looks to be a pretty classic burger but with tapenade (yeah, I didn't know what that was, and even my web browser thinks I misspelled it, until I tasted it, and it tastes like chopped olives), so I thought this should be a safe bet with the extra savory flavors that I'm paying for.  The wait time was decent, the place was packed and I was at a table with 14 people, but the service was fine.  I get the burger and my impressions are good... the garnishes looked the freshest I've ever seen with everything cut perfectly for you.  The patty looked pretty standard and I added ketchup and mayonnaise on it and put the burger together.  I took a bite.  I took another bite.  And another bite to be sure.  And that's when I got verified that this burger tasted no different from any other burger I've had before.  I would go as far as to say it tastes the same as a burger from Chili's or Red Robin or TGI Fridays.  I mean, it's not a bad burger in any way, but I was so disappointed from all the visceral hype I gave myself when sitting down in this fancy burger joint.  I asked my fellow adjacent guests about their burger and they all felt the same way.  Oh, this burger also came with fries, but nothing really to note here... it tastes like your typical french fries that you can get anywhere and I would still rather have McDonald's fries over this one.  I was definitely not feeling it that night.

An upside though, I got one their $8.25 shakes, I got Black & White, and that was pretty damn good.  The shake wasn't overly thick or overly sweet and that was the only thing that gave me enjoyment of the meal and the 2 stars for this review.  Though, I thought it was a little weird with the consistency because someone else at my table got the same shake, but the difference being that mine had chocolate chips on top while the other didn't.  Just a little detail that I noticed, but otherwise I'd recommend the Black & White and there was another with alcohol (forgot the name) that tasted even better.

In conclusion, I expected so much, but nearly all my expectations were crushed and I am yet to find a burger place to fill in my void ever since I went on that NY trip.  I really wouldn't spend my money on a burger here where I can get virtually the same burger down the street for half the price.  I would even say In N Out burgers were better than here.  I'd be open to try it again with a different (and unfortunately more expensive) burger, but if that doesn't meet my expectations, then I have no choice but to update my review with a 1 star, no matter how good the shake and atmosphere is at the place (the place does have an awesome view of Union Square).  This doesn't give me any negative impressions for Fleur de Lys, I still desire to go there one of these days because I'm sure that can't go wrong, right?
author: David Y.

description: I visited Burger Bar a couple weeks ago on a Friday night. It was busy at 6pm when I arrived, but we got a table for two right away. We got seated right next to the huge full-length windows, and the view of Union Square was spectacular! For dinner, I built my own burger with the Country Natural beef (deliciously flavorful), pepper jack cheese, avocado and bacon-- awesome!! Both the sweet potato fries and onion rings were delectable, and the service was top-notch. For something sweet, we split the Chocolate Burger, and it was a perfect end to a great meal. Plus, we got to wander the 7 floors of Macy's afterwards to help walk off dinner! I'll definitely return here on a future trip to SF!
author: Sarah W.

description: Chef Hubert Keller needs to get back and kick some butt in the kitchen and with the service staff. The burgers were overcooked. The waiter rarely came by to check on us. The place doesn't measure up to Hubert Keller standards, and he should be embarrassed to have his name on the restaurant. If I could, I'd give it 0 stars. It's like a Cheesecake Factory for burgers, an that's no compliment.
author: Rich W.

description: I came here for cocktails and some light fare.  Service was attentive...at times a little too attentive.  As my dining partner and I perused the beer selection on the menu, the waiter told us that a lot of those beers weren't available and gave us a scrap of paper with what they did have.  Luckily, our beers were available.  I had the Greek salad.  How can you mess up a Greek Salad?  It was so dull and flavorless and blah.  I know I should have ordered a burger because that's what they do...I just wasn't that hungry.  He ordered the surf and turf burger which he seemed to enjoy.  I wasn't impressed by the presentation.  The sweet potato fries were presented in this cute metal container and they were mostly good with a few old, dry pieces here and there.  I also had a martini which was ok.  The waitstaff asked me if they could clear my plate at least on 3 occasions even though we were still eating and the restaurant was near empty.  2 stars for some ambiance and views--waitstaff were too eager for my tastes.  The bill was high and as for the food, I expected more from Hubert Keller.
author: happy t.

description:
I give the Burger Bar four stars due to the fact that I had to wait for nearly a year for this joint to open. Talk about tardy! I mean . .. ! Now that it's open, I'm so glad, so glad that I now have a default eatery down in the Square, Westfield notwithstanding. I mean, one can only eat so many cream puffs, right?! I finally bit into burger heaven pleasure last week with my girlfriend and others. We met there for one of the world series games shortly after 5pm. The place was large and surprisingly empty, but it was early and a weekday after all, so no worries. Oh there's indeed ample of space, which I didn't expect, and plenty of natural light, an entire wall is glass, looking out onto Union square six levels below. Hii, shoppers!

We initially hunkered down at the bar and were instantly engaged in light conversation by the friendly bartender, who gave us a brief skinny on the spot. We had a good reposado tequila while waiting for the others to show. We admired the full bar replete with I believe four rows of top notch liquor - always glad tidings of joy. 
Once our friends arrived, we moved on to a booth. The great thing about their booths is the high def television set right into the booth. Although there's no sound, it was great to be able to watch the game right at the table while we drank what must be drunk and puzzled over our orders. Now everyone that's been to BB in Vegas knows the drill: Build your own juice gourmet burger. They've got some very notable fixings, my fave being anything with truffles. Don't know if I'll ever choose the foie gras, though I love the stuff. I think I'd explode if I did. 
Some day perhaps. Their patties are thick and juicy and delicious. The best element is the quality of their beef. You know from the first bite, trust me. You'll never stoop to In'n Out again! Expect on road trips, that is. Home Run, Burger Bar! 
For my next trip to BB: The milk shake bar! The bartender told us their shakes are off the hook awesome. Best part: you can spike your shakes with liquor! Smooth. 
Other perks: great beer selection! 
On the low: I wish they had more interesting appetizers, but can forgive them. After all, it's burgers & fries, c'mon ! 
Be prepared to spend the cabbage at this joint. It isn't Sonic. But it's worth the cost. Get to Burger Bar, both before and after shopping till you drop-ing !
author: Roland C.

description:
OK, wonderful restaurant, and I am  big fan of Mr. Keller. However, this place opened two weeks ago and they still have some kinks to work out. Thankfully, they made up for some of it with a round of martini's on the house (which helped).

My husband and I both built our own American Kobe beef burger. Man, that beef is tasty. It probably would have tasted better if they hadn't over cooked our  "medium" requests into well-done.  However, overall a really great burger. 

Service is a bit spotty, and probably due to the immaturity of this group working the restaurant. Our waitress seemed more interested in turning tables than selling us expensive burgers and drinks. It's frustrating to signal down your server for water refilling when your glass has been empty for 10+ minutes. It's also not great when the server finally comes over to ask us for our order, but fails to ask if we need another cocktail (hint: the empty glasses sitting at the edge of the table, closest to you, is your clue).  During our meal, two tables over from us, a glass falls and shatters on the ground. I wonder out loud how long it will take this staff to clean up the mess. Most seasoned restaurants would get the mess picked up before the glass hits the ground. It took the staff at Burger Bar about 15 minutes. So yes, service needs improvement, but overall I think this is a great place to check out. Service in a newly opened restaurant can only improve (well, it should). 

After our meal we could not resist ordering the dessert burger which consists of glazed donuts (the buns), chocolate ganache (the beef), gelatin-ized passion fruit (looks EXACTLY like american cheese!), mint (the lettuce) and some whipped cream. The p-fruit pretty much overpowered the whole taste, but I really appreciate how cool the desert looked. It really looked like a burger!  Once we peeled off the passion fruit, finishing the plate was no problem. 

In the end we dropped about $60 for two burgers and a dessert. I would do it again, definitely. I understand that opening a new restaurant can have it's problems and I  was happy to see management pop for some drinks for our troubles.  In the end, I feel we got our $$'s worth for some great food. Highly recommend.
author: Alison A.

description:
I've been a huge fan of Hubert Keller for a long time. I love his cooking shows on PBS and then his appearance on Top Chef Masters just made me like him more. Ever since Burger Bar opened in Las Vegas I have been craving something special from this concept. So, when the Union Square location opened I was so excited! Well, I have to say I am extremely disappointed. It may be that my expectations were too high, but my experience there was a huge let down.

First of all, the atmosphere is decent. Kind of like an upscale pub meets ice creamery but without the warmth of a real pub and without the welcoming feeling of a creamery.

Next, the service. Our server just seemed like he didn't want to be there. There was no spring in his step, no feeling that our satisfaction was his priority. Timing from the kitchen or from our server was way off too. I ordered a milkshake with my meal and I had finished the shake by the time our burgers and fries were delivered.
