Lastly, the food. It was ok. That's it. Ok. For $51 tip included for two people I expected a lot more than ok. The shake was great. I ordered chocolate and it came topped with real whipped cream and had hot fudge swirled down the side of the tall fountain glass. I ordered my burger medium rare and it came to me cooked medium. It was just ok. The meat needed sone basic seasonings like salt and pepper. The overall effect of my bacon cheese burger was off the mark. All the ingredients seemed high quality, but the net result was not quite there. Too dry and not enough flavor.

Like others have said, I've had much better burgers for a lot less elsewhere.

The French fries too were not great. I was expecting twice cooked French method French fries. But what I got were just regular old fries. They were cooked ok, but they didn't have the depth or texture of fries from places like Cafe Maman or Cafe de la press.

It's funny, I went around the corner of our booth to retrieve our son's stroller and literally bumped in to Hubert Keller. It was great to see him there but I was so disappointed with our experience that I acted like I didn't know who he was so I didn't have to go into how not great our meal was.

I will not be going back to Burger Bar again unless something drastic changes there.
author: Rob W.

description: Ok the reason I wanted to try it .... Beer!!!! They have 100 beers on the menue and that great news. Plus I wanted to see why it's good. I tried the sample plate of three sliders (small burgers) with three meats.
author: Brandi R.

description:
Pet peeves of mine: short answers and glares from waiters and/or waitresses!

As we sat down, the waitress came over and said, "What do you want to drink?" No "hello." No "how ya doing?" No "welcome." Just, "what do you want to drink?" Because we had waited 10 minutes at the table for her, she then asked, "Are you ready or do I need to come back?" I told her that we are ready and gave a moment to my friend so she could order first...there was a moments pause and the waitress said, "Um, so are you really ready or do I need to come back?" I SAID WE WERE READY. I'm sorry I just wasted 10 seconds of your extremely busy life by not saying something bc I was being nice to my friend! I wish I got her name but back to the intro we got, she never told us her name. I would so bust her out. She has arm tattoos though and short black hair. Next, problem...I like my meat medium well. Not medium, not well. MEDIUM WELL. I understand that all cooks are different but their is a standard for which meats are cooked. I asked her, "how well do the cooks grill to order?" She replied with, "On point." So I trusted her, my mistake. I ordered the American Burger or something like that. It had bacon. Yum. But it came out medium. :( It would have been a 5 star burger IF it was medium well...but it wasn't so ohhhh well. The fries tasted like Whataburger fries. Oh, and they give a pickle slice! Loved that.

The view was awesome! The wait time was 5 minutes.

I will probably be back...hopefully I won't get that waitress!
author: Cally L.

description: I ate here with a friend recently because I heard about the reputation of Keller but can't afford dinner at his finer establishment.  The first thing I noticed was the crappy music which I recognized from the website I had checked out earlier.  The service was pretty good, and the burgers were pretty good.  I had the kobe beef burger with cheddar and bacon, and my friend got the country (organic) burger with cheddar.  Both were cooked as we ordered, and the fries and onion rings were both very good.  But the burgers just didn't blow me away at all, and I had high expectations for the kobe beef in particular.  All in all I was satisfied when I left, but most likely wont return.  Its not cheap, and just doesn't stand out enough to justify going into a department store (enter via Macy's) to have dinner.   But if you're in the area and curious you certainly won't hate it.
author: Sam C.

description: This place is pretty good. Wonderful view of Union Square and the vibe is not bad on a Saturday night. Fairly different menu, if you don't eat meat - you might want to go somewhere else. They do have vegan options but they aren't  very fun. Full bar, inside a Macy's, good burgers, good view... worth a stop for sure.
author: Karen V.

description: I'm one of those people who believe that the greatest burger on Earth is still just a burger. That said, I don't mind paying these prices once in a while for a really outstanding experience. The signature buffalo burger, Hubert's personal favorite, was genuinely outstanding, as was the Burger Bar ale, but for a total of $28 for those two items they damn well better be outstanding. The vegetarian "burger", eggplant stuck between two thick juicy mushrooms, was equally delicious. Service was about as good as you might expect, and the view of Union Square all lit up for the holidays was worth a few dollars extra. In addition to the above-mentioned items, the menu lists a lengthy selection of other meat options and dessert items, all priced accordingly.
author: Dan Y.

description:
okay.  if there was an option for 1.5, i would have given burger bar that.

to sum it up:

1.  they didnt take reservations:  10 people, saturday night, 1 hour 30 minute wait.  ugh.

2.  they brought out 2 burgers... then the rest 15 minutes later!  one of the guys who got the kobe beef burger didnt want to be rude and eat his food in front of us but he didnt want his $16 burger to get cold.

3.  of the 10 total people, 3 people got burgers that were rare(ish) when they wanted medium well and well done when they wanter medium rare.  wrong buns on a couple people.

4.  i had the salmon burger which is why i gave them 2 stars.  i actually thought it was moist and tasty... 

5.  milkshakes took 25 minutes.

6.  and the kicker... subtotal $230 something + $22 tax + $6 sf health tax = $300
what? we did the math again... and again... AND again.  WARNING:  they include the gratuity WITHOUT itemizing it BUT then go and leave a gratuity line after the total.  so basically nowhere on the receipt did it say anything about including gratuity.  and with that extra line on the bottom, if we didnt pay attention we would have added even more.  

7.  so all in all, the salmon burger & fat fries save burger bar from a 1 star.
author: kim f.

description: I love a big juicy burger medium cooked any day but this place sucks ass! It's hella expensive and the burgers don't tast that good. Save your money and go upstairs to cheesecake factory.
author: Michelle C.

description:
After realizing that the Burger Bar has finally opened from after going to the Cheesecake Factory the night prior, we decided to come here for lunch since it is owned by the oh-so-famous Hubert Keller. I'm not one to say that I've had a perfect burger ever in my life and I'm not about to think so now, but since my boyfriend can appreciate a good burger, I can't say no to that.

We were seated immediately close to a window (can't expect everyone to have window seats, can I?) and was greeted by our waiter not long after (As a side note, seeing a hot waiter with a t-shirt that says "Fresh Meat" almost made me feel like I was at a male Hooter's for a good several minutes, not that that's a bad thing ;)).

My boyfriend saw "beer floats" on the menu and asked the waiter what that was about and he explained to us what they were in detail and since my boyfriend and I were on root beer float binges for the past 2 months, he decided to give it a shot since it was far too unique not to.

I went with the American Classic that is a Black Angus burger with crispy bacon along with the typical sides (red onions, tomatoes, lettuce, pickle) and I decided to add in avocado as well, it also comes with shoestring fries. My boyfriend order the Kobe burger and built his own along with a side of onion rings.

The beer floats came to our table first and the waiter patiently explained each float; there is about 7 in total, each with a liquor and ice cream of its own. My boyfriend liked it ok, I didn't (I don't drink alcohol).

Our burgers arrive and I immediately start panicking looking for the mayo and to my despair, there is none. I know, I know, you're thinking I shouldn't drown anything in mayo but I'm part of the elitist 2% part of the population that believes that you can never have too much mayo. Anyways, it's no big deal, but I really did wish I had mayo. I try the fries and they were cooked perfectly, I couldn't ask for much more. I asked my burger to be cooked medium-well and it got to be well-done. I actually prefer it well-done, I just don't want it dried out hence the medium-well, so it actually works towards how I wanted it.

However, my boyfriend ordered his medium-rare and his was close to medium-well. He showed the burger to the waiter and the waiter agreed and took it back immediately and had a new one brought out (although probably a good 10-15 minute wait). After getting his new burger, it was still a bit on the overcooked side, probably closer to medium than medium-rare, but he decided to let it go. His onion rings were done very well though along with a very nice batter.

While eating, I peered over to a table not far from us and it looked to me that it was a sundae and I just had to get one since it looked too good not to. To my disappointment, what she got wasn't a sundae but it was a milkshake! A heads up, don't get their sundae. When you're paying 7 bucks for a sundae, you expect a sundae, but this was a scoop of ice cream with an additional charge for toppings. But whatever, it was my own fault for assuming that she got a sundae; if I come back again, the milkshake is definitely on the list.

All in all, the bill came out to be about $80 with tip, it's definitely much more than I was prefer to spend on a meal with a burger. It wasn't great and it's not a place that I would be craving for any time soon but I wouldn't say no if I had to come back again. Oh, and one more thing, there's a split charge for like all the items on the menu, I'm not exactly sure what the etiquette is for charging for a split charge but when I'm shelling out 80 bucks for a meal, I am not a happy camper having a split charge on my bill. Now, it's not like it happened to me because the waiter was kind enough to tell us that the "split" button on the machine was out of order when we asked about it but that is a tad ridiculous if it did work.
author: Richard C.

description: Terrible service. The guy with long hair who was serving us was high.They forgot the sides in our create your own burgers and forgot to put in the order for our chicken wings. This was back in January 2012.
author: Sabrina L.

description: GREAT beer list, definitely on the pricey side. You have to decide if you want to pay 40-something bucks plus tip for a burger, a side and a couple of beers. If you do, you'll probably enjoy it. You just  have to know what you're getting in to ahead of time. I think the food is very good, just not a place I treat my self to very often.
author: S A.

description: Forget about the burgers, I would come here just for the Nutella shake. You have to be really uptight to give 2 stars to a burger joint. These are burgers people, meat between 2 pieces of bread. But alas, this place doesn't pretend to be just another "burger joint". Boasting beef from grass fed cows, foie gras with your burger patty? Damn. I can only review what I consumed at it wasn't the foie gras and truffle burger (can't afford it). I did have the american kobe burger with garlic aioli and grilled onions and it was exquisite. My overall experience on a busy holiday was excellent.
author: Mitch T.

description: Everytime I come here I leave so sad! I want to love it but for some reason I never seem to be able to come up with the right combination for a burger. They always seem to be quite bland. Staff is very kind and I always want to give their food another chance but I have yet to be blown away. Perhaps I need to splurge on the truffle burger one day...
author: Caitlin R.

description: This place should be called Alcoholic Shake Bar not Burger Bar because shakes are the only thing they do well here.  But I heart Hubert Keller so I'm going to give this place time to work out the kinks and hopefully I'll have a better update soon.
author: Jen C.

description: the Burger Bar is located on the 6th floor in the Macy's Building.  the environment is really nice and if you get a window seat, you overlook union square.  the Food.  yes, it is good, but nothing to die for and certainly way over priced.  burgers run $13 - $60.  I did, however, love the shakes.  I tried the Raspberry Sorbet - something you wouldn't normally order and it was outstanding and maybe worth the $8 price tag. Service:  the waiter was great and perfectly timed his visits.  the rest of the supporting staff was subpar.  I wasn't happy when one of them dropped off a napkin by tossing it on the table.  I almost said something and I ended up letting it go.  I would give this place as "you need to go once, but certainly not twice".
author: Glenn G.

description: Two of us split the kobe burger for lunch- plenty of food.  We ordered it with blue cheese and grilled onions- almost too rich.  The meat itself is so rich and melts in your mouth- spare the toppings.  Great beer selection.  Great view of Union Square.
author: blanca g.

description: I cannot even begin to tell you how awful my dining experience was. The service and food was horrendous. This is my 2nd visit and will be my last. We chose burger bar instead of the cheesecake factory. First, they took our names at 7.45 and said the wait was half hour(because we wanted a window seat to look at the Christmas lights). We were finally seated at 8.45 and guess what- we were squeezed right next to another family and the huge wreath hanging from the Macy's window. The server dint show up for almost 15 mins and by the time our food arrived it was 9.30. Over salted burger, soggy fries and miserably grilled, mushy vegetables. Hubert Keller, I love you with all my heart and rooted for you in Master Chefs. We have dined at fleur de lys and your wife was beyond a gracious hostess. Please, please teach the hostess, wait staff and servers at this location what restaurant dining is all about. The management and cleanliness of the restaurant is scarily sub-par.
author: Vidhya T.

description: Not bad at all - I appreciated the fact that the burger truly was cooked medium the way I ordered it.  Burger joints like to overcook burgers even when you insist on them being medium or medium rare, a huge bummer.  The place really is a "joint" - I expected darker lighting and comfortable seating as opposed to a sports bar set-up, but whatevs...IT IS WHAT IT IS...as honks around here say.  I'm sure I'll be back again ordering that $60 burger after one too many drinks within the next couple months.
author: Victoria G.

description: You choose your meat (kobe, angus, bison, organic), your bun, and select from a multitude of sides....truffles for $30 being one of them! Burgers were great, as was the service. Fries were dry...they need more restrooms to accommodate everyone. Two individual women's and one individual men's...not enough!
author: jennifer h.

description: I would love to give them 5 stars but the service here really sucked. The food is absolutely fabulous. The bacon on the burgers is so tasty. The buffalo burger is te best burger here. They also have a great beer selection. I've been to the one in Vegas too and it's just as good except the view in SF is so much better.
author: Ryan M.

description: I would give 3.5 if I could, food is really really good, the kobe beef burger was seriously delicious but the service is awful.  Like really bad, I am not usually one to complain but, I actually had to get up to go to the bar to get a drink at one point.  We were completely ignored, and it wasn't just our table it was everyone the server come and takes the order after you sit for 10-15 minutes and they are never to be seen again.  Sad that I have to give a lower rating because the food and the view are really worth the trip, but don't know if I am in the mood to be annoyed at dinner again.
author: Jennifer D.

description: If you come here you have to mollify your price to expectation ratio otherwise you're going to leave fuming. The Hubert Keller buffalo burger was very good (much better than the one from the Bullshead)as was their selection of beers. Unlike many of the other reviewers, ]I found the service spot on and the view over Union Square from the bar area was fantastic. The total cost for a burger, shared fries and one beer was about $35.
author: Procter F.

description:
Awful - Waiter was amazing - brings out the fries before the salad, then we waited 45 minutes for the burgers.  He said the burgers were coming right up, then 10 minutes later he said, defensively "This is not a fast food place!"  
Unbelievable.  When he was told the fries were cold, he said " Oh, you wanted your fries with your burgers?" 

 My vege burger was disgusting, barely cooked and mushy.  Hubert Keller should be embarrassed by the service and food.  Of course, the place was packed so he probably doesn't care.

Definitely give it a couple of months to shake out.  I've been to the Las Vegas Burger Bar twice and enjoyed it both times.
author: Robert S.

description: Visiting from out of town.  Food was amazing.  Everything is ala-carte.  Including cheese on your burger, but well worth it.  The ONLY thing that made me give them 2 stars was the HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!  Our waiter ditched us after he took our order.
author: Cara B.

description: I've had better burgers and for a lot less. Service was a little slow but the view was great. Would i go there again for a burger...probably not.
author: NANCY D.

description: Went here for lunch during a stay in SF and left completely stuffed. I had the absolute best strawberry milkshake here. The sweet potato fries and zucchini fries were also amazing. But the burgers were just average to me, and they were so gigantic, especially when you add your custom toppings, that it was a little unruly to eat. Although I did really like the a la carte topping selections. We had pretty bad service while there, but the location is very convenient. I'd say go there if you are in the Union Square area and craving burgers and fries, but don't make a special trip.
author: Brit T.

description:
When I stumbled on this place I couldn't wait to try it, but my experience here was underwhelming.
The wait wasn't bad for a crowded restaurant, but once we were seated the waiter (who was training someone else) forgot us for huge chunks of time.  This was made worse by the fact that a group of eight people right in front of our table for two seemed to be getting world-class service from several hovering staff members.  I must have waited ten minutes to have a sputtering moribund ketchup bottle replaced.  My shake, which was more like a sundae, came long before the burgers.  I'm used to having my shake with my meal. Maybe it's an East Coast thing.
I expected the high prices, but the size of the servings was barely adequate.  Maybe us mammoth Americans are spoiled, but it seems that a restaurant inside Macy's, surrounded by all the buying frenzy, should have big servings.  Exhibit One: Cheesecake Factory.
The food was very good, not great.
author: Robert C.

description: Completely underwhelmed. The burger was moist but not juicy, the bacon made no impression at all, the cheese was much the same, the bun was a bit dry. Everything is overpriced even considering the location, I'm at a loss as to why this place can't do the simple well.
author: James S.

description: I'm not usually a fan of restaurants in a mall or department store, but Burger Bar is pretty good for being in Macy's. The view of Union Square is great and they do have a bar area as well as pretty good burgers. They have buffalo, which if you like it, is quite tasty and a much healthier option over beef burgers.
author: Maren P.

description: I really wanted to like this place, I was looking forward to it and took a friend. The service was very bad, it took 20 minutes to get our drinks after we ordered them and had to remind the server and she responded by telling me she doesn't deliver the food. The food came out in a timely manner and I wish I could tell you what it was like but when I got a long dark hair in my burger it made me sick and didn't have the stomach to eat anything else out of that kitchen.The staff didn't seem shocked or even really care about it. I gave it two stars because they had good beers on tap.
author: Tyler S.

description: It is worth going to once, that's for sure, if you don't mind a 15 dollar burger with nothing particularly special about it.  They do a better salmon burger than hamburger, I think.  it is nice to sit near the window and look over civic center, but that's what you pay for, regular burgers with a decent view.
author: danica d.

description: So maybe it's because I went to Fleur De Lys the week before but I wasn't really blown away by this place. I had the Hubert Keller Burger which was a buffalo burger with caramelized onions, spinach, blue cheese on a ciabatta bun. I ordered my burger medium and it was cooked to perfection. Don't get me wrong it was a good burger but for a burger to have Hubert Keller's name on it I expected more. The zucchini fries and fried pickles were great, the perfect bar food. I was really impressed with the beer selection, the only other place I've seen that had Duvel Green on tap was the Trappist. They also had a variety of other Belgian beers and micro-brews on tap and in bottles. Burger Bar is a solid place and I would definitely go again but don't expect to go there and have the BEST burger in town because it isn't.
author: Boby M.

description: This is one of the worst restaurants I have ever eaten in!  First we had to wait an hour to get in.  Then when we finally got seated the floor was all wet and we had to get off for them to mop it up. The seat were all torn up. The burgers were horrible they had no taste at all.
author: Matthew T.

description:
I think Hubert Keller is a superb chef and he also seems like a genuinely good guy, so I give him a big cushion on stuff.

We went opening night (Friday - although if you showed up Thursday like my girlfriend did, you could have had a sneak-preview). We went early so as to beat the throng and it worked - we were seated within 5 minutes. 

The ambiance, as has been stated here, is not awesome. Its kind of stark and plain. Not terrible, not especially warm.

It is expensive. If you are going to squirm about paying $16 or $20 or more for a moderate-to large sized burger, dont come. 

Service was pretty bad - but it was opening night. I expect it to be botched up on the first "live" run. If it is still bad next week, then there is a bigger problem. They didnt have the kegs for most of the beers hooked up yet, one was not at all cold, the waitress lost our order, it goes on. 

The burgers were very very good. I had the Hubert Keller burger for about $22 bucks. It is buffalo and it is wicked good. My lady had the peppercorn one I think. Also very good. My only ding on the food was that I KNOW that a copious ammount of butter was used to make these burgers as unctuous as they were. That is great for the mouth but bad for the ass and belly.

Burger Bar is a good way to get some of Hubert Keller's food at a more attainable price than Fluer de Lys, but dont expect to be blown away.
author: Rick P.

description: Came in & sat at the bar. Waited 20 mins. Just for the bartender to throw a menu at me & my 4 friends and ignore us some more. Ended up walking out. Too bad.. were drinkers ! Will NEVER go back ! They should have zero stars!!!
author: Mary H.

description: I went here the day after Christmas and I loved the food. I ordered the make you own burger and it was really great. The place is a little crowded. It really isnt that hard to get too unless you are incapable of taking 5 escalators or waiting 2 minutes for an elevator. It was a nice view and the service was good. The only bad part is that it can be crowded but I did go on an extremely busy day. The price of my burger was about $14 which is pretty good considering Red Robin or a big burger at Burger King is about $10.
author: Johnny F.

description:
Average burger at best. 
Kitchen can't figure out the nuance between med rare and med well. On a $16 Kobe burger it would have been better med rare. 
It's just an expensive bad chain for burgers.
Rather have eaten at a five guys(I'm east coast.)
author: Jimmy M.

description:
"seriously?" is the one word that can describe my experience here. After my friend recommended this place, we decided to have a small birthday dinner here. We made a reservation for ten people two days ahead of time, so we figured "okay, cool! We won't have to wait at all when we show up for our reservation." when we got there on time, the hostess told us they were getting our table ready, so we waited...and waited...and yet again, waited. 20 minutes later, she finally calls for us, and then proceeds to take us to our table. 
We were seated in a huge, empty room, with plenty of extra tables, and only a few other people in there. I didn't understand why they had that huge, empty room, and a crowd of people waiting outside to be seated. 
Once our waiter came, he went around taking our orders, brought us our water, then left. After about 40 minutes, our food finally comes. After waiting an hour, we finally got the chance to start scarfing down. 
I've had many burgers before, and I must say, Wendy's can make a better burger than these guys. My burger was rare, when I specifically asked for well done. I couldn't eat it because it was falling apart, and I couldn't ask the waiter for a new one, because he was nowhere to be found. After forcing myself to eat my burger by using "this cost me $20" as my motivation, I couldn't take anymore. We were in that restaurant for a total of 2 hours, and the only time we saw our waiter was when he took our orders at the beginning. No one to ask if we needed anything else, no one to refill our drinks, and no one to bring our bill over. I actually had to walk around and hunt him down to get our bill, which is extremely unacceptable. I've been to some pathetic restaurants, but I have never had to get up and chase down a waiter before, ever. Overall, this was the worst birthday ever...and it wasn't even my birthday. This place is overpriced for the garbage they give you, they cheat their customers by making them wait outside when they have plenty of space, and their customer service is nonexistent. Regardless of all the "hype," this place is a joke, and is worth absolutely no one's time.
author: Ameer A.

description: i've been here two times.  the first time was pleasant, but that may be because there weren't so many people there.  My second (and last time here) was just a joke.  We waited about 20 min for a table.  as soon as we were seated, another 15 min has gone by before anyone had come to take our order.  our waiter was really sweet and apologized so i let it go.  so we order our food and the server just brings it to the table and leaves...no utensils, napkins, or anything.  So we spent about 5 min trying to flag down one of the dozen servers that were running around.  One guy finally stops for us and only gives us ONE set of utensils (there were three of us), and that set of utensils wasn't even clean.  so then we had to try to get someone else's attention to help us.  The entire visit was spent with us trying to get someone, ANYONE to help us out.  also, the food is not even that great.  Might as well go up to Cheesecake Factory.  this place is overpriced, not good, and the service sucks.  Will not be back
author: Damien R.

description:
A friend of mine RAVED about this place. She went on opening day and said nothing but nice things about the food and the owner. I stopped by here with some friends after a rigorous workout. We didn't want to waste any time showering and changing so we showed up in our workout gear. Luckily we fit right in because the Nike Women's Marathon had just finished. 
We waited in line for about 15 minutes. It seemed a little disorganized and short-staffed. After we were seated we waited a long time for the waiter and an even longer time for the food. While we waited we enjoyed the view over Union Square. 
We did not enjoy the wait but we did enjoy our food! I ordered angus beef on an onion bun with carmelized onions and mushrooms with cheddar with a side of onion rings. Everyone else liked their food too and we all agreed that it was worth the wait. My burger was HUGE, I could hardly open my mouth wide enough to accomodate it. The meat had a good consistency (I ordered medium rare) but didn't pop in my mouth. The onion rings went beautifully with a side of ranch. Plus they were only $3! The portion of the onion rings wasn't that large but it was enough for me. I don't usually eat like this (especially not after exercising) so it filled me up quickly.
Overall, I'm glad I went to try it out but it wasn't as mouth-watering delicious as I thought it would be. And the prices were a little steep for me. I would have tried their milkshakes if I wasn't lactose intolerant... but the looked like it would have been worth it. :)
 I agree with Eric H. and Nish N.'s reviews... I think everyone needs to try this place since it got so much hype. For me, it was a little disappointing but I might be back...
author: Amanda W.

description: I usually make it a point to stop by the Burger Bar in Vegas so when I found out there was one in SF - I was more than excited... Kobe Beef Burger and sweet potato fries !?! What !?! Soooo delish.. And yes of course you can't forget their Hazelnut Nutella Milkshake!  Two thumbs up and now I don't have until I'm in Vegas to get my fix! Oh the joys!
author: Caroline C.

description: Burgers were delicious!  Lots of different meat and topping  choices. The view was awesome. Service was awful. I would go again only if I was shopping at Macys and got hungry for a burger....otherwise the city has far too many choices for a great :burger with better service.h
author: Kim B.

description: Great for happy hour! That's the main reason I would recommend this place. Excellent view of union square with yummy appetizers and happy hour specials. The happy hour cocktail and appetizers are actually worth the cost during happy hour. Otherwise the burgers are pretty expensive. The milkshakes with alcohol are genius and delicious. Definitely worth trying (or splitting with someone). The milkshakes are a masterpiece to look at and to taste. Go for the happy hour and milkshakes. Those are your best bets!
author: Nicole L.

description:
I am a Las Vegas Burger Bar fan. Love the property and frequent there every time I go to Vegas. So you could imagine how ecstatic I was when Burg Bar SF opened up.

My daughter wanted to go there for her birthday, so we made a girls night out of it and invited our girlfriends to join us. Party of 4 please?

Once we stepped out of the elevator, the familiar ambiance of Burger Bar LV (with an SF twist of course) instantly greeted us.
In my opinion the space is noticeably different (in a good way), they managed to still capture the signature style of Burger Bar Las Vegas, but with a SF feel. I totally didn't feel like we were in Macys. The lighting was much more soft and relaxed and the music was hip and I could very often hear local artist in the play list. 

We scored a window seat and our waiter was nice to look at and very informative. He was not your usual over bearing opinionated "I tried this... this is really good ... everyone likes this ..." suggesting things without being asked kind of waiter. He instead explained the menu in a very inviting way, in a way that made us want to try everything. 
If you have yet to visit B Bar, I find it unique and quite cool that one side of the menu are Chef Hubert Keller's personal creations, and the other side of the menu is for you to build your own burger, with only the best ingredients of course. 

We were surprised to see world renowned, famous King of French cuisine, Top chef Masters Finalist, behind the milkshake bar whipping up a milkshake or two. You gotta love it! Of course we took advantage of the photo op and he openly and genuinely answered the girl's questions regarding "Top Chef Masters" and shared a quick story about  their favorite episode. It was nice to see that he is just as cool in person as he appears to be on TV and especially as cool as he is behind the ones and twos (DJ booth). 
We ordered a sampler of fries (still can't decide which is my favorite). The girls order Kobe beef burgers and giggled in excitement the entire time while eating. I decided to build my own burger with Kobe beef, BEST BURGER YET (aside from my usual out of this world Rossini of course). My girlfriend ordered Chef Keller's Surf and Turf, after a taste, I must admit that her burger out weighed anything I imagined it would be, so delicious and so divine. 

We bought a cookbook for my daughter, and chef Keller personally signed it. I hope next time I return that I'll have a martini in one hand snapping my fingers to the beat of some cool ass house music that Chef Keller is spinning in that cool private room they got over there. 
Still wondering about the negative Yelp reviews I read, maybe they were expecting something a little more IN and OUT?? A little more Fast Foodish?   
Take a bow Chef Keller, everything you touch turns to GOLD!!
author: MO C.

description:
Early on in my career I spent 5 years working in restaurants, some of the best in Houston. Whenever we opened a new restaurant we would do a mock run where we invited vip's and provided food for free so that the staff could get a feel for how things were going to be. After that we would staff as many floor managers, trainers from other sister restaurants, bartenders, waitstaff and busers as we could for the next two weeks so that we were prepared for the rush of a new restaurant. This all makes sense right? First impressions are everything right? 

We went to Burger Bar last night at 6:30 and were disappointed that the simple things are not happening yet. Understaffed, the staff that was there were totally stressed out, they didn't know the menu, I never saw a floor / front of the house manager even once, the hostess was unorganized and flustered (there was only one so she had to check people in and seat them and do table checks to see which tables were available to be seated). Another hostess did show up during the madness. Furthermore there was no teamwork amongst the waitstaff and they were all getting double and triple sat (plus the bar was getting slammed at the same time and the bartenders seemed like they were fresh out of bartending school with zero experience). The bar was dirty with plates and glasses for a good 15 minutes while we waited for our tables. Our drinks took 15 min and our burgers took 30. Not so bad for a flustered stressed out staff . The burgers were pretty good and everything seemed to be a pretty good value for San Francisco. 

My main gripe here is the fact that on an opening first week the staff seemed really weak and stressed out because there weren't enough of them! Food quality was fine, I hope they get the service to an acceptable level. We'll go back in six months to see how things have progressed.
author: Phillip K.

description:
Years ago went to Burger Bar in Las Vegas, and thought it was expensive and silly.

Hesitated before checking out the one in Union Square.  However, had a great time.

Burgers were great - moist and flavorful.  I usually drown my burger in sauces, but had no need to here.  The fries were crispy and delicious.

The waitress was professional and friendly - she got a big tip.

We got there before lunch rush, so had great seats right at the window.  By the time we left there was quite a wait to get in.

Would definitely return, but will note the lunch rush and come at a different time.  Too many great places to eat in SF to wait in line.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I just had the most disappointing dining experience tonite at Burger Bar.
The service was terrible & our appetizer presentation was blase.
After waiting 30 min. for a table for 5 we were finally seated, but it took 45 min. before we got our 1st course appetizers, which were not complicated or difficult orders~skinny french fries & sweet potato fries. While waiting for our food, I saw several orders of fries coming out in decorative metal coned shaped baskets. But, when ours finally arrived (after inquiring our waiter about the length of wait for our food), they were just thrown onto 2 small white plates & they were COLD!!!! We complained to someone (not our waiter because we could NEVER find him!), they apologized & told us the fries would be deducted from our bill (BIG DEAL!)
After another 15 min., our main course finally arrived...My son had the Peppercorn burger which he said was ok, my husband had the Angus burger & that was ok, my niece ate the Salmon burger which she liked & I & my sister-in-law both had the Cobb Salad which we thought was pretty good. But is that enough to go back? I don't' think so &I don't want to be discriminated again like that. We'd also noticed that 2 other parties who were seated AFTER us were served before us & even left before we'd finished our dinner. 
I'd eaten at Fleur De Lys before & that was truly a memorable experience but unfortunately, it wasn't that way at Burger Bar. I think the servicewokrers are doing Hubert Keller an injustice & he should look into this.
author: Karen Y.

description: I came here for a concierge mixer. I was able to try a couple dishes off the menu. The burgers are amazing but I have as good at much lower prices. Part Of the price you have to take into consideration is the location and the view. With all that the the food is a deal. The drinks a good. The staff does a great job. The management safe is friendly and seen. Its a great place for an awesome burger and a great view.
author: Michael T.

description:
Was in the city for the weekend, and meeting friends. Heard and read about the affiliate in Vegas. Turned out to be one of the worst experiences. 

1. Ran out of Chimay Red. 
2. Delivered the burger undercooked, and missing an item as billed {I ordered the Black Jack Burger}. We were specifically told "you cannot modify one of the chef's burgers." I didn't order a custom burger, so this is not mine.
3. Second burger was undercooked, again. Stomach aches in-waiting.

Now, the fakeGM is at the table. Did not introduce himself, simply said "Is there a problem here?" Lack of introduction, and lack of a simple "how can I help?" made for a dissatisfied experience.

And the rest of my party was simply unimpressed with their burgers. The price point mandates a solid, quality, flavorful burger. If you're pushing the $20 mark for a burger, you'd better be able to deliver. 

In-n-Out is my joint. At least I know what I am paying for.
author: joseph g.

description: So I've been into Burger Bar more than my personal fair share - If I'd register for Foursquare like all my friends do I'd for sure be the "Mayor" of the place by now! I'm not a big "foodie" like many of the reviewers seem to be on Yelp...but rather - I like what I like & if I don't care for it....i'd prob not say anything - I just wouldnt go back...I enjoy Burger Bar b/c I've always had a great burger - never the same one twice...all of the options from bun to toppings make this pretty easy to do! I always feel comfortable...either at the bar or checking out the Union Sq views from one of their 6th floor windows! Great beer & wine selection...And the Chef even brought me a milk shake once...VERY Kind...I won't soon forget that!
author: Nick F.

description: Came here after a horrible meal at Postrio down the street. Been to the one in Vegas many times. Disappointed with the SF version as the portions were smaller and the ingredients didn't seem to be the same. You can probably do better in San Francisco.
author: Dave R.

description: I had great expectation for this spot! Waited for awhile before they opened. Had lunch there with my brother and all i can say is Ehhhh. Ive had better burgers honestly. The fried jalapeno pickles were delicious but if your gonna call yourself Burger Bar, your burgers better be freakishly good. 1 star for clean and modern looking spot, 1 star for the fried jalapeno pickles and 1 star for the TRUFFLE SAUCE on the side.
author: Frankie L.

description: The burger is fine - got the country natural rare on ciabatta - their rare seemed like Medium to Medium Rare - no blood. The wait for just the  food is looong - that's why the A-OK. They have specialities though - a $60 burger with Kobe w/ the works. Make your own 4 additional dough for each add-on. 4me, I'll stick w/ Joe's Cable Car if I want a good burger. If I want a more fancy burger and if I'm @ Macy's - then Burger Bar would be it.  Maybe when I try it again, their food wait time get improved as its only 2wks old.
author: Johnson H.

description:
I went here a few weeks ago with a friend.  We both ordered the American Kobe Beef Burgers "as is" so we could taste the fabulous beef.  The manager came out a little while later to let us know that it would be a bit longer as they would need to re-cook our burgers.  We were catching up so it wasn't a big deal.  We had both ordered our burgers medium.  When they arrived mine was a bit less cooked than my friend's and I thought both looked a bit fleshy to be medium, I would have judged them to be medium rare.  I asked if they could just cook it a bit more and they did.  It came out alright but I can't say I noticed any particularly great flavor and really wish I hadn't spend the extra $7 on the Kobe.  In hindsight, a steak would have been a better way to experience Kobe beef.  They offered us free dessert for our troubles.  We ordered the Chocolate Burger and a couple scoops of ice cream.  It wasn't amazing and honestly it lost a lot of dessert appeal since it looked so much like a burger.

I doubt I'll be back.  It looks like the ice rink is up in Union Square so if you still want to try it, now might be the time.
author: Cristina S.

description:
I'm knocking my review down after a thoroughly "meh" experience over the weekend. I don't know what it was, maybe because I changed my order, maybe because I wasn't absolutely starving, maybe because we paid over $50 for 2 burgers and fries and the fries were the best part of the meal. We were completely unimpressed with Burger Bar this go round.
First of all, I hate the decor. I hate the dark wood against the white walls, it's the epitome of Faux Pub. It's trying to be homey and loungey but only superficially. There's nothing genuine about the attempt to simulate a bar atmosphere. Just blah
The Kobe beef upgrade is totally not worth it. I couldn't taste the difference from the half-the-price Black Angus burger. Maybe it was a little juicier but not worth an extra 8 bucks. The flavor of the meat is kinda non-existent; a little salt and pepper would go a long way. The sourdough bun isn't sour at all; sourdough for people who don't like sourdough, and they could stand to toast it a little. The whole package was just so Blah. I really like the skinny fries though. It's really bad when I'm eating the fries more than the burger. If I ever have to go back I'll probably just order fries and a chocolate shake.

I think a big factor in the "meh-ness" of this experience is that there are so many delicious, gourmet burgers to be had for much, much cheaper. The burger at Chez Maman is a great example; pure deliciousness for about $10 fries included; same with Jacks Prime in San Mateo. My tip for you: get a burger somewhere else, and with the money you save get a nice glass of wine to go with it.
author: Melanie V.

description:
Good burgers, but I suggest going off-hours. If they are busy the service can be... not the best. Definitely get the American Kobe beef or the Buffalo. Also the shakes are excellent.

Beware of paying with a credit card here, the receipts print out the entire credit card number (vesus just the last four digits.)
author: Brian H.

description: For being run by Hubert Keller, I was kinda disappointed.  We just went here for dessert but it was just so so.  Scoops of ice cream dropped in some beer.  Big frickin WHOOP.  My friend had the chocolate burger that comes with a slice of chocolate ganache, fresh strawberries, passion fruit all between a sliced, sugared donut.  The presentation was cute.  they had a whipped cream mouse on the side of the plate...and I wish I could tell you what this thing tasted like but according to my friend, he says it's awesome.  Usually, I try to take people's word for it when they tell me they had something good to eat but when it comes to this man, the one of the only thing he KNOWS when it comes to great food/bevs is alcohol so I don't know if I'd trust it too much.  Nice venue though.
author: Gina K.

description:
The good news is the food is good. 

The bad news is that you will not get what you ordered! On a table of 12 there were 8 wrong orders and plus we had to wait a long time. Do your self a favor and go else where.
author: Eric m.

description: Great food with okay service. Nutella Milkshake rocks!
author: Chas B.

description: its a nice place to eat every once in a while. just wish it wasnt so expensive. i always get the salmon burger cause its the cheapest thing there pretty much lol. service is nice foods always good and they have a nice selection of drinks. i enjoy it.
author: jen g.

description:
Apparently, it requires no talent to work here as I watched the hostesses struggle with the surprise crush.  Now, grant it, it was the day of the Giants World Series Parade.  But then again, its moments like these where professionalism can really shine, unfortunately, that is not Burger Bar.  

So what about the food?  In short, overpriced burgers - that's it.  Exhibit A: a pretentious $60 kobe beef burger, a ridiculous concoction that includes foie gras and black truffles as toppings.  Puh-lease.

Actually, I have no 'beef' with the quality of the food (pun intended).  I ordered the daily special, what appeared to be a regular sized burger on a fancy bun with swiss cheese and sauteed mushrooms for $11.25.  Fine, whatever, I love burgers, bring it on.  I briefly glanced at the other burgers and the "build your owns" started around $15.00.  

The burger and fries were fine.  Although, that's no surprise.  I mean, c'mon, it's pretty hard to mess up a burger and fries.  The burger was served with fresh lettuce, a slice of tomato, and a slice of red onion.  It also came with a quarter deli pickle which was average.

But the service!  Are you kidding me?!? The hostess called out our party, "Francisco."  While I was trying to get a member of our party's attention to answer the hostess, all of a sudden, right in front of me, a woman walks up, says "Francine?" to the hostess and the hostess begins to take her away to our table.  I called out to the hostess, to tell her to hold on, "Francisco" is right here, and the hostess said sorry, she had already called "it" and walked off with Francine.  I don't know who I was more shocked at - the unprofessional hostess or Francine.  Later I decided I disliked them both equally.  In any case, after our meal, I mentioned my displeasure to the hostess on the way out to which she replied whatever and rolled her eyes.  

At least our server wasn't rude but she wasn't anything to write home about either.  

So the bottom line is if you want to pay $15 to $20 for a burger and fries, a burger that is in no way special or worth the price and fries that remind you of the battered fries at Burger King, then this place will fit the bill. Just be sure to respond quickly when the hostess calls your name.  What a joke.
author: Brian H.

description:
I have never write a negative review as I do not even want to put bad restaurant name on Yelp, but my experience with Burger Bar this past weekend was so bad (the waiter) that I need to let all know so to be warned.

We were there (8 of us) to have dinner before a show (Dec 18th Sat).  The waiter some how looks as if he is on drug (blank stare and inattentive to what we order.  Repeated questions that we have already asked).  

In the course of dinner, he drop plate of food for another table.  We have asked for milk for 4 kids and he only brought one (when obviously we had 4 kids), and he went on asking how many more when all others other than the kids already have drinks...  

Finally when we asked for the check, we waited for more than 15 minutes, and when the bill finally came, there were extra items that was added to the bill (20$ worth) which we never ordered, and it was obvious that from the number of 8 parties, it is not possible to have that much food.

When we brought this up and ask him to correct the bill, I passed my credit card to him so we can settle the bill quickly as we have to catch a show.  5 more minutes passed, thus I walked up to the billing corner of the restaurant to see what was the problem.  Apparently there was issue trying to find out who the other 2 items belong to.

Finally when the bill was cleared (waited another 5 minutes), the waiter passed the bill to me asking for my credit card.  I told him that I gave him the credit card, but he protested that I never game him.  His colleague then found the credit card on the floor.

This was the most horrible experience I have ever had in a restaurant.  I was almost comical, but a scary experience.  Too bad the burger was excellent!
author: Eddie A.

description: Tasty buffalo burger. Enjoyed it! Definitely recommend. Location is a bit odd though, on the 6th floor of the Macy's building.
author: Kevin F.

description:
If you were considering this spot because of its famous french chef, forget about it.

If you want an average overpriced burger in an average environment in a department store, then the Burger Bar might just be fine for you. With a minimal menu of burgers with a salad or two you would think a "famous chef" would make an effort to make everything sing. I didn't try the fries but the salad was overdressed, and though I asked for a MR I received Raw burger seared on the outside, with toppings that could have been interesting if a chef was involved. But a chef was not involved in this meal. The toppings were indistinguishable and the cole slaw found in a supermarket deli. The underpaid immigrant prep cook of chain restaurants across the country was probably running this show.

The bar had a nice selection of microbrews and the alcohol milk shake bar had possibilities. But it all came with a tourist price tag, and coupled with the small print % surcharge to "cover the SF health initiative" expensive. I'm sorry but this just reeks of BS. If it is part of your overhead put it in the price. I didn't see a % surcharge for AT&T's overpriced  charges. This appeared to be an effort to make prices look less than they actually are, and an offensive political soap box.

Service was generally friendly but involved a rotating team of everchanging faces. The Rare burger was dropped off and I was not approached about how the meal was until it was time to clear the table. And then, he did, he asked, do you need change? This has got to be one of the most telling signs of servers that have very little to no idea of what service really is.
author: be b.

description: Went to Burger Bar with my boyfriend the other night and had a wonderful time! Amazing view of union square and great happy hour. It was a rather busy night, but our server, Brian, was very friendly and helpful in suggesting different types of burgers. Overall, had a fabulous time! SIDENOTE: For the yelp reviewer who mentioned that you need to dress up and have your boobs hanging out in order to receive great service here, wrong! I came to Burger Bar with my Rainbow flip flops, and a Northface jacket and ultimately had a great experience.
author: Brittney J.

description:
So here is my take on Burger Bar: I left this place with mixed emotions, given that it is in Union Square it's designed primarily for tourists, however the interior design of the restaurant was poorly executed, lights too bright, plain white walls with few similar cheap frames that were hanging too low. Maybe they should go upstairs and get some advice from the Cheese Cake Factory. Service: What service? They have a pretty good beer menu, but I highly suspect they did not bring me the correct beer I had ordered. Also, they actually brought me a glass of water that had food on the glass, this was something to remember. I also understand that it was opening day,  I was told that it's a 45 min wait this quickly turned into 1 hour and a half, by the time I was seated i'm pretty sure that anything after hanging out at the bar would taste pretty good. 
Food: Well I could say that the burger was pretty good. Here is what we ordered.
1 American Kobe Beef Burger with Blue Cheese and side of Onion Rings 
1 Country Natural with Pepper Jack Cheese and Zucchini Fries. 

Drinks: 
1 Irish Coffee Shake
1 Warstiener Pils Beer
1 Gin and Tonic

Total cost: $74.00

In conclusion: The drinks, with the exception the beer which I still suspect is not what I had ordered were excellent, the burgers and onion rings were great. Zucchini Fries, not so great. Was it worth the $74.00, well factor in the service and the fact that in the end your only ordering  burgers, your better off going to Brick House on Brannan Street ordering the same thing enjoying some live music and your bill will still be about half.
author: Philippe P.

description:
We came during the lunch time rush on a Friday and got take out. I had been waiting all week for this, and needless to say I was rather let down. 

It is FAR from an incredible burger. In all honesty, I've had juicier burgers at TGIFridays. Sad. Not a terrible burger, just not amazing, and definitely not worth the wait and the price. 

Seems like a tourist trap, rather than actually being a quality SF restaurant. I'd give this a "not worth visiting again, but not terrible" vote.
author: Anthony D.

description:
I went with no expectations. I left with no plans of returning. 

While the shakes were great, the burgers were something you can get anywhere at a much more reasonable price. (Perhaps Hubert should have opened a malt shop instead.)

The decor sincerely made it feel like we were eating in an airport sports bar. Imagine going to a Chili's with an expensive menu at SFO. There, you've just experienced Burger Bar. Save your cash and take the elevator a few floors higher at Macy's. You'll get a better selection at The Cheesecake Factory than you will here.

Both Macy's and Hubert should be ashamed for cheapening their images with this latest installment.
author: Shane M.

description:
I wish I could give this place negative stars.

I have eaten this in Vegas inside Mandalay Bay and thought it was "ok" and not too bad.  I would give it another shot one day if I wanted a burger.

Wish I never gave it a second shot here in SF.  The same kobe burger I had tasted like dog poo here.  Service?  Horrible.  Why do people stand in line to eat dog poo here?  Beats me, but they must be dumb like me.  

There are way better places in the city to eat than this junk.
author: K. H.

description: Burger Bar is Burger Bust, The place was dirty, the staff one scale above McDonalds.  If a celebrity chef puts his name on something, the expectations is it must meet such standards, and in this place it clearly does not.  The food presentation was lack luster, the food quality was ok, I cook better.  Good for tourist, but not those that live here, and know good food.
author: Michael G.

description: I came here with my friend before we started shopping in Union square. We were so lucky to sit by the window because its a great view and it was one of those nice clear days. I ordered the Salmon burger which was great!! Our server was so friendly and she never let our drinks go empty. The best part was the Nutella shake. My friend and I felt so guilty for ordering it, that we asked for it to be split. Our server was so nice, she happily split it for us. This is one of the best burger places I've been to.
author: Adriana M.

description: I feel so guilty not giving this place a better rating because I am such a fan of Hubert Keller. It is still a very new restaurant and I believe that there are still some problems that need to be fixed. While I was waiting for a table, I saw empty glasses strewn everywhere in the waiting area, not a great first impression. The service was even worse. We saw the server twice, once when we ordered and the second time when she brought our drinks. We never got a refill or a check back. Also, I know this place is casual, but the waitress' cleavage and red bra were too much. Thank goodness, the food was fantastic. I had the kobe burger with carmelized onions, cheddar and avocado. I also went to this place for one of their private events. It was entertaining but the bar was understaffed. I think this place has a lot of potential. It just needs to get its act together.
author: rebecca p.

description:
Decided to eat here on my first night in San Francisco with M. Wait was kinda long but it wasn't so bad since we were able to walk around Macy's to kill time. 
Service was ok. The food was ok especially for it's price. And the added veggies and extras? WAY too overpriced. For the price they charge for the burger, some of the veggies should come for free at least. I mean, .75 cents for a couple slices of cucumber? 
So I ordered the Country Natural and it was pretty good. I also ordered the black truffle sauce cause it wasn't as overpriced as actual black truffles ($30 extra on a $10 burger). 
Also got some sides... Onions rings - good; fried zucchini: yuck. Skinny fries are better than fat fries. All are better with ranch.
We did get very full and they have little tvs right at your booth so you can watch whatever game is on. Not sure if they can change the channel to whatever game you want, but it's there.
i guess the shakes are also something to try but with the burger already costing so much we decided to skip it. plus, the ladies in the booth across from us gave us a shake from their sampler. i don't remember the flavor but it was ok.
author: Kat Q.

description:
My cousins and my girlfriend came here because there was a 90 minute wait for a table at Cheesecake Factory.  We got a table right away on a busy Saturday night.
We ordered the world's spiciest burger, a buffalo burger, a kobe beef burger the regular angus burger, and the chicken wings appetizer.  The food was pretty good, but it was nothing special that you couldn't find at Burgermeister or some other nice burger spot.  The price, however, was quite high for moderate food.
The service was extremely terrible.  The initial exchange to order food and drinks was polite, but that was about it.  After finishing our meal, we wanted to order dessert.  I saw our waiter standing around at the bar area, obviously bored because he was chatting it up with a waitress and appeared to have nothing to do.  He never looked in our direction and after 2-3 minutes of watching him, he finally decided to move, to another area of the restaurant.
We waited 5+ minutes, and we asked another waiter if we could order dessert.  He mumbled something quietly and walked away to take an order from another table.  I can understand only being responsible for your own tables, but he could have at least told our waiter that his table needed service.
After another 5 minutes, I started to get annoyed so I asked a passing host to see if he could find our waiter.  Another 5 minutes later, our waiter returned to fill our water and bring us the menu.  He then disappeared and did not return for a whopping 20 minutes.  Needless to say, we ditched the dessert and asked for the check.  As he brought the check, I made sure that he did not just drop the check down and leave again.
If the service was excellent, I might have bumped this up to 2.5 stars or something, but the service killed it.  If i could give less than 1 star, I would.  Even if you have money to burn, I would not recommend this place.
author: T C.

description:
Because we were big fans of Hubert Keller from Top Chef Masters, we wanted to try out his burger place, since he was known for the kick ass burger. I was hoping the place he created was less of "The Counter" burger place, and more of his great creations, but I guess the Build Your Own Burger joint had more high end options than some restaurants. I was a little floored by the idea of paying $22 for a burger, though the $60 burger with truffle sauce and foie gras sounded like more of a deal than a Million Dollar Burger I have seen in other burger joints. 
I tried a BYOB country range burger with jalapeno bacon and cheddar cheese on an onion roll. My better half ordered the buffalo sliders. Both had exceptional taste from the meat. I liked the look of the sliders--everything miniaturized, the tomato slice, the onion slice, the bun--it was all so cute. We both accompanied the burgers with skinny fries and a 21st Amendment Watermelon Hefeweizen. The hef seemed pale for unfiltered, but the watermelon was refreshing....
A lot of money for a burger is still a hard idea to sell for me, though one of these days I will come back and tackle that $60 burger!
author: Verissa S.

description: hungry as hell on a wednesday night we decided to try the Burger Bar in SF. Looked at the menu and thought for 60$ that rossini buger better hold up to the hype. I ordered the burger as what the chef would reccomend. When the burger came I took a huge bite and was immediately pleasesd. The Froi Gras and truffles made this burger delicious, I poured a little of the sauce on the burger for every bite. I would defanitely come back and eat this burger again. Im not a huge BEEF fan and must say this is the one Burger I will eat. Didnt even leave me feeling super full and rundown, and this was at 9pm..... Service though did lack that is why this review only gave them 3 stars.
author: Jorge J.

description: This place was so hyped up because Hubert Keller was opening another restaurant in SF and one that was popular in other cities. After trying out this place Wednesday, I have to say that it is is over rated. I spent $20 on a burger that was undercooked and not flavorful. Even the extra fixins I ordered to put on the burger was bland. I almost wish I got the $60 kobe beef truffle burger just to get something out of it. If you're looking for good burgers, I suggest you look elsewhere. There are many pubs and burger joints in SF that make me drool just thinking of them, but this is not one. Also if you want skinny fries, save  yourself the money and go to McDonalds.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Date and time: Oct. 22, 2009 at 8:30PM
Moderate crowd. Many tables still open.

Upon entering Burger Bar, I noticed there were multiple tables available for my group of four. I actually told my group that that table was open and "called" on it. The hostess said the table will be ready in about 10-15 minutes. What? 10 minutes later, oh look, we sit in the table I pointed to. Strike One. Our waitress was Brooke, wearing a red bandanna on her forehead. It took another 20 minutes to get our round of beers, a world time record for slowest serving of beer ever prepared. Hell, she didn't even know what a Fat Tire beer or Dos Equis beer was. Strike Two. We even had to point to the Fat Tire on the menu because she didn't believe the beer was on the menu. After that, we didn't hear from her until we received our checks (the "chefs" presented our burgers), and we still had to flag her down to pay our meals. Strike three, the group is angry at this point. There was not suppose to be any wait time as half the tables were available. Very disappointing experience, and Burger Bar SF has only been running for what, a week? The whole point of eating at a restaurant/bar is for the service, and Burger Bar failed, at an epic proportion.

Ending statement: Great burgers, very customizable. However, the service is horrible even during dead hours (DO NOT have Brooke as your waitress, switch tables/waitresses ASAP!). Would I go back? If the food was half the price.
author: Michael S.

description: This place sucks!  WAY too expensive. The sliders were about a tablespoon of meat.  The buns were hard. There was no one in the restaurant and the fries were cold.  The sweet potato fries were tasteless. What is all the fuss about?  Skip it!
author: Sue H.

description:
I must say I have enjoyed the best burger in my entire lifetime here at Burger Bar. I was skeptical at first walking in being on the sixth floor of Macy's. Had a wonderful window seat overlooking Union Square and the lit Xmas tree, but it still felt a lil too commercial for me. How could this be "the " Burger Bar I had hoped to dine at ever since seeeing the opening in Las Vegas. I am a huge fan of Hubert Keller so I had to try it. 

Ok, I could care less bout the ambiance once I got the burger. Can't say much about a memorable experience about the service either. But OMG! The ambiance could have been %&$@# because I had my eyes closed for every second that mouth watering burger was touching my palate. Kobe beef burger, toasted onion roll, Pan-seared foie gras and a side of the red wine shallot reduction sauce. Although $30 may be a lot for a burger, everytime I have $30 in my pocket while in SF, I will be knocking on the door of Hubert Keller and the Burger Bar. I cannot say more to describe this experience. 

An added plus was the arrival of the MILKSHAKE PADDLE! Once again Hubert has hit the spot. 6 mini versions of his signature milkshakes with gourmet ingredients. My fav was the Nutella. Wife and kid loved the strawberry. 

After reading this review after typing, it must seem like I am an employee or investor for this concept. That is not anywhere near the truth. I love you guys Burger Bar! I will be back next week! Maybe even add the black truffles to the best burger in the whole entire world!

I CAN NOW DIE A HAPPY MAN!
author: Christopher M.

description:
Great food, great view and exciting atmosphere. The only reason I give 4 stars is because we have always had slow and even rude service.

The food however, makes up for the wait-staffs short-comings. Different selections of fries - my fave are the sweet potato fries of course :)

The buffalo burger is delish - i was hesitant to try it, but it was quite yummy! Have yet to try the famous $60 burger, might need to save some money for that one, but the menu is full of great items for semi-decent prices.

Best of all - this place is owned by Hubert Keller - and a lot of times, he is actually there! So cool to see him in the back cooking and prepping food!!

Desert is great as well - try the desert burger - I won't ruin the surprise for you, but needless to say it is delicious. The longest wait I have had here is about 5 minutes to sit, so its not too bad. If you go between 3PM-6PM you should not have a problem getting in.

Fun place, with great burgers of course!
author: Melissa R.

description:
you know i heard a lot about this place. i was expecting it to be more like a mels or something. 
I was soooo wrong. This place was great. wonderful view of union square. 
The burgers were wonderful
author: Steve M.

description: Great view. Hubert needs to get in the kitchen and kick someones ass. Stale sourdough bun. Inedible gristle in the kobe patty. Good servers and a nice spot to have an over priced beer.
author: Ben B.

description: burger bar is a good option in union square a beautiful burger along side a nice shake its a little pricey which is the fall back but still good they also have buffalo along side with other meats to try and you fully customize your burger worth a shot
author: Roshan K.

description: Great Happy Hour.  Killer wings!
author: Ryan A.

description: Came back another time to try some of the other menu options. The beau got the Surf and Turf Burger which was pretty good. Nice tender patty and a big chuck of lobster, delish! I opted for the Hubert Keller burger (his favorite apparently) and was a bit disappointed. I guess I had high expectations since it was his favorite. The buffalo patty was nice and tender, but it being buffalo, medium meant it was a little pinker than medium for beef. This isn't a big deal, but just bear it in mind if you order medium for buffalo. I've read some of the other reviews down below and people were complaining that they're burger came out too pink, ahem, this might be why so just take it into consideration. I was expecting this burger to be just as wonderful as I remembered when I tried it for the first time with the Burger Bar Sliders, however the caramelized onions didn't play a major role in the Hubert Keller Burger like it did in the sliders. Also, the blue cheese was over powering. Many have pointed out the playfulness in Hubert Keller and one of my favorite things here is the milkshake paddle. For $20 bucks you get six small milkshake glasses (three flavors: Strawberry, Caramel latte, and Nutella) on a paddle. A very good deal if you ask me considering that one regular milkshake already costs $8.75. Service was superb, better than the first time I was there when the waiter told me I couldn't substitute my skinny fries for sweet potato fries.
author: Karen L.

description: As a vegan, I like to go into meaty restaurants to see what's on the menu for me. So often I am blown away by the creativity that goes into accommodating us non-meat eaters. I usually come away satisfied and happy. At the Burger Bar I was going to order the veggie burger, but the bartenter (I sat at the bar) said it had cheese already in it so I ordered the Vegan Burger. The "bun" was a portobello mushrooom split in half and the innards were eggplant, tomatoes and grilled red bell peppers. It could have been delicious, but unfortunately the burger was sitting in a puddle of oil mixed with water from the cooked veggies. I love to be able to recommend vegan choices whenever I can and wherever I go, but no-can-do this time.
author: Barbara W.

description:
three of us showed up for a delicious burger on a thursday evening.

after a 20min wait we were seated, not so bad for a new place in union square. we had a decent experience, it wasn't mind blowing but it was fun.

i got a buffalo meat burger with a few extra fixin's, one of which was a fried egg. i paired it with a spaten oktoberfest beer, which was one of the many beers in their pretty good selection.

not somewhere i'd go often, but once in a while this place can be a fun dinner.
author: Ameer N.

description: If you're looking for fancy burgers and INCREDIBLE milkshakes, this is your place. I had the buffalo burger, which was good, but the main star of the show was the strawberry nutella milshake. It was all chocolate whip creamed and decorated within an inch of its life. I told my table that I wanted to create a milk shake like this before I die. I'm adding it to the bucket list, fo sho. It was rich and ridiculous. The service was pretty attentive and we were able to get in and out on a friday at noon relatively quickly.
author: Hanan H.

description: drinks, tasty burgers 8/10, great view and friendly waiters. kind of pricey but its worth it. the ambiance  really makes this place
author: Horacio R.

description: Tasty burgers, but it needs more of a Keller gourmet/plating touch at $40 per person for a burger and a couple drinks. Service pretty slow too.
author: Peter H.

description:
Consider this a 3.5 star review, with the view of Union Square tipping it in the direction of a 4 star review.

The food was really quite tasty, our waitress was nice, we were seated right away.  I liked the atmosphere, but it was a bit loud.  Now, the main complaint seems to be price, and I'd tend to agree - it IS a little pricey for what you're getting.  At the same time, you're in the heart of Union Square.... that's not a cheap locale.

Overall, I'd come back; but it's not going to be one of my go-to places.
author: Chris W.

description: Went on a Friday night, they take no reservations , they sat us quickly and with a request for a window seat.  Very dark inside so hard to read the menu.  I had a country burger with skinny fires. You create the burger they way you want it , all toppings and type of bread. The burgers range from $10-$15.  The service was fast and the food really good . I was surprised for a burger. The view was excellent full view of Union Square. I would go there again. The food was a lot so did not try out the desert.
author: Susie S.

description: No wait, got a window table, great view of Union Square. Ordered a Lemon Drop w/ Grey Goose® Vodka since they were out of Ketel One®. Was horrible. I think they used Country Time lemonade mix. I could barely drink it, it was so vile. I had the Kobe beef burger w/ avacado, bacon and carmalized onions. A great $25 burger. :-)
author: Red S.

description:
I had a great time at the bar on a sunday afternoon.  I had a few sliders with the skinny fries and they were good, but the 4 stars are for the beer selection, view, and ambiance.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that burger bar had a wonderful view of union square.  I thought it was completely enclosed... I guess that wouldn't make for a good restaurant, but that's what I thought...
Another surprise was the vast amount of opens seats in the bar and the dining room.  We sat in the bar since the main objective was to get a drink.  There were booths in the restaurant that had their own personal tvs - very cool.  

I spent quite a while looking through the drink menu and the beers on tap.  They had such a variety including old stout #38 in addition to a $38 glass of pumpkin beer? I didn't try it, but am intrigued. They also had alcohol floats!  

A downside is the one stall bathroom.  For such a large restaurant it would make sense to have a few more stalls.

There was also a private dining room with a large tv in it as well.  

Not too shabby.
author: Valerie S.

description: This place has a great view and you can get a Kobe Beef hamburger.  Definitely a great place to take a first date or a 50th date.
author: Chris D.

description: Solid 3 stars.  Nothing great, nothing bad.  I had the Hubert Keller burger, fried zucchini, fried pickles, and Nutella milkshake (okay I didn't order all of that, but that was what the table ordered).  The Hubert Keller burger was tasty, but not worth the price.  The fried zucchini and fried pickles were just that, fried food, really how bad could it get?  The french fries that came with the burger were also okay (I firmly believe that deep fried + salt can't ever be that bad).  The Nutella milkshake was way too thick and rich for me.  I swear it was probably a week's worth of calories in a glass, which wouldn't be so bad, but it crossed the line from guilty decadence to wow this is way too fat and rich.
author: Joann C.

description: Good burger, good sweet potato fries and a gorgeous view.  I'm not sure I;d pay that much for some of the burgers but it's a fun place to go and my burger was pretty good.  The staff wasn't that memorable or friendly.  I do regret not getting a shake because they looked good.
author: Kiki A.

description: It's located within the Macy's, which is very unique. Cheesecake factory also. Anyways, the service wasn't very good to begin with. We were constantly hassled to order, but when we wanted something else, there was no attention paid. The place is ridiculously overpriced, and the food was too glorified. Burgers were too small, and tasted bland. I had the Hubert keller with sweet potato fries, the fries werent bad. You'll notice how much they are trying to maximize profits by the size of their condiments. Everything is small, mustard, ketchup, A1 sauce, even their water glasses are small. The guy who brought our food out, got mad that he made a mistake on our orders, and was too stubborn to realize that he jacked all the food up. I mean, he didn't even take our orders, so how does he know who they go to? He was just throwing it down on the table to the wrong people, never asking who ordered what. Beer was the only good thing, as they sell pitchers. Save your money, go elsewhere.
author: Phan H.

description: Went there late on Black Friday, after tree lighting ceremony.  So, I expected to wait a long time and I did.  They were tremendously understaffed for such a busy time.  The real problem is that the food is not that good.  I had the black jack burger with tapenade.  The others in my party had the regular Black Angus burger.  The burgers are OK, but definitely not work the high prices they charge.  You are far better off at an In and Out for a Double Double.  Please avoid this rip off place.
author: Martin K.

description:
the only reason i am giving an additonal star is because our server tried his best to compensate for overall crapiness of this restaurant and the view is great.  i suppose if you like to taste your food for the entire night AFTER eating you may like it.

of the 5 people that i spend the evening with after leaving the burger bar all five of us burped disgusting, almost puke like burps for hours afterwards (and mind you we all had different dishes). this was a bit awkward seeing as though we had tickets to  a show at the Mezzanine and had to attempt several different tactics to avoid social humiliation and basic respect for those around us.

moving on.... you would assume that a place that specializes in burgers and fries would do a pretty good job at at least those two dishes right?  not so much.  it was actually not possible to get a hot fry. we decided to splurge and order a trio of fried goodness, it was delivered to the wrong table.  in the meantime, we FINISHED our mediocre burgers and cold fries that came with them, with no dipping condiments that we asked for.    when our apps came for dessert, only one of three was hot, the pickles.  i think that pickles might actually just hold heat a little bit better than fries and that is why they were hot.

i won't even bother to go into detail about the rest of the food/experience, as i am starting to feel the burps coming back just thinking about it.
author: Lindsey H.

description:
i usually do not like to give two stars, unless the food is crap, but I just called in to order a take-out for my office around the corner, and the lady on the phone told me that they quit doing take-out orders, wtf?  

This is San Francisco, and no take outs?.. she expects locals to order the food, either go back to the office, or wait 10-15 min for the order; both are a big inconvenience if you only like to take half-hour lunches.

update: so i tried the veggie burger, and its really yum, so i added another star
author: Fady A.

description: Whenever I go shopping with the Ms., I look forward to Macy's so that I can wait at the burger bar and catch a game.  I've tried all the different kinds of meats and their Kobe is by far the best...they're all good.  Add a little proscuitto and swiss and you are golden.  Did I mention that their onion rings are awesome!  I think I just did!!!
