author: LIVE to E.

description: Reason for rating is because I love their beer selection. I'm a fan of speakeasy beer and anchor steam's liberty ale so when I saw this on the menu I could care less about the food. Burgers were good, but I'm sure there are better ones out there. Sucks how some burgers you need to pay extra for fries and every side like cheese. Nice place to check out at least once. If you're lucky you can get a booth w/a t.v
author: Erica Z.

description: The decor and service were not impressive, and the ketchup bottle at our table was empty, not OK for a burger joint, but I have to say that I loved my burger. I had a buffalo burger topped with caramelized onions and cheddar on a ciabatta roll, and it was almost perfect.
author: Rose K.

description: TASTY and 5 stars for our awesome server.  One negative star for cold fries and one negative star for the lack of seasoning on the burger.  Get the red wine and shallot reduction or the chipotle aioli!!!! :)
author: Ivy S.

description:
Finally got to try the famous Rossini burger. The truffle sauce that came with the burger was amazing and went very nicely with the skinny fries.  The Nutella shake was delcious without being overly sweet. Such a decadent lunch.

We also got to try the sliders, which were ok. A bit boring but since they didn't have a children's menu, it seemed the only thing fitting for a child. She didn't really care for it. The biggest disappointment was the cobb salad. Yes, I know it is a burger restaurant but I wanted to add some greens to the meal. The dressing was too tart and the salad itself was dull. In the future, just forget about being healthy and stick with the burgers, shakes and fries.
author: Keromi K.

description: 3.5 stars really.  I had the Buffalo Burger, rare.  It is a good thing I actually like meat this raw, because it was several times more rare than most places send out.  So if you are not like me, take heed and order more done than you normally would.  The wait is a pain, the place is loud, the food is fairly good.  The wait staff were fairly on top of things.  Table next to us got comped some fries because their order was taking so long.  Points for comping them, but the delay indicates there is still a problem there.  Also eating there the week before Christmas is probably a big mistake, as the crowds are probably worse than usual.
author: geoff c.

description: I have never eaten a buffalo burger before and i have been DYING to try it. Thank goodness i came here randomly in a spur of the moment action with my friend cause surely enough, they had it! I ended up getting the sliders because i got to try a smaller portion of all the burgers and i'm so glad i got it! When it first came out i was like "wow, that's really small..." but as i was eating it, surprisingly it was the right amount of food because i ended up getting full pretty quickly. All the burgers were delicious! So rich in flavor and tender. One of these days when i have money, i am going to get the $60 burger ( it sounds so good.) Anyways, back to the buffalo burger, ITS A PLUS in my book. Totally lean, healthy, and delicious. yum!
author: Suzan L.

description: Not cheap, but delicious and has everything any burger fan could want. Also great shakes!
author: Andrew A.

description: An alternative to Cheesecake Factory if you want a place looking onto Union Sq. While I cant say it's the best burger I ever had, it's certainly not your fast food burger either. It can get pricey if you get the works i.e. cheese, toppings, sides etc. but keeping it simple the bill is manageable. My only disappointment was the milkshake. It was very very watery and not at all cold. That is a no no in my book.
author: Lisa C.

description: The FRENCH KISS MILKSHAKE is the most amazing concoction I've ever tasted. A chocolate lovers' must have!!
author: Aimee A.

description: We left Haryy potter depressed that this was the final movie in its series.  We needed to indulge our depression with some malt shakes fast.  We made a bee line to Union Square - the view always puts a smile on my face.  We came and this woman with such a sultry exotic voice - Hayley - seats us down.  I just wanted to hear her talk more, so I asked for randomness - Where's the bathroom, can we have a seat near the window...all the stuff a high maintenance "One of those" customers would ask...but she handled everything with such patience.   When we sat, we had the coolest waiter - Eric.  He had the best recommendations....there are so many burgers on this thing, its so hard to choose.  He vibed with our table and was great as service.  Food (as always) was great - although I didnt get to have too much since the wifey is preggers and doesnt share like she used too.... Cant wait for another gnutella milkshake again!
author: Shel D.

description:
Went here on kinda late on a Wednesday night, so it was not crowded at all.. kinda empty actually.  Had a beer at the bar.  Pretty good beer selection, friendly bar tender, TV's to watch... pretty nice. Hubert Keller came in like he owned the joint... said "Hi" to all the employees... seemed like a nice friendly guy.  Rest of my party arrived...since it was pretty empty, we got a good table by the window with the view over union square.  Pretty nice. Being inspired by his appearance, I got the Hubert Keller burger, medium rare.  The burger was very good.  It was cooked to my specification.  Very tasty, but not too juicy, which is good because it was buffalo meat which is leaner than regular beef I hear.  The toppings were pretty standard and kind of weak.  Bleu cheese, caramalized onions and baby spinach.  While I like all three, nothing about it was special and I probably would have enjoyed the burger just as much without them.  It also came with a side of fries (you get your choice of regular fries, sweet potato fries, or onion rings).  I tried all three, and both style of fries were pretty standard.  The onion rings were good, but not awesome.  Overall food was good, but nothing to write home about.

As far as atmosphere goes,  this place kind of feels like a touristy-chain restaurant, which makes sense as it's in the middle of Union Square in the same building as the Cheesecake Factory.  It's also priced that way, meaning it's a bit expensive for burger and fries, but what do you expect.  There's nothing SF-unique about it and it's almost got an upscale-city-version of Chilis feel.  But that's ok because the place is very clean, service is excellent, and everything is done the right way.  I'd come back here anytime and next time I'd like to try building a burger that's more unique.
author: Easter E.

description:
i wanted to really love burger bar...i mean, who doesn't love hubert keller??  he's someone you just want to run up to and hug all the time!

my friend and i were lucky enough to not have to wait on a sunday afternoon a few weeks ago.  my first impression...wow, it's pretty cramped in here.  it was difficult for the service staff and hostesses to manuever around to seat and serve patrons.  it's pretty bad when customers have to move and shift around in order for the staff to make their way with food and people.  anyway, the restaurant has a nice view, but if you've been to the cheesecake factory, you've seen it.  

i had their turkey burger...turkey because i rarely eat actual hamburgers...i can't remember the last time i had a real hamburger.  i liked that i was able to add my own toppings, which i did...my typical cheese (i think i got swiss) along with mushrooms.  i also got a side order of sweet potatoe fries, and stopped there...was very tempted in getting a milkshake, but i remembered how many calories i would be consuming in the very near future at this one sitting.

the turkey burger itself...eh...i wish people would learn that you HAVE to add spices to ground turkey.  there's not as much fat to flavor it alone, so please, please...add some spices!!  the sweet potatoe fries were okay...nothing too special...if i closed my eyes, i would think i was at taylor's or the gap cafe.

the desserts looked good, but i didn't try, so maybe i'll leave that for my next visit...which may be awhile, given we're coming up to the holiday season and union square becomes my worst nightmare.
author: Kelly T.

description: I was pleasantly suprised by Macy's "hidden treasure."  Burger Bar has a great view of Union Square, similar to the Cheesecake's view, but with smaller seating areas.  We decided to get a Kobe burger, Buffalo burger, and ceaser salad.  The salad was very good with not a oily dressing.  Our burgers were outstanding- both were very fresh and yummy.  However, we were a little perturbed that you have to order cheese or fries if you desperately want them.  As other Yelpers have mentioned, the wait for food/table was a little long, but the melt- in-your-mouth burger are definitely worth it.  Along with a $60 burger, Burger Bar can be a little overly pricy, but you will have a satisfying meal.
author: Shannon W.

description: Wait was long, atmosphere is very Vegas, burgers are really good...but pricey.  I'd recommend it only if you really want a good burger in the heart of Union Square.  Otherwise, you can find burgers this good for less.  Mine was very good...the kobe burger.  :-)
author: Elena F.

description:
Not sure where all of these low reviews are coming from, but I really enjoyed Burger Bar.
1.  My burger was cooked perfectly (medium well, natural beef)
2.  My fries were crispy and wel seasoned (I got the skinny)
3.  I really enjoyed my reviver champagne cocktail!

It was a winner in my book.  The service was enthusiastic, and Hubert Keller was an stabilizing presence in the restaurant, it seemed like the team really stepped up their game.  The only negative:  my side salad was over-dressed.  We were really stoked to get some personal attention from the chef and were really excited about our nutella shake samples.  These were delicious!

This is a great late night choice in Union Square, not sure why there are so many haters.  I think they have worked out a good deal of the kinks.
author: Jame E.

description: The first time my boyfriend and I went here it was good, food was average, we were seated quickly, service was good too. The second time was on a busier Saturday night. We put our name in with the hostess and she told us it would be about a half hour. Thinking we had some time, we walked through the 6th floor of Macy's and returned less than 10 minutes later. We waited another half hour, a total of 40 minutes. I asked the hostess what happened to our name on the list, and she said it had already been called. They either got our name wrong, called us within the first 10 minutes, or never called us at all. I heard the same thing happen to two other parties while we were waiting. The hostess then told me it would just be a few minutes, so we waited another 5 minutes. Instead of calling us first, they called two other couples and in result, my boyfriend and I just left. Completely irritating, complete waist of time. Wont be coming back. I'll give them 1 star for their great view of Union Square.
author: Carolyn H.

description:
Seriously, I don't think Hubert Keller has been around this place because if he were, he'd realize the service is horrendous.

We've tried it twice. Both times the service has been terrible. 

Our first time, he had a private room reserved and they had one person serving our group of 30. After 2 hours and no signs of the Milkshake sampler that we'd ordered, we left without receiving them. The catering manager did a great job selling us, but the staff could not deliver.

We visited again last Thursday night with a smaller group after dinner hours and still felt neglected. 20 minutes to get water and drinks ordered. Should it really take 90 minutes to get through a meal? 

Next time, I'll go to Perry's.

Eric
author: eric f.

description:
Simply put --- not worth the time or money. 

I was suuuper excited to try Burger Bar because a) I love burgers and b) I love Hubert Keller (from Top Chef). And I guess I've heard good things about Burger Bar... the one in Vegas. 

I ordered the Kobe Beef burger and added cheddar and avocado. I also got the fat fries. Overall, the burger patty itself was delicious --- moist, juicy, and flavorful. The cheese and avocado didn't really add to the burger even though they are my favorite toppings. The letdown was the fries. They weren't hot (as in temperature) nor were they anything more than grocery store freezer spuds. 

My fellow diners had the buffalo burger (also really juicy and didn't taste that much different than beef), skinny fries (again nothing special), fried pickles (a lot of batter and not great), sweet potato fries (just ok), and the veggie burger (supposedly really good). I think that someone also mentioned the sauces as being really good, so I might have to try that next time (if ever). 

So, all in all, a decent burger, but the sides are lacking and it's grossly overpriced.
author: Cecilia W.

description:
The Burger's are delicious although quite expensive.  You can go with a chef's creation or create your own.  You're looking @ $15-$20 a burger unless you get the $65 burger that has some crazy expensive stuff on it.

Besides that, the wait was about 45 mins, the view and service is good, and they have an array of beer selections.
author: Eric L.

description: I went here for lunch take out last week and had the Kobe Beef burger with Bacon and Cheddar and the Buffalo Burger with blue cheese and bacon, the Zucchini fries, onion rings, fried pickles and a strawberry shake. Yes it was a lot but I had LOTS of help finishing. The burgers were tasty but they didn't blow me away, nothing special and for $25 a pop you would expect something amazing but it was just eh. By the time I got back to my office the zucchini fries and onion rings were soggy, I'm sure if I would have had them at the restaurant they would have been fab. The milkshake was awesome. The service was amazing everyone was happy and very accommodating. I will definitely be back to try the burgers again but next time I will dine in instead of walking back to my office.
author: Michele G.

description: Not bad. I've eaten so many hamburgers that they are all starting to taste the same to me...lol. Swiped one of my friends zucchini fries. THOSE were tasty.
author: Stephanie R.

description: So I first ate at the burger bar in Las Vegas.  It was pretty good. I got the truffle burger w/ foie gras just had to try it and it was just ok. It's really all about how many expensive ingredients you can put on a burger. The second time we ate I just made my own burger and I think this is truly the magic about this place like other places like the counter you get your burger the way you want it. But Hubert has offered unlike other places an upscale ingredient list. And the beers on tap were great!! It is hard to find good beer in Vegas!! The third time we ate at burger bar was in Frisco as guests of Hubert. We had to wait 45 min tobe seated but I didn't mind we had just popped in during a crowd rush and once seated we quickly found out that Hubert was trying to get us in a booth by the kitchen so he could serve us. First he sent us out an appetizer plate with pretty much every appitizer on the menu on it. All good as usual. Then we ordered our burgers which have always been good.  But to top it off as we were all so full we couldn't eat another bite. Hubert popped in with a flight of milk shakes he had just made for us.  Somehow we found a way to eat them all I think his finess had something to do with it.  He was so excited to have us try them and I have to say they were really really good.  Strang enough this is the first time I've had a head chef drop off a bill and pick it back up. By all means how much do you tip a chef? If standerd good service is 18-20% what does a Michiline chef that has gone out of his way get?  Burger bar has always been consistently good but it was absolutly amazing when Keller is at the helm.
author: Clayton W.

description: About 16 of us went here during the race expo for the Nike Women's Marathon because there was a coupon for a free beer or well drink in the bag. We arrived and realized there was a 10 minute wait but a lot of tables were open- apparently they only had 2 servers which doesn't make sense when you advertise to 24,000 people for that same day. We waited about 20 minutes and had to split the group up to make it easier. We all picked out what we were ordering while we were waiting so when the waitress came we could order drinks and food and all ordered something that worked for the coupon and had them all on the table. We waited 20 minutes for just water! Finally our drinks came, then food - it was really good but pricey. When the bill came the girl said it's 1 coupon per table. We were all upset because she knew we were all ordering our free drink (sounds so petty but...) then we talk to our friends at the other table and they mentioned the waitress honored all of their coupons. The EXTREMELY RUDE manager came up to our table and said "you wanted to talk to me?" we said no, but we don't understand, and he cut me off and fought that he didn't comp anyone's drinks, blah blah blah. We basically sat there and had to cut him off and say "at this point we waited an additional half hour for our check, just give it to us please". He was a complete jerk about the whole situation. We do that race every year and eat at Cheesecake Factory upstairs and apparently that's where we'll be going next year.
author: Alison M.

description: Not for me.  It has undoubted appeal for many but even the great location and friendly service didn't take away from dry and tasteless burgers and fries that had been fried too long ago.  The salads our group of 10 ordered to share were fresh and tasty.  But it was burgers we were there for, and burgers that disappointed.
author: Ash A.

description: OVERRATED! holy crap I went there to grab a burger and few drinks with a friend and I walked away thinking I needed to open a macys credit card to pay for that meal loool. I think the owners of this place needs to meet with the owners of In-n-out to try to figure out how to make their burgers more affordable haha. You wont find me at this spot until there prices comes down.
author: nick h.

description: It's like being inside a Las Vegas pinball machine while eating your $9.95 burger without fries.  Techno thumping muzak blasting loudly overhead added to the daytime dining nightmare.  The service was LESS than mediocre.  Although the angus burger was delicious, it's not worth the elevator ride.
author: Lynda C.

description: I was surprised how crowded Burger Bar was for a Wednesday night. With such a crowd, I had really high expectations. I tried to forgive the wait, but after 45 minutes without our burgers, I was feeling frustrated and hungry. When the burger finally arrived, I had asked for medium well and the patty wasn't juicy at all. It was well done or arguably overcooked. Despite being overdone,  the burger was tasty, but the slow service really took away from the experience. I enjoyed visiting once, but I would prefer other comparable burger joints in the city...for a more affordable price as well.
author: Allison v.

description:
I almost didn't want to write this because I really really wanted to like Burger Bar more than I do.  

The Pros: Good ambiance, I like the tall booths with your own TV, but also the window tables are nice and offer great views of Union Square.  I got to meet Hubert Keller, which was awesome!

The Cons: The service is slow, you'll still wait for a table even when you can see several tables clearly free.  The fries are not good.  

I've had the Kobe burger, which to be totally honest in a burger is not really worth it.  It was also well done.  I had originally asked for medium rare (but then the waitress had warned that it would be one the rare side) so I asked them to make it medium instead.  What I got was a well done burger that was not very good.  The second time I went there a week later I learned my lesson and I got the Country beef and stuck to my guns with the medium rare, I was much happier.  Being an optimist I have to see the silver lining to all of this: Burger Bar in a way has taught me to trust my instincts.  The Country style burger I had was really good, I also added Cheddar and Guacamole.  Both good choices.  Although I dunno if $3.00 for an ounce of Guac was really worth it, but it was good nonetheless.  I had to skinny fries each time I went as well, nothing to write home about, and unless they come with your burger they aren't worth the $2-$3.00 price tag.  The shakes I haven't tried.  

I will probably go back one more time, Just to try a burger with Foie Gras on it, just cause Foie makes everything a lot better. However I don't think this place will be a destination I'll be going to often.  Burger Meister and Barneys are much better and about the same price.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
My friends....Truth be told ..This place is overrated!!!!! 
I hate to say it but It is. I wanted something good and was willing to pay good money for it. I though it should be worth it But I was wrong .... 

I came here to try the infamous Kobe Burger... 
I got it with fries and a soda. 
When it came I was so excited to sink my teeth in it but It was just another beef patty nothing special I thought it would be nice and juicy with flavors dripping off the bun.The burger was real dry and unseasoned ,it was warm not hot off the grill... maybe the burger bar in las vegas is better but if your in a mood for a fat juicy burger and don't mind the high price trust me ...try Joe's cable car that's some good meat in them buns and I left happy.
author: ren M.

description: Sliders sampler was just ok...couldn't tell the difference between the 3.  children's mac and cheese portion not worth the $7.50 and it tasted like it came from a kraft box.
author: Betty H.

description: Overpriced for burgers that are mediocre at best. The 2 stars are only for the kick ass milkshakes.
author: Abby P.

description: The food is fine but the service from the moment we got there was so bad and I had to give the place a bad review. From the 45 minute wait to the idiot working the bar that was more interested in talking than providing service made it a really bad experience. I would not go back. Also they wanted to charge $17.50 for a glass of house wine to the lady next to me which was just plain insane.
author: Mariah O.

description: After considering my original review, I think that 3 stars was too generous and that a more fitting rating is 2 stars.  I have not been back to retry Burgar Bar as it seems that the service has not improved based on what others have been saying.  Too bad.
author: Kai T.

description: I am giving Burger Bar two stars for the location and the decor. The reason I even ended up at Burger Bar was because the Cheesecake Factory had an hour wait and we had theater reservations. If you like paying over $ 80.00 out the door for hamburgers and two drinks, you might like this place, but I doubt it. The waitstaff is still getting their bearings; our waiter didn't know how the individual televisions in the booths worked,  and did not know what gins or scotches the bar carried. I ordered a martini straight up and it came with a watered down taste the result of ice cubes that weren't cold enough. The drinks were $ 11.00 each which is probably par for SF, but the drinks should be well made. A martini well made is one of the best drinks around; poorly made one of the worst. One person ordered a specialty burger medium well and it came medium rare. I ordered the sliders which were all supposed to cooked medium. They came well done. My wife ordered the salmon burger which she liked. Fries came with the sliders and they were good and plentiful. I would not come here again since their menu is pretty limited to burgers and variations thereof. Their burgers don't compare to Zuni's and they aren't even as good as the fast food versions at In-N-Out or Five Guys. I had high expectations for this restaurant since Keller's name is associated with it. I was sorely disappointed. Maybe I should have waited the one hour at Cheesecake Factory.
author: Bob Z.

description: Overlooking union square, it has a magnificent view outside but, a dreadful atmosphere.  No style - feels like a worn out sports bar.  The wait takes longer than they say, and I'm wondering why I'm torturing myself when I can be at any number of places enjoying a glass of Pinot and Prather Ranch Burger.  The manager did come by and seated us right away near the window when he suspected I was yelping.
author: Alison B V.

description:
I have been to the Burger Bar in Las Vegas and had a so-so experience, but I decided to try Burger SF while in the area. This was an overall better experience than the Vegas Burger Bar but only because of the items I ordered.

I got the peppercorn burger for around $17, which I found to be better than the more expensive Hubert Keller burger I had in Vegas. The fries, which were a huge complaint before, were better although still a bit generic. I noticed that, despite ordering medium, blood was pooling up in the plate. Even worse in my friend's plate who also ordered medium...clearly these patties could have been rested longer. Still, the burger was solid, and the peppercorn sauce, while subtle, was a nice addition. 

I decided to try the chocolate burger dessert. It really does resemble a burger, but it is made from a donut with a chocolate patty and sliced fruit as garnish. The chocolate was a bit too thick for my liking, but I appreciated the playful take on a sweet burger. 

While I liked the food well enough (and the service was acceptable too), I don't think I'd return any time soon. The total price just isn't worth the quality of product. If prices were lower or the quality was significantly higher, it would be a different story. For now, it seems like a more upscale Red Robin.
author: Andrew C.

description: so over priced for what it is. I don't mind spending money on food but not for something so blah. Was asked to wait for 30 minutes and ended up waiting for an hour which was fine but the waiting service was horrible. Had to wait another 20mins just to be asked for water. i got the kobe style burger and it was so bland. Not impressed.
author: danny h.

description:
I love the Burger Bar and cant wait to go back! Great selection of burgers, great selection of drinks plus a nice view of Union Square. My only beef - no pun intended - is the location ... sitting on the top floor of Macys (with the slowest elevators EVER), this isnt the easiest spot.... The location is just awkward - really only feasible if you're already out and shopping.
I would like Burger Bar to open up  a location somewhere else in the city- away from shopping central...
author: M S.

description: While I've heard that Burger Bar in Las Vegas is incredible, Hubert Keller's San Francisco homage to the humble burger is far from it.  I was there with a rather large group for a work event and kept lowering the bar until I could step over it which is saying a lot for a restaurant that one co-worker declared was more like a TGI Fridays than anything else.  When we first arrived, we sat at the bar and when the bartender finally came over he asked us to wait.  Was it crowded?  Was he knee deep in fixing fancy cocktails?  No and no.  We were two of four people seated at the bar (the other two were with us but had arrived earlier and were enjoying drinks already) and we were told to wait so that he could finish filling the ketchup bottles he was so focused on (wouldn't want to interrupt that).  I ordered a "Palms" cocktail - a Kettle One martini with blue cheese stuffed olives that I found undrinkable.  I will give it to the restaurant as I'm not a martini drinker and because my friend tried it and said it was pretty good as far as martini's go but I still felt a little taken advantage of at $13 a pop for a drink I wasn't crazy about.  We got seated at our table and I ordered the Sangiovese (an Italian red wine) but was brought out a glass of white wine - twice.  When the waitress first brought the glass out, I mentioned that I ordered the Sangiovese and she said ok and returned to the bar for what I thought was the right glass of wine.  The same girl returned minutes later holding the same glass of white wine and I mentioned yet again that I had ordered the Sangiovese, a red (I even showed her the wine list to ensure she got it right). The third time was a charm and she finally showed up with the wine I now so desperately needed.  The table ordered appetizers and my main thought was this: why hummus and pita at a burger place?  The hummus was terrible (pasty and musty) and was served with fried chickpeas that I'm sure were delicious when they first came out of the fryer but that was probably yesterday as what I put in my mouth was mushy and cold and entirely  lacking in flavor.  The other appetizers were comprised of the fried snacks tower (ooh), chicken wings, sliders with French fries and shrimp cocktail.  If I could have eaten one thing all night, it would have been the deep fried jalapeño pickles as they're truly extraordinary but everything else just paled in comparison.  I ordered the American style burger which was a Black Angus burger with American cheese and bacon.  It was good but certainly not worth returning for as I've had better (for cheaper) at In N' Out.  The service was barely keeping up even though we didn't order that much and towards the end of the night when the waitress dropped a knife on my arm as she was clearing my plate I almost wasn't surprised.  All in all, it feels like Burger Bar is looking to please the first time visitor and isn't interested in return guests.  I was expecting more given the chef connected to this restaurant is world renowned but after the way the night started and ended I'd say low expectations are the only way to go.
author: Erin H.

description:
I love Hubert Keller and it was hard to remember it was his restaurant, as it feels like 'Cheesecake Factory Junior" in the Macys.  but I saw him there and that made my experience a bit more exciting.  After waiting for 40 minutes, we got 2 burgers and drinks for $50.  The burger was good, that's all I can say.  I got the Country Natural with bacon and cheddar with a side of zucchini fries....yummy toasted sesame bun.  The atmosphere was ruined by loud 90s music that I imagined dear Hubert picking out himself -- think "My Prerogative", "Let's Talk about Sex" and Smashmouth.  It was also bizarre that a whole room was empty -- they claimed it was a private room where people could wait -- why not seat 50 people in there, for the Saturday 2 weeks before Xmas, so there's no wait at all? 
Sorry Hubert, I love you but I won't be back.
author: Kristi S.

description: This place was pretty good! I had the minis because I wasn't too hungry and they were quite tasty. I wonder where they get their meat. My friend had a classic burger and ordered it med rare but it was really rare. The shakes look amazing, although I didn't order any. Will come again another time. Good but not the best
author: Josephine S.

description: I've been here twice, once just for a milk shake and once for dinner. The milk shake was fantastic, especially given that they have some spiked versions to shake things up. I shared the caramel latte which I thought was scrumptious but I definitely wouldn't have been able to finish the whole thing by myself due to the richness. When I went for dinner I had the buffalo burger. If you haven't tried buffalo yet, I'd highly recommend it because it has a great flavor and is leaner than beef. The burger was okay. They give you the standard fix-ins (lettuce, tomatoes, and onions) but everything else costs extra (and they have quite the variety to pick from). I also had the sweet potato fries and I did enjoy those but the ranch dressing cost extra and I don't know how I feel about that.
author: Priyam D.

description: Average, very average and, thus, overpriced.  I was travelling on business, so was by myself.  Friendly service, nice atmosphere, good view of Union Square.  The burger itself (chose Angus) was good.  Properly cooked and with good, meaty taste.  The toppings were deficient.  One small slice of tomato from the end (I had to request another slice), one piece of wilted lettuce, and a couple of onion rings.  Nobody charging $14 for a medium sized hamburger should allow a burger with those toppings out the kitchen door.  The skinny fries were also average.  Too many places in SF to eat well; I would not return.  When a place specializes in only one type of food and charges a lot for it, it should be outstanding.  This place is not.
author: Carlos S.

description:
I was expecting better since this is a Hubert Keller establishment.  That said, I think La Folie is pretty awful, but was expecting something good from this establishment (although not sure why).  

The burgers were completely underwhelming.  I had the American Classic, and the bottom bun was completely soggy, which leads me to believe it was sitting too long before service.   But leaving that aside, the burger was really nothing special.  The fries are good but I didn't leave feeling I'd had one of the best burgers of my life.  

But, the alcoholic milkshakes are amazing.  They are topped with mousse and taste like pure decadence.  I would recommend the place for the onion rings and the milkshakes but not the burgers.
author: A J.

description: Below average, overrated, crowded, poor service, and too touristy. Save your time and money and go to Umami Burger or Roam on Union Street.
author: Brian J.

description:
I first have to say...I read all the reviews and all the comments about how it wasnt that good, and Vegas was better, and this was a disappointment, but thought...it was so awesome in Vegas, how could it be wrong?  Well...IT WAS!!!  First we asked for a booth and were told since we were only a party of two, we werent allowed to sit in a booth.  Ok, whatever.  Then we were sat in the hallway.  Four little tables, against the walls in a hallway...whatever, my hopes were still up for a great burger.  They werent kidding about the service.  The girl we had was awful.  It took her forever to come to us and ask for our order.  After that she was walking around and never bothered to get our drinks.  Finally those come and then it was a 30 minute wait for our food.  We both ordered our american kobe burgers medium.  His was medium...oddly only on the right side of his burger, the other half was well done.  Have you ever seen that???  A burger that is pink on the sides and well done in the middle and the other side?  Odd.  Mine has no sign of pink.  It was dry, well done and just awful.  I then waited for our waitress to come back and she didnt appear for another 15 mins.  I told her "Im sorry, this is well done and dry" and she asks me "well what did you order?"  with an attitude, as if she wasnt there when I ordered my burger??!!!??  No apology no nothing, she takes the plate and goes into the back, not asking if I want another one or anything.  My husband is done eating now, and finally she reappears and I tell her I do not want the food, my husband is done eating.  With an attitude she goes fine, goes into the back to tell them not to recook me a burger.  She comes with the bill and goes "so you just want the check" and then walks away.  When I open it, she did not take my burger off the check.  $24 for 2 bites...I dont think so.  I asked for the manager, and he was very nice, he took the check, reappeared another 10 mins later and removed the burger from our check.  But then it took the bitter waitress another 20 mins to take our check.  I wish I could tell you I was being dramatic or making this up. But I wasnt, and for her attitude and her crappy service her tip was nada...which we NEVER do.  We usually are great tippers, and if someone was a douche then usually we tip a little.  But that is how awful it was...nothing...zip...nada.  

My husband burger, even though he said it was cooked right just was not the same quality, flavor, or even size as the Las Vegas Burger Bar.  I will NEVER go back to this one.  NEVER! Next time I am in Vegas though...this will be the first place I go to in Vegas...best burger ever...IN VEGAS!
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Nice addition to Union Square! Shared a burger with a friend and it was tasty although not sure I would spend so much on a burger very often.  The shakes on the other hand was amazing and I would come in just for a shake! "4 Stars for the Shake"
As for service, especially since I also work in the service industry, there is some improvement to be made.  Our waitress failed to look at us the entire time we were in the restaurant. Everytime she came to check on us, she would talk to us and look elsewhere.  I make it a point to look at someone when I am speaking to them and it was quite odd talking to her while she looked at another table.
author: Daphne P.

description:
I cannot remember the last time I have had such a miserable experience. 

I love the Burger Bar in Las Vegas. We go every time we are in Vegas and was so stoked to see there was now one in Union Square. 

There were 5 of us around 2pm during the week. We were told it would be a 45 minutes wait. There were 3 18 year olds running the front and that was clearly part of the issue. Instead of trying to seat by what makes sense, they were seating people in order on the list. This meant they were seating 2 people at the tables of 5 and 6. So the larger parties were having to wait for much longer than the times they were being quoted. 

We finally said to split us into 2 groups-and that still took them 20 mins to get us seated. Actually, we found 3 seats at the bar and then told the hostess to get us a table of 2. 

At this point we are starving so the 3 of us at the bar order onion rings and ranch-which comes out without the ranch, in fact the ranch never came. 

The iced tea was over brewed and disgusting. 

The bartender told me to try some type of garlic dip with my sweet potato fries, so I did. It was awful and he charged me 75 cents. 

The sliders and fries were okay. And yes, everything is over priced. 

Oh and I forgot to mention, I was looking at the bill, they charged us for a milkshake, which never came, apparently my friends ordered one and they forgot to bring it out. It came out after we were done with everything. 

I won't ever go back to this location. Someone in management needs to make some changes ASAP.
author: Laura M.

description: Not that good, and way too expensive for what you get. Milkshakes are good though. view is great. staff is friendly.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Three stars for the food. Three and a half stars for the service. ONE star for the prices. Do a burger and fries really cost $20? Does a Diet Pepsi really cost you $3.95 to squeeze out of the gun?

I will never return here. There are plenty of great burger spots on San Francisco, and I don't have to pay $20 for them.
author: Justin J.

description: Amazing view! The sliders were wonderful! Great service. Prices are fair for a nice resturant. Regular burgers are fairly priced $9 - $14. Kobe beef about $17. Worth going to in you are in Union Square.
author: Brett A.

description:
Today is my birthday. I really wanted nothing more than to go to San Fran and finally visit Burger Bar. I have heard wonderful things about the Las Vegas location and mixed reviews of the one on San Fran. Sadly my experience was none too good. 

I went there with my wife and mother to celebrate my birthday. I ordered the Rossini ($60) burger and my wife and mother built their own burgers. Both my wife and mothers burgers did not come with jalapenos that they ordered or cheese. And my wife's burger was overcooked. 

Now on to mine. 

I'm gonna start off by saying that I have no problem with paying $60 for a burger, if in fact that burger is good. I ordered my burger Med-Rare and it came out Well done. I informed the waitress of this and that the other 2 burgers were incorrect. She came back out with the jalapenos and cheese that was missing but nothing about my burger.

When it was time for the bill to come nothing was taken off. 

This is when I finally said something. I told I was going to pay the full bill, but there should have been a gesture on their part for all the mistakes. After all The bill was $155 for 3 people. She then went to a manager and took $30 off and no manager came by. And never at any time did anyone apologize for all the mistakes. 

I will try the one in Vegas at some point. But I think Chef Keller should check up on this location more. 3 Yelp stars for a Chef of his stature, he should be embarrassed. 

Next time I'd rather eat a $6 happy hour burger at Flemings steakhouse than $60 or anything he has to offer.
author: Christopher B.

description:
I'm one of the legion of devotee's of Chef Keller and applaud his business acumen in going for what most people think is a simple and easy food challenge, the burger.  He's proof that a great Burger is or should be a passion, a commitment and a work of gastronomic art.  So today I parked in the garage at Union Square and crossed the street to Macy's where an elevator whisked me up to Burger Bar after a receptionist gave me a brief description of what to expect.  

Burger Bar is on the 6th floor of Macy's Union Square under the much larger Cheesecake Factory and I hope becomes as busy.  So I get off the elevator on 6 and am in a foyer dividing my destination from the retail behemoth is rents from.  It's modern, sleek, casually upscale and almost totally bereft of any visible attachment to anything other than the architectural design.  A clean and slick rectangle you enter from the foyer outside the elevator or by escalator through the lower floors of the host property.  A pleasant, black bedecked hostess welcomed me and offered a table or seat at the bar for me, a single diner, and I chose the bar which is long and densely populated by 24 draft beers, a top shelf bar with almost everything but Tuaca which surprised me with such a tribute to so many liquors.   At the West end of the bar is a chilled wine cellar with windows displaying bits of a huge and smart wine list.

The bar has 12 comfortable stools and the adjoining lounge features 7 bar high four top tables looking out over Union Square or at the four large flat screen monitors tuned to four different sporting events.  Beyond the bar area is the dining room which has a 'soda fountain' and further along a glassed in butcher shop where they cut, trim and grind the various meats they use.  It's all impeccably clean and orderly but also pretty damned sterile.    Nice tile flooring, white walls and ceiling with patches of mahogany paneling and five huge, modern octagonal hanging chandeliers are pretty much the eye candy until you get to the gorgeous menu and then the really good purpose of this joint, BURGERS.  

The menu is well organized as well as pretty, and its truly about the sandwich with some form of cooked meat between the bread.  In this case we're talking the BEST meat in several varieties, Buffalo, Salmon, house made garden burger and a ton of ways to customize whatever you choose.  A lobster tail on your burger?  There amazing, tempting choices in many categories and execution is what M. Keller is renowned for.  For my first of many visits I chose the slide plate because it offered three different meat choices and it came with fries which I'd heard are among the best anywhere.  This menu choice doesn't allow choices on doneness of the meat and the menu states each will come out medium.  The platter was delivered and had the three good sized sliders on one side of the rectangular plate and a lot of sizzling hot fries on the other.  The only things I noted that weren't as described were the rareness of the meat patties and the lack of quality condiments provided.  All they offer without ordering as a side are Heinz Catchup and Grey Poupon Mustard.  I wish I'd been told that there are choices I might like to add to my burgers, but I know now and will adjust and be prepared next visit.

I'm enchanted with the idea of treating this great sandwich with the honor it deserves and in his book, Burger Bar, chef Keller discusses the challenges and opportunities in making great burgers.  The buns here were perfect, the produce excellent, the meat great and the portion and price a terrific deal.  I will be back and will be updating my review as time passes but Burger Bar is a must visit place for anyone with a passion for GREAT burgers.

There
author: Stu S.

description: i given this place 2 chances and i doubt i give it a 3rd..reasons are as follow= too dam pricey for what you get, the scene is blah...and once again too dam pricey for a burger..if you want good!!!!! burger... hands down...god father burger in san carlos...
author: Ivan C.

description: I have heard so many great things and was pretty dissapointed with my burger.  I got the Kobe burger and ordered it medium rare and it was pretty well done.  It just wasn't anything special like i had hoped.  The zuccini sticks are delicious but for a burger bar I was expecting more.
author: Julia B.

description:
After watching Mr. Keller many times on TV I was very excited to try his new Burger Bar at Macy's Union Square.   Unfortunately I was VERY disappointed with the outcome.  
My girlfriend and I both ordered the $16.50 Kobe burger.  Hers well down and mine medium.   We also ordered the Sweet Potato and skinny fries.    When the burgers showed up they were tiny and imagine a large oval white plate with the 4 inch wide burger on it.  Also all the burgers come with lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle.   So you have this large white oval plate the 4 inch burger and a scrape of wilted lettuce, onion and Tomato.  It looks like something Denny's would be serving at 3 AM.  I mean come on this should blow me away and it's a total joke.   The Fries come out on these little white plates like a kid's side at Applebee's.  Very low budget presentation for such a bit of hype about the owner.   Sorry Hubert but just giving your name to this place will drop your stock price at Fleur de Lys.   Here's a tip, go to the Boonfly Café near Napa and have their Kobe Burger then you'll know what your missing.
author: Scott S.

description:
I went here last Saturday for a friends Birthday party and was highly disappointed. The Burger Bar requires a minimum party of 13 for a reservation and since we only had 11 in ours we were unable to make reservations. 

We got there at 6:45 hoping to be seated by 7:30. Not the case. After being told it would be less than an hour wait, we were not seated until after 9pm. Our table was next to the bar, so we could watch the group at our table argue with the waitress for about 20 min about something. We just assumed it was something small, you know there are just some people that like to complain.

After being seated we ordered drinks and quickly thereafter we ordered our dinner and milkshakes. The alcoholic milkshakes are out of this world. I ordered the American Kobe Beef Burger.(I know, I know that does not make sense, kind of like saying a Californian Texas Burger) It took about 45 min for my burger to come. But only my burger and the person next to me's burger came. The waitress said it would be about 5 more minutes for the other dishes to come out. (Which took more than 15 min.) So this put us in a bad situation, do we be rude and eat our burgers in-front of the rest of our party that has been wait now 3 hours to eat, or do we wait and let our $18 burgers to get cold. Even McDonald's has heat lamps. 

Well the rest of the dishes finally came, sort of. They got 3 orders wrong, so the servers came and went four times to sort it out. Finally everyone was eating, but one of the girls looked enraged. Turns out she had ordered a med-well done burger and she got a rare burger, it made my med-rare burger look well done. But she didn't send it back because she was starving.

Well despite our bad experience so far we decided to stay for desert. I went to the rest room while we waited for the chocolate burgers and milkshakes. Well you don't expect to see vomit in the bathroom sink of a nice restaurant like this do you? I didn't, but that's what I saw there.

I got back just in time to see that the kitchen made the wrong desert for the same girl who got the rare burger. You can probably already figure out that she wasn't pleased.

Few other notes. Our waitress was not at the table when our food was served. Our water glasses were filled once and that was only after we asked. Nor were we asked if we would like refills on our sodas, or if we wanted another beer when it was gone. Our waitress only asked one person how the food was and that was when she handed us the bill.

Oh and I forgot to mention how my American Kobe beef burger tasted. Let's put it this way, if you didn't tell me that's what it was I would have never known it wasn't just plain beef with salt and pepper on it. That's right, not extra tender, no special spices, just a slab of beef with lettuce and tomato.
author: Dave G.

description:
I am not sure how Hebert Keller can put his name on this place and be comfortable.  The salad was poor, the burger was OK, but OK here?
The service was astonishing.  We spilled a glass of water, asked for towels, and then dried the table, seat and floor ourselves.  We left the wet napkins on the table as well as the towels we used to dry the table, and there they remained throughout our meal.  We finally asked for dry napkins and that they remove the wet pile from the middle of the table.  This seems to be a tourist rap with very little regard for clients  quality.
author: Tessa W.

description: This place needs hamburger helper! The hamburgers were dry and tasteless. I ate two bites and wasn't really interested in continuing. I don't know how a bacon cheese burger can be dry?  It was a total waste of $60 for 2 beers and 2 burgers.  There is nothing that feels high end about this place except the location. Hubert Keller should be embarrassed by these nasty ass burgers.
author: Kristina B.

description:
Eh, I've had better burgers in a better environment but the view is pretty cool if you happen to get a table by the window overlooking Union Square.

The one thing I can say was the service was pretty terrible. Maybe it was because it was around the holidays and the place was packed, but we were sitting for at least 20 min before anyone even came by to say hello to us.

Huge beer list was a plus though and the milkshakes looked good, but I didnt have one.
author: Marc J.

description:
Unfortunately, I had yet another dissapointing dinner (see my recent review of Iluna Basque).  I was coming from seeing A Christmas Carol by ACT and decided to check out Burger Bar since I would be dining alone.  I've heard so much hype about this place that I figured I had to give it a shot.  Hubert Keller can do no wrong, right? 

Wrong.

I walked in a stopped at the hostess stand and was ignored by a gaggle of teeny-boppers posted at the stand.  They were literally talking about some kind of drama right in front of me.  Very unprofessional.  I asked if I could have a table for 1 person and the little girl told me that I could sit at the bar.  This place is HUGE and was rather empty around 9pm so it was a little off putting that I was shunned to the bar.  Dining alone isn't the end of the world, folks.  People do it all the time.  Besides, I wanted to take advantage of overlooking Union Sq.  I decided to pull up a seat at said bar (I LITERALLY had to wrestle a seat loose from a crowd of people).  The bartender was pleasantly attentive and took my drink order.  He then offered a menu and that was that.  I cracked up the menu and was expecting to see amazingness... not something that looked like it was ripped off from Applebees. 

I decided to go for the 'American Burger' and even though it had a hefty pricetag of $16.00, I figured it would be well worth it.

Wrong again.

My medium well burger was dripping and the bottom part of the bun was soaked pink from all the excess 'juice'.  The french fries were, well, french fries and I could tell the aioli was not homemade. 

I got my bill and really could not believe that I just spent $20 bucks on a burger.  I would have been more satisfied at In-N-Out for a fraction of the price.  Next time I shell out $20 for a burger, it better buy me flowers and open the car door for me.
author: Michelle P.

description: First this place is way overpriced for burgers half the size as other places. I ordered the World's Hottest Hamburger, had to sign a waiver before ordering it. It was definitely NOT hot. I would say Hellfire Wings at Smokeeaters is at least 5-10 times hotter than this. Overall, not impressed.
author: Ryan L.

description: I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant after shopping. It was nice, clean and friendly and although a bit steep in price a place I would definetly go back to!
author: M F.

description: Great place with a wonderful vibe.  Fun,  relaxed, great view.  Fun to build your own hamburger.   A bit pricey but worth it.
author: Jeff J.

description:
It has been a while since my wife and I did the eating that prompts this review. 

Doing the Christmas, Newyear vacation thing in San Francisco as we like to do. My wife practically lives in Macy's when we are here so a visit to the Burger Bar sounded like a good idea.

Well, besides the great view of Union Square and the ice rink there was not much to be excited about. The service was average at best, I may be being a bit harsh here but I would have thought that in the current employment climate a place that makes it self out to be a touch above the average would be able to find some quality service staff. 

The food, well it was ok, I must admit I did not go for any of the highend stuff, I stuck with the traditional. For the price I have had way better.

The drinks, this was even worse, they have a table menu of what the specials are, ok I will have one off the specials menu, no you won't we are not doing these at the moment.....what the?? If you are not doing them why the menu???

Overall, overpriced, under serviced....but the view from the 6th floor fantastic. I guess this makes it not a total loss.
author: Garry P.

description: Best burger I have ever had.  Period.  The beef came from Niman Ranch and it was cooked to perfection...with blue cheese on a ciabatta roll.  Onion rings were tasty, too.  I was not having a burger craving, but after one bite I completely tuned out the conversation and just focused on every bite.  Yummy shake, too.  Great views of Union Square---I'm sure it's even more fun at night.  Will definitely go back!!  FYI: no changing table in the bathroom.
author: Bananarama B.

description: I guess I came here too excited and ended up with a huge disappointment. First of all, the food was a very long wait - ordered a salmon burger, veg burger and fries. Only the salmon was acceptable to me. The veg was horrible!!! It felt like the worst burger I've had ever. No, it is in fact, the worst ever. I won't even begin to describe how it tastes like. It was almost unedible - no flavor whatsoever. The fries was soggy. If we weren't starving to death, I wouldn't have gobbled up the food. But I had no choice that time. IMO, this place is not worth coming to at all. There are so much better burger places out there. I'm sorry Hubert Keller. I didn't have a very good experience a few years back at Fleur de Lys, either.
author: Eloise L.

description:
11/16/2009 Edit »
Food poisoning. That sums it up.

Went there for dinner with my son and husband after some shopping. My husband and I made our own burgers and ordered them medium rare, like we normally do at any burger joint. We ordered the sliders for our son.

My husband and I both noticed our burgers were more rare than usual, but didn't think it was an issue. My husband scarfed his burger down. I only ate half of mine. My son took forever eating his sliders. I knew something was up when I looked over and he was still on his first mini burger. He loves food. Especially if cheese, tomatoes and meat is involved.

When he failed to barely touch the second mini burger, I told him to just eat his fries. 

A couple hours later, I was home puking my brains out for the next 12 hours. I couldn't even keep water down! My son woke up with a real bad tummy ache.

I never write reviews, but since I'm still stuck in bed 2 days post Burger Bar, I felt I needed people to know this place is just lucky it wasn't my son puking his brains out. Otherwise, they'd have a lawsuit on their hands.

Btw, the service sucked too. But I would've never written a review about just bad service. Too bad for Burger Bar ( and me) that it took food poisoning to yelp for the first time.
author: A M.

description:
Burger Bar get's 1 star because the floor manager was a nice guy and very cordial.  He understands the service timings and protocols that your drinks need to come out before your food so you actually have enough time to finish them.  I would go back there just because I liked the floor manager and one of the bussers was nice and it has a good view of Union Square.  The second star is for the beer selection.  Other than that, here is a list of gripes:

1.  Ashley our server was not attentive.  I ordered a beer and a $11 Pina Colada, a salad and a Kpbe Burger.  The beer came out right away and I had to remind her of the Pina Colada.  She said that the bar is really backed up and was not apologetic of the fact that we had the beer on the table for about 15 minutes and I was drinking by myself while my wife was empty handed.   

2.  Her Greek salad and my Kobe burger even came out before the $11 Pina Colada.  By the middle of my burger the $11 Pina Colada finally came out.  By the time we were done eating my wife only had a little of the Pina Colada.  I can't really expect her to chug a $11 Pina Colada and we needed to go.  When I brought his up to our server Ashley that I would like her to take off the Pina Colada from the bill because it came out after the food was half eaten, she said without being apologetic that there were 12 milkshakes being made in front of it, (even though they had time to cook our food and bring it out before then).   

3.  The Kobe Burger was the correct temp of Med Rare but Cheesecake's Kobe Burger is a little tastier and cheaper.  The Salad was fine.  The $3 skinny fries were room temp.  They also have an extensive beer selection.  Looked like about 20 draft beers and an entire book of bottled beers. 

4.  Just so you know what our tipping habits are, we normally give 20%.  In this case, the bill was $53 and even after I was offended by our server, I still left $11 on $53 which is still about 20%.  Drinks need to come out before the meal and if not then your server should be somewhat apologetic especially if you're dropping $11 on a Pina Colada.
author: nino l.

description: Great cheese burger w/ bacon and a milkshake w/ alcohol! Woo hoo!
author: Scott D.

description: Had the bison burger and it was fabulous..expensive, but good. I always love to read reviews about price, but hello....you are paying for the touristy view, it is what it is!! The food was good and the scene, was, well the Union Square scene. Chef Hubert was actually there and walked around shaking everyones hand and asking them about their experience. Maybe I was smitten by his sweet demeanor and that made me even more pleased, but I will be back when I want to "fine-dine" for a burger....this really is what this place is....but try it!!!!
author: Debbie L.

description: Visited Burger Bar on Saturday and not a good experience at all!  Don't think I will visit again.  The hostess did not know how to manage the tables.  It was about 4pm and she was saving most of the tables for the reserved for 6pm! Really we ate and finished well before then.  I then asked about waiting for a booth and she indicated that those that were seated there just arrived and it might be a while.  About 5 minutes after we sat down what do you know two of the three booths cleared.  Hum reason for lying in the first place?? I am not really sure.  Before we left I asked to speak to the manager who heard my complaint but she really didn't seem to be interested.  Customer service is obviously not high on their list.  The only good part about our visit was Daniel our server.  If it wasn't for his great service I would have just decided to take my family elsewhere.  I will not be back!  You should really take a look at your overall reviews and make some changes if you don't think customer service is important you have a surprise coming.
author: Tee R.

description:
WORST EVER!

i got a salmon burger nd it was dried out! i asked for well done, not dry out!! salmon is suppose to be juicy...achem burger bar people...my bf got a angus burger he said it was jus alrite..nothing special.  meaning we're never going back there again!
there was a table next to us, there were 3 people..and let me just say this..one of them only took one bite out of the burger and she didnt even ask for it to go,. But she did eat all the fries, like i did.
service was average, the interior design was not at all how i expected it to be..really normal nd boring, very similar to other burger places.

i only have one good thing to say about this place and it was the sweet potatoe fries! oo-wee! it was good.  
but i could get that elsewhere...NEVER EVER GO HERE, IT'S A HYPE!! all for tourist...damn shame.
author: Janet W.

description:
So a group of us decided to go to this place for dinner after watching the MJ movie.  Big waste of time and money.

EXPECT THE FOLLOWING:
- overpriced mediocre burgers
- be ignored by the hostess and servers
- not getting what you asked for, even after 3 times with 2 different servers

The only good think I can say is that the $60 burger is really really good.  Since it was $60, we decided to order this as an appetizer so that everyone in our group can get a taste.  If it wasn't for this $60 burger tasting so good, I wouldn't have even bother to give this place a star.

By the way, just to warn others, I made sure to select "NO" on the question that asked if this place had waiter service.
author: tina c.

description: I had a really good experience here, at their soft opening. It took a minute to get our drinks, but everything else was superb. I enjoyed the view, and the only thing I disliked was the fact that it's downtown. If youre downtown and craving a burger, hit up Burger Bar in Macys, it beats Loris or Mels hands down.
author: Rachel J.

description: We arrived at around 9:45 p.m. on a Friday evening and it was pretty slow.  Nonetheless, it took the server about 15 minutes to wrangle up a couple of beers.  The burgers are overpriced.  I ordered a Black Angus Burger ($10) medium rare and it arrived raw.  I showed it to the waitress and she started to claim that my burger really was medium rare.  However, about half way into this lame excuse, she seemed to realize it was stupid and took the burger back.  She brought out a real medium rare burger and it was not horrible, but not really great.  There are many good places to get a burger in San Francisco, but this is not one of them.  I won't be back.
author: Jim F.

description: My husband and I visited this place for the first time last night {11/23/13} and let me tell you it was AWFUL, first of all they sat us at a table that just shouldn't have been where it was, very very compacted in that place, we ordered and got our drinks that weren't cold at all {Iced Tea}; I specifically ordered the Kobe Beef burger with grilled onions and other condiments, when the burgers arrived they were room temperature warm as if they were sitting out for quite some time, and NO GRILLED ONIONS, the waiter never came back to see about us....We had to flag him down three times just to get our check, the table they sat us at was just horrible I kept getting bumped and knocked in the head by other patrons, that table should have not been there, the place was so crowded, it was unbelievable and one whole room that was for special parties just sat empty....O_o....Finally I was able to tell the wait person that we never got the grilled onions, then we had to wait while a Mgr. took that charge off our bill. A horrible horrible horrible dining experience WE WILL NEVER EVER GO BACK AGAIN....San Francisco has lost their zest on great customer service....!!1
author: Latricia S.

description:
Great burger with many selection. Delicious milkshake. We'd waited to be seated  only 15 minutes on saturday which it's not bad at all. Fast service, fast food. 
We will come back again.
author: Grace C.

description:
Great new place at macy's!
From the moment we walked, we were greeted by the hostess with a big smile and friendly servers. Food was great and wines were tasty also. Cool to see a place that has J Rose by the glass.

The quality of the burgers is awesome and it's fun to build your own with tasty side dishes. Milk shake sampler was terrific.

The assistant general manager, Laura treated us like VIP!!!!! She helped us choose a phenomenal Malbec from Argentina. Grafigna?

We highly recommend this place and an insane view of Union Square.

A and K
author: Wine L.

description:
I came here with a group of friends at around 1am after our Halloween festivities.  None of us were hungry enough to order whole burgers so we opted to share a bunch of things -a few orders of the sliders (each order consisting of 1 angus, 1 beef, 1 buffalo), sweet potato fries, regular fries, fried zucchini, and onion rings.  I also had a vanilla milkshake.  While none of us were blown away by anything we had, we all agreed that we'd want to come back to try other items on the menu.  

Let's be real - a burger is a burger and there are only so many ways you can make them.  The novelty here is the selection - there aren't too many places where you can get a Kobe beef burger or a surf and turf burger.  Temper your expectations and enjoy it for what it is - a fancy burger place.

More on the food:
Sliders: Maybe it's because it was 1am, but the buffalo slider I had was delicious!  Cooked just right and with a nice texture.  My friends also thought the other two sliders were really good.  At $12.75 not too expensive.

Fried stuff: The regular fries tasted like McDonald's fries and the sweet potato ones were ok - Taylor's Refresher has better.  The other fried stuff was ok but nothing spectacular.  

Shake: The milkshake was a bit of a disappointment - for $7.50 you'd expect it to be the best damn milkshake ever, but it's not any better than a Mel's shake (and half the size).  

Service: Not too many customers at 1am, so the service was great - our waiter answered all our questions and was attentive to our needs.  Chef Keller thanked us on our way out and graciously took a few photos with us.
author: Irene W.

description: The BurgeRACISM Bar is a terrible non-experience if you are an all Black party. As a party of 3 (me, husband and baby) we were put on their waiting list only to have 3 parties seated in front of us, which included parties of the same size. When I inquired at the hostess desk holding my baby, they (all White, young females) told me "oh that party has 2 adults and a baby" and I said "so do we". They then scramble to do nothing, so before leaving I asked to see the manager. Well, after I calmly explain the situation to Eduardo - he was unphased. So, sadly racism is alive and well in downtown San Francisco at the Burger Bar!
author: Suzanne C.

description: Well as a vegetarian, I should know better, I suppose, than to think I would get a good veggie burger at a restaurant that caters to carnivores.  I went here with a friend for the first time last night and was hoping I was going to like it.  I have to say the service was very good and the people were friendly but as far as the food goes, it was disappointing.  My friend had the Angus burger and thought it was okay but my veggie burger was the absolute worst one I ever had in my life.  It tasted like a potato pancake that wasn't cooked long enough.  It was beyond weird.  The onion rings we ordered were actually very good but that would not be enough for me to return.  I've actually had better food at a few local dives in town.  The view out to Union Square is really cool but you can get the same view from The Cheesecake Factory upstairs and the food there is much better.  Also, there is a heated outdoor patio at The Cheesecake Factory.  All I'm saying is this place didn't meet my expectations.  For a restaurant bearing the name of a celebrity chef, I would expect a lot better.
author: Rabbit B.

description:
I'm excited to FINALLY become a member of Yelp and write my first review!! :)  My parents were here visiting from South Dakota for the holidays and I thought it would be the perfect time to try out the new Burger Bar in Union Square.  (My dad is a huge fan of buffalo meat!)

We arrived 20 minutes before our reservation and were seated a few minutes before our actual reservation, which was surprising considering how busy it was in there.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable and was easily able to answer any and all questions that my parents threw at him (they're from the midwest :).  I was impressed with how fast our drinks arrived along with our appetizer.  We started out with onion rings and beer battered pickles...my favorite!
For my burger I decided to build my own, which seemed confusing at first but our server definitely had a hand in helping me build my perfect burger.  I chose the Country Natural Beef and added cheddar, bacon, portobello mushrooms, grilled onions and truffle sauce.  It was delish!!!! I was quite proud of myself for coming up with such an amazing burger.  My dad ordered the Hubert Keller Burge and was so impressed with the flavors that he actually took a napkin and wrote down all of the different ingredients that came on the burger.  He loved the combination of buffalo meat with blue cheese, spinach, and carmalized onions on a ciabatta bun.  My mom, who is constantly "watching her figure" ordered the grilled shrimp salad but ended up taking most of it home because she couldn't get enough of the burger I created.

After we finished our burgers, we all agreed on no dessert, we didn't think it would be possible to take another bite of anything.  The server came by to offer us coffee and dessert but we turned him down.  While waiting for our check, my dad made a trip to the restroom and on his way back noticed an entire station in the restaurant that is dedicated to making milkshakes.  He was so amazed by this that he talked us into ordered a milkshake to split.  We went for the mint chocolate chip ice cream shake and we couldn't have been happier with our final choice at the Burger Bar!!
author: Amber R.

description:
something is wrong if you have to add some fancy sauces to your burger to be seasoned right.

something is wrong when theres an entire fancy restaurant dedicated to presenting a nice burger, but they cant even get a simple thing like seasoning the meat right. 

hk made two big mistake as of late. one, his pbs tv show, the one with the production value of two college kids on a public access channel, and two, this place. 

you cant go wrong with this million dollar view, but thats about all that went right with this place. i mean, seriously, season the meat please. i can really appreciate a fine burger. im the type that doesnt mind dishing out some cash to have a "fancy" *fill in the blank*. sure i wouldnt want to eat that fancy version everyday as i tend to enjoy the simpler things more, but i can appreciate the care and effort put into making something a bit nicer than usual. HOWEVER. if you cant present good ingredients in a palatable form, maybe you should try something else. 

lets start from the begining. ive become much more patient over the past few years and dont mind having to wait for things. perhaps i burnt myself out real fast at an early age, but its pretty hard to get me upset about things now. i didnt quite understand why they would have one server to our party of 20 when the place was pretty much empty besides us, but meh. i had a beer. im not complaining. i ordered a country burger. it looked pretty middle of the road on the menu. i had half the mind to order the $60 burger, but meh, i wanted to see how they do a "regular" burger. i added a chipotle aioli, provolone cheese, prosciutto and a side of skinny fries. this came out to be about $25 or so. i ordered my meat med rare. the burger was infact medium rare. the meat seemed to be of good quality. completely underseasoned. i understand a low salt diet, but this was one of those moments when you say, ok. i understand what those judges were talking about on top chef... all this dish needed was some salt and it wouldve been so much better than it was. are these burgers designed so that you need to pour one of those additional cost sauces? thats kinda crappy. the burger left MUCH to be desired. 

i enjoyed their nice beer list. i probably had a couple too many beers, but i liked my duvel on tap. 11 bucks is a bit steep, but its a good beer. i enjoyed my chimay white. but $30 bucks for a 750ml? a bit steep. and finally i enjoyed my racer 5 on tap. 

in the end, would i spend 80 bucks on beers and burgers again? not here. i have a tough time imagining this place will be around for much longer than a few more months unless they change some things around quickly....

SALT!!! 

saving graces? nice beers. nice view. good staff, though a bit slow. the nutella milkshake i spilt with the lady next to me was pretty damn good and i dont even like sweets. 

saving graces from last night. good friends and that always makes up for anything.

lets see the score. i liked fdl in vegas, but didnt like fdl in sf. i didnt like bb in sf, maybe ill like bb in vegas.....
author: Euge L.

description:
After visiting Burger Bar on not one but several occasions but several since it's opening, the food, staff, and service continue to impress me along with the fantastic view.  Plus, all my out-of-town guests have been equally impressed as well.  

The burgers are cooked to perfection, whether you're having the "Low-cal"- "Kobe" - "Buffalo" or the Rossini.  The Capaca Beer continues to be my favorite. They do have beers specifically made for the restaurant too which you can't get anywhere else--I'm not mentioning the names as you will have to go there yourself and try them out.  Beer lovers, watch out!

The milkshakes are superb!  Their presentation and the combination of alcohol are absolutely original - gotta watch it as the alcohol can creep up on you without a warning.

I was lucky  to meet  the one and only, Hubert Keller, who stopped by our table and greeted all of us with a huge smile. He is down to earth and took the time to ask us if we were enjoying our food.  Certainly a plus if you're dining at BB.

All my out-of-town guests have left the city; however, they continue to talk about their Burger Bar experience.
author: Maria V.

description: Hubert Keller's the real deal - great distinctive food, the beer selection is extensive, the milkshake bar is nirvana for the kids and the view of Union Square is fantastic.  It's open late and is just the best experience in Union Square.
author: Jacklyn A.

description:
Not worth the hype that it has gotten...ordered a burger just how I liked it with cheese, eggs, bacon, and avocado. It came out perfect and was utterly tasteless..way overpriced for what you get. 

The service was ok, fairly attentive.

The milkshakes were just OK. Nothing special, it compares to something I could probably get at Mcdonald's. No joke.

Probably never gonna go back, the setting is wonderful, but definitely not worth the time.
author: Paolo B.

description: Choose somewhere else to eat...completely overrated, overpriced, small portions and mediocre food.  The only thing they have going for them is location in Macy's.  The kids meals are horrible, $7.25 for a 4oz. Cup of Kraft Mac n Cheese and small drink my daughter finished in 30 seconds.  Complained to Manager and he replied the meals are preportioned, can't do anything about it.  Are you kidding me?  The chicken sandwhich very dry, very small and you pay for every thing additional to lettuce and tomato.  Servers never offered more water.  Very disappointed, would never come back!!
author: Noreen S.

description:
Make sure to have a plan B! 
We called ahead a few days prior to our visit, since we were coming from the east bay with a group of people and wanted to make sure that we could get a table. "No Problem!" was their response. The woman I spoke with even said, "See you on Saturday at 7." 
When we arrived, we were informed that they were not seating anyone because the place was reserved for a private party. The hostess told me that she had just found out herself. So, planning ahead and traveling from the East Bay JUST to go to Burger Bar for a birthday was a bust. 
The hostess was kind enough to find us a table at another restaurant after we stood there for a few minutes with our jaws on the floor. 
Knowing that I can't even get in there after planning ahead leaves little desire to return.
author: Nancy W.

description:
The burgers were good especially the American Kobe.  The service is probably worse than I've ever experienced at a high profile restaurant.  I could detect no rhyme to reason to how management had decided which tables would be handled by what server.  I swear it seemed totally random.

The problem started when we were taken to our table which was in a row of two-person booths with only a view of the door to the kitchen at one end at the dirty dish bins on the other.  This was despite the restaurant being half empty. We finally asked to be switched to a decent table and were.  A number of different servers handled tables within a few feet of us.  Our server was rarely sighted.
author: Ken M.

description:
Took friends here visitng from out of town, some were excited cause they knew of the Hubert Keller association.  Now, this isn't Fleur de Lys by any means, but this is a H.Keller restaurant - with that said, the service was less than stellar.  We basically had one of those servers who took our order and we didn't see her for the rest of our meal, only when she came over after asking if we wanted dessert!  Not - 'how was everything guys? Do you need anything else?' Just, 'would you guys like dessert? No.' - check drop! I ordered an ice tea, never got it from our server, had to ask twice from the bus boys passing by.  Food came, things were missing, had to wait and ask twice before they finally came - still hadn't seen server since she took our order!  She did come to refill our water glasses (after we ate and the plates were already cleared) - I'm sitting closest to where she was, with my ice tea glass almost empty - does she offer me a refill on anything? - no!
Food was good, I found the buns for the burgers were on the 'hard' side, bread wasn't soft enough.  Zucchini fries were very tasty, nice crunch, nicely seasoned.
As we sat at our table - ready to leave - still our server is M.I.A. - since dropping the check.
