One HUGE peeve I have when I'm in a restaurant - a guest should NOT have to ever get up from the table (once seated) and only to use the restroom and cause they are ready to leave.  We waited long enough and my friends were ready to go, I had to get up, walk to the Host stand to tell them we are ready to leave and our server is all over the place but coming to our table so we can pay our bill - so can you please handle this (as I hand over payment with our check!)  They obviously told our server there was a mishap, when she returns to our table to bring the credit card slip, do you even think she even mentions this or apologizes for anything - NO!  The basic elements of food service 101 was completely missing from this experience - I've gotten better service at Denny's.  Mind you, this place was not slammed or busy at all at the time we were there.  
Now, writing a review on a restaurant and all I've mostly written on is how the service is lack luster... you can come to your own conclusions. To me, food is quickly forgettable if the service doesnt accompany the meal.
author: Eddie C.

description: I was actually VERY surprised by the quality of this place. I thought it would be another general run-of-the-mill burger place. It actually has kick-ass kobe burgers. They are decent size and not the size of a friggin' catchers mit. Also, admittedly, the choco shake here is easily one of THE BEST I have ever had, and this lady knows her chocolate. Only Hagen Daz can give their shake a good run for its money.
author: Not U.

description: I just attempted to have lunch w/a friend & Burger Bar in SF. we walked in @1:30, ordered by 1:40 after it took waiter forever 2see us. We waited over 30 minutes for two Turkey sandwiches. We were given two Beef Sandwiches. The waiter quickly ran to the back, grabbed what I assumed was the manager. The manager then came to our table, notice the bill already on table, asked if we already had eaten. We then made sure to point out our food never came, we were on tight schedule & asked for bill earlier (but also noticed we were charged for wrong meals). The manager offered to make meal s(overlooking our time rush). The manager didn't offer to provide two complimentary meals on them for our next visit. Of course we will never be going to any Burger Bar again because of this very inconvenient service. Maybe Macy's should evict Burger Bar in SF. Oh, &, I don't appreciate being forced to "Like" Burger Bar SF on Facebook just 2 post a truthful account of experience I just had 45 minutes ago!
author: S D.

description:
Short review:  Burger Bar is terrible.

Long version:

We ordered the sliders which came with fries, and the Kobe burger with a side of truffle sauce.  All of the meat, whether buffalo or beef, was a little dry, unseasoned, and devoid of flavor.  The truffle sauce tasted like McCormick instant Au Jus.  The fries were okay, in a McDonald's sort of way, but not in the delicious French bistro pomme frites sort of way that I'd expect Keller capable of producing.  The onion bun on which the Kobe burger came was reminiscent of Safeway.

I went here on a relatively slow Monday afternoon, and yet somehow the fire time for our order exceeded 20 minutes.  For burgers and fries.  On a slow afternoon.

I'll say this however:  the view is lovely.  Come here for the view and a drink and try to ignore the awful mall chain restaurant feel of the place.  If you're hungry for a burger after a few cocktails, Pearl's isn't too far away.
author: D M.

description:
Fantastic experience - food experience atleast. Had the Hubert Keller Burger - buffalo burger w/ carmelized onions, blue cheese, and sauteed onions. It totally hit the spot; I couldn't have been happier. The battered zucchini was great appetizer as well - nice, crisp coating with al dente zucchini in the middle (hate when it gets mushy). OMG the Nutella Milkshake.. all I have to say is try it or you're missing out. The skinny fries were great and so were the sweet potato fries - perfectly crisp on the outside w/ just the right tenderness on the inside.

The food was nothing short of fantastic. An added bonus - getting to meet Hubert Keller! He just happened to have been checkin things out that night and came over to our table for a hand shake and gratitude for our patronage. 

So why only three stars? Horrible service (this is a deal breaker for me most of the time). Our first waiter didn't want anything to do with us (maybe it was because he was ending his shift; still not an excuse). It was hard to flag him down and when we did; he got our order wrong (could've been his "walk and listen" method that didn't work. yes. he didn't even stop to listen to our order. the d-bag kept walking). After we couldn't find him for a good ten minutes; we asked someone for something simple -  a straw - but never got it. Then we got pleasantly surprised with a new waitress. Definitely better than our first - bubbly, attentive, and willing. Things were smooth until the place got busier. After a while we never saw our waitress so it took forever to get anything. When we tried to flag her down she gave us the index finger. So we tried to ask someone to pass on the message that we wanted some tea... when that didn't come after 15 minutes we were able to finally get her attention and she said she never got the message and that she'd make sure the tea would make its way to our table - never happened. Finally, she came back after another ten minutes, after we had to flag her down of course, and told us they had no more of the tea we wanted.. went to the fourth floor for some tea instead. Something small but significant enough to bother me...

Thank goodness the foood is wonderful; or else I'd have no other reason to come back.
author: kassandra t.

description:
Burger Bar by Hubert Keller from Fleur De Lys...

Their positioning by offering the fancy menu like hamburger with kobe beef wth fois gras...and choices of fries, etc. That made me want to try this place. And my expectation is very high too, something that is better than the generic hamburger places that we can have anywhere else offering by mass and commercial restaurants.

I got there on Saturday night about 7 pm. and waited about 20 minutes to get seat. The menu is impressive, They offer a lot of choices for hamburger.. from angus beef, kobe beef, ground turkey, salman, chicken, etc. I chose American Kobe Beef hamburger with mozzarella, Jalapeno Bacon, avocado on side and coleslaw. I have to order their dijon mustard (that they claimed it is homemade) on side because they do not offer any dijon on the table. -- minus 1 star for this and the taste is like the regular dijon. They only offer yellow mustard from the commercial brand on the table. I ordered my beef medium, and my husband ordered medium rare. But I got medium rare and my husband got medium. -- minus another 1 star for this. The quality of my kobe beef is ok but no flavor. The skinny fries that I got was already cold and plain, nothing special.- minus another star for this. If you tried fries from the restaurants in Napa, you will know what I mean, the fries that hot and crispy outside. For my personnal opinion, I think the fries at in & out is better!!!

The customer service was nice. Our waitress was nice. No complain about this. 

The interior.... it looks mass or chain restaurant. Like I said, they bring fois gras to the menu so I expect something more custom made chair or table, not something mass produce that they can get anywhere from the restaurant supply place.

For the conclusion, if I craving for hamburger and looking for the good quality hamburger, I don't think I will go back to this place again.
author: Chali L.

description: very mediocre and expensive burgers. skip this place and go to burger house on powell for a better burger at half the price.
author: Nicholas M.

description:
Wow, I have been a fan of Hubert Keller's since seeing him on Top Chef where he has shown himself to be not only very talented but very down-to-earth as well.  So I was very excited to hear that his Burger Bar was coming close to me in SF!  Needless to say I wasn't disappointed and neither were my 3 other companions.  They followed my lead on trying this new place and one of my friends said that the "Hubert Keller" burger was the best burger he has ever had.  

I had the buffalo meat which I had never had before and I was completely satisfied as it was cooked to perfection and all the toppings that can be custom-picked really made it special.  I am very picky when it comes to how my burger is cooked. Many places say they make it medium rare and then it comes out medium.  They got it perfect!  Another friend had the country burger meat and another the portobella mushroom -- all completely satisfied.    

The ambience is great as we sat in front of the window looking down on Union Square right next to the bar.  The best part of the entire experience was meeting Mr. Keller himself.  He was walking around the restaurant looking involved and attentive and our nice waiter, Chris, asked if we would like to meet him, well, duh- yes!  Mr. Keller stopped by and chatted with us very openly in his friendly style. He even stopped by a second time after our meal to ask us how it was.  Nice touch.

Overall excellent service coupled with wonderful quality  food cooked just right equals me being an instant fan and repeat customer.  I'll be sure to tell everyone to try this great burger place that I hope has much success.
author: Kelly B.

description: If the 6-Dollar burger menu at Carl's JR is your idea of a high-end burger, then take your stunted pallet next door to the Cheesecake Factory. This is a sit-down restaurant, so don't expect fast-food prices. I found the cost to be very reasonable as you can expect a meal (appetizer and entree) to run around $25 - unless you opt for the gourmet $60 Kobe, Truffle and foie gras creation. Good food, great view and decent service.
author: Preston R.

description:
I've been waiting and waiting for the Burger Bar to open.  I finally made it there last week.  I got there around 6pm.  They wait was only 20 minutes.   I ordered a caesar salad, a kobe burger, and a strawberry sundae with chocolate ice cream.  My boyfriend ordered a milkshake and a sirloin burger.

I knew it was going to be expensive - I went to the Burger Bar, not the burger barn.  But I expected the food to be great.

The caesar salad was surprisingly bland and my burger was really rare.  I ordered it medium but I'm ok with rare beef.  But the beef was really stringy.  There were large white bits of chewy things in the beef.   The sweet potato fries were good.

When I got my strawberry sundae, it had a scoop of ice cream with 1 strawberry cut into 4 circles.  The chocolate ice cream was good so when I asked the server whether they made the it on site, she said, "no, it's Breyers".  Wow - I paid $9 for a scoop of supermarket ice cream.

Well - I had my experience - probably won't go again...
author: L K.

description:
Burger King service.

Buffalo burger was actually good, but surprised at the lack of presentation.  Service was horrible.  

Overpriced for what it is.  If you like the Cheesecake Factory crowd and want your pic taken with a Food Network Star, then this is your place.  If you want a good hamburger at an expensive price, try Spruce....at least the fries are included.
author: Chris O.

description:
Took my daughter after seeing RENT as it was a special day for us. To bad the day ended with the service (or lack there of) we got. The burgers were indeed amazing, the milkshakes BEST I have ever had but the service...WORST I ever have had. Waited 20-30 minutes for the check, waiter never came back to see how our meal was, had to ask more then once for items he forgot to bring including the box for the half my daughter couldn't finish.

Only saving grace, the manager.  After waiting the 20-30 minutes to get out check I finally got up and asked to see the manager, when she came over I explained my dissatisfaction. She was apologetic and offered to comp the entire meal.  I let her know that was NOT my reason for speaking up but in fact was hoping the server would get some coaching.

The food is amazing so I will be back to try again but if the service isn't better I won't be back. In our economy I am not about to spend $30 plus for a burger if I have to wait 30 minutes to get the check. Let's hope the wait staff gets the coaching it needs.
author: valerie a.

description: My review is only based on cocktails! We stopped by the Cheesecake factory for a late morning bite (yum, I know). We were on vacation so why not add a cocktail to our healthy meal! I had a lemon drop whilst my partner had a mojito. Both were very yummy! The bar staff were very friendly as well!
author: Robyn G.

description: Tourist trap. Overpriced greasy burgers. 2 stars for the view.
author: The Y s.

description:
i loved the burger bar in vegas.  when i found out that there was a burger bar in macy's in SF, i was thrilled.  my excitment only lasted until i actually walked into the place.  i sat at the bar and was not served for over 10 min.  they weren't even busy at the time.  when the bitchy male bartender walked up to me, he had a serious attitude problem.  mr. bitch, if you don't like your job i will kindly take it from you.  you are in the service industry.  did you forget? maybe you should quit.  but don't think of throwing that tude around. this guy was actually talking shit under his breath about me and sharing it with the servers.  beers are expensive but they have a good selection.  i would never order a shot here because the price is too high.  also, don't tip these assholes.  i didn't.

burger bar gets one star for the burgers.  they're good.  service is crap!
author: T D.

description:
I had lunch at the bar at about 1 pm on a Thursday (today) when the place was nearly empty. The bartender could not have been less interested in serving. He walked over and barely looked at me to take my order. I got the lunch special with was a burger fries and soda for about $11. It took about 25 minutes for the burger to come out and it was totally "meh" (the yelp definition of 2 star). The sesame seed bun seemed like something you would get in a package of 8 at the grocery store and the burger itself was luke warm. The bartender never checked in on me to see how my meal was. I wanted A-1 sauce but all four bottles nearest to me on the bar and tables were completely empty. I laid them down on the bar and eventually the bartender picked them up and returned the empty bottles to the tables.  There are large TVs in the bar, but the two nearest me were showing an infomercial. If I could have gotten the bartenders attention in the EMPTY bar, perhaps he would have changed the channel for me.
I am sure that if I had a friendly, rather than disinterested and bored server, this might have been a nicer experience. It is clear that the so-called celebrity chef (they brag on the menu about him coming in second place on a cooking show) has nothing to do with the day to day operations of this restaurant. Definitely NOT a destination restaurant. Perhaps worth stopping by if you are already in Macy's (again, in hopes of getting better service than I got from the bartender).
author: Tom J.

description: Well, 4 for the food itself and our cute young server (his T-shirt said Fresh Meat, that about summed it up - the girls where ones that say Well Done) who tried quite hard, but 2 for the wild overpricing and sort of odd mish mash ambiance.  Do the booth tables really need 13 inch TVs at them? Was this a service that SF diners regaled with stunning view of Union Square just crying out for?  Very odd touch and the lay out of the restaurant is strange. Our big group got a window sort of alcove table so it was very nice, but the rest of the table seem sort of jammed in - I would not want to go with 2 people. We went late to avoid lines and I certainly don't think this place is good enough to wait on line for an hour for, but it was  pleasant dining. I love a great burger and everything is so customizable you can get *exactly* what you want from meat to topping to details.  That being said $20 for a burger?  Really?  Even my two servings of Fleur dy Lys side sauces I ordered (for extra fee) don't justify the price points here.  But if you are looking for a view, dragging out of towners around and need a Union Square nosh spot, this runs circles around The Cheesecake Factory upstairs.  Oh, and dessert shakes are just out of this world good. I don't even really like ice cream and I loved my caramel latte shake. Go for that alone and you'll love it, but even those were $8.95.  'Nuff said.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Went on a Saturday night (with a reservation) with about 14 people. Seated in the bar area at five tall bar tables pushed together. Kinda cramped. HMMMM. Took the waiter about five visits to take our drink orders because he kept getting distracted and wandering off. NOT GOOD. Ordered from the menu an American Kobe Beef Burger ($16.50) Okay. Kinda pricey. But I don't mind paying for quality ground beef. (You should see what goes into ordinary ground beef. YIKES.) And the fact that fries were an additional $3.50 didn't bother me. They must be fantastic fries, served in great big quantities, right? WRONG. Lame fries, stingy portion. Oh, it's a good thing I threw a runny fried egg onto my burger because my medium rare burger was overcooked like shoe leather. And the lettuce, tomato, onion accompaniment? STINGY. Want mayo? They call it ailoi and charge extra for it. And guess what? It tastes like Miracle whip. LAME. I looked at everyone else's burger and had a bite of my boyfriends. LAME. ORDINARY. BAAAAD. Oh and those drinks we fought so hard to order? NEVER got a second chance to order another! Glasses sat empty for an hour and a half. LAME. Finally, someone got up and got us water at the bar. I asked the hostesses twice to find our waiter. He still was never anywhere to be found. The sundaes? The milkshakes? WHO KNOWS? I didn't stick around to find out how they tasted. Wanna cheap tasty burger? Stick to In n' Out. Want a pricey, indulgent burger? Hit Zuni Cafe. At both places you get what you pay for and the service is always RIGHT ON.
author: Alexander G.

description:
Hubert Keller opened Burger Bar and it should serve amazing food right? WRONG!

When you eat at Burger Bar, you can throw out all of your hopes that Burger Bar's food will be the same quality as his finer dining institutions. Before I continue to knock Burger Bar, I think the decor of Burger Bar has Hubert Keller's charm and enthusiasm. There are booths with personal TVs and the restaurant has the feel of a classy diner.

We came here early to beat the lunch rush. We were immediately seated next to a window that had breathtaking views of Union Square (kudos to that!). The menu is not overly complicated, but PLEASE NOTE that when you order a "create your own burger," fries do not come with your order, which warranted a major demerit in my opinion. However, the specials come with skinny fries. My friend ordered to Kobe beef burger and I ordered the Hawaiian Burger. The orders came fairly quickly (probably because they are simply grilled pieces of meat placed between two buns). To our surprise, my friend's kobe burger did not come with fries and the lettuce, tomato and onion sat awkwardly on the half of the plate where we expected fries to occupy. We both just stared at it like two kids opening a gift box to find it empty. The Kobe beef burger is cooked to your liking but looked rather charred when it arrived. However, my friend said it tasted ok, as he downed the puppy in a matter minutes (read as: the burger was small). My Hawaiian burger came with a side order of skinny fries, which I unwillingly had to share with my friend. There were two pieces of marinated chicken, a slice of bacon, grilled onions, and a roasted pineapple on a buttered bun. To say the chicken was flavorless would be a compliment. I have no idea what the marinade could have been since I tasted no hint of flavor in the chicken. To make matters worse, the chicken came steaming hot, which made the buns soggy. The grilled onions were a mushy mess. The roasted pineapples seemed to have a few pepper flakes on it and was not particularly appealing. The only saving grace was the bacon, but it is pretty hard to mess up bacon. The mushy onions and the soggy buns made each successive bite less appetizing than the previous one. My burger and my friend's burger were highly disappointing.

I really wanted to like Burger Bar, since it would provide a less crowded alternative to Cheesecake Factory. I also wanted to like it because I am a big fan of Hubert Keller, but alas, my high hopes were unwarranted and unrewarded. If you want a better burger, head two blocks south on Powell St. to Burger King (you would also pay about $20 less for your food). Sorry Burger Bar, never again.
author: Gary L.

description: They've come a long way in the couple of years we've been going.  They used to have a rude hostess and impossible seating.  Thanks to their manager Richard, things have greatly improved and we always manage to get wonderful seating.  The views from the windows are spectacular and the booths offer nice privacy.  The burgers are always delicious.  I've tried so many of them the only advice I can give is to go for the plainest ones because the meat is delicious.  I got the Black Jack, and the olive tapenade while good, overpowered the delicious hamburger underneath.  Lots of different types of beef (including Kobe and Black Angus) as well as salmon and veggie burgers.  We go after theatre as they are open late and it's the perfect fun end to an evening.  The service is attentive and friendly and they always take such good care of us, we never go anywhere else for late dining on Union Square. And check out that milkshake sampler for the table, now that's fun in a glass!
author: Jim L.

description: Mom and I came here today for an early dinner.  We were seated right away.  We ordered a salmon burger and the slider trio.  We also ordered a side of zucchini fries.  The salmon burger was very generous.  The fish was a thick piece of fillet, not a salmon mash mixed with bread crumb that is what you get sometimes for that order elsewhere.  The sliders, though they were supposed to have been made using three different types of meat, all tasted the same to me.  The only differences between the three are what was put on top of each of the patties.   Both dishes were fine, nothing all that spectacular. However, the zucchini fries were the most disappointing.  The fries used all the breading that was not used on the salmon, and then some.  The breading has this unpleasant taste/odor that stopped me from having another bite after the initial taste.  I did not detect any zucchini with that one bite I took.  Overall, I'll probably go back there again, but not too soon.
author: Yvette F.

description: i have been a fan of hubert keller's tv show and couldn't wait for the burger bar to open. maybe i had set my expectations too high for this place but i was sorely disappointed. i had the angus burger and "skinny" fries. 1) to be honest I couldn't tell you the difference between mcdonald's $1 fries and burger bar's $3 fries. 2) for $9 there was nothing special about the burger. sadly, the only good thing that i could say about this place was that some of the waiters were pretty hot. overall, for the same price you'll have a much better experience at The Counter. Burgers there are bigger and the fries are better seasoned and actually come with different sauces.
author: johnny w.

description: so I came here to the Burger Bar to spend a gift card I have. if it wasn't for the card I would not be coming back! the people here are a bit of challenging and when they converse with people you can tell they don't give a f*#@! wow where are the days of good service? Don't you want a tip? I must say though that the turkey burger was delicious!
author: glenn m.

description:
Well first of all, even though it's in Macy's, it is hard to find.  I was afraid I was going to have to tuck myself into one of the designer bed set ups (on the same floor) with a sign "wake me if you know where the burger bar is".  
Wine - I ordered a glass of the Rhone wine but as I brought it to my lips it had a peculiar smell, kind of DDT-ish.  It was replaced graciously with an excellent petite syrah of the maitre d's choosing.
Burger - You can put together a foie gras burger for lots less than the $60 one if you omit the $30 truffles.  Choose from the left side of the menu to do this.  For what it was, i.e. wretches excess, it was good.
Sides - The sweet potatoe fries seemed cut too thin to retain moisture so they were not very good.
Dessert - I asked.  The waiter checked.  The ice cream is from Dreyers (hello, Safeway) or from something like Bluebells in Idaho or Iowa, which I take it is another low end creamery.  I assume this was on doctor's orders to keep the cholesterol below lawsuit level.
I'd probably go again, but not for awhile.
author: l h.

description: I pulled out two hairs from my burger. No joke. apparently they haven't figured out the whole hair net thing in the kitchen.  It took an hour and a half to get our food for a birthday party of 12. Half of the table didn't get their drinks for 45 minutes, while the other half was brought a second round. This place clearly doesn't have its sht together yet. The entire dining experience was so bad that we actually had a really fun time discussing just how ridiculous the restaurant is. I wasn't going to write a review, but I just checked my credit card statement and they over billed me for the meal. the last straw - I will never go back to this place.
author: dan h.

description: We have enjoyed eating here regularly and usually order the country natural burger which has always been a large plump juicy patty until last week .  What we got was a small dry patty minus the pickle and a very tiny piece of lettuce -- what's happening?  At this price, you should know better than to cut back the portions!  Service was also very haphazard.
author: Linda P.

description: Soooooo overrated!  I haven't been to Fleur De Lys but I think he should stick to it since I've heard good things about it.  Unfortunately I was really looking forward to dinner here and had high expectations.  I wanted to like it.  Really I did but when you charge me more than $8 for a milkshake that is supposedly alcoholic but tastes like you just threw some Dreyer's mint chip ice cream in a blender, then you have lost a possible fan in me.  First off, our waitress sucked!  I usually tip between 20 to 25% but I think we ended up leaving her a 10% tip if even that.  Throughout the meal, we were constantly looking for her.  She wouldn't take our complete order at once.  Instead she insisted upon breaking up our ordering so that we would order everything in the order it should arrive.  A good waiter would take the entire order and just stagger the input of the order into the kitchen.  Usually I wouldn't mind if it hadn't been for the fact that the waitress kept disappearing so we'd have to try to find her and flag her down to order our burgers after our drinks finally arrived.  I ordered the sliders plate because I wanted to try the various types of meat that Burger Bar served.  It had the Angus, Country Natural Beef and buffalo burger on it.  When the burgers finally came, I expected that the wait staff would at least point out the different sliders and describe the different meats.  Nope, some guy just plopped it onto the table and left without asking if we needed anything.   We never saw the waitress again until we flagged her down to get our bill.  She never checked on us and wasn't the one to drop off our food.  As for the burgers, we had to just guess what was what.  My friend and I were ultimately unimpressed with it.  You could taste a slight difference in the meats but it was still pretty flavorless.  I don't think they season or flavor the meat at all.  I suppose that if you custom ordered your burger and got the difference aiolis and sauces, it would be a different story.  Unfortunately substitutions and add-ons are not allowed on their signature burgers so we made due with ketchup and mustard.  Good thing they were on the table or else we would've ended up with some dry-ass burgers since we would never have been able to find our waitress to request those condiments.  My friend had wanted to order the dessert burger but we were full from the shakes and burgers.  It sounded intriguing but I was already disappointed and didn't want to waste any more money on a let-down.  We spent nearly $30 each for shakes and sliders and pretty much stiffed our waitress on her tip due to her craptastic service.  All in all, the burgers aren't bad but for the prices they charged, I would go elsewhere that will charge half as much for a mediocre burger.  The service was terrible for none too busy happy hour timeslot in the middle of Union Square.  I won't be back unless some friend has a birthday there and I have no choice in the restaurant.
author: elsa w.

description:
poor service, which is all too often a common thread there. server really wasn't engaged and allowed food delivery without checking that two of the orders were incorrect.

I really want to like this place, b/c i'm a burger guy and I have liked Vegas location. but this time even the bun was dry (old) and the milkshake was awfully thin and overwhipped. a poor experience all around
author: Eric S.

description: I got the the world's hottest burger and it was awesome! If you're into blue cheese the Hubert Keller burger is good too. I went on a Thursday night and without any reservations and walked right in.
author: Sunaina b.

description: went there after a musical performance at orpheum theater... got surf & turf burger and Hubert Keller Burger.. I think I like Hubert Keller burger a lot better just because it's more juicy and tastes better than the other one. surf /turf is too dry and I believe the lobster was frozen lobster... so that kinda left a bad impression of burger bar for me.
author: Jac L.

description: We found the Burger Bar to be a pleasant surprise in the midst of Union Square. After making your way through Macy's, you are greeted with a fantastic view from pretty much anywhere in the restaurant, and the food is not too shabby either. I was a bit skeptical about Beer-Battered Jalapeno Pickles, because they sounded like a strange combination, but they were surprisingly delicious, and not too spicy.  I was thrilled to find that the Veggie Burger was not just some pre-made patty. It's their own combination of ingredients, including pumpkin and cheese and a load of other things, giving it a very complex flavor. It was incredibly filling and tasty, and not like anything I've had anywhere else. My boyfriend said his American Kobe Burger was seasoned and cooked quite well. He also enjoyed the White Lightning beer, which our server explained was brewed just for the Burger Bar. And the milkshake sampler we had for desert was outstanding, if a little overwhelming! Next time we are in town, we will stop in again for sure!
author: Joanne S.

description: Definitely a great place I recommend, although I admit the location of it is weird, located inside macy's in union square. Who would of thought a restaurant inside macy's? I ordered a salmon burger and boy was the salmon fillet thick! It was big, juicy and well seasoned and the fillet alone would probably fill you up. The sweet potato fries and onion rings were also delicious, however, I also love their fried pickles! They were very generous with the pickles and it was perfectly crispy. My favorite thing however was the alcoholic milkshakes, specifically the mint one made with ice cream, bailey's and mint flavoring. You don't taste any alcohol, it tastes just like a delicious mint milkshake and then you start feeling the affects, its lovely. They also have one in vegas that I want to hit up! The price was also very reasonable, the only thing was the long wait but at least you can order drinks at the bar while you wait.
author: sherry w.

description: oh god i loved this place. i ate here once for a late lunch thinking it was gonna be like any other overrated higher-end burger joint, but i was quite surprised at how delicious my country natural was and sweet potato fries were. i read a couple other reviews and i'm seeing a lot of ppl saying their burger was dry, however mine was sooo juicy. i still remember the toppings i chose too: country natural on ciabatta with baby spinach, tomato, avocado, grilled onions, peppered bacon, pesto, and provolone. at first i was kinda skeptical about pairing the bacon and pesto together but i'm glad i did. i definitely recommend it.
author: Anthony L.

description: First time.  Last time.  Mediocre at best.  Lazy kitchen mixed old and new fries together---SCREW YOU!!  Who out there appreciates that?  Who are you, McDouchebags?  Burger was ok because it was cooked properly--still juicy BUT overcooked.  I paid $12 for a $6 burger.  Service was fine.
author: Victor J.

description: I came here very excited to try their burgers.  I've read a lot of great reviews and decided to come here on a weekday to avoid a long wait.  We were seated immediately and was brought our water very promptly.  However, after that we didn't see anyone for about 10 min.  We didn't know who our waiter was so we actually had to ask a bus boy to get somebody for us.  A couple of other waiters walked right by us and could clearly see that we were sitting there for a while yet didn't take the time to acknowledge our presence or get anyone for us.  Just shows that all they cared about was their own tables and not the overall customer service of the restaurant.  We finally got our waiter and ordered.  I ordered the kobe beef burger.  Although it took very long for it to come out, it tasted really good.  However, our waiter never checked on us, and we actually had to ask for the bill.  The bussers were very prompt.  Once we finished our meals they were very quick to clear our table.  So again, we sat for probably 5 minutes now with a clear table waiting for our bill.  I hope the management does a better job of managing their servers because once the word gets out to locals that their service sucks, they'll have to rely strictly on unknowing tourist as their main customer base.  I would definitely recommend to saving your money and not coming here.  Service is very poor
author: Jay G.

description: they have a huge beer selection which could draw me back here again if i am craving a burger. if you are a big burger person this place has literally any type of primary meat, topping, sauce, bun, etc you could think of combining together (i highly recommend the jalapeno bacon!) the catch is the price, a little much for me since burgers don't rock my socks. coming here was a lot of fun though and i am really glad i came. sitting on bar stools by the window you have an amazing view of union square and the service was really friendly as well as helpful when you cant decide between all your options.
author: Barbara C.

description: Food good. Service bad. The only negative about the food was my burger was overcooked. I ordered MED Rare, they brought medium well. Didn't send it back because fortunately it was really tender and delish still. Our waiter decided to go on break...no one told us so we were left high and dry for awhile with no one coming to check on our food, so i didn't even have a chance to tell anyone my burger was overcooked. The hubs even had to get up to get his own water. Eventually a gal came by. The hubs explained how we were deserted and my burger was overcooked. I don't think they pay the waiters here and I agree they rounded up all the losers to work here, coz she didn't give a damn. Didn't say or do anything about the overcooked expensive burger, and about our waiter, just flippantly said, oh he didn't disappear, he just went on break. !!!  POOR POOR service here. Guess the only bright side to the service is you can save money on the tip, coz they don't deserve one. Mr. Keller, do something about the service!
author: Chris C.

description: Terrible service, terrible atmosphere, terrible management. After less then a stellar experience they were having elevator issues. One elevator to service both the burger bar and cheesecake factory. After demanding to be let out after 30 minutes through the emergency exit the manager refused and walked away. Wake up idiots we live in earthquake country. Never again! Fire Marshall called
author: Michael G.

description: Quite ordinary burger and soggy fries even though we asked for them well done. Excellent wine though.
author: Francoise F.

description: I went last night and had the black angus with monterey jack, the skinny fries, and a nutella milkshake. I ordered at the bar and got my food to go. My milkshake came out a few minutes after I ordered it, and my food came out like 5 minutes after that. The milkshake was amazing! I almost died. The fries were hot and perfectly crispy. They put some ketchup, mustard, and aioli sauce in my bag which was a nice surprise. The aioli sauce was really good, and I ended up putting some on my burger. I loved everything I had, and I will definitely be going back!
author: Eileen H.

description: The biggest disappointment of our trip aside from the overly priced Gary Danko!  Having become a big fan of Hubert Keller from Top Chef fame we were surprised to have experienced the WORST burger, fries, and onion rings we have ever had...This place is like TGI Fridays meets the Yardhouse both on bad days.  I've had better burgers at In and Out!  First they brought us our burger fries and onion rings in measly portions with a little bit of onion and lettuce-nothing else on the bun.  Then they never brought us our fries until requested 2 times.  Finally they overcharged us for things we didn't order.  At this point I was steaming and disgusted and spoke to the manager who proceeded to credit us for our fries and onion rings!  The bill still came to $18.00 for a sprite and a lousy burger...DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME....
author: BECKY W.

description:
My boyfriend and I dined at Burger Bar on opening night. We arrived at approximately 6pm and were told the wait would take about 10 minutes since they weren't seating anyone yet.  After waiting about 10 minutes, another group showed up and was told the wait would take about an hour.  Frustrated, I asked the hostess about our wait and she looked on her small white note sheet and said we're number 14 in line and it will take an hour.  We noticed a small group arriving way after us and asking for a table for two and were seated right away.  The lady in that group was chatting with hostess and telling her what a great job she's doing and to just ignore all the negative comments from the impatient people waiting to her right.  If I knew I had to kiss up to hostess for a faster table, I would have done the same.  A group next to us saw what happened and left very upset over how unprofessional the hostess was acting.

When we finally got seated after an hour and 10 minutes wait, we only saw our waitress three times during the entire evening.  I never got her name since she never introduced herself.  We first saw her when she dropped off our waters and took our order.  We never saw her again until my boyfriend noticed her walking by and asked for the check.  I did mention to her that the service was really slow and she replied by saying "it's opening night".  Her final visit was dropping off the receipt and we promptly paid our bill in cash so we wouldn't have to wait any longer for her to return.  

In terms of the food, my boyfriend was satisfied with his Hubert Keller Burger, but my burger was anything but desirable.  I ordered the Angus beef and the patty was falling apart as I bit into it.  The pesto sauce had a very rusty oily taste to it which made the burger very hard to eat.  Additionally, my fries were very over salted and my pepsi was flat. 
  
I completely understand that opening nights are a bit tricky, but our complete dining experience was horrible.  I wouldn't have mind the wait if the service or food was better.  I have been to the Burger Bar in Las Vegas and very impressed with the food and service.  I even made reservations for Fleur De Lys for my boyfriend's birthday dinner because he is such a big fan of Hubert Keller.  We were both very disappointed with our dining experience.  I'm sure we'll be back in the near future to give Burger Bar another try when all the kinks are figured out and a working beeper/pager system is in place so people won't have to wait around for an hour. 

Called Burger Bar after our horrible dining experience since we didn't have time to wait around another hour and spoke with the manager, Danielle.  She listened to my complaint and told me I should send her an email.  I sent her an email similar to my review and it's been over 4 days and haven't heard anything back yet.
author: P L.

description: This place is a factory.  You can pick and choose the items for your burger, but they are haphazardly thrown together.  A little attention to detail would go a long way.
author: Rich L.

description:
We showed up on Monday night at 5:30 and were seated immediately at a window table for four. As we walked to our table, we were greeted by Hubert Keller, "welcome to Burger Bar!", while patting me on the back...good start! I ordered the Kobe burger with jack cheese and peppered bacon on a sourdough roll (they have 3 types of bacon to choose from!). My girlfriend and friends ordered the Country farm burgers, along with onion rings and fries to share. The onion rings were amazing! Lightly battered and crunchy with just the right amount of salt seaoning. A place that serves Anchor Steam Liberty Ale, the perfect burger beer?..wow that's using their noodles! Unfortunately the chef put my medium-rare jack burger on the wrong bun and served it to my girlfriend while I got her medium-well country farm burger on a sesame roll. After a couple of bites into my burger I could tell it wasn't my Kobe medium-rare. The server was very attentive and took my burger back to be redone fresh. My girlfriend liked my Kobe burger so much she kept it and ate it all...medium-rare no less! The manager came over during the redo of my Kobe, apologized profusely, topped off our beers for free, comped my burger...very attentive of her ! The new burger was served to me and it was one of the top three burgs I've ever had. Seared and juicy with medium-crisp bacon. At the end of the meal, a foursome of different flavored milkshakes arrived for all of us, againd comp thanks to the manager! Delicious! The waitress and manager made us feel as if they cared about the problem which was quickly corrected.

I'd give it five stars, but it's in the first week of its opening and the kinks usually take a couple of months to work out. We'll be back soon to enjoy the full experience around Christmas time. The one thing I would recommend to Mr. Keller is to offer some other type of ketchup besides Heinz. Mustard's in Yountville makes their own ketchup daily, and it adds a lot to the experience. I'm sure he's got a recipe for one in his box at home!
author: SFNATIVE K.

description: Decent but overpriced!  I have really great coworkers that treated me here today.  We arrived right at 11:30 and were promptly seated by the unfriendly hostess.  Luckily the waiter was in a good mood and very helpful.  He explained to us how the menu works.  Basically a build your own burger is gonna cost you some bucks, each item costs extra as does the order of fries.  I do have to give props to the meat, we selected the natural one and it was good.  Very flavorful even cooked well done.  The bread was a bit hard and I ended up only eating half of it.  The fat fries were good, as were the onion rings and sweet potato fries.  I would love to come back with an expense account and go wild and order the lobster add on with the kobe beef.  I would also love to splurge on a $10 milkshake!  This place is more hype than anything else.  I don't really see myself returning because it really wasn't to die for.  I still prefer Barney's for a good burger and shake.  This place is a beer lover's dream, they had at least 12 beers on tap to choose from.
author: La C.

description: Very weak.  Burger was average.  Shakes were below average.  Only get a small shake in the glass rather than the larger (steel) container.  Location is the only highlight.   The Burger Bar at Mandalay Hotel in Las Vegas is much, much better (at least a year ago when I ate there).
author: Robert P.

description: I'm a fan of the Burger Bar in Vegas, but the SF location was a big disappointment. The service was very slow, and the hostess said the staff was very busy when I told her we hadn't even gotten water after 10 minutes. This was a little puzzling, as they had a lot of wait staff who were just standing around. As for the food, it was unremarkable & kinda bland. I don't feel a need to deal with Union Square for a mediocre burger and poor service.
author: Kent H.

description: Visited in the fall of 2009. Great variety of burgers, different types of meat/chicken/fish and different toppings. Kids loved their milkshakes and I loved the sweet potato fries. Had a great view of Union Square. Had to wait about 30 minutes to get in. Would go back if in the area but wouldn't go out of my way to get there.
author: Jackie W.

description: BIG let down! Husband had been wanting to try this place for awhile now and we like many other people I see based on the reviews, felt that if you have a restaurant with the name Hubert Keller on it you are going to receive good service and great food. The burgers (first off came out completely wrong)---husband ordered medium rare, came out medium-well. Then it came back the 2nd time and was still moo-ing though he ate it anyway eww! The food was nothing special. I was honestly expecting to say, yum at some point...didn't happen! Fries were salty and cold! He had an $18 burger with no fries or anything. It was a Kobe Beef burger, oooh wow I'm so impressed, NOT! It tasted like any other burger I've had. I had the sliders...honestly I would have been happier going to The Counter, yes I said it and The Counter is not quality, I know that...and that is exactly my point. For what you pay it isn't worth it. And to top off the just so wonderful food (yes I am being sarcastic,) was the ever so cheerful waitress (sarcasm again) She was rude, had a total attitude and when husband said his burger was overcooked (and he is the nice one, so yes he said it very nicely to her.) she responded with a quick and cold snap, "well I didn't cook it." OK lady no one said you did cook it, but how about you go back to the kitchen and get it cooked to my liking. (NO he did not say this. haha I did...in my head at least!) Short and sweet, Save your time and $$ and go somewhere else. Oh and by the way, we saw Mr. Keller there...which makes me wonder, if it was like this with him there, just how horrible this place would be if he wasn't there. eeek!!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: The $60 Rossini wasn't all that. Will come back to try other burgers though.
author: C C.

description: I have been to the burger bar twice now. The kobe beef burger was amazing but the service was slow on both of my visits. I usually don't mind but both times it was a tuesday night and the place was empty so I didn't see any reason for the delays.
author: K. D.

description: Average food, great beer list, awesome fries, lazy server.  Not a bad burger, but San Francisco has lots of great burgers.  Clearly a tourist-oriented spot that seems to lack the attention of ownership that actually cares.
author: Drexel B.

description:
Please do not be drawn into this place because of the famous chef name! That was our first mistake! We spurged on the Kobi burger.
This was a TASTELESS, dry piece of  "mystery meat". I am not trying to be rude, but it did not taste like beef or any other meat. We had ordered it medium. There was no juice left in the meat. We also ordered fries that were good  when we received them, but sadly turned very limp.  The noise level is very,very high. Tables crowded together. Very few tables with a view or window. We were at a wall. Service very slow, but the waiter was nice. At the end, the manager came by and listened to our complaints, but had an o well attitude. I  had part of the meat left and there was just a shrug!  Save your money folks. Yes it is convenient, but that is the only plus. If you are really craving a burger, go to the wharf area to In and Out Burger rated high even by Consumer Reports and Martha Stewart favorite is the Animal Burger as it is mine.
Excellent service as well and very inexpensive.
author: Kathy L.

description: Burger Bar wasn't on top of my list of places to eat even though I do have a Hubert Keller crush but I had friends in town who were excited to try. I've heard about the wait and, fortunately for me, I was almost an hour late to the reservation while my friends waited and we were seated right when I arrived. Ha! Chef Keller was on hand to seat people, which definitely added to the experience. Our server was very attentive and made sure that we had everything we needed; she even took the time to explain why our milkshakes were taking so long. Apparently, they only have two milkshake machines to make all of the orders. I had actually already eaten dinner before I arrived but I got caught up in everyone's excitement and ordered a second dinner. =P There are lots of choices for the meat and non-meat eater. It was a little overwhelming, actually. I loved that there were alcoholic milkshakes on the menu - the Irish Coffee milkshake was da bomb diggity! My friends enjoyed their minty milkshakes too. Basically, everyone at my table loved their food. It's expensive for a burger but everything was perfectly cooked with quality ingredients. It was a VERY happy second dinner for me!
author: Queenie C.

description: listen, I like a good burger.  They had a good burger.  It's not the best burger I've ever had (see fatty crab, nyc...get the sliders, you'll wish you never had they're so good).  But it's everything else that comes along.  it's a fun place, the shakes were great, the fries where great.  overall, it's a good experience.  while a little pricey, it's not completely absurd considering the rent and the name.
author: Christopher J.

description: Wow, what a busy place on a Monday afternoon. Their sweet potatoe fries, not the greatest, wouldn't order again, but their skinny fries were pretty good, and the buttermilk zucchini fries, not really fries and I wouldn't get them again either. I had the buffalo burger (first time having buffalo meat) with sourdough and swiss cheese and it was a big burger and pretty good. Their $9 shakes- i had the caramel something and the rest of the group had the nutella one- both just WOW, so creamy, rich, smooth, and just yummy. I must say, it's a pricey place for burgers.
author: Zohal T.

description: i love hubert keller and fleur de lys but burger bar is just ok.  the fried pickles and onion rings are yummy but it kinda just feels like the cheesecake factory but just burgers.  the burgers are decent, but it's a little pricey and there are a lot of places to get good burgers in sf.
author: a g.

description: Pitiful. On a Monday at 2pm we sat and sat with no server. Is this what they do at Fleur de Lys too.  We left.
author: Eli B.

description: COME ON!! LETS GET GOING!! A BURGER JOINT WITH  HUBERT KELLER'S name BETTER BE FU-KEN OUTSTANDING.let down let down let down let down..the only thing that was good were the milkshakes extra STAR for that..how can you f up a burger , customer orders its med rare cook it that way dam !! dont like bitching but shit !!!!! with the HIGH prices that BB demands the burger better be outstanding..service , HEllO where over here!!!LOLOLO ..thats how it was ..it sucked...
author: places togo o.

description: So excited was I to try Burger Bar.  Other than the actual burger and sweet potato fries which were excellent, my question is, has Hubert Keller actually visited this place?  It's chain restaurant, burger-style. Cold and aloof manager, somewhat clueless waitress, and decor that was from a strip-mall including neon beer signs.  Would I go back?  Can't see why since I can find great burgers around town.
author: w r.

description: This must THE place to go for men who work downtown, there were suits everywhere! But the food is what it's really about... it was ok, I can make a better burger and I certainly can cook one properly - unlike some French men we all know... I don't know who set the grilling standards for Burger bar, but when I ordered my burger to be cooked medium I certainly did not expect it to still be able to moo when it reached my table. It was VERY pink inside. I like my burgers a little pink still but this was underdone. Not unedible, just underdone. However, I do assume that the kitchen would not have sent it out if it were a health hazard, so I ate it as it was served. It was ok. The fries were nothing to write home about, and while I didn't order one I do want to know who would pay $8.75 for a milk shake, or $60 for a cheese burger... I'd say try it, but you could do better eating at a fiend's back yard barbecue, although then you wouldn't get the tv's at your booth, which seemed a little superfluous to me.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Where do I start.....The service was horrible the burgers were ok, nothing to write home about!!! They don't care about the customers at all. I guess there bottom line is only making $. We had to wait 30 minutes just to get water. Then they brought us our sides of fries 15 minutes before our burgers even showed up. They didn't give us forks, or dishes. They don't even have steak knives to cut into there $24 dollar burgers.  Next time I pay $150 for 6 people to eat burgers they better wait on me hand and foot. Out of those 6 people two of them were children. They are very pricy...5 burgers 1 order of sliders about 1 inch in diameter 3 on the plate ...1 order of sweet potato fries, thick cut fries, onion rings and zucchini fries ...1 beer and no other items was $150 with the tip....talk about robbery I wish they never opened...I want my money back so I can hit up in and out for 6 months with that $!
author: Mr. E.

description: Great location! Decent price burgers...tried the most expensive burger there and it was delicious! Would definitely come back for the atmosphere!
author: Sara L.

description: i am a burger-aholic and nearly had a heart attack when the sign for this place went up.  i am one of those rare people that hates vegas and burger bar was, for me, the only thing that i looked forward to on my trips out there but now i have one of my very own!  the kobe burger with cheese makes me dance in my seat!  the regular burger is good too.  the zucchini fries with ranch are unbelievable.  still haven't gotten around to the shakes but i will!  the wait at macy's is still a little long but SO worth it...
author: Andrea B.

description: I've been to this location twice and to the Las Vegas location once. I must say, the Burger Rossini is worth the trip, the hype, the price. Make sure you slowly savor each morsel. It should be a slow dance, not a frenetic gulping down. THe madeira sauce is good to the last drop. To top off this meal, make sure you order the shake sampler, although with the size, you may need some help finishing them. But the three flavors are soooooo good! What a treat!
author: Fishcalldwanda K.

description: We went here as our first stop to San Francisco after the airport. The location is great - right in the heart of all the sf shopping. You get to overlook the square and everything. The food, however, is not worth the twenty bucks per plate. And the milkshakes are nine bucks and they don't give you the leftovers in the metal tin that most places do. I had the sliders, which was fine.  Teresa was nothing to hoot and Hollar about. My friends had the buffalo burger with blue cheese. It was delicious. A big concern to all of my friends and I was how they included the tip in our bill automatically because we were a party of six... And the service sucked because of it.
author: Nick B.

description:
maybe kobe beef just shouldn't be a hamburger. if i go back i'll get what  bf had -- the hubert burger (it was much more flavorful than mine). i was trying to do the whole "taste the meat, not the toppings" thing and it didn't work so well for me. 

their wines were all $12-$18/glass and my $16 glass of zinfandel was a good 10 degrees above the already-warm room temperature. not so good. hubert is french, i really didn't expect him to have such a careless attitude about the wine (seriously it was like 80 degrees). i would have sent it back but they were clearly having some sort of drama in the kitchen so i didn't want to bother. if i'd had ice water, i would have thrown an ice cube in there :)

but that shake... i'll be dreaming of it for weeks. toasted hazelnuts and chocolate chips on top of chocolate whipped cream... and the entire glass was coated with a thick layer of nutella on the inside. i walked all the way home to burn some of it off :)

and the view at night is spectacular -- especially tonight when there's a huge fashion ball happening in union square.

p.s. i get that you want the place to be american, but even the president eats dijon. get some mustard for grown-ups on the table, please...
author: Brian K.

description:
Went here for lunch today. The place was hopping and we had to wait 20-25 mins - it wasn't bad since its right in Macy's. Our server was ok not super friendly or helpful with the menu. We are not big meat eaters so ordered the salmon and the chicken burger and shared a side of sweet potato fries. 
Both bugers were in serious need of seasoning - it seemed as though they had grilled the chicken and salmon, put it on the burger and served us. We had added cheese to our burgers but that helped little. The burgers were expensive and on there own come with only onions and lettuce everything else is an add-on and is charged to you (even if you want your onion grilled instead of raw!).
The sweet potato fries were good but once again came with nothing - if teh waitress had reminded us we would have ordered buttermilk sauce or something to go with it. 
We got a table by the window and the view of union square was awesome. 
Will come back only if they can add some flavor!
author: P From CA C.

description: Went to burger bar on a Sunday, on a off time after lunch, but before dinner and there wasn't much of a wait.  The server seated us over by the window overlooking union square.  I got the American burger with sweet potato fries.  The burger was pretty juicy and had a hint of a peppered bite to it, which made it really good.  I never tried sweet potato fries, but I LOVE IT, kinda reminds me of tempura. Overall, a great dining experience. The servers we had were super friendly, Amanda & Laura.  They made sure we were doing alright and weren't rushing or anything.
author: Lorraine L.

description: Yes, the cheapest burger is $10 and yes, fries and rings are extra.  But it is a very juicy and tasty burger.  Deep fried jalapeno pickles were only ok (too much batter), the onion rings taste a little like Burger Kings but the sweet potato fries were solid.
author: C L.

description: Really? The kobe beef burger tastes just like the angus beef burger? Cool environment, nice view, food is way overpriced and frankly i prefer places that call the $5.00 burger what it is, a basic $5 burger.
author: s k.

description: So, I went here for the first time the other night.  My hats off to the management.  There was a small mix up with seating at the beginning of our experience and the Manager (Mark, I believe) not only fixed it right up for us, but went on to check back with us throughout the evening.  It's hard to believe, but such effort is rare these days, and much appreciated.  I had the Angus burger with bacon and cheese, and skinny fries.  All in all a better burger than most chains and a great location.  Also, try the shakes and fried pickles.  They're amazing!
author: Brandon B.

description: just from the prices i knew it was a bad place already.  i mean i can can-cock a better piece of burger and fries by myself. avoid this place at all costs! heck if you want, come to my place and pay me 15 for a burger and ill make you one. thanks
author: David L.

description: Honestly, I don't really take the time to write reviews.  However, this was the worst burger I have ever had in my life.  Not only did I have to send the overcooked burger that was burned, back, they then charged me for the additional burger they brought me that was also burnt and overcooked.  Stay away from Burger Bar, it is a waste of money and time.  I hope they read these reviews.  I tried to go to their website to let them know how their food was, but of course, they don't have an email on their website.  TERRIBLE FOOD!!!  stay away
author: Christopher W.

description: Well, well, well where to begin! It was my fathers birthday so we went to Burger Bar for lunch. We patiently waited for our water after we were seated . When it was brought to us I noticed my sister not drinking hers so I asked politely what the problem was, she said there was lipstick on her glass! She immediately informed them while we were ordering and it came after our food! Well that's all for now but the Yelp Ninjas will be back so long.
author: Yelp N.

description: It's an overpriced burger that probably isn't worth it.  But it is a nice oasis if you're stuck shopping in Union Square and I liked it better than the other options around there (mainly cheesecake factory).  So if you're in the area and starving and want a decent but expensive burger, go there.  If you're seeking out the best burgers in San Francisco, try Spruce or Fish and Farm.
author: Josh C.

description: I am from San Francisco, and was on my way to a valentines day event and I decided to stop into the Burger Bar for a couple of drinks. Though, the bartender had a typical "holier then thou" attitude, the beer selection was premo. Anywhere you can get an Abita on draft in SF is pretty clutch- though $6 a beer is a little steep, that is, if you are going to get a couple in (that's not including the $ on the tip). But your sort of paying for the nice view/rent  and I would pay that price for a beer if I got dragged out shopping anyday. "okay honey, you do your shopping, meet me at the bar when your done". Long story short,  I filled up on beer and left. Next time I will try one of these "epic" burgers. .
author: Mickrod S.

description: Uh, just three words: FAB-U-LOUS!! What's not to love (other than the crowds of course): all manner of burgers (Angus, Kobe, veggie, buffalo - real flesh, not the cheese), fries and a full bar, not to mention great milkshakes and other food items like chicken and veggies that are nicely prepared. The waitstaff is efficient and friendly, and it's kinda cool to see The Man himself (that would be Top Chef Master Hubert Keller) running around in his great looking black Burger Bar chef's jacket - makes me wanna learn to cook.
author: Daisy K.

description: i live really close by and i was excited for this place to open. but, i was not impressed by the kobe burger with added foie, as they were both under-seasoned and overcooked.  i'd be more forgiving if this burger didn't cost me $29.  they also got my order wrong but didn't offer to take it back, i got an apology instead.  2 stars because this meal was mediocre not horrible, but i'm not going back.
author: yolanda f.

description: The best darn low carb burger I've ever had! The meat and veggies were so flavorful that I didn't miss the bun at all. The nutella shake was heavenly. I don't eat burgers often but I'll definitely be back when I get the craving for a proper burger & shake.
author: Lorena E.

description: On a recent trip to San Francisco,I heard people talking about burger bar so I decided to give it a try it was the worst decision I made the whole trip, first the place is inside macy's department store, which was strange anyway put my name on the waiting list and the hostess was really rude,maybe because I had jeans on, then after waiting twenty minutes for a table the stick me in the back room and the table they gave me had been open the whole time I was there so why the wait, when I order all the hamburgers where like twenty dollars, so I got the turkey burger, it was ten dollars and it came with nothing no fries, no mayo on the bun it was pretty dry it did come with tomato and onion, and a piece of lettuce,worst turkey burger I ever had,so if you like bad service and twenty dollar burgers then go to burger bar and give your money away,I work to hard to give mine away so needless to say I won't be back,but if you don't mine getting ripped off go ahead and go you've been warned, bad service and bad food don't work for me there's better places in frisco to eat,it's your choice good luck if you choose to go there.
author: Richard K.

description: It was Sunday night, we waited 15 minutes for a table for 2.  Once we got inside, there were plenty of empty tables around, I guess they just want to slow down the orders for the kitchen to catch up, not a good sign when the place is ony 70% full.  We ordered a veggie burger, a salmon burger, and zucchini fries.  We waited 40 minutes, nothing came, I was falling asleep.  We asked the server to bring the fries first, since we were starving.  He came back with the skinny fries, we told him we ordered the zucchini fries.  He offered to leave the skinny fries at the table, but they looked so unappetizing, we didn't want to eat them even if they were free.  Zucchini fries came few minutes after, not much flavor, not too crispy neither, a bit soggy.  Another 10 minutes later, burgers came.  Veggie burger was really bad, it's like under seasoned mashed potato between the buns.  Salmon burger was average.  Long wait, not very good service, not very good food, expensive...
author: Dee L.

description: For my first visit I tried the basic burger "package" ordered medium after much discussion of the  definiation at this establishment.  This was an Angus beef burger with American cheese, bacon, onion, tomato, pickle and fries.  The first one to come was one of the most pathetic excuses I could have imagined for such a high scale place.  It was well done with no pink at all, broken in pieces and overly a very sad example of what a great burger should be.  It was immediately removed with my pickle only half eaten (great pickle by the way).  The second attempt was delivered by what seemed to be the cook whol apologized for the first burger--this one was cooked perfectly medium and looked and tasted good, but not great.  The sesame bun was a little dry.  The bar tender was nice enough to comp a side of onion rings for my inconvenience.  They were the best!  Sadly, the restaurnt charges an extra $.45 for dijon mustard because is it home made.  Otherwise you are forced to use the free French's yellow mustard that I personally do not like.  The onion rings came with no side sauce-a ranch dressing would have been nice.  The fries with the burger were not very crispy but looked like they could achieve greatness in another visit. I love French-style skinny fries, but these were not the best I've had.   I had asked for crispy fries but this request  did not seem to be an option.  Next visit I will do the "make your own" concept which others near me ordered and looked much better than mine.  It starts with a burger (beef, chicken, turkey or veggie) and you add all the options, each with their own price.  I find alot of the extras to be nickle and diming for items that should be included (such as dijon mustard).  Apparently mayo, ranch dressing and a few other sauces are free.   I have a personal problem with finding the perfect Sunday burger from 3-5 and had high expectations for this place.  Not sure why this is so difficult in this city of great dining options, but it continues to be a reality.  Still have a few others that are much better, Elite Cafe and Bar Johnny (if Roland is there).  I will go back to the Burger Bar, the bartenders were awesome:  friendly and cute, the concept is good although pricey, and it definately has potential and is a good location.  Being on the 6th floor of Macy's gives us a much needed affordable dining opportunity on Union Square.  Mr. Keller-- as much as I was rooting for you on Top Chef Master, you still need a little fine tuning here to make this a winner.
author: Laura I.

description: my friends wanted to drive to sf to eat burgers, some of us thought these must be the best burgers ever if we're making a trip from san jose. i had no expectations since they said it was in macy's, but when we arrived the placed was pretty crowded and atmosphere is pretty much a nice and hip burger joint with a bar.  we were told the wait was about an hour, but there was bar where you can order drinks and some appetizers. the wait wasn't that bad, they called us early actually and we got a window seat. most of the people in our group ordered the american kobe beef burger ($16.50), some ordered it with shaved truffles and foie gras, which was about $60. it was pretty good,  they cooked it the way i wanted it, i like my meat cooked medium rare with some blood. oh yeah, we saw the owner there, hubert keller, he talked to the customers there and seemed really friendly. i will definitely come back again.
author: Gilbert G.

description: I was looking forward to this meal - it's Hubert Keller!  Hubby and I split the Hubert Keller burger but swapped the blue cheese for pepper jack since I'm not a fan of blue cheese.  Burger was really good (4 stars) and the red wine and shallot reduction they give to go with the burger was super yummy.  Fries were nothing amazing.  We ordered the milkshake sampler, and while I have to admit I'm not a huge milkshake person, I was totally unimpressed.  The strawberry milkshake tasted like they used strawberry syrup from a jar.  While I did enjoy the nutella and caramel milkshakes, it was nowhere near worth the $20 price tag.  Service was so-so; the waiter had to refer to the menu just to answer our questions or just said "I don't know."  Not the best thing to hear, but oh well.  If you're in the area, feel free to give it a try if you love burgers, but I'd say pass if you're thinking of making a special trip for it.
author: Lori R.

description: went back for the peppercorn burger yesterday.  tasted great, sauce is pretty good.  fat fries are the way to go.  Had the "burger crush" (specialty drink) which was really good.  service was on top of it.  no complaints!
author: John B.

description: i would actually give it 3 1/2 stars...  the burgers were only okay and very highly priced...  i would much rather go to "the counter"...  but i loved their hazelnut ice cream shake...  ooohhhhh.... that was soooo goooooodddd!!!!  but their service was bad....  so only 3 1/2...  oh, and we met chef hubert keller so that was a plus!  =)
author: Cilou L.

description: Well, we liked it, and we'll be back.  Very busy Friday night - they told us 40 minutes but we were seated in 20.  $6 pints of ale is pretty normal for downtown.  Service was just fine for a cafe sort of place. No Hubert, alas...  My wife had the Hubert Keller burger and loved it.  I DID have the Rossini (birthday.....) - the foi gras, truffle extravaganza.  I wouldn't tell you to spend the $60, but it was yummy and certainly a dining adventure.  Her burger was ordered rare and came almost bloody(but she likes very rare), I ordered medium rare and it came medium.  I gave the waitress a bit of feedback about that - they were within our limits of eating it anyway, but for $60 you expect it the way it's supposed to be....  But we enjoyed it overall.  You want the best burger?  My pick would be Barney's with a giant pile of spicy curly fries.  But for downtown, somewhat upscale, full bar and a unique range of fixings and quality meat it's a fine place to eat!!  No, it's not the best restaurant I've ever eaten in but it is one of the best bistro type and we had a fine time. If I knocked one star off it could be because there are NO appetizers available - that would help a lot.  Maybe we were expecting burgers when we went, which is what we got.....  Good bread and very good staff too..
author: Jo-Ann D.

description: Since I always like to try things that are one-of-a-kind, I stopped by Burger Bar to try the $60 foie gras burger. It arrives with a portion of "skinny fries", two small pots of salt and pepper, and a massive burger. It's Kobe beef with thick slab of foie gras and a couple of slices of black truffle on top. Included in the price is a milkshake - I chose chocolate. How was it? Too much. The burger is simply too rich for me. The foie gras flavor is overwhelmed by the beef and I didn't get any sense of the truffles. In addition, the chocolate milkshake is also over-the-top. I love chocolate. But thick fudge sauce and chocolate chips overpowered me. Together, it doesn't work. While I never expected this to be "health food," I swear I could feel my arteries clogging up with cholesterol. On the plus side, the place has a great view of Union Square at night and I would go back to try a less elevated burger, but I'd skip the shake, too. For my money, I prefer the big burger at Mel's and they make a great chocolate shake.
author: Jeff A.

description:
i had such a great time at burger bar.  the food was so tasty and the shakes...well lets just say i was dreaming about them for months, in fact i need a fix as we speak.  we had a sample of about 5 or 6 different flavors and one was better then the next.
but about the burgers- you can tell the meat is of the highest quality,   my boy friend had the black jack and he commented that he could taste the quality of the beef.  i had the low carb (making sure i made room for the shakes) and i have to tell you i didn't miss the bun, i ate everything on my plate.
and of course what made the whole experience complete and so much fun was chef keller and his beautiful and elegant wife chantal.  they are truly charming and you can tell love what they do.  they make you feel at home.
i can't forget the view, amazing!  It was especially glorious during christmas, with the skaters and the tree right across the street.
To finish off, we'll be back, in fact i keep making excuses to go to macy's just so i can go back to burger bar.
author: susana b.

description: Take the elevator to the 6th floor of Macy's and you'll find the Burger Bar, Hubert Keller's casual, lively deli-esque tribute to ground beefdom.  We dined early  (7:00 pm or so) on Halloween night and it was already quite crowded, a tribute to Keller's reputation as a chef, since they're not  giving anything away with burger prices ranging upwards from $12.75 to a high water mark of $60.00 for the "Rossini", complete with fois gras and truffles.  I greatly enjoyed the "American Classic", perfectly cooked, medium rare, complete with American cheese, bacon, tomato, onion, lettuce, and of course, the requisite garlicky pickle.   (In fact, the accomodating waitstaff brought out a plate of 8 in response to my questioning as to whether the burger would come with one!)  My husband loved his peppercorn burger, and we both gobbled the skinny fries.  We were tempted to have shakes but opted instead for a nice glass of wine and a "weiss beer", one of many unusual choices available.  All around us, people seemed to be having a good time and relishing the terrific view of Union Square.
author: Bean R.
